672676219.name: Great place to cool off
672676219.author: a TripAdvisor user
672676219.reviewBody: After exploring the center of Valladolid on our bicycles we made our way to the towns Cenote. This was our first time to a Cenote and while we had looked many pictures of them we were completely in awe of it\'s majesty. I would recommend wearing your bathing suit so you don\'t have to change as it\'s a little difficult in the restroom. The Cenote is beautiful, cold, has spots to jump in from a height and lovely waterfalls. The small black catfish that live in the Cenote will leave you alone so no worries there. The $30mx pesos per person was absolutely worth it.

672359824.name: Magical Cenote that is a Must
672359824.author: a TripAdvisor user
672359824.reviewBody: When you arrive, you get a locker  so you may change into your suit.  Please if you wear sunscreen, it is best only for the mineral or zinc oxide.  Many of the ingredients are harmful to the fish, reefs, and  sea life.  You  take many steps down to the  deck for the Cenote.   You are given a life jacket to wear as it  is very deep.   There is a diving platform which had many takers, though I refrained. The surrounding rock wall around the Cenote was filled with nesting birds, swallows and the beautiful clock bird, which looks like the bird of paradise.   You could float on your back to enjoy the birds,  or get some exercise and swim about.  There are also little black fish swimming about.  It was very lovely side trip after a hot excursion to Mayan ruins.  A refreshing dip in a fresh water Cenote is a must if you go to the yucat\u00e1n peninsula.  \n

672247601.name: A cenote to start with
672247601.author: a TripAdvisor user
672247601.reviewBody: The main advantage of this cenote is that it\'s in the town of Valladolid, so you can access it by foot. \nIt\'s a good initiation into cenotes, the place was calm and serene.

671988373.name: Hidden Paradise in the of the city
671988373.author: a TripAdvisor user
671988373.reviewBody: This really is a hidden treasure.\nIt\u2019s in the middle of the city, where you least expect it. And for a small fee you can get in to swim and relax.

671910688.name: Right in Valladolid, walk from center!
671910688.author: a TripAdvisor user
671910688.reviewBody: Lots of craft vendors selling local stuff. After a short walk down you enter Cenote. Nice view, water was perfect for swimming. Really enjoyed our time here.

670310172.name: Don\'t miss these sacred pools!
670310172.author: a TripAdvisor user
670310172.reviewBody:
Swimming in the cenotes of the Yucatan was the most special activity of my trip.  This was my first, and after swimming at another location, I appreciated that life jackets were not required.  It is swim at your own risk and life jackets are available for anyone who isn't a confident swimmer. 

The scenery is stunning and the water is magical and refreshing. 

The restaurant was lovely.  We ordered the Yucatan sampler platter which I highly recommend!!  Samples of many traditional dishes of the Yucatan all on one large plate. If you are spending money at the restaurant, ask them for the receipt you'll need to get into the cenote for free. They also have bathrooms for changing your clothes.

The location of this cenote in Valladolid also can't be beaten!  It's a nice walk from just about anywhere in town.

669292280.name: Hidden gem!
669292280.author: a TripAdvisor user
669292280.reviewBody: We stumbled across this as we were exploring the town, it has a great huge swimming area with options to jump off several levels too. Not alot of lifejackets, i couldnt see any changing spaces or lockers, very little parking but you can park on nearby roads. The restaurant there was really good - proper local dishes, reasonable prices, decent service. Well recommended.\n

668416210.name: Very cool
668416210.author: a TripAdvisor user
668416210.reviewBody: It is a beautiful natural wonder.  A bit crowded.  Make sure if you take a tour- they allow getting in the water.

666210753.name: Refreshing!
666210753.author: a TripAdvisor user
666210753.reviewBody: It was my fourth cenote in two days and I was getting a bit fed up with them but I was surprised by this one, even more since it\'s in the middle of the city! Entrance fee is cheap (30 pesos) and the crnote is amazing and has both shade and sunshine. It gets a bit crowded but most people don\'t go swimming (at least the ones stopping in buses) Must see if you are in Valladolid!

663650555.name: Beautiful Paradise Cenote
663650555.author: a TripAdvisor user
663650555.reviewBody: You could think this was handcrafted, what a natural wonder. Be careful of the wooden slipper steps including the missing/broken runners.

663486076.name: Cenote on our doorstep
663486076.author: a TripAdvisor user
663486076.reviewBody: One of two cenotes we visited in the Valladolid area, Cenote Zaci has the great advantage of being within the town centre itself.  That said, once you have descended into the cavern itself, you could be forgiven for imagining yourself in some lost world or Shangri-La.  There is a cafe/restaurant that we did not visit, preferring to spend our time splashing up and down the pool and chatting to other friendly cavemen and women.

663339207.name: Great afternoon at the cenote
663339207.author: a TripAdvisor user
663339207.reviewBody: Easy to get to, multiple places of a variety of heights to jump from, and quite large. On a Sunday afternoon there were about 50 people there---it gets crowded. Life jackets cost extra. One reviewer mentioned a rope swing but when we were there---no rope swing. Small waterfall. Our 8 year old son loved all the different options for jumping. Had a great time!

662248074.name: So refreshing!
662248074.author: a TripAdvisor user
662248074.reviewBody: I was surprised to see such a lovely cenote in town. I can\'t describe how great it was after a trip to the bee farm. It is quite warm in Yucatan, even at this time of year (late March), so there is nothing as nice for me as a refreshing dip in a cenote after being in the heat. I was surprised, though, that they didn\'t have showers, and require one before going in. Most of the other cenotes do require showers. They do have some kind of recirculation system that pumps up the water, which kind of rains down on you.

662089931.name: Amazing cenote in the middle of town
662089931.author: a TripAdvisor user
662089931.reviewBody: This cenote was really a surprise in the center of Valladolid. A huge cenote, so beautifull with nice and clear water to cool down in. The entrance was 30 or 40 pesos pp and it\'s really worth it! Go there and enjoy, take time to swim and also to make some lovely photo\'s there. A must see in Valladolid!

661033356.name: Love this Cenote
661033356.author: a TripAdvisor user
661033356.reviewBody: This little Cenote is lovely. There is a rope swing into the water. There is also a ladder to get into the water. There are little fish which like to nibble on your dead skin cells. Unique experience.

660958633.name: Great swim
660958633.author: a TripAdvisor user
660958633.reviewBody: I saw other bad reviews saying the water was murky but it was really clear when we went. Very close to the center, easy to find, 30pesos pp, be careful on the wet rocks, no change rooms. We went in our bathers from the hotel... plenty of people jumping if you like that. Plenty of fish and good vision, we took our gogles. Not overly crowded. Really enjoyable

660643816.name: Fresh water
660643816.author: a TripAdvisor user
660643816.reviewBody:
We went there around 9 AM, but it was not open (they usually open at 8).  When we got there, the lady at the cashier came in... I guess she was late that day? 

Anyway, the cost was 30 pesos.  The life jacket rental is another 30 pesos with ID. 
The bathroom costs 5 pesos.  

The water is fresh, and there are fish swimming.  When I was standing in the water, the fish started eating my feet!  

I recommend to visit this cenote if you visit Valladolid.

659731895.name: A fresh water spring right in town.
659731895.author: a TripAdvisor user
659731895.reviewBody: For less than $2, you get access to the cenote, a locked locker, and access to a shower, bathroom, changing room. And you can walk there from downtown. There are many stone steps to get down to the cenote. While it is great for taking pictures from above, it took my 70+ year legs awhile to get up and down. There are life jackets for use and safety lines in the water to hang onto. Children and old folks can enjoy this lovely cenote. And bonus, a nice restaurant also in the park. This is somewhere to not skip when on vacation in Valladolid.

658694731.name: Beautiful but beware of bus tours
658694731.author: a TripAdvisor user
658694731.reviewBody: The Cenote is absolutely gorgeous beautiful deep clear cool pure water.   As an added bonus it\u2019s right smack in the center of town and only 30 pesos to get in .   My suggestion would be to go either early in the morning or late in the afternoon after 4 PM when the buses leave and you\u2019ll still have plenty of time to swim .

658526085.name: Nice cenote inside valladolid !
658526085.author: a TripAdvisor user
658526085.reviewBody: Very cool cenote, I was surprised in a good way because I was not expecting much but it is worth it.

658497729.name: Good cenote right in the city
658497729.author: a TripAdvisor user
658497729.reviewBody: Worth the 30 MXN in my opinion (or if you eat at the restaurant it\'s free).  Very nice cenote right in the center of Valladolid. Perfect if you are short on time and cannot explore around Valladolid to try other cenotes.

656807499.name: INTERESTING!
656807499.author: a TripAdvisor user
656807499.reviewBody: First time we visited a cenote and it was interesting enough although we did not go into the water as there are not lifeguard on duty.\n\nBesides we were allowed 30 minutes for the visit so it could be a cool dip in the hot summer.

655498448.name: Swim in cave
655498448.author: a TripAdvisor user
655498448.reviewBody: Nice place in the middle of the city where you can swim and relax. There is also very nice restaurant.

655218037.name: lots of steps to get there
655218037.author: a TripAdvisor user
655218037.reviewBody: very deep and not crystal blue but still very nice and it is close to center.wear a jacket if you are not a good swimmer

655024268.name: Worth a stop, great eating places nearby also.
655024268.author: a TripAdvisor user
655024268.reviewBody: Nice cenote located in the middle of town, you can swim if you so desire, not a long walk from the square and has little shoppes and places to eat around it.

654505540.name: An Oasis in the town
654505540.author: a TripAdvisor user
654505540.reviewBody: The Lonely Planet\'s description of this Cenote was OK but not wonderful so we arrived with little expectation. It\'s only 30 pacsos to enter so in we went. We descended the stone steps turned the corner and wow an Aladdin\'s Cave in the midst of the town with the sun light dancing on the blue water with visitors swimming and enjoying themselves. It\'s a beautiful place maybe not as beautiful as others but an unbelievable sight for the eyes in the middle of a town. We\'ll worth a visit.

653215935.name: Dirty and crowded
653215935.author: a TripAdvisor user
653215935.reviewBody: Conveniently located in the center of town, but that\'s why it\'s so crowded and worn looking.  Avoid this place and make the effort to visit a cenote outside of town.  You\'ll find someplace more beautiful and quiet.

653005160.name: Beautiful Cenote
653005160.author: a TripAdvisor user
653005160.reviewBody: Really nice cenote, minimal admission charge, COLD WATER (but that is expected in a cenote)! Nice walk from the square and a great mercado not far away.\n\n

652863482.name: Urban cenote
652863482.author: a TripAdvisor user
652863482.reviewBody: In the middle of Valladolid, a few blocks from the main square, you will find Cenote Zaci, a large cenote with good facilities- not the most picturesque but nice in any case.  A few platforms to jump off of and very refreshing water.  Good to go early as it is quieter.

652677642.name: Beautiful and tranquil swimming hole
652677642.author: a TripAdvisor user
652677642.reviewBody:
We came here just before lunch and had the place practically to ourselves.

It’s a short walk from town center. If you eat at the somewhat decent restaurant above the swimming hole, entrance is free, and you can use the bathrooms to change. 

The water was surprisingly warm. If you sit quietly in the water near the steps, little fish will nibble at your toes and ankles. 

At dusk, when the cenote closes at 5pm, bats emerge, gobbling up many mosquitoes. Very cool.

651938871.name: Very pretty, easy to get to
651938871.author: a TripAdvisor user
651938871.reviewBody: Not my favorite cenote by far but if you do\'t have much time in Valladolid (COME BACK! It\'s worth it!) it\'s a good place to spend an hour or so! But do try and spend at least a full day here to see all the other amazing cents and try the amazing restaurants

651934520.name: Great place to swim, clean water, cheap ticket
651934520.author: a TripAdvisor user
651934520.reviewBody: Great place to swim, clean water, cheap ticket (30 pesos per person). Just inside the Valladolid, a great place to escape the heat.

651751660.name: So Awesome and Right in the Middle of Town
651751660.author: a TripAdvisor user
651751660.reviewBody: I honestly wasn\'t expecting much from this Cenote as it was in the middle of the town.  I thought it would be a little hole in the ground.  Was I wrong!  It cavernous and stunning and super fun!  Go just to people watch and see the Cenote even if you aren\'t gong to swim or jump off the ledges!

651078233.name: Very nice Cenote right in Valladolid
651078233.author: a TripAdvisor user
651078233.reviewBody: This cenote is right in Valladolid and is very pretty.  The steps down to the water level are easy to navigate and there is a path all the way around the cenote.  A nice, easy stop on the way to/from Chichen Itza in a great little town with excellent restaurants.  If you want a restaurant recommendation, try the El Atrio Del Mayab which is on the plaza right next to the church.

649326873.name: Cenote Zaci: Natural treasure in the town
649326873.author: a TripAdvisor user
649326873.reviewBody:
This cenote is very convenient to reach from the Ado bus terminal in the centre of Valladolid, only about an 8 minute walk. 

The entrance is accessed from the south side, there are many stalls set up around the entrance so just walk past and into the centre of the place. 

There’s a stall opposite the cenote on ground level, it’s 30 pesos entry fee. 

This is the first cenote I saw and it was breathtaking. A miracle of nature are the words I would use to describe it. The steps are quite steep however so I advise caution. 

I didn’t get to swim in the cenote however those that did looked very content indeed. 

A must go to place on a trip to Valladolid!

648597748.name: Beautiful Cenote right in town!
648597748.author: a TripAdvisor user
648597748.reviewBody: Definitely worth checking out, is close to the main square and beautiful. We walked and it was only a few blocks. You can see the Cenote from the top so if you do not want to pay to go down and swim you can view for free to take a picture.

648584491.name: So easy to get to and cheap
648584491.author: a TripAdvisor user
648584491.reviewBody: We walked by on a rainy day and decided to just check it out. It is bigger then it looks from the outside. We then decided to get our bathing suits and go in for a swim. Even on a cool rainy day it felt warmer since it is so protected. We ended spending 3 hours there chatting with other travellers and really enjoyed ourselves. For the cost, it is well worth it and the setting is spectacular smack in the centre of the city.

648016444.name: Nice, but noneed to go out of your way
648016444.author: a TripAdvisor user
648016444.reviewBody: This in-town cenote is very nice. I enjoyed the handicraft vendors at the entrance as they had some interesting things.  One man was nice enough to repair my friends sandals.

647210257.name: Beautiful cenote near the centre of Valladolid / Gy\u00f6ny\u00f6r\u0171 cenote k\u00f6zel Valladolid belv\u00e1ros\u00e1hoz
647210257.author: a TripAdvisor user
647210257.reviewBody: You can refresh yourself in the beautiful cenote near the centre of Valladolid. Water is very deep, but a rope is stretched, so that you can have a bit of rest after swimming. Entrance fee is only 30 pesos. FYI: there is no locker, so take care of your personal belongings. After being finished, you can find a restaurant on top to grab something to eat. \n\nValladolid k\u00f6zpontj\u00e1hoz k\u00f6zeli gy\u00f6ny\u00f6r\u0171 cenot\u00e9ben friss\u00fclhet\u00fcnk fel. A v\u00edz nagyon m\u00e9ly, de egy k\u00f6t\u00e9l van kifesz\u00edtve, amin megpihenhet\u00fcnk \u00fasz\u00e1s ut\u00e1n. A bel\u00e9p\u0151 30 pes\u00f3. Info: nincs z\u00e1rhat\u00f3 szekr\u00e9ny, \u00edgy a kint hagyott dolgainkra \u00e9rdemes figyelni. A kij\u00e1rat tetej\u00e9n egy \u00e9tterem tal\u00e1lhat\u00f3, ahol f\u00fcrd\u00e9s ut\u00e1n ehet\u00fcnk egyet.

647182975.name: What a Wonderfull Cenote in Valladolid! Swimming !! Jumping
647182975.author: a TripAdvisor user
647182975.reviewBody: while visiting Valladolid. Make sure you go to this Cenote. a small entrance fee of 50 pesos.. jump in the crystal clear water and relax with friends.

647164560.name: Huge Cenote in the middle of Valadolid
647164560.author: a TripAdvisor user
647164560.reviewBody: Great example of a huge Cenote and located right in the middle of town. Large trees cover the area, nice to chill out on a hot day

647149798.name: A CENOTE IN THE CENTRE OF TOWN
647149798.author: a TripAdvisor user
647149798.reviewBody: We walked to Cenote Zaci from our hotel.  It is literally located in the centre of town.  From the restaurant terrace above, you can view the cenote!  While the site is rather lovely, the water did not appear to be very clean.  It does look like a refreshing site though.

646666461.name: Must visit in Valladolid
646666461.author: a TripAdvisor user
646666461.reviewBody:
The centre was just a few minutes walk from our accommodation, so we visited as soon as we were checked in.
Only 30 Pesos to enter and it is aesthetically pleasing, and probably worth visiting just for that.
However, if you are able it is definitely worth taking the plunge and getting in the water. It was quite warm, and life vests are available for those who are not so confident in water (it is pretty deep so probably not good for non-swimmers, although there is a rope across the water that can be used to pull out from the edge and back in again).
For the more adventurous try a jump from one of the many ledges, going up to about 8 metres.

646424679.name: Beautiful cenote in the centre of town
646424679.author: a TripAdvisor user
646424679.reviewBody: A wonderful cenote, my favourite of all the ones I visited around Valladolid. It is two blocks from the main square, and a steal at $30 MXN. The half covered, half open feel makes for a very beautiful experience, and the 8 metre cliff jump is great for the more adventurous. Finally, the restaurant/cafe above does a great breakfast if you fancy a morning swim/meal combo!

644818184.name: Okay for people. Watching
644818184.author: a TripAdvisor user
644818184.reviewBody: I recommend going to the restaurant first and getting a drink. Entry to the cenote is then free. This is the most convenient cenote for those who do not have transport.

644537483.name: Small cenote, but quiet and beautiful
644537483.author: a TripAdvisor user
644537483.reviewBody: Loved this small cenote: very beautiful, perfect to escape the town bustle & enjoy a cooling swim. If you go early you may have it to yourself!

642912370.name: Close enough to walk from the main square
642912370.author: a TripAdvisor user
642912370.reviewBody: This is an easy cenote to visit if you\'re in Valladolid because it\'s an easy walk from the center of town.

642794588.name: Convenient but disappointing
642794588.author: a TripAdvisor user
642794588.reviewBody: I went to this cenote after going to Oxman.  Cenote Zaci was disappointing in some ways because it had more people than the other two I went to and the water was murky for snorkeling.  The view was not as stunning as Oxman or Suytun.  I would recommend going to Zaci only if you could not go to any other cenote nearby. It\u2019s within the walking distance from the municipal plaza in Valladolid.  Finding it was challenging because there were not many signs pointing to it. Ask a local, you will get directions instantly.

642075679.name: Beautiful Cenote
642075679.author: a TripAdvisor user
642075679.reviewBody: This was a wonderful spot to visit, and I wished I had brought my swimsuit. Even without getting in, it was nice walking around the cenote and watching people muster the courage to jump in.

642062121.name: A cenote right the centre of town.
642062121.author: a TripAdvisor user
642062121.reviewBody:
This cenote is only partially covered making the water quite warm. It is fascinating exploring both areas from the water. There is a path going all the way around it too. 
Access is quite rocky and you have to be careful. It looks like they have a cafe but we didn't eat there.

We got locked in as they shut the gate early, but  if this happens to you, you can climb over the wall if you walk up through the trees.

641455239.name: Such a Novel Environmental Phenomenon!
641455239.author: a TripAdvisor user
641455239.reviewBody: The Cenote Zaci is impressive in size and entrance. Walking down into the cavern, getting the first glimpse of the large body of water far below \u2014 quite amazing to see. If we had not been swimming in the Cenote at Dzibilchalt\u00fan the week before, with its crystal clear water, a swim would have been more tempting. However, the dark murky water and black fish seen near the surface, as well as the large number of people both swimming and watching from the fences \u2014- together, these were enough to discourage a swim for me. Though it is highly commercialized as a cenote in the centre of Valladolid, it is still worth a visit if you are spending a few days or more in the town. Otherwise, save the cenote experience for another location with fewer people and clearer water.

641321616.name: Visisting with tourists.
641321616.author: a TripAdvisor user
641321616.reviewBody: An excellent choice if you want to know a big sunken cenote and at the same time, have some excellent yucatecan food and find a nice artcraft market, all with good prices. The service at the Restaurante is very good and also the food, b e prepared, bring your swimming suit for a refreshing deep the Zaci (the white hawk)

638936488.name: Amazing Ancient Attraction
638936488.author: a TripAdvisor user
638936488.reviewBody:
We knew we were visiting this cenote as part of our excursion to Chitzen Itza, but the explanations and even pictures did not do it justice.  We all felt like we were standing in a scene from Jurassic Park.

We couldn't help imagining all the things that must have happened in that spot over thousands of years.

Even though we didn't get to swim, we all thought it was worth the stop.

636734762.name: Don\'t miss this beautiful cenote in the middle of town!!
636734762.author: a TripAdvisor user
636734762.reviewBody: Go early!  We arrived about 9:30 and had only 1 other couple there with us.  It\'s a beautiful cenote - cool, clear water and greenery all around.  It\'s very easy to enter and exit.  There are no changing facilities, but if you aren\'t excessively modest and it\'s uncrowded, it\'s easy to change in a rocky area that\'s partially hidden above the cenote - just bring a towel to hold up.

636386748.name: Cool place
636386748.author: a TripAdvisor user
636386748.reviewBody: Be sure to change upstairs. A lot of steps and some very slippery but it\'s worth the visit. After a day of walking in Valladolid Zaci cools you off.

635820488.name: Beautiful and close to town centre
635820488.author: a TripAdvisor user
635820488.reviewBody: This cenote is so easy to get to, very cheap to get in and is absolutely stunning. We went quite early so were one of 3 people there whe we arrived and pretty much had the water ourselves.

632057596.name: So close to town!
632057596.author: a TripAdvisor user
632057596.reviewBody:
5 mins walk from the plaza! Perfect place to chill off and have fun.

The water wasn't brilliantly clear when we visited but it was still good. 

It's a busy place, fun.

631448425.name: Poor Water Quality
631448425.author: a TripAdvisor user
631448425.reviewBody: The day I went, the water was not blue, I find this to be the case with outdoor cenotes that do not get maintained very well. And while 30 pesos is not breaking the bank there are many other beautiful cave cenotes that cost only 20 pesos. It tends to get very crowded.

630844966.name: Amazing, and Easy To Get To
630844966.author: a TripAdvisor user
630844966.reviewBody: What a delight.  Everyone else is going to the more well known cenotes in Valladolid, and here is Cenote Zaci just minutes away from the plaza.  The entry path is a bit dodgy, so watch your step.  You do, of course, have to pay to get in, but is was cheap, less than 2 bucks at current conversion rates.  There was modest security there, so you felt safe leaving a few belongings on the side so you could go for a delightful swim.  Couples, families, backpackers and a few locals, all just enjoying the beauty and taking a refreshing dip in the cenote as a welcomed relief from the heat.  You don\'t have to swim if you don\'t want to.  Still need to pay though.  Great photos if you catch the light on either side of midday.

627511957.name: Beautiful Cenote
627511957.author: a TripAdvisor user
627511957.reviewBody: We made a quick stop in this beautiful cenote in Valladolid. We just sit for a bit to experience this beautiful place.

625993122.name: Amazing cenote, and right in the middle of town!
625993122.author: a TripAdvisor user
625993122.reviewBody: Beautiful oasis in a city centre block. Only 30 pesos to enter. If you don\'t want to swim, there is a ledge to sit in the water and cool off, and get a fish pedicure!

625082424.name: Super cool!
625082424.author: a TripAdvisor user
625082424.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cenote in Valladolid.  The entry fee is about $1.50.  Obviously it is very picturesque.  If you don\'t want to swim you there is a restaurant that overlooks the cenote.

622507537.name: The perfect spot to cool off
622507537.author: a TripAdvisor user
622507537.reviewBody: We stopped in Valladolid for a couple of days - we drove from Tulum and knew we would have a couple of hours to kill before we could check into our hotel. I\u2019m so glad this place exists! With it being very hot and humid it was the perfect place to cool off. It\u2019s cheap at only 30 pesos each and you get a wrist band so you can come and go in the day if you want. The water is fairly cool but a welcome break. We arrived around 1pm and there was only 4 other people, a few more arrived in the next hour or so but the swimming area is pretty big so it didn\u2019t feel busy or crowded. Plenty of space to leave your bag and also sit and admire the surroundings! Go if you can!!

622002837.name: Beautiful place!!
622002837.author: a TripAdvisor user
622002837.reviewBody: We visited this cenote while visiting Cancun. We actually stumbled across it by accident as we were actually looking for a place to eat. It is (what seemed to be) in the middle of town. The restaurant we stopped and asked about said there was also a Cenote there. Anyway....we\u2019re so glad we found it and the food was soooo good with handmade corn tortillas OMG...they were so good!! After breakfast we went down to the cenote which was so beautiful and peaceful! We did not swim although other tourists were. Very clean and easy access to the cenote. There was a souvenir shop at the end as well as men & women painted & dressed as Mayans. All in all we had a great time visiting Valladolid & this restaurant/cenote\ud83e\udd17

621924724.name: Refreshing swim
621924724.author: a TripAdvisor user
621924724.reviewBody: This is a huge and very deep cenote. We arrived in Valladolid just after tropical storm Franklin but it was back to hot and steamy weather so it was a welcomed swim. There were at least three different species of fish in the cenote. Entrance fee is 30pesos and you can hire floating jackets.  Daredevils were jumping/ diving in  from higher up. There is a parking area and some artesanal shops.

612721218.name: Super
612721218.author: a TripAdvisor user
612721218.reviewBody: This one it not crowded and is amazing !!! 30 pesos the entrance and it\u2019s lovely ! \nWe had a lovely time

612668963.name: Crowded
612668963.author: a TripAdvisor user
612668963.reviewBody: The area and walking paths were very crowded around the cenote.  It very pretty, though.  Our tour stopped here, and we walked around, but did not get in the water.

605092434.name: First Cenote, was great
605092434.author: a TripAdvisor user
605092434.reviewBody: Came with friends, the cenote is beautiful but a bit crowded. The water is kind of green and there are small fishes. 30 pesos.

604746628.name: Oasis in the heart of a city
604746628.author: a TripAdvisor user
604746628.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I stayed for 5 days in Valladolid and visited this cenote twice. It was a perfect place for a refreshing swim and nice and quiet especially in the mornings before the tour buses from Chichen Itza arrive. Really beautiful, natural swimming hole and only 30 pesos and you can come back all day with your wristband.

604606405.name: Didn\u2019t like it
604606405.author: a TripAdvisor user
604606405.reviewBody:
In the middle of the city so expect lots of people and not so well maintained. 30 mexican pesos to enter and you can enter anytime during that day.

The water was oily, I think people used sunscreen or any body oil before entering the water.

There are other options nearby.

599708916.name: Interesting Cenote on the Way to Ek Balam
599708916.author: a TripAdvisor user
599708916.reviewBody: This cenote was interesting because it was only half covered. It was huge and there were lots of fish swimming in the water. The entire area is walled off and there are a lot of fun shops and food options inside. Definitely worth checking out if you like cenotes.

593743567.name: Beautiful
593743567.author: a TripAdvisor user
593743567.reviewBody: $1.50 US to enter, we went on a Monday afternoon after visiting Chichen Itza and having lunch in Valladodid. Only a few blocks from the town square, plenty of parking, bathrooms to change, etc. This day there were less than 10 people in the cenote and the swimming area is huge. So cool, one of the best of the several cenotes we visited. Recommended.

591375764.name: Looks nice, but overcrowded.
591375764.author: a TripAdvisor user
591375764.reviewBody: A nice cenote to see, but the water looks a bit dirty and the place is really commercial and overcrowded. We saw a lot nicer cenotes a bit further out of town.

591148515.name: No need to go to far to find this great Cenote
591148515.author: a TripAdvisor user
591148515.reviewBody:
Beautiful water
$1.50 to enter
"cliffs" surrounded where is fun to jump from
Three blocks from our hotel (El Meson Del Marques)

589832422.name: Surprising. Beautiful.
589832422.author: a TripAdvisor user
589832422.reviewBody: When we were there people were swimming. It is a beautiful place to see. Definitely worth stopping, It is on your way to the Yucatan Maya site.

584130618.name: My favourite Cenote  in Yucatan
584130618.author: a TripAdvisor user
584130618.reviewBody:
The Cenote Zaci in the nice City of Valladolid is easy to find. We payed an entrance fee of 30 pesos and went swimming in heavy rain. After the entrance you walk a long dark pathway along the rocks and then unexpectedly the Cenote opens with a spectacular view.
 As the cenote is only half covered in contrast to most others we visited, it has incredibly green walls full of plants and farns  and with the special afternoon light of sun and rain it was unforgettable.
We 've been there shortly before the closing time, not many people around.
There 's a platform to jump, about 7 meters high and also some slippery steps for me, the mum, further on.
You see them on the foto on the left side.
As in most cenotes in the middle you find ropes from one side to the other, perfect to stand on, relax or balance.
We did not find any lockers , bathrooms or showers, but they may have been already closed.
In Valladolid you can also see an old Convent and some nice coffees , partly with garden.

582769077.name: Hidden Treasure of Mayan Period - A Sink Hole
582769077.author: a TripAdvisor user
582769077.reviewBody:
Our tour guide had informed that this place would be packed with tourists during the period of our visit, but to our surprise, 10-12 tourists only.  We had arrived there around 2:30 pm and it had started raining. Most of the tourists of our bus did not visit this attraction – may be due to rainfall. 

Entrance to Cenote Zaci is little difficult but the way is scenic & beautiful. Water looked blue and very clear. The entrance fee is $30 MX per person as displayed on the board near entrance. For us, it was included in our tour package. 

This place did not appear to be properly maintained by the authorities. The authorities may make it mandatory for swimmers to take a shower before swimming so as to protect the ecology and water quality. 

This place has a lot of history of Mayan period. 

We spent about 30 minutes at this attraction.

581766169.name: Gorgeous Cenote
581766169.author: a TripAdvisor user
581766169.reviewBody: This was our first cenote on the peninsula and we loved it.  I was worried it would be a dud and commercialized being in the city and it definitely wasn\'t.  My son is 8 and we opted not to do a life jacket and he was fine. Lots of places to jump from and sit.

580621979.name: A Refreshing Swim
580621979.author: a TripAdvisor user
580621979.reviewBody: A great place to escape the sun and heat for a couple hours. Swim with the fish while watching the birds and bats fly overhead!

578350786.name: Hidden dimond in a middle of downtown
578350786.author: a TripAdvisor user
578350786.reviewBody: That was such of incredible and unexpected experience just in a walking distance from ADO bus station. Cenote is deep with blue,crystal water and a lots of fish in it,Formations are very impressive and different in colour and shape. It feels very relaxing and refreshing to swim there leaving hot weather and hustle bustle of the city just 5 minutes ago. Cool, right? And they are opening from 9am to 6pm.So you can leave cenote and back again until closing.Or you can chill out at cenote restaurant having  nice launch or drinks.

575542642.name: Beautiful Cenote in the city center
575542642.author: a TripAdvisor user
575542642.reviewBody: So happy that we stopped by after our trip to the ruins at Ek\' Balam. I was hesitant at first and expected this place to be packed with tourists and was pleasantly surprised when we were among 15 people max., arrived there around 10AM. Cenote Zaci is beautiful, the water is clear and refreshing after a morning in the sun. The entrance fee is $MX30 per person and well worth it. There is an approx. 22ft terrace you can jump off, its a fun drop. Met some European travelers and had a great conversation. This place feel full of history and has a great energy to it. Don\'t skip a stroll though Valladolid afterwards.

573932734.name: Favourite Cenote and place to visit in Valladolid
573932734.author: a TripAdvisor user
573932734.reviewBody:
Absolutely love this place. The structure is beautiful, with vegetation growing along the walls. Pathways carved down to the bottom with various viewing ledges. It’s possible to leap or dive into the cenote from various heights (proceeding at your own risk of course. There are no lifeguard so bring a competent friend in case of injury). There were people jumping from some 20+ meter cliff jumps at the top.  The water is fairly clear. There are bees, birds, bats, and fish. A real natural wonderland. We were even so fortunate to have live music; a guitar and pan flute being played which filled the entire area and made it feel surreal and mythical.

A few downsides... they don’t protect it like they should. It would be ideal if they had some outdoor showers and made it mandatory for swimmers to wash off sunscreen and oils / hair or body products before swimming (to protect the ecology and water quality). At least there wasn’t any garbage or trash about. 

So, don’t wear sunscreen before going. Don’t use deodorant, perfumes or hair gel. And if possible, shower right before going :)

There is also a restaurant on site that is good and has traditional dishes. Very convenient 

Would highly recommend spending a full day lounging around here.

572873085.name: Good city Cenote
572873085.author: a TripAdvisor user
572873085.reviewBody: Had heard that this Cenote was a bit of a disappointment but we thought far from it. It\u2019s beautiful and quite open so you get lots of lovely light in. \nIt\u2019s the cheapest Cenote we visited at only $MX30 and you get s band for the whole day. If you get s good spot on the rocks in the sun it\u2019s a nice place to hang out and escape the city heat for a couple of hours. \nThe water is a little cloudier than some other cenotes but probably because it is quite busy as it\u2019s only 5 minutes from the city centre. Also the openness of it allows leaves etc to fall in. Still lovely though.

572438977.name: Beautiful cenote in the middle of Valladolid
572438977.author: a TripAdvisor user
572438977.reviewBody: Despite the toursity marketplace and costumed men trying to entice you to get your photograph taken with them, this site is so incredibly beautiful and not to be missed. It\'s an open air cenote, but the walkway is partially covered, with birds flying around. There\'s lush vegetation on the other side. We were warned by some locals not to swim in this cenote due to uncleanliness, but many people were swimming happily-- I guess that\'s up to your own comfort level? Glad we experienced the magnitude and the beauty.

571283294.name: Beautiful cenote
571283294.author: a TripAdvisor user
571283294.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful cenotes I have visited. Conveniently located in town. Jump off the cliff! Enjoy a drink in the restaurant, visit the vendors and just enjoy the beauty of the place.

570967737.name: Cenote inside the city
570967737.author: a TripAdvisor user
570967737.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a large cenote almost in the city center of Valladolid, one of the biggest ones we saw on our trip to Yucatan. We didn\'t swim this time but there were many people enjoying the fresh water.

569317160.name: A Hidden Treasure Right in Valladolid
569317160.author: a TripAdvisor user
569317160.reviewBody: This cenote is a gem and the setting is lovely. We didn\'t have a chance to swim and regretted that because it looked so inviting, but the grounds are nicely kept and there is a restaurant at the top which is nice for a beer. It is a great place to escape the heat of the Yucatan sun.

568420891.name: Fun visit
568420891.author: a TripAdvisor user
568420891.reviewBody:
We loved our visit to this cenote. It was the perfect way to cool off after exploring Valladolid and Ek Balam. It costs 30 pesos (15 for kids) so very cheap. We brought swimsuits to change into and there are bathrooms there but they charge 5 pesos to use them. I wish there were better facilities but they’re usable. 

The cenote itself is nice, a half open cave. I’m sure there are more breathtaking cenote but this one is pretty cool. And it’s especially great because it’s right in town, a short walk from the main square. 

There are some small black catfish in the water but other than that, not a lot to see snorkeling. We liked jumping off the ledges into the water. Maybe 15 feet high, which was the perfect amount of daring for our kids. And not too crowded. More people walking around the edge than actually swimming.

568245169.name: A natural wonder!
568245169.author: a TripAdvisor user
568245169.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful cenote that is off the beaten path. Driving up to this place, one would think you had missed the landmark that you were looking for. Maybe it\'s that I was just excited to be seeing something so cool, or the novelty of such a natural wonder, but I was impressed with the place. The flowering trees around were such a beautiful touch that it just seemed very surreal. We did not end up swimming in this cenote, even though we could have. We did enjoy watching others swim and saw that fish were swimming in the cenote as well. It is extremely deep and allows for cliff jumping down in to the water. What was nice was that we were able to sit and have some adult beverages before we went in, and our purchases at the restaurant waived our entrance fee! An overall very neat experience and one worth the stop if you\'re traveling the Yucatan peninsula.

568219650.name: Nice
568219650.author: a TripAdvisor user
568219650.reviewBody: Even though the tickets are next to nothing, we did not want to go swimming, so we just went to the restaurant to take a look. You can easily park on the street or by the restaurant.

567754218.name: Go. Get in the Water.  Enjoy!
567754218.author: a TripAdvisor user
567754218.reviewBody:
First of all we can't WAIT to return to Valladolid. We only spent 3 nights there and I SO wish we were there longer.  I guess that means we will have to return.
Our first morning after breakfast, we toured Casa de los Venados, then after that we headed to Cenote Zaci.  This was one cenote that I was really looking forward to.

Within walking distance from city center, we headed there around 11:30. Before we entered the Cenote we stopped at the on-site restaurant to have an ice cold beer and a quick appetizer.  If you order food from the restaurant, you can enter the Cenote for free.

I believe the free entrance into the Cenote is different from the entrance for those who paid the entry fee.  I just wish there were some sort of History information or informational brochure.  Wished there were signs, or a guide, or something to tell us about this marvelous place.  The whole thing just blows my mind.  How deep is it?  Where does the clear blue water come from?  How long has it been a sinkhole? Who built the ledge and stairs - was it the Mayan's or are they a recent addition (although the ledge and stairs look very very old).....oh I have so many questions.  But alas, I guess that's what makes it such a neat mystery.

The water is so blue and clear and just an amazing place. Tourists were there as well as local families enjoying the beautiful afternoon.  The weather was perfect and the vibe was so very calm and relaxing.  We went to Zaci on our first full day in Valladolid, so our itinerary didn't allow for us to go back, but next time we certainly will spend more time there.

Hubby swam and jumped off the ledge a couple times. I could kick myself for not getting in the water. I just sat at the edge and put my feet in.  Do you ever look back on a wonderful adventure and wish you would have done something?  Well, that's how I feel about Zaci.  I sure wish I would have gotten in the water.

Go.  Get in.  Enjoy.  It's a wonderful place!

563227625.name: Only City Cenote
563227625.author: a TripAdvisor user
563227625.reviewBody: Very beautiful cenote, not as beautiful as Ik Kil\n\nSomehow we walked in for free through a restaurant, without ordering anything. walked around it and watched people jump and swim in it. We didn\'t cause i read reviews not recommending it due to city sewage. Some very nice pictures from this place makes it more memorable than most of the cenotes we saw.

562720282.name: Averge cenote
562720282.author: a TripAdvisor user
562720282.reviewBody: In the center of Valladolid is a cenote that isn\'t spectacular , but if you\'re there , take a look. Not on the scale of some less obvious ones nearby, but , why not eh?

562555399.name: Relaxing spot in heart of City
562555399.author: a TripAdvisor user
562555399.reviewBody: Amazing spot in the heart of Valladolid. Stop to have a bite at restaurant on rim and then take a dip in refreshing waters of the. Denote.

561343971.name: Jump in
561343971.author: a TripAdvisor user
561343971.reviewBody: Loved this place. Coming back from C. Itzu and our tour guide put it on the stop. Loved it. Just bring towel and flip flops. Worth the small detour if going to C Itzu.

561057554.name: A bit commercialised - but you can swim
561057554.author: a TripAdvisor user
561057554.reviewBody:
We were a bit “cenoted” weary by the time we got to Valladolid

This is easily accessible from the main plaza and costs about 20 pesos to enter

It’s pretty busy and very commercialised with a restaurant and souvenir shops

Some Mayans in traditional dress also needed to be navigated if you did not want to pay for the photo opportunity 

The centre itself is half covered so there is plenty of shade, wild life in the roof ( birds, bats and insects) and fish in the water

Plenty of opportunities to junk in and swim and there is a well built path that descends / amends and circumnavigated the water

Would imaging it could get real busy as it is so easily accessible

560752036.name: Definitely worth a visit if you\'re in town
560752036.author: a TripAdvisor user
560752036.reviewBody: Mostly exciting because it is in the middle of the city - when walking by at night you wouldn\'t even know it was there. A bit touristic but definitely worth a visit if you\'re in town. If it\'s a hot day - bring your bathing suite!

560532120.name: Wonderfull place
560532120.author: a TripAdvisor user
560532120.reviewBody: A stunning view ! And You can swim in this one. Funny Colord mayan people around to take some nice memories... there are also some shops and you can eat in a restaurant next to it...

559268784.name: Beautiful cenote slap bang in the middle of Valladolid
559268784.author: a TripAdvisor user
559268784.reviewBody: This is an open cenote in the middle of Valladolid - it\'s really pretty and worth going to see even if you don\'t fancy swimming (it looked a little bit nippy to me). It has a walk way all the way round, carved into the rock, and you can jump off/dive in from some of the vantage points from the walkway - but they\'re seriously high! If you\'re lucky (like we were), there might be some brave soul (nutter!) diving off and performing back flips for your entertainment!!

558563282.name: Great location
558563282.author: a TripAdvisor user
558563282.reviewBody: Zaci is not the most picturesque cenote I\u2019ve ever seen but it\u2019s in a great location if you are visiting Valladolid. It\u2019s only a few blocks from the centro. Entrance fee was 30 pesos and the water was clean. There are lots of ledges to jump from also. We went in February and there were only 10-15 people there. I\u2019m sure it\u2019s more crowded in the hot months. There are more picturesque cenotes nearby but you can\u2019t beat Zaci for location and price.

558463476.name: Far Better Than a Municipal Pool!
558463476.author: a TripAdvisor user
558463476.reviewBody: For the cost of 30 pesos, Cenote Zaci is a worthwhile adventure and conveniently located in the heart of Valladolid.  We took it easy one afternoon and enjoyed the sheltering, encasing feel this cenote offers with its partial cave enclosure.  Hardly busy when we went, though my friend and I felt slightly chilly after swimming for a few hours.

557073266.name: Cenote in the middle of town
557073266.author: a TripAdvisor user
557073266.reviewBody: We just walked by on the way to the market but looked so inviting we wished that we had time to experience.

556938199.name: Easily accessible
556938199.author: a TripAdvisor user
556938199.reviewBody: Not the most majestic cenote in the area, but easy to get to. Free admission if you spend at least 100 pesos at the restaurant, otherwise it only costs 30 pesos.

556578944.name: Don\'t Miss
556578944.author: a TripAdvisor user
556578944.reviewBody: This is an amazing cenote, in the middle of town so well worth the short walk from wherever you are staying. It costs 30 pesos admission. We didn\'t swim, but we did walk all the way down to the water\'s edge (100 meters or so). The water looks clear but lots of leaves.

556156430.name: Unique place in the world to be found in the city center
556156430.author: a TripAdvisor user
556156430.reviewBody: Definetly what makes Valladolid so special is to have this amazing cenote in its center. You can have a swim there, we decided just to see it when we were touring the center. You have beuatiful views you ll see many nice birds and have a relaxing time. Due to some people advising not to swim there as its in the center and indicated it is not clean we did not take towels there but we regretted it - it looked very clean:)

555720185.name: Awesome
555720185.author: a TripAdvisor user
555720185.reviewBody: Beautiful Cenote, a must when in Valladolid! Worth the few cents of admission.\nA great way to spend an afternoon cooling off after lots of walking in the heat.

554942948.name: Great cenote in centre of Valladolid
554942948.author: a TripAdvisor user
554942948.reviewBody: This has got to have been the easiest cenote to access that I\'ve  visited - it\'s a 5 minute walk from the main square.  It is open 8am - 5pm daily and costs 30 pesos. You\'re given a wrist band so can return later in the day too.  It has interesting formations,  clear, refreshing  water and quite a few fish.  It is pretty deep though.  It\'s easy to access by a stone walkway.  Definitely worth the visit even if you just walk around it a several people were when I was there.

554665989.name: Spectacular
554665989.author: a TripAdvisor user
554665989.reviewBody: Crystal clear water, huge... Photos don\'t do  justice ....    A great little city .... This is a must see ... It is slippery so have good shoes .. It not for children or those with difficulty walking on uneven, slippery rocks

554081565.name: A must see if you are in Merida
554081565.author: a TripAdvisor user
554081565.reviewBody: take the plunge take your bathing suit and jump into the cenote! Refreshing filled with visitors, tourists, and locals. Great experience!

553656708.name: A veritable oasis of water and shade.
553656708.author: a TripAdvisor user
553656708.reviewBody: I went there last year and delighted in the coolness provided by the shade trees and humidity from the pool. I did not go into the water but many did and luxuriated in it.

553061445.name: Nice cenote in the middle of town
553061445.author: a TripAdvisor user
553061445.reviewBody:
If you don't have time to visit alot of cenotes near valladolid. It is enough to visit this cenote in middle of town! It's interesting location next to the residential area. 
Of cause you can swim and its cheap entrance fee than other cenotes.

If you don't want to enter you could look from outside.

552703118.name: Nice spot for cooling swim or just visit
552703118.author: a TripAdvisor user
552703118.reviewBody: Each cenote is so different! In this one you can walk around it or go swimming, or both. Very beautiful! The location is in city center so you can walk and parking is easy too. It could get crowded, so go early in the morning or before closing. This cenote is good for (quick) swim, not much snorkeling since the water is not that clear.

551350993.name: Beautiful!
551350993.author: a TripAdvisor user
551350993.reviewBody: Accesible, definitely worth a visit.  It may not have the wow factor of the underground cave cenotes with the stalagmites and other features, but this open cenote allows natural sunlight to tint its water a gorgeous dark jade.  It\'s surrounded by tropical vegetation which is another feature you don\'t find in an underground cenote.  I didn\'t swim, but enjoyed watching people jump off the high walls of the sink hole into the water many, many meters bellow.  Do visit if you are in town!

550765456.name: Beautful!
550765456.author: a TripAdvisor user
550765456.reviewBody: This was our first cenote and we were not disappointed. The swim was refreshing and the view was great. I\'d recommend coming with only your bathing suit and the money you need for swimming since there\'s no good place to change, though you can leave valuables in a locker. It\'s right in downtown Valladolid, used heavily by the locals, so it felt quite authentic, even if there weren\'t as many facilities as there were in the cenotes that are a few miles out of town.

550535041.name: Beautiful cenote right in town!
550535041.author: a TripAdvisor user
550535041.reviewBody: I am so glad we had a chance to visit this cenote! We were a little worried since it was in the middle of town it would be super busy with people, but it wasn\'t. The water is clean, not too cold and very inviting. I look forward to returning to Valladolid just to come back here.

550385832.name: A Cenote For The Locals
550385832.author: a TripAdvisor user
550385832.reviewBody: We hired a guide to walk us down to the water level, even though it was a very short distance, he gave us great historical perspective. The guide was very good and we hired him to show us around town as well as to another cenote.

548727012.name: Magical place
548727012.author: a TripAdvisor user
548727012.reviewBody: Right in the city, you can walk from the center. You descend the stairs into a magical cenote (sinkhole) which you can swim. The restaurant is supposed to be nice.

547744878.name: nice \u201ccenter town\u201d cenote
547744878.author: a TripAdvisor user
547744878.reviewBody: There are nicer cenotes, but this one is just in the town center and therefore more than worth a visit if you are in valladolid! The access fee is 30 MXN/p and it is easy to get down to the cenote. So go, if you happen to be close.

545313587.name: Go for a morning swim!
545313587.author: a TripAdvisor user
545313587.reviewBody: Two blocks from the Zocalo, you will find the Cenote Zaci! We got here early in the morning and had the whole cenote to ourselves for almost an hour! The kids in the entrance included the performance of a traditional \u201cBomba\u201d-poem in the price! (20 pesos). This cenote is as good as the other more touristic places near by, and has the advantage that you don\u2019t have to make a line to get into the water!

544772860.name: Zaci cenote
544772860.author: a TripAdvisor user
544772860.reviewBody: Not to be missed while in Valladolid! Denotes are a unique feature of the Yucatan. This is a marvel of nature right in the middle of town. Great place to cool off with a swim and great p.ace to take photos. Don\'t  miss it while here!

544427002.name: Beautiful cenote
544427002.author: a TripAdvisor user
544427002.reviewBody: A beautiful cenote in middle of Valladolid. Can be accessed either through a restaurant for free if you purchase something or for a small fee via "ticket point ". Full of fish, just beautiful

541910093.name: Very nice cenote that is not too busy
541910093.author: a TripAdvisor user
541910093.reviewBody: We ate at the restaurant, so got to swim for free.  There were only a few people there other than us, and the water was nice and refreshing.  There were lots of little fish, many of which nibbled at our feet which made everyone laugh.  A beautiful site.

541640247.name: Beautiful!
541640247.author: a TripAdvisor user
541640247.reviewBody: Somehow I missed seeing this cenote on my previous trip to Valladolid, so it was the first place I went to after arriving on my latest visit.\n\nIt is gorgeous and very atmospheric.  And much bigger than I expected!  I did not see anywhere to pay an admission fee, but others mention it.  I walked all around the edge, but did not swim, there were about 8 people in there at the time, however.

539073193.name: Wonderful cenote in city center
539073193.author: a TripAdvisor user
539073193.reviewBody: Wow what a treat to have a cenote in city center. The cenote is quite different from the others, with a nice cave. The water is clear and there are some great spots for cliff jumping.\n30 pesos is the cheapest we paid for! If there were a few more roots hanging in then 5 stars :D

538464898.name: Great for a swim.
538464898.author: a TripAdvisor user
538464898.reviewBody: Our hotel was only 5 minutes away from this cenote, so it was perfect to cool down after a long and hot day.

527712575.name: Refreshing cheap spot in the city
527712575.author: a TripAdvisor user
527712575.reviewBody: For 30 pesos you can jump into a cenote directly in the city! How great is it!?  We have been there in the afternoon after rain, but it was still great to see the spot! The water was refreshing and I can totally recommend a visit there if you have time!

526639027.name: Refreshing
526639027.author: a TripAdvisor user
526639027.reviewBody: A very welcome sight in the middle of town, especially on a typically hot day.  Cool, clean water and easy to access. Hardly anyone around, so had the whole place to ourselves (almost).   Had a late lunch in the restaurant.  Good Mexican dishes and friendly staff.  Beer\'s cheap, too....

524329672.name: beautifull cenote reachable by foot from town centre
524329672.author: a TripAdvisor user
524329672.reviewBody: We wnet her in the afternoon and first had lunch at the restaurant. The restaurant is very nice and offers delicious local food. we then went to the cenote. You can rent a life jacket upstairs and then go down. The acces is very good. My son did some snorkeling and you saw quiet some fishes.

517780736.name: Beautiful cenote in heart of town.
517780736.author: a TripAdvisor user
517780736.reviewBody: Beautiful cenote right in the centre of town. It\'s huge so even if there are quite a lot of people it doesn\'t feel too busy. Lots of jumps you can do if adventurous, some REALLY high! Like other cenotes in area lots of catfish and other types of fish. Only costs 30 mx pesos to get in.

515463014.name: Surprisingly good
515463014.author: a TripAdvisor user
515463014.reviewBody: We were amazed that this cenote was "hiding" within the city. Before we arrived, we thought it couldn\'t be too spectacular, considering its location, but we were wrong. You go down a few stairs after you buy a ticket (really cheap), through a half kind of cave, and then suddenly it feels like you left the city and entered nature, just like that. The cenote is really big, with several places where you can jump from, ranging heights from 1m to maybe 10-15m. The place isn\'t crowded at all, even though its located in the middle of the city (we were there in the afternoon). This is everything you could hope for in a cenote. Would recommend any day.

515221364.name: Super Convenient!
515221364.author: a TripAdvisor user
515221364.reviewBody: The cenote is located a few mins walk from Valladolid City Center / Bus station. Don\'t miss it if you\'re visiting this place. The water is not very clear, but the Cenote is beautiful. A great place to cool down in the hot weather.

512277134.name: Refreshing & used by locals - 5 mins walk away from main square
512277134.author: a TripAdvisor user
512277134.reviewBody: Wonderfully refreshing & used by locals on weekends - 5 mins walk away from main square. Great place to jump into the water if you have the nerve.

510280181.name: Cenote visit
510280181.author: a TripAdvisor user
510280181.reviewBody: Nice place to visit. Most impressive is that it is in the middle of the town. Nice blue water and a beautiful view. Swimming is also good, especially on a hot day.

509477162.name: very nice cenote
509477162.author: a TripAdvisor user
509477162.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful cenote just a ten-minute walk away from the main plaza. entry fee is 30 pesos and completely worth it. refreshing water, some catfish in there that won\'t bother you and also won\'t be bothered by you ;)\nawesome place to cool off when the sun hits Valladolid too hard ;)

506999715.name: Sink hole right bang in the town centre!
506999715.author: a TripAdvisor user
506999715.reviewBody: This cenote located 10 minutes walk from the main square.  Totally unassuming and very contrasting to the urban environment surrounding the attraction.  It is beautiful with high walls with clean refreshing fresh water swimming.  Warning: this cenote is visited by the Chichen Itza busloads and it can get busy.  We visited in the late afternoon and it wasn\'t too bad.

506718813.name: A must in Valladolid
506718813.author: a TripAdvisor user
506718813.reviewBody: We have visited a few cenotes and liked this one in Valladolid downtown the most. Large, open, with trees surrounded, water is refreshing but not as cold as some other cenotes. The entrance fee is only 30 pesos so it is worth to stop by even if you do not plan to take a swim (which would be a shame).

506585340.name: Cheap and fairly quiet
506585340.author: a TripAdvisor user
506585340.reviewBody: Definitely recommend going to this cenote, it is right in the town centre and easy to find because of the towns grid system. It was very cheap to get in and had very few people there compared to others we have been to.

504205321.name: Beautiful place in a beautiful town
504205321.author: a TripAdvisor user
504205321.reviewBody: Zaci is one of those places that is hard to describe. You arrive at a nondescript stop on the street, walk through a small area of shops (with what liked to be a great sandal maker but it was so hot we didn\'t stop) and then walk down steps to an underground cave- like area. After continuing further down you enter into a massive space with a beautiful blue green pool. Water flows in from the surface, hundreds of feet above. It\'s really something to see. We didn\'t swim, but many people were. After seeing all the ads for other cenotes, this one seemed more step aside - less commercial. Either way, I\'m glad I saw it. If you are close to valladolid, make the stop.

504044040.name: Magical place
504044040.author: a TripAdvisor user
504044040.reviewBody: We went there because it was included in the tour. We were driving among Valladolid streets and the weather was little bit rainy, when we arrive was fantastic, rainy weather, quiet place, full of children running to the cenote laughing in a funny way, full of life and joy. When we got in was fantastic as well, an space of nature, great. The water was so clean, and rain falling into the cenote, wonderful. Go to this place and enjoy it, take your swimsuit and have a refreshing bath.

504033685.name: Beautiful town center cenote
504033685.author: a TripAdvisor user
504033685.reviewBody: If you visit Valladolid, and have the time take the time to cool off at Cenote Zaci. It is a short walk from the town center of Valladolid. It is not expensive and be sure and bring your bathing suit of course.

503985774.name: Perfect for families
503985774.author: a TripAdvisor user
503985774.reviewBody:
We visited the cenote at the end of June in 2017. This was a great cenote to visit because it gets partial sunlight and the water is warmer than other cenotes. Admission is free if you eat at the restaurant (there is free parking).

Swimming is fun and refreshing. There are steps to get in and out of the Cenote as well as areas to jump off the sides if you are a daredevil. The water is clear and you can see plently of fish. If you sit really still the fish come up and nibble the dead skin off your feet. That's an expensive spa treatment you can get for free. The algae in the cenote is not slippery, but more spongey. There are tour bus loads of people at various times during the day, but there are no changing rooms so those groups just take pics, but don't stay very long. 

If you plan on spending time in Valladolid, it would be a mistake to skip this cenote. It's not far off the city center and definitely worth it. It was a highlight for my family.

502555989.name: Its not like the picture
502555989.author: a TripAdvisor user
502555989.reviewBody: Mmmmm not crystal clear, lot pf people, greenish water, little cascade, there charge to get in , there ar\u00e9 better in other places

502474225.name: Beautiful
502474225.author: a TripAdvisor user
502474225.reviewBody: This was such a beautiful cenote we had a quick stop over here and got to have a look. Some of the guys on our tour did jump in from a ledge but i decided not to.

500784726.name: beauty lives here
500784726.author: a TripAdvisor user
500784726.reviewBody: Enjoy the mood of true nature and the kindness of the people while you taste at the restaurant regional dishes with unique flavors.

497764778.name: Great fun right in town
497764778.author: a TripAdvisor user
497764778.reviewBody: My spouse, 12 year son, and I went here while staying in Valladolid.  We opted to dine at the restaurant first, which had excellent service, decent food, and included free entry to the cenote.  It was not crowded until late afternoon when a couple tour buses stopped.  Most people just hiked around and did not swim.  I suggest going for breakfast and a swim if you want to completely avoid others.

497194355.name: Cenote Zaci ( Sinkhole Zaci )
497194355.author: a TripAdvisor user
497194355.reviewBody: This beatiful cenote is located within the small city of Valladolid, which was built on the site the Mayan settlement in the Yucatan peninsula you can get inside for only $30 pesos  per person  the water is a little cold so you\'ll be thankful because of the hot of that area cenote zaci offers a shady respite from the tropical heat, with stairs carved right out of the natural rocks leading down behind stalactites to the water\'s surface, you can see eyeless black fishes that are swimming in its deep. There is a restaurant there too and the opening hours are 8:00 am to 6:00 pm they have parking lot too.

496928762.name: Just amazing!
496928762.author: a TripAdvisor user
496928762.reviewBody: A hidden gem in the heart of Valladolid! This beautyful cenote is in a cave that you can hardly see from outside but once you get in it is just like a paradise! Clear water, tree roots hanging from the ceiling and diving -natural- platform! You will have a great time!

496307752.name: Cenote, dining and tortilla-making all-in-one experience!
496307752.author: a TripAdvisor user
496307752.reviewBody: We ran out of time but wanted to see a cenote badly, so dropped by Zaci which is near town centre. We\'ve read comments about it being heavily used, but it turned out very pleasant. The cenote is fairly big and open, so it\'s very airy and bright. There are less than 20 swimming each time, so it\'s not that crowded. Water\'s ok quality.\n\nWe ate at the restaurant to gain free entry to the cenote, and the food is reasonably priced and surprisingly good! The servers are busy but efficient. We even made tortillas alongside the friendly lady making them, and my girls really enjoyed themselves. The visit was quite a surprise and we hung out longer than we anticipated.

496008489.name: Our favourite Cenote so far
496008489.author: a TripAdvisor user
496008489.reviewBody:
This Cenote is fully open to the sky, so the sunlight gets in and warms the water so this was a very pleasant temperature for a wonderful swim. 

There are two ways to enter, the first is to pay. The second is to eat in their restaurant which is very reasonable and then you can enter for free. (you only have to order a nice cold beer) 

This was a lovely afternoon out for us. Our son enjoyed jumping and diving into the water, whilst we swam around.

494127106.name: Great place to swim and jump
494127106.author: a TripAdvisor user
494127106.reviewBody: Despite the water not being clear this place was so much fun. We jumped from all heights into the water which is cool but not too bad once in. It wasn\'t too busy and the people don\'t harass you to buy anything or pay for a guide.\nThe cat fish are a little intimidating but don\'t bother you at all. The small ones give you a pedicure by nibbling on your feet, which doesn\'t hurt!\nAll in all a great experience, especially given the central location and low cost!

490214343.name: Afternoon visit.
490214343.author: a TripAdvisor user
490214343.reviewBody: I visited cenote Zac\u00ed but didn\'t bathe on it. Ticket is very inexpensive and you can enjoy the cavern view from different spots. Market stalls on the entrance with handcrafts. It has a restaurant. It is located two blocks from the main plaza.

490086064.name: Lovely place to stop for a swim and meal!!
490086064.author: a TripAdvisor user
490086064.reviewBody: This cenote on the center of the Valladolid town has a beautiful restaurant overlooking the cenote, the food is great and with the beers they bring a bunch of botanas for free , are small plates with food to munch in while you drinking\nThe food is really good, the atmosphere of the place is like campestre or from the countryside with the whole roof made out of palms leafs wich makes it more informal and fresh \nOnce you eat at the restaurant you have free access to the cenote

489971605.name: Great way to cool down
489971605.author: a TripAdvisor user
489971605.reviewBody:
This cenote has parking and is easy to access if your in town. Was lovely to cool of after exploring a little bit of the city. 

The cenote is beautiful and has lots of fish. 

There is a high ledge to jump off. 

It only cost around 35 pesos per person. 

The water wasn't as clear as other cenotes.

487495469.name: Nice place with nice restaurant
487495469.author: a TripAdvisor user
487495469.reviewBody: This Cenote has a very nice restaurant overlooking the Cenote so you can enjoy a very nice meal with a great view. You have free parking here as well and it is located right near the downtown area.

487375777.name: In the heart of Valladolid
487375777.author: a TripAdvisor user
487375777.reviewBody: Just a few blocks from the square, this very large cenote offers respite from the heat of the Yucatan. The day we visited, many people were swimming. There\'s a small entry fee to get in. The cenote also offers a restaurant and there are souvenir vendors all around.

486256885.name: Required while in Valladolid
486256885.author: a TripAdvisor user
486256885.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is a great way to cool down after a hot day in the jungle. The food is great and it\'s well worth buying a beer to get free admission. The cliff jumping is super fun and, quick bonus, If you hang around in the shallows you can get a free pedicure from the fish!

483043441.name: Big outdoor cenote, but not the best.
483043441.author: a TripAdvisor user
483043441.reviewBody: The location of this cenote is really convenient as it\'s right in the centre of Valladolid. It was 30 pesos to enter and 20 pesos to rent a locker. If I\'m honest this cenote wasn\'t really that impressive. It was pretty big but it felt quite built up, like the sides were man made and there were loads of steps all around. It just wasn\'t very authentic and the water was quite dirty as well.

483042832.name: Jump in!
483042832.author: a TripAdvisor user
483042832.reviewBody: If you\'re in Valladolid then definitely pay the 30 pesos to go swim in this cenote, so worth it. You can jump in without any problem but go in the morning as there are tourist buses that start showing up around 2-3 pm and it gets crowded apparently.

481077437.name: An Oasis in the Center of Valladolid
481077437.author: a TripAdvisor user
481077437.reviewBody: This is a stunning open cave/cenote right near the market. It\'s interesting and beautiful. A great place to cool off. Entrance fee is a couple of dollars and good for the whole day. We went twice.

475424974.name: Again and again
475424974.author: a TripAdvisor user
475424974.reviewBody: We were lucky to stay in an apartment close to this beautiful cenote. Actually, it\'s more like the public pool of Valladolid --- lots of locals hanging around, enjoying the cool air and water. Especially in the morning or late afternoon when it\'s not that busy it\'s always worth a visit for a quick swim.... Or a huge jump, if you dare.

475096375.name: Cenote in a City
475096375.author: a TripAdvisor user
475096375.reviewBody: We visited Cenote Zaci after seeing Casa de los Venados in Valladolid. Just a few blocks from the town center, this is a lovely, open cenote with stone steps leading down to the water from ground level. We did not swim, but enjoyed watching families leap from the surrounding walls and swim in the crystal blue water. A palapa restaurant adjacent to the cenote can be accessed from there. No need to pay to get in the cenote from the restaurant. The restaurant has good food, some free botanas when you order drinks, and a folkloric dance troupe surprised us with a performance as we dined. A great way to spend an hour or two on a Sunday afternoon.

473703503.name: Within walking distance from downtown
473703503.author: a TripAdvisor user
473703503.reviewBody:
This was our families first Cenote.  We went to 2 others during our stay and this one was  great for jumping.  The cost is about $2 per person.  We had one of the locals explain a lot about how Cenotes are made and spent about 10 minutes with us.  We ended up give him an extra $5 and it was well worth it because it was very informative.

We tried out all of the different levels for jumping.  It was fun for my kids and myself as well.  Make sure you keep the legs together when you jump.  

This is an easy one to access and the stairs are well designed for all ages.  The only caution I have is where people are getting out of the water, the ground was kind of slick.  We had a family of 7 with ages from 15 to 78 and we spent just under an hour here.

472216105.name: A gem just outside centre of town
472216105.author: a TripAdvisor user
472216105.reviewBody: Visited this cenote last week and as it was my first didn\'t know what to expect. It certainly was a beautiful spot to cool off and only a short walk from town. As I am not a strong swimmer there was no way I was leaping off a 10 metre ledge! On the way down I watched some locals entering the water and noticed they used some steps at left hand side (this will depend on which way you descend) and so I followed them in this way. It was a bit rocky but not too difficult. The lockers and toilets (for changing) are not obvious so when you buy your ticket (very reasonable) ask for the ba\u00f1os and you will be directed up a short path away from the entrance of the cenote. Didn\'t use the lockers so can\'t advise about price but did pay 5 pesos to use toilet for changing.

472205298.name: Nice cenote!
472205298.author: a TripAdvisor user
472205298.reviewBody: Very nice cenote, easily accessed by walking as it\'s near the centre of town.  Good cool water for a refreshing swim and great photos of the cave and stalagtites.

470881475.name: Feels Like Valladolid\'s Secret Underworld - Just Gorgeous!
470881475.author: a TripAdvisor user
470881475.reviewBody: It\'s so odd when you think about a place this beautiful being just four or so blocks from the city square. The area where you enter looks like any other little park on the corner until you descend down the stairs into the cenote. The stairs wind down, around the cavern, taking you through beautiful vegetation. The animal life is all around- bats, iguanas, birds, fish. When you are down in it, the cavern is so exotic, it feels like a completely different world from the surface level.  We went early in the day when the vendors were just setting up outside. They were friendly, not pushy at all. The cenote was quiet and serene, with only a few other people around, most of whom were just sitting along the edge, enjoying the morning. I highly recommend stopping at this cenote.

470176390.name: Amazing! A cenote *in the middle of town* with little to no vendors/hustlers!
470176390.author: a TripAdvisor user
470176390.reviewBody: M partner and I were hot and tired from visiting ruins and a dip in a cenote sounded really nice. However, we were really sick of being harassed by vendors. We randomly found this cenote whilst having coffee a few blocks away and thoughts it was a mistake. How could there be a cenote in the middle of town?\n\nWe went to check it out and had a blast, it was exactly what we were looking for! affordable, cool and refreshing, not too many people and NO VENDORS! This was a highlight for us and we highly recommend it

467860194.name: Beautiful!
467860194.author: a TripAdvisor user
467860194.reviewBody: This is a must see - it was only a 3 block walk from the main downtown area.  You can swim or just enjoy the views.  Was not crowded (especially in the morning).  Loved it!

467395575.name: Breathtaking place
467395575.author: a TripAdvisor user
467395575.reviewBody: I stumbled upon this place with my bike and loved every inch of this place.  I took my time going around the full cenote and watching a bunch of young men jumping into the water.  \n\nI did not take a swim and it looked so inviting.

467186423.name: Breathtaking
467186423.author: a TripAdvisor user
467186423.reviewBody: When we heard there was a cenote in the core of the town of Valladolid, I was expecting something small. How wrong I was. This is a beautiful place to swim and spend an afternoon, or even just to visit and have a look. Entry fee is equivalent to about USD$2. Keep in mind that the cenote is extremely deep and there is no lifeguard, so take you necessary precautions.

467017540.name: You can\'t find a cenote closer to town. Also: several tips...
467017540.author: a TripAdvisor user
467017540.reviewBody:
If you don't want to take a taxi or a bus from Valladolid, this is a good choice: You can walk here or take a cheap cab ride ($20 MXD from the Monastery, I think it was).

The private path from the restaurant to the cenote has much better views than the public entrance: trees, birds, and (in our case) an iguana, too.

The restaurant also let us sit at the tables outside, overlooking the cenote, for as long as we wanted. This is another reason to buy something at the restaurant.

My friend had the poc-chuc, which was piled high with grilled meat (more tender than the poc-chuc on the plaza at Las Campanas). Both times we came here, I had the pollo pibil; it was tender and absolutely delicious.

If you buy beer, they'll bring you a plate or two of antojitos -- local specialties, and refried frijoles, with tortilla chips to scoop them up. The meat was tough and chewy, but the flavors were good.

If you come here at an "off" hour -- for instance, after spending mid-afternoon in the cenote -- snag one of the popular tables along the edge that overlooks the cenote.

Although the walkway from the cenote was chained off, we walked inside and found the restaurant still open. But when the cenote closes, this place does too. We didn't realize (until then) that, if you buy a meal at this place, you can take the private entrance to the cenote later for free. (See the photo of a view from the path downhill.) The prices aren't unreasonable, so this makes it more of a deal.  We were the last people out at five o'clock -- after they turned out all of the lights, as a signal, I guess. (It would have been nice if they had warned us.)
