There was a big variety of prices; our meals were under $100 MXD each. This place is worth a bit of a splurge.

When the restaurant and cenote closed around 5 pm, we noticed that the three waterfalls into the cenote had stopped running. I realized that, when I swam from the steps to the opposite side of the cenote (under the overhang), I heard something like a pump whirring. I wonder if the waterfalls are created by that pump? (Whatever: the waterfalls are beautiful and fun to swim under.)

466287180.name: Stunningly beautiful, but don\'t stay in the water too long!!!!
466287180.author: a TripAdvisor user
466287180.reviewBody: This is one of those postcard-perfect cenotes that will earn you bragging rights on Instagram. Very inexpensive (only a few dollars), you can spend as much time as you wish here until it closes near dusk. There is a beautifully haunting staircase that leads you down into this breath-taking sunken spot that is half inside a cave and half exposed to the outside world. You will often see people jumping from a platform about 10 meters up, and while it is one of those must-do bucket list items, just be careful. As the water really has really nowhere to go, it can become stagnant and contaminated. My sister and I stayed in the water for over an hour enjoying the rock edges, taking pictures, and snorkelling with the hundreds (if not, thousands) of small black cat fish. While we had an absolutely amazing time, about 6 hours later we became very sick to our stomachs. It was just a 24-hour bug, but it was not pretty. I would not want to deter someone from going here because it is well worth it, but just be mindful about how long you spend in the water, and you will be fine! :)

462586871.name: Nice Cool Off for a Long day in the sun
462586871.author: a TripAdvisor user
462586871.reviewBody: After a trip to nearby Maya Ruins, this was a nice way to cool off with a swim and dip in the Cenote.  It is close to the central square in Valladoid

462501895.name: 10m jump into the Cenote!
462501895.author: a TripAdvisor user
462501895.reviewBody: Cheap and basic Cenote but a lot of fun and easy to get to as its in the center of town! The 10m (maybe more) cliff to jump into the cenote is awesome!

461854174.name: Piece of paradise
461854174.author: a TripAdvisor user
461854174.reviewBody: The visit to the cenote from friends say it is a wonderful rejuvenation!  They enjoyed the swim in the cenote.  However found it difficult to access the entrance to the cenote.  Many people blocking the way.

460684133.name: Short walk from downtown
460684133.author: a TripAdvisor user
460684133.reviewBody: We had a late afternoon visit to the cenote. It is easy to access, walking distance from most of the downtown hotels etc. Good for a swim, but no facilities to change (unless upstairs at the restaurant). Fun place.

460445111.name: Nice Urban Cenote
460445111.author: a TripAdvisor user
460445111.reviewBody: 10 peso entrance fee with the option to swim. We just walked in and took in the geological wonder that is a cenote. A must do given its proximity to the main square in Valladolid and the opportunity to see a cenote without having to travel terribly far.

458763647.name: A Cenote right in the heart of Valladolid town
458763647.author: a TripAdvisor user
458763647.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is pretty large and deep, and fairly circular in shape. The water was clear. It\'s located in the town of Valladolid. It was only 30 Mexican pesos for entry ($1.50 US). The walk way down to the water\'s edges offers a couple of main entry points (with steps), although one can jump or dive in from several other points. There were numerous black fish in the water (some small and others several inches in size), that were quite friendly. They nipped at my feet which made me think they\'re quite hungry or confident around people. Turns out they are eyeless. Our 3-year old was with us but didn\'t enter the water. It\'s not the most kid friendly cenote as there aren\'t any real shallow points. There are also no lockers, or equipment rental places on the premises. That said, it was still a fun experience to swim and jump in the water. If you\'re in Valladolid and need to cool off, take a dive at Zaci!

458396877.name: A cenote in the centre of town
458396877.author: a TripAdvisor user
458396877.reviewBody: Wear your bathing suit and bring a towel - there are no changing rooms but you can find a private spot to change. It was our first visit to a cenote - very reasonable in cost and we could have gone back later in the day at no extra charge. We were the only people swimming there most of the time. There is a restaurant on the site.

458181556.name: Yet another great Cenote in the middle of the town. Enjoy with the locals.
458181556.author: a TripAdvisor user
458181556.reviewBody: Just as we were looking for an artisan market we stumped into this beautiful Cenote. Locals come to enjoy nature at this huge Cenote. families and youngsters swim and get the small cat fish to nibble at your feet. Try the restaurant Zaci, well recommended, they take credit cards.

457974586.name: A cool centore right in town
457974586.author: a TripAdvisor user
457974586.reviewBody: Highly recommended, as it\'s right in the middle of town, cheap and pretty. The little fish in the water would nibble on your feet if you stay still for awhile - free doctor fish experience!!

457138842.name: GREAT IN TOWN CENOTE  very famous
457138842.author: a TripAdvisor user
457138842.reviewBody: Great Cenote in the heart of Valladolid.  A long climb down the stairs but VERY REFRESHING!  Geat restaurant to enjoy food & beverages after a refreshing dip!

457077600.name: Pretty cool
457077600.author: a TripAdvisor user
457077600.reviewBody: Didn\'t spend much time here but as it\'s so central it\'s worth a stop by , and if you dare to jump down from the high ledge !  Water is okay, fishes swimming around. Very nice way to spend some time , the cavern is very impressive.

456804223.name: Easy access
456804223.author: a TripAdvisor user
456804223.reviewBody: If you only have a limited time and can\'t drive to see the other cenotes, don\'t miss this one. So easy to get to. It is on 180 as you enter town if you are traveling from Cancun. You cannot miss it there are plenty of signs.

456628328.name: Easy to access in town of Valladolid.
456628328.author: a TripAdvisor user
456628328.reviewBody: A Wonderful way to cool down and enjoy a beautiful fun open cenote. An easy walk from town, many stairs up and down. Yet easy for almost any age if you go slow and easy. \nA nice view and an open air cenote with sunshine or shade for your personal preference. Not really any place to change, so prepare for this aspect. A wonderful energy, an enjoyable experience.

456276125.name: quick visit
456276125.author: a TripAdvisor user
456276125.reviewBody: stopped for quick visit.interesting place in middle of town,water was not cold very good for diving,very deep.

454477034.name: Tranqil setting for a swim
454477034.author: a TripAdvisor user
454477034.reviewBody: Beautiful little cenote with steps carved into the stone.  A refreshing dip after a hot morning at Chichen Itza. The restaurant at the top was lovely as well!

454241452.name: Very refreshing
454241452.author: a TripAdvisor user
454241452.reviewBody: The cenote in Vallalodid Is very conveniently walkable from the centro and parque. We had lunch and then walked to the change rooms (5 pesos each time) and took the winding stairs down to the cenote. The final stairs are a bit slippery and uneven. The swim  however was lovely. There are ropes across the cenote for uncertain swimmers. In all, it was a wonderful way to cool off, looking up at the sky above and down towards 200 feet of water below.

453496464.name: Great Cenote
453496464.author: a TripAdvisor user
453496464.reviewBody: This is an awesome cenote right in the middle of the city! Very affordable with a great landscape; vines and gorgeous trees are part of thr environment. Similar cenotes are much more expensive. Definitely a must.

452868291.name: Pretty place to visit in the middle of town
452868291.author: a TripAdvisor user
452868291.reviewBody: Personally I wouldn\'t swim in this cenote, but it is a beautiful place to visit.  The water is a little murky, but it is interesting to see a cent located in the middle of a small city.

451734608.name: You can\'t visit enough cenotes
451734608.author: a TripAdvisor user
451734608.reviewBody: In central Valladolid.  Wear your bathing suit under your clothes, have lunch at the restaurant and access the cenote through a private entrance for restaurant patrons.  Great way to cool off in the afternoon.

451731386.name: So beautiful!
451731386.author: a TripAdvisor user
451731386.reviewBody: Such a beautiful cenote with a great restaurant at the top! We ate and then went swimming! Careful when walking down the stairs as they are slippery and there are a lot of them! But the cenote is very worth it!

451063671.name: Wonderful and low-key
451063671.author: a TripAdvisor user
451063671.reviewBody: This is a pretty neat hidden gem right in the city, that you might not even know about unless you happen to walk by it. In the form of an "original swimming hole" this place is great for those hot afternoons when you need a break from touring the city. Stopped at Valladolid on our way to Chichen Itza, and needed just that. By about 12 or 1 it was really too hot to walk around. We had seen the church as well as walk through most of the vendors so decided to cool off here prior to moving on to Chichen Itza. It is quite amazing to see from the top but crazy once you climb down in to the hole. Water was cool with light green tinge to it, forgot to bring a mask in order to swim deep into the water. I think this is probably one of the lessor known cenotes, not too many tours pass by it seems...mostly a locals spot which is something we love. A great experience all-around and should you have the chance to do a cenote, it is a MUST!!!

450017782.name: Cool hot day activity
450017782.author: a TripAdvisor user
450017782.reviewBody: The cenote is right in town and is a wonderful place to spend a few hours paddling in the water or jumping from the ledges, which are quite high. Don\'t forget to point your toes and keep your arms in. You hit the water with a good impact.  Admission is just 30 pesos and goes right into the community. Not crowded at all.

449756255.name: Short stop while in Valladolid - Cenote within the city
449756255.author: a TripAdvisor user
449756255.reviewBody:
Located in the city of Valladolid is the Cenote Zaci (freshwater) which you can access, through a series of vendors/artisans selling handcraft produce.

It was calm, on the open (not claustrophobic), surprisingly cool and shady.  Nice view and access down with carved stone stairs.
We felt like we were far away from the city. Short stop.

449589968.name: In awe!!!
449589968.author: a TripAdvisor user
449589968.reviewBody: We have done several cenotes in the area and all are unique but this one was one of my favorites !!! The day we went was not too crowded. Just beautiful. Partly under ground, half exposed. Spots to jump in if you want a thrill. Water is clear and refreshing plenty of places to leave your belongings. About $2USD to enter. Just for sightseeing it is worth the drive from Tulum. The little fish will give you a fish pedicure !!

449141722.name: Oasis on a hot day
449141722.author: a TripAdvisor user
449141722.reviewBody: Not terribly packed, locally run, cheap and incredibly beautiful and refreshing! Also, it is in a very accessible location from the city center, 5 minute walk from restaurants, shops and the church. Definitely a great spot to enjoy natural beauty and cool off

448580282.name: Incredible underground pool in the middle of the city
448580282.author: a TripAdvisor user
448580282.reviewBody: Cenote Zeti is a large underground pool in the middle of Valladolid. Like other cenotes, it is a deep natural pool full of crystal clear water. There is a small entrance fee, and apparently it can get a little busy on weekends, but it is absolutely worth a visit!

448134243.name: Valladolid\'s in-town cenote
448134243.author: a TripAdvisor user
448134243.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is a five minute walk from the centre of Valladolid, and is very popular, so a bit crowded, but a very nice place for a swim on a hot day, and the restaurant serves good food at reasonable prices.

448129570.name: refreshing dip near city center
448129570.author: a TripAdvisor user
448129570.reviewBody: I was very excited to visit the cenotes of the Yucatan peninsula.  This was my first cenote and it did not disappoint.  It was easy to get to.  The water is so refreshing (but not clear).  Access down to the water is easy.  There are a few diving spots.  This is an open cenote where you can swim in the rain and look up at the sky.  Entry fee is just a few dollars (US).  There are on-site bathrooms for a small fee.

447564545.name: Cenote Zaci - Go early
447564545.author: a TripAdvisor user
447564545.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is a large cenote (basically a large underground swimming hole) located right in the centre of Valladolid. It occupies a city block and there is a small (30 peso) admission fee which is an amazing bargain to access this natural wonder. You enter the cenote by walking down a winding stairwell to a narrow path that winds around the edge. There are not any facilities in the cenote itself but you can safely leave your possessions wherever there is a spot. From the edge you just jump into the water. When you swim around you can look up and see the sky as there is a round opening in the rock directly above. The cenote is very deep so you don\'t have to worry about hitting bottom when you jump in. We went when the cenote first opened in the morning and had it to ourselves for the first 1/2 hour but we were told that it can get busy. Would say this is something you should definitely "not miss" in Valladolid

446076184.name: Easy to access
446076184.author: a TripAdvisor user
446076184.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is located in the center of the city. It is easy to find and the entrance fee is affordable. It is very touristy so there is a bit of a crowd. It is a good place to have some fun. If you are daring there is a small cliff which you can jump into the cenote from. The water is clean and refreshing.

445889975.name: A nice refreshing break from the city!
445889975.author: a TripAdvisor user
445889975.reviewBody: This cenote is in the middle of town, so don\'t expect a nature experience. But we walked a few blocks from our hotel on a hot evening and loved the refreshing swim we had here. You pay a small fee and then walk down a path to the water and jump in. We happened to be there at dusk and it was really mellow and pretty. It may be more crowded during the day. Plus we got to see a swarm of bats head out for the night, which was a great bonus!

445131299.name: Gorgeous
445131299.author: a TripAdvisor user
445131299.reviewBody: This place is magical and beautiful, when we went it was alone and the serenity of it all was comfortable.\n\nIf you want to swim be careful with the environment, dont wear chemicals, normal sunblock etc. to preserve this beautiful place.

444113311.name: Interesting but not a must see
444113311.author: a TripAdvisor user
444113311.reviewBody: We made a brief (30-45 minutes) stop here as part of a larger tour to nearby Chichen Itza.  It was interesting but probably not as much as a cenote in a more isolated (this one is  right in the center of town) or a more natural setting.  The stone stairs in and out were steep and could potentially be slippery during or after a rain.  Visitors with physical limitations (bad knees, etc.) would be advised to skip the hike down into the sinkhole and just check it out from some of the observation decks near the upper rim.

444102700.name: Amazing cenote in the middle of a tasty restaurant
444102700.author: a TripAdvisor user
444102700.reviewBody: We went at 6pm and it was closed, but we went back the next day and were glad we did.  The food was tasty at the restaurant and the cenotes was one of our most favorite because of how open it is.  It\'s nice to go down and swim around after eating.

444086947.name: A cenote you can swim in .
444086947.author: a TripAdvisor user
444086947.reviewBody: Approached through a cave/grotto the cenote is quite large and has access down to a swimming ledge equipped with a rope across to the other side.\nIt is not entirely enclosed but awesome all the same.

443634466.name: Great 45 minute tour
443634466.author: a TripAdvisor user
443634466.reviewBody: Stopped by at 9am to check it out for a later swim. Got a very interesting 45 minute tour from a young man working at the entrance booth - spoke excellent English and very knowledgeable. I assume he was not an official guide but could have been.

440766319.name: Great Spot for a Dip
440766319.author: a TripAdvisor user
440766319.reviewBody: We were pleasantly surprised that you could swim at Cenote Zaci. Someone had told us that you couldn\'t - not so. Some brave/foolhardy local lads were leaping from the highest spots into the cenote which provided entertainment. If it\'s a hot day this is a good spot to cool off, and a very different type of swimming hole, especially if you haven\'t been to many cenotes before.

440421451.name: Great food and a cenote
440421451.author: a TripAdvisor user
440421451.reviewBody: Amazing fun. Have been multiple times now. Have the Chaya Empanadas and take a bottle of the habanero salsa home.  Homemade hot tortillas. Lovely stFf and service. If you are lucky you will catch the folk dancing and then swim in cenote.

439559236.name: not too crowded but water not cristal clear
439559236.author: a TripAdvisor user
439559236.reviewBody: Price only 30 Pesos per Person, not too many visiotrs, good Location. water was dark and not for snorkeling

439148580.name: Great to cool off
439148580.author: a TripAdvisor user
439148580.reviewBody: Our hotel was only a few blocks away so we decided to visit cenote zaci. Cheap to get in, no changing or lockers tho so be prepared. Water was cold and pretty clear. There were plenty of fish, some quite large. Plenty of spots to jump in at various heights, depending on how adventurous you are. Seemed a little run down but did not spoil our time there.

439098851.name: easy to find
439098851.author: a TripAdvisor user
439098851.reviewBody: in the city center so easy to find. just 30 pesos. water is not cristal clear but ofcourse clean. there are fishes around if you sit the edge, after a while fishes can give free pedicure :)

437737640.name: Don\'t miss this one
437737640.author: a TripAdvisor user
437737640.reviewBody: Right in the center of town is the Cenote Zaci (Mayan name of Valladolid before the Spanish came), a gorgeous fresh water sink hole with a great restaurant looking over it. The food is very good and the prices are moderate. If you dine in the restaurant you can go down to the cenote for free.

432802342.name: Cold loved it.
432802342.author: a TripAdvisor user
432802342.reviewBody: This was a last moment  stop what a great   cenote the water was very cool after a hot day traveling  they a k so have food and drinks.

428548114.name: Wonderful
428548114.author: a TripAdvisor user
428548114.reviewBody: This cenote is literally in the middle of Valladolid town! Walk down a set of concrete stairs and you enter a water underworld. If you are in Valladolid this place is a must-see. We spent a couple of hours there one afternoon and it was the perfect place to cool off. There are fish in the water that will nibble your feet if you sit still long enough- a free pedicure!

417187200.name: Nice to visit as a side tour
417187200.author: a TripAdvisor user
417187200.reviewBody: Our tour went there after visiting Chichen Itza.  It is interesting to see a big sink hole, there are people swimming in the water.  The place needs a little bit of TLC.

416661758.name: Right in town in Valladolid!
416661758.author: a TripAdvisor user
416661758.reviewBody: Located only a few blocks from our hotel near the town square, this was a pleasant surprise right in town.

416603863.name: Fantastic location for a dip.
416603863.author: a TripAdvisor user
416603863.reviewBody: An excellent place for a swim. Make sure to jump from the highest ledge, it\'s an exhilarating experience! It\'s cheap to get in. Well worth a visit.

412306069.name: Good food and cool cenote after Chitchen Itza
412306069.author: a TripAdvisor user
412306069.reviewBody: After a hot morning in Chichen Itza, we took a cab to Valladolid, a colonial city that\'s pretty and has a lot of good restorants and crafts markets. Cenote Zaci is a good option, walkable distance to ADO bus station, center of Valladolid, and the craft markets, and has good food. The cochinita pibil was good, the salad was big and fresh, the flan was creamy. The cenote was not crowded (which is why we chose it over Il Kil, etc.) and pleasant to swim in. It\'s just a nice combination of food, swimming, and town. Many locals were eating here, too, with big families. Certainly great for large families with lots of huge tables (and tours, I guess...) The bathrooms could use improvement. They were basic and not very clean.

406633682.name: Spectacular view - not sure how clean it is!
406633682.author: a TripAdvisor user
406633682.reviewBody:
We came here as part of a tour to Chichen Itza - it cost nothing for us to go inside but usually it's 30 pesos which is about £1.20.

There's plenty of steps to walk along and I suggest walking the entire loop around the pool to take in the different views from the cave and the jungle side.

There were plenty of people swimming so it can't be all that bad though there are plenty of bats and birds in the cave above who regularly let go of their bowels over the pool so be aware of that!

405712849.name: Beautiful cenote located within a restaurant in the heart of Valladolid
405712849.author: a TripAdvisor user
405712849.reviewBody: Stop in for lunch, which grants one admission to the cenote, or buy a ticket just for the cenote.  The food is good, and service friendly.  The cenote is largely open to the sky, with a backdrop of high cavern walls, and jumping ledges.  The water is cold, dark, and slightly murky.  Lots of lush vegetation surround the cenote.  Swimming is recommended, for a refreshing dip and the full experience.

405273338.name: Located right in town
405273338.author: a TripAdvisor user
405273338.reviewBody: Good location and a nice Cenote to visit.  The grouds are well maintained and clean.  Unlike several of the other Cenotes in the area, you will not get harassed by countless street vendors

403828435.name: Visit as part of Chichen Itza excursion
403828435.author: a TripAdvisor user
403828435.reviewBody: We booked an excursion with Xcaret Tours to visit Chichen Itza, and then afterwards onto Valladolid taking in Cenote Zaci , dinner at a restaurant and a short time to look around the centre of the town.\nCenote Zaci was well worth a visit. Close to the centre of Valladolid it was easy to get to, and accessed by a small number of steps. Our excursion didn\'t leave enough time for swimming, but many people were swimming in it. We had about 20 minutes to appreciate the wonder of a cenote - lovely place to visit.

401281348.name: Great experience
401281348.author: a TripAdvisor user
401281348.reviewBody: Visited this Cenote as a recommendation from a local. the place did not disappoint. Not only we had the opportunity to have a taste of the local dishes in the restaurant next to it, but also soothed down at this oasis after a morning visit to Chichen Itza.\n\nMy kids jumped from several platforms while my spouse and I relaxed in the cool water. If you are visiting the area, a Cenote dip is a MUST, even if its juts for the bucket list!

398162177.name: Open air, with some shade in centre of town
398162177.author: a TripAdvisor user
398162177.reviewBody: Fabulous outdoor Cenote. Suitable for snorkelling. Very inexpensive . Opens about 8.30am. It gets busy so get there early.  There is a rope strung across, and life jackets are hired out if you want to just chill, or aren\'t a strong swimmer. regards cleanliness, most of the Cenotes I have used are enclosed and therefore dark, so I have no idea how clean any are. But there are fish swimming about in this one ( most of them I imagine).\n\nSorry guys I wrote an earlier review accidentally confusing Cenote Zaci with Cenote Palomitas ( which is enclosed, and closer to Ek Balam). I cannot see how to edit that review, and correct it.

394372633.name: Magnificent view
394372633.author: a TripAdvisor user
394372633.reviewBody: Yucatan and Quintana Roo are two Mexican states without surface rivers; instead, they have cenotes (the Mayan word from little lakes emerging to the surface, interconnected). The cenote Zaci is one of them, located at Valladolid downtown. If you  are not afraid you can swim or simply enjoy the view.

392167370.name: Water looked dirty
392167370.author: a TripAdvisor user
392167370.reviewBody:
i bought the ticket, went inside, and just looked at it. Very disappointing. 

I asked for my money back, and they refused. Go to other cenotes where you can actually see the bottom of how clean the water is.

This was muddy.

392147466.name: Amazing sight
392147466.author: a TripAdvisor user
392147466.reviewBody: Incredible cenote and easily accessible. There\'s a small entry fee and you can swim if you want. I personally prefer pristine swimming venues, so I didn\'t swim. There wasn\'t anything gross, just tree debris - there were other people in enjoying a cool dip.

390811279.name: Cenote Zaci
390811279.author: a TripAdvisor user
390811279.reviewBody: Short visit iinteresting to see how a "Cenote" looks like inside of it, recommended just for reference of this kind of things

388890107.name: Beautiful natural experience
388890107.author: a TripAdvisor user
388890107.reviewBody: As part of our tour to Chichen, we had this Cenote just to watch it. Beautiful, a marvelous piece of art from God. In Valladolid this is a must. Maybe you\'ll have the opportunity to bath in it. We didn\'t. But we enjoyed it. A few stairs, easy to reach.

382512795.name: Beautiful Cenote... Breathtaking really :)
382512795.author: a TripAdvisor user
382512795.reviewBody: We\'ve visited this Cenote with "Xcaret Experiences" as a part of trip to Chichen Itza and the city of Valladollid.\nPersonally I would have preferred going for a swim in the Cenote than going to Valladollid. The cenote is beautiful, one of the most beautiful things I\'ve seen in my life.\nNature at its best for sure and Mexico has thousands of Cenotes :)

362906549.name: Little oasis in town
362906549.author: a TripAdvisor user
362906549.reviewBody: It is a nice place, especially on a hot day. There all different types of different looking cenotes, so this should not be your only one. It is a decent cenote in the middle of lovely Valladolid.

349676822.name: Easy access and nice place
349676822.author: a TripAdvisor user
349676822.reviewBody: Probably not the most mind-blowing cenote of Yucatan or even around Valladolid, but still it was very nice with clean, warm water and a few fish. I arrived at the opening, 8:30 and was alone there, in the middle of paradise, for half an hour. 30 pesos seems a reasonable price. There is a platform to jump from, although I\'m not sure it does good to the place or the fish. Got surprised by a few iguanes on my way out. Loved it, although in winter (I was there in february) if you want the sun to light the water you\'d better go after 10:30 AM.

347648589.name: Cenote Zaci
347648589.author: a TripAdvisor user
347648589.reviewBody: The sink hole and the surrounding area was gorgeous. If you\'re able, be sure to walk the entire way around the sink hole because every angle gives you a different view. Make sure to slather on the bug spray. It\'s a water- filled sink hole so mosquitos are plentiful.

343449379.name: Stunning
343449379.author: a TripAdvisor user
343449379.reviewBody: What a beautiful place. We did not expect the impact of this beautiful pool with azure waters and delighted swimmers enjoying themselves. After walking down a narrow staircase into a limestone cave , walk past it to be greeted by a sunken pool in natural landscape.\nNo wonder the cenotes are a tourist attraction in themselves.\nThank you CanaunAdventures for including this in our Chichen Itza- Valladolid tour.

342387382.name: A grand treat
342387382.author: a TripAdvisor user
342387382.reviewBody:
This was the best cenote we visited and it was spectacular. Descending the stone steps the expanse and depth of the sinkhole came into view.  

The circular path gives great and changing views of the scene. Shafts of sunshine nicely illuminated the surrounds. On the way we passed a little votive shrine containing a religious picture. 

Some visitors had obviously come prepared for a swim. It was entertaining watching them diving from a height and enjoying traversing across. 

The preponderance of stalactites was impressive.  A multitude of dark fish was clearly visible  against the blue coloured water.

339707000.name: Our favorite Cenote
339707000.author: a TripAdvisor user
339707000.reviewBody: We went to three cenotes, and this was our favorite. Mostly because it\'s above ground, so you get some sun and it\'s not as dark as the others. There are some great jumping points that I highly recommend.

336499734.name: Awesome Experience
336499734.author: a TripAdvisor user
336499734.reviewBody: The cenotes in Mexico are a must when you travel to the Yucatan state, in particular. Zaci Cenote, Valladolid, is great example of a cenote. It is just like a large natural pool that you walk down several steps to reach. Some of the cenotes are found in caves and it can be quite a claustrophobic experience to access them. Zaci is not. You can view access to the cenote from ground level before you walk down into it.....alleviating an fears you may have. Well worth a swim, and not as busy as some of the other cenotes.

335918834.name: My only regret is that it was the last one on our list.
335918834.author: a TripAdvisor user
335918834.reviewBody: It was even better than any of the pictures I have seen. It was the last cenote on our list before leaving so we did not spent enough time. It is longer and deeper than the others that we visited but even thought the water was cooler initially once you are swimming you forget about that.  Highly recommended.  As with any of the cenotes if you travel with kids that easily tire out. get them a life jacket.

324018899.name: Cenote Neslted in the City
324018899.author: a TripAdvisor user
324018899.reviewBody: Who would expect a cenote in the middle of the hustle and bustle of town?! A definite must see.  The water was cool and refreshing. There are ropes to hang onto if you\'re not a good swimmer. The steps are steep, so expect to do some climbing. It was about $2 to get in...worth a visit!!

322139057.name: We didn\'t swim
322139057.author: a TripAdvisor user
322139057.reviewBody: Beautiful cenote, perfect little place to relax for a short while. We didn\'t want to swim due to the algae and dust build up but we did see one person brave it.

303543706.name: Crossed off the bucket list
303543706.author: a TripAdvisor user
303543706.reviewBody: Stopped here with a tour group returning from Chichen Itza and after eating at La Casona in town. My first time and I had to jump in. Lots of jumping off points at various heights. Ropes in the water for not-so-strong swimmers. Incredibly deep. Our guide told us it was fed by an underground river and to use caution while swimming. As you hike down in you can clearly see the K-T Boundary in the limestone, which is cool realizing you\'re so close to the Chicxulub impact that wiped out the dinosaurs. A little eerie because you can\'t see the bottom nor the little fish nipping at your heels. But so refreshing after a hot and sweaty day. Really enjoyed it.

299774935.name: Piece of nature in the middle of the town
299774935.author: a TripAdvisor user
299774935.reviewBody:
Nice place to take a break and enjoy... 
The water seems a bit dirty but it just looks that way because the water is 102 meters deep! Didn't go for a swim 'cause we had limited time. You could jump of the rocks. Highest point is around 7-9 meters. So... High! :-)
You get a great view from every angle inside and around the cenote.
There is also a good restaurant.

296453039.name: Middle of the city
296453039.author: a TripAdvisor user
296453039.reviewBody: Beautiful cenote located a couple of blocks from the main square of Valladolid. It\'s very beautiful and has ropes to stand on in the water, and a couple of safe spots to jump into the water. 25 pesos per adult entry.

296037475.name: Real good cenote
296037475.author: a TripAdvisor user
296037475.reviewBody: Very good cenote. We took a taxi out but walked back to Valladolid. Half subterranean and half open air. The water is quite deep at all points but the ropes that cross the cenote make it real easy for weaker swimmers to enjoy. We stayed until about 7 pm and eventually we were swimming with bats flying over head. If this is the only cenote you get to during your trip to the Yucatan, it\'s a pretty good one to experience. Lastly, it is fairly inexpensive compared to other cenotes I\'ve been to.

290762781.name: Pretty, away from crowds.
290762781.author: a TripAdvisor user
290762781.reviewBody: Worth checking out, especially if its part of your tour (no point on staying on the bus). The cenote is beautiful, you can actually swim (not just wade) in this cenote, and check out the flora. We were amazed as someone dove into the cenote from a very high point. I don\'t endorse this, but it was awesome to watch.

289979402.name: Impressive, Beautiful and Conveniently Located in the Centre of Valladolid!
289979402.author: a TripAdvisor user
289979402.reviewBody: Cenote Zaci is located in the middle of Valladolid, so it is easy to reach via walking or biking. The entrance fee is 25 pesos. The cenote is a huge hollowed out cavern that is very deep, with lush greenery on the opposite side of the cavern, climbing all the way up the steep incline to the surface. There was nobody here when I went (mid-afternoon) and it was relaxing and peaceful. The cenote is impressive and beautiful, with stalactites hanging down from the rock ceiling, bats flying overhead, and little black catfish swimming around with you in the water. The water is not clear and is a little murky with leaves floating around, but it still made for a cool and refreshing swim. It freaked me out a little bit that I couldn\'t see where all the catfish were (due to water\'s murkiness) and I dislike it when fish touch my feet while swimming (but I didn\'t feel anything here). I recommend checking out this cenote when in Valladolid. I did not visit the restaurant outside of the cenote.

286128010.name: Best Value Cenote
286128010.author: a TripAdvisor user
286128010.reviewBody:
This cenote is beautiful its well looked after the entrance fee is very reasonable(50pesos)
Its one of the best cenotes we went to while in mexico has several high jumping platforms. It is extremely deep. 
Has 3 ropes you can use if your not a strong swimmer. 
the water is beautiful and clear. 
Plenty of fish in the water didn't see any turtles but apparently they do come in here sometimes

285702977.name: Really magical area
285702977.author: a TripAdvisor user
285702977.reviewBody: This cenote is the neighborhood of the marketplace.The cenote is not too busy,so I could swim, and that was a good idea, because the water was very refreshing, and very sweety,where small fishes swim.The ropes over the water help for the safety swimming.It was wonderful experience.I can only recommend!

283640416.name: Refreshing, magical experience
283640416.author: a TripAdvisor user
283640416.reviewBody: The cenote is only 3 blocks from the main square.  One enters going down a flight of stairs and through a small cave that opens onto the massive open area with glistening blue water at the bottom.  There are steps to the water\'s edge and then ropes to hold on to if you aren\'t a confident swimmer.  The water is cool and clear.  Fish swim around your toes while birds fly overhead.  Truly a unique experience.  There are bathrooms in the restaurant but no real changing rooms.  Swimming in a cenote is one of my favorite things in life.

280111157.name: Easy to visit cenote in town
280111157.author: a TripAdvisor user
280111157.reviewBody:
This cenote is in the middle of town and easily reached by foot. Entrance is 25 pesos. Alternatively you can eat at the restaurant and then visit the cenote for free.

Although the entrance appears to be subterranean, the cenote is largely open to the sky. There are guide ropes span the cenote so swimming is easy. Ease of accessibility makes this a popular photo stop for tourist groups from Cancún. 

People are allowed to swim, although there are no change rooms or lockers. Between tour groups there were not a lot of visitors when I was there, it felt safe enough to leave my camera and shoes near the water's edge.

273488660.name: Great first time Cenote experience
273488660.author: a TripAdvisor user
273488660.reviewBody: We took a road trip to Merida from Cancun, via Valladolid.  During our time in Valladolid  we decided to check out this Cenote as it was near the center of town, easily accessible, and has a restaurant attached to it.  If you dine in the restaurant, you are provided free access to the Cenote, otherwise there is a separate fee.  After eating, we walked down the steps into the Cenote.  Its just so curious and cool, it immediately makes you feel like a kid again whose just discovered some amazing spot!  I got right in the water, slowly, climbing down the stairs.  The warm was still and refreshing, neither cold nor warm.  There were platform around the surrounding walkway from which other people were jumping off into the water.  I would come back in a heart beat and wish I could have experience other Cenotes.

262262617.name: Nice for eazy-level cliff!
262262617.author: a TripAdvisor user
262262617.reviewBody: There are severav spots you can do cliff, 5 and 10 and 12 and 20 (this one from the three) meters. Its better and funny than just swim at some buiterful but boring place!

262114757.name: Awesome experience
262114757.author: a TripAdvisor user
262114757.reviewBody: This was one of our treats on a tour of the Mayan Ruins. Water was a little cold but doable and felt good. Not as cold as the oceans. Easy climb to get to the bottom to enjoy the water. Be careful once there. The steps leading to the water are very, very slippery. The best way I found to get into the water was on the right side of the steps and holding onto the rope. There are a lot of uneven rocks that are slippery so be careful. It is worth the trouble. My photos did not come out so good because the only sunlight that gets in is a rounded hole in the ceiling. Be careful of the small kids around the park exit. 3 of them tried to grab money out of one of our members hand when she went into her billfold. I think this might be rare but it did happen.

253599352.name: There are much nicer ones!
253599352.author: a TripAdvisor user
253599352.reviewBody: As someone else mentioned the advantage is that this is in the middle of town. We had a car and drove to the Samula cenote and it was far more impressive! You can view this from the restaurant so if you don\'t plan to swim I would recommend just checking it out from there! We didn\'t swim in this one because the water didn\'t look all that inviting!

253430525.name: Interesting and easy to get to makes it OK.
253430525.author: a TripAdvisor user
253430525.reviewBody: As this is in very easy walking distance from the main square in  Valladolid it is worth a trip, small fee to get in but can have a swim if you desrie. Restaurant next door does the lovely lime soup !!

251282282.name: the advantage is that it is in downtown valladolid
251282282.author: a TripAdvisor user
251282282.reviewBody: but there are better cenotes. This one is not so clean, as it is in the city, and it is too deep, so not as transparent. I loved Samula, which is a short taxi trip away from Valladolid. There is a good view of this cenote Zaci from the restaurant, you don\u00b4t need to pay to get in if you just want to see how it looks like.

249882120.name: Such a great Cenote in the town!
249882120.author: a TripAdvisor user
249882120.reviewBody: I really liked how close it was to the hostel. After a long bus ride on a hot day, I couldn\'t wait to take a swim.  The cenote is deep, cool, and refreshing.  There\'s a long path and spirals down to reach the bottom.  A long the way there are many heights you can jump or dive in from.  I really wish I had taken pictures!  Such a great addition to enjoy when visiting Valladolid!

248301129.name: Quiet and beautiful
248301129.author: a TripAdvisor user
248301129.reviewBody: It was $2 USD to get in. It was the LEAST crowded thing we did in Mexico! Loved it. The water is crystal clear and so deep! Definitely bring your snorkeling gear.

245424390.name: Average to look at if you have seen other cenotes
245424390.author: a TripAdvisor user
245424390.reviewBody: If you have a little time to kill in Valladolid, it might be worth the 6 block walk from the square to the cenote.  The admission is $2USD.  However, if you have been to other cenotes, you aren\'t going to gain much by going to this one.  There are a couple of restaurants and souvenir shops at the entrance which are always fun to look at, but other than that I would spend my time exploring the town.

244706253.name: Lovely cenote but there better ones not far from town
244706253.author: a TripAdvisor user
244706253.reviewBody:
Location is brilliant. A short walk from town centre. Free to stroll in the park and only 25 pesos to go down to the cenote.
Park is pleasant - we saw a big iguana on the rocks. You can view the cenote from the park above if you want.
Would be a big attraction anywhere else but with two of the best cenotes in Mexico only a few kilometres away, it suffers by comparison.
(Dzitnip comprises Xkeken & Samula cenotes at one location. 40 pesos by taxi from Valladolid)

240064747.name: Beautiful View
240064747.author: a TripAdvisor user
240064747.reviewBody: Was great to look at but a bit dangerous to swim in as told by our guide as the water is very contaminated. It is up to 300ft deep and should have a lifeguard there as according to our guide several people have drowned in the Cenote,

226534791.name: An oasis in the heart of the city
226534791.author: a TripAdvisor user
226534791.reviewBody: This little cenote is the perfect place to cool off on a hot day. It\'s also incredibly affordable at 25 pesos per person. The atmosphere is serene and the water feels great. There are 2 ropes spanning the width of the water to stand on and plenty of spots to jump/dive in at different heights (some very high). Relax on the ropes while watching others jump in from high above or jump in yourself from one of the many places around the water. Whatever you do, don\'t pass on this experience!

215369331.name: Magic
215369331.author: a TripAdvisor user
215369331.reviewBody: Finding this place turned into one of the biggest adventures of my life. We had the place to ourselves and it was so magical. This is a "must-do" if you are in the area. The WILL lock you in if you don\'t leave on time....so beware! Ha!

202500121.name: Great Cenote right in the center of Valladolid
202500121.author: a TripAdvisor user
202500121.reviewBody: This cenote is right in the middle of the city in Valladolid. The entrance and the steps all around it are well maintained. It is nice to jump in as it is very big. It is very deep mostly. There is a cool "secret entrance to underworld". The guide can tell you al about it. The restaurant outside is very nice as well. A sopa de lima was $50 mexican pesos. There is parking/.

201683452.name: Huge Cenote!
201683452.author: a TripAdvisor user
201683452.reviewBody: I have been to quite a few cenotes in my time living in the Yucatan, and Cenote Zaci is great!  It is quite large and a bit more manmade than many, but still fun and it\'s great that it is so near to the town center. Twenty five peso entry fee when I went a week ago.

188618655.name: Great place to stop for a dip during a bike ride
188618655.author: a TripAdvisor user
188618655.reviewBody: We were riding our bikes around town when we came across this cenote right in the middle of a little park. We paid 15 pesos and entered one of the most beautiful cenotes we visited in Mexico. Nice platforms to jump from, deep water, awesome light when the sun enters the cave. It is well worth the price!

187112025.name: Refreshing dip in town!
187112025.author: a TripAdvisor user
187112025.reviewBody: This was the only partial open/ exposed cenote we visited. Lovely and airy, large and very deep. This cenote was the only one we visited where we could jump off a tall (maybe 2-3 metres) platform into the water. Great value for money at only 15 pesos!!

183916631.name: Interesting Place
183916631.author: a TripAdvisor user
183916631.reviewBody: This cenote was the first (and only) one we\'ve seen. We visited as part of our Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1 tour.  It reminded me of an underground lake we visited on one of the Greek Islands.  We did not opt to go swimming in it, although there were several people in it, and a guy diving into it from a high point near the walkway around it.  It was very pretty, but we found the walk down to be very slippery in places, and would warn people to watch their footing carefully.  If we had more time it would have been fun to go swimming there in the company of the catfish that live there.  I\'m glad we went, but I\'m not sure I would choose to visit another cenote.

173527361.name: Excellent example of Yucatan Cenotes
173527361.author: a TripAdvisor user
173527361.reviewBody:
We visited in the early afternoon, walked down close to the base of the cenote and watched a half dozen very happy visitors enjoying their swimming and diving. The setting is beautiful and, especially with the sun shining through the verdant surroundings, it is clear why the Maya consider this a very special place. Cenote Zaci is large enough for a crowd to be comfortable playing and deep enough for diving. The fee is 15 pesos per person but the fee is waived if you spend a bit of time and money in the restaurant.

The restaurant was good, the beer was cold and the botanas were both unusual and abundant. It was a nice break even if you don't go down to the cenote surface as you can see the view of Zaci and the swimmers from several spots at the restaurant. 

As we were leaving about 3:30 or 4:00, the buses were arriving into Valladolid with many of the Mexican and international visitors already wearing their bathing suits and walking toward the Cenote. I would advise a visit earlier in the day if possible.

161921725.name: a pleasant day
161921725.author: a TripAdvisor user
161921725.reviewBody: Sure, there are more beautiful cenotes in the Yucatan but this place is cheap and within walking distance and non-toursity, making it a great daytime activity. I went in the morning with a friend and we had the whole place to ourselves for the almost 4 hours we stayed there. There is plenty of wildlife to see there and restaurants and shopping without any pushy vendors. The pool is large, clean, and refreshing to swim in. Overall, it was a great visit!

160839744.name: Asbolutley Beautiful
160839744.author: a TripAdvisor user
160839744.reviewBody: We visited Cenote Zaki as part of the Chichen tour. There were a few people around (we were the third bus to arrive) but this strangely did not affect the quiet and sombre nature of the Cenote. It is very deep (200 feet down...?) but the walls and lighting makes it a very serene and beautiful place to visit. This was our first cenote to visit, and it made us appreciate how these were so important spiritually and functionally to the Mayan people. Totally worth a visit if you are in the Valladolid area.

144432771.name: Must do in Valladolid
144432771.author: a TripAdvisor user
144432771.reviewBody: I\'m writing this review because I read a few comments indicating that Cenote Zaci was in someway inferior to other nearby cenotes such as Dzitnup.  I would argue that each offers compelling reasons to visit.  In fact, I would say that none of the six cenotes we visited could be skipped because it was redundant with another.  Cenote Zaci was the only water source for a city which was continuously inhabited for 2000 years.  The water at Zaci was crystal clear when I visited, unlike some of the reviews would suggest.  I could watch the black catfish swimming many meters below the surface from the observation decks.  There were a few leaves floating about, but should not be considered a negative and is quite natural in any cenote which is not underground.  The cenote is larger than most and has limestone trail which wraps around the perimeter and has steps to the water level.  My family stopped for a light lunch in the restaurant at the top of the cenote.  The service was great - very attentive.  The ceiling fans cooled us off while we enjoyed a local food sample platter.  It was perfect for us.  Here you can get a Yucatan margarita, which is heavy on the lime and quite refreshing.  If you eat in the restaurant, they waive the 20 peso fee to enter cenote.

135589958.name: Amazing experience
135589958.author: a TripAdvisor user
135589958.reviewBody: We found it by accident after being at Chichen Itza, we heard a guide mentioning it and took a chance. It was the highlight of the children\'s day and mine. My little one took a dive from a high point and my older boy went from the top - both were very proud of themselves and it was certainly a thrill! the water was very clear and the fish didn\'t look bothered at all that these crazy people were jumping into this amazing pool. It was a memory making experience for me and my children x

129817576.name: What a Thrill!
129817576.author: a TripAdvisor user
129817576.reviewBody: This was one of the highlights of our Yucatan trip. After a day at the ruins in Chichen Itza it was quite refreshing to jump in the cool pool! I was chicken and jumped only two feet, but my adventurous daughter (27) jumped from about 30 feet. She did it twice and said it was the thrill of a lifetime! The platform was wet, muddy, and slippery so if you plan ahead you can wear water socks to increase your safety. She said the scariest part was running to do the jump and she didn\'t want to slip. The second time she jumped she was more confident and it showed in her form. From that hieght you need to use dive techniques so you do not get hurt!  But to just jump in from a short distance was cool. The day we went there was a group of local kids celebrating a birthday in the resturant leading to the cenote and they made it fun by cheering on visitors to jump in!

127348732.name: Awesome jump
127348732.author: a TripAdvisor user
127348732.reviewBody: Aside from it\'s location right in the middle of town (which is nice enough to spend a day or two), the best about this cenote is singular opportunity of a 30 meters jump (100 ft) into a black hole as it looks like from the top ridge. It might be not allowed, but mexican kids seem to do it all the time.

124278874.name: Awesome cenote!
124278874.author: a TripAdvisor user
124278874.reviewBody: I have been to 7 cenotes since I\'ve been in Mexico and I have to say there is something special about this cenote. Maybe it was perfect water temperature or maybe it\'s something more. This cenote is as clean and fresh as any of the larger cenotes if not more so. There is a really high place that dove off of into the water, it was awesome!

71114226.name: Mi fuente de juventud - My fountain of youth
71114226.author: a TripAdvisor user
71114226.reviewBody: For the past ten years I have been living in Valladolid 5 to 6 months a year.  I have been swimming in the Cenote Zaci all those years, sometimes daily.  It is a natural wonder that I call "mi fuente de juventud".  Recently criticized in the press for the surface being "dirty" I became defensive.  Being partially open to the sky the cenote has to be shared by many other plants and animals - including swallows, bats, pigeons, orioles, dragonflies, fish, butterflies, turtles, buds, leaves, seedpods from a variety of surrounding tropical trees.  The last couple of years municipal employees have done a marvelous job cleaning the surface, often daily.  Of course, it doesn\'t take long before the surface is viewed as "dirty" by some visitors.  As I swim I often do a little "skimming" with my breaststroke.  I have never had any skin ailments and, in fact, feel that the water quality is beneficial to my skin.  It is time for the lovers of this natural wonder to band together, to request reliable water quality analysis, and to work toward the positive image that the Cenote Zaci deserves.  Tom Jones (tomjoneslxvi@yahoo.com)

53271678.name: Spectacular cenote, well worth a stop.  Combine it with a restaurant stop.
53271678.author: a TripAdvisor user
53271678.reviewBody: We had read mixed reviews of this cenote in a few different books.  One said it was just ok, another said it was worth the stop, another said it was too developed.  We stopped there on 1.8.10, and went swimming first (15M per person), which was great!  There are several spots to jump off the path down into the cenote, which is spectacularly blue and gorgeous.  It looks like a tropical exhibit.

52765508.name: Beautiful and peaceful
52765508.author: a TripAdvisor user
52765508.reviewBody: Went on a trip through Valladolid (which is a great, up and coming town).  Didn\'t swim or snorkel this one based on the time we had.  Was worth it just to pay to see it and walk around.  It wasn\'t very sunny that day so snorkeling wouldn\'t have been great anway.  Definately good to see if you are in the area.  The service at the restaurant was good as well.

23232278.name: A novel swimming experience
23232278.author: a TripAdvisor user
23232278.reviewBody:
This cenote is very pretty. It is half hidden in a cave, accessible by a ramp or by a stair. Enough of the cave roof has fallen in that the pool is brightly lit. (No fear, the rest is very solid.)  Creeper roots and stalagtites hang from the roof.

The pool has sheer sides and immediately gets quite deep, but there are cables across the pool at water level for weak swimmers.

The entrance is located in Vallodalid on Calle 36 between Calle 37 and Calle 39. There is a small parking lot and a restaurant visible.

The ticketing stand is next to the parking lot with a small room to change into the swim suit.

We did not eat at the restaurant, but passed through it on the way out.

22925185.name: Cenote Zaci - Don\'t miss this
22925185.author: a TripAdvisor user
22925185.reviewBody:
This has to be the best parts of my trip. We drove from Cancun to Valladolid on the toll road and we arrived in time for lunch. The restaurant at the entrance was good and the waiters were friendly. If you eat at the restaurant, you can take the side entrance to the Cenote and get in for free. 

I went in mid-December and the water was great. It was cool, clear and you could see the eyeless black fish called "lubs" swimming around. Bring a swimsuit because you can go swimming. I read that the Cenote is about 260' deep and some of the locals were jumping off the side walls that were at least 30' from the water. 

The winding stairs and walkways around the cenote made it magical. 
I was in awe and still am.

671191632.name: Swimming in a cave
671191632.author: a TripAdvisor user
671191632.reviewBody: We visited only the xxx cenote as we had restricted time. We took a taxi from Valladolid and the driver waited for us for roughly an hour and drove us back after our swim. The cenote is very nice, sort of a cave with clear water and small black cat fish. Only some light gets in through the opening at the top. Definitely worth visiting. Not great for snorkeling, gran cenote by Tulum is one for it out of the ones we visited. The only thing I would say that put me off a bit at this cenote is the guide that come forward to you from the information point and doesn\'t announce himself as guide. He takes you to the ticket booths and walk you to the cenote talking very fast about some Maya decorations that I doubt are genuine along the walkway. We might have been naive but I honestly didn\'t see it coming when after taking us a quick pic in the cenote he asked us for 100 pesos. So if someone approached you just simply ask if they are a guide or not.\nOther than this the cenote is very unique.

668596280.name: Good swimming, place needs some tlc
668596280.author: a TripAdvisor user
668596280.reviewBody: It was very quiet when we were there and we were \'encouraged\' to have our photos taken on arrival with a parrot! Later they tried to get us to buy the set, not just one photo. Three Cenotes to visit but few signs to tell you where to go.  We paid for a life jacket for 7 yr old to go into the first Cenote but it was taken from us when we came out so he didn\'t have one for the other 2 Cenotes. 1st Cenote was the best it was the biggest with small top opening that the sun streamed down through, turquoise blue water, small fish, easy access, lifeguard. The other 2 had steeper steps, colder water and were much smaller. The outbuildings needed reroofing and no changing facilities only the toilets. We stayed a couple of hours in total as we didn\'t find any catering facilities apart from a man selling coconuts and a fridge of cold drinks.  Obviously the season had not started at the beginning of April so we enjoyed a relatively quiet visit.

664598402.name: Swimming in a beautiful cenote in the shade
664598402.author: a TripAdvisor user
664598402.reviewBody: Loved this. Place is very low key. The cenote is really underground with only a small hole in the ceiling letting light through. The water is cool, refreshing, and clear. They\'ve strung ropes around so you can explore the edges of the cave/cenote. And there were not many people. We did not eat here, but there is a restaurant that looked fairly high end (white table cloths).

659290424.name: Great adventure
659290424.author: a TripAdvisor user
659290424.reviewBody: We came here on recommendation of our restaurant waiter earlier in the day and were not disappointed.  Wonderful swimming adventure.  Water was cold, but if was unique and worthwhile.

659140674.name: Magical experience exploring underground
659140674.author: a TripAdvisor user
659140674.reviewBody: This cenote is right next to Samula, and it is darker and the cave is simply beautiful. The lights were broken so they lit candles inside which made it even cooler. Not too many people when we visited either on an afternoon, I would recommend doing both cenotes since they are right next to each other, even if you only swim in one like we did it is still very nice to see both.

658619227.name: A visit to cenotes Xkeken and Samula
658619227.author: a TripAdvisor user
658619227.reviewBody:
We came here as part of our Chichen Itza tour with Absolute Adventures. The shady area with lots of trees and the beautiful cool water cenotes were just what we needed after a hot morning visiting the ruins.

When we arrived, my mum became quite entranced by one of the two macaw parrots there, and was offered to take photos with them for a small fee. The birds looked well cared for so we decided to take them up on the offer and the guy at the desk emailed them all to me as well as printing a few.  

We first went to cenote Xkeken which was my personal favourite of the two. The water was so clear that you could see the bottom straight away, and a beautiful shade of blue. The sun streaming in from above hit the water in just the right way to give it a lovely natural atmosphere. There were a few people in there, but it didn't feel crowded. Look out for tiny fish swimming around you, and bats flying above. 

Next we went for a short walk with our guide to cenote Samula. This one was slightly darker, but just as clear and blue. Both cenotes seemed cold when we got in, but this was likely because our skin was hot from the morning at the ruins. We enjoyed both cenotes and stayed for a little while until we decided it was time to leave for lunch.

In all, this was a wonderful stop to our day and had been recommended by our guide as an alternative to the busy Il Kil. I've not been there so I can't comment on that, but we loved how quiet this place was and that we could relax and cool down a bit before going on with the rest of our day.

655274268.name: Cool underground swimming
655274268.author: a TripAdvisor user
655274268.reviewBody: This Cenote is underground with a single hole providing a shaft of light to enter.  Cool stalactites.  Surreal experience.

655218564.name: beautiful. clean facilities,
655218564.author: a TripAdvisor user
655218564.reviewBody: very clean beautiful underground cenote. You have to drive there. about 10 min drive from Valadolid. 2 cenotes togeher

654788677.name: Go in the early morning!
654788677.author: a TripAdvisor user
654788677.reviewBody: It\u2019s such a beautiful cenote! If you go very early in the morning, around 8:30 when they just opened, you\u2018ll most likely be the only ones around..  it\u2019s worth it, because all the sellers aren\u2018t there yet, and your can swim all in your own! It\u2019s about 180 pesos for the two cenotes, a very good price! (You also have options for food packages, but they only apply once the restaurant is open)

654672006.name: Beautiful and serene
654672006.author: a TripAdvisor user
654672006.reviewBody: As with the other cenote we have went here early in the morning which has allowed us around half an hour of peace and serenity by being alone in the cenote. In my opinion this one is the prettier cenote of the two in the complex but both are well worth the visit, they offer showers and bathrooms which is really helpful. I would suggest you if you are staying in Valladolid to go there as soon as they open on a week day because that feeling of being alone in such a beautiful cenote should not be missed

649967163.name: Worth the visit
649967163.author: a TripAdvisor user
649967163.reviewBody: There are actually 2 cenotes close to each other which you can visit all at once. Very nice facilities like bathrooms and showers. There are lifeguards as well. And there are volunteers to guide you around. Beautiful place to see, not to be missed.

648373558.name: dark, intriguing cenote
648373558.author: a TripAdvisor user
648373558.reviewBody:
A dark, cool, spooky cenote with stalactites and dangling tree roots reaching down from the cave's ceiling.  Only a small amount of sunlight from a hole in the ceiling above.  A must-see, along with Cenote Samula across the street.  A little harder to climb into the water here than at Samula -- watch your step and go left or right on the rocks as you get in.

X'Keken and Samula share a parking lot.  Definitely check out both while you're there -- Samula is prettier, but the contrast in atmospheres is worth experiencing.  The food options, which are few, are on the X'Keken side. Bring towels.

Tips: 1) Ignore the white-shirted young men between the parking lot and the entrance (other than a "no, gracias").  You don't need a guide to go swimming, and you don't need to tip them -- parking is free.  2) No need to engage with the vendors between the entrance and the cenote (again, other than a "no, gracias").  Their towels are raggedy and overpriced -- bring your own or just let the air dry you.  You can also walk around the tourist plaza to the cenote on trails through the trees.  3) No sunscreen allowed in the cenote, but you won't need it because there's only a little spot of sunlight in the cave.

646425956.name: Good two-for-one cenote experience
646425956.author: a TripAdvisor user
646425956.reviewBody: Xkeken and Samulha are in the same \'complex\', and both are very beautiful, if lacking the incredible atmosphere of Suytun or the general excellence of Zaci. Still well worth a visit.

645520786.name: Incredible place! A must go!
645520786.author: a TripAdvisor user
645520786.reviewBody: This place is out of this world. Beautiful to swim in such a location... the best cenote we visited. \n\nYou can visit another cenote in the same location but this one is my far the nicest.

632058141.name: Xkeken Cenote by cycle
632058141.author: a TripAdvisor user
632058141.reviewBody: Easy to get to by cycle from Valladolid. A beautiful cenote, area around it is over touristy imo. Definitely worth visiting.

630064057.name: Fantastic experience
630064057.author: a TripAdvisor user
630064057.reviewBody: Out of the many cenotes we visited X\u2019Keken is the most amazing for us. The real cave and underground experience with the light coming in through a small hole. Fantastic!

629954240.name: Amazing place for a swim
629954240.author: a TripAdvisor user
629954240.reviewBody: This was beautiful, the water was cold but clear. The stallectites were amazing.  Definitely worth swimming in both cenotes.

627698701.name: Awsome
627698701.author: a TripAdvisor user
627698701.reviewBody: Very well developed cenote. Unfortunately too many tourist shops but otherwise clean. Showers are available. Good accessibility from the street.

620863969.name: Great clear view cenote with catfish foot spa
620863969.author: a TripAdvisor user
620863969.reviewBody: This was my first cenote experience and I must say it has been great. When I arrived there were guides who tried to show you around and explain to you about the cenote. I just followed the guide who explained the two different cenotes at this place whether you want a darker one or brighter one. We went for the samola cenote which has a little hole for the sun to shine inside. We hired lifejackets as it was really deep inside and didn\u2019t want to risk getting drowned. The guide helped to take some photos in the cenote. Although it was pretty unnecessary, you could just skip the guide bit as they just want some money. I just tipped 20 pesos in the end. The cenote had about 6-7 people at the time which was perfect as my girlfriend and I can pretty much spend our time there. The water was definitely cold! It was crystal clear that you could easily snorkel inside. I didn\u2019t bring my goggles with me which was a missed. Would recommend you to bring one or you could hire a snorkel goggles for 30 pesos for two. We swam a bit in the cenote - it was definitely a great one as we saw catfish swimming around. After the swim I sat by the entrance where we can do some fish spa where the cat fishes will come to your legs and eat all the dead skins. I stayed for 30 minutes and really had great time with the spa. Overall I would definitely recommend this place if you are driving between tulum/cancun and Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1.

616530266.name: The better of the two at Dzitnup
616530266.author: a TripAdvisor user
616530266.reviewBody: We were glad we paid to see both the cenotes at Dzitnup.  This one was a little different with the stalactites.

613950238.name: Water was so cold
613950238.author: a TripAdvisor user
613950238.reviewBody:
After Chichen Itza, this was the second stop during our full day Chichen Itza and Valladolid tour. We arrived here before 2PM on Aug 8, just as the rain started. Our YucaTreks guide took care of the tickets, pointed us to the change rooms, waited for us near the cave entrance, then led us down the slippery steps to the cave. Watch your step and do hold on to the rope railing. Inside the cave, sunshine streaming in from the hole above towards the waters below was such a cool sight. This cenote actually reminded my husband and I of a similar tourist attraction in Bohol, Philippines, called Hinagdanan Cave. 

I would recommend wearing water shoes because the ground you walk on and the rocks that lead down to the water are both slippery and rough—they hurt your feet. Be careful getting in and out of the water, no handholds after the first couple of steps, and it is not always easy to keep your balance. In case you were wondering--the water was so cold!

There are 3 different stairways leading down to the water and we chose the middle one. After stepping off the huge submerged rock, the water was immediately deep and we cannot reach the bottom. We just treaded water and kept within reach of the rope. It started to rain harder as we were swimming--we could tell from the rain falling down from the hole above. I would also recommend borrowing a life vest, even when you know how to swim, to be able to swim confidently towards the spot directly underneath the hole. We admired stalactites and overhanging vines while small fish swam around us. There was a lifeguard on duty who blew his whistle when anyone tried to grab the overhanging vines or roots.

Heavy rainfall just as we were leaving the cave an hour later. Change rooms have a thatched roof, so while it was raining, the roof leaked in places. No hooks for hanging clothes inside the stalls so had to do a bit of manoeuvring while changing to make sure nothing fell on the wet floor.

613566926.name: Refreshing stop with clean facilities
613566926.author: a TripAdvisor user
613566926.reviewBody: This cenote is a great place to visit after you tour Chichen Itza. The cool clear waters are revitalizing and refreshing. They have a nice Reaturant and changing areas. Absolutely beautiful!

595642299.name: Amazing cenote(s)
595642299.author: a TripAdvisor user
595642299.reviewBody: Two cenotes located next to each other! Cenote X\'keken has a small opening with a some hanging tree roots, stalactites and is nicest around noon. Cenote Samula has a bigger opening and has a round shape. Prices are lower than the very touristic ones. The price for both cenotes is just slightly more than for a single one.

593884628.name: Still my Favorite Cenote
593884628.author: a TripAdvisor user
593884628.reviewBody: I visited this cenote, and Samula across the street about 20 years ago, and they were my first cenote experiences. I still love Xkeken (Dtznup) as a beautiful cave. It\u2019s just \u201cway cool.\u201d Samula, across the street is great also. You should buy the ticket for both and spend a few minutes cooling off after that hot hot hot day at Chichen Itza. Definitely a vital part of a memorable day.

587026876.name: Dark and No Steps to Get In and Out
587026876.author: a TripAdvisor user
587026876.reviewBody: This is next to another Cenote, and we used Collectivo to get here. I think it was 35 pesos per person. Collectivo are in front of Hotel Mar\u00eda Guadalupe in downtown on Calle 41 and 39. It took us time to find it because google maps don\'t list this hotel and Apple maps had it at wrong location. On the way back, we took taxi which charged us 90 pesos. Also, we heard that there are collectivos next to ADO bus terminal. This centoe is dark and it is difficult to get in and out because they don\'t have wooden steps like others. Therefore, it could be slippery.

585353286.name: Worth a visit
585353286.author: a TripAdvisor user
585353286.reviewBody: If you are that region, take your time and visit both chenotes. They are nicely organised for tourists and both quite big.

581249735.name: One of the more beautiful cenotes
581249735.author: a TripAdvisor user
581249735.reviewBody: The place is advertised as Cenote Dzitnup and consists of two different cenotes, X\u2018Keken and Samula. X\u2018Keken is the far more beautiful and romantic cenote so you can easily save the extra money and go straight for X\u2018Keken. Samula is just big but otherwise dull. Also: you really don\u2018t need a guide. This is all about taking a dip in the (somewhat chilly) water and appreciating the atmosphere.

579444276.name: Beautiful!
579444276.author: a TripAdvisor user
579444276.reviewBody: We visited both cenotes and they were very pretty! As it was low season, it was not crowded. \nWe bought at the entrance the ticket that included both cenotes plus lunch. We were afraid that it was going to be a tourist trap and we were highly surprise with the food and its quantity. It was really good!

574419180.name: was once great
574419180.author: a TripAdvisor user
574419180.reviewBody: This used to be a great place to swim but it is now built up, expensive and over run with tour busses.

570633023.name: Swim on your back and appreciate the ceiling
570633023.author: a TripAdvisor user
570633023.reviewBody: We only did this one of the two cenotes on the property but I would have liked to have done both after seeing this one.  There were fish in the water but we were told by some people with snorkeling equipment that they were only non-native catfish and that the water wasn\'t clear to the bottom so looking up was better than looking down.  The water was chilly but you got used to it.  There were some ropes to stand on or grab onto if you needed a little break.  For people who aren\'t strong swimmers or for children I recommend a life jacket.  That will help you just relax and float while looking around the cave\'s impressive ceiling and the bats flying above.

564067221.name: Amazing
564067221.author: a TripAdvisor user
564067221.reviewBody: We have been there with rented car. Compared to Chitzen we were there almost alone. No bus tours. I don\u00b4t know if we were just lucky or they don\u00b4t go there. The 2 cenotes are very impressive. I don\u00b4t think it is expensive. 9 USD for both cenotes. You don\u00b4t have to buy anything from the sellers and you also say politely to photographer that you don\u00b4t need photos. The parking guy with uniform asked for tip and we gave him a small amount.

563429319.name: Well organized double cenotes
563429319.author: a TripAdvisor user
563429319.reviewBody: This is basically 2 beautiful cenotes. Well organized with a guide escorting you around, waiting for you while you swim, take photos, buy souvenirs and food. I recommend this experience.

557803839.name: Wow!
557803839.author: a TripAdvisor user
557803839.reviewBody: Trust me on this one.  It\'s worth the trip.  I\'ve seen a lot of cenotes but this is spectacular. Don\'t look at pictures first.  Just go and be in awe. Take your swimming suit if you like to swim.  You need to be able to climb up and down a lot of stairs.

551856255.name: No for tourists trap, Yes for Cenotes
551856255.author: a TripAdvisor user
551856255.reviewBody: Xkeken and Saluma Cenotes are in the same property. It\u2019s impossible to say that these underground creations of nature are not impressive. On the other hand the human creation above ground are a turn-off. After you pay the entrance fee -expensive for Mexico- they take your picture to sell to you later. You must walk thru rows of noisy food vendors and vending stalls to get to the sink holes. In my opinion to much of a tourist trap and to much cement, that detracts from the Cenotes natural beauty.  Go for the Cenotes, but be prepared for a rowdy access.

550764963.name: Wow!
550764963.author: a TripAdvisor user
550764963.reviewBody: This was wonderful. It\'s easy and inexpensive to get to from Valladolid on a collective taxi if you don\'t have a car. The Xkeken cenote is awe-inspiring, so go to the other one first; but both are beautiful. The swim was refreshing and the eye candy can\'t be beat. I also liked seeing the bats (way overhead).

550756996.name: As an alternative to Chichen Itz\u00e1
550756996.author: a TripAdvisor user
550756996.reviewBody: We couldn\u2019t face the crowds in Chichen Itz\u00e1 so we headed to these 2 cenotes for relaxation until the nighttime show at Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1. The 2 cenotes are close together and both worth a visit. Both are big with access by easy but steep stairs. (A bit slippery) The first has amazing stalagmites whilst the 2nd has lots of natural light and deep cool water. I think the quality of the light varies with the seasons, most impressive being in the Spring. It\u2019s a great way to relax and cool off after sightseeing.

547401909.name: Double cenote + buffet lunch
547401909.author: a TripAdvisor user
547401909.reviewBody: From appearances on the outside the place looks a little run down, however the 2 cenotes were impressive. We arrived early by bikes and were the first ones in, some got some great snaps. Make sure you have some change in your pocket for the obligatiory escorting to the cenote by the guide at the entrance. We were talked into the package at the entrance, which included a buffet lunch for and extra 125 pesos/ pp and it was delicious! A menu degustation of the local dishes from the region and a lovely waiter who patiently explained what is was. Overall a good experience.

543999871.name: Worth seeing if you are in the area.
543999871.author: a TripAdvisor user
543999871.reviewBody:
So, I feel conflicted about this place.  The exterior seems a bit depressing.  Like maybe it was once a more popular place, but now not so much.  There are lots of empty, unused spaces which kind of make it feel like a bit of a ghost town.  We went late in the afternoon  when there were very little visitors, maybe it's different when it's crowded.

Anyway, you are here to see the cenotes, so that's what you should focus on.  They accept credit cards and for my husband and I it was a total of $13 US for both cenotes.  They are both underground cenotes, so if you've never seen this type, then it's worth stopping by.   

Lots of the cenotes in the area are more open and have jumping platforms or rope swings.  For safety reasons, this place doesn't have either.  It's dark inside. The water is also a little cooler, but there were plenty of people swimming.  

These weren't our favorite cenotes, but we love all cenotes and never think that visiting one is a waste of time.

They take your photos on the way in.  We didn't have a lot of photos of the two of us, so we bought the usb stick for 7$ US and used one of the pics for our Christmas card.  The quality is very good.  

The employees were very nice and they gladly called us a taxi when we were ready to leave.    We had taken a taxi from Valladolid to Selva Maya, paid 50 pesos for that cenote , then walked to  Xkeken on a paved bike path, it was an easy 15 minute walk.

541723127.name: A paradise inside a cave
541723127.author: a TripAdvisor user
541723127.reviewBody:
After  visiting at least 6 cenotes, we arrived to this stunning one. It is a paradise to swim inside a cave!

Although you can feel the darkness and the humidity, there are some fake lights that helps you to see the beautiful colours of this cenote and to guide you in the water.

Please, take into consideration that swimming in a cenote is not as easy as swimming in the sea so if you are not a strong swimmer, you should avoid the deepest parts of any cenote.

We spent almost one month recorring Mexico and have to say that cenotes is definitely one of my highlights. I would recommend Santa Barbara, Cozuma, Gran Cenote, X`Keken and Kankirixche.

TIPS FOR TRAVELLERS: If you are planning to visit Mexico and the cenotes, check the weather in advance.
