We visited the cenotes at the end of October and having seen them in several stunning pictures before, I have to say that my first impression was so dissapointing with some of them.The reason was that due to the rain, not all of them were in the best condition and the famous blue colour and the transparent waters were not there. Some of them (the open ones) were brown and lots of leaves were floating in the water. Unfortunately, nature is impredictible and there was not too much that we could do about that but we were there, and not really willing to cancel the day because of that.

540768498.name: Under used natural beauty
540768498.author: a TripAdvisor user
540768498.reviewBody: My idea of swimming in fresh water in a cave with beams of sun is now off my bucket list! I really like cenotes, and this site offers 2 of them, very unique. Not pricey, you can spend a good hour without even talking about the flea market shopping. You put that in the hands of a Disney like company, and they could turn this into a magical feature park! OK maybe a bit of exaggeration but is is a bit of a shame that so many locals try to make a living of that beautiful place and are more numerous than tourists...while being very respectful, not pushing to sell you anything. Get some cash at hand to tip the young guides who are touring you as I suspect this is their only salary. Buy a few beers, get a few paid pictures...this is ecotourism at its best. The good side, you get to swim practically alone with your party...WOW.

540509776.name: Fantastic cenote (cave to swim)
540509776.author: a TripAdvisor user
540509776.reviewBody: Beautiful to see and swim in... also a free pedicure of the small fishes was good fun for our son. Advanture starts when going down the steps into a cave.... Some baths sleep-ins and flying around. 80 peso\u2019s to go in one cenote and 125 to go in two (also cazumel, which you don\u2019t want to miss) Really great experience!!

538619065.name: Wonderful cenotes, so crowded :(
538619065.author: a TripAdvisor user
538619065.reviewBody: We visited the two cenotes, xkeken and samula, and eat at a restaurant next to xkeken. Price for admission and restaurant was 265 pesos per person. We also had an english guide ( ask for ambrosio ) that you can just tip. \nBoth cenotes are really nice. Especially xkeken with the stalactites. Look on the ceiling for some fossils on the entrance. The problem ( hence 3 stars ) is that the place gives you a lot the feeling of being in a turistic overly exploited place whereas cenotes are wonders of nature. Pretty crowded compared to other cenotes too. Food was quite reasonable!

537755639.name: On way back from Chechen Itza
537755639.author: a TripAdvisor user
537755639.reviewBody: On way back to Tulum from Chechen Itza , we stop by to see Cenote X Keken , there are 2 Cenote 1. Cenote X keken Nd Cenote  samula close to each other ,\nFew steps down you will clear water and people take a dip in it .. you can find sunlight also coming from 2-3 places. \nThe upkeep of place is not good and shows that not many visitors are coming there, more then half shops are closed and play area of kids look deserted..

518002296.name: Awesome place, a must in Valladolid
518002296.author: a TripAdvisor user
518002296.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place, the guy who give us the tour was very kind, his name was Damian, ask for him if you can.

507236504.name: A refreshing dip in a subterranean cenote
507236504.author: a TripAdvisor user
507236504.reviewBody: We paid around 80 pesos for a soak in this refreshing cenote and it was well worth it. It would probably be a good idea to rent life jackets for 20 pesos if you are a non swimmer although we did not do this. The trip down is on slippery stairs so mind not to slip. There are guide lines criss-crossing the cenote which is just as well as the water is incredibly deep. Overall, a good and cheap stop for travellers to or from from Chichen Itza or Playa del Carmen.

503957229.name: Don\'t miss it!
503957229.author: a TripAdvisor user
503957229.reviewBody: Really cool close cenotes for a refreshing swim! Specially cenote xkeken with all the bats flying around!

496705994.name: Go here for the underground cave cenote experience
496705994.author: a TripAdvisor user
496705994.reviewBody: Great  underground cenote. Kids loved it. They just wanted to keep swimming and  not get out the water. We were looking for an underground  cave sink hole (cenote) not too crowded and close to the Chichen  Itza - Valladolid - Playa road.  This is a good option. Only reason why I give 4 stars is that I just don\'t appreciate how once your are inside the park they charge you extra for the life vests, and even to use the restrooms. While I understand people in the nearby communities make a living of tourism it will be great if all services were included in the entrance fee and employees of the park were paid better. We only visited the X\'Keken Cenote, so cannot comment on the Samula cenote. Try both if you have the time.

494429826.name: Refreshing swim
494429826.author: a TripAdvisor user
494429826.reviewBody: We came here as part of the YucaTreks tour to Chichen Itza and Valladolid. It was the second stop on our tour and much needed after spending several hours in the blazing sun, heat and humidity of Chichen Itza. The cenote was very clean and the waters cool and refreshing. It was my first time visiting a cenote and I was quite amazed by the tree roots and stalagmites hanging down from the roof of the sinkhole. \n\nLuckily, it wasn\'t too crowded when we visited except for a couple of families. There\'s also an area to rent life jackets if needed, changing areas and bathrooms.

491799157.name: A must see!
491799157.author: a TripAdvisor user
491799157.reviewBody: We stopped by here while on a tour and I have to say this was our favorite cenote we visited during our vacation. If you are in the area I highly recommend going to X\u2019Keken.

491143152.name: Exquisite Natural Wonder
491143152.author: a TripAdvisor user
491143152.reviewBody:
We visited the cenotes on our own. We took a ferry from Isla Mujeres to Cancun, jumped on a Ado to Vallodolid, then booked a tour, after getting a cab catering rides to the Cenotes site. We were there on May 3, 2017. We paid $125 per person for both Cenotes. The prices varied depending on it you wanted food, ATV, and or horseback riding included in your tour. We elected for Cenotes only. Both were beautiful, offering something different. Xkeken had more stalagmites and stalactites lower to the water than the other, which gave a different feel for the place. The water is VERY cold, but once you jump in, you'll be more than fine. There's no inching your way into this temperature, you just have to go for it. I definitely recommend beach/pool shoes. 

These natural wonders have fish (Garra rufa, I think they are called) that eat debris, bacteria and dead skin out of the water to keep it naturally clean, thus eliminating the need for chemicals (very cool, I think). There are ropes throughout both of the cenotes for those who are not so strong swimmers or just want to hang out in the water with a little assistance. We saw quite a few native bats in both locations. It was nice to see since they remained high in the top of the cenotes. I'm sure I would not hold this perspective had they been flying lower. lol They truly seemed unmoved by our presence.

I didn't give 5 stars because of the staff (Some were very nice and professional while others were, well... let's just say they needed quite a bit of improvement). 

A Word of Caution: If you have health issues or are not in moderate to great shape take caution. The steps into the cenotes are a very long way down, with questionable footing in some areas, so watch your footing. On the way up, those with foot, leg, hip, lung, or heart problems may find this climb quite challenging. Pausing and taking great caution is recommended if you decide to experience this wonder. Enjoy! It is definitely a sight see.

490749883.name: Great cenote
490749883.author: a TripAdvisor user
490749883.reviewBody: If you only go to one cenote, make it xkeken .  We have done a few but the stalagmites, tree roots and fish make this the best.  Better than Samuels next door (our guide book had them back to front).  Not an expensive taxi ride from the town.  Taxis waiting at the gate afterwards.

488910015.name: Ahhh!  Cool Cenote  Nice experience!
488910015.author: a TripAdvisor user
488910015.reviewBody: We went late in the day - about 5 pm - and there were no crowds. Just 20 or so - with maybe 15 swimmers. I really liked it. Jamie was nervous about bacteria in the water. \n\nYou should try at least one cenote. \ud83d\udc1f\ud83c\udfca\ud83c\udfaf

487808699.name: wonderful cenote!
487808699.author: a TripAdvisor user
487808699.reviewBody: we visited Xkeken and Samula cenotes since they are next to each other; it is worth to pay the $125 pesos to visit both. They are both different and gorgeous!!

485444616.name: Recommendation from Locals
485444616.author: a TripAdvisor user
485444616.reviewBody: The owner of our appartement recommended this place to us, as there were so many cenotes all over Yukatan.\nDefinately was worth the trip. You can park the at the Parque Xkek\u00e9n and have to decide if you want to visit both cenotes or only one of the two. We decided to visit only one cenote. 5 Minutes walk by feet and you will reach the entrance. Some steps down and you stand in the cave which is quite impressive. natural daylight is shining through a hole in the ceiling and gives the water some blue colour. artificial lights are also placed around the cave. be aware the floor is very slippery when it is wet.

485300407.name: 2 for one
485300407.author: a TripAdvisor user
485300407.reviewBody: You can pay a little extra and get access to both cenotes. Given how little it is, it\'s worth seeing them given it\'s in the middle of no where. Both were nice but I was little disappointed you couldn\'t jump in any of them. Secondly, they\'re very dark inside so it\'s not a scenic i hoped. Otherwise great for cooling down and not very busy at all.

481087273.name: Cool place, really beautiful
481087273.author: a TripAdvisor user
481087273.reviewBody: Cool place. Fresh clear water. Liked it, it needs a bit more security for kids and maintenance. It\'s a really nice experience, worth the time.

475424074.name: Beautiful cenotes turned into an awful adventure park
475424074.author: a TripAdvisor user
475424074.reviewBody: I\'m still giving this a great rating although some aspects are horrible. But good things first: both cenotes are beautiful and offer seldom seen swimming experience in natural caves. In one of them there\'s enough room to spread your towel and relax for a while -- the other being more of the hit and go type. \n\nHowever, they raised the entrance fee to 160 pesos for both cenotes, for no obvious reason. Besides a bunch of merchandise and get-your-photo-taken, there\'s no infrastructure except for bathrooms, some of which were unaccessible. But there\'s one really wild adventure waiting, if you let your kid venture out on the playground: rusty nails and screws sticking out, swings on hair-thin corroded chains, rotten panels and slides that end mid-air. You might think that a higher entrance fee would suggest proper maintenance. Well, it probably just suggests higher profit.

464170365.name: Beautiful cenotes but a bit too touristy
464170365.author: a TripAdvisor user
464170365.reviewBody: The two cenotes are really worth the visit, but that being said it is always really annoying when you have to walk pass the markets offering things that you don\'t really want, that really bothers me and especially with small kids it is even more annoying as they want to check it all out. We visited with our almost three year old and she loved swimming in crystal clear waters, the water is cold and it is an excellent place to escape the heat of Valladolid!

464037955.name: Totally Cool
464037955.author: a TripAdvisor user
464037955.reviewBody: Followed the signs to Dzitnup and easily found the parking lot for Cenote Samula and Cenote Xkeken. We paid about $8 USD to get into the both. Safe parking lot and a trail to walk to both cenotes. I liked Xkeken better because of the hanging vines and stalactites. The water is crystal clear in both. There are bathrooms to change in. We stayed about 15 minutes at each cenote- it was MARVELOUS!

462730864.name: Beautiful but over developed
462730864.author: a TripAdvisor user
462730864.reviewBody: Now I know that tourism is an industry and people have to make a living out of it, but for my personal taste these two Cenotes are over developed now. That said, they are beautiful and I loved the bats flying around in one of them.

461126111.name: Sacred and healing
461126111.author: a TripAdvisor user
461126111.reviewBody: If you want to visit one of Mayan sacred cenotes, I recommend this cenote. The location has two cenotes, but I prefer to go the X\'Keken. You will enjoy the light which come through the ceiling hole. It is absolutely beautiful. We have been there four times so far. Yes, we love this cenote a lot! I recommend you to bring your water shoes, because inside of cave and rocks are slippery. Also I brought a trash bag to keep our stuff dry.

459740146.name: Amazing!
459740146.author: a TripAdvisor user
459740146.reviewBody: Wish we had longer amount of time to spend here, but we were on our way to Merida by car and it was late afternoon.

459131395.name: Very cave-like, and not for people who don\'t like bats
459131395.author: a TripAdvisor user
459131395.reviewBody: This cenote (X\'Keken, or X\'quequ\u00e9n) is one of two at Xkeken park. It is much more cave-like than its sister cenote, Samula. It is lit artificially, which highlights the beautiful stalactites that hang from the high ceiling. Hundreds of bats make this cenote their home and they will squeak and sing as you float beneath them. I am not at all bothered by bats, but if you have a phobia about them flying above you this might not be the cenote for you. \n\nThe water is cool and refreshing. Go early in the day to avoid the crowds, and bring your own towel. Swim shoes would be helpful on the sharp/slick rocks. A small tip for the staff at the end of your swim is a kind and polite thing to do.

458968401.name: Go early and beat the crowds!
458968401.author: a TripAdvisor user
458968401.reviewBody: We arrived at Xkeken as soon as they opened and found it to be a peaceful and pleasant experience. Our kids really enjoyed swimming in the two cenotes. They are both more cave-like that hole-like, but you get fantastic photos once the sun shines through the holes in the roof! We had both cenotes to ourselves save for one or two other people. The water is cool, which means it\'s probably more fun later in the day when it\'s warmer, but we get the feeling that the crowds descend once things warm up. \n\nThere was evidence of the place becoming annoying touristy once the busses arrive, but we were there and left before any of those things occurred. No one bothered us, tried to upsell us, or even tried to sell us anything. Arriving early and beating the crowds is probably the best way to enjoy the wonder of these lovely cenotes.

456189711.name: Worth stopping by if nearby
456189711.author: a TripAdvisor user
456189711.reviewBody: We brought our kids to the this cenote park. It was very touristy, but overall we enjoyed the stop.  The cenote was lit with electricity, there was an area to sit and watch or set down your swim towel, etc.

454976893.name: Best Cenote in Mexico!
454976893.author: a TripAdvisor user
454976893.reviewBody: This was my favorite Cenote I visited while in Mexico! It was absolutely stunning and gorgeous and the water wasnt very cold. The one small hole in the top of the cenote with the sun spotlight shining through onto the blue water made this cenote what it is and much more dramatic! Easy to drive to as well if you have a rental car.

454836984.name: Not just another Cenote
454836984.author: a TripAdvisor user
454836984.reviewBody: Absolutely loved the solid cent movement in Mexico, most people told me once i had been in one i had been in them all but I disagree. Each one offered something different, where it was nested, getting down to the cent, atmosphere, water, places to jump. This was an exceptionally good one and loved every minute. They do get a bit leave it though when there is too many people.

451599034.name: Really cool cenote and adventure park
451599034.author: a TripAdvisor user
451599034.reviewBody: I\'ve done over 20 cenotes and this one is a prime example of the big, deep cavern full of stalagmites and stalactites.  The water feels pure and there not too many people. The mayans selling their wares are very sweet. And though I didn\'t partake in other activities, there are a lot. ATV, horses, drinking, eating. And what looked like a football field!  Go!

451559065.name: Too Touristy!
451559065.author: a TripAdvisor user
451559065.reviewBody: Cenotes are lovely but the tourist juggernaut they have constructed around them, starting with an attempt to upsell you to a package, followed by aggressive attempts to sell guide and photo services once you buy your ticket and completed with rows of shops you need to pass and decline to buy from before actually entering the cenote ruined the experience.  Natural beauty totally overshadowed by commercial hard sell.  Guests feel like prey.  Would not go again

451544466.name: Overhyped, not worth it for me
451544466.author: a TripAdvisor user
451544466.reviewBody:
If you are in Valladolid I would recommend visiting the cenote at Hacienda Oxman instead - much more beautiful, quieter, and cheaper. It's the same distance from Valladolid and if you are car-less you can easily cycle there on a pathway south of Calle 54.

The cenotes at Samula and Xkeken were the least interesting of the 7 cenotes I visited during my trip to Yucatán and Quintana Roo.

As a lone traveller it was an expensive trip. Entry is 100 pesos for both cenotes (65 for one). I was able to share a taxi there for 30 pesos (catch on calle 39 just past the ADO station) but then couldn't find a shared taxi on the way back so had to pay another 70 pesos for the return journey. Renting a bike would be cheaper, there are no cycle lanes though so it wouldn't suit a nervous cyclist!

The cenotes themselves were okay, you would probably only find them to be spectacular if you hadn't visited any other cenotes before. Both are busy and noises echo around the caves so it's not a peaceful experience.

You can leave your stuff on the side safely (at least I was able to) whilst you swim. I found that X'keken did smell of urine which wasn't so pleasant. X'keken is the prettier and more interesting of the two.

Life jackets can be rented from the many vendors who you will not be able to miss for 20 pesos. There are also ropes strung across the cenote to rest on as you won't be able to touch the bottom.

449434786.name: Tourist trap
449434786.author: a TripAdvisor user
449434786.reviewBody: Tons of tourists and not pretty at all.  We went to another cenote next to this that was so much better.

448327276.name: Don\'t go, I guess :(
448327276.author: a TripAdvisor user
448327276.reviewBody: It is a special phenomenon to see, but the cenotes here are very commercialised. Merchandising everywhere.. It has a strange theme-park-feel. More of a downside: there is \u00a1POO IN THE WATER! In both cenotes we saw the turds floating around :-/ So, I don\'t think I would recommend it...

447569807.name: The first cenote I visited
447569807.author: a TripAdvisor user
447569807.reviewBody: It\'s a touristy place, yes, but the cenote or water hole itself is impressive - swimming in a cave really.

446621457.name: Beatifull!
446621457.author: a TripAdvisor user
446621457.reviewBody: Very nice cenote, no need for snorkeling though, fun for swimming as well. 80 pesos entrance fee, try to come early!

446452234.name: Beautiful & calm
446452234.author: a TripAdvisor user
446452234.reviewBody: It is just amazing. A Mayan tour guide lead us throughout the entire thing & answered to all our questions (in Spanish). The place itself is incredibly beautiful just to get a nice view & to relax for a moment. \n\nIt is a MUST once you\'re in Chichen Iza.

445864040.name: This cenote is really cold
445864040.author: a TripAdvisor user
445864040.reviewBody: This is beautiful not too tall but too much humidity and color of water is not clear, is not the best cenote but the coolest thing is that is right in front of another cool cenote and a buffet restaurant

443856193.name: Review
443856193.author: a TripAdvisor user
443856193.reviewBody: A must visit although a short one. Take advantage and swim the sinkhole- purest water you\'ll ever experience- it\'s a 45 min visit at best but something you\'ll never do again -

442749911.name: Wonderfull Cenotes!
442749911.author: a TripAdvisor user
442749911.reviewBody:
Both he Cenotes are soo cool to see and swim in. Much cooler and bigger then Grand Cenote in Tulum and not that crowded.
The buffet was good with alot of local flavours. 

Only bad thing was that we got this "guide" who hung around us everywhere, even when we just wanted to sit and read and chill. I understand that it is to be friendly and offer service, but it is enough to show us around. We can manage. 😊

441155772.name: Xkeken is the best cenote!
441155772.author: a TripAdvisor user
441155772.reviewBody: I really liked Xkeken cenote - I would say only pay for that one, not samula (it is way better). Definitely advise going around 12 - 1pm, as I went at around 4pm and it\'s much darker. Swimming around made me wish I had a go pro, it was so pretty!

437238094.name: Not worth it
437238094.author: a TripAdvisor user
437238094.reviewBody: Our guide told us that there are over 1400 cenotes in Yucat\u00e1n. I\'m sure it\'s true, and advise you pick a different one. The cenotes were nice enough, but the place is over-priced and very touristy. Do NOT buy the expensive package that includes the buffet!  Our meal was genuinely dreadful, surely an accomplishment of sorts in a country where bad meals are hard to find.

436482832.name: Darker and more touristy than other cenotes in the area. Still a cool experience though!
436482832.author: a TripAdvisor user
436482832.reviewBody: Entrance to the cenote was pricier than some other local places, but not bad. Walking in, you feel like you\'ve entered a small theme park though many shops and restaurants were closed during our visit. The cenote itself was down some steep steps, but that\'s normal. it was a more covered cenote and for that reason was dark with some bats hanging above. If you\'re in the area and haven\'t been to many other cenotes, I would say it\'s worth the visit though!

433083824.name: Give me light cenote!
433083824.author: a TripAdvisor user
433083824.reviewBody: What a great find! Glad we got to experience an underground cenote. This one was beautiful and I can see why it is one of the most photographed. Steep steps into cavern. A little bit of a hike from parking lot.

428958338.name: Nice visit
428958338.author: a TripAdvisor user
428958338.reviewBody: I went relatively early around 9am. Its a cool place. They wouldn\'t turn on the lights until later on, or for some special occasion. Nonetheless, it the tree roots was enlightening to look at.

418254735.name: Beautiful, but be careful.
418254735.author: a TripAdvisor user
418254735.reviewBody: This place has two Cenotes. The cenote that is actually called X\'keken is breathtaking! The drawback to this place is that you will be constantly approached by people who want to offer services that may or may not even be needed. Parking is free but you will be hit for a tip by the parking attendant. The park is open but you will be hit for a tip from somebody who offers to "guide" you around the park. You don\'t really need a guide. There are plenty of signs in both Spanish and English to point to where you want to go. Both swimming holes are a short walk from the entrance gate . Low season tickets are $100 pesos per person for admission to BOTH. We got suckered into paying 250 pesos per person for admission to the 2 cenotes and a "buffet dinner" in the AKTUN ( tortoise) restaurant. Definitely give the restaurant a miss!I\'ve had better food in school cafeterias! By all means do go to the underground cenotes. If you\'re hungry you can get food outside of the X\'keken cenote for around $50 pesos ($3US).

418144763.name: Wow
418144763.author: a TripAdvisor user
418144763.reviewBody: Beautiful cenotes (there\'s 2 here) breathtaking & unbelievable. We went here for $10 each. Practically free considering other ones are tourist traps at $70 & up.

416603038.name: Fantastic location for a dip!
416603038.author: a TripAdvisor user
416603038.reviewBody: Make sure to jump in! It is an exhilarating experience. Really enjoyed this cenote. It\'s a Fantastic location for a dip!

416159740.name: Beautiful
416159740.author: a TripAdvisor user
416159740.reviewBody: We loved these cenote so much It really brought our experience to a top notch experience. So many people we tell about cenote ask what they are. So its nice to share

411093600.name: Interesting: Worth a visit if you are touring cenotes.
411093600.author: a TripAdvisor user
411093600.reviewBody: Interesting, but if you are looking for the best place to spend an afternoon, the cenote Zaci in downtown Valadolid is more picturesque and you can swim there also.

409734873.name: Great for hot day
409734873.author: a TripAdvisor user
409734873.reviewBody: Great cenote, there is two of them in one place. Taxi from Valladolid 70 peso entrance 100 peso for both Cenote.\nNice and quite, we went there late afternoon. Perfect place to cool down in a hot days.

408714460.name: Cave cenote
408714460.author: a TripAdvisor user
408714460.reviewBody: Nice place to swim or just to take a look. The cave can get a bit humid. In one park with Cenote Samula, so get a ticket to visit both.

407643911.name: Busy, over-marketed but the light shaft is special
407643911.author: a TripAdvisor user
407643911.reviewBody: We had hoped to swim, but my children were put off by the birds flying around simply because they drop their guano in the cenote ( I must look up whether swimming in them is safe for this reason!!) as we saw. So suitably put off, we just looked at the cenote. The shaft of light through the roof hole is amazing but I wouldn\'t rush to see this cenote. I preferred Ik Kil but Ik Kil is not subterranean like this one. \n

405418970.name: Swim underneath stalactites!
405418970.author: a TripAdvisor user
405418970.reviewBody: Pay admission, use the restroom facilities, browse stalls and have something to eat at the restaurant - but be clear that you do NOT require a guide to walk the short, signed distance from the parking lot to the entrance to either Cenote Dznitup or Cenote Samula, both part of the Xkeken complex.  There is a lifeguard here, and the water is clear, cool, and refreshing.  The stalactite  covered ceiling and walls are amazing, and the light shining through the opening to the sky beautiful.  Life jackets are available for rent if you feel you need one, but there are ropes strung across the cavern through the water so that you can rest while swimming around.

404045597.name: It is nice but there are better ones out there
404045597.author: a TripAdvisor user
404045597.reviewBody: A few too many vendors set up in the path from the parking lot to the cenote.  It is okay for an underground cenote but we have been to better one.

404012939.name: Magical underground swimming
404012939.author: a TripAdvisor user
404012939.reviewBody: We visited a few cenotes on our trip to Yucatan. What made this one special is that it had swallows flying inside. The cenote only has  a small hole in the roof that allows the birds in. It\'s a really refreshing activity to beat the afternoon heat.

398177449.name: Unique, but there are better ones
398177449.author: a TripAdvisor user
398177449.reviewBody:
Overall it's a nice cenote, just a little hole in the ruff and so you really feel like in a cave. 
It's much colder than outside and water temperature could be ruffly 18 degrees Celsius. 
It's a bit difficult to pay the entrance, and you can pay seperate, for the attached park and the cenote.
We didn't found Dressing rooms and shower but toilets are available. 
Also you can eat there and buy some handcrafts circa 30 -40 traders. 
But there are better cenote in my opinion, for example close to chichen Itza.

394928224.name: Amazing
394928224.author: a TripAdvisor user
394928224.reviewBody: This is a magical place, water is very cold but be ready to have a great experience but be ready to pay a life jacket and snorkeling kit as they are not included in the entrance

394128123.name: Very nice!
394128123.author: a TripAdvisor user
394128123.reviewBody:
You have to go around noon as there is a hole in the top that is illuminated at noon.
It is Huge cave. Not the best facilities to change...
Just pay for the cenote entrance 65 pesos.
You have to go through all the merchants and many offers...if you come back from chichen itza you'll be used to it.

387909961.name: Nice centote to visit
387909961.author: a TripAdvisor user
387909961.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way back from Chichen Itza.  It was affordable and a really nice stop on our way back to Cancun.  The centote is beautiful with clear water and sun shining in from above.  The water was chilly but refreshing and felt great after spending the morning walking around the ruins.  We made sure to get there early before the bus crowds come in, so there were <10 other people there, which was nice.

386196153.name: Interesting
386196153.author: a TripAdvisor user
386196153.reviewBody: Nice subterranean water-cavern with light opening in the roof. It\'s really one big cavern complete with stalactites etc. and underground lake. Interesting to see but it doesn\'t take long. There were people swimming but, personally, I feel that this detracts somewhat from the natural splendour of the place. I know I\'m a bit of a misery but I just think that there are plenty of tourist options for swimming without invading places like this.\nThe site has two cenotes and we felt that this was the better of the two. We bought a combined ticket for 100 pesos per person. The site has a structured commercial side with restaurant and vending stalls and I suspect that it is a fixture for tour buses after trips to nearby Chichen Itza. Probably worth visiting earlier rather than late in the day if you want to avoid crowds.

383228359.name: It was ok
383228359.author: a TripAdvisor user
383228359.reviewBody: It was not what I expected.  It was one kinda big cave with water.  It was neat to see, but not inviting to swim.  I would not go out of my way to go to this cenote.  Luckily, we found another one where you could swim from cave to cave.

382985972.name: Really nice! Lindo!
382985972.author: a TripAdvisor user
382985972.reviewBody: They are like caverns so light is poor. It\'s better to visit midday.\n\nLos cenotes tienen poca luz ya que son cavernas, es mejor visitarlos a mediod\u00eda.

379803004.name: Amazing place, clear cool water, though there is a little stink
379803004.author: a TripAdvisor user
379803004.reviewBody:
We were there on one of the evenings. You can reach the cenotes by taxi or use the city tour buses from Valladolid which start from the Central Park and are free. 
It's an amazing place to explore, look and swim for a fee. Do take your towels and swim wear etc. 
The forest around the cenote and the neighbouring cenote too is beautiful. 
I enjoyed swimming though I will mention that there is a mild stink at the edges in some places. 
Perhaps some swimmer do not mind peeing in the water!!!

376263175.name: Natural wonder
376263175.author: a TripAdvisor user
376263175.reviewBody: You can\'t miss the chance to swim in these crystal clear waters. The scenery is really impressive, this is a must stop if you go to Chichen Itza or near the Valladolid area.

375836195.name: scenic cenote
375836195.author: a TripAdvisor user
375836195.reviewBody: a picturesque cenote that\'s worth the visit. I recommend making a day trip to Valladolid. Enjoy the park, the church, have a swim in the cenote and have lunch in one of the restaurants.

372214957.name: Almost had the Cenote to ourselves
372214957.author: a TripAdvisor user
372214957.reviewBody:
What a find!
We started the day early at Chichen Itza to beat the heat, and the headed to Cenote Xkeken just before lunch time, hence beating any possible crowds.
The price is extremely reasonable (65 pesos per person) & you can wonder & swim as much as you like, & the experience is very relaxing 
The natural beauty is not to be missed.

371633624.name: Nice but crowded
371633624.author: a TripAdvisor user
371633624.reviewBody: Impressive caved Cenote but nowhere to really leave your stuff. Also got hassled walking everywhere by vendors and there were loads of people there (although we did go on a Sunday). Would advise to go early morning rather than mid-afternoon, would perhaps be quieter. We preferred the smaller cenote attached to Xkeken as it was quieter and just felt a bit nicer.

369063295.name: Superb
369063295.author: a TripAdvisor user
369063295.reviewBody: Never in my life I did feel so in peace with nature and myself. I booked my trip to Valladolid to visit this immense beauty of the world. It is an experience which really worth.

368955788.name: Refreshing
368955788.author: a TripAdvisor user
368955788.reviewBody:
Great cenotes,a wonderful thing to do after a hot morning of sight seeing
The water is very refreshing, as I'm finding most of the pools and beaches in Mexico
a bit warm(mostly because I'm from Melbourne)
Beautiful setting, good for a bit of snorkeling . Buy a ticket for this one and Cenote Samula and it's a little cheaper 
Also they are both a bit different, good for everyone,kids,oldies etc

367909730.name: Visit if youre going to Chichen Itza
367909730.author: a TripAdvisor user
367909730.reviewBody: We came here on the way back from Chichen Itza.  Of the two cenotes at Dzitnup, this was our fave.  There are stalactites which you can swim up to and bats flying around.  The fact that theres only a little light makes it an even more special experience.\nForeigners get charged more than locals to visit so if you only do one, id recommend this one....unless you don\'t like bats!

367608817.name: Go to the whole park
367608817.author: a TripAdvisor user
367608817.reviewBody: At the entrance to this Cenote you can buy a package and you see three cenotes and you can also purchase a ride on a 4-wheeler. The 4-wheeler ride was the best part, and when we got to the cenote we were the only people there. It was far less crowded than all the other Cenotes.

366485783.name: Busy but breathtaking
366485783.author: a TripAdvisor user
366485783.reviewBody: We took a cab out to this location and found several other people doing the same thing. However, it was still a beautiful and different experience than anything else. I took a quick swim in the refreshing water and marveled at this geographical marvel.

363930656.name: Loved the heart opening!
363930656.author: a TripAdvisor user
363930656.reviewBody: It\'s so fun to explore cenotes!  They are all different - Loved the heart opening in this one and the bonus was that you could go to 2  cenotes (Xkeken and Samula) for one price!  This one has bats which I didn\'t especially like - but the stalactites are pretty cool!

363736038.name: Great way to experience a cenote
363736038.author: a TripAdvisor user
363736038.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a day-long chichen itza small tour group; it would be very difficult to find on your own, as the place looked abandoned and closed, but there a few food huts and a ticket booth that lead to the narrow stairs down into the cavern.  The water is very refreshing and the cavern and pool are beautiful.

363680358.name: A Highlight!!
363680358.author: a TripAdvisor user
363680358.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a tour to Chichen Itza. There are changing rooms outside and then you descend steep slippery steps, so make sure to wear flip flops. Once you get down there, there is a dry area, where you can leave towels etc. This was such a refreshing swim after spending the hot day in Chichen Itza. The kids loved swimming with the catfish and having bats hovering overhead. Don\'t worry, they\'re no where near you. With the stalactites, ropy tree roots hanging down and the opening overhead, where the sun shines through, this is a magical place and made for amazing pictures!! Don\'t miss it.

361249006.name: Cold water on the hot day
361249006.author: a TripAdvisor user
361249006.reviewBody: This came as a perfect cool down. Majestic site, sun coming down through the hole in the ceiling hitting the water, stalactites all around.  Only thing was that at the time it became overcrowded. I recommend going there early before tour groups.

358690248.name: Beautiful...
358690248.author: a TripAdvisor user
358690248.reviewBody: We hopped on the collectivo early in the am and managed to get to this cenote before the tours arrived.  It is beautiful, quiet, you feel like you are in the centre of the earth.  It\'s nice and close to town so if you want a quick cheap cenote experience this is for you.

357962618.name: Refreshing swin in a beautiful cenote, but that\'s it
357962618.author: a TripAdvisor user
357962618.reviewBody:
At the time I went (around 2PM), the Cenote was darker than it looks in the photos; but it's still impressive even though. Water tone is blue/emerald and there are some fish wondering around. 

They have lockers (you have to pay) but they are located in the entrance, somehow far from the Xkeken cenote. But that's what's available... At the entrance they try to sell you a package with buffet lunch, but I preffered to eat in Valladolid. 

If you really want to relax for some time, better to renting a floating vest with the various people on the way to the cenote. It's actually annoying that you have to pass through so many store to get to the cenote, but it's probable the way they make money.

Water is cold but very good to cool down from the melting temperature outside. 

This was the first and only cenote I visited, but if I had visited another one before I don't know if the experience would have been so good. Just pick one that pleases you and go.

357091391.name: Nice swim with view other visitors
357091391.author: a TripAdvisor user
357091391.reviewBody: We were there early at the two cenotes next to each other ( samula and xkeken). You can buy one ticket for both the cenotes which was 90 pesos compared to 60 for either one cenote . We were with only one other couple in samula and wen we went to to xkeken there were maybe 10 people. We did swim in both of them and anjoyed it much. The lighthole in the cieling in samula is biggr than xkeken making them different from each other. We left before the tourbusses came and the got over crouwded. Visit was from 09.00 to 11.00.

356802599.name: Amazing experience!
356802599.author: a TripAdvisor user
356802599.reviewBody: We loved swimming in this cenote as part of our Chichen Itza excursion with YucaTreks. What a beautiful location---very surreal! Just be careful of the stairs; it is dimly lit and the stairs can get quite slick!

355739401.name: Felt so wonderful to cool off and swim around here!  Great Experience!
355739401.author: a TripAdvisor user
355739401.reviewBody: You do have to walk down quite a few wet stairs, so make sure you are able to handle it before you go.  If so, you are set for a fun new adventure to swim in an underground cenote with a most amazing ambiance!

353726753.name: Good place to spend a day
353726753.author: a TripAdvisor user
353726753.reviewBody: There are two cenotes at X\u00b4keken and I enjoyed swimming both. There are a couple places to eat including a buffet with typical Yucatecan food - muy bueno!

353636365.name: Laid back and wonderful
353636365.author: a TripAdvisor user
353636365.reviewBody: Went to this Cenote after spending the afternoon at chichen itza. There were only a handful of folks there besides the tour bus that I was on. I liked the non-crowd. Small snack and drink place--pleasant garden area with places to sit. Short hike on a gravel path and down some very steep rock stairs to the MOST AMAZING cave and pool. Myself, my son, and his 14 year old daughter loved this attraction. However, if you have a disability or health issue that would prevent you from climbing the very steep stairs (up and down) then it is not for you. Also, if you want to swim, there is a mandatory life jacket rental. Not that I disagreed with that policy--just be aware. It wasn\'t expensive, although I don\'t remember exactly how much it was. ( 25 pesos, I Think!?!?)

353351651.name: A pleasant surprise!
353351651.author: a TripAdvisor user
353351651.reviewBody: We had originally planned to visit a cenote close to Chichen Itza, but saw an advertisement for this cenote there.  We decided to give it a try and were very happy with the choice.  The complex actually has two enclosed and top-lighted cenotes -- X\'keken and Samula.  Samula is the lighter of the two, but they are both large and very uncrowded.  In fact, because of its proximity to Valladolid, most of the people there were locals instead of tourists.  Of course, there are all the commercial elements (e.g., lots of shops and vendors), but they weren\'t pushy.  My only disappointment was that they didn\'t rent towels there.  Hence, we had to drip dry.  I would really recommend visiting this little jewel!

353145210.name: Wow, i loved this cenote
353145210.author: a TripAdvisor user
353145210.reviewBody: This place was magical to me. It was like entering a cave to another world. Would recommend this place cause of the beauty. Very relaxing atmosphere. Not alot of people while i was there. They try to sell you a lot of package tours, but you don\'t have to buy. Just pay entrance fee for both cenotes cause there are two. Beautiful place to visit. I loved both cenotes. Both had there own beauty.

353120606.name: Refreshing, cool swim
353120606.author: a TripAdvisor user
353120606.reviewBody: What an amazing experience to swim in this cave.  The water is maybe 10 feet deep with rooks coming up here and there that you can stand on.  There are fish swimming around and stalactites hanging down.  There are changing rooms available as well as lockers.  Sign said no photography, but that didn\'t seem to be enforced. There was no life guard.  Employees take your pic as you enter, than want to sell it to you as you leave.

352864029.name: Beautiful cenote with only small opening on top
352864029.author: a TripAdvisor user
352864029.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cenote and one you can swim in.  There are small lockers near the ticket window for stowing things you don\'t want to take down.  Changing room is in this area as well.  Do wear flip flops or beach shoes with good gripping as the walk down is wet and slippery.\n\nThere is a sign near entrance to cenote that photography is not permitted.  Don\'t know why nor understand why another sign is not more prominent before you get to that point.  Hard to go back to stow camera in vehicle or storage locker.  I guess you could stow a camera in towels you are taking down, but I would never encourage bad behavior.

352761838.name: Definitely go!
352761838.author: a TripAdvisor user
352761838.reviewBody: Beautiful!! We loved it!! It was very easy to get to. The grounds are well-maintained. You will be offered a photo to buy and many other things, which is a little annoying, but minor in comparison to what a great experience it is to visit this cenote!

352494685.name: Nice swim
352494685.author: a TripAdvisor user
352494685.reviewBody: Go early! Take a taxi to be there just as they open and you will be in the cenote alone. Noone to bother you, no vendors, nothing. Just a beatiful cave with clear water to swim.

351700963.name: Cenote plus cave environment
351700963.author: a TripAdvisor user
351700963.reviewBody: This cenote is a very cool experience.  Since it is  mostly closed off from the sun, it is a little dark inside.  Be sure to wear flip-flops or water shoes, because the rock is slippery and jagged.  I cut my foot trying to get in, so be careful!  There are small little "cleaner fish" for your feet and small size catfish so you can snorkel in here if you want (you have to rent snorkel gear first). I\'d go to this cenote wearing your bathing suit.  Even though they do have a changing area, it is up a steep set of stairs (after climbing down stairs to get in there).  Also, there are no lockers or any place to put your things, so don\'t bring things that you don\'t mind getting wet or losing.  The major plus for me is that this cenote doesn\'t seem as touristy as the others, so there are less people visiting it.  They do have lockers outside you can rent and a few life preservers...but I wouldn\'t recommend it for small children or if you are not a strong swimmer.

351089212.name: Average
351089212.author: a TripAdvisor user
351089212.reviewBody: There are lots of cenotes in this area and this was our second. The first, Gran Cenote, was much better for me. \nThe water in this Cenote did not look as clear and inviting.

349943821.name: Cenote Close to Valladolid
349943821.author: a TripAdvisor user
349943821.reviewBody: This centote is easy to get to from Valladolid. I took a combi taxi from the station that is right beside the ADO bus terminal. It was 30p. I had to take a regular taxi back to Valladolid which was 80p. A really nice break from the heat of the day. There are 2 cenotes here. You can pay 60p for one or 90p for both. I went for both. There are lockers for rent and bathrooms to change in. Both of these cenotes have small openings to the sky. The water is very clear with a few catfish. These were not the most beautiful cenotes I have seen but very nice and also convenient to Valladolid.

349577705.name: Good place after Chichen Itza
349577705.author: a TripAdvisor user
349577705.reviewBody: It was hot sunny day when visit Chichen Itza...but it was very nice and cooling as we swim in this cenote and having a foot reflexology by the fishes there!!

348448895.name: exciting
348448895.author: a TripAdvisor user
348448895.reviewBody: This cenote is very special.  I loved be able to take a swim and have all those black fish swim around my legs.  Water was quite warm and clean.

347901957.name: Good detour from chichen itza
347901957.author: a TripAdvisor user
347901957.reviewBody:
This is a semi-park with 2 cenotes and other activities. 
cenotes are big, circular cave like with huge dome and a little windows on cealing.

Went after visiting chichen itza. Now soncrowded as others...

347451929.name: Nice cenote, almost no tourists
347451929.author: a TripAdvisor user
347451929.reviewBody: Very nicely lighted cenote for swimming. We hesitated to visit as it was a little chilly that day, good we still went: Temperatures ok for hot & also for somewhat cooler days! (Almost) no other visitors when we were there around midday.

346742321.name: Beautiful
346742321.author: a TripAdvisor user
346742321.reviewBody: Visited both of the denotes here. Had a beautiful swim, very deep though. Gorgeous place to visit. Loved it.

345366840.name: Amazing
345366840.author: a TripAdvisor user
345366840.reviewBody: So beautiful to believe it\'s real :)\nYou can visit two places there for $90 mxn and is 10 minutes from valladolid.

345253168.name: Great for refreshing
345253168.author: a TripAdvisor user
345253168.reviewBody:
This is a great place to refresh!

You will have a great time swimming in this amazing place.

There are 2 cenote's in this area, you can swim in both of them.

Please be respectful of nature, don't use chemical products and don't touch the rocks.

344445564.name: beautiful site
344445564.author: a TripAdvisor user
344445564.reviewBody: this beautiful and easily accessable cenote is close to valladolid and really worth a visit. the water is cool, so it\u00b4s nice in the heat.

344236614.name: HIDDEN UNDERWATER Caves - A MUST SEE!
344236614.author: a TripAdvisor user
344236614.reviewBody:
After touring Chichen Itza all day, our next stop was to the downtown area of Valladolid to get lunch. The bus pulled over to the side of the road, right outside of the circle center, (maybe only 10 minutes) to a small area that lead right into caves. The walk down to the area was rocky and life vests were available in a small stand.

It was SO beautiful. After going through the cave, the world opened up to a huge natural swimming hole where people were jumping in from the rocks. We did not have the time in our tour to get in but we took pictures galore!

It was SO large, deep and tall the water and the cave top could not fit into my cameras screen. It's like out of a movie. HOT and humid, but worth even swinging by even if you do not get in. The cost to swim is free.

check it out!

344128116.name: Simply amazing
344128116.author: a TripAdvisor user
344128116.reviewBody: For the first time in my life I had a chance to swim in an underground lake. Amazing feeling, especially that it wasn\'t crowded at all. Only the locals trying to sell you everything were annoying, but luckily not very importunate.

343994813.name: Another amazing cenote
343994813.author: a TripAdvisor user
343994813.reviewBody: The one thing we love about this area of Mexico is the cenotes.  Each one is unique and interesting!  The entrance to this cenote is a bit daunting if you have mobility issues but there is a rope to hang onto.  The cenotes are always a highlight for us and this one is definitely worth a visit!

343768208.name: Wonderful Subterranean Experience
343768208.author: a TripAdvisor user
343768208.reviewBody: We came to X\'Ke\'Ken after touring Chichen Itza. It was easy to get there via Collectivo but the walk down the dirt road to the actual entrance is long and hot. A taxi might see you and ask if you want a ride: take it. The entrance fee is 60 pesos, 90 if you want to go to Samal center which is just across the entrance. Lockers and towels are extra. X\'ke\'ken has refreshing clear turquoise water with tiny fish that will nibble your toes. Don\'t worry, the larger black catfish leave you alone. The light streaming through the occult is very beautiful and makes for a magical photo opportunity.

342942674.name: Awesome
342942674.author: a TripAdvisor user
342942674.reviewBody: Beautiful, awe inspiring and very easy to get in and out of with toddler and kindergartner.  Playground onsite for after swimming was nice, although falling apart and kind of dangerous.

342373580.name: Great visit
342373580.author: a TripAdvisor user
342373580.reviewBody: I was gathering research for #5 ADIE STURM MYSTERY and thought the two cenotes were perfect. I didn\'t go for a swim as I was running out of time but the place is lovely, especially if you\'ve never seen cenotes. I have seen others on the road from Playa to Tulum and on the road to Coba. These two (Samula and Dzitnup Xkeken) were magnificent. I need a better camera to take pics in the dim light.

341767657.name: You need to stop here!!! Nature, really close to the road, excellent view and photos!
341767657.author: a TripAdvisor user
341767657.reviewBody: Excellent place, they have a 5-8min walk from the entrance to the Zenote, and you can also rent snorkeling equipment. They have free Parking or whatever you want to give them as a contribution, and the entrance of each Zenote is about 30 pesos mxn. They have two Zenotes.

341488210.name: Refreshing after a Hot day!
341488210.author: a TripAdvisor user
341488210.reviewBody: Stopped by while on a tour with the amazing Yucatreks and  after being in the heat of Chichen Itza, this cenote was right on point. Few steep steps down into the cave, bats overhead, some fish in the fresh water. Perfect temperature for swimming. With the wee crack of light in the ceiling it almost felt like being in the Goonies. There are ropes to hang onto and stand on incase you get tired which I sure did.\nNo sunscreen needed as you are underground. If you do have it on its meant to be \'reef safe\'.

340572749.name: Fun afternoon
340572749.author: a TripAdvisor user
340572749.reviewBody: We swam in the cave with the fish while the bats were flying overhead. We got there early and that was good because 2 busses were unloading as we were leaving. Wear shoes because bottom is rocky.

340532257.name: Xkeken and Samula are located at the Dzitnup park - must visit both!
340532257.author: a TripAdvisor user
340532257.reviewBody: Xkeken and Samula are a couple of the most picture perfect cenotes you will find in the entire area - the natural light comes through the ceiling and you get the perfect light ray coming through into the turquoise / blue water - for those discovering the area - go in direction of the Dzitnup park and this is where you will find these 2 beautiful cenotes one next to each other - very easy and relatively inexpensive visit - go for it!

337007770.name: Great Cenote to cool down and take kids
337007770.author: a TripAdvisor user
337007770.reviewBody: We travelled with a 1 and 3 year old. There is enough place inside the Cenote to put your bags and take a break. There is also place on steps for kids to play around and shallow limestone (uneven) before it goes deep. Its got a great view.\nSome of the reviews have said stairs are slippery, i don\'t agree. Use precaution as you would on any stairs that are wet. There are rails on each side to hold on an the facility and surroudings are in excellent shape. \nAlso, travel books say this closes at 4:30, again not true. We reached at 4:45pm and it was open for atleast an hour after. I believe its open till 6pm (for entrance) in winter, possibly longer in summer.

336807779.name: Impresive
336807779.author: a TripAdvisor user
336807779.reviewBody: This cenote is really impressive is bigger than the other cenote nearby and its just a magical place .

336473652.name: Amazing
336473652.author: a TripAdvisor user
336473652.reviewBody: One of the best cenotes i\'ve ever been. At only 1 km from Valladolid its definitely a MUST if you travel to Yucatan or near Cancun the park entrance costs $90 mxn and includes 2 cenotes (Samul\u00e1 & Xkeken aka Dtzinup) the amazing views among the crystal clear water and freshness are one of a kind. You will invest a couple of hours and then you may keep going until you reach Uxmal ruins.

335849519.name: Too crowded and unmagical
335849519.author: a TripAdvisor user
335849519.reviewBody: Might be a good place to visit on ultra low season. But in December it was full and felt more like a public swimming pool than the cenote experience you might be looking for. Way to many vendors pushing to sell. Water is not as clean as in many other cenotes.

335564888.name: A bit crowded
335564888.author: a TripAdvisor user
335564888.reviewBody:
If you imagine some remote and dessert med Cenotes, this is not the one.

But if you are passing by, so make the stop and see the limestone pools. Even take a dip in the cool water.

A lot of vendors trying to push some cheap souvenirs on you, will quickly make you leave

335336432.name: Stumbled upon town and cenote
335336432.author: a TripAdvisor user
335336432.reviewBody: We were on a day trip to Chichen Itza and decided to take the local road back. So glad we did. We stumbled upon the cenote as we drove around town. It was late December and there were few people around. Probably 30 total in the swimming hole area. Would love to come back and explore town and the region more.

334698402.name: Nice experience
334698402.author: a TripAdvisor user
334698402.reviewBody: We got there later in the day, no light coming though the hole in the roof but was still beautiful and the water temp is perfect. Can bring whatever you need and get changed there. People will rent towels if you need them and even life jackets if you can\'t swim.

331842669.name: Roadtripping Mexico
331842669.author: a TripAdvisor user
331842669.reviewBody: The two cenotes are a good hangover cure. What I did not like is that the guys at the parking lot lied to us about the possibility to jump from a higher spot. It is completely forbidden. For 90$ you can see both, but there are more beautiful ones. It was a little disappointing that there is already so much merchandize around and I would recommend to see others.

330507186.name: Try another cenote
330507186.author: a TripAdvisor user
330507186.reviewBody:
The Bar is small with very few chairs/tables and almost nothing to offer 
The restaurant works on a buffet basis small
Selection of food 
Their coffee is soooo bad 

Crowded 
Not the cleanest place in the world 

I would try another cenote as there are so many to have some fun

328461494.name: Beautiful!
328461494.author: a TripAdvisor user
328461494.reviewBody: A trip to this cenote is a must for anyone staying in Valladolid. It costs 20 pesos to get there in a shared taxi and the ticket price to see both cenotes on the site was 90 pesos. Both were beautiful and well worth a visit. You can also swim in both.

328108279.name: Amazing do not miss
328108279.author: a TripAdvisor user
328108279.reviewBody: Awesome place with great activities for all...do not miss.they charge you around $65usd for pics loaded in USB to take home..you can also buy some local artifacts here.

326972511.name: Beautiful cenotes in a rundown area
326972511.author: a TripAdvisor user
326972511.reviewBody: Amazing cenotes - went to both xkenken and Samula (right next to each other) 90 pesos for both. However, beware area prior to cenotes opening (before and after ticket booth) littered with sellers and local people trying to sell guides / photos. Also no signs once inside.Did take away from the charm of the place- an amazing natural experience inside.

325812720.name: Dark and peaceful
325812720.author: a TripAdvisor user
325812720.reviewBody: This cenote has a smaller opening so tends to be darker and water a little colder. However, when you come in there is a sense of peace. Also, there are bats and they will hang just over your head as long as you do not scare them.

324880531.name: Good, but Saamal at Selva Maya is better
324880531.author: a TripAdvisor user
324880531.reviewBody: Very good cenote, although the rest of the park premises seemed a little shabby. Saamal Cenote (aka Selva Maya Hacienda), which is the first cenote off the main road is better than these two, and the grounds are more classy and clean. No lockers or free life jackets here, which sucks.

324770860.name: Cool place with great shooping
324770860.author: a TripAdvisor user
324770860.reviewBody: The cenote is cool and you will see many pictures of it. There is the option to pay for 2 or 1, 90 or 60 pesos. You can swim in them, both are pretty similar now, since the ones in Samula doesn\'t reach the bottom.\n\nThe important thing here is the shopping options if you want to buy a Guayabera or Huipil  (the typical dress) they make them around and they are cheaper than you will find for a Guayabera in Valladolid. They have some other handcrafts, so don\'t run to the cenote only and walk around and see the stalls, the owner let\'s them have the stalls without rent so it\'s mostly a fair trade scene, which is not common outside a turistic place. So the TL;DR is buy here, they have good bargains

324013839.name: Beautiful cenote!
324013839.author: a TripAdvisor user
324013839.reviewBody: It was quite the experience! 60 pesos per adult, or you can visit two cenotes (Sumala and Xkeken) for 90 pesos. They are different. Sumala is breathtaking, and Xkeken is almost completely closed except for a small opening, and you can observe bat colonies (don\'t worry, the water is still clean!). We went on October 31st, and it wasn\'t as crowded as expected. Yes, the place is setup in a way that you HAVE to walk through several stalls of stuff for sale, but the visit is worth it!

323310718.name: Bike the cenotes
323310718.author: a TripAdvisor user
323310718.reviewBody: We rented bikes in Valladolid and biked to the cenote from the Zocalo - 9km. Find Calle 41 and go southwest and you will reach a nice plaza with a castle like church, find Calle 49 and follow west until the highway 180, turn left - there is a nice bike path on the left side of the road (sw). Go straight on a huge crossraod and turn left in 500m, there is a sign for Cenote. In 2 km tou will reach a tourist center for two cenotes 60 MXN for one 90 MXN for two. We went just for Xkeken. Great place to cool down after the bike trip :)

322792161.name: Good cenote slightly marred by money making
322792161.author: a TripAdvisor user
322792161.reviewBody:
Visited here after chichen itza to cool down and both cenotes were beautiful however I didn't appreciate the constant pestering from the stalls to look, see, but, give me best price on everything. 
It seems the whole attraction is set up to steer you through the maze of traders before you get to the cenote which is a shame as they are amazing.
You can also get a free pedicure from the fish (I think garra rufa) that nibble at your feet to eat away the dead skin. 
If going definitely do both as they are very different and if you are a weak swimmer or struggle in cooler water get a life jacket they are only 10pesos.

317202638.name: Magic
317202638.author: a TripAdvisor user
317202638.reviewBody: Cool and refreshing. Large rope goes across the center for non-swimmers. Have to be careful on the rocks getting into the cenote.\nMore suited for older children and adults.

316680449.name: One word, WOW
316680449.author: a TripAdvisor user
316680449.reviewBody: It is so hard to explain the amazing experience we had at this cenote, it is truly amazing to have such a place to visit.  Please, please plan your vacation and go if you are ever near the area.

312972267.name: one of 7000
312972267.author: a TripAdvisor user
312972267.reviewBody: This is so refreshing beautiful place to cool down one of 7000 cenotes  in and around this region water is clear and cool after along day at Chichen Itza you go swim in this incredible cenote does not disappoint ! 60 peso to get in stay as long as you want kids to adults can enjoy ! people with limitations are not recommended due to the fact hard to access  by stairs and a liile hard to get into water but all in all wonderful a must see and do if you are in this area !!

311393286.name: FEMALES BEWARE!!!!!!!
311393286.author: a TripAdvisor user
311393286.reviewBody: While the cenote is pretty cool my experience was ruined when I caught one of the male staff members on his knees in the female toilet trying to watch me get unchanged. As you can imagine I was horrified and was quick to chase him down after he bolted when I spotted his hand on the ground outside the door. He was hiding in the back room behind where you pay and when he finally came back out he acted like he had no idea who I was or what I was talking about. I gave him a crash course in colorful English words and left feeling disguted.

311002239.name: Beautiful underground cenote!
311002239.author: a TripAdvisor user
311002239.reviewBody: We came here after a visit to Chichen Itza. What a perfect thing to do! You pay for either one or two cenotes and a "guide". The first cenote is deep underground. The water is cool and refreshing, and its quite deep. You can look up and see the bats flying around. Our guide then disappeared so we followed another to the second cenote...equally as beautiful and less crowded than the first. Neither cenote is overly crowded though. Bring deet free bug spray, towels, good water/hiking sandals and water to drink. Don\'t really need to bother with sunblock since both are under ground. The hiking down into the cenotes can be slippery so not a good idea for people who are not secure on their feet.

308356513.name: Unbelievable rock formation.
308356513.author: a TripAdvisor user
308356513.reviewBody: The good thing is that is not very crowded, the entrance is a little bit difficult with young children and of course is hot and humid inside, the water is so refreshing and clear I recommend to go between 12 pm or 3pm because the light is so beautiful after that ( I sadly took my pics after 5 pm)  the cenote got a little darker. the vendors outside are very rude so be prepare. \n**Another thing water shoes saved my life because is very slippery.

306003392.name: Refreshing and stunning
306003392.author: a TripAdvisor user
306003392.reviewBody: If you are close to valladolid, do not miss the opportunity to visit this cenote. You will have to go down thru cement steps, until you reach the cave. There is a lot of humidity but the beauty of this cenote make it worth. Visit close to mid day, so you can see the light coming thru a hole in the ceiling. The water is very refreshing and the rock formations stunning. There is another cenote in front of this one, that is also amazing. Take the time and visit that too. Just be aware that you will have to pay another fee for the entrance. There are bathrooms and dressing rooms.

305965859.name: Cenote Xkeken near Valladolid
305965859.author: a TripAdvisor user
305965859.reviewBody: Beautiful cenote. We visited it early in the morning, we were the first in. It was beautiful. Later one the sun peeps in into the centre of the cenote, but also more people come.\n\nAmong the 5 cenotes we visted in Mexico (with a swim in each), it ranks second after the Great Cenote in Tulum

301820333.name: Stunning ecosystem to see
301820333.author: a TripAdvisor user
301820333.reviewBody: The cenote is an entire ecosystem with bats in the cave, fish in the underwater lake and cave formations. The light pouring from a hole in the cave ceiling gives it a mysterious, ancient feel. The Cenote had a lovely garden but visitors were not encouraged to stay but rather diverted to the shopping facilities.

300737543.name: Good cenote - less touristy than sum.  Visit in the morning.
300737543.author: a TripAdvisor user
300737543.reviewBody: We visited this cenote in the morning when it was not very crowded and there were very few aggressive vendors.  This cenote was really neat because it was like swimming in a bat cave.  Lots of bats flying around the ceiling, which is fairly high.  The opening in the ceiling for light is fairly small so it is dark inside.  I enjoyed it, but I didn\u2019t want to hang out in this cenote long.  Kind of a creepy feel.  We ate lunch at one of the mayan food stations (under a tarp) outside this cenote and it was REALLY good authentic mayan food.  I highly recommend stopping there for a small meal if you are not on a timetable.

298561973.name: The "Hog" Cenote
298561973.author: a TripAdvisor user
298561973.reviewBody: Another great example of the magnificent Cenotes of the Yucatan peninsula, wide cavern with a small hole in the ceiling, big enough to have 100 people inside, the local guides are very friendly, water was clean and refreshing, not to easy to get there but worth the trip.

298267562.name: An amazing natural attraction
298267562.author: a TripAdvisor user
298267562.reviewBody: I have been coming here since 1992.  Yes it has changed over the years in terms of now there are paved roads, formal parking... but take look at the cenote and cave for what it is an incredible thing of beauty, an awe-inspiring geological formation and just friggin\' cool.

294420481.name: Beautiful but commercial and overcrowded
294420481.author: a TripAdvisor user
294420481.reviewBody:
We visited this denote in the afternoon. After paying our entrance fee, we tried to find our way to the denote. It is very poorly sign-posted, leading you through a market of stalls selling all the same clothes. Eventually we found our way out of the market through a side entrance and followed the path, passed a café bar when we saw some steps. We went down and there was a kiosk to collect tickets. We asked about changing facilities, but had passed the changing rooms a way back, again with no signs. After finally changing and getting ready, we descended a steep, slippery staircase. (When we were on our way out, a man fell down on his way in, don't think he hurt himself too badly as he walked away, but my guess he was badly bruised).
The cave is beautiful and the connote breath-taking with the stalactites. There are no lockers, but people just left their belongings at the side.
It is quite hard to get into the denote, there being no proper steps, and even harder to get out, although there are ropes to pull yourself up on. What then made it harder still was the amount of families sitting on the rocks in the water, totally blocking the way in and out.
It was very busy, and obviously a popular place to go for the locals, but I would suggest that other denotes are better.

291879754.name: Disappointed
291879754.author: a TripAdvisor user
291879754.reviewBody: I was expecting something different.  More natural.   The Cenote is beautiful... But is a public pool.   This was one of the main reasons I took this trip.  The water looks dirty... Maybe is just my impression.  If you are looking something not that crowded and natural... This is Not the place.  So sad.

291422817.name: Beautiful
291422817.author: a TripAdvisor user
291422817.reviewBody:
I cycled here in the afternoon from Vallodolid and found it to be quite crowded - Mainly with locals as opposed to tourists.
It’s an amazing spectacle. Unlike most cenotes, this one still has its roof, bar the small opening at the top which beams down a strong ray of light and electrifies the tranquil crystal clear waters below. This in turn reflects upon the stalagmites making up the walls of the hidden arena. 

The hole is deep but has a couple of ropes spanning its length for safety. Whilst it was busy, there was still plenty of room. The hall is humid and sticky but the waters are cold and refreshing.

My only criticism is that the outside of the cenote has become very commercialised. Yes, some of the paths have been concreted over for ease of access, but the tourist shops and stalls need not be there. I looked, but soon realised it wasn’t local trade but instead resembled the same old mass produced tat from other tourist zones.

291084191.name: Incredible
291084191.author: a TripAdvisor user
291084191.reviewBody: My first Cenote and one of the most beautiful things i have seen, the water is so clear and refreshing especially when its just so hot in Mexico.

288037244.name: Excellent Cenote, not that busy.. so all just gor us...
288037244.author: a TripAdvisor user
288037244.reviewBody: Great place, there was almost no visitors compared to other cenotes which was excellent, not too big but just perfect, a small opening allowing not too much and not too lottle light, very, very nice...

286464837.name: Beautiful Cenote But Too Commercialized
286464837.author: a TripAdvisor user
286464837.reviewBody:
Cenote Xkeken was physically beautiful. It is completely underground with a small opening at the top where the sunlight shines down to the water. There are stalactites hanging from the rock ceiling, bats flying around and black catfish swimming in the water. It costs 65 pesos to enter. There are no lockers but you can leave your things on the side of the cenote. I went in the afternoon with friends and it was more crowded than I was expecting, with tourists and children. 

What I didn't like about the cenote, was that it was too commercialized for my liking. I prefer more off the beaten path cenotes and that is not what this is. The setting surrounding the cenote area is not natural or treed, but instead is concrete everywhere. It is very confusing to find the entrance to the cenote initially, as you are forced to walk through a circular maze of vendor booths selling overpriced touristy souvenirs before you get to the cenote. The entrance to the cenote after walking through this market-like area is not marked at all (zero signage anywhere at this cenote telling you where to go) and you basically have to walk around aimlessly and try walking down different paths until you find it. 

I would recommend visiting this cenote for a one-time visit only, because the cenote itself is beautiful (and it would probably be less crowded first thing in the morning), however, I would not return for a second visit.

273319080.name: Breathtaking and Relaxing
273319080.author: a TripAdvisor user
273319080.reviewBody: I followed the advice of many a guide and got there at the opening time (830am and not as I had been told 8am) and had the entire place to myself. The colour of the water with the light shining through is gorgeous, especially with the stalactites hovering over it. I say I had the place to myself but the water is filled with catfish and the bats are constantly flying above your head.\nWell worth hiring a bike for the exercise to get here and the reward at the end.

271684880.name: Is this a Cenote, or a public pool / craft fair?
271684880.author: a TripAdvisor user
271684880.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful cenote without a doubt, but it feels like kind of a rip-off having to pay to swim in what has essentially been turned into a public pool, where visitors are funneled through a series of craft fair booths to access... and what's with the vendors not taking a polite no for an answer? Just because we're forced to walk past your sales booths, doesn't obligate us to buy any of your over-priced, over-distributed, mass produced, well, uh, junk.

Some other cenotes require visitors to rinse off before entering, but this one doesn't, so the surface of the water is slick with sunscreen, lotions, etc., and one has to wonder what that is doing to the natural environment... well not really, because it's more algae-green, than crystal clear blue, which it probably only looks when being illuminated below, and photographed under just the right conditions... this one could be majestic if they cleaned it up and began taking care of it.

And would it be so bad if there were a few trees left in the parking area to provide some shade? It's like "come visit the cenote, uh, we mean public pool, that we surrounded with concrete and a craft fair".

266718102.name: The most beautiful cenote!
266718102.author: a TripAdvisor user
266718102.reviewBody: The cave has a wonderful underground lake. There is a hole in the roof through which light enters and hits the water, which is with a gorgeous shade of blue. There are stalactites coming down from the ceiling, including one that has the shape of a mushroom. Delicious bath on a hot day. 65 pesos, cheaper than other cenotes

266446594.name: Amazing & nearby natural attraction
266446594.author: a TripAdvisor user
266446594.reviewBody: I rented a bike for 15 pesos per hour from my Candelaria hostel and rode for about 25 minutes to get to it. Once there you pay 65 pesos to get in and jump right in the water once you walk down a tight staircase.\n\nThere are fishes, a couple of mosquitos and lots of bats at the top (they never come down and control the insect population). Around 11am the sun comes in strong and the views are best, however earlier on, it has less people. Highly recommended!

263509942.name: Great cave cenote experience
263509942.author: a TripAdvisor user
263509942.reviewBody: This was part of a stop on a tour with Jerry Ham to Chichen Itza.  Very refreshing, intriguing and mysterious.  I would highly recommend this natural wonder.

261339832.name: Way built up, but pretty
261339832.author: a TripAdvisor user
261339832.reviewBody: I was here 10 years ago, it was not very well visited then.  It was bittersweet to see that so many people had discovered it.  Nice for the locals to have the traffic and income I\'m sure.  \nThere is a oddly large marketplace built in front of the entrance so that you have to walk by hawkers\' stalls.  Slightly lame, but the cave is as pretty as ever!  Bring you snorkels, and as with all cenotes & ruins..the earlier you go, the less people are there.

259208351.name: 2nd cenote in our trip
259208351.author: a TripAdvisor user
259208351.reviewBody: Cenote in a cavern , very beautiful , only a little hole in the roof , very impressive stalagmites .

258210487.name: Pretty underground swimming pool
258210487.author: a TripAdvisor user
258210487.reviewBody: After we rode on our bikes the back way, via calle 54 and the town rubbish dump, to the cenote, we negotiated the twisting path through all the vendors to the top of the steps down to the water. (We found on the way out that you could go directly to the parking unhindered! ). The steps down were steep but fairly save. The Cave was delightful, lovely rock formations, pretty blue lake with a shaft of sunlight playing on the surface. The water was clear and refreshing. But, because you\'re underground, it\'s cool and damp. Not an attraction you can stay too long at. Surface cenotes allow you to warm up, dry off, and take another dip if you so wish.

255843512.name: Dip in cool water in a grotto
255843512.author: a TripAdvisor user
255843512.reviewBody: Like a cave, with a small hole in the ceiling that let in light.  Well worth it, and very close to Valladolid on the "free road" to Merida.

254392700.name: Worth the bike ride
254392700.author: a TripAdvisor user
254392700.reviewBody: We biked to Xkeken from Valladolid. We decided to only visit the one cenote and were not disappointed. The water was cool and clear with black catfish? and bats whirling and squeaking overhead. True a few your groups came through but they don\'t stay long. It wasn\'t overrun with tourists we found.

253589262.name: A surreal experience. The most refreshing dip I\'ve ever had.
253589262.author: a TripAdvisor user
253589262.reviewBody:
Tour buses and hoards of people aside, I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed swimming in this cenote. It's very cool to be able to be floating under the one hole providing sunlight in the cave. There are ropes in the water to help those who aren't strong swimmers. The natural lighting was amazing and I can only imagine what this place would be like a hundred years ago or more. 

After touring ruins and being in the hot sun all day, I did not mind the other people. It wasn't bad actually, it was fun to see so many people from all over the world gathering in a cool spot and enjoying themselves. Don't bring valuables inside, there is nowhere to hide them. Gotta say, it was the most refreshing water, so cool and because it's an underground river technically, the water was pretty fresh as well. It felt perfect on the skin and I am so glad I got to experience this. 

It's for sure worth a stop, in my opinion. The water is amazingly clean and refreshing, and the temp is perfect for cooling off.

252213697.name: Natural Beauty Compromised by Development & Commercialism / GPS
252213697.author: a TripAdvisor user
252213697.reviewBody:
I would give this Cenote (and the neighbouring Cenote) mixed reviews.  Whether you visit these Cenotes really depends on what you are looking for.  These Cenotes are quite developed and commercialized and have become popular with the tour buses, hence the natural beauty and tranquility of the Cenotes have been somewhat hindered.
