Our guides were the owner's daughter and nephew.  They explained how the family had purchased the land and had spent the previous 7 years getting it ready for visitors.  We were given a tour, which included Mayan legends.  This really enhanced our visit.  The cave/cenote are enormous and beautifully lit.  It feels very magical down there.   After a walk around, you are given an opportunity to swim or kayak in the cenote.   

We also purchased the dinner package which included delicious Yucatecan specialties.  

We had a wonderful evening with this special family.

I highly recommend a visit.

540514447.name: Amazing!
540514447.author: a TripAdvisor user
540514447.reviewBody: Top clear a few questions first.\nThere is an English and Spanish speaking guid. Since the cenote is in a cave it does not matter if it is dark outside. We went there at night because we thought that will be even better for the atmosphere but it does not matter :)\nThe cenote was shown to us with a special story and is probably the most beautiful of all we have seen. The owners and the guides are presenting it in a fantastic and lovely way. In the end of the tour everyone has the possibility to enjoy the water in that fantastic atmosphere. Highly recommended.

535246008.name: Hard to find, worth the trip.
535246008.author: a TripAdvisor user
535246008.reviewBody: We were given the tip at a restaurant in Valladolid that this was a place not to miss.  Finding it was a bit or a challenge, the sign on the left side of the road is a bit hard to see and the GPS is aiming for a spot three miles past the site.  \nThe tour is fantastic, the swim in the cenote is fabulous with fish and bats.  We enjoyed a dinner with the family after our tour and the food was outstanding.  Some of the best we\'ve ever had and beautifully presented.  If you do nothing else in the Valladolid area, do this.

517240125.name: Best Cenote in Yucatan
517240125.author: a TripAdvisor user
517240125.reviewBody: This Cenote is just amazing. We booked the tour with Aquamaya in Valladolid and had a awesome guide. We was there alone and enjoyed a interesting tour trough the Cenote with a Mayalegend and a shaman. This was one of the best things we done  on our 10 months worldtrip. \nDo it with the Mayadinner after the tour.\nThe tell us you can also have a romantic dinner in the Cenote, i think it would be really worth it.

507235348.name: This is the BEST CENOTE EXPERIENCE in the YUCATAN
507235348.author: a TripAdvisor user

506616994.name: A MUST IN VALLADOLID
506616994.author: a TripAdvisor user
506616994.reviewBody: Zazil Tunich is UNREAL, you will never see anything like this. The cave is absolutely stunning, with stalactites and stalacmites EVERYWHERE that have been there for thousands of years, all natural no man has set hand there. The cenote is beautiful but hats off to the cave wherever you look, you turn there is something to admire. From the moment you walk in, you feel a great vibe and just so peaceful. The whole mayan underworld experience that Armando the owner and his family offer is magical. It is a hidden jewel that everyone should go check it out, make sure you make reservations before getting there and ask for the full package, it is not easy to find, better to have someone drive you there, and you do not want to miss on the food they offer at the end of the journey, you get to make your own traditional hand made mayan tortillas and have a yucatecan meal. SOOOOO WORTH IT!

503722809.name: Dont miss this experience!
503722809.author: a TripAdvisor user
503722809.reviewBody: Although it is off the beaten path a bit, it is easy to get to and is not that far from Valladolid.  The owner Armando was very welcoming and with his teenage daughter as a translator (she speaks very good English), told a great story of Mayan mythology as they walked us down through the Cenote.  The geological structures are fantastic and has the largest Stalactite in the Yucatan.  After being immersed in a great cultural experience (and a little fun along the way-offering the mayan beso to appease the gods) we got down to the water which is lit perfectly to enjoy the magic and romance of the place without seeming creepy.  My wife and family of 4 (2 teenage girls, and 2 boys under 12) loved every minute of it.  They even had a kayak to use if you wanted to explore the water without getting wet (it was hot though and we wanted to swim.  Absolutely worth taking the time to visit, the owners are a humble, but knowledgeable family who have done an amazing job of keeping the ancient culture alive while protecting a beautiful natural geological treasure.

503682742.name: Mi cueva es su cueva!
503682742.author: a TripAdvisor user
503682742.reviewBody: My wife and I arrived on a Monday night at sunset for a cave tour and dinner. We got so much more! We were lucky to get a private tour, as the other person was a no show. Armando and his daughter met us and walked us through the beautful stone paved path through a garden of trees and hammocks. The cave was breathtakingly beautiful and the stalagmites and stalactites were equally impressive. The thing that made this cave more special was the legends of the Maya that were told to us as we decended into the cave. Once at the tourquise, dimly-lit spring, they gave us all the time we wished for to spend alone, only to lead us to a traditional Mayan house where we had tortilla lessons (we were terrible at making them) and homecooked Mayan dishes and drinks. Strange to say they made us feel like home in a cave, but they did. The hospitality and warmth made it feel like we were visiting family. Strongly recommended and undescribably unique.

503215890.name: One of the best things about our trip!
503215890.author: a TripAdvisor user
503215890.reviewBody: My husband and I visited Zazil Tunich with a friend. The three of us had an amazing time! The owner and his daughter were wonderful entertaining hosts and the cave and cenote are breathtaking! We have been to other cenotes before and they do not compare to this one! The cave itself is amazing, the legend surrounding the cave and the pool itself was informative and very entertaining. We were there in July and it was super hot outside so being able to go down into the cool cave and swim in the pool while listening to bats and birds fly around was a great way to cool off and relax for a bit. Thanks for an amazing visit!

499641120.name: Marvelous sorprise
499641120.author: a TripAdvisor user
499641120.reviewBody: What an incredible place, we were not expecting all that beauty, the tour with the place owner made the difference, he explained every detail of the cavern and Mayan history. Totally worth it, do not miss it

496952817.name: Gorgeous cenote and amazing owners!!!
496952817.author: a TripAdvisor user
496952817.reviewBody: Zazil Tunich is stunning and definitely worth a visit, with amazing stone formations and clear water. Owners are very friendly, helpful (we got lost on the way and they found us so worth emphasizing :)) and passionate about sharing Mayan culture. Great alternative for more crowded places.\n\nOnce again, thank you for great time!!!

489204076.name: Really a Magic Place!
489204076.author: a TripAdvisor user
489204076.reviewBody: We had fantastic evening in Zazil Tunich, especially as there were only the two of us this day. The owner ist very nice guy and gives you the mayan spirit when you visit the place. This Cenote was one of the most beautiful ones we saw in Yucat\u00e1n! Definitely a recommendation!

485122719.name: A photographer\'s dream!
485122719.author: a TripAdvisor user
485122719.reviewBody: This is a truly one-of-a-kind cenote! The second you walk in the place just takes your breath away. Stalactites and stalagmites hang from the ceiling, giving the cenote that cave-feeling every explorer craves. The water is lit perfectly, and the tour was the perfect length with a swimming break included! If you\'re coming to Valladolid, don\'t miss this place!

484780790.name: Great views, swimming, and tour guides
484780790.author: a TripAdvisor user
484780790.reviewBody: From the moment we arrived at Cenote Zazil Tunich we were warmly welcomed by the owners, who proceeded to be informative, entertaining, awesome tour guides for our group of college students. Definitely the coolest cenote I\'ve been to during my two weeks in Valladolid thus far. If you can, go at night time for an added mystical effect. I am definitely trying to go back before I leave!

484771209.name: A unique cultural experience
484771209.author: a TripAdvisor user
484771209.reviewBody: Most cenotes you will visit require a small entrance fee and then they permit you to enjoy the refreshing water, the awesome rock formations, etc.  This cenote however is unlike any other, in that in addition to all of the things you\'d fine at a normal cenote, Zazil Tunich provides visitors a cultural and historical background of the area.  No other cenote I\'ve visited is anything like it and the information you will learn during your visit will help you to place cenotes into the context of their mayan importance and significance.  I HIGHLY recommend visiting it, especially for the night tour because you go in when it\'s light out and you leave with the stars above you which connects so well to the story of the cenote itself.

484371502.name: More than a cenote, an experience
484371502.author: a TripAdvisor user
484371502.reviewBody: This cenote is the best that I have seen. It is clean, unique and comes with a lot of history. It truly has a unique ambiance. It is a great place to swim and relax, but it also an unforgettable sight and walk around the entirety of the cenote. It is a great place for those that want to see a fascinating cave. There is a shallow area of the cenote too so that those who cannot swim well can still enjoy the refreshing water. \n\nEste lugar es limpio, bonita y el mejor cenote que he visto. Muy divertida.

484219511.name: Truly One-of-a-Kind Experience
484219511.author: a TripAdvisor user
484219511.reviewBody: The cenote itself is simply beautiful for swimming and relaxing, especially at night. The people working there do a good job of explaining the history of the cite in a way that deepens your appreciation rather than bores you. All in all a very eye-opening, picturesque place that I would recommend to anyone.

477832321.name: The best cultural experience on the peninsula .
477832321.author: a TripAdvisor user
477832321.reviewBody:
As a well travelled family we are weary of tour operators selling places to us .
We needed after many weeks of making our own entertainment for us and kids , to leave it in the hands of a tour guide.
The cenote is very close to Valladolid and is the most exclusive and yet reasonably priced place in the  Yucatan we feel .
The water is clear and clean and not as busy or packed as others.
The people who own the cenote are living on the property and are very knowledgeable about the area and the Mayan culture and food .
We were given an explanation and permission to go and swim ,ask questions and  all in the most friendly and informative way by the owner and his family.
With limited Spanish we got so much from the educational into the Mayan story and life in the area , both pre and post colonial times .
Afterwards we were treated to the most amazing local food ,drink and deserts !
The owner armando and his wife Maria wonderful people and wish them the best in keeping it an exclusive place for people who are genuinely interested in the experience and not the entertainment water park style .

467922405.name: Unique experience!
467922405.author: a TripAdvisor user
467922405.reviewBody: A unique and powerful energy can be felt in this place. With much love put into it by its owners, Zazil Tunich is a project striving for sustainability with the Mayan local communities. Dont miss it! | Lugar m\u00e1gico lleno de energia \u00fanica!

676214049.name: BEAUTIFUL CENOTE
676214049.author: a TripAdvisor user
676214049.reviewBody: Beautiful Cenote that you should definitely visit if you are nearby. Go early in the morning and you will get the place to yourself and you can enjoy a swim in the water

670963183.name: The colors are unreal
670963183.author: a TripAdvisor user
670963183.reviewBody: Very beautiful and authentic Cenote. \n\nIt is best to go there during the week and early to avoid tourists.

663340425.name: Impressive--but not the cenote for this family
663340425.author: a TripAdvisor user
663340425.reviewBody: You need to arrive to this place ready to say "no, gracias" about a thousand times. From the moment the car door opened, there were folks asking us if we wanted a guide (What do the guides do here? You do not need one), wanted our car protected, etc. etc. We just kept on walking, bought tickets for both cenotes, and then bypassed the touristy photo op. Then we meandered through a maze of shops and buildings to find the cenote entrance. Once there--it was peaceful--but our son prefers the cenotes where he can jump in, there are rope swings, etc. I prefer swimming in the more open air ones as well. Both of the ones on this site are for swimming around and for admiring the rock formations and beauty. Another reviewer mentioned that it really depends on what you\'re looking for in a cenote experience whether or not you\'ll appreciate this one. It\'s indeed impressive---The light coming in IS magical, and it\'s a very pretty place, but it wasn\'t a favorite of our trip, and the non-stop requests on the way to the cenote entrance were over the top.

660836151.name: Unique experience
660836151.author: a TripAdvisor user
660836151.reviewBody: Got to visit the Cenote. Very unique experience and excellent  tour. I\'ve never been to a Cenote before. This was a truly enlightening experience.

659140269.name: The view is just magical
659140269.author: a TripAdvisor user
659140269.reviewBody: The afternoon sunlight shining into the cenote opening into the water is just surreal, the water is a bit on the cool side which made it perfect for the hot afternoon. Not too crowded either, and you can just leave stuff on the side of the cave.

658635260.name: A visit to cenotes Xkeken and Samula
658635260.author: a TripAdvisor user
658635260.reviewBody:
We came here as part of our Chichen Itza tour with Absolute Adventures. The shady area with lots of trees and the beautiful cool water cenotes were just what we needed after a hot morning visiting the ruins.

When we arrived, my mum became quite entranced by one of the two macaw parrots there, and was offered to take photos with them for a small fee. The birds looked well cared for so we decided to take them up on the offer and the guy at the desk emailed them all to me as well as printing a few.  

We first went to cenote Xkeken which was my personal favourite of the two. The water was so clear that you could see the bottom straight away, and a beautiful shade of blue. The sun streaming in from above hit the water in just the right way to give it a lovely natural atmosphere. There were a few people in there, but it didn't feel crowded. Look out for tiny fish swimming around you, and bats flying above. 

Next we went for a short walk with our guide to cenote Samula. This one was slightly darker, but just as clear and blue. Both cenotes seemed cold when we got in, but this was likely because our skin was hot from the morning at the ruins. We enjoyed both cenotes and stayed for a little while until we decided it was time to leave for lunch.

In all, this was a wonderful stop to our day and had been recommended by our guide as an alternative to the busy Il Kil. I've not been there so I can't comment on that, but we loved how quiet this place was and that we could relax and cool down a bit before going on with the rest of our day.

656188626.name: Beautiful cenotes
656188626.author: a TripAdvisor user
656188626.reviewBody: We came ona Tuesday afternoon and there were only about 10 people in one cenote and 6 in the other. No tour buses or crowds. the water is crystal clear and warm.  They have ropes in each cenotes so no need to rent a life vest if you are a poor swimmer.\n\nIt is difficult to find if you are driving as there are no signs from the roads and the google maps directs you to a remote ranch.

655218506.name: what a treat!
655218506.author: a TripAdvisor user
655218506.reviewBody: water was 71 degrees, ver yrefreshing, We enjoyed having one of the guides take our pics while we swam.

654670699.name: Beautiful cenote
654670699.author: a TripAdvisor user
654670699.reviewBody: We have gone there via collectivo from Valladolid early in the morning so we had around 45 minutes before anyone else showed up and that time was otherworldly...you are alone just with bats over you and fish under you in the crystal clear waters. This cenote is much more closed than the other one in this complex but absolutely beautiful and well worth the price. The only thing that I was really annoyed by were the "scammers" that wait for you when you exit the collectivo and there is absolutely no way to get rid of them he was asking 50$ as a guide for 1 cenote or 100 for two...we have tried to get rid of him but to no avail...staff there had even seen us trying and did nothing...

651938959.name: Very pretty when not crowded
651938959.author: a TripAdvisor user
651938959.reviewBody: Amazing rays of light come in, very impressive.... sometimes the crowds take away but if you come near closing time or opening, you should miss most crowds~

651104880.name: Awe-inspiring beauty
651104880.author: a TripAdvisor user
651104880.reviewBody: You can visit two cenotes at this location but this was the best experience - so beautiful! We arrived early and there were only 8 other people there; we all swam around quietly so it was a very peaceful and relaxing experience. (We arrived at 9 a.m. on a Saturday morning, so there were no tour buses yet.) Be warned that the steps down to the cenote are quite steep and slippery, so you might have problems accessing it if you have any mobility issues; you should also bring water shoes if you have them. But there are ropes criss-crossing the water, so even if you can\'t swim, I imagine that you could easily pull yourself around. It was easy to reach via collectivo from Valladolid.

648372365.name: otherworldly beautiful cenote
648372365.author: a TripAdvisor user
648372365.reviewBody:
A highlight of our trip to the Yucatan.  Absolutely gorgeous, dark cenote with shimmering light from a hole in the cave ceiling above.  It's true, if you dangle your feet in the water, the little fish will nibble the dead skin off them!  (It's not scary -- it just tickles.)

Samula is across the road from Cenote X'Keken and shares a parking lot with it.  Definitely check out both while you're there -- Samula is prettier, and it's easier to get into the water, but X'Keken's dark atmosphere, stalactites and dangling tree roots are cool.  The food options, which are few, are on the X'Keken side. Bring towels.

Tips: 1) Ignore the aggressive young men between the parking lot and the entrance (other than a "no, gracias").  You don't need a guide to go swimming, and you don't need to tip them -- parking is free.  2) No need to engage with the vendors between the entrance and the cenote (again, other than a "no, gracias").  Their towels are raggedy and overpriced -- bring your own or just let the air dry you.  You can also walk around the tourist plaza to the cenote on trails through the trees.  3) No sunscreen allowed in the cenote, but you won't need it because there's only a little spot of sunlight in the cave.

647966738.name: One of the nicer cenotes to visit
647966738.author: a TripAdvisor user
647966738.reviewBody: This cenote was recommended in some literature and did not disappoint.  Reasonably priced entry and near rte between Merida and Chichen Itza

646304702.name: Great but crowded
646304702.author: a TripAdvisor user
646304702.reviewBody:
If you visit a cenote and you see a tourbus than the cenote is popular.

Great open cenote with a made waterfall.
Area to jump high in the water.

Lockers, showers, toilet and dressingrooms upstairs.

Before you visit you have to go thru some shopping area.

638882024.name: Neat place and the fish clean your feet!
638882024.author: a TripAdvisor user
638882024.reviewBody: This is part of the Dzitnup park that has two cenotes Samula and Xkeken. Both are very beautiful cenotes, but this one is not as cold as the other one because it gets more sunlight.  The park is very touristy and you\'re better off eating elsewhere.  Loved having the fish nibble at my feet while sitting on the edge.

636528935.name: Lovely cenotes, annoying brats
636528935.author: a TripAdvisor user
636528935.reviewBody: The two cenotes are extremely nice, special and a little "dark" :) Plus there were not a lot of people. But those extremely impertinent youngsters trying to get money from you were just disgusting. Wonderfulf place, but our impression was depreciated by the annoying guys in entrance area.

632059019.name: Beautiful
632059019.author: a TripAdvisor user
632059019.reviewBody: This is right by Xkeken, the same complex. Beautiful cenotes, the complex it is part of is very touristy. Definitely worth visiting and very easy to get to from Valladolid.

629954699.name: Swimming in a cenote
629954699.author: a TripAdvisor user
629954699.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place for a swim. The pool is clear and cool.  The fish even give you a foot fish spa if you stand still for long enough!

617959000.name: Amazing!
617959000.author: a TripAdvisor user
617959000.reviewBody:
The cenote is located in a place where there is another cenote (the entrance fee is 125 pesos for the two of them) and the place is great - located in a very peaceful area, with bathrooms available (not the cleanest ones though). 

The water is great to swim, you just need to be careful and ask where you can swim since some parts are a big more shallow. The water is in a good temperature and just a beautiful thing to see. I went there at the end of the day - around 15:30- and there were very few people.. which made me enjoy it even more. I definitely recommend it! 

Tip: some guy/girl at the entrance may offer to take you to the cenotes and stick with you for the whole time, waiting for a tip. Don’t accept it: he/she will only disturb your experience, since you won’t be able to stay in the cenotes as long as you would really like to.

616530038.name: One of two cenotes in Dzitnup
616530038.author: a TripAdvisor user
616530038.reviewBody: We decided to visit both cenotes here because it didn\'t cost much more to see both.  We preferred the other, Xkeken, but both were lovely.  We had already spent some time at Ik Kil near Chichen Itza and Xkeken provided a different feel.

609370515.name: Impressive Cenote but for the rest it depends what you are looking for
609370515.author: a TripAdvisor user
609370515.reviewBody:
We visited a lot of Cenotes through Yucatan and Quintana Roo and the prices, even for the most amazing and impressive ones, were between 30 to 80 pesos. If you wish to visit both of the Cenotes here, be ready to leave there 125 pesos each person. 
The Cenotes themselves are really impressive. We loved mostly the Samula, because there was less people and the water is cristal blue. 
Unfortunately, as we were paying the entrance, a volounteer tour guide approched us and basically decided for us that he was going to take us around. Right after paying, you have to go thorugh the   »picture time », picture that according to them is for their Facebook page. Picture that actually, later on your visit, they will try to sell to you after photoshopping you into the Cenotes (which is totally fake btw).
After the picture (that we really tried to refuse but they seemed shocked and made us stop to take it), we started to walk with this guide. The poor guy was probably very nice, but we weren’t too happy with the service from the start as we didn’t want a guide in the first place. He explained some basic things about the Cenote Samula to us and then waited for us inside as we decided to swim in it. 
Afterwards we headed to the other Cenote and at some point (not sure if he realized that we were not interested in his service or because apparently the other Cenote is completely separated from the main entrance and so maybe he couldn’t come), he stopped and asked us for « propina » right away without half terms. He also said that as he was a volounteer, a 100 peosos as tip would be ok. After we gave it to him he disappeared and left us wondering around (which is what we desired).
The thing is: if you want a guide, then fine. If you don’t want one and want to be on your own, apparetly you have to fight for your freedom. 
Advice: say no right away if you are not interested and don’t let them start with « where are you from » or you are doomed.

Enjoy Mexico and it’s magic!

598589292.name: Refreshing on the way back from Chichen Itza
598589292.author: a TripAdvisor user
598589292.reviewBody:
This is our first cenote so I can’t really compare. There are two cenotes here and you pay MXN225 to visit both. 
The facilities are very basic (rudimentary changing room, no place to store your belongings, limited shower with barely trickling water). 
The cenotes are beautiful and it is very refreshing to swim in the cool water after a hot day visiting Mayan ruins. 
I recommend bringing swimming goggles or a dive mask to be able to open your eyes under water. 
There are a few people, but I didn’t find it crowded. 
As the water is stagnant and underground, I have to wonder about the hygiene considering that a large number of people swim in it.

593884873.name: Buy both cenotes
593884873.author: a TripAdvisor user
593884873.reviewBody: Title says it. Buy the ticket for Dtznup and Samula together, collectively called Xkeken and see both, one across the street from the other.  See review of Xkeken.

587028016.name: Good Place to Swim and Fish Massage
587028016.author: a TripAdvisor user
587028016.reviewBody: This is a good place to swim. Keep you feet in the water and your will get free fish massage. This little fish start nibbling on your feet, and my wife loved it. I saw some small rock falling deep on the right hand side and didn\'t feel comfortable to go there. However, there is a plenty of other space to swim around

583685929.name: Natural Spa, beautiful place!
583685929.author: a TripAdvisor user
583685929.reviewBody: There are small fishes that will exfoliate your whole body while you are admiring the beauty of the cenote. The water is cool and refreshing.

581454935.name: Beautiful place
581454935.author: a TripAdvisor user
581454935.reviewBody: After exhausting sightseeing, it\'s worth cooling down, a very pleasant and cool place. Beautiful views and natural shapes of rocks.

569498995.name: pleasant cenotes, not so pleasant surroundings
569498995.author: a TripAdvisor user
569498995.reviewBody:
Cenotes Samula and Xkeken are both unique and worth paying both entrance fees for. Samula is the cenote with sunlight beaming in through the top of the cave amidst tree roots dangling into the water while Xkeken is known for its stalactite formations. While we preferred the Gran Cenote in Tulum, it was nice to take a cold swim after a long day in the heat. The water was pretty murky when we went though and we couldn’t see more than a few feet with the snorkeling gear that we had rented. You can probably save yourself some money by skipping the snorkeling gear.

Unfortunately, the area leading up to the cenotes is a somewhat dismal affair with an overbuilt marketplace with dozens of shuttered and abandoned shops, likely the result of an overzealous developer with failed ambitions of creating the Disneyland of cenotes. What shops were open were run down and occupied by bored looking shopkeepers. 

The staff working in the areas leading up to the cenote deserve a mention for being pushy and rather abrasive, first when we arrived (“Where you from?”, the lingua franca of touts worldwide) to staff not-so-subtly asking for tips by pointing to their tip jar with a look in their eye that shot daggers. The owners must not be paying them much which is sad. Okay, we did meet 1-2 nice folks working there but they were the exception rather than the rule. 

My advice: Buy your tickets, skip the guy trying to take your photo, say hello to the sad looking shopkeepers, and find the entrance to the cenotes as quickly as you can.

569334637.name: Great staff
569334637.author: a TripAdvisor user
569334637.reviewBody: I was at the Cenote Samula in March 2018 as one of 10 family members.  At the cenote they have a platform to jump from into the water.  My father (65 yrs old) decided to jump and forgot to remove his glasses.  When he came to the surface his glasses were missing from his face.  The water was cloudy and there was no way for us to find them.  As we left, one of the employees who was manning the platform was told that we had lost the glasses.  He asked where we thought my father landed in the water, and we tried to guess.  The employee was able to free dive (fins and goggles only) about 10 meters down and retrieve the glasses.  It saved the rest of our trip as my father can\'t see without them.

566769342.name: Our first cenote visit
566769342.author: a TripAdvisor user
566769342.reviewBody: Visited the cenote for the first time and we just loved it. The best was that half of the place was shallow so it is a good place to start if you are a bit afraid. We enjoyed the place with our daughters (4&6years) as they were useing their floaties. Cenote was a bit busy when we visited but it was not too crowded.

566169713.name: Amazingly interesting
566169713.author: a TripAdvisor user
566169713.reviewBody: On a private tour of the area we stopped here and had a great time. Everyone were very friendly, the water was cold, but fun to jump into. They have done a lovely job making it a travelers stop with nice little things locker rooms, restaurant, gift shop and lovely buildings with nice surroundings.

565713810.name: I\'d Give It a 6 If I Could
565713810.author: a TripAdvisor user
565713810.reviewBody: Beauiful "double feature" of cenotes. One entrance, two cenotes. Both are quite different and extremely beautiful. Go early before the buses come in. Just buy the entrance tickets.. IMO skip the package deals with meals and tours. Enjoy the crystal clear water with little fish nibbling at your feet. A little out of the way if you are in Cancun, but thoroughly worth the trip!

563222206.name: Well organized double Cenote feature
563222206.author: a TripAdvisor user
563222206.reviewBody: It was my 2nd cenote after an Impressive Ik Kil. I have been to approximately 10 cenotes on Yakatan. This turned out to be one of the most liked. It is well organized tour with another Xkeken cenote. There was a free guide that was walking us through these 2 cenotes, making a few pointers, jokes and patiently waiting for us while we experienced  it. \n\nLife jackets, pictures with parrots, coconut drinks are all provided for a small fee.

562096560.name: Fantastic Cenote
562096560.author: a TripAdvisor user
562096560.reviewBody: This cenote is just lovely. It is next to the Xkeken cenote. I really recommend both cenotes as both of them are just fantastic. These 2 are definitely among the best ones I\'ve ever seen. We arrived very early to be the first ones in and we literally had both cenotes to ourselves. Just lovely. \nThe only con is that a person was taking us to the first cenote and telling us about the history, we initially thought this was included with the price but it wasen\'t. He expected a big tip. If we would have known we would have preferred to go by ourselves. I think this would be OK if they would tell you in advance and have a standard guide fee. Be aware, this happens in most attractions in the area.

561578339.name: Beautiful water and cenote, easy climb and delicious temperature.
561578339.author: a TripAdvisor user
561578339.reviewBody: You get a guide to take you to the cenote, you tip him what you wish, but worth it.  The water was fantastic, beautiful colors and worth the swim.  One of the nicer cenotes.

560702388.name: Worth it to get out of town and relax!
560702388.author: a TripAdvisor user
560702388.reviewBody: Such a beautiful escape. We had the whole cenote pool when we first got there and it was stunning! Recommend it for sure, we rode bicycles over from downtown Valladolid and it was a good ride with a bike path the whole way.

559234602.name: Beautiful Cenote
559234602.author: a TripAdvisor user
559234602.reviewBody: Stopped here with our tour, and it was beautiful and the water was crystal clear.  Highly recommend.  Not very busy the day we went so was very enjoyable.

558184053.name: Once is enough
558184053.author: a TripAdvisor user
558184053.reviewBody: In my opinion, if you see one cenote, you\'ve seen them all.  But you definitely want to see at least one or two.  And while you\'re there, take a dip in the cool waters of this underground lake.  There\'s a nice dive down from the platform into the water, so if you\'re one for taking a plunge then that\'s something you should do.  Please be careful on the stairs as they will be slippery.  This makes a convenient stopover on the way to Chichen Itza.

555208781.name: What an amazing experience !
555208781.author: a TripAdvisor user
555208781.reviewBody: Went there as part of a large group tour. I guess it will be always crowded no matter how or when you visit given how close it is to chichen itza and the coty of valladolid. Crystal clear clean blue water.. Cold too. 1 USD if you want to swim which includes a mandatory life jacket. 1 USD extra if you need a locker. Need to shower beford you go down and jump in.. There is a platform about 10ft high if you feel a bit more adventerous..\nIf its not this Cenote you must swim or dive in one if you ever go to Yucatan..sometime you quite cant digest natures\' creations.

554073898.name: Really beautiful, must see!
554073898.author: a TripAdvisor user
554073898.reviewBody: Amazing spot like none I\'ve seen before. Saw a few cenotes in Mexico and they were all amazing in their own way. These were the only two that had such a contrast between light and dark. The sun coming through the hole gave it quite an amazing effect and the place looked completely different when a cloud would pass in front. Definitely worth a drive if you\'re going throgh Valladolid or a small detour going to Chichen Itza.

552982014.name: worth to visit
552982014.author: a TripAdvisor user
552982014.reviewBody: one of great cenote! \nclean, transparent, BLUE. even if you don\'t swim, it is worth to take a nice picture.

552573707.name: Unique
552573707.author: a TripAdvisor user
552573707.reviewBody: Every single cenote is different from others. All of them are unique and worth to be discovered. Yes, it can be a bit expensive and yes, the local people can be a bit pushy to get "something" from you but: first of all they are working and is the only way to really know the stories about this places, and second is a very small price to enjoy this wonders of nature which are kept safe and clean by the same locals. So is understandable and justified.

552008466.name: Beautiful
552008466.author: a TripAdvisor user
552008466.reviewBody: This cenote was fun! Busy but how cool to swim in a cave! There is a yellow rope you cannot cross and you cannot stand on the rocks in the middle. You do get 2 cenotes in this trip and the second one is less busy but darker and a little more eerie! Fun to see!

551855496.name: Yes for Cenote, No for Tourist trap
551855496.author: a TripAdvisor user
551855496.reviewBody: Saluma and Xkeken Cenotes are in the same property. It\u2019s impossible to say that these underground creations of nature are not impressive. On the other hand the human creation above ground are a turn-off. After you pay the entrance fee -expensive for Mexico- they take your picture to sell to you later. You must walk thru rows of noisy food vendors and vending stalls to get to the sink holes. In my opinion to much of a tourist trap and to much cement, that detracts from the Cenotes natural beauty.  Go for the Cenotes, but be prepared for a rowdy access.

549935689.name: Interesting spot
549935689.author: a TripAdvisor user
549935689.reviewBody: A cenote is a sunken cave the Mayans believed were the entrance to the underworld. The cenote was interesting to see. The water is from fresh sources and is very refreshing. If you book a tour of Chichen Itza this will most likely be included.

544337729.name: I didn\'t ask for a guide but he followed us in and wanted $. Lame.
544337729.author: a TripAdvisor user
544337729.reviewBody: The place is of course gorgeous but I was so turned off that a guy at the front says he\'s your guide (you do not need a guide to walk 50 feet) and then he asks for money. I was pissed and it ruined the tranquil feeling totally. Either way, swimming in a cenote is super rad.

542723134.name: Nice place to cool down and be impressed by nature
542723134.author: a TripAdvisor user
542723134.reviewBody: I visited this place because I stayed close to Valladolid and you get two cenotes at one place. It was really worth it and I took the offer in cluding both cenotes and a lunch buffet for 255 pesos. The lunch was really nice and the cenotes pretty impressive.

542378507.name: Xkeken cenote
542378507.author: a TripAdvisor user
542378507.reviewBody: We visited the Xkeken cenote only we went a bit late but was so beautiful!! The water so cold and refreshing, was few people but still u could swim around! You can stay there for around an hour!! Is the perfect place to recharge batteries and to enjoy the refreshing waters!!!

541799766.name: Great experience
541799766.author: a TripAdvisor user
541799766.reviewBody: Cenotes are definitely one of the best things about visiting Mexico and this particular one is certainly worth a visit. The water is clear and refreshing whilst the facilities are good to make it worth the money. A must do in Mexico.

540981499.name: A little overpriced but the place is amazing.
540981499.author: a TripAdvisor user
540981499.reviewBody: The place is amazing, I\'d never been to a cenote before and it\'s an awesome experience. You can swim in there and have a good time. Our guide Israel was super helpful, he even took pictures of us while we were swimming. They sell you pictures with a parrot which are amazing but a little overpriced. Overall it\'s a very cool place to visit.

540805187.name: quiet and beautiful cenote
540805187.author: a TripAdvisor user
540805187.reviewBody: at this site there are 2 centotes, samula and xkeken. Samula was quieter, deeper underground and more relaxed. We swam for about an hour (after we got over the initial coolness of the water). The lights that they have put in there give a really nice atmosphere. There are changing rooms and showers (which are ok) and lockers available for about 10 peso but you could take stuff to the side of the pool if you wanted. It is worth going into xkeken to see the amazing stalactites and the bats that live in there. We decided not to swim as we felt it was inevitable the water would have bat urine in it given the number of them. It was still worth paying the entrance fee for both cenotes though.

533264067.name: Wow amazing
533264067.author: a TripAdvisor user
533264067.reviewBody: This was our first cenote in Mexico and the experience was great! We also visited the Xkeken cenote. Wonderful and magic! Not many tourists because it\'s October and the high season hasn\'t started yet

530901595.name: Really interesting
530901595.author: a TripAdvisor user
530901595.reviewBody: Doing a day road trip, seeing a cenote was on the agenda. Our guide had obviously checked the cenotes around the Valladolid area and these two cenotes had few visitors which he knew would suit us. He chose Samula because of disability issues in our group. 45 steps to water, the first flight being a bit more challenging due to rain. Lovely cenote, beautiful light flooding in, water refreshing. You could see the small fish but probably not best cenote for snorkelling.

517475821.name: My first cenote
517475821.author: a TripAdvisor user
517475821.reviewBody: My first cenote experience was Cenote Samula and Cenote X\'keken. I liked Samula better than the latter because it\'s deeper underground and made me feel like a James Bond in Octopussy. Cenotes are a magical, wondrous experience and Samula was a great introduction to this mystical underworld that undergirds the yucatan peninsular region. It\'s more popular with local tourists which means few to no annoying European or American tourists and a pretty low entry price. Do not wear sunscreen or moisturizers in any cenote because it upsets the delicate ecosystem. Moreover since this cenote is so far underground, you have no fear of burning. It\'s a bit dark, not great for snorkeling. I don\'t dive but I didn\'t see much diving in Samula though X\'keken seemed to offer good diving. You come here to experience swimming in a cave. If you want to see fish or dive deeper in to a cavern, this may not be the right cenote for you.

515357136.name: Amazing place for amazing experience
515357136.author: a TripAdvisor user
515357136.reviewBody:
My wife and I went there and tried 2 caves there.
Experience was amazing, the water is fresh but very nice.
Experience is not that expensive it's worth it.

513060594.name: Worth a visit! Stunning cenote under the ground
513060594.author: a TripAdvisor user
513060594.reviewBody: Amazing spot! In my opinion the Cenote Samula is more beautiful and also a bit less crowded than its twin xkeken. We went there in the afternoon, almost evening and it was still an incredible view even if the sun wasn\'t directly shining through the hole in the ceiling of the cave. \nI would recommend going there by mid-day. It\'s said to be an incredible view, when the sunrays shine through the hole, diving the water into an azureblue tone.

511509795.name: Wonderful experience
511509795.author: a TripAdvisor user
511509795.reviewBody: I went with folks and family. We had an excellent time. \n\nWater is clear with a green tone and cold which was perfect for the hot weather.

509828394.name: Good Cenote
509828394.author: a TripAdvisor user
509828394.reviewBody: It is a good cenote, super cold water. Not super clear water but they explain why. X\'keken is still my favorite though.

504448338.name: Good to look at ,... but too busy
504448338.author: a TripAdvisor user
504448338.reviewBody: We went to Cenote Samula on our return from Chichen Itza. - we were prepared to go for a swim , but it was really busy , and didn\'t appear that inviting , with so many people jumping into the water.- which didn\'t look that clear.

502538993.name: X\'Keken and Samula Cenotes - One site - two cenotes
502538993.author: a TripAdvisor user
502538993.reviewBody:
We arrived at these cenotes in the early afternoon.  They are both at the one site with a car park between them, you pay for either to enter one or both.  Please be aware that you need to walk between the cenotes.

We were asked if we would like a guide, we had read that a guide was compulsory so agreed but other people were walking around without one.  On saying that the guide was very knowledgeable, he helped us with information on the cenotes, walked between each with us and waited whilst we swam.  There are lockers available for your bags and belongings (for a small price) but you can leave your personal belonging by the cenote whilst you swim but this is obviously at your own risk. 

Before leaving the UK, we purchased water shoes from Amazon and these proved fantastic when walking to and from the cenote and in the water. If you don’t purchase before leaving then they are available at Walmart in Mexico too.  Between the cenotes there are lots of shops and traders with souvenirs and other items, although our guide walked straight past them all so we weren’t bothered by anyone.

Both cenotes are beautiful, the water is clean and clear but cold.  However once you are in it is refreshing and didn’t seem as cold.  There are little fishes which will give your skin a clean whilst you swim.  This was a wonderful experience and these Cenotes were quiet in the afternoon and we highly recommend visiting. 

The usual photo opportunity is available before taking the tour, so expect to be offered the photo on your way out!

500520001.name: Go
500520001.author: a TripAdvisor user
500520001.reviewBody: If you are wanting an out of the way place with way fewer people to share the water, this is it!  This was in basically a large underground cave filled with clear cool water, the ceiling being 30-40 feet high. So we\'re swimming around with stalactites and roots from the trees above hanging over us. Amazing.  A great place to cool off after the days of exploring the ruins in the heat.

496684803.name: Creepy - water not clear
496684803.author: a TripAdvisor user
496684803.reviewBody: We went here after going to other cenotes in the area with clear water - this one was creepy to be honest.  Beautiful to walk around in and look at but to get in the water was really not fun. It was refreshing, as almost all cenotes are, but the fact that you couldn\'t see through the water made it unpleasant.  Also we went late, 4pm, and we were the ONLY people there which made it even scarier....being in a big dark, dark water cave all alone....eek.  I would check out Dos Ojos on Hwy 307 or Cenote Gran or Labnaha before going to this one. My daugthter who is a lifeguard in the USA was not even going to get in - I convinced her to jump in and swim at least for a minute.  We literally stayed 15 mins and left.  People that worked there were very nice though and there is a restaurant on site and a little store.  Clean bathrooms too.

492908827.name: Disappointing
492908827.author: a TripAdvisor user
492908827.reviewBody: We stopped here in the morning on the way to Chichen Itsa and were very disappointed after the great reviews we had read.  It was dark and gloomy and the water was not clear and inviting as it had algae floating and just looked dirty.  However, it was very cold and refreshing, but you were required to wear life jackets if you wanted to swim.   It is worth a visit if you have not been to anything similar.

492304216.name: Wow!! Breathtaking.
492304216.author: a TripAdvisor user
492304216.reviewBody: We visited a few Cenote on our recent visit to Mexico and this gem was our favourite. Wow! It was stunning. It was open and very deep with a cascading waterfall. There\'s a high platform for jumping that provided so much fun. We loved it here! \nIf you are planning a trip to Valladolid then swing by here!!

491798476.name: Very cool!
491798476.author: a TripAdvisor user
491798476.reviewBody: We were on a tour and stopped here, what a nice surprise! It definitely was the coolest Cenote (along with X\u2019Keken) that we have seen. Definitely something not to miss if you are in the area.

491144541.name: Exquisite Natural Wonder
491144541.author: a TripAdvisor user
491144541.reviewBody: Cenote Samula was our 2nd cenote in our 2 for less deal. The cenotes are gorgeous and the feel of them is something I find hard to describe. We paid 125 Pesos pp. I recommend allowing at least 5 hours for both cenotes if you really want to play it by ear, and move at your own pace. We stayed about 2.5 hours at both cenotes and we were full by then and ready to head back to Cancun to make the last ferry to Isla Mujeres at 11:30 PM. Those who enjoy water less may not require as much time. We had not really planned on any tours this trip, except Chichen Itza (ruins) and, or a few Cenotes. We did the cenotes and were not disappointed!

490745556.name: Good but next door is better
490745556.author: a TripAdvisor user
490745556.reviewBody: A lovely, dark and clear cenote.  A cool swim among black fish. Not too busy with changing facilities and stalls.

487804729.name: just what we though it would be!
487804729.author: a TripAdvisor user
487804729.reviewBody: this cenote is close enough to the city of Valladolid and it is gorgeous!! worth the visit...across this cenote is the cenote Kenken, which it is as nice but different. It is really a good idea to visit both for the $125 pesos fee. We had a guided visits to both cenotes but if you prefer to have the freedom to explore the area, don\'t get a guide

485739985.name: What a perfect day
485739985.author: a TripAdvisor user
485739985.reviewBody: We visited the Cenotes by bike from Valladolid. Taking a bike and ride it through the Yucatan country side? That alone is an amazing experience in itself.\nIf the destination is this magical place? Gosh, it becomes one of the most memorable days of your life. I still tell every friend that thinks about travelling to Yucatan that swimming in these Cenotes was one of the coolest and most magical things I\'ve ever done...and I am not exaggerating. It is so beautiful, neither words nor pictures can capture it. You have to experience it yourself.

485298733.name: Good for a swim
485298733.author: a TripAdvisor user
485298733.reviewBody: Shame you couldn\'t dive in etc but as cenotes go, this was good to swim in however not as beautiful as Ik Kil for example.

483042683.name: Nice cenote
483042683.author: a TripAdvisor user
483042683.reviewBody: We stayed in Valladolid for 2 nights and went to Xkeken and Samula cenotes one day. We enjoyed our trip however if you have to choose, visit the cenote Zaci inside Valladolid, much nicer and fun than these. The price is 120 pesos per person for both cenotes. We really enjoy seeing cenotes and were glad we added these two to our list, but not the most amazing that we\'ve seen.

481693354.name: LOVE IT!
481693354.author: a TripAdvisor user
481693354.reviewBody: Beautiful sink hole with refreshing undergroud river to extinguish the heat! Beautiful place and a definitely must do!

477196086.name: something different
477196086.author: a TripAdvisor user
477196086.reviewBody: On the way back to Holbox, from Chichen Itza we stopped here for a swim. So cool, so weird. A hole, or a cave with a hole in the roof with sunlight coming trough.

470607264.name: Wow!
470607264.author: a TripAdvisor user
470607264.reviewBody:
I had the greatest time of my life, really enjoyed the cenote although I found out it had changed a bit (referring to the fact that about 5 years ago it had like roots hanging) but other than that, I loved it. The water was a bit cold but once inside you forget; there are little catfishes inside which gives you a free pedicure lol; there is a lifeguard, lights and small holes inside to put your stuff in case you don't rent a locker. There are also bathrooms and showers, little souvenirs places and they sell cold coconuts (oh yes!). 
The price per cenote is $80 pesos per person and children I think is less (sorry but we didn't take children so I didn't pay attention) but is a place for family all ages just have to be careful when you go in since there are a lot of stairs and it might be a little slippery. 
I would recommend to take your own car but in case you go on by yourself, there are local taxis to take you to Valladolid's downtown for about $80 pesos (for 2 people maybe even 4).
Totally recommend this place!

470196645.name: Dos cenotes en uno
470196645.author: a TripAdvisor user
470196645.reviewBody: This cenote and the X\'keken cenote are collectively called the dzitnup cenotes and they are a beautiful side trip while visiting either Chichen Itza or Ek\' Balam.  The cost for one cenote is 80 pesos and 160 for two.  Pay for both of them.  They are different.  While X\'keken is far more dramatic, Samula is a pleasant one to swim in.  Beware that you will be asked to stop for a photograph at the beginning and/or someone will just start tagging along with you to do a tour.  If you\'re not into spending money on either, just politely reject and quickly walk towards your cenotes (they also make you walk around shops before you can reach them). You may want to consider a locker rental at Samula as the area to put your bags down is at a second level and out of sight the entire time you are swimming.

464330079.name: Beautiful water and light
464330079.author: a TripAdvisor user
464330079.reviewBody: This was our first time to a subterranean cenote; we\'ve been to some open ones. The water was naturally lit by an opening at the ground surface, creating a beautiful blue color. The water is cold, about 70 degrees, but bearable. It\'s very deep water, so rent a flotation jacket if you\'re a poor swimmer. There are showers but no lockers or benches in the shower area. There are a few lockers outside.

463175533.name: Unique experience
463175533.author: a TripAdvisor user
463175533.reviewBody: We decided to visit the cenote while on our way back to Cancun from Chichen Itza and it turned out to be the highlight of the day! The unique experience of swimming in a natural underground pool that has so much history was amazing! Only about 10 km from Valladolid and 40 km from Chichen Itza, this is not to be missed if you are in the area. The entrance fee is 80 pesos/person for one of the cenotes but well worth it!

462734246.name: Good cenote
462734246.author: a TripAdvisor user
462734246.reviewBody: There are 2 cenotes that you can access from one parking lot Samula and Xkeken (they are collectively known as Dzitnup on road signs.  I liked that both were underground.  Samula had a smaller entrance area for people getting in and out- which was a bit of a problem, because some people just came and sat and dipped their feet- oh well.  I preferred Xkeken better.  The cost was about $8 USD to enter. There were bathrooms for changing in. There was a restaurant- but it had average to bad reviews so we ate before we came.  there is safe parking- so we didn\'t worry about the car being broken into. I would return here.  it was not crowded when we went at 2pm. We swam for about 10-15 minutes in each cenote, so it was a great break!

461861810.name: 2 cenotes in one location!
461861810.author: a TripAdvisor user
461861810.reviewBody: Beautiful cenotes at this little park.  Very clean and cheap to get in. Hard to find the actual cenote but worth it. Some food and lockers if needed but since there were so few people we didn\'t need them. Literally we were the only ones there for a while. Totally worth going to and enjoying the cool waters after a hot day. 160 pesos for both and I would do both. Very different and both really nice.

460881478.name: Nice
460881478.author: a TripAdvisor user
460881478.reviewBody: We only had time for one cenote and decided to see cenote Samula (80mxn). We went there at around 3pm and took a refreshing swim in the almost empty cenote. It is not that exciting, some little fishes nibble on the feet and bigger ones swim pretty close - you can bring your mask etc. to see more, but at around 3pm it was pretty dark inside.\nWe were a but disappointed because the ropes of the tree were cut. Overall, it is nice to go there for approx. 1h, maybe it is better to combine it with the second cenote. If you have seen other cenotes then it is not extremely exiting, though a nice swim in clear water with a special atmosphere.

460451075.name: Impressive!
460451075.author: a TripAdvisor user
460451075.reviewBody: You have to visit the Cenote Samula. So impressive! Water is warm and it\'s so peaceful. Bring your GoPro!

459133360.name: Arrive early for a peaceful float
459133360.author: a TripAdvisor user
459133360.reviewBody:
We swam in both cenotes at Xkeken, but this was our favorite. The iconic hole in the ceiling of the cavernous cenote allowed a beam of sunlight to sparkle on the water. It makes for amazing photos! 

The water is cool but not cold; it would be tempting to swim later in the day when it's hotter outside, but we found that arriving at Xkeken as soon as they opened allowed us to have both cenotes almost to ourselves. There was evidence of a massive tourist infrastructure warming up outside when were done swimming, so I imagine that later in the day it would be much more difficult to enjoy a quiet swim. There are changing rooms and bathrooms nearby, but you need to bring your own towels. There is a snack bar and many stands selling souvenirs and local treats like pipa (cold coconuts with a hole + straw, delicious after a swim!). 

This is a kid-friendly activity. There are life jackets for rent, but there are also ropes strung across the cenote to make it easy to stop for a rest. Wearing swim shoes is helpful, too, since the rocks are slippery and sharp. A good location to experience the beauty of cenotes!

459086565.name: Nice cenote but crowded and very aggressive touts selling everything
459086565.author: a TripAdvisor user
459086565.reviewBody: Both, Cenote Samula as well as Cenote X\'keken share the same entrance and can be a combined visit. There are less people swimming in Cenote Samula than in Cenote X\'keken but before you reach both cenotes you will have to pass by the locals souvenir shops and their touts can be rather aggressive in selling activities (horse riding, quads etc.), so make your way straight to the 2 cenotes. Water is about 25 degrees C and the water is clean, way down can be slippery.

458798057.name: Get There Early and Enjoy
458798057.author: a TripAdvisor user
458798057.reviewBody: The park was barely open when we arrived and Cenote Samula and Xkeken. With only a couple of other people there, we had plenty of space to take pictures in this glorious and bright blue centote. Here, the light was mostly natural which made is beautiful and clear. As you float you can see the stalactites above you which makes a surreal experience. With these two cenotes together just a short 20 minute bike ride from Valladolid, these are a perfect morning trip with time to be back for lunch!

457865687.name: Awesome cenote for a swimming on a  hot day
457865687.author: a TripAdvisor user
457865687.reviewBody: This cenote is clse enough to Valladolid that yu can do it renting a bike for nearly nothing in Valladolid center (one place is by the cathedral the other one in Hostal Sol), there is a cylcing path that goes all the way there, to cenote Xkepel and Samula. Samula def the one I enjoyed more, as you can swim snorkel in a big cave with a perfect hole so the light filters like a Spa...amazing experience. 80 pesos entrance per Cenote def on the expensive side, so I would only do Samula, better pics, swim and experience. Had an awesome time. Although still I prefer Cenote San Lorenzo de Oxman, as a lt more fun, more beutiful and not as much on the tourist circuit so you have it for yourself, all within cycle from downtown valladolid.

454015673.name: Cenote Tza-Ujun-Kat and Cenote Santa Rosa
454015673.author: a TripAdvisor user
454015673.reviewBody: Tza-ujun-Kat is beautiful.  Went on a Friday and no tours in site.  Entry fee is minimal I\'m thinking around 40 pesos maybe.  Stairs steep, rocky and slippery near bottom.  But well worth it.  Large hole in ceiling let\'s in light.  This cenote does have a "bottomless hole" but also lots of swimming room where you can stand. On the side there are stairs going right into water.\n\nSanta Rosa was an OK cenote.  Kids were jumping off platforms into water and there isn\'t much natural light.  Swimming space is smaller, but it was a good cooling off swim...mask and snorkel not needed in this cenote as it\'stands much darker and they use artificial light which is blinding in some areas and too dark in others

452885330.name: Beautiful and clean cenote close to Valladolid
452885330.author: a TripAdvisor user
452885330.reviewBody: We visited this cenote, which has another cenote right next door.  These are unlike the denotes I have visited near Tulum where you arrive with snorkeling gear.  These cenotes are more for just cooling off and enjoying their beauty.  Arrive early if you can because as we were leaving it was getting packed with tour buses and lots of traffic coming in.  We went after breakfast and we really enjoyed it.

452880399.name: Cenotes!
452880399.author: a TripAdvisor user
452880399.reviewBody:
All locals have their favorite cenote. These were recommended to me by the hotel owner at hotel hacienda Margot in Valladolid. 

At the entrance you can buy tickets for both cenotes. 

Be careful when going downstairs, since it could be slippery. Inside there's artificial light in both. Early in the morning was the ideal time to avoid crowds and vendors 

Samula:
Deep cenote at the end of rock stairs. Natural light comes from the top of the cenote

X'quequen:
Across the street. Here there are huge stalactites and you will also see the roots of the trees and bats flying 

Which one is best? 
They are both beautiful in their own way

452763422.name: Less crowded than the other one and just as  nice.
452763422.author: a TripAdvisor user
452763422.reviewBody: We went to both cenotes in the park and I liked this better because of fewer crowds.  Both are nice but this has a  quieter vibe to it.

451278319.name: Good cenote
451278319.author: a TripAdvisor user
451278319.reviewBody: Not too far from Valladolid and on the way to Chichen Itza you will find two cenotes in one location. Samula was the one we went to, and unfortunately the other name slips my memory. Either way the property is sort of set up like a waterpark and I believe there is even a hotel at the beginning of the property. They get packed by about 12 and stay so until close. There are a lot of vendors selling wares and there are a couple of bars/restaurants. Because they are run and promoted like a waterpark we didn\'t find it as enjoyable as other places such as Zaci. It was honestly too busy but swimming it essentially what was a cave is a pretty neat experience as opposed to a hole, i.e. Zaci

451080431.name: Topped our list of places we enjoyed the most
451080431.author: a TripAdvisor user
451080431.reviewBody: My brother\'s only desire on our trip to Mexico was to swim in a cenote. We planned a day trip from Puerto Morelos and hired a car and driver. The drive is about 2 hours. It was well worth a day trip to Valladolid. The denote is massive and impressive. The cost to enter is reasonable. We throughally enjoyed our swim and it was my brother\'s highlight of our trip. I\'m told the restaurant is good there but we did not take part. A visit here on a hot day is highly recommended.

450779509.name: The cenote of cenote\'s
450779509.author: a TripAdvisor user
450779509.reviewBody: This cenote is a must see. I\'ve visited a lot thru out the Yucat\u00e1n and this one is by far one of the best you\'ll find. The photos you get are hyper stunning and it\'s simply a breath taking experience.  If there\'s any one cenote to visit then it\'s definitely this one!

449952457.name: Fun and Beautiful
449952457.author: a TripAdvisor user
449952457.reviewBody: We stopped at the Cenote Samula which is very close to Cenote Xkeken and the two are combined in one attraction.  We swam in both and this was our favorite cenote experience.  The water is clear and refreshing and it was not crowded at all.  Both Cenotes are underground with stalactites and a hole in the roof for light to come in.  At the entrance we signed up to eat at the buffet and it could easily have been skipped.

449435219.name: Amazing
449435219.author: a TripAdvisor user
449435219.reviewBody: Gorgeous cenote.  Glad we went.  Very few tourists.  Easy to get to and very inexpensive.  We did not swim but others did.\n

448345590.name: Amazing Sinkhole
448345590.author: a TripAdvisor user
448345590.reviewBody: Great place if you want to see one of the cenotes. Our children jumped off the deck and swam in the clear cold water. We went as part of a tour. There\'s an admission charge and a requirement to rent life jackets. There are changing facilities with lockers and outside showers. There are also 2 restaurants on premise.

446621238.name: Beautifull and fun!
446621238.author: a TripAdvisor user
446621238.reviewBody: This cenote is very impressive and fun to swim in, not much to see with a snorkel but nice. Try to come early as it can get pretty busy.

446255248.name: Great swim but lacking basic amenities.
446255248.author: a TripAdvisor user
446255248.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cenote - well worth the visit and admission fee but a little disappointing to discover that not one of the three bathrooms I could find were in service. This made for an uncomfortable conclusion to an otherwise enjoyable afternoon. Surely it\'s possible to do better than this?

444872186.name: refreshing dip after Chichen Itza
444872186.author: a TripAdvisor user
444872186.reviewBody: Lovely Cenotes, refreshing cool clean water. Enjoyed it on the way back to Valladolid. Changing facilities and lockers available.

444557965.name: A sea of orange flotation vests
444557965.author: a TripAdvisor user
444557965.reviewBody: Best to go early morning to avoid the bus loads of Chichen Itza day trippers. We went late afternoon & were blown away by the number of people. It\'s clearly set up for group tours. After they all left it was quite pleasant. The cenote at Ek Belam was much better - no buses of day trippers.

441330543.name: Decent cenote
441330543.author: a TripAdvisor user
441330543.reviewBody: This cenote wasn\'t nearly as good as yzndnot (not correct spelling)  was rather expensive and run down.  Wasn\'t pleased with being forced to park for a tip and hassled by parking staff.

435498481.name: Tourist trap
435498481.author: a TripAdvisor user
435498481.reviewBody: This natural beauty has been turned into a commercial enterprise, where you get hounded by vendors flogging trinkets. Of all the cenotes around Valladolid I think cenote San Lorenzo oxman is stunning and worth visiting!

432159583.name: Don\'t go in the evening...
432159583.author: a TripAdvisor user
432159583.reviewBody: We arrived to the Cenotes around 6.30pm (we had a car and were driving from Chichen Itza to Tulum so decided to stop) and it was starting to get dark. The Cenotes were open till 8pm so we got our tickets and entered. We couldn\'t see anything while there so it was a waste of money. I just wish the ticket salesman had told us that there\'s nothing to see at that time.

430968342.name: Better of the two cenotes at this stop
430968342.author: a TripAdvisor user
430968342.reviewBody: We visited both cenotes at this touristy stop. This was our favorite even though the other seems to get more recommendations (probably because there were only a few people). We did not look for lockers and left our clothes and backpacks on the platform near the water; they were fine. The water is very clear and refreshing and the light is pretty.

430112213.name: Great experience
430112213.author: a TripAdvisor user
430112213.reviewBody: I really like how enclosed this cenote is and it feels like swimming in a cave. The water is crystal clear. It was something quite special swimming there.

408715247.name: Cave cenote
408715247.author: a TripAdvisor user
408715247.reviewBody: Just like Xkeken cenote this one is in a cave. It can get a bit humid inside. You can take a swim or just have a look around.

405422737.name: Beautiful, clear waters, gorgeous cavern, view to sky
405422737.author: a TripAdvisor user
405422737.reviewBody: Ignore the insistent staff who say you need a guide to get to either Samula or Dznitup, the two cenotes that are part of Xkeken.  Pay admission, get your ticket that lets you into both, and walk the short distance on either side of a complex with stalls and a restaurant.  Samula features the most clear waters, turquoise in places, with a wide open cavern and an opening to the sky..  There are ropes strung across through the water so that you can rest while exploring and swimming.  There\'s  a lifeguard on duty, and life jackets can be rented.

404046628.name: A bit over priced in get in
404046628.author: a TripAdvisor user
404046628.reviewBody: A few too many vendors set up in the path from the parking lot to the cenote.  It is okay for an underground cenote but we have been to better ones.

401062006.name: Don\'t waste your time
401062006.author: a TripAdvisor user
401062006.reviewBody: Too expensive, over crowded, a long walk through many tourist stalls to get to the cenote. The cenote is interesting but very crowded, the water it cloudy and the experience was poor overall. The complex is so overdone and a real turnoff. Try cenote Oxman for a wonderful, peaceful cenote experience.

400044557.name: WOW
400044557.author: a TripAdvisor user
400044557.reviewBody: I think my title speaks for itself.  This place is amazing.  The people are really nice and we felt completely safe.  We left our backpack with passports and shoes on the rocks stairs and they were still there when we were done.

392297709.name: amazing cenote to swim
392297709.author: a TripAdvisor user
392297709.reviewBody: This cenote is really beautiful and cool and a lovely place to cool down and escape the heat...you can see fish really well as the water is so clear. Must do :)

389163119.name: Unique and beautiful Cenote
389163119.author: a TripAdvisor user
389163119.reviewBody: Right in the middle of Valladolid, this cenote is very unique. You can swim in the cenote "under your own risk" but if you do not want to swim you can also walk around it and observe the beautiful natural ceiling and walls covered in seashells. Super historic!

388468818.name: Beautiful Cenote
388468818.author: a TripAdvisor user
388468818.reviewBody: We visited on a hot humid day and the cave was wonderfully cool, lit through an opening in the cave roof.  The water was so refreshing, floating on my back watching the birds diving through a hole in the roof.  I then sat on the side of the pool and let the fish clean my feet.

386197071.name: OK
386197071.author: a TripAdvisor user
386197071.reviewBody: On the same site as cenote Xkeken and similar in context (subterranean cavern with lake and light hole) but, we felt, the less interesting of the two.

383229012.name: It was ok
383229012.author: a TripAdvisor user
383229012.reviewBody: Saw this with Xkeken Cenote.  Both were similar.  It was not what I expected.  It was one cave with water.  It was neat to see, but not inviting to swim.  I would not go out of my way to go to this cenote.  Luckily, we found another one where you could swim from cave to cave.

380854897.name: great cave
380854897.author: a TripAdvisor user
380854897.reviewBody: visit this place in june 2016. really magical. must visit if you go to chichen itza. even more magical if it rains.

380063409.name: Clear water, mysterious charm but my sensitive nose can smell urine at some places
380063409.author: a TripAdvisor user
380063409.reviewBody:
Of course it's a must visit along the neighbouring cenote. Tho the entry is through a row of shops!!!

Floor that leads to the water is wet and slippery so be careful. 

Water is cool, deep blue and crystal clear and you can see the limestone formations. There are tiny fish too. 
Swimming for the experience is certainly recommended but oh wish visitors stop peeing as my nose which is rather sensitive can smell the stink at 2-3 places on the evening we visited.

378818240.name: No one there
378818240.author: a TripAdvisor user
378818240.reviewBody: Very lovely cenote near Valladloid. Everyone was next door at the "more popular" one. I wish we had time to do both. This one was crystal clear, and more importantly, pretty deserted.

378361454.name: Beautiful, cool, relaxing
378361454.author: a TripAdvisor user
378361454.reviewBody: What a highlight. After a few hours walking around Chichen Itza, we visited the cenote for the wonderful opportunity to swim in the cool water, under the stalactites. It is underground, and the entry to the water is rocky and a little slippery, but it\'s well worth it!

376263936.name: Refreshing and relaxing
376263936.author: a TripAdvisor user
376263936.reviewBody: I recommend you to visit this place early so that you can really enjoy the beauty of the place before other visitors start arriving. We were the only ones in the place the moment we arrived and that helped us to really enjoy the cenote.

375048183.name: Cool caves perfect on hot day
375048183.author: a TripAdvisor user
375048183.reviewBody: Incredible place almost in the middle of town. Cool caves surrounding lake give you shade and comfort. Interesting discovery plus relaxing area.

374573562.name: Great cenote experience!
374573562.author: a TripAdvisor user
374573562.reviewBody: The Samula and Dzitnup cenotes are now part of one park with one admission charge.  This area should not be confused with the cenote along the highway -- the park is a couple km down the road from the highway and is now also referred to as Xeken (sp?).  The roots that the Samula cenote is known for have fallen down/removed.  The stalagtites are very impressive at the Dzitnup cenote.  Definitely worth a visit.

369063749.name: Superb
369063749.author: a TripAdvisor user
369063749.reviewBody: It is in the same place of Xkeken. I decided to visit both. And it was a truly right choice. Strongly recommended.

367910702.name: Interesting but not as special as Xenken
367910702.author: a TripAdvisor user
367910702.reviewBody: We visited both the cenotes at Dzitnup. This was quite different from Xenken, more open and shallower so not as exotic a swimming experience but still enjoyable.

366485942.name: Dark and Mysterious Swim
366485942.author: a TripAdvisor user
366485942.reviewBody: I just had to visit a few cenotes on our family trip to Mexico. Although my boys (4 and 7) did not want to go in, because of the fish, I found it magical to swim out to the center of the water alone and bask in the small dot of sunlight coming through the roof of the cave.

363931463.name: Stop #2 on the cenote tour
363931463.author: a TripAdvisor user
363931463.reviewBody: We thought Cenote Samula was interesting because you could see the well hole  - this cenote was deep and fun to swim around:)  You have to walk through a bunch of stores to get to the cenote entrance.  No need for snorkel masks at this cenote!

362669139.name: crystal clear waters worth the stop!
362669139.author: a TripAdvisor user
362669139.reviewBody: Although many rave about the more well-known X-keken, we preferred the colors and waters of Samula.  The water is crystal clear and the "island" is a fun destination when swimming in the cenote.

362030489.name: Unique experience.
362030489.author: a TripAdvisor user
362030489.reviewBody: We stopped with our large group from Belgium. My son and I took a swim in this wonderful cenote. You don\'t neet to be an olympic swimmer to have this unqie experience. Do it ... and you will not regret.

360686821.name: the better of the two
360686821.author: a TripAdvisor user
360686821.reviewBody: we paid to visit both cenotes and though i\'m glad we did i rated this cenote the better of the two. at its deepest its 17m and the dark blue water with limestone edges is truly beautiful. we arrived early and were lucky enough to have it ourselves for nearly 20 minutes. it was breath taking. highly recommended

358462520.name: Great excursion
358462520.author: a TripAdvisor user
358462520.reviewBody: This stopover was part of our Chichen Itza excursion.  The kids loved the swim in the Cenote, the water and surroundings were beautiful as well.

357092184.name: Nice swim
357092184.author: a TripAdvisor user
357092184.reviewBody: See my commends at xkeken cenote as it is basically one attraction. Be there early and leave at 11.00 when the touringcars arive

345833112.name: 2 Beautiful cenotes!
345833112.author: a TripAdvisor user
345833112.reviewBody: Samula is situated in the same complex as X\'keken cenote so you get to see 2 at the same time for the combined price of 90 peso. They are both beautiful, bring your swim costume as it\'s hard to resist the water. I stood motionless in the water of X\'keken while little fish were eating dead skin off my feet. Really worth a visit if you\'re in the Valladolid area; a tour bus from Valladolid can take you there for as little as 70 peso.

344084702.name: It\'s a cenote.
344084702.author: a TripAdvisor user
344084702.reviewBody: If you\'ve never seen a cenote (sink hole with water) it\'s great; otherwise average. Place is very touristy with buses, several restaurants, gift (read junk) shops.

343993350.name: Beautiful!
343993350.author: a TripAdvisor user
343993350.reviewBody: This is part of a complex with another cenote.  This one is so tranquil and quiet!  The admission for both cenotes is a bit high but it is well worth the price.  The climb into the cenote is a bit steep and slippery so make sure you have good footwear.

342156522.name: Wonderful
342156522.author: a TripAdvisor user
342156522.reviewBody: Visited 10 years ago and again this month.  Still my favorite cenote.  Stunning!  The light coming down from the roof and the roots is very beautiful.  This is the most stunning cenote, in my opinion.  I studied Maya culture in the Yucatan in school 10 years ago and visited many cenotes.  This is still my favorite.  Dos Ojos is #2 (in tulum).  Enjoy!

341291297.name: Very Nice
341291297.author: a TripAdvisor user
341291297.reviewBody: This is a very nice cenote-probably not the best in the area, but still awesome. It was very dark inside.

340534654.name: This cenote defines what you expect a cenote to look like!
340534654.author: a TripAdvisor user
340534654.reviewBody: This Cenote is probably the best example of a picture perfect cenote the way you would expect it to be with the natural light coming through the roots of a Ceiba and the ray of light touching down into the turquoise water - doesn\'t get much better than this for picture fans!!

338184412.name: Nice Cenotes, Less of a crowd and hassle than Ik Kil
338184412.author: a TripAdvisor user
338184412.reviewBody:
We visited here after Chichen Itza, its a short drive from Valladolid. There are 2 cenotes here Dzitnup (Xkeken) and Samula. They are much less crowded than Ik Kil which is closer to Chichen Itza and more often included in a package tour for tourists.

Samula had the long tree roots hanging down into it now they have been cut. 
Dzitnup (Xkeken) is the better of the 2 in my opinion as you can enter a real cave and see the stalagmite formations and swim into them.

If you go early enough 8-12pm it wont be too crowded even during high season, the parking may look full but its a small lot so dont let that deter you.

As with most cenotes not much to see in terms of snorkeling but a pleasant swim nonetheless.

There are vendors here (mostly on the Dzitnup/Xkeken) side selling cold coconuts and simple food

337400156.name: a cool experience, peaceful
337400156.author: a TripAdvisor user
337400156.reviewBody: a cool experience, peaceful. to get it it\'s only 5 bucks or less. It\'s 7 dollars I think if you pay for both cenotes as a package.

337360154.name: Nice place for a swim.
337360154.author: a TripAdvisor user
337360154.reviewBody: The cenote is beautiful but the area is quite dark. The all inclusive meal is a good deal but I found the food a bit tasteless. If you wand good local food in that area. Ask for Do\u00f1a Rosy\'s Kitchen. A nice mayan lady prepares very good food. You will love the taste.

336807677.name: Very nice
336807677.author: a TripAdvisor user
