336807677.reviewBody: This Cenote is very beautiful theres another cenote walking distance that you should visit too if you have time .

334912310.name: Gorgeous
334912310.author: a TripAdvisor user
334912310.reviewBody: We went late in the afternoon so there were no crowds. Beautiful crystal water, amazing tree roots, you could gaze into it for hours. We stayed for almost an hour which was enough as we don\'t swim. The best cenote we\'ve seen yet.

330740188.name: Most impressive
330740188.author: a TripAdvisor user
330740188.reviewBody: The Cenote is so deep and gorgeous. My friend and I have been swimming for about an hour. The lunch time is very crowed but after 1:10 PM there aren\'t many tourists. The experience of seeing this huge deep cenote is unforgettable!

328396757.name: See this one after Cenote 7 bocas, and before Gran Cenote.
328396757.author: a TripAdvisor user
328396757.reviewBody: I think there are 3 cenotes worth visiting: Cenote 7 Bocas, Dzitnup, and Gran Cenote.  And I\u2019d recommend seeing them in that order, since they will get progressively more fun and impressive.\n\nThe last time we were at Dzitnup, there was a problem with the lights down in the cenote, so if you have a flashlight or headlamp handy, you might want to bring it just in case.

324782027.name: Good cenote!
324782027.author: a TripAdvisor user
324782027.reviewBody: Great, just wish there were lockers and life jackets for rent. Was pretty quiet when I went. The life guard on duty was a really nice guy, but the guy at the front checking tickets was kind of a flirt!

305243065.name: Breath taking!
305243065.author: a TripAdvisor user
305243065.reviewBody:
This is magical place that is breathtaking!  You access the denote through a series of steps leading you down about 50ft under the ground.  This then opens to a cathedral like space with the cenote about another 50ft below you.  You can hire a locker for 7 pesos and swim in the very cool water.  Their are cat fish in the water too!  The hole in the roof lets a natural beam of light onto the water that provides you with a blessing if you swim under it!
Outside the cenote for around 200 peso you can access he cenote, have an all inclusive lunch and visit the tequila museum and craft shops in the complex.  This is very reasonable.  The complex also has showers, changing rooms and toilets.

A good way to spend a couple of hours.

304767486.name: Amazing cenotes
304767486.author: a TripAdvisor user
304767486.reviewBody: We swam in the two cenotes at Dzitnup on our last day in Mexico.  They are both amazing, although pretty similar.  We swam in 8 cenotes in our time in Mexico, and these were probably the most impressive.  They are both in caves, and the water is very clean.  We went early in the morning, and in one of them we were the only people there.  I think they probably get busier later in the day when the tours come through.  Would definitely recommend a visit.

300746684.name: Enjoy it (and don\'t think about the \'over-exploitation\')!
300746684.author: a TripAdvisor user
300746684.reviewBody: The cenotes of Dzitnup and Samula are part of the same \'experience\'. You pay an entry fee to visit both cenotes. If you\'ve never been into a cenote inside a cave the first impression is \'wow\' - and yes it is beautiful: a fresh water reservoir, underground and in the \'roof\' of the cave the sunlight comes in through a small hole, which adds to the feeling. After a while you realise it is a bit overexploited. Entryfee, pay/tip someone in the parking lot, pay/tip someone who guides you to the cave (although it s obvious where to go), who tries first to get you in the bar of restaurant and you\'re not alone there. That s all a bit too much. Nevertheless, enjoy the fresh and cool waters, have a swim and just enjoy it.

300736653.name: Cenotes Samula and Xkeken (AKA Cenote Dzitnup)
300736653.author: a TripAdvisor user
300736653.reviewBody:
There are two cenotes at this location and you need a ticket for each.  We were happy with the value, but we arrived around 11 am before most of the tourists arrived in the afternoon.  I recommend coming when it is mostly empty -- the more people that are at a cenote really ruin the experience.

Cenote Samula:  This cenote along the way to Dzitnup is crystal-clear, relatively shallow compared to other cenotes.  I think this was my favorite cenote (of 4 that we went to on our trip) because it was so easy to see the various fish and rocks at the floor of the cenote.  We were there around 11 and it was not crowded.  This cenote (along with Xkeken) has less tourist development than Ik Kil and the bathrooms are a little rougher, but still clean enough.

Cenote Xkeken:  This cenote was really neat because it was like swimming in a bat cave.  Lots of bats flying around the ceiling, which is fairly high.  The opening in the ceiling for light is fairly small so it is dark inside.  I enjoyed it, but I didn’t want to hang out in this cenote long.  Kind of a creepy feel.  We ate lunch at one of the mayan food stations (under a tarp) outside this cenote and it was REALLY good authentic mayan food.  I highly recommend stopping there for a small meal if you are not on a timetable.

295776607.name: A Bucket List experience!
295776607.author: a TripAdvisor user
295776607.reviewBody: It was a magical experience for me! :)  While there were no fish to see (wore my mask and snorkel and tried very hard to locate one of any size!), it was a new experience for me to swim in a cenote!  My only complaint was that I wish it had been longer.  I had thought that given we went here on our own--as opposed to with a tour--we\'d be able to stay as long as we had wanted.  Such was not the case.  Our time was limited to make room, I suppose, for others--I can understand that!  It was spring break, after ll!  The Cenote cannot be seen from above the way one can experience the Sacred Cenote in Chichen Itza.  You must descend rock stairs.  Keep your head down when leaving the Cenote!  I am only 5\'2 and had to duck to get out! LOL\nThe Cenote is beautiful as it contains stalactites in one section which has been roped off to swimmers.  Wanting to go where no man has gone before...I confess to diving under the rope to get a few photographs with my throwaway underwater camera :)  \nOn the farthest wall, close to the ceiling, there is an opening which at certain times of the day, light comes through giving a different feel to the Cenote. I was fortunate enough to be in the Cenote when this occurred :), but even if you are not, you will still enjoy your visit here! :)

293523674.name: Disappointing tourist trap
293523674.author: a TripAdvisor user
293523674.reviewBody: First of all our son of 9 got charged as an adult. The guide, which is tip based, was very not enthusiastic, the place had a dirty feel to it, you have to walk through quite a lot of tourist shops before getting to the cenote. The water was very murky with too many people swimming in it. All in all we felt put off and would not recommend this place.

289981257.name: Spectacular!
289981257.author: a TripAdvisor user
289981257.reviewBody: If you have never visited a cenote, it is a must see.  The water supply for Mexico is located underground in these water caves for lack of a better term. This particular one has a hole in the ceiling so as to allow light from the outside to shine through which makes for an amazing effect. You are also allowed to swim in these pools and it is amazing.  This facility had adequate changing rooms and toilet facilities.\n\nThis visit was in Jan/Feb 2014.

286483950.name: Cenote Samula Review
286483950.author: a TripAdvisor user
286483950.reviewBody:
Cenotes Xkeken and Samula are across the road from one another. Since Cenote Samula does not have it's own page on Trip Advisor, I have left my review here. My review of Xkeken Cenote is located on it's separate TA page. 

The cenote itself is beautiful and is completely underground with a small opening in the rock ceiling where the sunlight shines through to the water. The water is very clear and shallow, with a small rock island in the middle to rest. There are no lockers, but you can leave your belongings down near the cenote on the rock ledges. It costs 65 pesos to enter this cenote and another 65 pesos for the Xkeken Cenote. I took a taxi here from Valladolid for 70 pesos and back for the same amount. 

The site surrounding the cenote is very commercialized, with lots of vendor booths selling over-priced touristy souvenirs, that you are forced to walk through in order to finally get to the cenote entrance. There are no signs directing you to the cenote entrance, but I found it eventually. It feels like you are walking in circles around the vendors until you finally find the entrance. There is alot of concrete surrounding the cenote and I was expecting it to be located in a more natural jungle setting. There were lots of people and children at the cenote when I visited (in the afternoon), but it might be less busy in the morning. 

I would recommend visiting this cenote for a one-time visit, but I probably would not return.

272780508.name: Be there in the afternoon at 2pm
272780508.author: a TripAdvisor user
272780508.reviewBody: Be there in the afternoon at 2pm -> Then you\'ll see the sunlight through the ceiling -> that\'s so nice... they are building the entrance new so no signs - you have to ask when you walk to the cenote. But that\'s ok.

271671527.name: Fairly shallow, cool looking underwater wall
271671527.author: a TripAdvisor user
271671527.reviewBody:
This cenote is good for a quick dip, but I can't say that the trek through the aggressive vendors in the entry way is worth it, and I'm fairly accustomed to this stuff after living down here the past two years... 

Anyway, the water is nice and cool with reasonable visibility, it's more green than the crystal blue color shown in the promotional pics.

The water is about five meters on the back wall, and the stalactites extend down into the water there, which made for some cool underwater video, but it's not my favorite; and I wouldn't wade through the vendors to get to it again.

267432631.name: Cool dip after heat and dust of Chichen Itza
267432631.author: a TripAdvisor user
267432631.reviewBody: Nice, delicious cool swim, but felt a hustled between the paid parking, the "voluntary" guide and kefuffle over whether we had paid for tickets. Blind black cave fish slightly disconcerting. First place that gave me tourist fatigue.

265995534.name: Special feel
265995534.author: a TripAdvisor user
265995534.reviewBody: There were just a few people when we arrived, close to closing time, and that was perfect. Special feel, lots of atmosphere...

258286625.name: Very nice Cenote but a little touristy.
258286625.author: a TripAdvisor user
258286625.reviewBody: We arrived later in the afternoon to check out the cenote when the crowds of people were gone. It was nice as there was maybe 15 people total there. Very warm and and refreshing water.\nLots of booths selling tourist novelties of course. Overall nice Cenote.

252974799.name: Wow!
252974799.author: a TripAdvisor user
252974799.reviewBody:
This is a magical place, and certainly the most impressive cenote we've ever seen. Also known as Xkeken, so there is no confusion as to which cenote I am writing about. Crystal clear blue water inside a marvelous cavern, underground, and lit with sun from above through a hole in the top.

Practicals - Just a few km from Valladolid. 20p each to get there, 70 p for both to return...61p entrance fee (this was on Feb. 6). I rented a snorkel mask for another20 p...so the whole trip was around $17 US  for two. There are life jackets if you need or if you didn't bring yours...there are food stands...there are plenty of bathroom facilities, all very clean and well-equipped. There are many other stands selling various souvenirs, clothing, etc. 

I have read others remarking about "danger", "claustrophobia" , etc. We didnt see any evidence of any of that. There is a  good stairway leading down to the water...there is ample lighting...there is an attendant to help...there are several entry points into the water...and there are ropes (in 6 different spots) strung across the full length of it, allowing you to cross back and forth by just holding on. No particularly strong swimming skills are required. One of those ropes in particular is ideally placed, taking you right under that hole in the roof I spoke of earlier, the same hole you see in the famous National Geographic cover photo from 2010.

We spent probably a bit more than an hour crossing those ropes. The water was comfortable, and we never were chilled. There are quite a few tiny fish in the cenote, and the smallest ones do like to nibble at your skin. Coupled with the bats flying high overhead and making their unique sounds, it was an extraordinary experience. But timing can be important too. There were 2 couples there when we arrived. They soon left, and we were all alone (except for Benjamin, the attendant) until our final trip across. If it were crowded, with many people wanting to use the ropes, with our weak swimming skills we would have needed life jackets so that we could swim wherever we might want. But we were able to have unlimited access. Lucky day, and what a memory!

246582660.name: Two Choices at this Cenote
246582660.author: a TripAdvisor user
246582660.reviewBody: This is a well located cenote between Chichen Itza, Ek Balam and Valladolid. There are two and we went into the one with the dead tree with the roots hanging over the opening. Surprisingly,  it was not overly crowded in early afternoon. Had a pleasant short 30 min swim and took a few pictures.  I visited as part of a tour of Chichen Itza, Ek Balam, Valladolid, and a Cenote. It\u2019s a long day but the best use of time.

244710929.name: Two amazing cenotes & a lovely garden. Careful with taxis.
244710929.author: a TripAdvisor user
244710929.reviewBody:
This comprises two really beautiful cenotes within well kept gardens. The cenotes, Xkeken and Samula get separate reviews.
Xkeken is really beautiful, but we spent more time in Samula.
In between, the gardens are brilliant. Lots of seating. Plenty of birds and butterflies. I rambled off several times and there interesting tracks all around.
Note on taxis. We got a taxi from Valladolid for 40 pesos. On the way back, blue taxis have a monopoly and charge 70 pesos. Not big money, but I don't like being manipulated. We shared a taxi with another couple and paid 20 pesos per person. At least we felt we beat the system!

243744169.name: Great stop-off, can be packed full of tourists
243744169.author: a TripAdvisor user
243744169.reviewBody: There are actually 2 cenotes here, both within a 3 minute walk from reception. 59 pesos to enter either one, it\'s a great stop-off point for an afternoon (or morning) swim. The cenote that we visited was pretty cool - it\'s dark down there and you can see a huge tree root growing down into the cenote from the ground above. There are also catfish in the water, as well as guppy fish (they like to eat the dead skin from your feet) and if you catch it right, you may well have the whole cenote to yourself for a relaxed swim.

242811744.name: Impressive natural formation, but too touristy
242811744.author: a TripAdvisor user
242811744.reviewBody: Makes pretty pictures. But when we got there, a few visitors were frolicking in the water loudly, making the place less impressive.

233381092.name: Graet swim
233381092.author: a TripAdvisor user
233381092.reviewBody: We went after a very hot day in Kabah. It was sooo refreshing! It os pure, fresh, almost magic underground water!

227155315.name: 2 cenotes
227155315.author: a TripAdvisor user
227155315.reviewBody: I already reviewed one of these Cenotes, Xkeken. There is 2 cenotes. Worth both (one is 59 mexican pesos,the other 39, quite cheap). 10 minutes driving from Valladolid. We swam a lot, not snorkeling ( no need ),  , etc. We had a great time.

225949881.name: Well Worth the Side Trip
225949881.author: a TripAdvisor user
225949881.reviewBody: Cenote Dzitnup (Xkeken) is a semi open cenote just outside of Valladolid. This is a smaller cenote and is mostly for swimming no real need for snorkeling and definitely not for diving; the best for diving is still Dos Ojos. This cenote has a small hole at the surface and man made stone stairs into a cave like setting. The need for artificial lighting does add an eerie look to the stalactites hanging down from the roof. But the cold clear blue water is still very refreshing and well worth the side trip for a visit. It cost M$60 to enter.

224692464.name: An absolute must!
224692464.author: a TripAdvisor user
224692464.reviewBody: Visiting an underground cenote is truly an experience.  I did one at Dzitnup and was mesmerized...being underground floating in cool, fresh, crystal clear water, the sun shining in from above with birds darting in and out of the above the hole and little fishes darting round in the water....I was fortunate to be nearly alone.  I can only imagine meditating in such a place, if only I mediated!

217033763.name: Natural attraction
217033763.author: a TripAdvisor user
217033763.reviewBody: Many times we try to visit places where nature shows up almost for free. This is the case in this Cenote (sinkhole) in the Yucatan Peninsula. Very close to Valladolid, a small ancient town about 100 miles  from Merida, amid the sub-tropical Yucatan jungle, there are lots of these cenotes, however, this one has a small light entrance at the top making a beautiful view of the pristine and cool waters where you can enjoy swimming and cooling down. There are some steps to go down this place; watch your step because they are very slippery, beside this the place is very safe. So bring up your swimming trunk and enjoy !!!

215252290.name: Our first cenote
215252290.author: a TripAdvisor user
215252290.reviewBody: You can chose between 2 cenote: Samula or Xkeken. We travelled with young children so they told us to take Xkeken. The kids loved it! Really nice to swim, clear fresh water, very refreshing for a warm afternoon. Fee 59 pesos, children are free.

214745651.name: Beautiful
214745651.author: a TripAdvisor user
214745651.reviewBody: Nice but the stalls with cheap trinkets and extremely pushy salesmen everywhere makes this place feel way too touristy. Also slightly overpriced in my opinion.

210617686.name: Like a postcard, Samula cenote is picture perfect
210617686.author: a TripAdvisor user
210617686.reviewBody: Before coming to Mexico, knowing we would not have much time for some things like cenotes (sadly), I investigated which might be the most worth visiting. I guessed right! At Dzitnup, you have two choices of cenotes and pay $5 US separately depending on which you want to visit -- I knew Samula was very beautiful and representative of the photos that you see of cenotes. Yep, it was gorgeous, and the water was brisk but fine for swimming. There are vendors of course, but just ignore them if you don\'t want to buy something, and head straight down to Samula and swim and swim; you will not be disappointed. It\'s HUGE, something which the photos do not catch, and the water is crystal clear and filled with little fish that will lap at your feet if you stay still. It goes deep. When we went, about two hours before it closed, there were only three other tourists there. There were no lights that I\'ve read about (maybe they turn them on only when there are more people around?). The grounds are also well-kept, but do be careful: I saw a coral snake slither across the path as well as a giant yellow millipede.\n\nThis was so beautiful. I would love to go back every day. And the price was good. Also, good dressing rooms and plenty of places to buy beverages. A bit commercial looking on the outside, but that doesn\'t follow you underground.

206623276.name: More Than I Expected!
206623276.author: a TripAdvisor user
206623276.reviewBody: My wife & I took a trip to the Yucatan in Oct. 1992.  I\'d done my rearch, so returning to Valladolid from Chechan Itza I watched for a sign.  When we arrived at the site it looked pretty bare while on the surface.  But going down the stairs was like going into another world.  Once I saw the entire cenote it was breathtaking.  It is a grotto with a small opening on top.  Water was crystal clear and 72F.  Lighting was by an old electrical system back then.  Not to be missed!

205787481.name: Cenote suprise
205787481.author: a TripAdvisor user
205787481.reviewBody: I had searched for the cenote before we went and there are literally hundreds of them in the yucutan! This one was magical though, the catfish, the depth, how the cave roof had collapsed etc was all amazing to see. Go to a cenote if you have the chance

204044009.name: Beautiful Cenote Samula. Must experience in the Yucatan.
204044009.author: a TripAdvisor user
204044009.reviewBody: We drove out to Cenote Samula from Valladolid and it took about 15 mins. The actual opening time was 0830hr and not 0800hrs as stated in most guidebooks.. We chose Samula due to the unique opening on the roof of the cenote.\n\nThe water was a very clear blue and there were only 4 visitors during the first hour of opening. I\'m not a water person, so it still felt a little creepy to swim in a cenote.

201939336.name: Magical experience
201939336.author: a TripAdvisor user
201939336.reviewBody: We arrived at this place, only a few other people there, on a hot afternoon. I was very fearful but wanted to just see what this was. The fact it was translated as \'sinkhole\' didn\'t help. The path down didn\'t encourage confidence but as it opened up underground I felt as if I was in a magical world. The sunlight streaming through a hole in the top dappled the water and it sparkled deep blue and green. I was worried about swimming as I had heard they were very deep, bit in evee cenote there are ropes across to stand on, or hang on to. After I got confident I swam to the middle and back, a bit of a scramble on rocks to get out but well worth it. Some people hired life jackets to feel safer. The second cenote is more open at the top with tree roots spilling into it, again beautiful but my favourite is the first. We visited several others in Mexico but this remained the best for me.

201641067.name: Spectacular beauty!  Do not miss.
201641067.author: a TripAdvisor user
201641067.reviewBody: These 2 cenotes were absolutely spectacular.  Surreal beauty, I cannot recommend them more highly.  Samula on the right was our favourite of the two, with the roots of the big tree spookily dangling down into the cave.  \nDo go for a swim in the crystal clear water - not as cold as we thought it was going to be - an amazing experience.\nOne of the highlights of our trip!

200802933.name: Amazing experience
200802933.author: a TripAdvisor user
200802933.reviewBody: We got a taxi out to the Samula cenote from Valladolid, one of the two cenote\'s at Dzitnup, and apparently the less visited.  It was an amazing experience swimming in the crystal waters with a few blind cave fish swimming around you.  There were just a few people there, not crowded at all, and I spent a happy hour in the water.  The tree roots hanging down from the hope at the top make it visually interesting  although there aren\'t the great stalactite formations you find at some other cenotes (like the much less known agua dulce & palomites on the Routa Cenotes between Ek Balam and Valladolid).  However Samula is still my favorite cenote for swimming.  Floating under the hole in the roof so you are spot lit by the sun, which casts this great searchlight beam into the water, is great fun.  A small quibble is the lack of good infrastructure with only restrooms (and no lockers) to change, but that\'s minor.  BTW, if you do visit Cenote Palomites, there\'s a new palapa just built with changing rooms and lockers.  Swimming in a cenote is a \'must do\' experience for anyone visiting this part of the Yucatan, slightly surreal (especially if the cenote has few visitors) and great fun.

200741738.name: Very Clean Cenote
200741738.author: a TripAdvisor user
200741738.reviewBody: Although I did not swim in this cenote just inside the town of Valladolid, it is set up to be a swimming hole.  In the middle of a busy city this tiny jungle gem takes you back to a completely different century.  There are a lot of stairs and it seems a bit creepy, but it is very much worth the trek down to take a closer look.  \n\nThere was a small fee, but if you eat at the restaurant admission is free (we found that out after the fact - we went to the cenote first and then ate...oh well).  It was not busy when we went during the week around 1:00pm.  Other people were swimming and the water is crystal clear.  There are a lot of fish - some of the fish are kind of big, but they are harmless or so I was told.  I wish I would have had a change of clothes and just jumped in.  I have regrets about that, so be prepared and make sure that you do not have any!  I did dangle a foot in and the water felt great!

200141227.name: A nice denote, not overcrowded
200141227.author: a TripAdvisor user
200141227.reviewBody: Relatively quiet and a beautiful underground lake to swim in.  The very large cave and the artificial illumination create a wonderful effete of blue and green waters.  It is only about 7k from Valladolid and relatively easy to find.  Access is very orderly.

197764026.name: Wonderful experience floating in the sunlight shaft underground !
197764026.author: a TripAdvisor user
197764026.reviewBody: This is a fun and interesting visit. The underground Cenote is amazing to swim in and very memorable. For me I would have liked more information about the formation of the Cenote, maybe some history or interpretation. Nevertheless, we researched on line afterwards... Maybe also a refreshment area ? It\'s a bit out of the way if travelling by public transport... But easy by car with masses of parking. Overall though worthwhile and memorable visit at reasonable cost,

190362654.name: Nice underground Cenote
190362654.author: a TripAdvisor user
190362654.reviewBody: You can go for a swim in this underground Cenote. Entrance was OK at 57pesos. We\'d preferred if the surroundings and infrastructure would have been maintained better: while the access building is quite promissing, actually infrastructure is quite poor: no real changing cabins, no lockers...  from the main building it\'s about 10min walk to the cenote. Infrastructure closer to the Cenote (there are a few changing cabins, but again no lockers) could be maintained much better, as the cenote itself looks in fact very nice with refreshing water and little fish inside the water.

187823094.name: Absolutely beautiful
187823094.author: a TripAdvisor user
187823094.reviewBody: This was the first ever cenote that I had ever seen and it was beautiful. We were fairly lucky as there was no one else there but a couple of locals so we had the place to ourselves. Absolutely magical. Definitely recommend xXx

187789794.name: Gorgeous!
187789794.author: a TripAdvisor user
187789794.reviewBody: There are two Cenotes here Xkeken and Samula.  Cenote Xkeken is beautiful and it\'s had a more eerie feeling. When you dip your feet in small fished gather and start pecking at the dead skin... pretty ticklish.  As beautiful as Xkeken is Cenote Samula is much more picturesque.  The ambiance and the swimming through the sun light cast on the water is surreal.\n\nI am not a fan that you have to pay two separate entries for what feels like one consolidated place, but I do recommend visiting both.

184087620.name: Wonderful escape from the heat.
184087620.author: a TripAdvisor user
184087620.reviewBody: Fantastic place truly beautiful. And the water is so fresh, its great to see the fish and the bats in there too. Only thing i didnt like was a coloured light which changed from red to green to blue to yellow, that spoiled it a little but still it was beautiful.

174577425.name: Perfect
174577425.author: a TripAdvisor user
174577425.reviewBody: A trip to the cenote was included in my day tour to chichen itza.  This was by far the highlight of my day.  We came here after walking around the chichen itza site in 40degree heat and it was so cold and beautifully refreshing.  It was so unbelievably peaceful and picturesque. I could not rate it higher.\nThere were mini catfish and guppies in the water that decided to give my friend and I mini pedicures too :)\nWhen we visited we were lucky enough that it was not busy.  I could have stayed there all day!

163714524.name: Cenote Samula
163714524.author: a TripAdvisor user
163714524.reviewBody: We stopped by Cenote Dzitnup on the Chichen Itza tour with Go Natural Tours. Our tour guide took us to Cenote Samula where there were tree roots extending from a hole in the ceiling of the cave all the was down to the water and the way the light bounces around at certain times makes it so beautiful. Swimming there was so refreshing!

162525944.name: Go for a swim
162525944.author: a TripAdvisor user
162525944.reviewBody: This cenote is close to Xkeken cenote and a little smaller. It\'s worthing checking out both. I would recommend to go by taxi. Apparently the same price like a colectivo. Very few people in the water.

162282247.name: One of the coolest things I\'ve ever done
162282247.author: a TripAdvisor user
162282247.reviewBody:
We asked our guide at Chichen Itza to recommend a beautiful cenote that wouldn't be too touristy.  He recommended Cenote Samula, which is one of the 2 cenotes here, and he nailed it.

This place was gorgeous, and we were the only ones there.  When swimming in this underground cave, you look up to the ceiling and see a small opening to the outside, with a large tree right next to it.  The roots of that tree stretch all the way down to the water, probably about 40 or 50 feet.

I loved this place and would recommend to anyone looking to swim in a cenote while at Chichen Itza.  It was only about 15 minutes away from the ruins.

They have a bunch of different colored lights making for great photo opps, above and under water!

160381500.name: A Truly Spiritual Experience
160381500.author: a TripAdvisor user
160381500.reviewBody: I visited Dzitnup Cenotes in early Apil 2013.  There are two cenotes at Dzitnup, which is the name of the community where the cenotes are located.  I went to the one which had the most stalagmites and stalactites; I cannot remember its name at this moment.  The two cenotes are located next to each other, and there is an admission fee of approximately seven dollars to enter.each one. The cenote is subterranean and illuminated.  The water is cool, but after about ten seconds, your body acclimates.  There are lots of small black cat fish and guppies, which call the cenote home.  The guppies give your feet a good exfoliation.  There were only about four people there when we visited, so the combo of subterranean darkness and multi-colored ever changing lights, gave the cenote a special feel.  Definately do not miss this cenote, if you are visiting Valladolid.

160186562.name: Pretty cool
160186562.author: a TripAdvisor user
160186562.reviewBody: Attracts crowds for a reason.  Light streaming in from a tree root vined hole in the ceiling make for a pretty spectacular swim.

158644109.name: Excellent tour
158644109.author: a TripAdvisor user
158644109.reviewBody: Visit to Cenote Dzitnup was part of the Chichen Itza tour. It was nice refreshing after visiting Chichen Itza ruins on pretty hot day with high humidity. \nOverall whole tour was very good organized, booked through AAA/ Pleasant  Holidays with Best Day Travel and Go Natural, Playa Del Carmen tour guide. Gama, the tour guide and Gustavo, the driver were excellent team, it was lot of fun to be with them. We learned couple spanish words (very important though) and lot of history of Mexico, Mayan\'s and Yucatan peninsula. \nYucatan\'s Cenotes and Underground river system are very impressive with clear water, natural ventilation, trees\' roots from ground surface all the way down to the well\'s water .... beautiful. Hopefully they will be preserved and kept clean, considering fast developing of the entire region.

158426512.name: Weird
158426512.author: a TripAdvisor user
158426512.reviewBody: The only other cenote we had been to was Ek-balam, after we toured that site.  Ek-balam was fantastic - a natural oasis open to the sky with swinging vines to do Tarzan leaps into the pool, and very few other people around.  Completely natural setting, very refreshing.  Dzitnup, on the other hand, is highly developed, and is a true cavern, with just a hole letting sunlight in.  Colored lighting makes the whole thing surreal, and the vendors are a little out-of-the ordinary.  The teens, however, loved it.  We could barely get them out of there.  The deep plunge end is very deep indeed.  If I recall correctly, the sign said 30 meters.  I know I couldn\'t touch the bottom after clearing my ears twice on the way down.

157930749.name: beautiful and fun
157930749.author: a TripAdvisor user
157930749.reviewBody: Went to the Cenotes at Dzitnup outside Vlladolid as part of our Chichen Itza tour.  Not very crowded, and quite beautiful.  There is a playground out front, so once the kids got tired of swimming, they could play on the playground.  Quite a few annoying vendors, so be prepared.  Only downside to me is that you have to pay for both Cenotes (in other words, 1 price does not get you into both).  \n\nAs an interesting side note, they had some of the cleanest public restrooms I\'ve ever seen.  As another interesting side note, the toilets in the mens room do not have seats.  Perhaps the 2 things are related?

155302128.name: Cenote
155302128.author: a TripAdvisor user
155302128.reviewBody: We booked our excursion with Best Day. We went to this cenote before going to Chichen Itza ruins. They had lockers for you to rent for your clothing,shoes,belongings.You had to shower out in open before going down to cenote.About 50 steps or so to go down to cenote.Allowed to jump off steps into cenote.Water was so clear ! Different levels of photo ops.Be sure and take towels!

153819922.name: Beautiful swim spot
153819922.author: a TripAdvisor user
153819922.reviewBody: Stopped off on way back from chichen itza, there are actually 2 cenotes here and therefore 2 entrance fees which is a bit annoying! We bought tickets to the one on the left with all the stalagtites, you can see pictures before you decide which fee to pay! Its a stunning cenote down underground and is a beautiful unique place for a swim. Wish the fee included seeing other cenote though. Worth a stop for sure.

151853653.name: Excellent excursion
151853653.author: a TripAdvisor user
151853653.reviewBody: This cenote is worth the journey. We arrived early in the day and pretty much had the place to ourselves. The water is clean and makes for a very refreshing swim. The place is well set up for visitors (change rooms etc). Recommended.

149631428.name: underground lake
149631428.author: a TripAdvisor user
149631428.reviewBody: Very impressive place. You can swim in this underground lake and refresh yourself while the weather is hot at outside. But prefer to visit early at the morning, 09:00-10:00. Later it is getting crowded.,

148923175.name: Worth a visit
148923175.author: a TripAdvisor user
148923175.reviewBody:
The cenote with its lights is worth a visit. The different light spots give it a cool atmosphere to relax and have a refreshing swim.
One preview review states that it is not in a good shape anymore. As I have been there only once I can not really comment on that, but I assume it has been in a better condition before all the travellers started going there.
My recommendatio is to take a ride with the bike from Valladolid (30 to 45 minutes / easy to find) and enjoy a coconut after the swim. I really enjoyed it and and can recommened it when you are in Valladolid. 
I also recommend to go there in the morning you then will have the chance to have cenote all by yourself. During the day it can happen that a couple of big tour buses stop there.
Hearsay: I have been told it is one of the better cenotes close to Valladolid.

148476067.name: Cool cenote
148476067.author: a TripAdvisor user
148476067.reviewBody:
My wife and I visited this cenote as part of a tour where we visited the Chichen Itza archeological site and the city of Valladolid.

The cenote was really fascinating and it was great to swim in a sinkhole for the first time. 
I was afraid that the temperature of the water was too cold, but it turned out to be fine, especially after being in the sun for hours visiting Chichen Itza.

129757034.name: A good cenote to visit
129757034.author: a TripAdvisor user
129757034.reviewBody: This cenote doesn`t belong to the natural-adventurer category, but rather to the popular one. This means: it has artificial light and many local families visit the place. The light helps us to appreciate the beauty of the cave. The local people is interested in passing a good time, behave very well and also speak Yucatecan Maya among them. It\'s amazing to hear a live indian language in our borderless world. Definitely it`s not to be missed in a day trip to Chich\u00e9n-Itz\u00e1.  The entrance offers tickets to 2 cenotes separately (~5 USD each). If you have time to visit only one, choose Xkeken, which is the larger and is the one that shows up in most pictures of the place.

124639651.name: Ruined cenote, not like the pictures anymore.
124639651.author: a TripAdvisor user
124639651.reviewBody: I hate to give a bad review of a cenote as the other six I visited were amazing. It\'s not the cenotes fault it\'s the people running the attraction. They installed lights not just on the place you sit and leave your stuff but all around the cenote. The lights are blaring and they periodically change colors like it is a disco or something. I was unable to get a single good picture of the cenote because of it. It ruined the entire experience. Someone warned me about it but I went anyway and wish I hadn\'t bothered. There are many cenote in the Valladolid area to go to without wasting your time at this one.

123648710.name: Beautiful underground cenote
123648710.author: a TripAdvisor user
123648710.reviewBody: Dzitnup is a small village just outside Valladolid on the non-toll highway 180.  It has two beautiful cenotes (I forget what they are called, but they are not called "Cenote Dzitnup").  It costs about $5 USD (~ 50 pesos).  There is ample parking.  There are changing rooms and you can rent a lifejacket if you want, but it is not neccessary.  The cenote we went to was in a natural underground cave with a natural skylight.  It was well-lit and there were ropes to hold on to in the water if you are not a strong swimmer.  There were also fish in the water (small varieties of what look like catfish).  It was not very crownded when we went and there was a variety of people there, including locals and tourists.  The cave is beautiful and the water is pleasantly cool.  This is such a fantastic experience and it is more authentic than the highly commercialized cenotes!  Bring a camera, and a swimsuit and expect to spend about 2 hours there.  We stopped here after seeing Chichen Itza on our way back to Cancun and it was a great way to refresh after all the walking.

119358898.name: Go if you are in the area. It\'s well worth it.
119358898.author: a TripAdvisor user
119358898.reviewBody: A great place to go for a swim in a large ceynote. Plenty of fish in the water indicating that it\'s not stagnant. The water is crystal clear and wasn\'t cold. If you are in the area I\'d definitely recommend going.

668084572.name: Great mapping!!
668084572.author: a TripAdvisor user
668084572.reviewBody:
If you are around this town and would like to have a great experience do not miss the mapping night! 
Spanish at 9 PM
English at 9:30
Always ask before you get there because sometimes they do not show according to holidays or religious dates.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

667519270.name: Beautiful huge and very yellow
667519270.author: a TripAdvisor user
667519270.reviewBody: We all had a great time here. This is second to Rome and the pope came here but not when we were there.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

665390837.name: Don\'t miss the light show!
665390837.author: a TripAdvisor user
665390837.reviewBody: The building was ok. Nothing extraordinary to see. Just a few small rooms and some empty rooms. But the light show was definitely the highlight. The show is offered every Tuesday to Sunday. Spanish at 9pm and English at 9:25pm.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

663343585.name: The light show really is THAT good
663343585.author: a TripAdvisor user
663343585.reviewBody: It takes a lot for me to leave the house late in the evening (yes, 8pm is late for me). And I tend to avoid anything that sounds too touristy or that will draw a big crowd (introverts travel too! :-)). But the reviews on the light show were compelling, so our family made their way to the Convent at 9pm, and we are SO glad we did. We sat through both language versions. It was visually fascinating while also informative (actually, it proved to be a great jumpstart for more learning for our 8 year old. He had heaps of questions afterwards. A wonderful provocation to guide our travels and research!). Totally worth it when visiting the area.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

662090451.name: Interesting convent.
662090451.author: a TripAdvisor user
662090451.reviewBody: Its an interesting convent to visit during the daytime you can go in. Also the garden behind the convent is open if you visit the museum. It shows you the history of the museum and Valladolid.\n\nIn the evening go back to the convent because there is a videomapping of the history shown on the convent. First in Spanish and later in English. Check the Valladolid visitors informationcenter for the times.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

657250748.name: Very Historical
657250748.author: a TripAdvisor user
657250748.reviewBody: we got to see the light show this year. shows the history of the Mayan people of the Yucatan.   both in Spanish and English

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

657071562.name: Sound and Light show
657071562.author: a TripAdvisor user
657071562.reviewBody: This was a great find. At 9pm in Spanish and 9:15 in English there is a sound and light show in Parque Sisal. Images depicting the history of the area are projected onto the side of the convent building. Just wander down to the end of Calzada Los Frailes and sit on the stone wall. Very cool

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

655304418.name: Covent de San Bernadino
655304418.author: a TripAdvisor user
655304418.reviewBody: Beautifully historically detailed, the detail in architecture and design is amazing located next to a lovely park a peaceful place to be. Very picturesque.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

655097512.name: Piece, quiet, history and beauty
655097512.author: a TripAdvisor user
655097512.reviewBody: Though not exactly eye-catching from outside, you may be pleasantly surprised inside the complex. The entrance is only 30 pesos (15 for students). The church is quite simple but it has an outstanging altar. You can visit a small museum, which shows the history of the convent, on the ground floor. Climb to the first floor and you will have a view of the cloister\'s atrium. The walls have - quite surpsisingly - pink colour! \nAnd don\'t miss out the garden with tropical  trees with an old waterwheel (built on a cenote). Very romantic!\n

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

655091731.name: Convention de San Bernardino de Siena is a must visit
655091731.author: a TripAdvisor user
655091731.reviewBody: Originally built in 1705, this beautiful church is really the center of the old town.  This massive structure has a church and a chapel as well as the living quarters on the second floor all open to walk through.  Many historical items on display as well as the church\u2019s original cenote open for view.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

653218250.name: See the Light Show
653218250.author: a TripAdvisor user
653218250.reviewBody: It\'s nice to walk through the Convent during the day, and it looks like there are some grounds to see (couldn\'t figure out how to get to them), but really you should go to the Convent at 9:00 PM for the light show.  It\'s done first in Spanish, then 20 minutes later in English.  Really cool! Check which nights it\'s done.  Maybe Wednesday through Sunday?

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

653004793.name: Beautiful by Day or Night
653004793.author: a TripAdvisor user
653004793.reviewBody: A wonderful place to visit while in Valladolid. The convent is beautiful with a nice museum that gives insight on the Caste War as well as the convent itself. At night there is a light show about the history of Valladolid -- done first in Spanish and then repeated in English

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

651125619.name: Filled with history!
651125619.author: a TripAdvisor user
651125619.reviewBody: Convent filled with history. Beautiful inside, especially the altar and chapel. Worth a visit. Free entrance.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

647183219.name: Beautiful Convent
647183219.author: a TripAdvisor user
647183219.reviewBody: Every night at 9-10 there is a show about the city of Valladolid. This show describes the origins of this magnificent little place.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

647164385.name: Large plaza with nice view onto convent and colonial neighborhood
647164385.author: a TripAdvisor user
647164385.reviewBody: We walked along the nice plaza with good view of the convent. Some of the neighboring side streets are restored while others are remaining in their original state where you can see the passing of time upon the arcitecture. Nice walkabout.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

647152666.name: WHAT A BEAUTIFUL BUILDING
647152666.author: a TripAdvisor user
647152666.reviewBody: As you meander down the scenic Calzada de los Frailes street, you eventually arrive at the Convent de San Bernardino de Siena. We visited the convent on what turned out to be a rainy day, and this created such a beautiful atmosphere in the courtyard! The convent was restored relatively recently.  The chapel is still used and is stunning.  A small museum provides information about the site and its restoration.  In the courtyard is an elaborate system that was used to draw water from cenotes! In the evening on most nights, a light show takes place on the convent\'s walls. Visit and contribute to maintaining this historic building!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

646304034.name: Wow building
646304034.author: a TripAdvisor user
646304034.reviewBody: We rented bikes and we bike to cenotes and came by this buikding.\n\nDon\'t know from or what but it a great picture moment

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

645235371.name: Worth going inside
645235371.author: a TripAdvisor user
645235371.reviewBody: I think it was like 30 pesos to go inside. The back of the main alter is very impressive. There is also a small museum. Out front is the pic opportunity for the Valladolid sign

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

644818640.name: Nice to explore
644818640.author: a TripAdvisor user
644818640.reviewBody: We had time to kill before a buss. The convent has a beautiful pink corridors. Great for photography. Nothing to special. But still nice to walk around

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

641322012.name: In my guided tours to Valladolid
641322012.author: a TripAdvisor user
641322012.reviewBody: I generally bring my foreign visitors to this beautiful place, This old 16th century convent is one of the churches with one of the most spectacular altars that I have seen in all my trips through the Mexican Republic

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

636736242.name: Interesting and cool inside!
636736242.author: a TripAdvisor user
636736242.reviewBody: The convent is a welcome cool spot from the heat of the day.  You can walk around the convent by yourself, and I found the stations explaining the parts of the altar in the church extremely interesting.  The courtyard has an old well that used to be the water supply for the people of Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

636387065.name: A quiet and cool place
636387065.author: a TripAdvisor user
636387065.reviewBody: The church in the Monastery was a beautiful surprice. Nice to walk around surrounded by big cooling walls .

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

630845377.name: Very Interesting Historically, and a bit creepy
630845377.author: a TripAdvisor user
630845377.reviewBody: The place itself is an easy walk from the town centre.  Fascinating history and you can wander around most of the site without any trouble.  We thought it had a bit of a creepy vibe, but we really attribute that to the history of the place.  A lot of things went down there over the years, some of them not to nice.  But, history is history.  Staff were friendly.  Impressive colonial architecture.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

629235693.name: 9pm night show
629235693.author: a TripAdvisor user
629235693.reviewBody: Beautiful park, I highly recommend to go in the evening and watch the movie about the story of the city in english and spanish

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

625082583.name: Nice photo spot
625082583.author: a TripAdvisor user
625082583.reviewBody: We didn\'t go into the Convent because we got there a bit late but it is very interesting architecturally in this pretty colonial town.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

622081778.name: Impressive
622081778.author: a TripAdvisor user
622081778.reviewBody: This was an impressive complex. I just wish that it had been open to visitors. Next time, maybe? It was great to see anyway.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

621924994.name: Walk back through time.
621924994.author: a TripAdvisor user
621924994.reviewBody: Impressive work from the archaeologists who dived in the cenote and retrieved the rifles and other artefacts. There were some antique typewriters and sewing machine on display. There are lingering echoes of the past .

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

621632108.name: Awesome laser show
621632108.author: a TripAdvisor user
621632108.reviewBody: Took a taxi to the outskirts and enjoyed a really cool light show showcasing the history of Valladolid. English and Spanish available!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

589037889.name: Beautiful, laid back, bring bug spray!
589037889.author: a TripAdvisor user
589037889.reviewBody: Valladolid was my favorite stop in my trip around the Yucatan Peninsula (Yucatan, Quinta Roo, Campeche). The convent is beautiful and perfect for pictures. Admittance is really cheap, 30 pesos ($1.50 and they did not take American dollars). Tours are self lead and most of the convent is open to view. Some areas that have not been preserved well are blocked off because of danger and the crypt is blocked off to tourists who do not have family buried there. Bring lots of bug spray and water!! You will need them both.  I would not suggest bringing very little kids since there is a LOT of walking, stairs, and it is very hot. Additionally, there are active services and some very reverent areas where you should to be quiet. There is not a lot of information posted and there is no program or anything, so if you are a history buff, I would google information in advance. The cenotes were closed for construction when we were there, so I can\'t comment on those.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

583172921.name: Incredible Church and Convent!
583172921.author: a TripAdvisor user
583172921.reviewBody: It is a very simple church, but still magnificent. The convent is an interesting one and the museum explains the history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

580005818.name: The San Bernadino Convent is an obligatory stop when visiting Valladolid
580005818.author: a TripAdvisor user
580005818.reviewBody: Artfully restored, this charming little convent is a great representation of Franciscan architecture. Built as a fortress in 1552 it stands as proud reminder of an important moment in the history of the Yucatan Peninsula.\n\nThis picturesque building, set in the residential outskirts of the town is well worth the visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

578148962.name: Beautiful colors
578148962.author: a TripAdvisor user
578148962.reviewBody: Beautiful colors, well-preserved, pretty small.  Takes about 1.5 hours to go through.  Has a small exhibition with explanations at the beginning, otherwise you just wander around.  Great for mid-day since it\'s cool inside and it gets very hot in Valladolid with the pounding sun.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

577664842.name: History and an experience not to be missed
577664842.author: a TripAdvisor user
577664842.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours seeing this magnificent complex. The main sanctuary is rather austere but the altar and retablo are fantastic with some elements dating back to the late 1500s. There are even painted wall elements near the altar in a couple of nichos that are original and give an idea about what the interior originally looked like with vibrant orange and blue flowers/fruit  designs. The side chapel has rooms leading off from it where the locals continue to bury their loved ones in above grade crypts. Then go to the church office to pay(30 pesos) for the convent. See the structure that housed the water wheel for pulling water from the cenote, the small museum with artifacts from the cenote along with excellent explainations of the site and cenote. Tour the cloisters where the monks lived and the service rooms.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

574418364.name: Pretty
574418364.author: a TripAdvisor user
574418364.reviewBody: A cool place to visit during the hot part of the day. Beautiful rose colored walls, some interesting things to look at.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

573853082.name: Fantastic History in Lights at Night
573853082.author: a TripAdvisor user
573853082.reviewBody: We went in the evening on Sunday for the light show. It was an easy walk from the central square. The show started at 9pm in Spanish, and we stayed for the 9:30 showing in English as well. The entire side of the convent is illuminated like a projector screen, and the short film/light show presentation covers the history of Valladolid. It was very impressive, and a lovely way to spend the evening.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

573586910.name: No convent
573586910.author: a TripAdvisor user
573586910.reviewBody: It is more a church than a convent.\nNot what we were expecting. Nothing to see. Can see the outside but not much more.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

573321031.name: something different
573321031.author: a TripAdvisor user
573321031.reviewBody:
It' worth comming here. It's a little bit outside the centre; aprox. 15 min. walk. But on the way to here you'll also a lot of interessting views.
The place it self is very vivd.
A good place for a picnic

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

566819274.name: Tranquil experience
566819274.author: a TripAdvisor user
566819274.reviewBody: One of our favorite experiences in the Yucatan since it was such a peaceful place. Low key for the wandering traveler. Takes you back in time. Upstairs lookout areas offer a nice view.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

561573598.name: Well preserved convent
561573598.author: a TripAdvisor user
561573598.reviewBody: This convent is easily reached by a pleasant stroll from the cener of Valladolid along the Calzada de los Frailes. The convent contains a small museum. For us the most interesting part was wandering through the convent, chapel, and grounds, mostly open to the public, and practicing photo composition. Only a few other tourists were there.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

560267381.name: not too much to see
560267381.author: a TripAdvisor user
560267381.reviewBody: A very average experience, compared to European convents and churches this is a very poor cousin, its small, its architecture is simplistic and devoid of detail, it is unkempt and fairly dirty looking. Looks like its on the verge of collapse from not being taken care of... its only saving grace is that it is kind of quaint in its state of partial decomposition. Nice little park around the place. Worth no more than half an hour of your time, sadly, but truly.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

558464652.name: Gorgeous and Impressive
558464652.author: a TripAdvisor user
558464652.reviewBody: This ex-convent stands in a rare, captivating part of time.  Here you will find extraordinary pink interior walls juxtaposed against a green moss and limestone exterior, precious reliquaries and medieval Christian artifacts, recovered artillery and porcelain pulled from nearby cenotes, and a lucid understanding of the influence of Christianity on Mayan culture during the colonial period.  Light shows at dusk had been advertised throughout the city, but we did not witness this during our trip.  Touring the grounds of this ex-convent was most definitely a highlight here!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

558005348.name: Well preserved
558005348.author: a TripAdvisor user
558005348.reviewBody: This establishment has been very well preserved and is worth the 30 pesos to get in. We started in the garden and worked out way to the cenote access. Because this establishment was purposely built on the cenote, we expected to see more of the cenote. Instead, we found a hole in the ground with some metal screening atop it. While the outside did not hold my attention, the convent itself did. The sheer size of this establishment is enormous and the world trade y\nwent into creating

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

556159479.name: You ll feel like some templar stories are hidden here
556159479.author: a TripAdvisor user
556159479.reviewBody: It is a must visit place in Valladolid, this amazing convent, unique in numerous characteristics, with amazing frescos, great music played from organs during the masses, hiding cenote below its gardens. When you enter the inner courtyard you ll notice a lot of templar mask motives - it was recommended to visit by our host:) We definetly did not regret it.\nWhen we visited in august entrance was free

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

555719737.name: Wow!
555719737.author: a TripAdvisor user
555719737.reviewBody: A great place to visit. Feel the history of this place. \nWatching the light show projected each night on the side of this beautiful building...a definte must when visiting Valladolid!!!!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

555605728.name: great convent and well preserved
555605728.author: a TripAdvisor user
555605728.reviewBody: a nice visit of the convent and the cenote right in the convent grounds. nice walk to get there on a well renovated street from the center part of the city.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

553018670.name: History!
553018670.author: a TripAdvisor user
553018670.reviewBody: I loved everything about this! It was a good size and will take you a bit to look at everything! And it\u2019s totally worth it!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

552571077.name: Frescoes
552571077.author: a TripAdvisor user
552571077.reviewBody: For the inexperienced eye, this can be another church from the many we have in Mexico, but the are some frescoes that really got my attention. Just at the side parts of the transept, you will find one of the most beautiful pieces you will see... they are untouched, no restoration at all up to this moment so basically they are a national treasure.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

550306603.name: Interesting trip into the past
550306603.author: a TripAdvisor user
550306603.reviewBody: Beautiful, tranquil step into the past.  Well worth the low entrance fee to see this historical museum.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

549938570.name: Beautiful but a bit overrated
549938570.author: a TripAdvisor user
549938570.reviewBody: It\'s an old convent with not that much to see in it. In comparison to other churches in Mexico nothing special. However it\'s historical meaning for the region is what it puts it onto the bucket list. It\'s the oldest in the peninsula Yucatan. So totally worth it if you are interested in history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

549358081.name: rigght next door to my favorite restaurant and my favorite B&B
549358081.author: a TripAdvisor user
549358081.reviewBody: in its own special part of Valladolid, a quiet visit to the old Convent ( which is built over a pyramid, and has its own private (not used) cenote.\n\na nice place to visit and then enjoy the nearby Yerbabuena de Sisal.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

548765219.name: Great place
548765219.author: a TripAdvisor user
548765219.reviewBody: If walls could talk.  This place was awesome. Make sure you see it all. Wonderful opportunities for photos. Lots of history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

548729202.name: The austere, historical heart of the city
548729202.author: a TripAdvisor user
548729202.reviewBody: A must see -- one of the original colonial structures, it gives you a window into the history of the town.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

544774181.name: Awesome history and light show!
544774181.author: a TripAdvisor user
544774181.reviewBody: One of the  highlights of  our time in Valladolid was the historical light show at the convent. It is truly a  marvelous  experience.  It is projected on the walls of the convent. The show is at 9:00 in Spanish and at 9:30 IN ENGLISH. WE SAW IT TWICE IT WAS SO MUCH FUN.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

544426431.name: Evening video projecion
544426431.author: a TripAdvisor user
544426431.reviewBody: Times differ in winter/summer time. There\'s a 20 minutes long video projection first in Spanish and straight after another 20 minutes in English. Definitely worth seeing

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

543519870.name: Inexpensive, interesting place.
543519870.author: a TripAdvisor user
543519870.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t say this is a Must do, but if you have time, I would definitely stop for a look inside.  It\'s very inexpensive to enter and won\'t take up too much of your time.   Stop in the small museum. The history is well explained in the plaques around the room. The artifacts they found in the on-site Cenote  are very cool to look at.\n\nGo back at night (Wednesday -Sunday 9pm) to see the free show that displays the history of Valladolid onto the convent exterior.  English version is at 920.   Very well done.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

540924774.name: Good to visit but lacks a bit of content
540924774.author: a TripAdvisor user
540924774.reviewBody: Very well preserved Convent. Small museum. But not a lot of content nor action. Could be nice to offer guided tours or audio support. Also, some parts are not allowed that could have been interested (kitchens, dormitories or rooms, rooftop to get the full view, basement...\n\nSo in a nut shell, worths a 20 minutes stop if you are around but overall I felt that this could be better valorised.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

540033745.name: Impressive
540033745.author: a TripAdvisor user
540033745.reviewBody: Definitely worth the time.  These old churches/ convents are simply awe inspiring  Small museum . is nice, 1500\'s building cannot be described and must be seen

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

538772680.name: My third visit! (Yes I like it)
538772680.author: a TripAdvisor user
538772680.reviewBody: Such a peaceful space and their little museum filled with pottery and guns that were found in the local well is really interesting.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

533616052.name: Interesting to think how they lived here...
533616052.author: a TripAdvisor user
533616052.reviewBody: Interesting to visit in the Valladolid area.  Includes the large historic convent, small museum with items found in the on-site cenote, & church.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

529064258.name: Pleasant surprise..
529064258.author: a TripAdvisor user
529064258.reviewBody:
We decided to visit Valladolid for the day and started off down at the former convent, mainly because there was plenty of parking right by it so we could explore the city.
It is a nice building, set in a bit of a park. Make sure you get your photo by the Valladolid sign LOL
We wandered in to the church, where there is a fantastic carved altarpiece, and sat to soak in the atmosphere... little did we realise that we were going to witness a service and Christening. It was very nice to be involved in this special occasion, and we had a lovely chat with the father afterwards.. he was concerned about the events in Manchester that had just happened (Arena bombing), which we found amazing in such a far away place.
If you come to the Yucatan, you must visit Valladolid, and especially this former convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

526643019.name: Imposing
526643019.author: a TripAdvisor user
526643019.reviewBody: Had a look around the grounds and into the church during the day and then witnessed the light show that evening.  Neither was overly inspiring or memorable, but worth a quick visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

526494343.name: Wonderful Convent and Exceptional FREE light show
526494343.author: a TripAdvisor user
526494343.reviewBody: We spent several days in and around Valladolid on our Mexico vacation this year largely so we could see some of the churches and especially the convent that we had seen while passing through the city on other excursions in days gone by. I know a lot of people have complained about the 30 peso fee to walk the convent but that is less that $2.00 to see a part of history of the region. My wife and I spent over 2 hours walking the grounds, visiting the museum, the chapel, etc. We then came back for the FREE light show on the Convent walls that runs from Wed-Sun weekly. It starts (in Spanish) at 9:00 PM and English at 9:20. Wear sunscreen when you go as it\'s "nightime in the jungle".

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

526436741.name: Nice Mexican Culture
526436741.author: a TripAdvisor user
526436741.reviewBody: It was so nice to visit the city of Valladolid in Mexico and be able to interact with their culture and their people.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

521549760.name: GREAT LIGHT AND SOUND SHOW, OVERALL BEAUTIFUL SPOT
521549760.author: a TripAdvisor user
521549760.reviewBody: The ex convent itself is a beautiful place to visit, it is nice to look at, has a nice church inside, a little park and the famous "Valladolid" sign for the perfect picture. The coolest thing about this building is the video mapping show they do some nights a week, it is good to find out when or which nights they will show it, since it is not a daily thing, it is free and so worth, they tell you the history of Valladolid and the spanish influence in the town. Really pretty, it is in spanish and then in english, about 17 minutes long.\ntotally worth the visit

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

518004969.name: Nice cultural visit
518004969.author: a TripAdvisor user
518004969.reviewBody: Greater historical place to visit. This is a 16th century convent with a beautiful architecture. It\'s a pretty nice visit.\n\nYou can see in the church the 3 beautiful retablos in perfect conditions. The convent has his own cenote (you can not swim there) and a little museum with all the explanation of site.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

505596150.name: Love this place!
505596150.author: a TripAdvisor user
505596150.reviewBody: We absolutely love this place! You feel like you traveled in time once you entered the doors of the convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

503346649.name: Better take it 7pm
503346649.author: a TripAdvisor user
503346649.reviewBody: Great historic place in the Yucat\u00e1n state, and in the night they will pass lights show about the her\u00edtage of the place stating with the mayas, go to the tourist infirmation area in Z\u00f3calo square, its free, and you can learn local historic facts, a must, But 2 hrs walk so take water with you

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

497766409.name: Interesting to visit during the day and later at night for the lightshow
497766409.author: a TripAdvisor user
497766409.reviewBody: This is a quick, free  attraction to visit both during the day and at night during the lightshow.  The walk there is easy and scenic from the centro.  Plenty of restaurants and places to get a refreshment.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

490751587.name: Worth a visit and don\'t miss the evening show
490751587.author: a TripAdvisor user
490751587.reviewBody: The monestary is mildly interesting to visit.  Discoveries thrown into the cenote are worth a look.  The building and grounds will not detain you too long.\n\nBut in the evenings from mid week through the weekend there is the story of Valladolid projected onto the building.  In Spanish at 9:00 and in English at about 9:20 pm.  Amazing.  Don\'t miss it!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

488251543.name: Don\'t come, it\'s rubbish.
488251543.author: a TripAdvisor user
488251543.reviewBody: We came here for an afternoon, paid the modest entry fee and were deeply underwhelmed. There\'s very little to see, and if you\'ve been in any old buildings before you won\'t enjoy your visit. \n\nFeels a bit of a scam that they charge you to come in to be honest. Save yourself some money and go have lunch instead :)

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

488177061.name: Lovely serene place
488177061.author: a TripAdvisor user
488177061.reviewBody: We visited the convent in the morning to avoid the daily tour buses.  Entry to the church and convent are free,  you can leave a donation for the upkeep.  The church and convent are a valuable and cultural asset to the town and every effort should be made to maintain it.  It is a very impressive structure and you can gain access to the second level of the convent which overlooks the inside of the church.  The old water wheel in the garden area is also worth a look at.  The garden is full of iguanas, pea hens and chickens.  The garden is a bit dry at this time of year like all surrounding areas.  One of the priests who still resides at the convent came up to us and asked where we were from and then went and got his atlas so we could show him.  There is a small museum which shows some of the artefacts which were located in the cenote located on the property.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

487808910.name: Historic and interesting
487808910.author: a TripAdvisor user
487808910.reviewBody: we were there on a Sunday night to watch the Light and Sound historic show, where you can learn about the history of Valladolid and the Yucatan. Very nice show and place! it is worth it.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

487374887.name: Hundreds of Years of History
487374887.author: a TripAdvisor user
487374887.reviewBody: We wandered to this amazing convent and took time to tour it (for a small entry fee). It\'s very old and still has two priests who live there and celebrate mass in the lovely church that\'s part of the convent.\nThe convent even has its own cenote for water. Located just a few blocks from the main square, it\'s definitely worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

484786830.name: Interesting history
484786830.author: a TripAdvisor user
484786830.reviewBody: The convent is more interesting for its history than the architecture, since it suffered the ravages of time and neglect, but is worth the walk from the town square.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

484776085.name: Unforgettable experience.
484776085.author: a TripAdvisor user
484776085.reviewBody: We went twice there. First time in the afternoon time and had a very pleasant conversation with the priest there. Second time was during night light show and it was superb. We were surprised to see so many local people with kids peacefully enjoying the park nearby. Must see when you are in Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

483043382.name: There\'s a cenote under the Convent!
483043382.author: a TripAdvisor user
483043382.reviewBody: You can visit the Church for free and on the side there\'s an access to the Convent. It\'s old and a little decrepit but very interesting. You\'ll see a small museum with objects they found inside the cenote years ago. We enjoyed it.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

480735162.name: Amazing lightshow
480735162.author: a TripAdvisor user
480735162.reviewBody: From wednesday until sunday there is a light show at 9pm in spanish and at 9:15/20 in english about the history of yucatan, the mayan culture and Valladolid. It is simply amazing.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

479619273.name: Sound & Light show Valladolid
479619273.author: a TripAdvisor user
479619273.reviewBody: Short stroll from the town centre to this very colourful and clever show which covers key aspects of local history on the wall of the old convent. We saw the English version which started at 9.20pm, not 9.30pm as advised so go early! Well worth it and its only 20 mins long.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

477973679.name: Very interesting
477973679.author: a TripAdvisor user
477973679.reviewBody: Very interesting huge convent. There is not too much to see inside besides the building itself. The building is impressive with its more than 4 ft width walls. The church is also very nice and interesting.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

475424411.name: Only went for the laser show
475424411.author: a TripAdvisor user
475424411.reviewBody:
I admit we didn't enter the Convento, but the show they offer almost every night is a wonderful experience! 

I quote: 

From Wednesday to Sunday the video mapping show for national and foreign tourists is presented on the facade of the former convent of San Bernardino de Siena in the Sisal neighborhood of Valladolid.

"Nights of the heroic Valladolid", is a show lasting 22 minutes. In this time they narrate the most memorable events of the history of Valladolid. The show starts at 9 pm in Spanish and at 9:30 in English. 

It's a free show and a must-see!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

474047386.name: Early spanish colonial convent....
474047386.author: a TripAdvisor user
474047386.reviewBody: Built in 1552, the San Bernadino Convent was interesting to visit, but was somewhat disappointing as there was not that much of the original buildings left intact - eg. the old watermill has been replaced with a modern hydraulic pump, although the ediface itself was intact. There was a small exhibition /museum of the objects found in the cenote supplying the convent\'s water, which apparently was first dived by Jacques Cousteau.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

473680697.name: See the lights
473680697.author: a TripAdvisor user
473680697.reviewBody:
We did go inside which was interesting but not sure it was worth the 80 pesos we paid. The light show in the evening was awesome!! 

For the Spanish narrated for the light show go at 9:00pm for the English narrated light show go at 9:30.

Really worth a look and it's free!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

473008584.name: Wonderful wood carvings and a cool walk into the past.
473008584.author: a TripAdvisor user
473008584.reviewBody: This is a big old colonial monastery built over a cenote and it is interesting.  More importantly today, it was a cool refuge from a very hot day.  The carvings above the altar are interesting.  Be sure to read the explanations out in the hallway.  Also enjoyed all the wildfowl out and around the waterwheel in the old orchard.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

471193902.name: We Visited at a Good Time
471193902.author: a TripAdvisor user
471193902.reviewBody: There was a little street fair going on when we stopped by and that was a bonus.  The convent itself is very interesting to wander through and picturesque. It is definitely worth a 20-30 minute visit on your way back through from Chichen Itza or while you are staying in Valladolid. Honestly, though, the churros and smoked meats from the street fair and the music and dancing added a really fun local flavor. It took the visit to Convent the next level.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

470873784.name: Beautiful architecture, interesting history
470873784.author: a TripAdvisor user
470873784.reviewBody: We stopped at the convent while touring around Valladolid for a morning (we were staying in Tulum, but went to Valladolid on our way to Chichen Itza). It was a very interesting stop! The ex-convent and church was built by Franciscan missionaries between 1552 and 1560, and it\'s incredibly beautiful. They\'re restoring it bit by bit, and the colors inside are gorgeous! It was built atop a cenote as well. For a small fee, you can walk around and explore the church, convent, and grounds, which is well worth it. It even has a tiny museum area with items that were found in the cenote (guns that were thrown into the cenote to hide from colonial authorities) with signs in English. There is an angry goose or two in the courtyard as well as some chickens - don\'t get too close! Definitely an interesting stop in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

470439139.name: Well worth the walk
470439139.author: a TripAdvisor user
470439139.reviewBody: Built in the 1500s in the middle of the jungle, it is incredible to think about. We walked it from our hotel and enjoyed the 15 minutes it took to get there. There is a nice restaurant bar just before you reach the convent and we stopped there for a cold drink in the shade before going inside. Highly recommend it.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

470038312.name: This place was really interesting
470038312.author: a TripAdvisor user
