470038312.reviewBody: I had a bit of spare time in Valladolid so popped in here and was very pleasantly surprised and ended up staying and looking around for much longer than I had expected to. There was a really interesting exhibition with information in Spanish and English showing how excavations had taken place and all the things that were found in a cenote out the back. The convent has lovely gardens out the back. Definitely worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

469384040.name: Amazing light show
469384040.author: a TripAdvisor user
469384040.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the amazing light show. It tells the history of Valladolid. It promptly started at 9 pm for the Spanish show and 9:20 for English. It was truly impressive. Best of all, it was free!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

468690994.name: Don\'t miss it
468690994.author: a TripAdvisor user
468690994.reviewBody: Wonderful place on grand plaza with small museum.  Something always going on there, including excellent Sound & Light show Wed. - Sun. at 9 pm in Spanish followed by English.  Seems as much the center of town as the central plaza.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

468318482.name: Great architecture, interpretation, features, birds, bats, Cenote, colours,neighbouring church, Son et Lumierr show at 9
468318482.author: a TripAdvisor user
468318482.reviewBody:
We three middle aged British guys were looking for something local to do on our second day in Vall (Thursday 16/3/17). I read up TA and found the convent appealing.

We arrived at 15:10 expecting it to be shutting by 17:00 but the desk woman said 19:00! It was only 40 each for entry (the neighbouring church was free of course). We were given a wrist tag each.

We made our way round the fascinating interpretation of the historical artefacts found in the adjoining Cenote (mostly armaments deposited in 1848) and saw the church from the viewing gallery (accessed separately from the front. The garden had turkeys, pheasants and geese in a pen and wandering round as well as a community garden planted by kids it seemed. 

The water wheel had rotted away years ago but the building was interesting and had a resident bat hanging around quite happily! There is a light switch for illuminating the Cenote a bit to give the impression of depth. 

Overall a great attraction for 40 each.

At 21:00 every night is a free Son et Lumiere at the front of the convent and church. 20 minutes of (constant) Spanish version then the same in English but less speech unfortunately. The small crowds of locals and tourists gathered to sit on the walls opposite the building with huge trees behind by the road. The show was impressive light wise, sound not quite stereo. The history of Vall was explained but missed out the Crimes of the Mayors and British involvement in the timber trade.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

467703056.name: Back in Time
467703056.author: a TripAdvisor user
467703056.reviewBody: We visited the convent as part of a day trip to Valladolid. There is a small admission fee (I think 40 pesos) for the self guided tour. Besides the beautiful chapel there is a small museum area with artifacts and information about the cenote and water wheel in the courtyard.  It was a quick stop and I wished there had been more information about the convent and its nuns. All the same it is a worthwhile stop. :)

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

466383758.name: Impressive and Inspiring
466383758.author: a TripAdvisor user
466383758.reviewBody: This is one of the oldest structures of its kind in all of Mexico.  It is beautifully preserved and contains a museum and cathedral that are awe inspiring.  Many of the significant historical events of Valladolid have happened here.  If you are fortunate enough to be around when the computer graphic light show is presented, it should not be missed!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

464598606.name: Get there on Sunday morning if you can!
464598606.author: a TripAdvisor user
464598606.reviewBody: We have visited the Convent several times. Built in 1552 it has a lot of history. But it is also very much alive today especially on Sunday when the place is full for the mass. The choir with children voices is moving. A must see if you spend few days in beautiful Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

464338176.name: Light show is pleasant way to pass warm evening.
464338176.author: a TripAdvisor user
464338176.reviewBody: We walked here from the Valladolid Plaza, takes 10-15 minutes through safe, historic streets. Arrived a couple of minutes after the light show started. The show projects graphic images of historic Valladolid as a narrator provides a historical overview. The projections are scaled to match the convento fa\u00e7ade and the various historical changes to the fa\u00e7ade are shown. The show lasts about 15 minutes and there are alternating Spanish and English versions.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

464158011.name: nice spot
464158011.author: a TripAdvisor user
464158011.reviewBody: very imprssive spot in the town, probably the most interesting in the town ( beside catedral ) . we were really happy to see it

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

462792258.name: Tranquil
462792258.author: a TripAdvisor user
462792258.reviewBody: Very tranquil building. We went in the late afternoon, so not too hot or stuffy. There were a few kids playing on the lawn which added to the incredibly relaxing vibe. Interesting history behind the convent, and there are descriptive boards for both English and Spanish speakers. Also enjoyed the colonial architecture. Certainly worth the visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

461220394.name: Glad we toured
461220394.author: a TripAdvisor user
461220394.reviewBody: Toured here just to kill some time. Very interesting, glad we made the stop. Reading some of the history was interesting. Glad we stopped

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

460444746.name: A Step Back in Time
460444746.author: a TripAdvisor user
460444746.reviewBody: An absolute must do while in Valladolid is to walk el calle de los frailes and explore the convent. There was no organized tour when we were there. Just pay the entrance fee and explore. Also on the grounds are turkeys and ducks. This activity takes ~1 hour or less.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

459171132.name: Light and Sound
459171132.author: a TripAdvisor user
459171132.reviewBody: In 2016 we went to Chiczen Itza 3 times to see the light and sound show (Video Mapping) It was excellent. So when we heard they were doing something similar at the Convent de San Bernardino de Siena we put it on our list. It is on Wednesday to Sunday with the Spanish version at 9:00pm and the English version at 9:30. We were told the opposite so we sat through the Spanish version. It was very well done and something we we definitely recommend especially on a nice warm night if you are looking for something to do. As you walk back to the main square you we see many restaurants that are open and just waiting for you to drop in for some food or a drink. We saw a few places that have just been added to our "Will Do" list. We are staying in Valladolid until the end of March and always on the look out for someplace new to go,

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

458397520.name: Great photo ops
458397520.author: a TripAdvisor user
458397520.reviewBody: We wandered around on our own - there was only one staff person at the entrance and the entrance fee is a donation. An hour or so should be enough to cover all the grounds.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

458043276.name: Enjoyed!!
458043276.author: a TripAdvisor user
458043276.reviewBody: The convent is a beautiful place to visit. You can see variety of birds in the back including peacocks and geese walking around. The museum is small but nice to learn about the history of the place. Recommended!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

456836925.name: Interesting church and convent.
456836925.author: a TripAdvisor user
456836925.reviewBody: The church structure indicates superior architectural skills compared to, say, the  Missions of California.  You get the sense that this is much closer to the center of the Spanish colonial power.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

456776228.name: Historically amazing
456776228.author: a TripAdvisor user
456776228.reviewBody: Our group stopped at the end our visit and it were in awe.  It\'s amazing to have such a well preserved church and monastery in this charming colonial town

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

456412745.name: Fine old stones, plus a sound and light show
456412745.author: a TripAdvisor user
456412745.reviewBody: Last trip to Valladolid we finally took a walk through the Convent.\n\nInteresting history and much less disturbingly  \'garish\' than I find many old churches / cathedrals to be.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

453444981.name: It is a Colonial Convent 470 years old that was built over a huge cenote. fascinating.
453444981.author: a TripAdvisor user
453444981.reviewBody: It is great to visit this convent with its thick walls and big beautiful church.\nThe garden and well is all sorrounded by thick rock walls.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

451578385.name: Interesting to see
451578385.author: a TripAdvisor user
451578385.reviewBody: Something to do and see historic site. Light show Wednesday to Sunday. There is a playground near by for young kids. Great restaurant next to the park.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

451506023.name: Interesting
451506023.author: a TripAdvisor user
451506023.reviewBody: We toured the convent and found it rather beautiful, a bit austere and historically fascinating.  I kept thinking about how the Christians came to this area at that time and changed things so dramatically.  The convent dates from the 1550\'s and anything that old has interest and significance.  The church and altar are beautiful to see.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

451079728.name: Lovely spot with great history
451079728.author: a TripAdvisor user
451079728.reviewBody: We walked from the centre of town and found the Convent easily and it was well worth it. We spent about 2 hours and enjoyed walking the gardens in the back, they have a small museum with English and Mexican captions and then the church. The entry cost is very reasonable. I noticed, although we were there during daylight, the place would be enchanting in the evening as well. There is a great restaurant across the expansive field in front of the convent. The area is pretty and a pleasure to walk through.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

450017356.name: Very nice
450017356.author: a TripAdvisor user
450017356.reviewBody: Nice church at the end of the street of the Friars. Well worth the walk from the centre. The street has been redone and some of the houses are beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

449734409.name: Beautiful historic spot
449734409.author: a TripAdvisor user
449734409.reviewBody: This convent is well worth a good look around for a special view into Yucat\u00e1n history. The museum had a good photography display of the archaeological exploration of the ancient site and cenote.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

448258103.name: Worth a 20-minute stop
448258103.author: a TripAdvisor user
448258103.reviewBody:
My rough memory is that we paid about 30 pesos per person. The very low cost is a plus, because your visit will probably last less than 20 minutes. It's a very interesting building, but some of the rooms are empty. 

The part I found most interesting was the small museum part near the northeast corner that described the historically-significant items that divers have pulled out of the cenote on the convent compound. 

We visited Valladolid to get exposure to colonial Mexico (after spending most of our trip focused on Mayan culture and cenotes), and this convent, as well as a stroll down Calz. de los Frailes and then Calle 41 toward Parque Francisco Canton, gave us the quick exposure we hoped for.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

448135182.name: A wonderful glimpse of the past.
448135182.author: a TripAdvisor user
448135182.reviewBody: A 15-minute walk from the centre of Valladolid the Convent de San Bernadino de Siena offers a wonderful glimpse of the past. The building was started in the 16th century. The thick walls are painted pink in places, and contrast beautifully with the grey of the natural stone. The church inside the convent is beautifully decorated. Outside in the gardens there is a building that covers a cenote that was the source of water for the property. Wandering around the property gave my wife and I a glimpse of what life must have been like for the inhabitants of the convent hundreds of years ago. Well worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

447817367.name: A Must See!
447817367.author: a TripAdvisor user
447817367.reviewBody: What a peaceful spot to visit and see the cenote and waterwheel infrastructure from the late 1500s. If you come here you\'ll enjoy this charming spot.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

447438668.name: Lovely cultural site
447438668.author: a TripAdvisor user
447438668.reviewBody: I really enjoy the Spanish Colonial culture and this is a good example of it as this site was first stablished in the mid-1500\'s.\nI\'d recommend "hiring" a guide to take you around otherwise it\'d be easy to miss out on important facts.\nExpect to spend at least 2 hours here.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

445175378.name: Amazing light show!
445175378.author: a TripAdvisor user
445175378.reviewBody: Ask around and find out if there light show if on when you\'re there. \nAround 9pm they light up the building with a visual light show (first in Spanish, then in English). Only about a 5-10 minute show - but amazing to sit there and listen to the history. Great for all ages!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

442743964.name: Near the Valladolid
442743964.author: a TripAdvisor user
442743964.reviewBody: Walk through the convent free of charge. It is at the end of the famous walk of the friars (beautiful architecture). Nice view of the plaza from the second floor. In the plaza in front of the convent, you will find the Valladolid sign.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

442371180.name: Walking into history
442371180.author: a TripAdvisor user
442371180.reviewBody: I was just killing time until my lunch appointment so I didn\'t have many hours to explore and spend more time in every room. You can definitively see how the place had a time where the splendor was at its top. The church is just beautiful. Kept nicely. It\'s a nice place to visit and enjoy a little of culture. \nI wish the government would put more money into the convent and give a better experience as it truly is a beautiful place.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

440765938.name: An interesting place for a brief visit
440765938.author: a TripAdvisor user
440765938.reviewBody: The convent is well restored and quite an impressive structure. Inside much of it is original. We found reading about the history of the convent quite interesting. It\'s also a pleasant walk up the diagonal street from town to get to the convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

439722296.name: Fabulous!
439722296.author: a TripAdvisor user
439722296.reviewBody:
A "must see" in Valladolid.
Take a pleasant walk down Calle 41A (California de Los Frailes) from the main square to this spectacular former convent, church and walled grounds. Excellent museum with good English interpretation, and incredible waterwheel structure over cenote.
Several interesting artifacts are displayed from a recent archaeological dive in the cenote!
Church has some very old carved wooden decorations.
Pleasant square in front, great restaurant within view Taberna de Los Frailes).
Strong recommendation.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

436481074.name: Worth a visit! A real piece of history and culture.
436481074.author: a TripAdvisor user
436481074.reviewBody: Be sure to ask for a student rate if you are one. They attempted to charge me different fees each time, but it\'s inexpensive anyways. On Saturday evenings in the summer (I think at 8 or 9pm) they have a beautiful light show projected on the building and people sit on the front lawn to watch. The video plays in Spanish first, but then in English! It\'s a cute thing to do if you\'re staying in town for the evening.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

433067875.name: Structure well preserved and interesting to see how large and important this Convent during Spanish rule.
433067875.author: a TripAdvisor user
433067875.reviewBody: This a Convent is about a km from the centre of town along an attractive street with old Colonial houses sprinkled with cafes and restaurants and arty shops. The  Convent is very large but empty as it had been sacked during the Caste Wars but still worth visiting as by walking about you can imagine how busy it would have been when it was full of monks tending the gardens and praying in the large church connected to the convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

432331137.name: Magnificent Colonial Monastry
432331137.author: a TripAdvisor user
432331137.reviewBody: Visited this 16th century monastery/convent whilst on a tour. I was very impressed with the appearance and the  quality of the building. It has been really looked after. The chapel is very pretty and has been looked after well.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

431999649.name: Military fort
431999649.author: a TripAdvisor user
431999649.reviewBody: This from the out side looked like a fort 3 foot thick walls  all around the entire  structure  but it\'s a church , they have a light show at night to show the history  but it\'s not every night so we mist it what a shame we stayed right across the street.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

419630279.name: Beautiful piece of history
419630279.author: a TripAdvisor user
419630279.reviewBody: Take the time to read the walls and don\'t miss the gardens and ruins out back.  Being allowed to self tour was a real plus.  Absolutely beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

418257969.name: Worth a visit!
418257969.author: a TripAdvisor user
418257969.reviewBody: This is not a big deal.  You can see the whole thing in less than an hour really! If you are a history buff or a fan of Spanish colonial architecture this is one you will want to see. there is a small museum inside of the convent. It mostly deals with artifacts pulled out of the Cenote on the property. There\'s also nicely cared for gardens surrounding the convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

400464814.name: Beautiful Convent --- One of my favorite stops!
400464814.author: a TripAdvisor user
400464814.reviewBody: This beautiful convent is right across the street from the best restaurant (Yerbabuena del Sisal) in Valladolid, we wandered in and were awestruck, the entire inside is an amazing aging bright pink, so photogenic! There were very few tourists, and we were free to wanter the halls and up to the second floor, the church was beautiful but the whole place just felt like a special place in the universe, absolutely worth visiting.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

397310932.name: Gorgeous colonial monastery
397310932.author: a TripAdvisor user
397310932.reviewBody: It\'s a short walk away from the central square.. facing the San gervasio cathedral, take the road that stretches to the right along the facade. Though a short distance, the heart can make it seem longer!\nThere is an entry fee for the monastery, but the adjoining church has free entry. The monastery walls are a pink-brown color. It\'s quite atmospheric. Small central courtyard. Take the stairs up and from the upper cloisters you can look down into the church as well. \nThere\'s a cenote on site which used to provide water in the garden outside.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

392671792.name: Long history
392671792.author: a TripAdvisor user
392671792.reviewBody: I didn\'t spend too much time here because, honestly, the site wasn\'t was too interesting to me. If you\'re Mexican or Catholic history buff then you\'ll really enjoy the site, otherwise, there\'s more to explore closer to the city center.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

389894702.name: Great Light Show
389894702.author: a TripAdvisor user
389894702.reviewBody: It is not well publicised - but most nights they do this amazing light show projected on convent walls telling the history of the town. Well worth visiting. When I was there it seemed to be every night (except Monday) at 8.30. Really well done.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

379797700.name: Interesting place with a beautiful light and sound show for free in the evenings.
379797700.author: a TripAdvisor user
379797700.reviewBody: The convent is like most convents with a very interesting though small museum. There is also a decent collection of paintings. \nThe presence of underground cenote ( tho not accessible now) adds to the aura of the place. \nThe light and sound show in the evenings is a must watch if you are spending a night there.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

375845171.name: ancient convent in an ancient town
375845171.author: a TripAdvisor user
375845171.reviewBody: a walk through the convent grounds transports you back in time. its majestic buildings and grounds are beautiful structures worth the time and the visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

372164581.name: Think old here
372164581.author: a TripAdvisor user
372164581.reviewBody: I have been going at least yearly to Valladolid for medical mission work for over 15 years.  Although since closing the old hospital next door it is now out of my way, I ALWAYS walk back to the Sisal neighborhood just kind of to stand in awe of the building, walking around it.  It is said by some to be the second oldest religious building in the western hemisphere.  It is still an active church, but worthwhile to take a tour of it sometime to understand just how inclusive this site had to be to exist.  It goes back I think to the 1400\'s, when the highest structure in USA was probably a tee pee.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

366483422.name: Enjoyable Experience
366483422.author: a TripAdvisor user
366483422.reviewBody: When I travel places, I LOVE seeing the different types of architecture. This was a must-visit for me to see in Valladolid. I found the history of the building interesting, but even better, my young boys also liked it. They especially loved learning about the rifles found in the cenote under the convent. Outside the building, on the fields that surround it, my sons played soccer with local children and I got a chance to met neighborhood folks. There was even a playground nearby for the boys to play on. We came to this area 2 days in a row.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

364710307.name: Beautiful Convent in a charming city
364710307.author: a TripAdvisor user
364710307.reviewBody: Izamal is a quite charming and peaceful city. Locals are friendly and helpful. Not very touristy when we visit. The courtyard was large and enclosed by arcade on three sides. Enjoyed the visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

361781133.name: Part of exploring Valladolid
361781133.author: a TripAdvisor user
361781133.reviewBody: Visit this austere building erected by the early Spanish conquerors. It\'s free and in the evening they project a nice ligth show on its walls.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

359077122.name: cenote in a monastery
359077122.author: a TripAdvisor user
359077122.reviewBody: Lovingly restored, the former franciscan convent provides a glimpse into life following the conquista. Beautiful, sparse altar pieces. the museum showcases  recovered old implements and weapons, paintings and sculptures. There is a small garden, and a cenote (water hole) with a water wheel; it is worth visiting just for that. A very short distance walk from the city center.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

357966633.name: Lovely Setting ...stoic structure.
357966633.author: a TripAdvisor user
357966633.reviewBody: Marvellous stone facade and lovely setting around a cenote , which has a stone structure that used to house a water wheel . The rooms and terraces are a beautiful dusky pink which exudes warmth against the severity of the stone exterior. Very little ornamentation ...but a beautiful convent all the same . The central courtyard is very simple but attractive as well as a small museum . We have seen much bigger convent but this one was very attractive , and we enjoyed it immensely.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

357000176.name: Evening light show is fantastic!
357000176.author: a TripAdvisor user
357000176.reviewBody: While we did not visit this site during the day, the free evening light show is well worth attending.  It\'s relatively short (15-20 minutes or so???) and it is a multi-media presentation on the historic walls of the structure (as opposed to a laser-light show).  It tells the story of Valladolid in both English (1st) and Spanish (2nd); history is interesting for adults and the images alone were enough to keep boht us and our 5-yr old entertained.  We were impressed (having very little expectation coming into this) and thought it was a very nice family-friendly event.  We were travelling with a 5-yr old and, at night, there was a cute little carousel right there that she enjoyed and also some taco and food vendors there as well.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

356672630.name: Excellent Explore at Your Own Pace Location
356672630.author: a TripAdvisor user
356672630.reviewBody: First of all, I had this scheduled for a brief one hour stop. I am so glad that we decided to take our time to explore and experience this lovely and historic site. There are lots of things to look at and lots of places to take interesting pictures. It is one of the few locations where you can go up into the old organ loft and see the sanctuary from above it all. You can go up in the bell tower. It is possible to see the old cenote entrance. The art work is amazing, although somewhat more primitive and down-scale than many cathedrals. We found this visit highly interesting and a nice way to spend the later part of our afternoon around Valladolid. Entrance fees are by personal donation of choice.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

353700397.name: Historic Statues
353700397.author: a TripAdvisor user
353700397.reviewBody: I really wanted to see the light show here but checked with the tourism office and it wasn\'t on that Monday evening. There\'s not much to see but the church has lovely wood carved altars and around the courtyard, photos with explanations in English tell you about all the statues in the altar, some dating back to its founding in the 1500s.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

353312808.name: 30 pesos per person
353312808.author: a TripAdvisor user
353312808.reviewBody: 30 pesos is what you pay to enter.  The grounds are give a very old vibe a neat to explore,  however I am not sure it was worth 30 pesos.  As I was walking the grounds, I saw several folks sneak in through side doors.\n\nI heard the night light show is good but I did not stick around to see it.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

352504519.name: Light Show at Night is Great
352504519.author: a TripAdvisor user
352504519.reviewBody: The light show at night is really well done. First a history in Spanish, then English. The graphics are well done and very vibrant.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

350649479.name: Convent of San Bernardino of Siena
350649479.author: a TripAdvisor user
350649479.reviewBody: There is no fee to enter the church, but we paid $30 pesos per person to visit the museum and grounds of the convent and it was well worth it. The Convent was erected over the vault of a very large cenote, (underground river), and during times of war with Spain, and during the Caste War (a civil war), many weapons and items were thrown into the cenote. In the 1970s, a team of archaeological divers recovered and cataloged several items from the cenote and they are on display in the museum side. They have done an incredible job of writing the history on display boards \u2013 both in Spanish and English \u2013 explaining the history of the convent, the area, and the recovery of items. After touring the museum,we went into the church, which you can see from the upper floor of the museum. Interesting place to visit with lots of great history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

350101187.name: Beautiful Evening Light Show
350101187.author: a TripAdvisor user
350101187.reviewBody: A nice easy walk from the centre of town. The church has a beautiful wall behind the alter, other than that it looked like all the other churches. The light show at night was spectacular! Problem, for me was, it was in Spanish! I was told that some of the presentations are in English and some are in Spanish. I went to the Tourist Information Office at the south east corner of the zocalo. They told me about the light show and also about a waking tour that is offered on Monday and Fridays at 6pm. It is free but I gave him 100p. It was a good overview of the city.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

349159103.name: Discover Guns Recovered from Convent Cenote
349159103.author: a TripAdvisor user
349159103.reviewBody: Quiet and peaceful walk around the building and grounds. Lots of opportunity for epic photos. To reach the convent from the central historic district, walk down the Calzada de Los Frailes past delightful restorations of colonial style buildings. There is a small entrance fee. Stroll around the grounds and learn about the history in the small museum. Some evenings there is a light show on the grounds but on the night we went it did not happen.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

348714098.name: great light show in the evenings
348714098.author: a TripAdvisor user
348714098.reviewBody: we really enjoyed the light show that takes place several evenings a week. We highly recommend watching it.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

347420969.name: Interesting
347420969.author: a TripAdvisor user
347420969.reviewBody: Nice place to visit if you have too much time in Valladolid. But not the most interesting place I\'ve been to.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

345273543.name: Another visit required
345273543.author: a TripAdvisor user
345273543.reviewBody: We went to the convento for the sound and light show, which was unfortuately cancelled that evening. We did tour the church and were impressed with the frescoes from the sixteenth century which have survived in some nichos. The altarpiece is from the 18th century and quite beautiful as well.Our next trip will allow us to tour the entire complex.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

344446182.name: nice church
344446182.author: a TripAdvisor user
344446182.reviewBody: beautiful colonial convent, not far from the centre of town. best visited while taking a walk, the garden is also nice.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

342943091.name: Light and Sound Show
342943091.author: a TripAdvisor user
342943091.reviewBody: We went to the free light and sound show recommended by our hotel on a Saturday night at 6:30pm.  It was awesome!  Would have been great if there were signs at the gift shop or somewhere prominent to know when the show was happening.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

342671880.name: Amazing at Dusk
342671880.author: a TripAdvisor user
342671880.reviewBody: We didn\'t expect much but were pleasantly surprised, the lighting and atmosphere as the sun is setting is pretty amazing and would recommend this time of day to go.\nIts nice just to wander round and take in the building, and a pleasant stroll from the main square.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

342178679.name: Go see the light and sound show
342178679.author: a TripAdvisor user
342178679.reviewBody: We visited the convent during daylight hours - it was interesting enough.  We then happened upon the light and sound show around 8:30 in the evening.  It was free and fantastic!  We saw no information telling us this would occur either in other reviews or at the convent.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

340533907.name: Beautiful especially at dusk
340533907.author: a TripAdvisor user
340533907.reviewBody: Valladolid has two main historical attractions - the historic centre or plaza mayor as well as the convent of San Bernardino - looks a lot more impressive at around 5 or 6 pm as the lights come on and the sky is dark blue! Don\'t forget your camera - excellent shots not to be missed!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

340108609.name: beautiful
340108609.author: a TripAdvisor user
340108609.reviewBody: Just another beautiful neighborhood in this charming colonial city. I wish we could have spent another night here. At night they light up the convent but we missed it. There is a denote beneath it and it has such a rich history coupled with beautiful architecture!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

339001877.name: Pray and love
339001877.author: a TripAdvisor user
339001877.reviewBody: We stepped in the convent at night and it was a magical experience. Even those who are not religious succumb to its charm. The convent is simple, modest but transmits this peace. At a night of full moon the entire square was lit and a soft light was spreading at its doorstep. Go light a candle at the open air annex. This was a moment to cherish. A sky full of stars and a few candles burning gently in the frescos of this open air annex. Simply beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

337606794.name: Beautiful place full of history. Perfect for time travel.
337606794.author: a TripAdvisor user
337606794.reviewBody: This convent has the second atrium in Yucatan peninsula and it\'s full of history and well preserved. There is a small museum to know the history and the wars that took place here. Don\'t miss walking around, watch its deep well where they took the water and let your imagination fly, you might see a monk floating around ;)

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

337471729.name: Interesting
337471729.author: a TripAdvisor user
337471729.reviewBody: Old convent at the end of a beautiful street 15 minutes walk southwest of the plaza. Well worth a short visit and the reasonable entrance fee. Also a backyard with some ruins

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

336113504.name: Interesting structure with a nice little museum
336113504.author: a TripAdvisor user
336113504.reviewBody: Only 30 peso admission price.  Nice little diversion while I was waiting for my bus departure.  Many historical artifacts on display.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

335325791.name: Its a fortress
335325791.author: a TripAdvisor user
335325791.reviewBody: This old convent and church is awesome in design. It was used as a fortress during i believe in one of the wars with the spanish. The walls are 5ft thick and the windows look like gun ports in design. It was basically a self reliant walled fort. Complete with cenote and garden area. If you visit Valladolid you should take the time and visit. There is a small museum there as well

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

335293335.name: Take the time to visit and explore
335293335.author: a TripAdvisor user
335293335.reviewBody: We loved the grounds and the interesting and well kept building. Waterwheel was worth the walk from our hotel..stay for the mass if you have the time.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

333180038.name: Great Place to Explore and Fascinating History!
333180038.author: a TripAdvisor user
333180038.reviewBody:
The Convent de San Bernardino is located at the end of the historic and well maintained diagonal street known as Calzada de los Frailes (about a 15 minute walk from Valladolid’s central square). There is a beautiful park surrounding the convent, which is a great place to relax. 

The convent itself has a lot of historical significance and I recommend doing some reading about it before you visit, either in a guidebook or via online sources. 
The church inside the convent is still used for services. When I walked in to the convent, there was a service being held, which was interesting to sit in on for a little while. 

What I really enjoyed about this place, was just wandering around through the pastel pink coloured corridors, checking out the central courtyard, the cenote/water wheel in the beautiful gardens behind the convent and peeking around in small rooms and climbing narrow staircases in random areas around the building. I was completely alone and had the entire place to myself, which was super cool but also kind of eerie. 

The hallways all look identical so make sure to take note of landmarks and which way you entered, so you can find your way back to the entrance. It’s very easy to get turned around and lost once you’re inside, if you’re not paying attention to the details! 

I highly recommend a visit to this convent when you are in Valladolid. It was definitely an interesting place and I enjoyed exploring it!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

332418056.name: Built Like a Fortress
332418056.author: a TripAdvisor user
332418056.reviewBody: Though the area had been taken by the Spanish from the Mayans, there was still fear of reprisal from the locals so this monastery (yes I know it is called a convent, but friars lived there, not nuns) was built to withstand attacks.  The inside is very bare and simple as Franciscans lived there.  But that just adds to the beauty.  My guide and i spent almost an hour wandering around and viewing all the nooks and crannies.  Be sure to go into the little museum and visit the waterwheel (there is a light switch).

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

332170768.name: A great attraction, especially the new archaeological findings
332170768.author: a TripAdvisor user
332170768.reviewBody: The best way to see this excellent 16thC monument is to walk down the Calzada de los Frailes (The Walkway of the Friars) just along Calle 41 out of the main plaza, taking in the facades of the wonderfully restored colonial barrio buildings until you come to the expansive plaza that hosts the Convent. Even for folks that are not religious, this is a fascinating building seeped in history. Entry is a measly 30 pesos. Unfortunately, there is no guide material but there is enough of the restored pink and terracotta cloisters on three levels to evoke the building\'s usage. Just next to admission desk there is also a nice little museum detailing the archaeological artefacts found dumped in the adjacent cenote - including most notably some rifles sent by the Brits from Jamaica during the War of the Castes in the mid-19thC. Here you will find commentary in English as well as Spanish. Outside, you can climb into the cenote and see the well where they were dumped, as well as several peacocks.\n\nI would recommend a visit. There is surprising more to see than I expected

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

329038389.name: Must visit in Valladolid
329038389.author: a TripAdvisor user
329038389.reviewBody: This is a very interesting place in Valladolid and is definitely a must see.  The entry fee is very cheap and gives you access to the small convent, museum and the church.  The infrastructure is not in very good shape but you can feel some historical vibe during the excursion.  The gardens and exterior access to the cenote (now closed) is also interesting.  It has a lot of potential and a guided tour is missing to really understand the meaning and connection of many artifacts and historical references around but overall is really worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

327273787.name: Pink!
327273787.author: a TripAdvisor user
327273787.reviewBody: One of the oldest convents with lots of pink corridors. It would have been nice to get a leaflet or something with some of the history details. There is also a church with interesting altar paintings. The convent is situated on a large square which creates an unexpected and amazing space, framed by nicely renovated old buildings. There is a very nice looking restaurant in one of the corners but it only opened when we left. should be a perfect lunch spot.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

326388107.name: Excellent value for money
326388107.author: a TripAdvisor user
326388107.reviewBody: I spent a long time wandering around this site as it has a lot to see. I enjoyed the church with the beautiful walls and saints and it was very informative (signs). I then looked upstairs (not much to see) and went down to the museum and out into the garden to see the water wheel. I enjoyed my time and was surprised at how big it was!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

325540998.name: Worth a visit
325540998.author: a TripAdvisor user
325540998.reviewBody: Interesting old convent and can explore all areas. Worth a visit whilst in Valladolid. Is about a 15 minute walk from the park centre. Entry by donation. Lovely cafe next door.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

316368148.name: Not bad,
316368148.author: a TripAdvisor user
316368148.reviewBody: An old convent. Pretty much a ruin, but an interesting spot to take a walk around. The garden was nice.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

296764174.name: A special trip through history
296764174.author: a TripAdvisor user
296764174.reviewBody: We spent 30 pesos each to tour the convent and really took our time going through it. The gardens and water wheel on the back were really neat. There is a grove of banana trees and lime trees. The covent even has a little museum. Worth the trip.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

287969143.name: Lovely convent
287969143.author: a TripAdvisor user
287969143.reviewBody: Really enjoyed looking around this convent. Beautiful gardens and you can go around whole convent. It also has its own cenote in the gardens along with orange trees

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

287452650.name: Wonderful old church and abbey.
287452650.author: a TripAdvisor user
287452650.reviewBody: Beautiful structure from the 1500\'s. Lovely grounds in a park like setting. A cenote on the grounds provided water to the monks that lived here. A nice way to spend a couple of hours.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

286713165.name: Amazing to Explore this Historic Former Convent! I Had The Whole Place to Myself!
286713165.author: a TripAdvisor user
286713165.reviewBody: The Convent de San Bernardino de Siena is a former convent with lots of history. There are orange-coloured information posts in front of the convent, explaining some of the history. A portion of the convent has now been converted into a museum with a small cost, which I did not explore. However, you are free to explore the inside of the convent on your own. I wandered all over the interior and I was literally the only person there! The walls are painted a pastel pink colour and every aisleway looks the same, so it is easy to get turned around if you\'re not paying attention to landmarks and tracing your route back. There is a courtyard in the center of the convent and framed photos of what the former convent looked like hanging on some of the walls. You can explore all of the various little rooms stemming off from the aisleways as well as the many dark and creepy staircases. There is a beautiful garden on the grounds with a well built overtop of a cenote, which the nuns used as a water source back in the day. There is also a church in the convent which still holds regular services, and it was interesting to sit in and listen. I highly recommend taking the time to explore this beautiful and historic convent when in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

273203585.name: A throwback in history, we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves !
273203585.author: a TripAdvisor user
273203585.reviewBody: This is a pretty extensive complex as its a former convent for monks.  Now it serves as some type of museum.  Once you pay the nominal admission, you\'re free to wander around... and wander we did!  I can imagine, kids would get a kick out of this place as its very historic and old world feeling, like roaming through a castle.  In the courtyard, there is even a cenote with a well built over it that you can view.  We were literally the only tourist there.  We had a great time running around and being silly making spooky sounds!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

271824415.name: History in the Yucatan
271824415.author: a TripAdvisor user
271824415.reviewBody: Great quiet place to begin ones visit to Valladolid. About a half mile walk from main square...I\'m not religious...but this place is spiritual....and full of interests...states, architecture, and solitude . The walk there is quite interesting as well...18 th century streets line the way with shops, restaurants and hotels.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

263758548.name: Interesting but could be better maintained.
263758548.author: a TripAdvisor user
263758548.reviewBody:
We visited this to get out of the sun and it was cooling and enjoyable to find some peace from the busy town.

However, the place didn't seem to be well run and a lot of the rooms were just empty or had some random items like chairs and boxes.

The museum part was interesting showing you some old guns and objects they had found within the local cenote but nothing really special.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

258808277.name: first time visit
258808277.author: a TripAdvisor user
258808277.reviewBody: We pass thru Valladolid almost every year but this is the first time we were able to visit the convent. It is very historic with impressive architecture that says that the convent was as much a fortress as a house of worship as was appropriate four hundred years ago. I especially liked seeing the noria or water wheel, apparently the second biggest in the Yucatan. It is not completely intact but the architecture gives you the idea.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

258782636.name: Interesting building
258782636.author: a TripAdvisor user
258782636.reviewBody: I spent some time here recently on a single night stay in Valladolid and found it a more interesting landmark in the town. It is located away from the other points of interest but its a nice stroll down Calle 41 through a quieter area to reach. The building is of some size and you can stroll around it in an hour or so. There are some nice pieces on display that were excavated on site along with photos of the dig and descriptions of the objects.\n\nThe grounds in the back contain a cenote but this is not visible from above and the grounds are not  in great shape either. The building itself could be in better shape but it is interesting and it wont take you too long to appreciate it and the history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

255431567.name: An Historic Adventure
255431567.author: a TripAdvisor user
255431567.reviewBody: Valladolid is billed as a "colonial city" near several "archaeological zones."  We headed there from Coba because such cities are usually very interesting.  We enjoyed a walk around the city, a fun lunch and a visit to Convento de San Bernadino de Sienna. We were fascinated by what we saw.  The structures are well preserved and displays, somewhat old and sometimes poorly lit, have important information.  We were especially captivated with the story pertaining to the excavation of the cenote.  This was definitely worth the admission and our time.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

254515708.name: Convent near our hotel
254515708.author: a TripAdvisor user
254515708.reviewBody: A pretty church and the monastery is preserved as a museum. There is an exhibit about its place in the Caste Wars, important in the history of the area. There is a nice garden complete with colourful rooster and chickens. A cenote provided the water for the monks, and that is explained as well. The convent is situated on a pretty, quiet square full of dogs playing, or children playing soccer. A nice place to sit and watch the locals. And there are a few restaurants around the square and along the tourist street nearby.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

253281027.name: Wonderful experience for history lovers
253281027.author: a TripAdvisor user
253281027.reviewBody:
We paid three dollars to get in and we were literally the only people in this huge convent complex. The architecture and interior spaces are amazing. If you are a photographer you will get incredible shots here. We were able to wander through dozens of rooms on multiple levels and drink in the historic vibe in complete isolation.

There are several beautiful chapels and lot's of weird Mexican religious art. Like a life sized wooden Jesus laid out in a coffin like at a funeral.

There are good museum displays explaining the history, which is fascinating, in english.

It was easily 100 degrees outside, but it was cool and comfortable within the 3-foot thick adobe walls and cool, shady courtyards. A wonderful experience.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

252422327.name: OK
252422327.author: a TripAdvisor user
252422327.reviewBody: Not sure if we hadn\'t had a car that we would have bothered to go here.....however we had a fantastic lunch first at the restaurant close by!!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

251518595.name: The Monestary
251518595.author: a TripAdvisor user
251518595.reviewBody: Massive building full of secret corridors and doors, good setting for a movie mystery thriller. I especially like the walled garden at the back with the cenote and water wheel and fruit trees.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

249877259.name: Looks alright
249877259.author: a TripAdvisor user
249877259.reviewBody:
I only biked by while riding around the city. Looked okay. I only saw the exterior so I think the interior would be more interesting.  Something to do next time I make a trip out!

Many people, especially young local couples were around. Maybe a good date place or somewhere people can be romantic?

Worth a pop by if you're in Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

249195155.name: NICE PIECE OF ARCHITECTURE
249195155.author: a TripAdvisor user
249195155.reviewBody: This is a unique design for a cathedral. It looks like it was a Mayan ruin converted to a cathedral.  I went as a part of tour that included Chichen Itza, Valladolid, and Ik Kil (the cenote). The cost was $50 per person including lunch and all entrance fees. I later discovered how beautiful Valladolid really is while the bus was driving us through it and wanted to come back, however the trip is 5 hours by bus and my time in Riviera Maya was running out. If you have time I would recommend coming to Valladolid via the ADO bus on your own from Cancun. That way you can really enjoy the  colonial town, people, food, and photograph the architecture without rush.  This site is the highlight of Valladolid but the town have so much more. Happy Travels!!!.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

245683026.name: Marvelous visit!
245683026.author: a TripAdvisor user
245683026.reviewBody: Awesome 16th century buildings. Amazing place for photo amateurs. The jardin at the back is priceless.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

241180810.name: Beautiful old building, peaceful garden, interesting history
241180810.author: a TripAdvisor user
241180810.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old building inviting quiet reflection and providing lots of opportunities for pictures. You could see most of it in 10 minutes, but it is also possible to spend the better part of an hour wandering the corridors, the garden, and the site of the old Cenote. Lots of signs with explanations, both of the art (religious), and the history of the site, its role in the rebellion, and the excavation of the Cenote.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

241173596.name: Magical
241173596.author: a TripAdvisor user
241173596.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this when in Valladoild!  Built over a cenote the Convent de San Bernardino de Siena has a magical energy. The colonial era cathedral was built by Franciscan missionaries between 1552 and 1560. It is located in the Sisal neighbourhood and is a short 10 minute walk from downtown down Calzada de Los Frailes, a pleasure in itself, where you\'ll pass Coqui Coqui and Dutzi Design. In front lies a beautiful park where you may see locals flying a kite, playing soccer, and cuddling on benches. Make sure to also wonder through the garden behind the monastery where you can see down into the cenote in a couple of places. There\'s also a small museum attached and several adjoining chapels. I let you discover the rich and fascinating history of the place when you go! And I highly recommend eating at Yerba Buena across the way for surprisingly fresh lunch.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

238738735.name: good place to see
238738735.author: a TripAdvisor user
238738735.reviewBody: great place to visit a sense of the past and the history of the country, the interior as the exterior is beautiful, i recommend a night or late evening visit when the exterior has light, walk to the convent from the downtown via Calle del Fraile

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

238317716.name: No t a convent
238317716.author: a TripAdvisor user
238317716.reviewBody: Convento = monastery whereas monasterio = convent. Go figure! When I was here the monastery was locked and only the adjacent, and beautiful in an austere way, church was open.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

235800113.name: Beautiful
235800113.author: a TripAdvisor user
235800113.reviewBody: Visited San Bernardino on a recent trip to Ek Balam and was not disappointed.  Built in the early 1500s the building is amazing and the main chapel is beautiful.  On the day in October that I visited you could tour the building for 30 pesos and a wonderful lady offered to give me a tour for an additional 30 pesos.  So, for $6 US I was able to see everything.  Well worth the time to stop by and take a look.  A little insight into the history of the area and a very peaceful place to reflect.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

232698145.name: Peaceful and historic
232698145.author: a TripAdvisor user
232698145.reviewBody: Had the convent to myself which enhanced the experience (I went early morning). Lovely peaceful gardens and cloisters. Small but interesting museum containing artifacts recovered from the cenote in the gardens. A nice way to pass an hour or two

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

224453393.name: A  Jewel to be discover
224453393.author: a TripAdvisor user
224453393.reviewBody: Amazing Convent church and museum that is very well preserved, by walking along the red color corridors one can fell a taste of antique history of Yucatan.\nA must to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

224267792.name: Well worth a visit
224267792.author: a TripAdvisor user
224267792.reviewBody: Only a short walk out of town and we very much enjoyed visiting this.  There is a nice garden to walk round too.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

214305411.name: its an amazing place!!
214305411.author: a TripAdvisor user
214305411.reviewBody: Its an old building that represents much of the history of this town. people and the priest are so kind, and walk around the convent is amazing!!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

213478445.name: Beautiful convent
213478445.author: a TripAdvisor user
213478445.reviewBody:
Beautiful convent you must visit. 
Nice place to visit when it is hot outside.
The sun shining into the convent gave it a very special light to take beautiful pictures.
Hidden small stairs to discover

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

207146478.name: Great place at a great time
207146478.author: a TripAdvisor user
207146478.reviewBody: We arrived at night in the week prior to Easter... there were communal meals being prepared by the parishioners outside, music, laughing, and lots of things to view and contemplate.  It\'s great visiting a place where the \'tourists\' are 99% locals.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

201856621.name: Beautiful and historic building.
201856621.author: a TripAdvisor user
201856621.reviewBody: Very informative so you can self-tour...we didn\'t know that a guide could be hired and take you to the top of the bell tower but I doubt my asthma would have allowed me to climb all those stairs!  Would have been a great view, though, I am certain.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

193172034.name: hidden peace
193172034.author: a TripAdvisor user
193172034.reviewBody: This well-preserved convent exceeded my expectations. The interior of the church was nicer and better adored than the main cathedral in Valladolid centro. The grounds are well maintained, and features huge lawns and a peaceful neighborhood.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

193008013.name: A must do in Valladolid
193008013.author: a TripAdvisor user
193008013.reviewBody: Loved this place. Beautiful and peaceful - we wandered around the building and grounds for some time. There\'s a little room with some history about how they did the restoration and what they found. We almost didn\'t make it here but so glad we did. Stopped for lunch at Taberna de los Frailles afterwards, which is right next door. The short walk back to the centre of town along Avenue of the Friars is lovely - a beautiful, quiet, and photogenic street. On the way you\'ll pass by the chocolate shop, perfumery, and tequila shop (pushy salespeople giving samples of delicious but expensive tequila.)

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

192545288.name: very beautiful
192545288.author: a TripAdvisor user
192545288.reviewBody:
We went here on a day when it rained. The upstairs of the building in hauntingly beautiful......

They want me to say more but isn't that enough reason to visit.…...
Ah! Please, please do not restore or touristify this place the beauty is in its tiredness

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

190540618.name: Beautiful Old Building
190540618.author: a TripAdvisor user
190540618.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful old building to walk around and look at.  

An opportunity is being missed at this site to have a knowledgeable person on staff to do tours and share the historic information of this building.  

Definitely worth a visit if you are in the city.  

There is also a lovely restaurant / bar beside the back parking lot where we stopped for a drink afterwards.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

190338003.name: Beautiful historical church and friary from 1552.
190338003.author: a TripAdvisor user
190338003.reviewBody: Wonderful to see this really old church and friary.  Special visit.  Make sure you walk around, check out the courtyard and the gardens and the water wheel.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

190182228.name: 16th century convent worth a visit
190182228.author: a TripAdvisor user
190182228.reviewBody: entrance is 30 pesos, about $2.50, per person; we were not aware of any guided or self-guided \'tour\', but certainly appreciated the ambiance and history of the site. Archeologists work on the third floor studying and classifying artifacts. wander around the garden and to the cenote which provided water for the convent, too. Chapel is awesome.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

181267837.name: Worth the Walk
181267837.author: a TripAdvisor user
181267837.reviewBody: Its a bit out of town from the main square but well worth the walk and interesting shops/places along the way.  A beautiful old structure inside and out.  A modest entry fee is charged.  You will need about an hour to explore the building and grounds.  The church is being restored.  A nice find.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

177655193.name: Impressive site
177655193.author: a TripAdvisor user
177655193.reviewBody: We visited during the low season, so there was not a lot going on. Unless you count the conservation work that was happening on the grounds. We were able approach the young people working on the frescoes and altars and chat with them about the process. A nice behind-the-scenes peek. Other than that, the really striking thing about this place was the austerity of it. It was built in the mid-1500s, and its fort-like demeanor gives an idea of the still-beligerent relations between the Spaniards and Mayans. Very different from the ornate churches of 200 years later in Central Mexico--where and when the conquest was an established fact.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

175968158.name: Beautiful.
175968158.author: a TripAdvisor user
175968158.reviewBody: In this place you will understand the culture on the south side of mexico. Beatiful, full of history and mistery.  The main square and the inside of this church makes you feel on a very special place. Visit the cenote inside the building and take a look on the rescued objects from the bottom.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

167728918.name: Nice place - but not much there
167728918.author: a TripAdvisor user
167728918.reviewBody: There was no one around so we just wandered around. Basically an old church - not super impressive. There is a lot of history though.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

156834901.name: Excellent history and exhibits
156834901.author: a TripAdvisor user
156834901.reviewBody: This old convent is beautiful in and of itself, but it also has some really interesting historical exhibits.  One is about the research they are doing about the cenote on the premises in which they have discovered all sorts of interesting historical artifacts.  As a tourist without a lot of knowledge of the area, I thought it was really interesting to learn more.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

156171398.name: Great street food outside!
156171398.author: a TripAdvisor user
156171398.reviewBody: Visited at night time and got lost inside, couldn\'t believe I was walking on my own through corridors and a big patio, going past valuable works of art and nobody ever noticed! Took me a while to find my way out but it definitely deserves a visit during the day.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

156164740.name: awed by the history
156164740.author: a TripAdvisor user
156164740.reviewBody: The cenote on the property and the museum. Leave lots of time and get a guide. The restaurant next door s very good for dinner so plan accordingly.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

155602121.name: go back in time
155602121.author: a TripAdvisor user
155602121.reviewBody: beautiful and very old convent. Artifacts,photos and nice yard with animals roaming around. A very enjoyable outing and very easy to access from the town cental park or zocalo.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

153690260.name: Very interesting historic site!
153690260.author: a TripAdvisor user
153690260.reviewBody: A really beautiful and interesting building to explore. Neat to learn more about the city\'s colonial history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

151785124.name: Lovely but rather insignificant
151785124.author: a TripAdvisor user
151785124.reviewBody:
We spent about 20 minutes here

It is free to visit and close to the main square. 

While we liked seeing the site it was an add on and we would not recommend a special visit.

If passing by do stop in.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

150945596.name: Interesting and historical
150945596.author: a TripAdvisor user
150945596.reviewBody: Worth investigating.  Walk up and down the stairs.  Poke into rooms.  And wander out back.  There is an interesting pool type structure with a bridge.  Looks like it was a pool.  But for nuns?  Or?

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

150145443.name: No guide required
150145443.author: a TripAdvisor user
150145443.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday after mass, what a peaceful experience. The sign boards around the property explain things very well. It was a nice way to escape the heat and let your mind wander in the stillness of the building.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

148093355.name: Nice place
148093355.author: a TripAdvisor user
148093355.reviewBody: Unfortunately most of the artifacts are gone but the building and church are nice. Can spend owner two leisurely hours there.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

145759291.name: check that it is open.
145759291.author: a TripAdvisor user
145759291.reviewBody: A monastery with much interest and well kept up and it is easy to get to. I would suggest certainly leaving time to go there.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

144885160.name: Small and peaceful
144885160.author: a TripAdvisor user
144885160.reviewBody: We got here accidentally on our way to the Cathedral at the center of Valladolid.  The church is small compared to the Cathedral, but solemn with its history.  A gentleman, I believe he is local, in the church told me that the construction of the church started 1552 and ended 1560.  There\'s a museum in the monetary at the side of it, which need a fee.  Due to the lack of time, we did not enter the museum.  But it\'s a nice short stop.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

144039597.name: Small but ok
144039597.author: a TripAdvisor user
144039597.reviewBody: Don\'t expect epic tales about this place but it is ok to visit it. Not a lot to see, but a nice stop

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

143189985.name: Enjoyable visit
143189985.author: a TripAdvisor user
143189985.reviewBody:
Liked - The convent was very pretty, quiet, not too touristy and very nice to look around.

On the down side, it's quite small.

Worth a look though, especially if you like archways.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

137592729.name: Get an idea for life a century ago.
137592729.author: a TripAdvisor user
137592729.reviewBody: It gives me an idea about the buildings people used as refuge during times of war and also punishment by the church in others.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

132408465.name: San Bernadino in the afternoon
132408465.author: a TripAdvisor user
132408465.reviewBody: i went at about 4:00 PM and I believe they were anxious to close up for dinner time. A few more written explanations of the rooms and areas of the "convent" would have helped me.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

131582132.name: A surprising personal tour
131582132.author: a TripAdvisor user
131582132.reviewBody: We don\'t like to take guided tours.  This was place was perfect for my wife and I.  30 pesos and your own tour to browse the grounds.  It\'s beautiful inside and out and has a lot of history that is explained in a small museum with artifacts retrieved from the cenote it was built over.  There are pictures and explanations.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

131092818.name: Worthwhile and interesting
131092818.author: a TripAdvisor user
131092818.reviewBody: Spend a few moments and immerse yourself into history.  We did and found the experience both worthwhile and interesting.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

130243855.name: back in time
130243855.author: a TripAdvisor user
130243855.reviewBody: felt like in the old times as a movie... lovely place!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

126820051.name: One of the highlights of Valladolid
126820051.author: a TripAdvisor user
126820051.reviewBody: Great place to spend an hour or so, climbing the stairs, exploring the gardens, seeing the colonial art and reading the history.  It\'s very photogenic and as a plus the Taberna de Los Frailes is a great little restaurant right next door!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

126189371.name: Better than the Cathederal In the Center of Valladolid
126189371.author: a TripAdvisor user
126189371.reviewBody: This is a little bit "out of the way" but it is definitely worth the effort to get here.  There is a very good chance you will be the only one experiencing this gem, and if the timing is right - like I had at 1:00 - ask the man at the entrance if you can ring the bell.\n\nAnd, again if the timing is right, Taberna de los Frailes is next door, and opens at 1:00 for lunch.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

126174508.name: Interesting
126174508.author: a TripAdvisor user
126174508.reviewBody: Convent (or actually its a monastery in my definition) from the 1600\'s \nInteresting architecture and artifacts in the museum.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

125890162.name: Very interesting and worth your time!
125890162.author: a TripAdvisor user
125890162.reviewBody: We visited this attraction before checking into our hotel on a Sunday afternoon and were glad we did. The walk along the Calzada de los Frailes was pretty (check out the Mayan chocolate shop along the way - free tour!), and the monastery itself impressive. For a small fee we were able to check out most of the building. Lots of rooms and nooks and crannies to explore. A cute dog patrolled the premises and posed for photos with us. Not to be missed if you have a couple hours to kill in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

125708952.name: History
125708952.author: a TripAdvisor user
125708952.reviewBody: read about it before visiting it will surprise you.Ask your guide to make a special stop.Its a must

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

125423500.name: Serene, pink and lovely
125423500.author: a TripAdvisor user
125423500.reviewBody: The monestery was one of the prettier churches inValladolod. The restaurant next door, Taverna de Los Frailes is not to be missed.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

124635480.name: Fascinating convent with a cool little museum.
124635480.author: a TripAdvisor user
124635480.reviewBody: It is built over a cenote that is unfortunately inaccessible by the public. They have a little museum display with pictures of the first exploration of the cenote It also has spanish muskets on display that had been tossed into the cenote during the caste war.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

124596037.name: Worth the visit
124596037.author: a TripAdvisor user
124596037.reviewBody: For a small donation, you can take a self guided tour around the Convent.  If you\'re a photographer, it is great place to get some nice shots.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

124452026.name: must see.
124452026.author: a TripAdvisor user
124452026.reviewBody: Well, we walk from La Aurora to this Convent and there is a lot of nice things to see. I am still not sure if this is an original San Franciscan convent, it seems it was rebuilt after been destroyed in some war, back in the 1800...

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

123808784.name: Take the time to go visit this historic site!
123808784.author: a TripAdvisor user
123808784.reviewBody: Takes you back in time - the convent portion was very simplistic as it must always have been. The museum was interesting to see where they discovered artifacts in the cenote, which they have on display. Next door in the beautiful church cathedral, they were blessing or baptising children and what a perfect day to visit! The families brought the church to life and they were so happy and proud to be photographed on this important day for them. The hallways were washed in a rosy pink and I\'m so glad we decided to visit. We went for lunch afterwards at the Taberna de los Frailes next door and that was icing on the cake to a great afternoon.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

123792569.name: Sight to see when open.
123792569.author: a TripAdvisor user
123792569.reviewBody: Very large convent that is easy to get to and see, although it is not always open.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

123118662.name: Yucatan\'s Colonial History nicely consolidated
123118662.author: a TripAdvisor user
123118662.reviewBody: Most 16h and 17th Century Convents in Yucatan are magnificent;  San Bernardino de Siena stands out ammong them for it\'s history and apportation to Valladolid and eastern Yucatan.\nFransciscan Monks, Dominicos and the Catholic church played a vital role in Colonial Yucatan.  To participate in the dialogue of the influence of the church during the period, San Bernardino is a piece of the mosaic that most be covered to fully understand the implications of the Church in  Yucatan\'s history.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

122850617.name: A True Historical Experience
122850617.author: a TripAdvisor user
122850617.reviewBody: If you like history then check this place out!  It is a 16th century convent that you can stroll leisurely.  Right by it is the a great restaurant.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

120719525.name: Go In The Museum
120719525.author: a TripAdvisor user
120719525.reviewBody: Great history, well signed, great picture taking possibilities.  The walk there from down town, along the 41A Calle is beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

119717043.name: beautiful place
119717043.author: a TripAdvisor user
119717043.reviewBody: great museum, interesting history! I also attended a mass and passed by the convent daily and was surprised to see activity in the church late into the evening.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

117585950.name: Nothing special
117585950.author: a TripAdvisor user
117585950.reviewBody: Really not worth the fee they charge to go in. Don\'t recommend.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

116287600.name: Do not miss this in late afternoon
116287600.author: a TripAdvisor user
116287600.reviewBody: What an interesting place to visit.  I met a young lad who spoke English and gave me a tour of the Church and grounds.  There is so much history here it is fascinating.  There is a little museum room in the back that documents the excavation of the cenote where the Spaniards dumped their weapons.  Well worth a walk though.  The cenote itself is encased in stone but an interesting place nonetheless.\n\nBe sure to take your camera and go when the light will be dramatic.  The afternoon light with the pink and red colour was amazing.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

105795270.name: Very much worth a visit
105795270.author: a TripAdvisor user
105795270.reviewBody: Wonderful colonial architecture - well worth a stop on your visit to Valladolid.  Next door there is also a GREAT restaurant called "Taberna las Frallies" (spelling?) It is one of the very few really nice restaurants that is also open for lunch (at 12 noon) and they stay open very late....like maybe 11 PM or so.\n\nGo and see the ex-convent and then stop and have a wonderful lunch of either Yucatan food or fusion continential dishes.

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

52333497.name: unique stucco architecture and a gorgeous altar if you like old churches
52333497.author: a TripAdvisor user
52333497.reviewBody: A few blocks away from the central plaza of this colonial town 40 kms from Chichen Itza. The convent has some nice architecture on the outside and a nice courtyard on the inside. the church inside has a beautiful altar and nice faded frescoes. when we visited, a brother-sister pair from the U.S. sang a spontaneous hymn which added to the moment. Well worth the detour!

itemReviewed.name: Convent de San Bernardino de Siena

672368429.name: Worth the visit!
672368429.author: a TripAdvisor user
672368429.reviewBody: We went here around 11am and it was EMPTY! we left Tulum at 7.30am and our first stop was Coba, also empty!! and when we finished coba around 10am we were met with a flood of tourists that just arrived! we then continued our drive to suytun Cenote and i am so happy we organised our own driver. After spending 1 hour at this cenote we went back to the entrance and i felt so bad for all those people who came there in the big tour buses.. having to share this place with all those other people would not have been the same.\n\nMaybe we were lucky but this place is really worth the visit if you go a bit earlier or wait around until the big groups have left

671910234.name: Awesome! Great experience
671910234.author: a TripAdvisor user
671910234.reviewBody: Arrived at 3PM and we almost had it to ourselves. Creepy going down all those stairs to enter Cenote. It\'s beautiful and I sight to see. Didn\'t swim here but took several photos for ourselves and others. Met some cool travelers. Going back up the stairs for a 65 year old was no fun. Cute surroundings with the biggest peacocks I have ever seen.

670609373.name: Nice but touristy
670609373.author: a TripAdvisor user
670609373.reviewBody: If you want good pics for Insta then you\u2019ll get them - the sunlight streams in from a small hole at the top and the water is a cloudy blue. There are also Mayan shows on the platform that juts out into the cenote, and you can take a photo with the performers for a donation. Annoyingly you have to wear a life jacket if you want to swim (and it\u2019s super cold!) and there will be a lot of people in the water - seriously, A LOT as yours stop off here all day.
