They don't allow cameras but take excellent photos, and purchasing the pictures supports the community whose land the cenotes reside. 

They do require you to rinse off entirely and don't allow sunscreen or bug spray but it is understandable since this is the community water source (goodness knows stuff even with a rinse us visitors still adversely affect the water quality)

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

500813305.name: Awesome!!
500813305.author: a TripAdvisor user
500813305.reviewBody:
Wow what a great day, we did this as part of the Ek Balam tour. 

Started the day going round Mayan ruin and then on to the Cenote. An under ground pool/lake that you abseil in to start with then once inside there is zip lines and a jumping platform! 

If abseiling in isn't for you there is steps or a tunnel in to it. 

After they is a lunch put on for you and the whole place is run by the Mayan community, which is really nice as to start with it is on there native land and secondly the money goes back to them! 

If we get the chance to go back to Mexico we will come back here again, so much fun!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

499755619.name: Wow!
499755619.author: a TripAdvisor user
499755619.reviewBody: This may have been the highlight of our first trip to Mexico. Our only excursion from the resort combined the cenote and EkBalam ruins. Here, you can swim in the largest as yet discovered denote in Mexico. A cenote is an underground pool, part of the underground rivers. They are discovered when a portion of the roof of the natural cavern collapses. That may sound like no big deal, but getting there... We are NOT zip line, rock climbing, adventurers,  so don\'t be put off by this. This is a closed cenote so only a small part of the roof is open. You can opt out and walk down on a set of stairs, but please don t! I\'m 62 and scared of heights. Step into the harness, don t look down and step off backward into the big dark hole! Yep, you can rappel down - they show you how and cheer you On! If you freeze up or lose your grip, people below have you anchored and can lower you the rest of the way. Trt to keep your eyes open. The walls are beautiful! You come down to a person standing in the water who will help you stand also. Step off the platform and swim to the edge. Once there, you can zip out over the deeper parts and drop into the water or jump in from various heights. They take pictures of each person multiple times, which are made available to you for an additional cost.  Life vests are provided if you would like to use one. There are also some tubes. Both are free to use. After walking out thru a cave, we changed back into our regular clothes and walked through the Mexican jungle to a replica Mayan home, and an authentic Mayan meal. Try the food, it is really delicious! Listen when you are told sauces are mild, medium, hot and really hot. They are exactly what they say. Try the chicken cooked in chocolate. It really is amazing! After another short walk through the trees to see more of the beautiful country,  your ar e ready to move on!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

497797285.name: Great One-Day excursion
497797285.author: a TripAdvisor user
497797285.reviewBody: We had an awesome day with Alltournative Tours combining Ek\' Balam and Cenote Maya! Our tour guide, Sarah, was fantastic, very knowledgeable and patient with us. She made the whole day really lighthearted and lot of fun! The descent by rappel into the cenote was thrilling! I was quite nervous but they do such a great job putting you at ease and making sure you get a good experience down in the water. All in all, a great day!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

496707358.name: Gorgeous, Fun and Incredible Lunch
496707358.author: a TripAdvisor user
496707358.reviewBody: I have gone to three different cenotes in the Yucatan and this is by far the best. You first experience a ceremonial blessing from the Mayan people before entering the cenote. You then have the option to repel down (at your own pace) or walk the stairs down to the cenote. This is a high ceiling, gorgeous, large cenote. You can zip line and fall into the water, jump off high/low platforms or just swim and enjoy the beauty of this sinkhole. The lunch served afterwards is AMAZING! It is homemade by the local mayan women and was the best food we had on the entire seven day vacation. You cannot use your own waterproof camera unless it is harnessed to your head or chest and they do not provide harnesses. They do take pictures of your entire excursion and offer packages starting at $55/couple. All four of us LOVED this excursion along with seeing Chichen Itza. Worth the 2.5 hour van ride from Playa.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

492327499.name: Experience Mayan culture
492327499.author: a TripAdvisor user
492327499.reviewBody:
This experience was awesome. We booked this as a package deal with the Ek Balam ruins tour using the all tour native touring group. We drove about 2 hours to get to this cenote. I was very impressed by the tour groups' vision of giving back to the Mayan community. Everything at the cenote was operated by the Mayans except our specific tour guides. 
The first thing we did was have a traditional Mayan ceremony of blessing. Then we saw a traditional Mayan house (hut). Then to the cave! There are restrooms in which to change into your bathing suits and lockers to keep your stuff in. You can either rappel into the cenote or go down the steps. I rappelled cause why not? They were very safe. Once you reach the water it is freezing cold. Freezing but oh so neat. You can jump off of several platforms into the water, There were 2 ziplines into the water. I tried it all and it was amazing. It is not an experience I will soon forget. 
After we got done swimming, we had a Mayan buffet lunch. It was organic food that the Mayan cooks prepared themselves. 
Before we left you can, of course, purchase the pictures they took of you in the cenote. We bought the complete CD and it was $53. There are other options depending on how many people are in your group and how many photos you want. 
On our way out of the park, we walked through the organic garden and learned how the tour group is teaching the mayan people to grow crops.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

492198195.name: Great place, great service!
492198195.author: a TripAdvisor user
492198195.reviewBody: Went to Ek Balam first and then to the Cenote Maya with Alltournative, Jocelyn was super knowledgeable and super friendly the whole time! She united the whole group and made us feel like a huge family! In the Cenote she helped guide those who were afraid of rappelling and made us all feel very safe! She is definitely great! The food was amazing and the Cenote is very nice! Lots of safety and people looking after you. I will recommend this tour to all of my friends and family!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

485575118.name: Amazing
485575118.author: a TripAdvisor user
485575118.reviewBody: This was our second time at the park. 2 years apart. First was the Ek Balam Tour. This one as part of the Chichen Itza Tour.  Mayan lunch was amazing! They strengthened the hand rail going down the stairs from the first time we visited!!! This made it not so scary. The center is beautiful... Tour guide "Arenza" was awesome!!! Don\'t miss out on this attraction!!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

484503873.name: Stunning Beauty
484503873.author: a TripAdvisor user
484503873.reviewBody: Out of this world beautiful.  Lot\'s of fun things to do here. Rappelling, two zip lines, tubes, kayak, platform jumps.....water is crystal clear and beautiful

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

483673598.name: AllTourNative is the way to go
483673598.author: a TripAdvisor user
483673598.reviewBody:
My wife and I are on our fifth anniversary vacation since we got married at the Dreams Cancun which is now Hyatt Ziva. Since we toured Tulum last time, we wanted to tour Chichen Itza this trip and do it right. 

My wife just happened to pick up the Alltournative brochure so that when we visited the tour agency and they tried to offer another tour (that was cheaper even) we already knew we wanted the added experiences that Alltournative provided. This included rappelling into the largest domed cenote - the Cenote Maya.

The most exciting thing was rapelling down from the roof of the large domed cenote (if you're afraid of heights, there are steps down too). After descending into the cavern, activities include snorkeling, zip-lining (2 lines), diving, tubing (lazy river style), and of course swimming.

You will be required to rinse off your sunscreen to preserve the pristine state of the water (which is freezing - but once you're in you're good to go). They don't allow you to bring your own cameras and for good reason - they will want to sell you photos taken by their staff who do a very good job. You have to realize that this is one of the poorest areas you may ever see and the local economy thrives on anything they can get. So it's worth the $40+ for the souvenir photodisc in more ways than one.

I'll have to admit that I wasn't a big fan of the buffet, but my wife was. It was mainly vegetables and two types of chicken.

Our guides German (pronounced HER-Mon), Gustavo, and driver Lupe couldn't have been more knowledgeable and professional. They answered all questions bombarded by our group of 14.

They do recommend bringing beach towels but they were actually provided. I would recommend this company and esp the guides we were lucky enough to have gotten.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

482462430.name: Amazing
482462430.author: a TripAdvisor user
482462430.reviewBody: My husband and I have pretty much seen every documentary on Mayan history. This stop was part of a trip to Chichen-Itza and we were so happy that it was. It was beautiful and we were able to speak to some of the Mayan people as well as participate in an ancient blessing ceremony. We\'ll be back!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

479550714.name: absolutely amazing!
479550714.author: a TripAdvisor user
479550714.reviewBody: the small group was a great way to see this amazing site; Martin and Samuel looked after us so well, and we were treated like royalty; the visit to Cenote Maya was well worth the time it took to travel from the resort and we loved every minute!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

478711372.name: A Must see
478711372.author: a TripAdvisor user
478711372.reviewBody: If you go to Cancun, make sure to spare time to see this!!! Unbeliecable! Entry is 35 USD without lunch!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

478519364.name: Experience we won\'t forget
478519364.author: a TripAdvisor user
478519364.reviewBody: What an amazing day- first a great trip to Ek Balam followed by a sailing down the cenote- Grecia Medina was our guide for the day and we were very impressed by her knowledge and friendliness. Thank you!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

478480421.name: Fascinating Grotto
478480421.author: a TripAdvisor user
478480421.reviewBody: Visited here as part of a guided tour that included the El Balam Mayan Ruins.  This stop includes displays of how the descendants of the Mayans live plus the chance to swim in an underground grotto!  One can climb down or rappel to the water.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

477998913.name: Unforgettable beautiful experience!!
477998913.author: a TripAdvisor user
477998913.reviewBody: We had such a great experience at Cenote Maya Park! It\'s so beautiful. Our tour group (Alltournative) was the first to enter the cenote which was great timing.  We rappelled down into the deep water where a staff member helps you off your harness.  You have some time to swim around or go zip lining on 2 different lengths of ropes.  There are fishes in the water which is cool.  The water was freezing but very refreshing after a hot day.  The lunch afterwards was surprisingly very tasty.  Thank you!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

474807301.name: Amazing Cenote!
474807301.author: a TripAdvisor user
474807301.reviewBody: Great fun!  We stopped here at the end of our tour.  Started with a Mayan ceremony and then swimming, rappelling, or zip lining in this huge Cenote.  Water was cold but refreshing.  There are lockers and towels available and lunch was provided on our tour.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

473208186.name: Overpriced tourist trap in the middle of nowhere
473208186.author: a TripAdvisor user
473208186.reviewBody:
Inconsistent hours and rude staff, and apparently run by smarmy 15 year old kids. 
First they quoted us $50 per person (ridiculous rip-off!), then suddenly they said they were already closed for the day (even though it was 75 minutes before posted closing time).
They only offer the all-inclusive ticket price to force you into this gaudy 'theme' park, (including a buffet that no one wants). Wish they would just let you swim and enjoy the cenote's natural beauty, instead of turning it into a trashy overpriced tourist trap.
If you're near Tulum, go to Grand Cenote instead.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

465618596.name: amazing place but inconsistent hours
465618596.author: a TripAdvisor user
465618596.reviewBody: The website says it\'s open until 5, but we arrived before 4 and it was shut down for the day. Fortunately they still let us in to look, but not to swim. Perhaps better to go with a tour group than on your own.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

464030565.name: A true adventure!
464030565.author: a TripAdvisor user
464030565.reviewBody: We took this tour along with Chichen itza through Alltournative tours and it was excellent.  Our tour guide "Elias" was truely a delight and was very knowledgeable and took the time to answer all our questions.   The trip to the cenote was a true adventure and very exciting to not only see but to actually experience.  Rappelling down into the cenote along with doing the two zip lines and diving was such a thrill.  I must also commend our driver "Jesus".  He also was excellent in getting us to our sites with utmost care and respect.  I would recommend this trip to anyone!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

464001110.name: Natural wonder turned attraction
464001110.author: a TripAdvisor user
464001110.reviewBody: The biggest cenote in Yucat\u00e1n. Beautiful natural wonder. But they turned it into an attraction park with 2 ziplines and a diving platform. US$ 49 pp is just way too much for spending an hour or so in the cold cenote. Granted; lunch buffet is included but nothing special. Your \'personal guide\' acts more like a guard who tells you what you cannot do (including not bringing your own camera)\nIt was fun, but not $49 worth. Especially if you realize it is quite a trip to even get there from Cancun, Playa del Carmen or Tulum. 1,5 to 2 hours drive. \nI would recommend visiting one of the countless other cenotes where you pay just a few dollars for an actual cenote experience.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

463614361.name: Es Perfecto! (With gluten-free notes)
463614361.author: a TripAdvisor user
463614361.reviewBody:
My entire family absolutely loved our day with Alltournative! We were picked up outside our resort (Moon Palace) perfectly on time, in a nice Sprinter-type van, picked up a few more people, and our group of six adults and six children was off to Chichen Itza followed by a trip to this quiet cenote.  I mention Chichen Itza because it was so amazing to cool off and clean up after the busy, hot tourist destination at the cenote before the long ride back to Cancun!

The drive to the cenote allowed us to see a different side of Mexico that is different from what we experience in the oasis of Cancùn. It was safe, but my children got to understand on a new level the poverty and hardship in some parts of Yucatán 's jungle through the large, tinted windows of the bus. Seeing the homes made of sticks reminded us all of the level of luxury in which we live, and sometimes take for granted.

Departing from the bus in the park, we strolled through absolutely lovely organic gardens teeming with love and fresh food. This was a great teaser for our lunch, which was just around a few more corners....

Lunch was amazing!!! I had concerns because my sons cannot eat gluten, and I was hoping there would be a variety of food they could enjoy. There was actually MORE than they could handle! Fresh corn tortillas (handmade before your eyes), rice and beans, chicken, salads, lime soup, eggs with chiya, plus other gluten-filled dishes for the gluten-ous! ;). Drinks included hibiscus water (sweetened, cold, and delicious), rice water with vanilla (sweetened), plain water, and commercial beverages (for purchase).  Our meal was so amazing, I was a little sad that I could never repeat it without coming back!

After lunch, we changed in swimsuits and put our belongings in lockers, including shoes! The lockers were a beautiful high-gloss wood, and the bathrooms were clean and not smelly, due to being somewhat open air (raised-platform cubicles under thatch). Soap and sinks were very nice!

We were led to participate in a ceremony to cleanse us (smudging) and requests to grant us permission to visit and safety in the cenote. Lovely ceremony!

We then walked to the showers and got off sunscreen grime, dirt, vanity products, etc to help preserve the cenote waters. The showers were open-air and kinda fun!

A few steps down a path, and there was the hole in the ground leading to our cenote! We were nearly swooning looking at the long rappel lines descending into the dark waters. My husband went first, new to rappelling, and the instructors (Herman and Pepe) were very clear and encouraging.  After a lot of nervous laughter, he easily descended, and quickly yelled up to us that it was "Awesome!"

My 16-year-old son followed, equally nervous, but managing to put on a big smile for the camera! His twin brother wasn't feeling it, and decided today was not his day to try rappelling, and the guides were very supportive of his last-minute decision to bail, as he was literally on the edge of the platform. The local workers were very nice about not wanting him to feel badly.

So, he and I descended some slippery stairs carefully. By the time we got to the water's edge, my other son was already snorkeling around, enjoying the clear water and even saw a fish!  We swam...the water was cool but SO refreshing!

We had the whole cenote to our group of 12 for a very decent amount of time. Several grown-ups and kids enjoyed the two zip lines. I personally enjoyed just floating on my back, staring at the limestone ceiling and the hanging tree roots. There were many inner tubes available for floating. I loved that they didn't make me wear a life vest! After the year's cancer surgeries, I floated, visualizing my body being healed from the sacred waters. It was one of the best swims of my life. My husband said I looked so happy and healthy afterwards!!!

The exit walk was nicely lit, a ramp, like exiting a cave.  Next stop was a building with plenty of large computers to view the extensive pictures taken! Images were already sorted by family. We laughed and sighed at many pictures...there are some priceless ones, such as my husband and son rappelling side by side, showing the length of their descent. We got all pictures, video of the ceremony, pics of the site and its flora, plus traditional music on a USB for only $63....a very very fair price! I was so happy to hand off camera duty to someone else so I could be fully present, AND support the local Mayan economy. Since the pics were less than I anticipated, I purchased some lovely woven blankets in the gift shop. While CDs and USBs were being loaded, we had complimentary margaritas! 

The day and place was fantastic, but Herman and Pepe were outstanding guides, here and at Chichen Itza. Incredibly knowledgeable and fluent in English (and French, Italian, and German for Herman!) I always felt safe riding with Chico behind the wheel, as well!!!

Amazing day!!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

463238770.name: Amazing Cenote, great service, poor product concept
463238770.author: a TripAdvisor user
463238770.reviewBody:
I loved the cenote and the experience. It is now one of my favorite sports close to valladolid. They did a good job with the design of the stairs, the rappel and the diving platforms. If you go there, ask for Gonzalo, he was our tour guide and was very kind and helpful. I wouldn't do the tour with anyone else. Food is good and the fact that they grow their own produce makes it better. 

I like the ecofriendly concept, my only problems is that they don't allow to bring cameras and want to charge you extra for the service with no added value. The pictures they take are quite bad (anyone with a decent camera can take the same pictures). If you are going to charge extra I would expect to get some spectacular shots with great angle, light, different lenses, underwatter pictures, etc. 

I honestly believe that they should allow you to bring your own camera and offer the pictures as an extra. if they would put a little more effort in the "production" side I would be willing to pay extra. Another down side is that you have this photo guy following you everywhere.... it's ok at first but by the end of the day you'll end up hating having him there all the time. 

Overall it is worth it, especially if you are visiting from outside of México.

PS. if you go there, please avoid any sunblock or mosquito repellant. This is very harmful for the Cenote. Before entering the cenote there are showers available. I might be a little cold but it will help keep the cenote healthy.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

461270192.name: Wonderful Experience
461270192.author: a TripAdvisor user
461270192.reviewBody: We rappelled into the refreshing water of Cenote Maya, and I highly recommend doing this if you visit. You can go down the stairs, but rappelling is easy, quick, and a cool experience! As well, the lunch we had afterwards was the best meal we had on the entire trip.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

458948921.name: Fantastic experience!
458948921.author: a TripAdvisor user
458948921.reviewBody: We repelled 100\' into the Cenote, and swam and ziplined in the cool waters! Buffet lunch afterwards was very good too! i would do it again!\n

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

458294461.name: Lovely, not commercial
458294461.author: a TripAdvisor user
458294461.reviewBody: Went with a tour group. First the lunch had best food on our vacation. The staff really seemed to enjoy their jobs, and their visitors. I\'m a wuss, but the zip line guy convinced me.  Loved it. Needless to say Cenote and grounds are lovely

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

454783290.name: Beautiful!!!
454783290.author: a TripAdvisor user
454783290.reviewBody: We drove to this place, I suggest going there without the tour groups gives you the time. I am telling you you would want all the time in this place. You rappel down to get in bring your Gopro head gear for full video experience, I was kicking myself in the butt cause I didn\'t bring mine so I didn\'t get to video my descent to the cenote. There are 2 ziplines I enjoyed both and 2 platforms to jump off from. This is a must to visit when in or around Tulum or Yucatan area, you get your own tour guide, our tour guides name was Aron and he was very very nice and informative.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

454121964.name: Amazing experience and people!
454121964.author: a TripAdvisor user
454121964.reviewBody: We loved the Cenote Maya park.   Fantastic rappel into the cenote, and great experience ziplining in the cave and swimming in the cenote.   The Mayan culture is so huge at this park, and the lunch was great as well.   GREAT experience!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

454082784.name: I didn\'t want to leave; some badly-behaved people
454082784.author: a TripAdvisor user
454082784.reviewBody:
I wanted to swim in the cave for hours, but our group had about 90 minutes. I swam over to the walls to see the bats. The water is clear so you can also see the bottom, although it is very deep. Most people rappel to get into the cave, but there are also stairs and a (steep & slippery) ramp. 

We had lunch here, which was delicious. There was a rice drink and a hibiscus drink, both of which were a bit sweet for my taste, but very flavorful.

Part of the experience includes a smudging ceremony. The only thing that spoiled the visit was some smokers who said that smoking was no different from the smudging ceremony, and demanded that they be allowed to smoke in this non-smoking park. To avoid further confrontation, our guide arranged to allow these people a supervised smoke break.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

451761384.name: DADA AND DAUGHTER AT CENOTE MAYA JANUARY 2017
451761384.author: a TripAdvisor user
451761384.reviewBody: The place is nice. They tried to charge us $100 for the tour, lunch, and swimming in the cenote. We did not need or want lunch, nor want the tour. So, I got the charge down to $50. I liked the place very much. But, I do not organized tours nor do I like someone being with us the entire time. I felt like we could not just walk around and explore on our own. I did not like that at all. We stayed about 30 mins and that was it. Again, I like being on my own to do what I want when I want.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

450249368.name: Great Cenote
450249368.author: a TripAdvisor user
450249368.reviewBody: Went with family as part of a tour that visited Ek Balam and also the Cenote Maya Park.  In these ruins, you are allowed to climb them.  View from the top is great.  I highly recommend.  \n\nAfter Ek Balam, we went to the cenote park.  We started with a Mayan ceremony.  Then we went to the lockers to change into bathing suits, followed by entering the cenote itself. It was a great experience.  At the end there was a buffet lunch. Grecia was a great tour guide.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

446878859.name: Love it
446878859.author: a TripAdvisor user
446878859.reviewBody: Teens enjoyed jumping off into the water...The staff was extremely friendly. Mayan food provided was very fresh and delicious

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

446574083.name: Beautiful Cenote!
446574083.author: a TripAdvisor user
446574083.reviewBody: One of the most spectacular Cenote around. Highly recommend! The repelling is fun, though the lines are quite stiff. Water is very clean, beautiful formation with large stalactites.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

446502534.name: really cool day
446502534.author: a TripAdvisor user
446502534.reviewBody: did the ek balaam ruins and then cenote maya. We were staying on cozumel so we needed  to figure in cost of ferry both ways  to playa (approx 10$ each way) where we met our "Alltournative" guide Olga and driver Sammy. They did a fantastic job of explaining culture and telling us what to expect next. ( like the 1hr and 40min drive to Ek Balaam from Playa and what to leave in the van or take with us at each site) Rappel into the cenote is very fun, water is cool but ok if you keep moving. zip line was good, platforms to dive from, a mask to wear or innertubes to float on.\n\nMY BIGGEST FRUSTRATION OF THE DAY---- NO CAMERAS ALLOWED AT CENOTE-- then they take pics and sell digital file for $17 U.S. each or $90 U.S. for all the picture files. --we opted out and that cost left a bad impression for my whole family.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

446310204.name: Outstanding for adults.
446310204.author: a TripAdvisor user
446310204.reviewBody: Do not miss this attraction if possible. Rappel into the water of the cenote (sinkhole). Use the zipline while down there and swim in the cenote. Our tour include a great Mexican meal too. Just a great outing with great staff and guide.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

445863553.name: Beautiful place to swim
445863553.author: a TripAdvisor user
445863553.reviewBody: These place was incredible, you won\'t Imagine that this cave was in the middle of nowhere, the water is clear and very impressive

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

431350250.name: Nice stop
431350250.author: a TripAdvisor user
431350250.reviewBody: We stopped at this ce note. Did not stay too long. Definitely worth the try to any denote while you are in mexico

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

424567306.name: Just Incredible!
424567306.author: a TripAdvisor user
424567306.reviewBody: My daughter and I visited on our way back to Merida from Isla Holbox. It was incredible. Beautiful, big cenote with a number of activities. Wish we had gotten there earlier, but we loved it nonetheless!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

421615753.name: Cenote
421615753.author: a TripAdvisor user
421615753.reviewBody: Today we visited Maya park Cenote it was absolutely beautiful we repeled  down into the water which was rather cold but refreshing after the Mexican sun above. Fortunately we took mask and snorkel with us and swam with the catfish. The guide sorry can\'t remember her name was extremely knowledgeable about Mayan culture and the staff were all friendly.\nOne word of warning if you take a go pro which is the only type of camera allowed you must have a chest or head harness or you will not be allowed to take it in i had a wrist mount so was not allowed to take it but the professional snaps were not too expensive unlike the dolphin swim

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

405949321.name: cold water. great time.
405949321.author: a TripAdvisor user
405949321.reviewBody: only go pro with harness allowed inside cenote. no water shoes. you tour the Mayan village and get a blessing before entering the cenote. you swim for about 45- hour maybe. its the first stop on the way to ek\' balam. if u cant swim they have life jackets for the rappelling. afterwards the serve authentic mayan food which is really really good. all made from food grown on site. its about 40 bucks for a cd of the pics they take if u get all. there is cheaper packs available and it all goes into the mayan community at the cenote so we didnt mind paying it. they were very nice. our tour guide for here and ek balam was mimi from alltournative. great person lots of fun

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

384687565.name: Fun time had by all
384687565.author: a TripAdvisor user
384687565.reviewBody: We did this trip right after going to some ruins, so the water in the Cenote was quite refreshing. The teenagers and I had a blast rappelling down into the cenote while others took the stairs down, once inside you can swim and jump off some platforms at 2 different heights, they also had some tubes that you can float in the water with. The Mayan lunch that you can get there is very good.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

375909029.name: Awesome
375909029.author: a TripAdvisor user
375909029.reviewBody: The best tour guide and driver ever, Martin and Ricky!  Loved the Cenote Maya and learning abt the Mayan Culture.  Martin was very knowledgeable and informative abt the culture and the surrounding areas. We were blessed and granted permission to enter the ruins and the cenote by the Mayan priest. The traditional Mayan food was great as well.  I loved it all.  The tour guide for Ek Balam was also great. The history of the ruins was very interesting and the views were awesome.  AllTourNative rocks!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

373497607.name: Amazing ruins, plus great swimming - MUST GO
373497607.author: a TripAdvisor user
373497607.reviewBody:
We went on the Cenote Maya tour with Debby and it was amazing.  She was very knowledgable and very happy to answer any questions, she's studying archeology.
We have been to Tulum (several times) and Coba and other smaller ruins and this was one of the best.  Tulum is awesome by the sea but this has many more intact buildings and you can climb on them, go into them, really get the feel.  
Part of the tour was visiting a Mayan house and  seeing how they live.  The company that runs the tours Altournative (clever name) supports the local villages and helps keep it sustainable and real instead of too  "touristy".  
There was also a great swim at the largest Cenote in Mexico.  You can repel down (totally controlled by the guides) or walk down a stairway.  Cool water and very refreshing.  
Really an amazing triip.
For those with no appetite for getting there, it was about an hour and 20  minutes to get there but it was broken up with the cenote first then the ruins and by the time you're done most everyone on the bus was napping so it didn't seem so long.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

371635686.name: Best tour ever
371635686.author: a TripAdvisor user
371635686.reviewBody: We took Altournative Tour for an excursion from Grand Sunset Princess to Ek Balam and Cenote Maya. Our guide was Tita. She was extremely knowledgable and so friendly. She actually got our 10 year old daughter to rapel into the Cenote. We highly recommend this excursion. We cannot praise the Cenote, the people of the Mayan Village, the amazing authentic food or the tour company enough. So worth every dollar we paid.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

369891710.name: Such an overwhelming experience.
369891710.author: a TripAdvisor user
369891710.reviewBody:
It's not the first time we visit this park, but we'll never get tired of doing so, due to it's so beautiful, you always enjoy it as the first time. Actually, this time the park is better because the organic orchard they're developing in the facilities now has new plants and animals as the hairless yucatecan pig and the melipona bees that are also endemic from Yucatan.

In some way, we enjoyed more this visit because we had more experience using the rappel rope you can use to descend the 22 meters inside the huge cenote. We also experienced the adventure of tasting the habanero "mayarita" (that is the Alltournative version of the margarita) As you read it! besides the mint and tamarindo natural flavors they have, you must try this spicy one.

We're also happy that the park is very conscious about ecology. For example: they ask you not to use any chemical on your body before entering the cenote and you have to shower also. They have biodigestors in the restrooms and the orchard produces locally and organically part of the ingredients they use in the delicious buffet they serve to guests.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

368594397.name: The Most Beautiful Place in the World
368594397.author: a TripAdvisor user
368594397.reviewBody:
Beautiful, natural and surreal place to visit. Personally, my favorite place in the world. If you want to experience Mexico and the local Mayan culture in a friendly safe place, you need to see Cenote Maya. Have visited twice; once via Alltournative Tours, which was super informative and fun, and took the local roads through Chemax. Tour guide was great. - but it's a tour. Second time, rented a car and drove through rural Yucatan. It's beautiful. Everyone should do it. Bring a good GPS.

So,
In the middle of nowhere is a perfect little paradise.  To reach the cenote you'll walk through a maze of incredible botanical gardens. There is a dining area and a locker area. To reach the cenote, you'll need to give up all your worldly possessions and stow them away. I insist on carrying a tripod everywhere and the nice staff let me stow it behind the counter until later. So now, the only thing left to do is rappel down. You have to. On the tour, I saw a lot of people shy out. I assure you, it's the best part of the experience.  Just do it.

Then you just look around you, and for a moment, you know you're in a sacred place of some kind. The scale of the cavern and the weird lack of echo is a factor. Maybe it's the crystal clear blue water, or the cathedral-like rock. 

Hang out. Dive. Zipline. Float around on a tube. Whatever you want. It's worth it. 

And afterwards, you're rewarded with the best tamarind margarita you ever tasted. The BEST.

Make time for it.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

368594301.name: Interesting
368594301.author: a TripAdvisor user
368594301.reviewBody: We visited this Cenote on the return trip from our outing to Chichen Itza , the coolness of the place was very appreciated after a day of sight seeing in the sun. Our guide gave much information on the geological and historical points of Cenotes in general and this one in particular. It was quite interesting to take a walk around and fun to watch some of the swimmers and divers, which made us sorry to not have had time to join in. Guess  swimming in it would have given us a much better appreciation of the place.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

364930669.name: Best part of our 2 week trip to Playa
364930669.author: a TripAdvisor user
364930669.reviewBody:
I don't know where to begin. Found this day long excursion from the lobby at the resort we were staying at. Noticed the photo of Cenote Maya on a brochure matched a photo that a coworker had shown me previously to my trip. The excusion came highly recommended although the brochure sold us on the trip itself!

After getting picked up at the resort, we made our way to the cenote. When we arrived there was only another group that was slightly ahead of us (we had approximately 18 people in our group). After we had completely the Mayan ceremony, we made our way to the cenote where we repelled in. Just as the last of our group made their way to the water level in the cenote the other group was leaving. This felt like you had the whole place to yourself.

After spending a bit of time playing on the zip line, ropes, and ledges that you can jump off it was time for us to go. Shortly before leaving we saw a small sea turtle swimming by the main platform - which was really amazing!

After cleaning up we were treated to a mayan buffett, which was delicious. From local drinks to different types of local food I thought it was a hit. Shortly after eating, we purchased photos from the morning. Local Mayans were tought to be photographers so while you're enjoying yourself in the cenote they take your photo's. I thought it was aweseome how Alltournative was giving back to the community by providing jobs and techinical training!

The second half of the day was a bit more of a bus ride from the cenote to the ruins at Ek Balam. After a bit of a brief history run down provided by our fantastic tour guide Danique, we had a bit of time to explore and climb to the top. Again because of timing with groups it really felt like you were alone experiencing the sights which was a huge contrast from having recently seen Tulum!

The day never felt rushed, and felt quite informative. The staff was positive and friendly and eager to share/answer any questions you had. I'd highly recommend this trip because it feels like the timing of everything is right where you don't get sick of something, or feel like you didn't have enough time to enjoy things.

I'd highly recommend this to anyone who is visiting the area!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

364223077.name: Highlight of our trip! Even with some car trouble...
364223077.author: a TripAdvisor user
364223077.reviewBody: We did the combined tour of Ek Balam and Cenote Maya with AllTourNative Tours and it was one of the best tourist excursions I\'ve ever been on.  Being down in that cenote is one of the most incredible places I\'ve ever been - even without the rappelling, zip lining, diving, etc., which are also a lot of fun.  It\'s so vast and quiet and unlike too many other places in the world.  The Mayan lunch afterward was also delicious.  \nEk Balam was the perfect place to see a bit of the Mayan culture too - not too crowded, enough ruins to explore without being overwhelming, and a chance to climb to the top of a few towers.\nOur van did break down on the way back, but our fantastic guide Lily had us in another AllTourNative van so quickly we never got a chance to give her her well deserved tip.  The least we can do is to let everyone else know how great she was and try to convince others to go on the tour and make up for it.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

363933649.name: WOW!
363933649.author: a TripAdvisor user
363933649.reviewBody: I booked this visit, along with a trip to Ek Balam, thorough AllTourNative tours.  It was amazing!  The trip to the cenote included a tour through a traditional Mayan community, a shaman\'s blessing, rappelling (though I opted for the stairs down), and swimming in the underground cenote.  Once inside, you could zip-line into the water, traverse ropes over the water and jump off 3.5m and 7m platforms (I jumped from 3.5m, that was scary enough!)  You could swim, laze around in inner tubes, and/or simply enjoy the unbelievable cenote itself. Tree roots hung down, the stalactites & stalagmites surrounded you and the water was crystal clear (when you were under the ceiling openings).  The park is beautifully kept, simple and the people friendly.  After the swim, we had a traditional Mayan lunch, got to help make tortillas with the locals and wander through the organic garden on site.  A gift shop is available and you can buy pictures of your experience from the locals.  The cenote is about 1 1/2 hours into the Yucatan interior from the Riviera Maya location I was staying at.  The drive in was interesting, simply because it offered a different perspective to the tourist areas and offered a glimpse into everyday life.  Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

362730120.name: Beautiful cave, but disappointed cameras are not allowed
362730120.author: a TripAdvisor user
362730120.reviewBody: Cenote Maya was lovely to see - a really special, beautiful natural attraction, but that made it all the more disappointing that cameras are not allowed in the cenote. I enjoyed the tour (through Alltournative which included Ek Balam) and the tour guide Lilia was excellent. \n\nYou can sneak away and take some photos from the top after lunch (which was a Mexican buffet with decent variety). They will sell you photos of yourself swimming (if you swim in the cenote) and you can get a CD of photos, but it\'s still not the same as taking your own. If you don\'t mind really cold water and want to swim in a cave - it\'s a great excursion.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

362391989.name: Beautiful Cenote - unfortunate tourist trap
362391989.author: a TripAdvisor user
362391989.reviewBody: We had heard how beautiful Cenote Maya was so we decided to go see it for ourselves. If you take a taxi it\'s about 600 pesos return. It\'s not easy to get a collectivo. Once we arrived we were told the entrance was $49 USD per person. I am not American, nor do I earn money in Dollars, so this is very expensive for me. Yes it includes many things but when asked if we could just pay to go swim in the Cenote without additional extras, they said those were the prices and the best they could do was 49 USD for 2. We arrived at 3pm and the park closes at 5pm. But what do you do after you\'ve paid so much money for a taxi? So we paid. Yes, it\'s an absolutely gorgeous Cenote but unfortunately has sunk even deeper into a complete tourist trap! If you\'re happy to pay 2USD for a can of Cola this place is for you. Quite frankly there are other impressive and beautiful cenotes around Valladolid for much much cheaper!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

360088278.name: One of the better Cenotes
360088278.author: a TripAdvisor user
360088278.reviewBody:
We went as part of the Alltournative tour and spend a few hours at the cenote. The facility are first rate as to compared to the other tour (jungle maya) we did with the same company.  
Our guide Alita was very informative give us lots of info about Maya culture and the flora and fauna. 
The actual cenote is outstanding a real natural marvel. The rappelling was good and the equipment was at a higher standard than that at jungle maya.  For those that could not rappel there was a well built set of steps to the bottom of the cenote. 
The only minor complaint would be would be being called out on the bus ride home for my evaluation scores of the driver and guide.  Out of a score of 1-10 I gave the guide an 8 and the driver a 5. Alita chastised me in front of everone. Why I gave the driver a 5 was it was average. He drove the bus.  I had thought the 8 I had scored here was way above average.  Who could really give someone a perfect score of 10?  Why ask for evaluations if one only want everyone to mark down 10 and 10. And why make a fuss if someone gives someone an average? It was just odd and unpleasant experience.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

357972654.name: Great tour
357972654.author: a TripAdvisor user
357972654.reviewBody: We stayed at Akumal Health & Wellness Resort that was a 2 1/2 hour drive to Cenote Maya & EkBalum.  Our tourguide, I C, from Lithuania, spoke english & spanish fluently as well and she was interesting, informative and an excellent tourguide with a sense of humor.  It was very interesting to see the way the Mayan people live today; without modern conveniences.  Repelling into the Cenote was magical, it was a great experience I will always remember.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

357366041.name: A MUST!
357366041.author: a TripAdvisor user
357366041.reviewBody:
We booked a day tour through Alltournative and our guide MARTIN was fantastic! our tour included the Ek Balam ruins prior to the Cenote. It is a bit of a drive from our resort ( Bahia Principe Akumal) but definitely well worth it!
You can not take cameras into the cenote but they have amazing photgraphers to capture every moment. We paid $63 US for all of our photos and there are so many, you will not be disappointed. I am afraid of heights so this was a big deal to rappel down 80 feet. Martin was incredible, he made sure we all felt safe and educated on what to do. The guides in the water are incredible too so do not fear anything. I am so glad that I did it! It is something you will never see again or experience. The water is cold but the most beautiful I have seen. As you rappel down, take the time to take in the views and take your time, you will be in awe. 
When we first arrived, we were blessed by a Mayan Shaman and that was lovely, then we got a tour of a Mayan Palpa (spelling) and it was wonderful to learn so much about the Mayan culture. After the rappel, swim and tarzan zip line we were reated to a traditional Mayan lunch, which was excellent. We got to do a bit of shopping and enjoy martinis! You will love this tour combined with the ruins.
Please ask for MARTIN, you will adore him!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

353791496.name: Wow ! Spectacular !
353791496.author: a TripAdvisor user
353791496.reviewBody:
This was a very nice excursion.
To get there is quite far from the hotel but this is a nice visit if you also join that to an other visit such as Ek Balam park.
You can see different things on the site such as a shaman or a little house that they built to explain how maya people were living.
These components of the park are nice but they are not the main attraction.
The cenote is cool. You do rappel down  from 22 meters into the cenote... some emotions I would say :-)   Children can also rappel down and it is secure.
In the cenote, you can swim, dive from 3 metters and 10 meters plateform... quite impressive... and there are a couple of activities.
The only comment is... you are not allowed to take pictures and bring a camera... you have to buy picture from people in the park. 40 $ if you are alone, 50 $ a couple and 60 $ or 70 $ if you are a family.... this is a program to finance youth in the area so....

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

352432375.name: Fun but no cameras allowed in cenote!
352432375.author: a TripAdvisor user
352432375.reviewBody: We visited this Cenote with AllTourNative tours along with Ek Balam one day during our week in the Riviera Maya. It also featured a Mayan blessing ceremony, mayan meal and visit to a mayan village. Our tour-guide Daisy was great. \nWe loved the repelling (not as scary or as difficult as I thought it would be) and enjoyed swimming in the denote. We were just disappointed that we couldn\'t shoot any pictures inside. We understood why- because people lose their cameras in the cenote (which is a drinking source for locals) - but wished this had been better explained to us beforehand by our Air Transat rep at the hotel- or we might have chosen another cenote to visit. We also felt that the $65 US the people who run the cenote wanted to charge for photos was a bit overpriced. If they brought this down a bit- perhaps they would have sold more as souvenirs of a lovely day in their village. Would still highly recommend this though. Just bring a GoPro with a chest harness if you want to capture your own pictures repelling into the cenote! Otherwise - be prepared to pay extra.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

350853070.name: Alltournative Ek Balam
350853070.author: a TripAdvisor user
350853070.reviewBody: Many thanks to Alltournative and our guide Daisy for an excellent day trip to Ek Balam and Cenote Maya Park.  All be it a brief introduction to local culture, Daisy made the trip memorable and interesting.  Very satisfied and would recommend to anyone wishing to experience a little of the \'real Mexico"!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

350412253.name: GREAT HIGHLIGHT OF MAYAN CULTURE
350412253.author: a TripAdvisor user
350412253.reviewBody: We visited this park as part of a full-day tour with Alltournative Tours.  It was a wonderful way for our family to get a small taste of Mayan culture.  From the Mayan shaman who blessed us to the opportunity to see what a Mayan home/farm looks like it was an eye-opener.  The highlight was descending into the depths of the Cenote. If you were adventurous like me, you can descend in to it by rappelling straight down directly into the water.  Qualified multilingual staff ensure that you are both safe and comfortable before you take the "big step".  For everyone else, you can descend via a wooden stairwell and either walk into the water or jump of a platform into the water.  There is also a zip line and a variety of other platforms of varying heights available to enter the water via.  They also have a very good buffet lunch that is part of the admission price.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

349674048.name: Awesome Experience!
349674048.author: a TripAdvisor user
349674048.reviewBody: We did this with the EK Balam ruins tour. Both were GREAT! Daisy was our tour guide and she was awesome. This tour is located in the middle of a Mayan village and we were fortunate to have an authentic mayan lunch. The best chicken we had during our entire trip!\n\nThis was a day filled with fun and history. You will not be disappointed by taking this tour.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

349127217.name: Very Cool
349127217.author: a TripAdvisor user
349127217.reviewBody: Loved rappelling into the cenote.  Sorry that I didn\'t get any pictures inside as I had left my camera in the locker and the photos that were taken of us by the staff were being sold as a set (expensive).  It was a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

347005337.name: Beautiful
347005337.author: a TripAdvisor user
347005337.reviewBody: Located in the middle of an authentic Mayan village, it is great way to see how many Mexicans really live. It is also an eye opener to appreciate what many of us take for granted. The tour starts with a blessing from the village shaman/ healer. Then a tour of some of the village homes. The Cenote is accessible by either rappelling down to the water or using the stairs. You can also swim as well. You get an authentic Mexican lunch as you exit the park as well

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

342888074.name: Beautiful!
342888074.author: a TripAdvisor user
342888074.reviewBody:
My husband an I decided we wanted something a little different from the extra touristy chichen itza, so we deiced to take the Cenote Maya tour. We drove 2 hours north of the Caribbean coast to Ek' Balam, we had a lovely tour guide Debby who was not a native Mexican, but spoke the language perfectly and knew the answer to every question we had. Along with Debby we had a great drive Jose who got us there efficiently and made sure our bags stayed secure.
Ek' Balam is a beautiful live excavation site, as a decent amount is still being discovered. The site was very well preserved for only being out of the ground 20 years.
After spending a couple hours at the pyramid, we all boaded the bus and drove another hour to a secluded mayan village which houses the Cenote Maya. The largest Cenote. We were blessed by a shaman in ancient mayan language. We then had the option to walk down the stairs into the cenote or repel. My husband walked as he was not feeling well, I repelled. The staff were amazing and it was so much fun.
I would reccoment this tour for any age, so much rich culture. Also you get a traditional mayan made lunch!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

341512526.name: I could have stayed all day!
341512526.author: a TripAdvisor user
341512526.reviewBody: We booked an excursion with AllTourNative that included the Cenote Maya as a stop. This was a fantastic excursion. The bathrooms and change rooms were clean and lockers provided. I was hesitant to rappel into the cenote but was convinced to do it by my family - I am so glad I overcame my fear of heights to do it and I wish I could have done it a second time! There was a zipline, ropes, and dive platforms, and I could have played/swam all day in the cenote. So much fun!!! The scariest part of the trip was seeing the pictures of me rappelling in a bathing suit at the end :)

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

340070022.name: So much fun
340070022.author: a TripAdvisor user
340070022.reviewBody: We did this as a package with the Ek Balam Mayan Ruins .. It was a fantastic excursion .. Rappelling into the cenote can be a bit scary at first but once you start going down the view inside makes it worth it ..  The blessing ceremony from a Maya Shaman was neat .. The Mayan lunch buffet was very tasty .. This excursion was well worth the money.\n\n*NOTE* You cannot bring your camera into the cenote while rappelling but they take continuous pictures of you while rappelling and inside the cenote. The pictures cost 50USD on a disk or 60USD on a USB (there is also pictures and a video of your blessing by the Maya Shaman as well as other professional pictures of the area).

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

339803473.name: Cenote Maya & Ek Balam with Tai
339803473.author: a TripAdvisor user
339803473.reviewBody: Our guide was Tar\u00e9. Otherwise known as Tai. He was absolutely the best Guide we have ever had on any tour we have ever done. On the day we took our tour he had to speak 4 different languages, which he eased in and out of effortlessly, his knowledge of EkBalam & Cenote Maya was very informative. If you take a tour with "all tour native" we hope you get this guy

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

338909642.name: Cenote Maya with Nicolas
338909642.author: a TripAdvisor user
338909642.reviewBody: Amazing experience for me! the tour is well organised, we had a french guide, Nicolas who was funny and really competent. The tour is incredible and hard to describe. Ek-Balam is beautifull, the maya ceremony is impressive, the cenote facilities are awesome and the food was incredible.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

338894312.name: Brilliant trip, DO IT!
338894312.author: a TripAdvisor user
338894312.reviewBody:
We travelled with alltournative for this attraction. The trip is amazing and well worth missing half a day on the beach.
100% recommend abseiling in through the cave roof, cracking :-)
Our guide Alejandra Nunez was friendly, funny and so knowledgeable you would think she was twice her age. 10/10 for this trip, the people involved and the service provided.
Fully recommended!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

335448619.name: Great park with stunning views
335448619.author: a TripAdvisor user
335448619.reviewBody: Our visit to this park was a great experience. The personnel, food and facilities were of high quality. There is a Maya ceremony before entering the great Cenote and we descended rappeling the 22 meters, it was overwhelming. Although if you\'re not into adrenaline, there are stairs or even a ramp for people with disabilities. Inside the cenote there\'s a spectacular view since it\'s the biggest underground cenote found in Yucatan up to now. After swimming in the cenote, enjoy the maya buffet and the Mayaritas! Great to taste.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

335108734.name: Breath Taking
335108734.author: a TripAdvisor user
335108734.reviewBody: I visited cenote de maya and ekbalam two days again, but till today I can\'t find the words to describe how amazing this experience was for me. Ah it was just breath taking. Such a beautiful place. Our tour guide was Valentine and Guadalupe. Valentine was amazing, she didn\'t leave out any details.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

334912971.name: Great cenote and organic farm
334912971.author: a TripAdvisor user
334912971.reviewBody: We did this combined with the Ek Balam ruins. We do not swim so we were able to just take lots of pictures, I felt sorry for the people who jumped into the water and had to pay ridiculous money to have pictures. Lunch was absolutely delicious at the organic farm, food was divine. Organic food in Canada tastes nothing like this, makes me wonder how "organic" it really is. We did the Mayan blessing ceremony which was pretty cool, then strolled through the farm to see all kinds of trees and plants. All in all a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

332690956.name: An amazing place!
332690956.author: a TripAdvisor user
332690956.reviewBody: I had a fantastic visit to this cenote!  I traveled here on a tour combined with the ruins at Ek-Balam.  Rappelling into the cave was so exhilarating, I\'m very afraid of heights but the staff were very calming and I\'m so glad I did it!  The water is chilly in the cenote, be prepared!  There are zip lines, tubes, diving platforms and more to check out here.\nI also have to say, the food at the buffet here was the best I had in my whole time in Mexico!  As a vegetarian, the food in Mexico can sometimes be difficult, but they had a delicious soy and vegetables dish that was the best thing I had the whole trip!\nI absolutely recommend this attraction.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

332688503.name: Wonderful excursion
332688503.author: a TripAdvisor user
332688503.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed this cultural experience and the rappelling into the cenote was so exciting! We were honored to be a part of this  experience and interact with the Mayan villagers. The Mayan ruins were wonderful to see and we learned quite a bit!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

332168849.name: Very disappointed
332168849.author: a TripAdvisor user
332168849.reviewBody: So I visited Tulum from 08/12-13/12. I got many tour offers to this park for $ 250 for me and my husband. The tour included transportation to the cenote, Chichen Itz\u00e1, Valldolid, lunch buffet and transportation back to our hotel. Well we did not want to do the buffet lunch as we preferred to eat at a local restaurant in Valladolid so we rented a car instead and went on our own. If I may add I also got offered the tour to the Cenote for $50 USD, including lunch buffet. So as I was saying, my husband and I rented a car and went on our own. When we got to the cenote and even though I said to the guy selling tickets we only wanted to see the Cenote and swim, apparently the park did not have any other fee but that offered to us at the hotel! Then the guy said to me "if you tip me well I will see what can i do for you. He said he could charge me $30 as I was Mexican but my husband was a bit tricky as my husband was clearly a foreigner (he is Canadian and white with blonde hair and green eyes) and he (staff) may get in trouble. Then he changed his story and say he would charged us the equivalent of 75 USD for the two of us. We declined. Chichen Itz\u00e1 charges $20 USD per person! I was willing to pay that just to get in but I was not willing to get robbed! I understand they need to pay staff wages but I think what was very disappointing to us was the guy\'s shady attitude! To bad.... I heard the cenote is a breathtaking place.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

330722414.name: Terrible costumer service
330722414.author: a TripAdvisor user
330722414.reviewBody: I did this excursion two weeks ago, on the day of the trip i didn\'t bring money to purchase the photos, two weeks after purchasing them i still don\'t have them. THIS IS NOT A COMPLAINT ABOUT THE EXCURSION  (because the experience it self was amazing 10/10) IT IS ABOUT THE PHOTO SERVICES AND COSTUMER SERVICE. I have called 17 times and emailed at least 20 times. First they gave me the wrong code, i waited 3 days and received another code. second after i purchase the photos they DOUBLE CHARGED ME. Then they email me back in spanish twice and stop answering. My money hasn\'t been refunded yet. I have received the same emails back with the same downloads that don\'t work. This is the most frustrating service I\'ve ever dealt with. I called and asked to speak to a supervisor thinking he would be of better help and it turns out he was WORSE. He said i would receive a call back that never came, if it wasn\'t for the fact that these are the only way of getting pictures from my birthday i would have cancelled the transaction already. i will never deal with this again. Terrible service, my advise is bring money on the day or your own camera.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

330248816.name: Amazing Experience
330248816.author: a TripAdvisor user
330248816.reviewBody: Repelling into the underground cenote was an amazing experience.  The zip line in the cenote was great.  The water in clean and refreshing.  The entire experience was fantastic.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

330176603.name: Just beautiful!
330176603.author: a TripAdvisor user
330176603.reviewBody:
Took a day trip combined with Ek Balam from the Grand Bahia resort. it was a full day (08:30 to 17:30) through AlTourNative with Debbie as the tour guide and Jose as the driver.

Words can't describe this experience. Repelling into the cave and spinning as you go down, it was breathtaking. When you hit the water a staff member helps you unhook and you can swim to a platform to get a flotation ring, or hit the zip line or diving boards.

This cavern is massive too, so it's pretty much a giant swimming pool. There were small fish swimming and you could feel them brushing up against you. This is one of those things that everyone should do at least once! 

Before we went in, we also had a traditional Mayan ritual to ask for permission to enter the underworld. Debbie was very impressive and gave us so much Mayan history throughout the whole tour. 

Only downside is you can't take pictures but there are guys with digital cameras taking pictures of you the entire time. I knew what was coming next after we got out and sure enough we went to a room where all of our pictures for sale through 4 or 5 different packages ranging from $17 for 1 picture to $70 for all your pictures. There were about 25 pictures that they took of me. I would have paid $20 for my pictures probably but not the price of another excursion. A bit of a cash grab, but this exists everywhere so it wasn't a be all end all situation, and the Mayan people did a beautiful job creating an experience with the well maintained grounds, ceremony and traditional buffet lunch (yes they had a nice clean commercial kitchen) with proper food handling techniques.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

324958694.name: An Amazing Cenote
324958694.author: a TripAdvisor user
324958694.reviewBody: I haven\'t found a bad cenote yet but this one is particularly refreshing and beautiful, The water is so clear and cool, especially after repelling down into the pool. The staff was truly attentive and helpful. This place is magical.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

324874269.name: Rappeling into a cenote - So Awesome!
324874269.author: a TripAdvisor user
324874269.reviewBody: Who would have known that such an awesome activity even existed - strap on the harness, rappel 75 feet straight down into the 77 degree waters of an enormous cavern. So cool! Highly recommend this for anyone that is at all adventurous.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

315836559.name: Awesome experience
315836559.author: a TripAdvisor user
315836559.reviewBody: We drove to Cenote Maya on our way back to Tulum from a drive to Chichen Itza.  We didn\'t realize that the patrons exclusively contract through various resorts to take bus trips there, as opposed to driving yourself.  Normally there is a buffet, but they let us just pay for the cenote experience and before we knew it we were rappelling down into the water from a hole in the ceiling several stories up!\nThis is a good half day activity if you just drive there like we did. After dropping in, there is a zip line, and numerous platforms to jump into th crystal clear underground water.  When it\'s 90 degrees up top it\'s nice and cool inside this massive cenote.  This is a one-of-a-kind experience that should not be missed!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

312811940.name: Cenote Maya Park Day trip
312811940.author: a TripAdvisor user
312811940.reviewBody: What an excellent time!  There are so many amazing things to see, be prepared to be amazed!  Food was good too!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

306448617.name: Beautiful cavern with fun activities. Explained as the largest cenote in the region.
306448617.author: a TripAdvisor user
306448617.reviewBody:
Visiting the cenote of Ek Balam is something you absolutely must do of you're visiting the Yucatan. My group went as part of a guided tour by alltournative and our tour guide Artur was very informative and really got us all excited for the events. 

The cenote is a long drive into jungle territory and you will pass by many small towns and villages. Artur was eager to explain the culture and answer all questions we had. 

Coming into the cenote Park there is a long trail by which you travel to a clearing where a welcoming ceremony is performed by one of the elders. The ceremony is filled with Mayan blessings, incense, and the obligatory video recording that will be offered at the end of your trip. After the ceremony concluded, about 10 minutes, we were led to a mock Mayan house. They explain how Mayans lived in the past and how some still choose to reside. There are a few actors/villagers that wear the "traditional" Mayan garb and event costumes. 

Following the mini Mayan village, we were taken to complimentary lockers to store the few belongings we brought from our tour van. After locking everything up, you're directed to some showers to wash off any sweat, soap, deodorant, etc. The water is frigid but it's a requirement since you'll be swimming quite literally in their water supply.

After the shower you're given an option of walking down stairs to the cenote (boring) or rapelling down through the top directly into the water below (a lot of fun). Life jackets are available to anyone who isn't comfortable swimming. The rappel lines are all very secure, the harnesses and equipment in great shape, and guided below acting as belay if you need help. It was a lot of fun even for those with me that were afraid of heights. You descend into the water below which, in all honesty, is cold. After the initial shock it was great and extremely refreshing since prior to this you've likely been in the hot, humid jungle for hours. 

Once in the cenote you swim to a landing to take off your harness and gloves. After that you're on your own for a while. Activities in the cenote are two jumps/dive platforms at different Heights, a Tarzan swing, tight ripe walk, and tubes to float around in. The water is clear and if you have goggles you can take a look at the fish that you're swimming with. 

Be sure to look around and take it all in. It's a giant cavern half filled with water and with the roof opened up. Quite unlike anything I've ever had the opportunity to experience before and totally awe inspiring. Tons of photos will be taken of you this entire time and when you're about to leave they'll have you pose with your group and again as couples. 

After you're done in the cenote, you go back to the lockers and get changed. Towels are provided for you which was nice because your feet end up stained with clay from the walk leading to the lockers. Once done changing they will bring you to lunch. 

The food was all so good. Not sure if it was because of 4 days of all-inclusive resort food or if this was truly just so great, but several of us agreed the black beans specifically were hands down the best we've ever had. 

At this point you're tired from a long day, well fed, and about to be presented with the photos of your adventure. The prices were actually very reasonable when split amongst the group. We got our a and we're very happy with how they turned out. You do get to preview everything before you decide to purchase. It's an all-or-nothing deal so you don't just pick a few pictures, you get the entire collection they took of all pictures you're in. 

Last stop is the gift shop that has the items you'd probably expect to find. They have complimentary margaritas available for you as well (they are an odd brown color I can't begin to explain). 

I'd highly recommend participating in this experience if you're visiting the area and have the opportunity.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

300084977.name: Absolutely amazing !!
300084977.author: a TripAdvisor user
300084977.reviewBody:
I was there in a group of 5 (2 adults and 3 teens)
We were there at the end of the afternoon, after a morning visit to Chichen Itza, and every moment was delightful. This is a huge "cenote", where you can spend a fantastic time refreshing yourself and admiring the beauty of nature. Water level is 25 meters below surface.
Staff is fantastically friendly, there are lockers for your personal belongings.
Just go there, it is located some 30-40 min from Valladolid.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

298956023.name: A brilliant surprise
298956023.author: a TripAdvisor user
298956023.reviewBody: Wonerfully refreshing and most enjoying, this  swimming hole is a welcome relief in the heat of the day...

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

296139233.name: Drop Into Earth
296139233.author: a TripAdvisor user
296139233.reviewBody: We did a day trip from Puerto Adventuras (Barcelo) to Cenote Maya and the ruins at Ek Balam in September, 2014.  Cenote Maya has only been open to the public for about 4 years and it is unspoiled.  This is really not a diving or even snorkeling place, it is more of a drop into the earth by rappel of about 200 feet.  The staff is excellent and almost anyone can do the rappel (there are stairs if you want and they recently completed an excavation to allow for a ramp from top to bottom; accessible to all).  It is basically a big swimming hole underground at a cool 70 degrees.  I think everyone really comes here with a guide and they feed you lunch after you are finished in about an hour of swimming, then on the ruins and back to the hotel by about 5:00 p.m..  Don\'t remember the name of the tour we took (they limit to about 6-8) but they are in about every hotel with Apple reps.  About $70.00 U.S. per adult person. Kid person?  Well worth the day.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

293945158.name: Fun Adventure
293945158.author: a TripAdvisor user
293945158.reviewBody: You can rappel down about 60 feet into the water as my wife and I did, or go down a wooden staircase to the bottom. The water was cool and clear. They had a fun zip line, ropes challenge, tubes to float on, and 2 diving platforms. The lunch was excellent, and the ceremony with the Shaman was pretty cool too. We did this in combination with a trip to the Ek Balam Mayan ruins nearby. Really fun day.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

290919982.name: Great trip
290919982.author: a TripAdvisor user
290919982.reviewBody: Got there late in afternoon. 1 guide 2 photographers 4 people helping us out. Very friendly staff. They stayed late to let us enjoy the full experience. My wife and two daughters all enjoyed it fully. No one else there but it was like the place just for us.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

290501206.name: Cenote Maya Park
290501206.author: a TripAdvisor user
290501206.reviewBody: I didnt go swimming because of time but just observed for a while. Looks very nice and would put it on my list of things to do

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

285631741.name: Great cenote
285631741.author: a TripAdvisor user
285631741.reviewBody:
Part of a tour and we were first blessed ahead of entering the cenote as said to be part of the underworld in mayan history and also today.  Some mayans in historic dress that you could have pictures with.

Large cenote that you could rappell into or alternatively use the stairs, I'm not that brave so stairs it was. Nice and cool as you descended into the void and once at the water took a while to pluck up the courage to enter the cold (freezing) water.  Once in this was great, really refreshing and you could see fish in the clear water, 30 metres deep.

Number of activities in the cenote, zip wire and diving platforms.  Great place to cool down.

We then made our way to the surface to dry off and then lunch prepared by the locals, rice, chicken, and some egg/spinach filled pastries, vegetables and much more, said to be their local cuisine - all good

Recommend for a great cool down and some culture

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

284865636.name: Refreshing and beautiful
284865636.author: a TripAdvisor user
284865636.reviewBody: Visited here on my trip to Cancun. What a refreshing dip on a hot day and in a beautiful location. Great food too and extremely helpful waiting staff

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

284056160.name: Cenote Maya
284056160.author: a TripAdvisor user
284056160.reviewBody: Thanks Alejandra (Alita)-our guide, for that awesome trip- it was worth!\nWe both will remember sliding to the cenote on the lines- GREAT

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

282242747.name: AWESOME!  MUST DO!  HIGHLIGHT!
282242747.author: a TripAdvisor user
282242747.reviewBody: You don\'t want to miss this adventure!  It was Awesome.  We went with AllTOURnative Tours... Nicolas was our Guide and made it Awesome!  ASK FOR NICOLAS!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

281723552.name: Erik made this trip unforgettable!
281723552.author: a TripAdvisor user
281723552.reviewBody:
The entire trip in itself is pretty remarkable. 

There was a very long ride from our resort (Akumal Bay) to the first location (Ek Balam). However, our main guide Erik made the trip hilariously entertaining. With a mix of wit, sarcasm, and detailed information about the rest of our day, Erik was an incredible breadth of knowledge. He made the trip pass by in the blink of an eye, mainly because he had most of our van in stitches for the majority of the ride.

Our group went to Ek Balam first, a Mayan acropolis that has only bee open to the public for about 5 years. While there were other groups at the site, which made the place a bit crowded,  Erik as well as the Mayan guide made the trip very worthwhile. Both were very knowledgeable, earnest, and willing to answer any and all questions to the best of their abilities. Erik was currently in the process of studying archaeology at the local university, so he knew a lot more history compared to an average guide. You can tell that he embraced the culture respectfully and with great care.

One of the refreshing things about the excursion was the familiarity everyone felt towards Erik. It was obvious that he personally cared a lot about the culture and the integrity of the location. 

After Ek Balam, we went towards Cenote de Maya. Erik explained the purification ceremony we went through before entering the cenote. The Mayan shaman had prayed for our group's protection, peace, and continued well-being throughout our trip and beyond. It was a very humbling and once in a lifetime experience. 

The cenote itself was magnificent. The location was just breathtakingly beautiful. Because our group was small and the tour company had exclusive access, we were able to enjoy the space without competing with other people. 

All in all, I feel like the trip was well worth the money and time. I highly recommend this excursion.
