PS: If you get Erik as a guide, he's also friendly with the stray dogs that hang around the area. He fed them while we were there, much to our delight!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

272340146.name: REFRESHINGLY COOL
272340146.author: a TripAdvisor user
272340146.reviewBody: Before coming to Mexico I had no idea what a Cenote was - now I know that it\'s a large underground cave containing a pool of clear, clean water. We came here with a small group tour - only 10 in the group. Our guide - Tita with Alltournative - was very encouraging and helpful giving us the confidence to rappel down into the water rather than take the stairs. I am very glad that she did! The water was cold after being in the heat of the day, but so refreshing. There is a place to change and lockers for storing valuables. Towels are provided. Once in the Cenote there is a zipline to use and platforms at various heights for leaping off into the water. If you are worried about how to climb back out - no worries - there\'s a gently sloping tunnel to walk back up.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

271749054.name: Just based in publicity, very expensive compared with the other Cenotes. The staff is rude.
271749054.author: a TripAdvisor user
271749054.reviewBody: The price is expensive, is overcrowded and dirty. The staff treat the costumers just as a fontain of money. Cero recomandable. Avoid a de\nDisappointment and visit another Cenotes.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

266480320.name: Amazing!! Loved it!!
266480320.author: a TripAdvisor user
266480320.reviewBody: This was an amazing tour - loved every minute of it!!  Thank you!!\nThe tour was very organized, would have loved to have stayed in the Cenote a little longer, but completely understand we had to stick to our time.  The tour guide "olga" was very informative and very friendly!  The lunch provided was great - if you get a chance to go to this park - definitely do it!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

260452053.name: Really cool big cave-like cenote
260452053.author: a TripAdvisor user
260452053.reviewBody: Tour guide was Olga Gladkova with Alltournative Ecoachaeological Expeditions! !! Repelling into cenote was easy and felt safe. 75 foot drop. Water cool and refreshing.   Really cool big cenote with a small openings. I would call it a cave.  Good stairs and path if your don\'t want to repel.  You can swim in the cenote or use a tube provided you can also rope swing. Not crowded. Mayan ceremony seems authentic. Best cenote yet. They served us a Mayan lunch very good. Note: we did both the cenote and EkBalam on this excursion.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

259951605.name: Ok but not the best food ever.
259951605.author: a TripAdvisor user
259951605.reviewBody: Nice huge Cenote... but the rest is average. Fun to visit once, but would not go back. The place is not far from Ek Balam. Works great as a combo.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

259435025.name: Cenote Maya
259435025.author: a TripAdvisor user
259435025.reviewBody: Rappelling into the void was a thrilling experience, as was the shock of the chilly water! Awesomely beautiful. Don\'t waste your money on the photos, in my opinion...

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

258777461.name: A must doo...
258777461.author: a TripAdvisor user
258777461.reviewBody: Went with a tour, Ismael was a great guide, safety is a first with this tour.  You can rappel down, swim, tarzan rope, jump from a plaform... great activity. The only downside was that we did not stay long enough.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

258472781.name: An amazing site to be seen
258472781.author: a TripAdvisor user
258472781.reviewBody: This cenote was probably one of the most amazing things I have ever seen.  The repel into the water was very neat and exciting.   The water was very cold but so worth it.  It was so beautiful inside. It was nice just floating around on the inner tubes enjoying the beauty of the cave.  Would do again!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

257570159.name: Amazing Experience
257570159.author: a TripAdvisor user
257570159.reviewBody: My husband and I went on the Cenote Maya tour on our honeymoon. We had an amazing time. We started off with a traditional ritual given by the Mayans giving us permission to see the grounds. Then headed to the Cenote. You can repel down 80 feet or take the stairs. I was a little nervous to repel, but after a brief lesson and demonstration I felt much better. It\'s actually really easy & it is so rewarding when you get to see the enitre cenote from such a height. My husband turned into a little kid once he saw the water...instantly ran to the zip lines and platforms you can jump off of. Bring a waterproof camera if you have one. They will take your photos there. You can buy a CD with all your photos...roughly $70 USD.  Afterwards, we headed to a mexican homemade lunch. It wasn\'t what we expected, but we found things we enjoyed. After we headed back on the bus to see the Ek Balam. Amazing place to see. Hiked all the way up the ruins. Its very high & tiring. Coming down is a bit nerve racking...but it was worth it to see the view. \nWe wished we could have done it in the opposite order because it was extremely hot at Ek Balam. I had trouble focusing on the tour guide. I\'d suggest dressing lightly. I highly recommend this excursion. It was the highlight of our trip.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

255855355.name: Loved this Cenote!
255855355.author: a TripAdvisor user
255855355.reviewBody: We took a guided tour through Alltournative and really enjoyed our visit at this Cenote.  We started our visit observing a blessing from a local shaman and then proceeded to have a traditional Mexican meal and then visit the Cenote.  Cenote are considered sacred by the Mayans.  Guests have the option to either repel down into the Cenote or walk down the steps. I choose to repel down it was a very exciting experience which I would highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

254207099.name: 5 Star Cenote !!!!!
254207099.author: a TripAdvisor user
254207099.reviewBody: This stands out as one of the best things to do for a day trip including Ek Balam !!!! Rappelling into a Cenote is a must for a Bucket List !! Went on the tour with Alltournative Tour and the guides were Great but the experience is just Awesome !! Rappelled down , jumped off the platform inside the Cenote into the water , did a zip line and had fun with friends and family . Had an underwater camera so no worries there and got good photos . There are professional photographers there taking photos you can buy also...this is a must to capture your experience . This is a recommend for sure . You can also walk into the Cenote if you do not wish to rappel but......Just do it :)

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

253575175.name: Amazing Cenote Experience
253575175.author: a TripAdvisor user
253575175.reviewBody: Wasn\'t busy, rappelled down, tarzan lined across this amazing 80m cenote! Was a great experience and a delicious authentic lunch with Alltournative tour company and Joan was an excellent and very knowledgeable guide.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

253545557.name: EXCELLENT PLACE TO LEARN ABOUT THE HISTORY!
253545557.author: a TripAdvisor user
253545557.reviewBody: EXCELLENT FOOD, GREAT PLACE TO TAKES PICTURES, CAN\'T PUT INTO WORDS. A MUST to bring a waterproof camera to take picture of the underwater cave. the authentic mayan food was excellent & the drinking water natural spring. very good

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

253199104.name: You have to try this
253199104.author: a TripAdvisor user
253199104.reviewBody: Incredible views and a great experience.  Our guide, Joan Burgos, from Alltournative was very helpful in describing what a cenote was and what to look out for and where to see certain formations in the caves.  If you have never snorkeled in a cenote, I would recommend a guide the first time.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

253022637.name: Amazing
253022637.author: a TripAdvisor user
253022637.reviewBody: First of all our tour gide on and off the bus Olga was amazing so full of information about the site and area. To go and recline into the Cenote is a life experience. Then to swim in it Wow. The archeological site of the Temples just out of this world. The trip was incredible. Thank You Olga for a wonderful experience you made our day .

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

252940071.name: Cenote Maya, Riviera Maya, Mexico -- fun but brrr!
252940071.author: a TripAdvisor user
252940071.reviewBody:
My grown children and I visited Ek Balam ruins and rapelled down Cenote Maya.  Really enjoyed the Cenote!  

You rappel down from the top of a very large cavern -- wish I had paid more attention on the way down, because the cavern is spectacular!  I was too afraid of how cold the water at the bottom was going to be... and it was!!!  I told them I can't let go, and they brought an inner tube to me and hauled me to the platform!  :) 

This was followed by a very good Mayan lunch -- foods I have not experienced, and they were very good.

Worth going.  They also take a lot of pictures, and they are excellent.  I paid less than $100 for electronic pictures of all three of us.

Well worth seeing.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

252836011.name: Beautiful and fun!
252836011.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836011.reviewBody: The rapell into the cenote was amazing. The huge wooden structure inside doubles as a water park haha. The authentic Mayan food was excellent.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

252682055.name: Awesome Combo Trip
252682055.author: a TripAdvisor user
252682055.reviewBody: Mayan ruins, rappel into massive Cenote and swim in a cavern that looks like a set from a James Bond movie. Great value!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

250709451.name: So scary but definitely worth it
250709451.author: a TripAdvisor user
250709451.reviewBody: This activity was with ek balam and definitely was one of my favorite. That was really scary I have vertigo so badly but I did it anyway and I don\'t regret it..... Spectacular view from down there.... One of the highest cennote I\'ve seen. Amazing day and our guide Erik was awesome! \ud83d\udc4d

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

249790761.name: Awesome!
249790761.author: a TripAdvisor user
249790761.reviewBody: Super fun and beautiful!  A must do!  The whole experience was fantastic.  The service around the park is great and the lunch is delicious.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

249486000.name: Amazing time!
249486000.author: a TripAdvisor user
249486000.reviewBody: After viewing and touring Ek Balam, we traveled the short distance to the Cenote Maya Park.  What an amazing time we had. We swam in the Cenote after a purification ceremony.  The swim was cool but not cold.  The Cenote itself is absolutely beautiful. One of the best things we did in Cancun. We highly recommend it. (Try the zip line.....what a hoot!!)

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

249481839.name: Awesome experience!
249481839.author: a TripAdvisor user
249481839.reviewBody:
You have to swim in a cenote once in your life!
We did the rappel to get in. It was quite an adventure but it's super safe and the staff makes sure you feel comfortable (as much as you can be comfortable wearing a harness in bikini haha). Even my 60-year-old mom did it and she is totally not the adventurous kind. Try it! That's what travels are made for ! 

The cenote is situated in a nice little mayan village that offers you the food and a short visit before or after your swim. They have towels, lockers, washrooms and showers. 
Very welcoming, Dios bo’otik!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

247340042.name: Best day ever!
247340042.author: a TripAdvisor user
247340042.reviewBody: This was one of the best outings I have experienced!  So empowering and fun.  Our tour guide was excellent.  I would recommend buying the photos! The trip to Ek Balam was also excellent.   Well worth the money and time.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

247160072.name: Exciting Experience
247160072.author: a TripAdvisor user
247160072.reviewBody: We visited Cenote Maya as part of a tour of Ek Balam With Alltournative.  Both tours are top notch.  You can repel into the water or climb down the stairs to water level.  The water temperature was cool but not cold.  We enjoyed the zip line and different heights to dive from.  The buffet lunch was good with fresh tortillas being made next to the buffet tables.  It was very interesting to tour their gardens and see the many organically grown vegetables used to prepare the lunch.  Very enjoyable experience.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

247143644.name: AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE
247143644.author: a TripAdvisor user
247143644.reviewBody: Ek Balam and ruins tour  with alltournative.  \nRepelling down into the Cenote  was an amazing empowering experience.  absolutely gorgeous.  Cheers to our guide Mauricio who was patient, interactive, informative and had a great sense of humour.   Buffet was good.  Great experience- i would do tour again  with the same tour company as  this was definately one of the highlights of our trip

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

246344435.name: Amazing AllTourNative tour
246344435.author: a TripAdvisor user
246344435.reviewBody:
I had an amazing time 
I really enjoyed our guide Liliana her knowlage and interest made it a perfect day 
We greatest the shaman and were blessed before we went to the Cenote .. 
We rappelled  down into the Cenote where we zip lined   jumped off a cliff and walked the ropes 
We went to the buffet area and I was amazed by the feast waiting for us it was made by the local mayan people and it was delicious 
I highly recommend AllTourNative for this tour 
Request Liliana she's amazing

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

246331800.name: Great adventure!
246331800.author: a TripAdvisor user
246331800.reviewBody: This was so much fun, we took a taxi from Valladolid, they charged 400 pesos to drive us there, wait 2-3 hours, and drive us back.  It was $49 US dollars for the park and included a tour, rappelling into the cenote, swimming, diving, floating, zip line in the cenote, margaritas or coffee afterwards, a buffet lunch (good if you like authentic Mexican food, they did have spaghetti too but it wasn\'t what American\'s are used to) and a tour of all the native plants they grow and use.  It was a great experience and off the beaten path!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

245343907.name: Great day
245343907.author: a TripAdvisor user
245343907.reviewBody: Koodos to Lilianna (Lila) who is an amazing guide, and truly knowledgeable.  Tour was fun, informative and lunch very good.   Cenotes are fun and gorgeous as well.  We went with your 77 year old mother and has slight mobility issues such as walking slower than most, so tour was a little too fast past for her.  Would not recommend for elders.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

244498102.name: Excellent day out
244498102.author: a TripAdvisor user
244498102.reviewBody:
Went to the Cenote as part of a package including Ek Balam ruins. This Cenote was spectacular. When you travel along the main highway between Cancun and Tulum you come to realise by the road signs that these Cenotes appear to be in every back yard lol, I was beginning to wonder how eastern Mexico didn't just collapse. 
We chose this one because of the photos and the fact there were other activities included such as high boards and a zip line.
We chose to rappell into the sink hole from the top and got some stunning photos of this.... This has to be the ONLY WAY to enter... Don't take the stairs unless you really have to. The fresh water at the bottom was very cold :o) but very refreshing. It's around 6-8 metres deep. 
The buffet lunch we were supplied at the end of the visit was great... All authentic Mayan food with some dangerously hot salsas. I'm not sure if the lunch was because this was part of a package so you may want to check. 
They take many hi-res photos of you in the Cenote which they offer to sell you at the end at about 15 dollars each but if you have a waterproof camera they don't restrict you from taking it in with you. I bought one photo of us rappelling in from above as it was something I couldn't have shot myself. 
All in all an impressive site and I would have no hesitation in returning.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

244439066.name: Don\'t worry if you\'re not a swimmer
244439066.author: a TripAdvisor user
244439066.reviewBody: Even though you can propel down to the water in this Cenote, which my husband did, I chose to walk down the large wooden staircase (I don\'t swim.)  Being inside this gorgeous Cenote was a worthwhile experience.\nThe park also provides a beautiful and educational tour of their gardens and a blessing ceremony with a Sharman.\nI enjoyed the Mayan Buffet with its\' traditional dishes.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

242978574.name: Underground cavern
242978574.author: a TripAdvisor user
242978574.reviewBody: Walk carefully down the slippery path into the dark of the cavern to discover the eerie light and shimmering water\u2026and you can swim in it too.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

242843453.name: Excellent!
242843453.author: a TripAdvisor user
242843453.reviewBody: We visited the Cenote Maya Park as part of a package with the Ek-Balam Mayan Ruins using Alltournative ecoarchaelogical expeditions. Our guide, Carlos, was amazing for both locations and had a great understanding of Mayan culture. Repelling into the Cenote was exceptional and the traditional Mayan lunch was delicious. A must visit!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

226480936.name: Couldn\'t be better
226480936.author: a TripAdvisor user
226480936.reviewBody: We kept seeing the signs for Cenote Maya on our way from Tulum to Merida. We decided to visit and we were not disappointed! The drive from the main road to the attraction is a bit long but well worth it! Our guide was Rafael and he did and he was wonderful; he took great pictures and videos of my husband and I with out iPad and he also made sure we were having a good time. The lunch buffet was tasty and adequate. I highly recommend the "maya" rita that the bartender makes. We will definitely be returning to this attraction and bringing the kids.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

222493776.name: Chilly but fun
222493776.author: a TripAdvisor user
222493776.reviewBody: This is not an experience for the faint hearted. You can rappel into the underground lake, walk the ropes, dive in and zip wire in. Our son is four and was unable to participate in any of the activities but it was amazing to look at and he was happy just watching the cat fish swimming around.  The ceremony with the Mayan shaman was interesting to see. You can\'t really take good photos due to the lighting underground but there are photographers there and you can view your family photos at the end (which are excellent) and you also get a large selection of nature photos on the cd.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

219591265.name: Very Cool!
219591265.author: a TripAdvisor user
219591265.reviewBody:
We went here with Alltournative on a tour combination with Ek Balam.  This was a very cool experience which we all enjoyed.  Before you get into the cenote you are required to shower off.  The showers are outdoors and bees are flying around...be careful because my daughter got stung!
You can rappel down or walk; rappeling was fun!  Inside it is beautiful and the water is cool.  We had a great time.
Afterwards we were served a decent lunch and then they had pictures for us to buy.  This was the worst part because there were plenty of pictures of us but the price was ridiculous!!  They would sell many more and have satisfied customers if they would sell you all the pictures on a CD for about $20-$25 instead of $54.  I recommend you invest in a water proof camera for this trip.  We ended up buying only a couple of pictures.
We could have spent MUCH more time in the cenote but we were on a tour and were time constrained.   You might want to consider renting a car and have control of your time.  Next time I go I will rent a car.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

219240420.name: Cenote Maya
219240420.author: a TripAdvisor user
219240420.reviewBody: We loved everything, the rappelling , the diving, the time to explore the cenote, this experience was unforgettable

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

217741833.name: perfect
217741833.author: a TripAdvisor user
217741833.reviewBody:
it was perfect, very safe, clean, interactive.
i drove there and the roads are very safe.
well worth the 49 usd entrance fee my son did not pay.
my 9 year old (a true scary cat) did every activity.
the food could be better but, it was ok.
take a water resistant camera, invest on a good one, it is worth it
they will take pics of you and sell you a cd with all your pics for 38 use ( for two of us)
if you are planing on buying the cd then ask the photographer to take pics of you every time you are gonna jump.
plan to be there for about 3-4 hours

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

217200746.name: Amazing!
217200746.author: a TripAdvisor user
217200746.reviewBody: Was visiting Cancun for the first time with the family celebrating the little ones birthday.  We decided to book a couple of adventures with our agent from apple vacation this was our first one. We were picked up at our hotel by our AWESOME tour guide Thomas. He was just awesome made us feel welcomed. Enough to say everything ran perfect and the Cenote was just awesome. Thank you everyone for the great memories.  RRosales Colio

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

215000921.name: My teenager\'s favorite part of the trip
215000921.author: a TripAdvisor user
215000921.reviewBody: This place is fun for all ages.  I was hesitant to repel into the cave but am so glad I did and would love to do it again.  Once into the cave, there was so much fun to do.  You could use the zip line and jump into the water, you could use the tubes and float, you could race on the ropes or jump from the platforms.  I recommend spending the $53 to purchase the photo CD of yourself.  The lunch buffet was excellent.  We enjoyed resting in the Mayan hammocks after lunch.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

214573589.name: what a beautiful place!!
214573589.author: a TripAdvisor user
214573589.reviewBody: I had no idea  what it meant cenote!! but this place is an example of how beautiful  nature can be!! huge cave with crystal clear water for swimming and enjoying with family

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

214121620.name: Rappel a must to go down into the water.....
214121620.author: a TripAdvisor user
214121620.reviewBody: Totally beautiful and relaxing....Great experience...a must to do and well worth the excursion. Get to pass through many small towns. The Alltournative guide was great.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

212229138.name: Swim in a cenote
212229138.author: a TripAdvisor user
212229138.reviewBody: If you don\'t mind cool water you can rappel down a rope and take a swim in this large and beautiful cenote.  Those less adventurous can walk down a path to the water and still enjoy a dip!  The park is beautiful and still undergoing  development.  Besides the cenote you can also see local vegetation, enjoy a meal, and shop at shops.  Something for everyone.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

207248546.name: Brilliant!!
207248546.author: a TripAdvisor user
207248546.reviewBody: In the morning we had been to Coba, climbing up the Mayan ruins and wanted to visit the cenote for its beauty but also to help cool us down. We drove into the car park wondering if we were in the right place as we were the only car there! We chose not to do the tour, the ceremony or the lunch so can\'t comment on those parts - but the cenote visit was really well organised. It\'s apparently the biggest in the Yucatan peninsula. There are lockers for your valuables, a local shower which was brilliant fun and a guide who takes you down into the cenote. The cenote is a source of drinking water for local communities so take care to wash off the sun cream etc before you go in. The cenote was beautiful, the sound of the bats was enchanting and the water so cool. We had a thermal rash vest on and took our snorkels and masks to look around. There\'s a few little black catfish in the water but nothing else so we took them off after a while. There\'s a zip line in the cenote which was a lot of fun and such a different experience. We were the only people there which was pretty incredible. It cost us $21 each which wasn\'t bad and we had a great guide too. Tipping is very gratefully received. We had a guide who didn\'t speak any English but he tried so hard nonetheless! An excellent afternoon all round.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

201092158.name: Superb Day!
201092158.author: a TripAdvisor user
201092158.reviewBody: If you enjoy partially excavated archeological sites this one is for you. Booked through Alltournative tours provided excellent service. Our guide, Olga, was knowledgeable and fun to be with. I did a first time rappel into the cenote: YES, I had a panic trying to let go and rappel down but Olga and the expert at the top of the cenote were amazing in calming me down and I DID IT!  The lunch in the Mayan village was very fresh and tasty. People were all so happy and welcoming. Thoroughly enjoyed exploring Ek Balam with a Mayan guide. Climbed to the top of the temple and well worth the climb! Harder coming back down: not for those afraid of heights or steep climbs. A wonderful memorable day! Bring cash for the photographer if you do the rappel. Photos are worth it!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

200285394.name: Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Maya Park
200285394.author: a TripAdvisor user
200285394.reviewBody: We went to this Maya Park after visiting the Ek Balam ruins on the trip advisor recommendations and while it\'s probably a 20-30 minute drive we weren\'t disappointed.  The people there were fantastic.  The Cenote was great.  For MP$350 we got the all inclusive package that included repelling down into the cave, the zip line and platform diving while in the Cenote (the Tarzan swing was out of service while we were there) and a full buffet lunch and Mayan Ceremony outside the cave.  We skipped the Mayan ceremony as we arrived in the afternoon and the place shuts down around 4pm but we took advantage of everything else and the facilities were awesome with showers, changing rooms and lockers and the lunch was absolutely delicious.  We are so glad we came to Maya Park.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

198461856.name: AMAZING TIME!!!
198461856.author: a TripAdvisor user
198461856.reviewBody: I went with ALLTOURNATIVE on a combined tour with EkBalam.. an amazing, unique experience.. would highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

198011503.name: Rappel into a cenote!
198011503.author: a TripAdvisor user
198011503.reviewBody: We went to Cenote Maya as part of a day trip (also included Ek Balam) with Alltournative Ecoarchaeological Expeditions.  Shaman blessing for safety was a unique Mayan experience that we didn\u2019t experience elsewhere.  Felt the buffet here was average, surprising given they grow many fresh ingredients on site.  The walk into the site through the large vegetable and herb garden was interesting though.  After lunch, the cenote itself was outstanding.  My brother and I got a thrill from rappelling into it, while a stairway and a ramp were available for others in our party that were feeling less adventurous.  Swimming wasn\u2019t the only activity available at the bottom.  There were also zip-lines, platforms to jump off, parallel rope walks and float tubes to entertain everyone.  There are a number of photographers snapping photos, including some really good ones of us rappelling.  We weren\u2019t surprised the images cost extra, but were still a little disappointed given the cost of the expedition.  Leave the water shoes at home as they are not allowed in the cenote.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

195394205.name: So cool!
195394205.author: a TripAdvisor user
195394205.reviewBody: We were brought along forest trails and shown some local Mayan gardens, then received a Mayan blessing from the village Shaman. Then we repelled 20m into The largest known cenote in the Yucatan! It\'s 80m across at water level. Very, very cool trip.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

193920734.name: The Cenote Maya Park
193920734.author: a TripAdvisor user
193920734.reviewBody:
While on the Riviera Maya last week, we took Alltournative's 'Ek Balam - Cenote Maya' tour.   I'll review the Cenote Maya part of the tour here.

We were then driven to the Cenote Maya from Ek Balam by way of a few Mayan towns and villages, the last of which being where the staff of the park live.  The park is beautiful, situated in the lush jungle - too many photo ops to count.  The cenote experience itself was nothing short of spectacular.   This cenote (cave), apparently the largest on the peninsula, can be entered either by way of stairs, or by rappelling some 75 feet in open air down to the wonderfully cool water below.  For those who have never rappelled, no worries - the staff ensure a very safe rappel!  Swimming in the cool water is a lovely treat after spending time in the warm sun.   After spending some time in the Cenote, we were treated to a most excellent lunch prepared by some of the people living in the area.
If you have a chance to get in on a tour to the Cenote Maya, do so.  Well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

192768171.name: Do the repel
192768171.author: a TripAdvisor user
192768171.reviewBody: The first part of the Alltournative tour was Cenote Maya. Very large Cenote and it it well worth the option to repel down into it. Very safe and anyone can do it. Cool, clear water at the bottom and you can have fun on the small zip line and dive platform. Walk back up to the top for a great Mayan lunch ( try the green sauce if you like hot). Photo of the repelling is quite expensive though ($56USD for the full set). No one in our group opted for that. Mayan ceremony at the beginning was quite interesting and the guide (Sophie) was well informed about the site and the Mayan culture.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

191949500.name: Do you dare to Rappel into the unknown
191949500.author: a TripAdvisor user
191949500.reviewBody: We visited the Cenote as part of our trip to Ek Balam...  we were told ahead of time that because of the heavy rains the platforms in the Cenote were under 2 metres of water so you couldn\'t walk across.. i\'m not a strong swimmer so didn\'t change into my suit, just decided to walk part way down.  To bad as the water wasn\'t that deep and i could have walked across... several from our group did the rappel and were thrilled with the experience... Over all a great experience... from the initial ceremony getting the blessing to enter the Cenote to the crafts at the end of the tour..

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

191724515.name: Largest and most fun cenote in the Yucatan
191724515.author: a TripAdvisor user
191724515.reviewBody: The Cenote Maya is the largest and most interesting - we have been to several cenotes.  There is a Mayan ceremony by native Mayans before entering the Cenote.  We walked down six flights of wooden stairs, or if you prefer, rapel down on a rope. There are lifeguards with wet suits.  There are ample bathrooms, lockers and a restaurant as well as a large gift shop.  Take your camera!  A prepared CD with  photos is available for purchase afterwards.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

184414909.name: Great family adventure
184414909.author: a TripAdvisor user
184414909.reviewBody: We visited Ek Balam and Cenote Maya with our girls aged 10 and 12 and it was a wonderful day! The Cenote was magnificent and we enjoyed rappelling, Tarzan swing, high dive board...all in a cave with genuinely friendly Mayan hosts!  Yes, they do encourage you to buy the cd of pictures but for the first time I really wanted to...they take the best action shots! The food was great and the facilities clean and safe but still maintaining authenticity of the area.  The drive to the site was long but the portion that went through the Mayan villages was such an educational experience and eye opener for our girls it was worth missing school back home...this day was nothing anyone can get from a textbook!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

173079663.name: Great Experience for my 50th Birthday
173079663.author: a TripAdvisor user
173079663.reviewBody:
Something to check off on your bucket list. The site is very remote and you have to walk a path through the jungle to get to it. Before you arrive you pull off to an area where there is a tiny old village elder and he says a blessing to all of the group. It was very spiritual. You are then led to a locker room/washroom area to get your bathing trunks on. All your belongings are safely locked up in the locker provided. You then head off for a cold shower. This Cenote is actually drinking water and they don't want you to contaminate it. 
You are then harnassed up and then you rappel down into the Cenote, water is super cold but very refreshing. There are tarzan swings, diving platforms, and a sling shot type swing, I tried it all. I was totally exhausted but totally relaxed.
Once your time is up, they take you for a nice hot lunch. Everything was very clean and the food was very good. My picker eater actually ate a chicken leg wrapped in banana leaf.
Then after lunch they take you to the photo hut to look at all the pics they took of you. You wont be able to resist. Pics are amazing. The pics I took with my waterproof camera didn't even compare. Buy the CD and then head to the bar for freshly made margherittas ( really good) 
 They have very nice facilities, and lockers.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

172858725.name: AWESOME
172858725.author: a TripAdvisor user
172858725.reviewBody:
This place from start to finish is beautiful, terrifying, relaxing and peaceful.

Beautiful and Peaceful:
The scenery, the setting, the people, you feel like you're in a secret exclusive getaway, from the jungle walk to beautiful trees and flowers, this place does not disappoint.  Upon arrival you will be blessed by the village elder in the middle of the jungle, it is very peaceful.

Terrifying:
If you're into rappelling than this is the spot for you! I was not brave enough, unfortunately I looked down and decided to take off my harness while kids... I mean kids walked by me excited ready to go.  I took the stairs, those were scary enough.  

Once you're in, there are zip lines, a swing line thing, different points of jumping, I chose none and just swam.  Water is COLD but very refreshing.  It's also very dark and very deep in certain spots.  

Relaxing:
After you have braved the elements of the Cenote you relax with a nice hot Mayan lunch that was in one word DELICIOUS.  Lots and lots of food options, hot coffee and soup was a perfect way to finish after the swim.

Tips: 
Don't bring your fancy cameras, you cant take them into the Cenote anyway.  Bring waterproof if you can but really you don't have to bring either, all the guys there take awesome professional photos as you rappel, zip line, swing line, swim, they take TONS that are available for purchase (at a reasonable price considering the amount of pics they take).  BE BRAVE --- unlike me.  You'll probably enjoy it more than just a swim. :)

I went as part of a tour so I'm not sure of individual rates!!  Sorry!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

172218504.name: Very cool!
172218504.author: a TripAdvisor user
172218504.reviewBody: This one is more than your average sinkhole.  You can repel down into this cave from the only opening.  Awaiting down below are zip lines, jungles ropes and diving (jumping) platforms of various heights.  What a great time for everyone in the family!!

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

156442765.name: Repelling was the BEST
156442765.author: a TripAdvisor user
156442765.reviewBody: If you are to experience a Cenote, go to the World\'s largest !!!! 45 m below ground. That is a long way to repel if you are afraid of heights.  Be tough !!!! DO IT !!! .... just don\'t look down. The rock formations can be admired once you have reached the bottom. The water is COLD !!!! The workers arrive with lifejackets if you are not a swimmer. Note that the stairs are just as scary - or scarier - if you suffer vertigo as you are forced to look down onto the next step. We got the CD of all the photos -  great souvenir of a great adventure. The special Mayan ritual that preceeds the descent is also interesting, but short.

address.streetAddress: Road Chemaxenas de Uspibil - Chacmil, Km 3

673069082.name: WRONG ADRESS
673069082.author: a TripAdvisor user
673069082.reviewBody: Comon... have the right adress when it\u2019s the top 3 things to do here... Search on google maps if you go there

668677193.name: A hidden gem! Absolutely beautiful!
668677193.author: a TripAdvisor user
668677193.reviewBody: Beautiful cave experience with not that many people there which made it peaceful and wonderful! It only cost $100 pesos or $5 dollars. Trust me worth the trip!

663484049.name: Other-worldly beauty
663484049.author: a TripAdvisor user
663484049.reviewBody:
We were advised to visit this cenote by the manager of our Valladolid hotel, and how glad we were to have taken his advice.
We did not visit a huge number of cenotes and this was our only fully subterranean one, so perhaps we are not in the best position to judge...  But, if there are any cenotes more beautiful than this one, then Yucatan is indeed blessed.

Perhaps the best thing about Palomitas is that its relative remoteness means that it does not attract great hordes of tourist.  Indeed, we had it to ourselves for over an hour.  Swimming in the cool turquoise waters is certainly the water-borne highlight of my life to date.  I had to keep pinching myself to remind me that I was not an aquatic extra n some Lord of the Rings-type extravaganza.  I doubt Peter Jackson could have dreamt up a more appealing nor breathtaking set.

658640975.name: wrong adress!!
658640975.author: a TripAdvisor user
658640975.reviewBody: wasted my time to look for it - wrong address!\none said it\'s around the corner, one it\'s next to Coba, the other said its 25 km away.....

655217312.name: Powerfully Moved
655217312.author: a TripAdvisor user
655217312.reviewBody: Singing, chanting and submerging quietly with full awareness in this sacred place was purely magical

652852613.name: World-Class Attraction
652852613.author: a TripAdvisor user
652852613.reviewBody: This eco-spiritual, as well as aesthetically-profound, attraction is amazing and may well achieve "peak-experience" status for many travellers.

643535621.name: Best Kept Secret
643535621.author: a TripAdvisor user
643535621.reviewBody: There are two Cenotes here - Palomitas and Agua Dulce, and we (my husband, two college aged kids and I) did both of them on the way to visiting Chichen Itza. It was our first experience with Cenotes, and because we had the place to ourselves, it made all the others that were crowded with tourists seem so unappealing. Palomitas has beautiful turquoise water and little jet black fish that dart around you as you swim and Agua Dolce has a rope swing and kayaks. This was my 19 year old son\'s favorite part of our trip. And we saw a giant Iguana and a goat that sounded like a person.

614055016.name: One of the best!
614055016.author: a TripAdvisor user
614055016.reviewBody: Amazing cenote where we really liked it. Off the beaten track, we were absolutely alone there. Highly recommended!

576901629.name: Cool and lovely
576901629.author: a TripAdvisor user
576901629.reviewBody: I prefer above ground cenotes but Palomitas was beautiful, and a must for anyone who likes geological formations.

572560491.name: Wonderful place
572560491.author: a TripAdvisor user
572560491.reviewBody:
We visited this Cenote with our lovely taxi driver (check out Maya adventure transportación peninsular on FB).
It was empty when we got there (about 2 pm) and we had the whole place just for us.
They have ropes and free floating stuff you can use to swim. 
Entrance was a little under 200 pesos for 2 adults and 1 child.

Clean, good people, great experience. A little remote but worth the drive if you don’t like crowds.

570980793.name: Great experience
570980793.author: a TripAdvisor user
570980793.reviewBody: Beautiful cenote with a minimum of people. Clear water with beautiful color, very nice surroundings. The cenote you must to see.

567965558.name: A lovely place to relax
567965558.author: a TripAdvisor user
567965558.reviewBody: The Cenote Palomitas is an excellent introduction to cenote swimming. Connoisseurs of cenotes may rank this one fairly low but it is very convenient and is a beautiful place for a cool  swim in the heat of the day. Also, not crowded so plenty of space for swimming.\n\nThe attached restaurant is very good too for non-swimming colleagues.

566769455.name: Unforgettable experience
566769455.author: a TripAdvisor user
566769455.reviewBody: This is for sure an experience to remember. We visited the cenote around 12.00 and we were the only ones. The view is beautiful and the water was refreshing but not too cold. At first it felt a bit scary to know that the bottom is 50m but even our daughters (4&6years) enjoy the place with their floaties

562549286.name: Amazing for the family
562549286.author: a TripAdvisor user
562549286.reviewBody: Everyone had an amazing time! We are traveling with our 1 and 5 year old. There is a stone platform on the left before the steps that has about 5 inches of water that was so perfect for the baby. We brought a floaty tube for the 5 year old and he was swimming all over. Just a few other people there. It was crystal clear, beautiful stalactites and stalagmites, a gorgeous beam of light entering in. You can jump into the water off of different platforms. So fun!!! We originally were coming to see both Cenotes - Palomitas and Agua Dulce. After Palomitas we ventured over to Agua Dulce, but it was not what we expected and did not match any reviews I had read. It was closed off by a barbed wire gate that a kid came an opened for us. Super dark, scary and dismal looking, full of spider webs so you could tell no one goes in that often. Though we took a moment to take some pictures and play with our echoes. The winner hands down of these two was Palomitas!

533615779.name: Beautiful cenote!
533615779.author: a TripAdvisor user
533615779.reviewBody: Chilly water!  Beautiful, enclosed cenote somewhat outside of Valladolid.  We were one of only 2 groups visiting (total of 6 people)!

515138944.name: A family cenote
515138944.author: a TripAdvisor user
515138944.reviewBody:
Beautiful closed cenote, with a family spirit.
You can jump into the water from 2 to 5m !
Lavatories, showers, cabins are free and people are very friendly. Small typical village near the cenote: you are welcome!
More than 4 cenotes in the same périmètre(2km)...Enjoy!

514635777.name: Amazing Cenote
514635777.author: a TripAdvisor user
514635777.reviewBody: Cenote Palomitas is a stunning and beautiful cave without the hustle and bustle of other Cenotes. We were only one of two small parties visiting at the time which was good as  I suspect it would be quite easily feel crowed.\nThere are toilet/changing rooms/showers then its a short walk to the Cenote via steps carved into the rock. The view when you enter is amazing then take a deep breath and jump in !! A great experience which we would recommend.

484771814.name: BEAUTIFUL Cenote on the road less traveled
484771814.author: a TripAdvisor user
484771814.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful cenotes i\'ve visited.  It\'s underground and it is enormous and beautiful.  You enter a cave and take steps down to enter the clear waters.  The best part was that since it is less known it also also less frequented, so when my friends and I visited we were the only ones there at the time (and we went mid-day aka prime cenote-visiting time).  Definitely recommend.

477277740.name: One of my favourite Cenotes
477277740.author: a TripAdvisor user
477277740.reviewBody: This place was recommended to us to visit and we were really glad that it was. When we visited we had the place to ourselves a lot of the time. A few minibuses came and went but it was lovely to relax in the cool cave water in total privacy.

465606560.name: Cenote Palomitas off the beaten track.
465606560.author: a TripAdvisor user
465606560.reviewBody: This cenote is one of two about a half hour drive from Valladolid. It is underground with steps carved from the rock leading down to the water. Lighting has been strategically placed in the cenote. The water temperature is very pleasant. Lots of stalagmites and stalactites.One opening in the roof lets in natural light. A guide is provided. There are change rooms with lockers and washrooms. There is a little snack and souvenir shop as well. And we were the only ones there so no crowd.  It is truly awesome. The sister cenote Agua Dulce was closed for maintenance. And apparently it is not as easily accessible.

460152188.name: Amazing cenote
460152188.author: a TripAdvisor user
460152188.reviewBody: It is not the easiest way to get there from Valladolid but it is absolutely worth it. We took a taxi in the end, which was not so expensive in the end. The cenotes are slightly remote, but it only means that we were the only people there. The stuff working there is very friendly and funny. It is worth visiting both cenotes. The second one has a rope, so you had use it like a big swing. Both have an inflated circles if you are tired of swimming. Absolutely magic place

450984344.name: One of the most amazing cenotes I\'ve been
450984344.author: a TripAdvisor user
450984344.reviewBody: This beautiful cenote is located around 10 minutes from Yalcoba town, if you are in Valladolid the best way to go is walking to the main plaza and ask for the shared taxis to Yalcoba, from there you can take a little trasnportation, like a bike with space for 4 people on the back and they can drive you to the cenote las palomitas. Big cenote, you also can visit Agua Dulce in the same  area, the pictures can\'t show how beautiful it is. Don\'t miss it.

448641571.name: Great experience!
448641571.author: a TripAdvisor user
448641571.reviewBody: Simple, not crowded, clean and beautiful. Great formations - stalactites high above your head while in the water. Not for the faint at heart, as it is fairly steep to get in - man made steps are fairly basic, the water at 50m depth is a dark blue, but what a rush to swim in it.\nGreta experience, we were told by other people which tried some other Senota\'s that the Palomitas is still a bit of a hiden gem.

448610727.name: Good infrastructure
448610727.author: a TripAdvisor user
448610727.reviewBody: Better than many visited cenotes. \nGood clean services.  They added lights. Good swimming. And the stairs they added work well. Do not walk barefoot as rocks can be sharp.

441213059.name: A hidden gem but worth the 40 minute drive to get there
441213059.author: a TripAdvisor user
441213059.reviewBody:
Well a couple of things here. Make sure you have correct directions,as it's a little way away from anywhere.
Would suggest it is worth getting there earlier in the day as the sun shafts into the cenotes are better.
Both which we visited were spectacular,and essentially we were the only ones there. The water so clear 
Very different experience to Grande Cenote near Tulum

440496019.name: Interesting
440496019.author: a TripAdvisor user
440496019.reviewBody: Its a wondeful place, very well cared, very clean and there were only us so it was quiet too. The water in not so cold and the view is incredible!

430738160.name: Beautiful magical place
430738160.author: a TripAdvisor user
430738160.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful desolate and so incredibley magical, cold water but so refreshing after sometime under the hot sun! Can\'t wait to go back!also nice because not crowded at all we had the place to ourselves :)

398165873.name: Great
398165873.author: a TripAdvisor user
398165873.reviewBody:
Down some steep stairs.
With a small hole in the roof.
Great for swimming. Also possible to be Bilayed through the hole in the roof, and down to the water below. My son did this ( he happens to rock climb so enjoyed this, I hadn't the courage). 
We loved it, but if you have difficulty walking or swimming, this might be difficult for you, as it is deep. There are public bathrooms at the top.

The restaurant along the same track is pricey and not that great. 

We travelled here after visiting Ek Balam by local taxi, and our driver suggested this Cenote, before returning to Valladolid. It is possible to share a taxi from Valladolid to Ek Balam to reduce the cost. This Cenote is off the beaten track, it was recommended to get a taxi to hang around and wait for you, if you visit this Cenote, and arrange a flat rate before hand. ek Balam is easy to get a taxi from.

396173627.name: Authentic experience
396173627.author: a TripAdvisor user
396173627.reviewBody: Went to the Zaci Cenote in Valladolid last year and we were very disappointed (crowded and didn\'t seem very clean). Someone suggested Palomitas and we are so glad went. It is stunningly gorgeous (bright, clean, light blue water) and there were very few people. The staff who work there are very helpful, and the shower/changing facility is really clean. I appreciate that they ask people to shower before getting in. Once you get to Yalcoba the road to the cenote really narrows down and isn\'t very well marked, but everyone in town can point you in the right direction. Really worth a visit!

389094396.name: Magical!!
389094396.author: a TripAdvisor user
389094396.reviewBody: This is a fabulous magical place! Theres another cenote next door called agua dulce (in the same land) that is even more magical but darker and with steep steps. If you don\u00b4t mind the steps, it\u00b4s an AMAZING place for healing waters!

340775308.name: Amazingly beautiful Cenote
340775308.author: a TripAdvisor user
340775308.reviewBody: Bring your snorkeling gear and you will have a fabulous time! Even without it you\'ll have fun. There are so many cenotes in the Yucatan peninsula and I didn\'t encounter one I didn\'t like. Each has its own unique beauty that is indescribable. You just need to go there.

330473432.name: Cool
330473432.author: a TripAdvisor user
330473432.reviewBody:
We started out to got to Cenote Maya but the price was exorbitant so gave it a miss.  Came across sign at side of the road for Cenote Agua Dulce and decided to give it a try rather than having a wasted journey.  

We arrived about 14.00hrs on a Tuesday and the place looked deserted.  Welcomed by guide who explained there are 2 cenotes at the site, Agua Dulce and Palomitas, at a cost of £4 (US$6) each, guide recommended Palomitas was the most beautiful.  Showed us to large, clean changing rooms and offered us life jackets at no cost although we did not take these.  

Short walk to steps down into Cenote Palomitas which was warm and lit by small hole in the roof and 1 single light.  Water was a refreshing 25 degrees, so cool to step into but very pleasant once in and moving.  The stalactites are awesome and the water appeared black apart from a bright turquoise pool where a shaft of light enters through the roof.  Three different sets of steps into the water where catfish gather.  

We stayed for and hour and a half and had the place to ourselves the whole time, very ethereal experience, floating in the black water in silence apart from the occasional drip of water from the stalactites.  

Well worth a visit.

309822290.name: Beautiful But It Did Not Wow Us...
309822290.author: a TripAdvisor user
309822290.reviewBody:
We visited Palomitas Cenote on a tour to Chichen Itza.  
Palomitas is a beautiful cenote with clear water and huge stalactites. 
It was nice to visit another cenote however, it does not compare with Dos Ojos because you don't have the opportunity to snorkel through the caves.
We were not provided with wet suits or snorkel equipment so that made the experience less enjoyable too.
There are very nice rest rooms available for changing clothes.
As nice as this basic cenote was, it just did not wow us.

308956202.name: Nature at its Best
308956202.author: a TripAdvisor user
308956202.reviewBody: We wanted to see stalagmites and we were directed to this cenote. If you are seeking an attraction with tons of touristy developed activities - this is not for you. But if you are in search of nature\'s simple wonders, you will be rewarded at this cenote. You don\'t have to go into the water to appreciate this wonder. There are places to sit on the rocks with a perfect view of the stalagmites hanging down. Even seniors can visit this cenote because there are handrails beside the steps that make it a safe entrance. Kids and those who are confident jumpers, have several spots for leaping into the water, which is obviously quite deep so perfectly safe. I even saw one young man dive into the pool. Life jackets are available for those who which to float in the pool but are not confident swimmers.  What I appreciate the most about this attraction is that it is NOT highly regulated like so many other tourist attractions. They leave the choice of wearing life jackets up to the individuals, giving us credit for knowing our abilities and limitations.

306776418.name: Palomitas Xenote
306776418.author: a TripAdvisor user
306776418.reviewBody: Loved it! My favorite and it wasn\'t so crowded. It appears mostly the locals know about it and its in a large cave...gorgeous!

305540810.name: WOW, an absolute must see.
305540810.author: a TripAdvisor user
305540810.reviewBody: We did this tour as part of the included available tours for Moon Palace. It made the vacation. The drive was long but once we saw the Cenote, we forgot about the ride. The food was authentic and a nice change from the all inclusive hotel provisions. The tour guide was amazing and very funny. He truly cared about the people and culture of Mexico. He was quite passionate about the Mayan people and the environment. He was so knowledgable. Our 9, 11, and 15 year olds were fascinated. We also did the Tequila factory and downtown Vallidad. It really was that good.

294542865.name: Very nice place to visit
294542865.author: a TripAdvisor user
294542865.reviewBody:
This is a place that every member of the family can enjoy (in my case from ages 8 to 79) 

The place wasn't crowded, the water was cristal clear and has natural and artificial lighting. it has clean restrooms, dressings and for an extra fee you can get a locker and towel.

I didn't rate this Cenote with 5 stars because I'm sure there might be more impressive cenotes but this was great for me.

281834522.name: Waste of time
281834522.author: a TripAdvisor user
281834522.reviewBody: We stopped there on our way to Chichen Itza. The place is a bit far, not much to do there, as usual they offer the regular tourist souvenirs. It\'s a nice cave filled with water. That\'s it. Stop there only if it\'s on your way. Yucatan peninsula is full of cenotes.

279530163.name: A very magnificant and beautiful Cenote!
279530163.author: a TripAdvisor user
279530163.reviewBody: This a a very large mostly covered cenote with many long stalactites hanging from the dome.  The water is crystal clear and such a beautiful turquoise color.  A bit chilly when you first jump in, but very nice and comfortable after a minute or two.  The few openings at the top let in light that makes the cavern luminous and water glow in bright and vivid shades of blue.  There are steps leading into the cenote and throughout the cavern making it easy to access and exit.  The food at the nearby restaurant was very authentic and tasty and included in the tour!  There was chicken, pork short ribs, carnitas, fresh tortilla chips, salad, rice, and beans that were all very good.  This was a very nice stop on the way to the city of Valladolid.

279529781.name: OMG!
279529781.author: a TripAdvisor user
279529781.reviewBody: This cenote would have to be the most impressive that I visited.  Entirely underground, the water is crystal blue, and 45 metres deep.  We visited this on the way to Chichen Itza.  For a fee there are lockers, life jackets and towels for hire.

675996892.name: Outstanding Mexican folk art collection
675996892.author: a TripAdvisor user
675996892.reviewBody: The Mexican folk art collection displayed at this private home is remarkable.  Many pieces and very high quality.  If you like folk art it\u2019s a don\u2019t miss stop.

674607047.name: Nice folk art collection
674607047.author: a TripAdvisor user
674607047.reviewBody: Really cool house with lots of mexican folk art. I love that some of the rooms are dedicated to folk art from certain areas/cultures. You really get to see the differences between the styles that way. It\'s also great that all proceeds/donations go to local charities.  \n\nMake sure to take note of the tour times and get there exactly on time. They are very punctual. We got there 10 minutes early and were told to come back in 10 minutes. The other couple that toured it with us showed up late and were just added onto our tour, so they missed out on a couple of rooms.

673670845.name: Beautiful city house and with artisan art
673670845.author: a TripAdvisor user
673670845.reviewBody: Guide David showed us Dorianne and John Venator\u2019s beautiful city house in the centre of Valladolid. The magnifically restored house hosts the Venator\u2019s impressive collection of Mexican local art. Maya guide David gave us an interesting tour with a focus on Mexican and Maya culture, customs and art. Nice, very nice!

673530667.name: Exceptional
673530667.author: a TripAdvisor user
673530667.reviewBody: Tours start at 10am daily, but if you are a little late it is no problem. Our guide was Miguel who was very friendly and informative. He said that the requested donation is 100 pesos and at the end there is a place to leave the money. There was no hassle and in reality you can leave what you like - more or less. It is good to have a guideline amount, so visitors shouldn\'t be taken aback. It\'s fair for what you get to see, which is quite frankly a breathtaking private collection of colourful artworks. As it is a private collection it is a rare opportunity and our group certainly were very grateful for the owners\' philanthropic stance. Thank you - what a wonderful legacy. Our tour was in English (which was helpful) and the variety of rooms we saw, the central courtyard, the pool area and dining area were all excellent.\nTip: Make sure your camera is fully charged ready for all the photo opportunities!

670309139.name: A highlight in Valladolid!
670309139.author: a TripAdvisor user
670309139.reviewBody: This private museum was more than I expected and I could\'ve easily spent more time than our group allocated. It\'s a mind-blowing collection of beautiful and interesting art from across Mexico.  The hospitality and generosity of the owners and curators are as much a highlight as the art. Our tour guide was helpful and informative.  If I were to go again I would study a map of the states of Mexico in advance.  I like having a visual understanding of things and the art is often explained or described based on its state of origin. Definitely a highlight of our visit to Valladolid!

667450721.name: Nice collection, beautiful house
667450721.author: a TripAdvisor user
667450721.reviewBody: An interesting collection of Mexican art. The house is beautiful and nicely redone. The tour is short and thoughtful that they use donations for charity.

665583364.name: World Class Museum
665583364.author: a TripAdvisor user
665583364.reviewBody: This museum is not to be missed. The tour of the home to see this collection included both contemporary and older folk art pieces. This was a highlight of our trip the the Yucat\u00e1n.

663342831.name: A MUST see in Valladolid
663342831.author: a TripAdvisor user
663342831.reviewBody: This was an absolute highlight of our week in Valladolid. What a gift to see such a diverse and gorgeous collection. I so appreciate that we were permitted to take photos---this house is a wonder to behold. Our 8 year old came home and immediately started making things from clay out of what he saw there. Inspiration for everyone!\n\nI didn\'t understand (or probably pay attention well enough) the opening hours or how the tours really work. One day we showed up at 11 and were told to come back at 1. Another day we showed up at 10:15 and were let in and joined a tour that had just started. Our tour was just under an hour, and we left a donation afterwards. Absolutely worth it. You will see art from all over Mexico---a visual feast!

662931669.name: Such a great collection of Mexican art
662931669.author: a TripAdvisor user
662931669.reviewBody: Get there right as they open. They literally open the door, let everyone who is standing there in, and take you on the tour. The tour is about an hour and it is free with a donation. The art inside is so great. If you love anything about Mexican art, it really is worth the trip. The house itself is spectacular as well. Very worth it!

657802822.name: AMAZING ART COLLECTION
657802822.author: a TripAdvisor user
657802822.reviewBody: So this startes apparantely as a guy who likes mexican art and started collecting souvenirs and such and now has an impressive amount of art in his house, a lot of them very unique and specially made for him, so you enter his house, and see the different rooms and decorations is really cool, definately worth visiting if in Valladolid

657653343.name: Sumptuous
657653343.author: a TripAdvisor user
657653343.reviewBody: A wonderful house which the owner graciously opens to visitors for merely donations to charity. It is hard to believe that it a private home. The tour is very educational and takes about an hour which is just right. A fascinating place - truly not to be missed. Very central to the town.

657250419.name: oh my a hidden treasure
657250419.author: a TripAdvisor user
657250419.reviewBody: we missed this our 1st trip to Valladolid.. it was amazing. Grand collection of folk art from all of Mexico

656854109.name: This is a fantastic collection and thanks to John and Dorianne\'s generosity it\'s available to visitors to Valladolid.
656854109.author: a TripAdvisor user
656854109.reviewBody: The guide who took us around this very interesting home and collection was very knowledgeable. We were allowed to take photos and I will have great memories of this wonderful art.

655704073.name: A must see
655704073.author: a TripAdvisor user
655704073.reviewBody: A private home that\u2019s open to the public and this is something that I cannot possibly put in words. It is amazing interesting educational and even the owner of the home was there and we enjoyed talking with him and how he got his collections. The guides are amazing they speak English amongst many other languages. It is about a one and a half hour tour one really needs to be there at least a week to see everything  Ask for a donation of 100 pesos which goes to the Rotary for community projects mainly freshwater in the outer areas in Yucat\u00e1n. If you miss this you\u2019ve really missed something.

655401507.name: A Must See in Valladolid
655401507.author: a TripAdvisor user
655401507.reviewBody: No visit to Valladolid would be complete without touring this casa. There is no cost but a donation is appreciated at the end of the tour. The one hour tour will interest people who appreciate both architecture and museums. They display photos of the falling down 400 year old building when they bought it. The renovations and designs are beautiful and imaginative. The art collection is brilliant with pieces from all over Mexico and in every room and corner of the home. I gained a new appreciation for Mexican folk art.  We were fortunate enough to meet the owner John Venator, and hear about the good works the donations do to support in the local community.  Take an hour to have this experience!

655224144.name: A feast for the senses!
655224144.author: a TripAdvisor user
655224144.reviewBody: The amount of quality folk art in this place is astounding not to mention the impressive nature of the residence itself. Our tour guide was friendly and full of knowledge and we even got to meet the owner of the collection and his dog. The best part is that he donates all proceeds to charity. This is a MUST in Valladolid.

655053397.name: Fantastic dinner experience!
655053397.author: a TripAdvisor user
655053397.reviewBody: We drove to Valladolid and just walked around the central park.  There we located the restaurant at Casa de los Venados and found a beautiful spot.  Not only is the restaurant lovely but the food was terrific.  We felt we had a truely Mexican meal at an afordable price.  Wonderful.

653214311.name: Must See in Valladolid
653214311.author: a TripAdvisor user
653214311.reviewBody: There\'s nothing like this, anywhere else, so you must go see this house and the art collection within.  The guide was full of fun facts.  We met the owner who was very welcoming.  Amazing to see what lies behind the plain outer walls!

652677203.name: A must see when in Valladolid
652677203.author: a TripAdvisor user
652677203.reviewBody:
This is a private house that gives tours in English, and Spanish, depending on the time. The collection of Mexican art is extensive and beautiful. The house itself was transformed from a rack into a magnificent townhouse. Each room is exquisitely decorated and Full of art everywhere. The pool is quite impressive. All proceeds from the tours go to various charities. We met the owner, Mr. Venator, who’s warm and generous. 

We were allowed to take pictures of all the art, since there are no royalty issues. It’s a private house. We were guided through the many rooms by Miguel, who was knowledgeable and charming.

I highly recommend this tour. It takes about 1+ hours, given at specific times.

651851717.name: A \u201cnot to be missed\u201d museum-like home in Valladolid!
651851717.author: a TripAdvisor user
651851717.reviewBody: If you appreciate the wonderful folk art in Mexico, this home is a knockout!  The owners have collected for many years and seem to very much enjoy being able to share it with others!  I believe they have 2 or 3 tours each day and a guide takes you around and explains from where the art was found and a bit about many of the pieces.  It is an awesome collection of folk art from all over Mexico!

651823740.name: Wonderful
651823740.author: a TripAdvisor user
651823740.reviewBody: What a place. Went following a recommendation but I was still amazed at just how much great Mexican art there is here. As others have said it\'s a private house and the owner just takes donations at the end which are then donated to a variety of local charities. The owner briefly said hello during our tour as he was in the middle of a meeting with the mayor of the city working on plans for local schools.\n\nSo much dazzling colourful art in the whole house. If you like colour or art or Mexico then you have to visit!

651742109.name: Amazing private collection!
651742109.author: a TripAdvisor user
651742109.reviewBody: Tours of this private art collection in a private home are free and scheduled. We didn\'t find out until we arrived and were told a tour had already started and to come back at an appointed time. Our tour guide was very well spoken, knowledgeable and clearly enjoyed his job.

651576456.name: Wonderful house with great art
651576456.author: a TripAdvisor user
651576456.reviewBody: The owners open up their house and Mexican art collection for a donation to local charities. Well worth a visit the house and art is stunning. Takes about 1 hour, guided tours in English at 10, 1130 and 1.

651095841.name: Don\'t miss this gem!
651095841.author: a TripAdvisor user
651095841.reviewBody: This huge private home is open to the public for hourly guided tours at 10 a.m. through 1 p.m. There is no admission fee; you can make a donation (which goes directly to local charities) at the end of your tour. The house is chock full of amazing Mexican folk art of every genre, collected lovingly (or, as the owner might tell you himself, obsessively) from all over Mexico. It is a true delight to behold, and you won\'t want to leave!

650417149.name: Skip it,- there are much better things to do.
650417149.author: a TripAdvisor user
650417149.reviewBody: Take any typical Mexican folk art store and magnify it by fifty & this is what you\'re looking at here. The guide had very little information to share, repeated many times what little information he had.  And there were things he said that he definitely needed to research more. The owner was there and made fun of another visitor\'s home city. We found him cocky and unpleasant.  The donation situation could use more transparency.

649550537.name: A must see!
649550537.author: a TripAdvisor user
649550537.reviewBody: Whatever your taste in art, you will be impressed! Not just with the art but how it has been acquired. Our wonderful guide David had a great gift with words and we learned so much from him about the culture of Mexican people.

649016935.name: Amazing collection.  Need multiple trips to appreciate it all
649016935.author: a TripAdvisor user
649016935.reviewBody: There\u2019s a great deal here but since it\u2019s an occupied private home, you can\u2019t just wander.  If you really want to look carefully in each room consider doing 2 back to back tours.  There are 3 a day.  We met the owner who was most gracious and, if you appreciate the arts and crafts of Mexico this is a \u201cdon\u2019t miss\u201d place.  Check the times of the 3 daily tours.  Each lasts about 1 hour.  A small donation for charity is requested.  Worth every peso!

648585987.name: Impressive but too rushed
648585987.author: a TripAdvisor user
648585987.reviewBody: This place is beautiful and certainly worth a visit. It is more like quick overview of the owners\' art collection then a guided tour of mexican art. Which is what we were expecting from the description and were hoping to learn more about different types of art in different areas of Mexico. We started 15 mins late waiting for 2 people who never showed up and then had a group of 40 on our heels constantly interrupting our small group. We were done in 30 mins when this tour should take a good hour. Not complaining since entry is by donation and to see the collection is certainly appreciated...but could be so much more.

647890438.name: Amazing collection of art, do not miss this
647890438.author: a TripAdvisor user
647890438.reviewBody: A huge collection of Mexican folk art from all over M\u00e9xico. Many of the pieces are one-of-a-kind. The owners have collected the art over many years and now share it with the public in their home. The house is almost as amazing as the art! The tour guide spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable about the art and the owners themselves. We even got to meet the family dog. This stop should not be missed, I highly recommend it.

647677097.name: Don\'t miss this house/museum
647677097.author: a TripAdvisor user
647677097.reviewBody: Be aware that this is a private home with the family still living there. They are generous enough to open their property for tours so people can see the fabulous folk art collection as well as enjoy the architecture of the building.  Entrance is by donation, and they recommend 100 pesos person - with the money going to charity.

647149296.name: YOU MUST GO
647149296.author: a TripAdvisor user
647149296.reviewBody: It is not often that you are invited into someone\'s private home to visit and view their collection of folk art.  This is what happens at Casa de los Venados!  The owners have made their gorgeous home available to visitors to share their love of Mexican art.  Specialized tour guides take you through the home, including the living quarters of the owners.  Every step brings a new discovery!  Donations are taken for the tour and contributed to charitable organizations in Valladolid.  Now that is generosity.

645630016.name: What a Treat!
645630016.author: a TripAdvisor user
645630016.reviewBody: We LOVED this tour with a capital L. The art is fantastic and the story of the home and collection is fascinating. The owners, who have generously opened their home to tours, are very welcoming. Inspirational. Be on time or you will miss the one tour they have daily.

645584165.name: Incredible private collection of Mexican Folk Art
645584165.author: a TripAdvisor user
645584165.reviewBody: This is a private home, whose owner ( a former tech industrialist) restored  it back to its original glory (height of colonial Mexico) and improved with modern conveniences in order to retire here and also to house one if not the most extensive collection of Mexican folk art.  The collection is impressive, as every nook and cranny has something of interest and we were glad we went. There is a donation that is requested to support the orphanage and other local charities and enough newspaper clippings and awards to vouch that the owner does indeed give everything to the charities. \nHighly recommend if you love art, folk art, and colonial architecture, my husband was very impressed and some of the pieces are absolutely stunning. Times vary due to it being a home, and you have to wait outside till they open but just walking in and seeing the first piece was worth it.

643298497.name: One of the Best Collections I\'ve Experienced
643298497.author: a TripAdvisor user
643298497.reviewBody: Had an amazing experience here: an incredibly interesting private collection of Mexican folk art pieces. Beautiful, surreal, bizarre. In every room and corner is a fascinating object... wish I could have explored for much longer. The tour moves quickly and you can either pay attention to the very knowledgable speaker or let your attention drift to examine the different pieces. Highly, highly recommend.

642937305.name: Extremely rude - we were treated like dirt
642937305.author: a TripAdvisor user
642937305.reviewBody: First of all, this review is not based on the collection itself, for the simple reason that we didn\'t get to see it.\n\nAt the door, a rude man named Carlos told us that there is a minimum donation of M$100. I have no problem with paying for a museum or attraction but we were slightly taken aback as we didn\'t expect a cover fee. It\'s not a donation if it\'s an obligation. Anyway, we should\'ve done some research in advance. Upon seeing our surprise, Carlos started bawling that we didn\'t have to come in. That should\'ve been a red flag, but we really wanted to see the collection. We discussed it quickly and decided to still join the tour. But when I said I wanted the English tour, that I didn\'t want to pay for Spanish, Carlos became really aggressive. He roared, "What the hell is your problem?", like he wasn\'t a museum guide but a street thug or gang member. We felt really uncomfortable and swiftly left. We\'ve been travelling for eight months in Central America and Mexico and we\'ve never been treated like this. It really felt like Carlos didn\'t want a couple of scruffy backpackers visiting. It\'s a disgrace for a place so highly rated (or maybe that\'s part of the problem, that the visitors pour in, anyway, regardless of how the employees of this place treat them).

641660164.name: Best Mexican craft and art collection!!!!
641660164.author: a TripAdvisor user
641660164.reviewBody: Private collection in a welcoming home like you have not seen before. The owners stroll around the house while you visit. Call to confirm tour hours or you won\u2019t be allowed to visit. Donations are welcome to support local needs. Best place to visit in Valladolid!!

641158161.name: Must-visit spot if you are in Valladolid!
641158161.author: a TripAdvisor user
641158161.reviewBody: This is a really neat museum that a philanthropic couple runs out of their own home. It features their private collection of commissioned and authentic Mexican art, which they encourage you to explore and touch. I even got to pet their dog! The tour is free, but they ask for a small donation to go toward local charities.

640764887.name: Incredible collection
640764887.author: a TripAdvisor user
640764887.reviewBody: We visited last week and ended up getting a private tour of this amazing collection from Miguel Angel who explained everything with so much enthusiasm that we were both hooked until the very end. Having never been to Mexico before the tour not only gave us a glimpse of popular art but Miguel also told us so much about Mexican culture more widely. Especially the way in which Mayan and Christian belief systems feature in the items of the house really struck us. Last but certainly not least, the resident dog made the visit even better!

639030418.name: Casa de Los Venados
639030418.author: a TripAdvisor user
639030418.reviewBody: Fabulous. Incredible things to see, looking up and then down. Some old things, and some modern riffs based on old things. Just amazing work. Having worked a remodel on a small house, I have a challenge imagining how one gets this done on such a scale.

639015637.name: Wow!
639015637.author: a TripAdvisor user
639015637.reviewBody: What an unexpected surprise. This house has a private collection of 5,000 pieces of Mexican folk art, apparently the second largest in the country next to the national museum.
