It\'s hard to take in all in during the 1.5 hour tour. In addition, the home itself is spectacular, fully and carefully restored. It\'s just a couple of houses up from the main square so it\'s easy to get to. Definitely a unique experience, not to be missed if your spending any time in the City.

637745199.name: Interesting tour of a unique collection
637745199.author: a TripAdvisor user
637745199.reviewBody: We did not really know what to expect when visiting Casa de los Venados, but we were pleasantly surprised! The art may not be your taste (as it is an incredibly diverse collection, it is almost impossible that you will like everything) but it is still worth a visit for the history and culture behind the pieces. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable about the collection. We briefly met the owner, who was warm and welcoming (and has the cutest dog!). While entrance is free, a donation is requested for charity. You can see proof of the various donations in one of the hallways near the main entrance, so please be assured that all the money goes to worthwhile causes!

637668877.name: Amazing place, philanthropy at its pinnacle
637668877.author: a TripAdvisor user
637668877.reviewBody:
We visited this private home with our toddler (on foot) and baby (in buggy).

The guide was accommodating and spoke English well.

The home is quite amazing itself, more so with the abundance of local artwork on display. Nothing is particularly ancient, but are very culturally appointed and interesting.

The couple that owns the place must be as facinating as they are philanthropic. I’d love to have met them and talked over a good glass of wine! Perhaps next time!

Definitely top of the list to see/experience while in Valladolid.

637128126.name: The owner is a horrible, horrible lady
637128126.author: a TripAdvisor user
637128126.reviewBody: First I must say this is the second time I visit the place. Carlos, the guide was super nice with us all the time, since the beginning of the tour all the way till the end. Too bad in the middle of it we encountered Dorianne the lady owner who was extremely aggressive towards us and specially towards a mexican older lady and a kid that were with us in the group. She just lost control and was yelling at us horribly. We all felt really bad. Our tour guide was completely ashamed by what happened apologizing all the time. \nWe come frequently to Valladolid and I had already heard pretty bad stories about her husband, John but first time I visited the place he was there and seemed to be a polite person.\nToday it was one of the must uncomfortable experiences Ive experienced as a tourist in my own country. If you don\'t want people inside your house then don\'t open it as a museum. This lady could probably use some anger management therapy as well as some Spanish lessons. It is unbelievable that someone who says has been living in Mexico for over 40 years and loves Mexican culture can\'t put together two words in Spanish. Shameful. It was really sad seeing the way she was so unwelcoming towards us when we are even paying for a visit and specially hard to see how badly she treated her employee who was really making us have a nice day until she messed it up for all of us. Thank you Dorianne, we are not coming back. You should go back to Portland.

637124372.name: The best art cultural experience in Valladolid..probably all of Yucatan Peninsula!
637124372.author: a TripAdvisor user
637124372.reviewBody: The tour of this magnificent house and remarkable folk and fine art collection was well beyond our expectations and imagination. I think it\u2019s wonderful and laudatory that the gracious hosts, John and Dorianne, are willing to open their home and share this marvelous collection with the public instead of hiding it away as do so many art collectors. Our guide, Carlos, was great! Very engaging and very knowledgeable and very interested himself in the specific art pieces. I\u2019m sorry we didn\u2019t get to meet a fellow Portlander (I believe John was originally from Oregon) but nonetheless we are grateful for the opportunity to explore their art.  The highlight of our stay in Valladolid!

636737833.name: Best thing in Valladolid - don\'t miss!!
636737833.author: a TripAdvisor user
636737833.reviewBody: I would come here every time I was in Valladolid!  There is SO much to see, you can\'t take it all in.  This is a huge, private home with Mexican folk art everywhere - even the furniture is art!  You must go with a guide, and our guide was extremely knowledgeable.  He talked about many of the pieces and also answered questions about other things that caught our eye.  The tours start every day at 10 a.m. and the house/museum is closed to the public at 1 p.m. as the owners do live here.

636539374.name: Wonderful!!!
636539374.author: a TripAdvisor user
636539374.reviewBody: This home is a must see in Valladolid. Come at 10 am for the tour. We loved our guide Carlos. I collect work by Oaxaca ceramicist Josefina Aguilar and the house is full of her work and that of many other talented artists. Mr. Venados greeted us. This visit was a highlight of our vacation!

636502842.name: Very unique and totally amazing
636502842.author: a TripAdvisor user
636502842.reviewBody: La Casa de los Venados is a private home occupied by the owners who graciously share their amazing collection of thousands of items of Mexican art, some rustic and some sophisticated. We were there 2 years ago and returned with our adult daughter and her partner so they could see this amazing collection with their own eyes. The owners ask for a small donation to support their philanthropic work in the area. If you are near I highly recommend that you see this. The tour only takes about an hour and is led by a bilingual guide.

631767327.name: Don\'t miss it!
631767327.author: a TripAdvisor user
631767327.reviewBody: La Casa de los Venados is a must see if you are in Valladolid. \nI went there after a friend of mine wrote about it on her blog, without being particularly interested in Mexican art. I had no idea I would enjoy it this must! Our guide was doing a tour in English for the third time and he handled it perfectly, knowing pretty much every piece of art in the house - and there is a LOT. We also had the pleasure to meet John and have a little chat with him. It is very generous of them to let tourists into their house everyday to admire the impressive amount of works of art they managed to gather.

631471256.name: Unique place
631471256.author: a TripAdvisor user
631471256.reviewBody: Normally I get bored in museums, but in this place it was unique experience. It is the real living place, because owner actually lives in this place. You can meet owner and his dog as well!

630842327.name: Absolutely Brilliant
630842327.author: a TripAdvisor user
630842327.reviewBody: A must see in Valladolid.  What a great tour.  This is like a museum, but it is actually someone\'s house.  They are avid collectors of artwork.  You are walking through their house/mansion.  All of the pieces have been specifically commissioned by the owners over the years.  And the owner wanders around and you\'ll bump into him for certain.  Wife is there too, but didn\'t see her.  Our tour guide spoke 5 languages and is studying two more.  He was engaging and very interesting, and extremely knowledgeable.  At the end, there is a non-obligatory request for donations, but the money does NOT go to the owner.  They are very involved in many programs to assist families with children who need medical assistance.  MUST SEE

630063106.name: Excellent collection and superb guiding make you better understand Mexican culture
630063106.author: a TripAdvisor user
630063106.reviewBody: Really unique collection of Mexican folk art organized and showcased in a way to help understanding the Mexican culture, beliefs and really the people. Our guide, David went the extra mile to help is on our way of discovery which put together a lot of pieces of the Mexican puzzle.

629826095.name: Not to be missed!
629826095.author: a TripAdvisor user
629826095.reviewBody: I visited Casa de los Venados yesterday for the third time with a couple of friends. David was my guide, also for the third time. He is highly knowledgeable of the house\'s fabulous collection of Mexican folk art. He guides you through the guest rooms and a few of the private spaces, and tells you about the history of some of the house\'s most interesting pieces, and answers any questions you may have. The tour of this private house lasts approximately 1 hour and you might even get a glimpse of the homeowner. If you like Mexican folk art, Casa de los Venados is not to be missed!

628641707.name: Excellent tour with history of area
628641707.author: a TripAdvisor user
628641707.reviewBody: Our tour guy David was superb. Lots of laughs, very informative, and incredibly competent grasp on Mexican art history and politics. We were blown away. And the donations all go to charity.

628238312.name: Must see in Valladolid
628238312.author: a TripAdvisor user
628238312.reviewBody:
This was by far one of my favourite experiences to see in Valladolid, the house is absolutely stunning and it’s a wonderful experience to see all the Mexican folk art and learn about some of the pieces. 

The house is privately owned with the owners living in their private area, and I’m very thankful to them for opening up their home for everyone to be able to see their collection. Our tour guide Carlos was very friendly and informative, and was happy to answer all our questions. Thanks again to the owners for doing such an amazing thing!

627245178.name: Absolutely phenomenal place
627245178.author: a TripAdvisor user
627245178.reviewBody: Visited Casa de los Venados with the family during a recent trip to Mexico. We missed the organised tour that day but David very kindly offered to take us on a short \u2018in promptu\u2019 tour of the house. It is absolutely beautiful, and well worth a visit. Thank you so much David!

621630731.name: Awesome tour
621630731.author: a TripAdvisor user
621630731.reviewBody: Came in from NYC and had a lovely tour of a private home turned museum. The before and after photos are amazing and the owners are lovely!

621205092.name: What a great place! A MUST!
621205092.author: a TripAdvisor user
621205092.reviewBody: When my boyfriend told me the first time we are supposed to visit that house, I told him: what a bullishit, are you kidding me? A house like this, from an American living in Mexico, and for free? What is wrong. And of course: I also saw what is inside of that house - crazy stuff. Well - I regret saying this and on top of that believe me: the owner is or was never a Trump supporter for sure.\nSome facts: the collection is an obsession, an addiction to collect fancy things you will not find somewhere else. About 3000 artefacts of Mexican art, plenty of Catrinas, are presented. Each single piece is exceptionary, it is marvelous. Not made in China, not out of mass production. It is the owners understanding to see the world. It was a true honor for us to became part of this and we had a really good time.\nThe staff: we had David - FANTASTIC! What an unbelievable great guy! He found a perfect job for himself with all his enthusiasm. That needs to be extended and I am pretty sure he will make it! The house itself is huge, really huge! Several rooms are shown including the owners one and by chance we run into this fantastic and warm welcoming guy.  At the end of the tour you are asked for a small donation for local charity (5 US dollar recommended, NOT a must). The donations from the past are all documented, certfied and presented to the public. We strongly recommend to visit that place for sure!

619170988.name: Beautiful and interesting artwork
619170988.author: a TripAdvisor user
619170988.reviewBody: We arrived for the 10am tour and were guided by David. He was very knowledgeable about all the artwork in the home and answered all our questions about Mexican artwork and ways of living. This home is beautifully decorated and brings the colourful artwork to life, we thoroughly enjoyed this visit.

619119586.name: Horrifying experience
619119586.author: a TripAdvisor user
619119586.reviewBody: At the beginning of the tour we were told that we could leave our bags at the wardrobe in the entrance and that it is absolute save there. As you are in a nice place you don\'t worry about thieves there and that is why I left my bag at the wardrobe in order to enjoy the tour without a heavy bag on my shoulder. After the tour I went directly with a friend by car to Puerto Morelos where I had to realize that somebody in Casa de los Venados has stolen 500 Pesos. Not a nice experience!! It makes me wonder how badly the staff there is paid??\nThe tour itself was interesting. Although I didn\'t feel very comfortable as the clash between the owner\'s american square style and the mexican folk art doesn\'t realy match. In most parts of this private exhibition I missed a concept behind it. If you go visiting, be careful with your valuable belongings!

618902053.name: Fantastic
618902053.author: a TripAdvisor user
618902053.reviewBody: The most beautiful place I have ever visited. Everywhere you look there is artwork, statues - it\u2019s hard to explain when you think it\u2019s also a private house. Carlos our guide was excellent, very good English.\nYou just must visit!

618525364.name: Wow! An extraordinary private collection open to the public!
618525364.author: a TripAdvisor user
618525364.reviewBody:
We joined the 11:30am tour on 21st September with Carlos. The whole thing exceeded my expectations and it left me with a frustrating desire to go off and explore the rest of Mexico... I only came here for a two week holiday!

Carlos was very knowledgeable, personable and kindhearted. He clearly shares the passion for the folk art of Mexico that his employers do and takes pride in his work. The amount of artwork on show is astounding and I never expected to see quite so much. My wife and I really appreciated that the owners have really taken the opportunity to share this with the world. Coming from England, where private collection, means private collection, we were pleased that not only the artwork was on show, but the home too. 

The length of the tour is absolutely necessary and we wish we could have had longer. How lucky their guests must be to stay in those suites!

This is a must do for anyone in Valladolid!

618378400.name: A jewel in the center of Valladolid
618378400.author: a TripAdvisor user
618378400.reviewBody: I happened to arrive unscheduled and unannounced (not at the daily tour time of 10am) and David very kindly gave me a tour of the house. David was extremely knowledgeable about the house, its pieces of Mexican art and the philosophy of its owners.\n\nA must do for your visit to Valladolid (don\u2019t be a Wally like me and make sure to arrive at 10am!)

614097912.name: Beautiful, unique attraction
614097912.author: a TripAdvisor user
614097912.reviewBody: The owner\'s hospitality shines in this tastefully designed,expansive casa, filled with contemporary Mexican art. Definitely worth a follow-up visit. You couldn\'t dream of seeing everything in a single trip. Our guide David was knowledgeable, spoke perfect English and Spanish, and had a warm, welcoming personality. John, the owner, personally spent time to talk to all in the tour group individually.\nThis attraction is more informal than your typical art museum. It allows you to get up close to the art work. A very intimate feeling.\nDefinitely the highlight of my Yucatan vacation.

611515538.name: Visit this unusual home.
611515538.author: a TripAdvisor user
611515538.reviewBody: Possibly the greatest personal home  you may ever visit.It has thousands of unusual Mexican artworks from furniture, tile artistry, pictures, paintings, sculptures, and many other objects. The owners live on the premises and often are your guides.  Cost is a voluntary charity choice.

597173469.name: Amazing place!
597173469.author: a TripAdvisor user
597173469.reviewBody: We were greeted at the door by the owner, John, who gave us some great tips on the town. Carlos was our guide, he was super knowledgeable and funny. We loved seeing this private collection, as well as the house. Definitely recommend for anyone looking to see some art in Valladolid!

595443071.name: 4th Visit and Still Impressive
595443071.author: a TripAdvisor user
595443071.reviewBody: This was my fourth visit to Casa de los Venados and I\u2019m so pleased I went again. The collection is so immense, I saw things I hadn\u2019t noticed before and revisited some of my favorite pieces. This is an amazing place well worth seeing multiple times. The tour is given in English and/or in Spanish. The guides are very informative and you will get a lesson in Mexican folk art from all over the country. A fascinating place - definitely go if you have an interest in art and Mexican culture.

593664649.name: Amazing private collection of Mexican folk art
593664649.author: a TripAdvisor user
593664649.reviewBody: On the recommendation of Danielle from the textile museum, we visited the private home of John and Dorianne Venator with its phenomenal collection of Mexican folk art. The Venators have collected and commissioned every type of Mexican folk art and contemporary art from every region of the country. Our tour guide, Arnaldo was very knowledgeable about the art, the artists, type of art and region where the pieces were made. What an incredible collection! The architecture of the home and seeing the art in bedrooms, bath, patio, dining room and displayed throughout this beautifully renovated building was a once in a lifetime experience.

593112230.name: Beautiful private art collection in a beautiful casa
593112230.author: a TripAdvisor user
593112230.reviewBody: We had a private tour in English from a very friendly guide. We saw all the guestrooms, the swimming pool,  kitchen and loving room. All fully Dec rotated with art from all over Mexico.

590916269.name: Beautiful home with an amazing collection!
590916269.author: a TripAdvisor user
590916269.reviewBody: This place is awesome!  Our guide (Arnoldo) was well informed, sharing a lot of history and knowledge throughout the tour.  The rooms are filled with gorgeous and interesting pieces of Mexican Folk Art.  Thank you to the owner who are opening their home and sharing their private collection with us.  It\'s a must see when you are in the area.

589040595.name: Beautiful, personal, with very informed tour guides
589040595.author: a TripAdvisor user
589040595.reviewBody: Probably the best art tour I have ever taken. This is someone\'s actual house so the pieces displayed change based on the owner\'s mood or purchase of new pieces. The tour guides are amazing and speak many languages (English, Spanish, Mayan, Italian, French are the ones I heard them use), so almost anyone can take a tour here! Admission is free but donations are highly encouraged (not "required" but customary). I would suggest going during an off time, like lunch hour, to have a smaller tour. Set aside about two hours of your time to fully enjoy the art and not rush or be rude to the tour guides. We were very lucky to get a private tour and since the owner was out of town, we got to see their apartment (where they actually sleep, eat, etc.) which has the best pieces by far. Pictures and videos are aloud unless the tour guide says otherwise. Street parking is available outside and in the surrounding blocks. I would suggest leaving your bags in your car if you can because the art covers every surface of the house and it would be easy to knock something over with a backpack. Similarly, I would not bring any children under 12 as they would get bored and may touch or break something.

588966821.name: Beautiful home bursting with Mexican Folk Art
588966821.author: a TripAdvisor user
588966821.reviewBody: Swung by this place after seeing a brochure at our hostel. Was not prepared for the incredible huge collection. Fantastic knowledgable guide who gave us almost a history of Mexico and its art through the pieces. The colours are incredible. A highlight to actually view the owners  apartment. What a dining room! Must do in Valladolid

588958961.name: Amazing!!!
588958961.author: a TripAdvisor user
588958961.reviewBody: Sooooooooooo much to see... pieces everywhere you look. Well worth the time and money (which is a donation to charity)

588177972.name: SO AMAZING!
588177972.author: a TripAdvisor user
588177972.reviewBody: Our tour guide, David, was fantastic and super knowledgeable and welcoming. This is a "must see" if you are in Valladolid.

583905819.name: Absolutely Incredible!
583905819.author: a TripAdvisor user
583905819.reviewBody:
My wife and I just finished our visit and to say that we were blown away would be an understatement. The owners have amassed a huge and wonderful collection of folk art from all around Mexico that is housed in a completely renovated 16th century building in Vallodolid’s center. 

From the moment that you enter, you are surrounded by incredible works of artistry displayed in a completely natural manner around the home. Our tour guide, Arnoldo, was so informative as he pointed out details on various pieces as we went from room to room. One of the best aspects is that this is very much a living museum; nothing is behind glass or ropes—in fact, there were several times throughout the tour that Arnoldo would have us touch a piece to fully appreciate the tactile component of the work. We were also free to take as many pictures as we wanted. At the very end, we even had a chance to meet the owner, John, and his dog, Mia. Another wonderful aspect is that the donations collected at the end of the tour all go to support local charities.

Having been to several museums around the world, I can easily say that this is one of the very best I’ve been to and certainly the most “accessible” to the visitor. This is absolutely a must-see, not just for anyone visiting Vallodolid, but for anyone with even a passing appreciation for artwork or folk artisanry and who is in the Yucatan region. Muchas gracias, John and Dorianne (and Mia), for opening your stunning home to the public and letting us appreciate your incredible collection!

582098498.name: Terrific artisans!
582098498.author: a TripAdvisor user
582098498.reviewBody: At first we just stood outside, along with some other people, waiting for the doors to be opened; then we noticed we could ring a bell (minding the schedules, of course). We were graciously greeted and given the option to either join the Spanish or English group. Architecture is incredibly well executed between old hacienda and restored property, and the pieces on display lovingly curated by the owners. The guides are knowledgeable, and even the family pet is friendly. As a Mexican, it was very fulfilling to see such authenticity and attention to detail.

582070391.name: Amazing folk art home
582070391.author: a TripAdvisor user
582070391.reviewBody: This was a fascinating and wholly enjoyable visit to the owners home. Suggested donations go to charity. Every bit of wall, floor and sometimes even ceiling was covered in colourful Mexican folk art, so much to see and so much colour. Our guide was so knowledgeable, and every guide greeting people were so friendly and enthusiastic about the collection. It\u2019s hard to describe how much there is, but also how beautifully put together it all is, it doesn\u2019t feel staged, it just feels right. The owners still live there and use it as their home, so most tours will meet and greet them, John likes to know where his visitors are from and to suggest other places to visit. I would visit again as I am sure I didn\u2019t see everything. Don\u2019t go if you like minimalist monochrome homes.

582035495.name: Worth it
582035495.author: a TripAdvisor user
582035495.reviewBody: This was a very interesting experience for my family as we stopped in Valladolid after visiting Chichen Itza. David was a great guide - very friendly, entertaining, and informative. Highly recommended.

579484204.name: Great if you love folk art
579484204.author: a TripAdvisor user
579484204.reviewBody: I am not a big fan of folk art - but if you are then this place gets a 5 star rating. Our guide was +5 stars!!! gorgeous house - we want to copy their swimming pool : )

578866807.name: Wonderful experience!
578866807.author: a TripAdvisor user
578866807.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is a must see destination if you have even the slightest interest in art and design or indeed home decor and architecture. It is a stunning collection, gathered over the years by John and Dorianne Venator and displayed throughout their beautiful home. It is an exceptional and inspiring place and I would highly recommend a visit to anyone visiting the area.

578399782.name: So Very Interesting
578399782.author: a TripAdvisor user
578399782.reviewBody:
We arrived before 10 and gathered with about 15 or 20 people and just a few minutes after 10 the front door was closed. No one was allowed in after that time.

We were asked if we wanted to hear the tour in Spanish or English language. We broke into two groups.

Our tour started right in the hallway,  and continued on throughout the huge home... bedrooms, dining halls, living rooms, other dining rooms, little courtyards of the bedrooms, even the pool area... everything was filled with the most interesting forms of Custom art or folk art. 

We even were able to meet John Venator, the owner of the beautiful Casa de Los Venados. He was so kind to open his home to complete strangers, for only a donation of your choice all of which goes to local charities.  He even suggested places to visit and to eat that were not on the beaten path.

 We were not rushed and were encouraged to take pictures!  There were so many items I couldn’t take everything in, so when I return to Valladolid , I know I will return to the Casa de Los Venados!

576981298.name: An Absolute Feast for the Eyes
576981298.author: a TripAdvisor user
576981298.reviewBody: No wonder this attraction is rated No 1 in Valladolid.  We arrived just before 10.00am to begin the tour and were warmly welcomed by David, the tour guide.  We were then guided around the private home of John and Dorianne Venator, who have opened both it, and their collection of Mexican folk art to the public.  Both the house and the 3000 exhibits are vibrant, strong, colourful and, as a whole, breathtaking.  What is so impressive is that they have spent their lives collecting these pieces, buying and commissioning them from artisans and thus supporting their craft.  They have also arranged to leave the house and collection to the people of Yucatan through their charitable foundation in the future.  All donations for the tours go to charity also.  The visit includes tours through the entrance, main courtyard, swimming pool area, guest suites and their living quarters which contain the exhibits.  We loved every moment of the tour and it was a privilege to briefly meet the owner, John at the end.  There is a four minute Youtube clip about the house available to watch, but nothing can compare to actually seeing it, so keepthat treat until after your visit.

575721143.name: Must see
575721143.author: a TripAdvisor user
575721143.reviewBody: Had no expectations before our visit but we were blown away by this private folkart museum. It was sesnsational. We visited just before lunch on an unbelievably hot day but forgot all about the heat because of the room after room of fantastic art pieces and architecture. An absolute must to visit. Thank you David for such an informative tour and thank you to the owners for making your collection available to the public.

574418025.name: Must see!
574418025.author: a TripAdvisor user
574418025.reviewBody: We have been to Valladolid many times going back to the 90\'s and this place is a standout. Amazing collection of Mexican folk art. Good tour guides. Pay what you can. Don\'t miss this place!

574334421.name: Incredible Museum!
574334421.author: a TripAdvisor user
574334421.reviewBody: Folk art galore and a gorgeous home and family to honor it! The tour was fascinating and I highly recommend.

573850628.name: WOW!
573850628.author: a TripAdvisor user
573850628.reviewBody: This private home is incredible, not only for it\'s incomparable collection of art, but also for the home itself. Our tour guide (David) was personable, multi-lingual, knowledgable, and entertaining. We explored many rooms of this exquisite home, saw photos of the history of the renovation, and enjoyed so many styles and types of Mexican folk art. The collection was stunning. The brochure and website do not do it justice. I highly recommend taking advantage of this opportunity.

569765847.name: Absolutely amazing!
569765847.author: a TripAdvisor user
569765847.reviewBody: This could be the only reason to visit this small town if time were of the essence.   My friends and I could not believe all of the beautiful contemporary and folk art we were exposed to.   This is the most beautiful home I imagine I will ever visit, do yourself a favor and make sure to stop by for one of the 3 tours offered daily.  Our tour guide was especially knowledgeable about many of the items in the home (there are 3,000), you could tell he was passionate about sharing his love of Mexican art and creations...I will make sure to visit each time I go to  Valladolid, the small donation that is requested of you is donated to local charities.   Thank you John and Dorianne, for sharing your beautiful home and collection with the public!

568753904.name: A rare opportunity to see incredible art as part of a home and everyday life
568753904.author: a TripAdvisor user
568753904.reviewBody:
There are famous art museums all over the world that were once private collections, but became museums after the collectors' deaths. The couple that have created this collection have been generous enough to allow the public to see their art while they are still alive and it really is such a privilege. The guide told us that they've arranged for it to become a proper museum when they're gone, at which time it will probably get all the usual museum accouterments, like plaques telling you what everything is and who the artists are. These are good, educational things, but a museum can't give you the same sense of art as it was meant to be enjoyed, as part of a home and everyday life. 

I was shocked when I got there early and a guide asked me to sit down. I looked around and finally said, "where?" There were chairs and benches, but they were clearly not meant for sweaty, dusty tourists to mess up, these were works of art. He laughed and said, "No, it's okay, they're for sitting on." The whole place is like that, incredible works of art arranged, not for viewing, but for living with. 

The owners were there and were kind enough to give us a few moments of their time. They told us to take pictures, "use a flash, it's not a problem," and asked us to post them online. These are people who love this art, not as untouchable museum pieces, but as parts of their lives that they want to share as widely as possible.

If you possibly can, go there while it's still a home, while you can still experience this amazing collection as it was meant to be seen. It will still be there later, but it won't be the same when it's a museum.

568535111.name: Must visit when in Valladolid.
568535111.author: a TripAdvisor user
568535111.reviewBody: So much to see here that once isn\'t enough . Great guided tour thru this art collectors private home that is open to tour every morning ... Be on time .... Lots of Frida art, many interesting stories by informed guides you describe each room, how the art was collected, what it is. You even get to meet the owners as they sit for brunch as the tour passes . Extremely interesting

568417950.name: Truly a unique experience
568417950.author: a TripAdvisor user
568417950.reviewBody: Our family showed up at 10 and the tour began almost immediately. David was our guide,and he was very informative and friendly. The tour goes  through part of the 18,000 square foot house, including the large courtyard, several of the smaller guest rooms, the amazing pool area, the Frieda Kahlo room, and the kitchen and dining room. At each stop, David would talk about some of the art, Mexican culture, local customs (our favorite was the saying about adding salsa to your own tacos), the history of the house, and Valladolid. Each room is filled with so many interesting pieces that we were scanning the room and listening to David at the same time. One of our favorites was the huge mural at the entrance. The owner John also stopped by at the beginning and end of the tour and he couldn\u2019t have been nicer. He obviously has a passion for Mexican folk art and for sharing it with others. The tour lasted about an hour. \n\nWe all really enjoyed the house, the art, and the tour. It was the perfect beginning to our day trip to Valladolid. Highly recommend it.

567963854.name: Very Different Experience
567963854.author: a TripAdvisor user
567963854.reviewBody: Very interesting and different. The place is full of stuff. No original Frieda\'s but a nice room. Tour guide was very good. We went to Valladodid for this experience.

567592956.name: Sensory Overload But Don\'t Forget to Look Around!
567592956.author: a TripAdvisor user
567592956.reviewBody:
Lots of wonderful reviews, which I'm sure you have read many of them.  I wanted to point some things out that perhaps might go un-noticed but shouldn't be missed.

First of all the home is spectacular.  The story of the owners purchasing the home is really so fascinating.  Yes the artwork is glorious but pay attention to their story.  When you walk in, it's sensory overload and might be hard to pay attention to the grand story of how this beautiful treasure came to be.

After the tour guide finishes talking about the first area (the main entry-way) he will take you into the next room which is a hallway type area.  To the right in that room are some poster boards with several old photos on them.  Please pay attention, as these are photos that were taken of the owners standing inside the dilapidated walls of the once-then abandoned over-run home, that NOW is this beautiful mansion.

I was fascinated with what the property use to look like.  Concrete walls, with no roof, and completely overgrown with foliage. Such vision for them to be able to see the potential in a ramshackle land.  The guide told us it took 12 days of 22 men (I think those are the numbers) to just remove the overgrown shrubs and trees and weeds!

The other item I wanted to mention is imagine them cutting and chopping down weeds and trees and vines that had been growing inside this concrete home for heaven knows how long.  And during the cutting and chopping, you decide to leave one tree.  Why this tree of all trees?  It is the coolest tree I think I've ever seen.  And it proudly is growing right in the open-aired courtyard/patio area. So very pretty. I think it's called the Calabash Tree, or some form of this species.

The tree has perfectly round large green gourds growing from it.  It's so unusual.  The guide said the Mayans, hundreds and hundreds of years ago, would use these gourds, once dried out, as bowls or as drinking vessels.  The inside of the gourd is poisonous but the green ball once cut in half and dried out will turn into a sturdy brown utensil.  They have a few samples of what the gourd looks like once dried that the tour guide will show you.

I just find it so neat that of all the brush and weeds they were cutting down, then chose to leave that tree standing (heaven knows how old I is)  And the tree grows beautifully in the open-aired courtyard.

Another item not to be missed is in each of the guest rooms, they have their own mini courtyard - please be sure to check out the wonderful cactus growing in the mini courtyards located in the guest rooms.  I know the artwork is so wonderful, it's easy to overlook the wonderful cactus!

You can read other's reviews of the stunning artwork, I just wanted to make sure you took time to look away from the art for a moment, and check out some other items.
Lovely home in an absolutely darling darling town. Such a beautiful property. These owners are truly blessed to be able to own such a glorious place and to be able to travel around and add to their art collection.

The owner was sitting in the courtyard, visiting with a friend while the tour was going on.  So be aware, they actually live there, and you are walking into their home while they could be milling around.

Very much worth seeing.  We enjoyed it immensely.

566176151.name: Must See.  Tip guide also.
566176151.author: a TripAdvisor user
566176151.reviewBody: This is a family house open to view their great art collection. No charge but ask for donation at end which is given to charity. I also suggest tipping the guide although he doesn\u2019t ask.  Incredible art collection. Also got to meet the owner drinking lemonade in the main plaza. Great experience.

565162121.name: Beautiful
565162121.author: a TripAdvisor user
565162121.reviewBody: We were awed both by the variety of Mexican folk art from Mexico\u2019s different provinces as well as the ability to view an entire 8000 square-foot house where the owner still lives and which was opened up for us to see and Enjoy. I took the prescient that there is no depression feet just donations which is given the various charities In Valladolid.

564083843.name: Definitely a Highlight
564083843.author: a TripAdvisor user
564083843.reviewBody: I love Mexican folk art, and one of the reasons I wanted to stay in Valladolid for a couple of nights was to tour the casa. What a fabulous place! The guide was very good - he kept us moving along, but was open to questions and I didn\'t feel rushed. I\'d highly recommend doing this if you\'re in Valladolid. The collection is awesome.

563874260.name: What a great opportunity.
563874260.author: a TripAdvisor user
563874260.reviewBody: What a great opportunity to see a huge collection if folk art. This is our second visut, this time we brought our 22 year old son with his girlfriend. We had David as our guide, he was very informative and funny. Each time we go we see and hear new things about all of the pieces. The owner each time takes time to visit with his visitors. I highly recommend and please don\'t forget to donate.

562554706.name: Impressive Mexican Art collection
562554706.author: a TripAdvisor user
562554706.reviewBody: Wonderful experience! Extensive collection of Mexican folk art. Our teams host of John and Dorianne Venator  were very gracious. Building Architecture is also quite amazing as well. Well recommended if in Villalodid. Also go around corner on 41 calle to Mexican folk clothing museum. Extensive collection of native clothing from all area of Mexico.\n No charge but a recommended donation encouraged.

562183168.name: Beautiful restored home and extensive collection of folk art
562183168.author: a TripAdvisor user
562183168.reviewBody: Well worth the visit. Stunning reconstruction of a 17th century casa. Wonderful collection of folk art pieces!

561984452.name: Surpassed expectations!
561984452.author: a TripAdvisor user
561984452.reviewBody:
I love art but sometimes find museums and galleries to be information overload. This home/art gallery had tons to look at, but it didn’t get boring or feel overwhelming. You can take a tour here at 10am, 11:30am, or 1pm. (You aren’t allowed to browse on your own.) There are multilingual guides available—our guide spoke Mayan, Spanish, English, French, and Italian... and I think a couple of other lanuages also. He gave the tour in spanish, and I’m not great at Spanish, but I understood him more clearly than almost any other Spanish I’ve heard, so that was an unexpected treat!
The house itself is a marvel, both for the art collection and for the remodelling that has been done of this very old building. Tons of sculptures, wall-mounted art, paintings, mosaics, and textiles in this colorful and fascinating collection. The tour moved quickly—I only wish we’d had a little more time to look more closely at the displays. 
There is a suggested donation of 5$, which is donated to charitable organizations. 
Photographs were allowed. 
The home owners do have a dog, which barked at our group—just a heads-up if there are any dog-phobics out there.

561727817.name: Amazing art collection
561727817.author: a TripAdvisor user
561727817.reviewBody: John and Dorianne Venator have made their unparalleled collection of Mexican art open to the public.

561571251.name: Don\'t miss this feast of Mexican folk art
561571251.author: a TripAdvisor user
561571251.reviewBody: This is a private collection of Mexican folk art in a large house just off the main square of Valladolid. Visits are by guided tour between 10 am and 1 pm. Our tour of ca. one hour was guided by a young man who spoke excellent English and gave us interesting information on the highlights of the collection; I finally understand the Mexican enthusiasm for skeletons. The owner of the home happened to come in just as the tour began; he gave us a few words of welcome then left the guide to show us around. The quantity, quality and variety of the artwork is amazing; much of it was commissioned to fit the space. If you are in Valladolid long enough you may want to repeat the tour to absorb more of what is there. At the end of the tour we were gently invited to leave a donation to be used for local charities; 100 pesos suggested.

561028752.name: Extremely interesting
561028752.author: a TripAdvisor user
561028752.reviewBody: Someone\'s private home that they share their collection of Mexican art and crafts. It covers a wide span of time and area. It is really a amazing collection. Well worth the time.

560931870.name: Unique art experience!
560931870.author: a TripAdvisor user
560931870.reviewBody: Grateful to have gotten an insight to a huge range of amazing Mexican folk art. Really cool opportunity. If the tour could be slightly shorter it was be awesome to get an opportunity for 5 mins to just walk back past some pieces that caught our eye as there\'s ALOT of info given during tour (which is cool) but can be overwhelming to fully absorb the skill and beauty of different art pieces. \nCheers again for a great experience!

560751664.name: Definitely worth a visit!
560751664.author: a TripAdvisor user
560751664.reviewBody: Very colorful collection of folk art from all over Mexico. Beautifully renovated house and good project. Really friendly guide. Amazing that they open up their private house for people to see.

559654606.name: A Warm Home Tour Among Thousands of Colorful Art
559654606.author: a TripAdvisor user
559654606.reviewBody: It is hard to imagine that standing at the simple iron gate of a beautiful, colonial apartment, your mind will be blown away with the thousands of colorful native art within.  There is no clue such a "museum" of top quality pieces exists from the steps outside. Only a few steps away from the large square in Valladolid is the fantastic Casa de los Venados.  Over 3000 pieces of art, from sculptures to paintings, from chandeliers of unique characters in Mexican history, to painted tables and chairs. The collection is both elegant and eclectic -- all placed in the home of the American collectors!  We walked through their family room, bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen and pool area - all encompassing more brilliantly, colored pieces of art that have been selected from artisans all over Mexico.  There is a Frieda Kahlo room, of course. The couple were not home when we were there.  No charge for the tour, by the way.  Although tipping is a pleasant gesture to thank the guide. \nAt 10 AM already a dozen were waiting for the tour, but arriving only a few minutes later, a single tour guide took my spouse and I on the same tour. He was marvelous in his knowledge of the pieces. He knew when to linger to share a unique story of how the piece was acquired and when to move on.   You will be dazzled with the craftsmanship and creativity surrounding you ...in every room.

559117639.name: Rare opportuniy!
559117639.author: a TripAdvisor user
559117639.reviewBody: What a gift this art collection is for the Yucatan and Mexico!  The beautifully designed and rebuilt colonial home is an absolutely breathtaking setting for this fine collection of folk art.  Tours are given daily and include background on the collection, the home restoration, and the collectors who generously welcome everyone to come appreciate the art and culture of Mexico.  The small donation is used to fund local organizations providing health and education services.  Wonderful experience and incredible gift to all.  Thanks John and friends!

559072112.name: If you do ONE thing in Valladolid, GO HERE!
559072112.author: a TripAdvisor user
559072112.reviewBody: We spent exactly one night in this beautiful city.  We tried to figure (as non-city folk) what the best thing we should do while we were here was.  We almost didn\'t go because some of the reviews we read made me think we\'d be walking through "someone\'s (tiny) house" packed to the gills with Mexican folk art.  I am SO glad we went!  First of all, John was lovely.  He and his wife built and refurbished this massive, private dwelling.  They have accumulated literally thousands of beautiful works of art over the years and generously open their home daily for private tours of their home.  This is a HOME, not a museum.  They have tour guides who are very, very well-versed in all of the art around the home.  They do not charge for this tour.  That said, John and his wife Dorianne are philanthropists always donating to make their city/area better.  In fact, the day of our tour, they were hosting a number of international veterinarians who came to help spay and neuter strays around town.  You can\'t help but WANT to put as much cash as you can afford in the donation jar at the end of the tour.  GO HERE!  I have tons of photos but nothing does this place justice like seeing it in person.

559066170.name: Do not miss this
559066170.author: a TripAdvisor user
559066170.reviewBody:
This beautiful space is 18,000 ft. of private residence that two collectors of Mexican folk art have graciously decided to share with the world. This house was in shambles prior to being bought by the owners and it took them nine years to rebuild this colonial beauty. From the street, you would never know what lies behind these walls. Upon entering you will find a very large custom piece of artwork that is the largest piece in this collection. As you move from room to room, you will see many beautiful pieces of art that your guide will explain the history of. This house is not to be missed!!! It was easily a highlight of my time here in Mexico. 
There is a donation suggested of $100 pesos per person and it is worth every cent. Yours begin at 10,11:30 & 1 pm sharp. Our tour guide, who I believe was named Alfando, was fantastic. Pictures are aloud and the house is lived in so there are no roped off areas or glass cases. 
Again, this is a lovely collection that is not to be missed.
Thank you to John and Dorianne for opening up your house and sharing this beautiful collection.

557120335.name: One of the coolest, quirkiest museums I\'ve ever been to.
557120335.author: a TripAdvisor user
557120335.reviewBody: This is a private home filled with tons of Mexican folk art.  The owners live there, so you have to visit during a private tour (10am everyday).  This is an actual home and the tour guides invite you to sit on the couches as if you are an invited guest.  When I was there, the owner was home and came to say hi.  It is so incredibly generous that they open their home up like that.  Free, but such a cool experience that you will want to donate; donations go to charity.  Make sure to bring cash.

556984199.name: What a fantastic place
556984199.author: a TripAdvisor user
556984199.reviewBody: Wow, this place is actually better than I expected! Such a wonderful home & fabulous collection of Mexican Folk Art and Handicrafts. Everything you can of --- Ceramics, Metalwork, Woodwork, Needlework, Sculptures, Furniture, and More! And the owners are lovely and so hospitable. What a treasure! I\'ll be back next time I\'m in Valladolid!

556910574.name: Great folk art collection
556910574.author: a TripAdvisor user
556910574.reviewBody: Overwhelming collection of Mexican folk art. It\'s pretty cool that someone has opened up their private residence for tours. People should be respectful of that. We had one American in our group who kept trying to wander off on his own, and our guide had to keep reminding him it\'s a private house not a museum.

556287348.name: The one must-see art museum
556287348.author: a TripAdvisor user
556287348.reviewBody: Pay attention to the VERY restricted hours -- you\'ll want to show up at exactly 10 AM to get a tour, and by 1 PM they shut down for the day.  But it\'s worth adjusting your schedule.  This is a private home of a retired art collector, and it\'s stuffed to the gills with uniquely Mexican art.

554941407.name: Wonderful home generously opened for public viewing - a must if visiting Valladolid!
554941407.author: a TripAdvisor user
554941407.reviewBody: The casa was bought by an American couple 8 years ago and has been stunningly restored and furnished with their private collection which has taken decades to lovingly accumulate.  Tours are available in English and Spanish on the hour from 10am - 1pm daily, I\'d suggest getting there 10 minutes before the hour. The house closes to the public at 2pm.  Our guide,  David,  was very informative and interesting.  We also met the owner briefly.  Entrance is free,  but a donation of 100 pesos is suggested which goes to local good causes . I highly recommend visiting here.

554882930.name: Very interesting Art exhibition!
554882930.author: a TripAdvisor user
554882930.reviewBody: Our Tour guide was Great and explained everything very well. The owner of the House said hi himself and is a nice guy. Er were able to see some guest rooms and family Area. Everything is full with interesting mexican art.

554802769.name: You should go there if you are in Valladolid
554802769.author: a TripAdvisor user
554802769.reviewBody: The Casa de los Venados is a kind of museum, but in a private home. Tours are daily at 10 am and it is very interesting to listen to the guides explanations and stories. No entrance fees but you can give donations which are used for beneficial programs.

554257234.name: Amazing Art Collection in a private home
554257234.author: a TripAdvisor user
554257234.reviewBody:
Going into Casa, we didn’t know quite what to expect! That said - my partner and I were floored by each section of the home we entered.

We can best describe Casa de los Venados as similar to the original Barnes Foundation in Philadelphia - a personal and extensive art collection in a private philanthropist/collector’s home, curated to their personal tastes and generously opened to the public 1x a day. It is not intended to be a museum, but a visual introduction to various forms of Mexican folk art, in the home
of two individuals who have dedicated their lives to elevating these traditions and supporting artists. 

Also impressive is the amount of funds these private tours raise for important health and social service projects - so don’t be stingy with your donations for entering! Each month, all money raised is given to a different community organization around Valladolid.

On a personal note: I work with an arts organization and had a few questions for John, so left my card with our guide. I was quite surprised that he personally emailed me a few hours later and invited us in for coffee the next morning! He spent over an hour with us, chatting over coffee and talking about his art, life, philanthropic work, and connection to Valladolid. This was above and beyond what we could have ever expected - it points even more to the genuine love and warmth put into the collection, John’s mission to expose more people to folkloric art forms, as well as the selflessness it take welcome strangers into their private (and, frankly, breathtaking!) home every day. 

If you’re in Valladolid - this is 100% worth the visit (10:00 am sharp!). Between the art, architecture, historic preservation, and personal story - you will not be disappointed!

554083373.name: A wonderful gem in Valladolid!
554083373.author: a TripAdvisor user
554083373.reviewBody: This private home is opened for tourists each morning to view an amazing array of Mexican folk art.  the owners of this lovely home are collectors. Tours are given in English and Spanish. The variety of the art is remarkable - so many sculptures, paintings, pottery, furniture - traditional and modern. A great change from tourist shops - a beautiful way to see Mexican culture from around the country.

553544602.name: Sweet shop of Mexican folk-art. Great sugar rush but ultimately not very satisfying
553544602.author: a TripAdvisor user
553544602.reviewBody:
First of all the art itself. It's Mexican folk art, so a genre that needs to be handled with care. As you might expect, lots of bright colours, busy street scenes and plenty of skulls... and there is a lot of it, coming at you from all sides as soon as you walk in. Initial impressions are great, with plenty of eye candy and lots to entertain the kid in all of us. But wait... then there is another room ... and another room. There is no real organising principle, other than what might look good in a particular spot or space and the designs, motifs and colours start to repeat, and stick to the roof of your mouth...

More importantly, none of the art is attributed, so you learn nothing about the artist, their heritage or the artistic tradition in which they are working. For a museum that purports to be of the art of the people this is a serious omission. Where is the context ? What's the history ? Where (in this complex country) is the politics ? Surely there is more that can and should be said about the art we are looking at ?

The error is compounded by a rather unfortunate focus on the patron and collector. I guess this is not unusual in the art world but is nevertheless still rather unattractive. Only one piece was singled out for specific comment on our guided tour, on the basis that it was the first piece in the collection, an attribute that speaks more to the history and evolving taste of the collector than it does to the art itself. The effect was heightened by a rather obsequious tour guide who insisted on inviting us to admire the good taste of the collector at every turn, and especially by the visit to the owners private quarters, where in a rather uncomfortable ten minutes we held our breath wondering if we might have the opportunity to meet the great man himself, before being informed that no he would not be meeting visitors that day.

So my advice to the Casa de los Venados -
- decide if you are going to be a museum or a private house, the combination does not work well
- if you are going to be a museum, do it properly. Give credit to the artists, organise the collection so your visitors can make sense of it and give us some information, context and intellectual stimulation to go with the eye-candy
- retrain your tour guides so they are better informed about the art than they are about the owners
- rename the collection if you want (credit where credit is due..) but then leave your role and ego above the door. If the Getty museum can do it then I'm sure you can to...

To my fellow travellers - 
- worth a visit but expect to come away feeling like a kid at the end of a birthday party

552762735.name: Astonishing Home and Art Collection
552762735.author: a TripAdvisor user
552762735.reviewBody: Tour led by amiable staff shows off this staggering art collection. Lucky for us, we get to see the home too and even the owners personal quarters. Worth the 45 minutes.

552571741.name: Just \u2018WOW\u2019
552571741.author: a TripAdvisor user
552571741.reviewBody: We felt impressed many-many hours after the visit. It is one of the top impressions in Mexico and one of the most beautiful and unique houses we have ever seen. You are surrounded by pieces of art everywhere - walls, furniture, pillows, mirrors, even kitchen! All pieces compliment each other and create an amazing atmosphere.  \nSpecial great thanks to the owners who are so kind to open their doors to people every day, share all this beauty and give so many unforgettable emotions!

551642098.name: Stunning. Thrilling. MUST SEE.
551642098.author: a TripAdvisor user
551642098.reviewBody: Awesome collection of top quality folk art in a private collection in a beautiful private house.\nThere are guided tours in English at 10am. You are invited to contribute $5 to be sent to local charities...but you may want to be more generous because it is unique and wonderful.

551352742.name: Colonial home with a story
551352742.author: a TripAdvisor user
551352742.reviewBody: A large collection of folk art from a several places in Mexico.  Learning about the history of this old colonial home was interesting.

551156221.name: I wish I could give it 10 stars. Absolutely make time for this!
551156221.author: a TripAdvisor user
551156221.reviewBody: an extraordinary collection: more than 3000 works of Mexican folk art, many of them commissioned by the US-native couple who lives there, both of whom have been collecting since the 1960s. Reservations are not necessary and admission is free (with a voluntary donation requested at the end of the tour to support various social betterment charities)\u2014but you must be there at 10 a.m. and join a tour. Our guide was excellent and this is not one of the best folk art collections from any culture I\u2019ve seen anywhere, but one of the best curated, too. Many of the pieces are displayed strategically to interact with each other. An absolute must that didn\u2019t show up in our online explorations (we heard about it from another traveler on the walking tour the previous night).

551037220.name: Amazing!
551037220.author: a TripAdvisor user
551037220.reviewBody: This way surpassed our expectations. The building and all the art is exquisite, and you can get up close and personal without being in the market place and hounded to buy stuff. They only do one tour a day at 10 am, but you don\'t have to reserve in advance. The tour is about 45-60 minutes long and the guide was very personable and gives you enough time to walk around and look at things.

549936687.name: Highlight of our stay in Valladolid
549936687.author: a TripAdvisor user
549936687.reviewBody: This place is a must see! The private house is open for 4hours a day and is one of the best places to visit if you like Mexican art! The guide was super knowledgeable and the tour took about 45 minutes. The donation suggestion is 5 dollars or 100 pesos, which is super cheap....

549846503.name: Amazing
549846503.author: a TripAdvisor user
549846503.reviewBody: Great tour, make sure you ask for David, he is the best, very knowledgable and speaks many languages.

549049446.name: A must see art collection
549049446.author: a TripAdvisor user
549049446.reviewBody: If you are visiting Valladoild, you must check out this beautiful casa full of folk art. It\'s a hidden gem, a very unique place!

548890339.name: A must see
548890339.author: a TripAdvisor user
548890339.reviewBody: The house alone makes Valladolid worth a visit. The Mexican folk art collection is stunning, tastefully presented in an architectually  spectacular house in which the owner still lives. Be there at 10 am for a tour with knowlegeable guides

547745752.name: amazing folk art collection!
547745752.author: a TripAdvisor user
547745752.reviewBody: This house is way worth a visit. It\u2019s a private home and there is art everywhere! It\u2019s amazing that this couple opens their doors to strangers, so if you are there really JUST RING ONCE, it\u2019s enough and someone will come in seconds. It\u2019s a fun collection following mainly the theme of \u201cEl d\u00eda de los muertos\u201d with plenty to see and learn. You don\u2019t pay access fee but they ask for a donation that goes completely to different charities. My husband and I loved it.

546039659.name: One of most interesting private art collections ever
546039659.author: a TripAdvisor user
546039659.reviewBody: One of the best tours we have ever done.  Private art collector opens his home filled with art from all over the world, but mostly pieces from Mexico.   So many things to see, layout of the hacienda type house is stunning and every where you look there is another interesting piece of art.  I especially liked the Frieda Kahlo and Diego Rivera rooms.  Get there by 1015 to make the tour or you lose out.  Its worth it.  I will go back

545637793.name: A Collection Put Together with Dedication
545637793.author: a TripAdvisor user
545637793.reviewBody: Valladolid, which feels like mini-Merida, is home to this private collection of  Mexican folk art. Keep in mind that 75% is commissioned work. If you\'re looking for traditional/authentic Mexican folk art, you should visit the wonderful museum in Mexico City. This one is put together with a lot of love and dedication but you may or may not always agree with the choices made by the owner. Some pieces are tacky while others show good taste. The 16th century mansion has been restored beautifully but with some indulgence. The place smacks of American wealth and opulence (a mini bar in each bathroom!)  but that\'s easily forgotten  when you think of the care with which this collection has been assembled and  displayed. You can\'t wander around at will--you have to take a tour (see website) and make  a 100 peso donation.

545161344.name: If you can\u2019t spend a month in Oaxaca and visit most of the Mexican states collecting beautiful things, take 10am tour.
545161344.author: a TripAdvisor user
545161344.reviewBody: The owners of this house allow one daily 10am tour of their residence. It takes 45 minutes and is excellent. They have spent many years collecting folk art. The items from the villages in Oaxaca alone are worth the visit, and there is much more to see. The tour guide was great and speaks Mayan, Spanish and English well and a few European languages enough to help most visitors. This is NOT suitable for children unless they are old AND responsible enough to walk among fragile, irreplaceable objects reliably! Photos are permitted. A few are attached.

545155026.name: An amazing house/art collection
545155026.author: a TripAdvisor user
545155026.reviewBody: This amazing restored house acts as both a museum of Mexican folk art as well as a home for the owners of this establishment. The owners have spent years collecting lots of Mexican folk art - wood carvings, metal sculptures, embroidered pillows, beadwork, paintings, furniture - you name it, they have it. The one hour tour through the couples\' house will allow you to see lots of amazing pieces of artwork. We met the owners at the end of the tour and thanked them for sharing their home and their art with the world, as well as using the admission fees (donations) for a variety of charities.  Our visit here was the highlight of our visit to Valladolid.

544775707.name: Very lovely
544775707.author: a TripAdvisor user
544775707.reviewBody: Beautiful private art collection in an amazingly restored private home. One hour guided tour from 10-11. Donations go to fund local medical facilities. Well worth it.

544500666.name: Extensive collection of folk art
544500666.author: a TripAdvisor user
544500666.reviewBody: If you are already a Mexican folk art collector and have traveled extensively throughout the country, it may not be for you. But we did encounter some exquisite pieces as well as some from craftspeople we know personally. I don\'t like that they called the 100 fee a donation, especially after our guide told us outright that the owner decided to start a business out of his collection.  Call it what it is, an admission fee for the guided tour. Yes, it was worth it. Also, the owner did not seem interested in chatting with us although we would have liked to exchange stories, experiences, etc. The home is indeed exquisite, but lacks interior colonial charm.

541420871.name: Beautiful home. Well worth your time to visit
541420871.author: a TripAdvisor user
541420871.reviewBody:
My husband and I took a tour here in November.  While walking by the house the day prior to our visit, an employee was exiting the building.   He let us know that besides the daily tour at 10am, they also offer tours at 1130am and 1pm if you inquire.  

The house is beautiful.  Even if you aren't interested in Mexican folk art, it's still worth visiting here.  The restoration was so well done.  The artwork displayed might not be to everyone's taste, but it is lovingly displayed and most of it is very interesting to look it.  

I admire the owner for opening up his home to visitors to share his collection and also for his decision to donate all of the money collected after the tour to charity.

My only question is, How do I become a friend of John's so I can stay in one of those lovely guest rooms!

If you have the time, definitely add this to your list of places to visit in the area.
Or better yet, Make the time!!

540995605.name: Mexican art tour - private house
540995605.author: a TripAdvisor user
540995605.reviewBody: Excellent, informative tour by David. Fascinating to see and hear about the collection plus the restoration of the house.

540938540.name: This is a must See in Valladolid !
540938540.author: a TripAdvisor user
540938540.reviewBody: How wonderful that the owners have opened the doors to their magnificent home for all to see! Definitely a must see to enjoy all sorts of Mexican folk art and a beautiful home all wrapped up in one...we were lucky enough to meet John Venator and his lovely dog Mia...John gave us lots of tips for our visit in Valladolid.  Many thanks to the guide Roberto for such a wonderful tour and all the history of the thousands of pieces of artwork.

540220490.name: Beautiful house with a mind blowing art collection
540220490.author: a TripAdvisor user
540220490.reviewBody: We had a great time visiting this amazing place. The guide was very friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable about every single piece in the house. The entrance fee goes to local charities. We wished the tours could be longer because there is so much to see and discover. I fell in love with this house! Would definitely come back.

538773408.name: Fourth visit and looking forward to go back
538773408.author: a TripAdvisor user
538773408.reviewBody: A must-see when in Valladolid. A unique private museum of more than 3,000 traditional art pieces. Fabulous and David (our guide) is very interesting. He is also fluent in Spanish, French, German, English and Mayan of course. Italian too I think.

538719178.name: Colour, culture & a true delight
538719178.author: a TripAdvisor user
538719178.reviewBody:
Seldom have I been moved to tears at such a collection of art, but Casa de Los Venados is a truly inspirational and intimate experience that celebrates Mexican artists and culture. 

Arrive for a free tour at 10am (donations are accepted at the end). You are welcomed into the private home of John, his wife and their cute doggie to view his personal collection of diverse Mexican folk art. 

Every corner is a delight. The building itself is inspirational in its renovation and cheeky details. Much of the art is used in its intended function (chairs as chairs, tables as tables). 

When you enter the kitchen, you might become emotional (as I did), as the sheer amount of beauty, craftsmanship, cultural significance in every available inch. 

This was an important visit for reconnecting with my own Mexican heritage through art, and I’m so thankful for John and Casa de Los Venados for opening up their home to curious minds. 

We will absolutely be coming back. Highly recommended for any local or visitor. ❤️

536061439.name: A must to do in Valladolid!
536061439.author: a TripAdvisor user
536061439.reviewBody: The tour (in English) was great and the collection is incredible! A lots of creative sculptures, paintings, statues...from different styles and places in Mexico. I learnt a lot, thank you!

533615862.name: Wow!  Largest private collection of Mexican folk art.
533615862.author: a TripAdvisor user
533615862.reviewBody: Interesting house museum with the largest private collection of Mexican folk art.  Donations accepted.

529161818.name: A gem for folk art lovers...
529161818.author: a TripAdvisor user
529161818.reviewBody: Wow still thinking about this fascinating private collection. Hard to know where to look first but you will see many commissioned artworks which are a beautiful cross section from Mexican artists. Our English speaking guide shared information about the work and the areas where the work is from. Visit this Folk Art casa and come away happy. It was one of the highlights on our travels in Mexico.

528058764.name: Amazing artisan folk art in a private home tour
528058764.author: a TripAdvisor user
528058764.reviewBody: This private home is opened for tours each morning so that visitors can view an amazing array of Mexican folk art, created by fine artisans, collected and displayed by the owners of this lovely home.  Tours are given in English and Spanish, depending on the make up of tour group.  The variety of the art is remarkable - so many sculptures, paintings, pottery, furniture - traditional and modern.  A great change from tourist shops - a beautiful way to see Mexican culture from around the country.  Probably not for young kids - because this is a home, you are walking in and around the art.  A wonderful gem in Valladolid!

526641336.name: Just a bit too much
526641336.author: a TripAdvisor user
526641336.reviewBody: I don\'t have many skeletons in my cupboard, but this guy has thousands from floor to ceiling.  All very colorful and skilfully displayed; shown off by a very helpful (and profusely sweating) guide, who tells us the owner (who introduced himself personally to the group) is buying even more!   Too many bones for my liking, but the wife seemed to enjoy the experience.

526000478.name: DO NOT MISS Casa de los Venados!
526000478.author: a TripAdvisor user
526000478.reviewBody: After breakfast we walked over to Casa de los Venados. We had heard much about the world\u2019s largest private collection of Mexican folk art, but were completely unprepared for the majesty of the house itself. Winner of four architectural awards, the home is stunning and as unique a home as, say, the Hearst Castle. Even without the art collection we would have enjoyed seeing the home and fantasizing about staying there. The pool area might be the most beautiful I\u2019ve ever seen in a private home. In addition to seeing the home and collection, tour guide David explained the traditions behind things like pi\u00f1atas and the Katrina figures one sees associated with Day of the Dead. Tours are offered daily at 10 AM and last just over an hour, but David explained that they are open until 2 PM and often do a second tour at 1:00, even though it is not advertised. Tours are free but donations are accepted, which support many local charities. This is a do-not-miss attraction in Valladolid.

523536077.name: Amazing.
523536077.author: a TripAdvisor user
523536077.reviewBody: Amazing collection of Mexican craftwork from all around the country. A veritable treasure trove. Definitely worth a visit.\nDonation to worthy charities.

520612576.name: Wonderful place
520612576.author: a TripAdvisor user
520612576.reviewBody: It was an amazing time. The owner of the house was there so we got to talk to him directly. The collection is very extensive! Such a treat. The house is amazing. The progression of the renovation over 8 years was very interesting as well. The guide was informative as well. Great time for all interested in folk art.

519389688.name: Not to be missed
519389688.author: a TripAdvisor user
519389688.reviewBody: Do visit this, really interesting artworks and nice guides. The home of two collectors with a glimpse of their lives as well as their collection

516817248.name: Amazing
516817248.author: a TripAdvisor user
516817248.reviewBody: An impressive museum in the city of Valladolid. This is the home of an American family in love with mexican art and crafts. Their house itself is already a piece of art and their huge collection of objects and painting are amazing. We are very lucky to have the possiblity to admire this enormous collection of mexican art that no mexican museum has. Congratulations to John and Dorianne Venator the owners.

515218013.name: Fantastic Private Museum
515218013.author: a TripAdvisor user
515218013.reviewBody: Must go if you\'ve time. Fantastic Private Collections of Mexican artists. Every item is exceptional. Big thanks to the owner for opening up his house to the public. Great tour guide. Highly Recommended!

513447643.name: A treasure trove in a beautiful house
513447643.author: a TripAdvisor user
513447643.reviewBody:
The casa dos venados is an absolute gem and I'm so glad we visited whilst in Valladolid. The house is owned by a wealthy couple collecting Mexican folk and fine art and each room is like a carefully curated gallery showcasing an area's art or a particular style. The art itself is staggering and a gallery showcasing it all would be a great visit in itself.

What makes this even better is that you basically get to snoop around an incredible house and truly get a sense of how the other half live! The pool area is amazing: beautiful gardens and an incredible swimming pool, all adorned with more masterpieces. 

Well worth a visit.

511494768.name: A treasure trove of Mexican art
511494768.author: a TripAdvisor user
511494768.reviewBody: I absolutely loved touring this exquisite home. A treasure trove of Mexican art. And I loved that my donation went to such a worthy cause - supporting the community. I look forward to returning to Valladolid and this unforgettable place.

506891287.name: Must-see to believe
506891287.author: a TripAdvisor user
506891287.reviewBody: A visit was high on our list after reading all the great reviews posted on this site. We arrived before ten and could wait inside for the tour to begin. Staff member Alfredo gave us a wonderful and detailed tour of this living estate, with patient and enthusiastic descriptions of the artworks and their origins. We had a fantastic time and would recommend to anybody visiting the nice town of Valladolid to pay a visit. The entrance fee is suggested, but is given to many charities in the region. Please give freely because the place breathes love for Mexican life and culture!

505218718.name: Must see!
505218718.author: a TripAdvisor user
505218718.reviewBody: Must see place in Valladolid. This was my favorite place in town. Charming, beautiful Mexican artwork in a gorgeous house-museum of an art collector.

504032551.name: beautiful private collection
504032551.author: a TripAdvisor user
504032551.reviewBody: Casa venado, is a museum of folkloric art from all over Mexico. The collection is owned and kept in the home of US couple in the small town of Valladolid, Yucatan. Because the couple continue to live in their home, they allow one tour a day at 10am. The home itself is beautiful, and the amount of access they allow into their home is amazing, and the collection they have amassed is truly amazing, Art of so many types from so many different areas of Mexico. The charge for the tour is voluntary. Don\'t forget your camera.

503354816.name: Fascinating!
503354816.author: a TripAdvisor user
503354816.reviewBody: Well worth a visit! Fascinating home & collection! Our guide was a wealth of knowledge, and the owner gave us a personal welcome. I love Mexican art, so it was my cup of tea, but it was my parents first time in Mexico and they found it incredibly interesting too. Our kids, 5 and 7, learned a lot and hung in there for the tour...our kids are used to being drug around museums, but not all little kids would like it (lots of breakables!).

501330428.name: utterly dumbfounding!
501330428.author: a TripAdvisor user
501330428.reviewBody: i\'ve see some crazy places in my time but this was the most i\'ve been engaged in art as culture in a long long . david our guide was incredible. A must if u are visiting valladolid. A pure treasure!

501062979.name: So cool!
501062979.author: a TripAdvisor user
501062979.reviewBody:
This is not a formal museum, and I love that. 
Casa de los venados is an old (large) and renovated hacienda. It is actually the house of the owners, but is opened up to the public so that we may see their amazing and enormous Mexican art collection. 
The tour was great, our guide Arnaldo (I'm hoping I am remembering his name right), showed us about seven rooms including the yard, and every single room, walls floors and every available space, was occupied with some form of art ranging from the famous Frida Kahlo to local vendors who probably didn't think they were making art. Arnaldo was very knowledgeable on all the art he showed us so it was really interesting to see and learn about. 

This place is not like the grand museums of the US but it is absolutely fantastic and interesting, the culture is so beautiful! If you like art at all I would completely recommend this trip.

500104379.name: GO HERE!
500104379.author: a TripAdvisor user
500104379.reviewBody: This was one of the most amazing and unique art experiences I\'ve ever had.  The home was beautiful and the art is really something you should see for yourself if you have the opportunity.    Just be aware that if it\'s hot outside, it will be hot on the tour.  Truly amazing collection of folk art from across Mexico and truly unique way to experience it.  Plus the donation goes to charity.  Really not to be missed!

499210716.name: Incredible private collection! A must awe
499210716.author: a TripAdvisor user
499210716.reviewBody: Casa de Los Venados was absolutely incredible. We had a wonderful guide David who was warm and knowledgable. The structure and history of the house and the story of the American couple who own it will blow your mind enough, let alone the endless incredible pieces of art from all over Mexico. You really feel the love in this place and as an art and history lover this was my favourite thing in Valladolid.

498359763.name: Incredible Place
498359763.author: a TripAdvisor user
498359763.reviewBody: Well worth a visit in Valladolid. It\'s lovely that these people have opened their home to allow others to view their extensive art collection. Even if you\'re not a fan of art, the house is so beautiful and worth a look.

497761684.name: Interesting, one-of-a-kind museum
497761684.author: a TripAdvisor user
497761684.reviewBody:
Drop by early and schedule your tour time.  Each lasts about an hour.  

The suggested donation is more than worth it based on the amazing folkart collection and to support Valladolid locals in need.  (You could probably give less as it is on the honor system.  Remember that there are not social supports in Mexico for people with disabilities like in the US.)

Highly recommended!
