496927259.name: Beautyful house-museum with Mexican art!
496927259.author: a TripAdvisor user
496927259.reviewBody: This house is owned by two Americans that love Mexican art and they open every morning with guided tours for visitors for free! It is an amazing thing, it is charming to see how they set the house and how they collect all the art. They ask for a volunteer donation that goes to help the city of Valladolid! Awesome idea and awesome people!

490075363.name: Quirky and extensive collection
490075363.author: a TripAdvisor user
490075363.reviewBody: This place should not be missed! It\'s fabulous. The art collection is vast and varied. It\'s well worth the visit.  It\'s only open in the mornings as it is a private home.

487122315.name: Superb Collection of Mexican Art
487122315.author: a TripAdvisor user
487122315.reviewBody:
When visiting Valladolid, make absolutely sure you take a tour of Casa de los Venados, a private home with an amazing collection of Mexican folk art. (Tours start at 10.00 a.m. most days and include parts of the house that the owners use on a day to day basis. If you are lucky, you may even get to meet one of them as we did. Donations are encouraged and support a number of projects in the local community.)

The house itself, a wonderful example of colonial architecture, has been lovingly restored by its owners. But it is the collection of more than 3000 pieces, as varied as it is extensive, that will astound you. The owners acquired most of the collection directly from artists all over Mexico. Everywhere you look there is something to admire. Our guide was friendly and very knowledgeable, cheerfully answering any questions guests had. 

Whether you have an interest in art in general or simply want to appreciate more about Mexican culture, this is one place you should not miss. It was certainly a highlight of our trip.

485770080.name: Above and beyond
485770080.author: a TripAdvisor user
485770080.reviewBody: This place is awesome! The renovated house is a private home of the owners. The folk art collection is a private collection of the owners choice. Over 3000 pieces. They only ask for a donation for charity. Nowhere does it say that they have to let you in to see it. Show a little respect and enjoy it! Leave your children with sitter.\nThanks

484776772.name: There is nothing like that. Period!
484776772.author: a TripAdvisor user
484776772.reviewBody: Hidden absolutely unique gem in a private house that you don\'t want to miss while you in the town. You have to see in with your own eyes to believe how beautiful it is.

483745277.name: This is an amazing art collection.
483745277.author: a TripAdvisor user
483745277.reviewBody: This place is amazing. We hope to return as you can\'t absorb it all in one day. If you are fortunate you will be able to meet the owner as we did. A foundation has been set up to preserve the art for future generations.We hope return on future trip to MX.

482201114.name: Very cool display of art.
482201114.author: a TripAdvisor user
482201114.reviewBody: This collection and property is amazing. The owners have great taste but really, taste aside... the art that they have acquired is just such a good sampling of so many different mediums. The owners of the collection simply had the money to purchase it all along with having the resources to renovate what is also a wonderful display of historic architecture in all of its glory. Hopefully, while purchasing form all of the many artists they have on display, they paid them well for their beautiful art. Beautiful and I\'m looking forward to going back on our next trip to Valladolid.

479826816.name: An amazing house and collection
479826816.author: a TripAdvisor user
479826816.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the opportunity to see this amazing collection of first-rate folk art in this massive and beautifully renovated private colonial home.  It\'s a very straight-forward drive (or bus trip) from the coastal region, and you can take in Coba on the way if you need an extra reason.  For me, it\'s a gem that too many people seem to miss.\n\nThe house and collection owners, originally from Chicago, use the donations collected from visitors to help the needy.

478642555.name: Amazing Place, must see for art lovers!!!!
478642555.author: a TripAdvisor user
478642555.reviewBody: This amazing private home with huge collection of Mexican art is a must see for anyone passing through Valladolid!!!!

476558460.name: A surprise and hidden bonus
476558460.author: a TripAdvisor user
476558460.reviewBody: Having never seen Mexican folk art, and almost missing out on this experience, it was only due to another Trip Advisor search that I spotted this hidden gem.  Turn up at 10am any day to get a free tour (with small suggested donation to local charity)/.  I went without kids, tour takes just over an hour (though they say its shorter), but older kids would find it interesting. Amazing collection of art, great multi lingual guide, and also interesting house from interior design/ renovation point of view. Not to be missed - just off town square

475126125.name: A must do in Valladolid
475126125.author: a TripAdvisor user
475126125.reviewBody: A wonderful experience and great insight into Mexican art of all shapes and sizes. Felt very lucky to be shown the house. Book ahead

475093413.name: Folk Art in a Restored Home
475093413.author: a TripAdvisor user
475093413.reviewBody: If you love Mexican art, especially folk art, this is a museum not to be missed. The owners lovingly restored a building in central Valladolid where they reside and share their 3000 piece collection with visitors. The home is beautiful, with polished local limestone, wood cabinetry, a stunning pool and open courtyards. And then there is the art! Many pieces were commissioned by the owners, including logo dinnerware, hand painted dining room chairs, lead figures of Mexican people from every state, and an entrance mural made of tiles depicting the daily life in a Mexican village. Tours are scheduled between 11 am and 1 pm, so plan your visit accordingly. And enjoy the art of the people!

474292744.name: I\'ve been twice.
474292744.author: a TripAdvisor user
474292744.reviewBody: This is a beautiful collection of Mexican folk art. I\'ll go again because you cannot take it all in in one trip. \nIts beautifully displayed, the people,who,own the house are kind and welcoming and th guide is knowledgeable. \nIt\'s inspired to me to begin collecting some folk art pieces of my own.

473802416.name: Highlight of my visit to Valladolid
473802416.author: a TripAdvisor user
473802416.reviewBody: This is a private house with over 3000 pieces of Mexican folk art  that the owners have collected in the past 34 years.  Interesting note told by tour guide David is that the owners didn\u00b4t buy their art at mercados but in artists studios or they were commissioned.    Lovely home with art pieces in every nook and cranny.

473680327.name: Just aweosm
473680327.author: a TripAdvisor user
473680327.reviewBody: We could of spent hours in this amazing house! It\'s not a museum it\'s been opened by the US owners for people to view their incredible private 3000+ collection of Mexican folk art. Which is just incredible!! \n\nA must go! All donations go to charities within the area :)

472792006.name: Fantastic Collection and Home
472792006.author: a TripAdvisor user
472792006.reviewBody: My family toured the Casa de Los Venados with David on the weekend.  My kids, aged 10, 13, and 15 don\'t always appreciate the more cultural elements of our trips abroad but this was an exception.  After we left the casa, my thirteen-year-old exclaimed that it was the "best tour ever" - which is high praise from her.  David was very animated and clearly loves his job.  The stories of the home\'s restoration and the traditions behind some of the pieces were interesting for all.  Thank-you.  This was a very memorable part of our vacation.

472542546.name: Highlight in Valladolid
472542546.author: a TripAdvisor user
472542546.reviewBody: We weren\'t sure what to expect before we went, but all four family members agreed it was a highlight in Valladolid. So much fun art to enjoy, and our tour guide (David) was very charming and entertaining.  Cool that it is a home as opposed to a museum.  Thank you to the owners for opening it up to the public!

472509161.name: Super interesting!
472509161.author: a TripAdvisor user
472509161.reviewBody: A really interesting trip around the Mexican folk art scene. I left the house wanting to become a collector myself! Definitely do the tour if you find yourself in Valladolid

472204922.name: Interesting!
472204922.author: a TripAdvisor user
472204922.reviewBody: Private home and private art collection opened up for public visitors each morning.  The guide we had was David and he is extremely knowledgeable about the entire collection and very animated.  We enjoyed the tour immensely.

471663177.name: NOT TO BE MISSED!
471663177.author: a TripAdvisor user
471663177.reviewBody: This is an amazing, charming and spellbinding experience!\nThis private property is jammed full with the most visual appealing pieces of Mexican folk art, furniture and artefacts.\nGo and see for yourselves, words cant describe the achievement the owners have pulled off - and all from a ruin of a building.

471636129.name: Mexican Folk Art Collection
471636129.author: a TripAdvisor user
471636129.reviewBody: Excellent, Amazing. Do not miss this intimate tour of the collectors personal home. Your donation goes to local charities.

470248600.name: Incredibly beautiful home and art collection
470248600.author: a TripAdvisor user
470248600.reviewBody: A private restored colonial home filled with Mexican folk art. Tours in Spanish and English each morning. Breathtaking.  This is a must visit for anyone in the Valladolid area. Located near the central town square.

470098873.name: An odd experience-- possibly great, if folk art is your thing
470098873.author: a TripAdvisor user
470098873.reviewBody: This collection is in a private home, so you get toured around by a guide to see the pretty vast collection of folk art and tchockes, some of which struck me as pretty kitsch (but hey, I\'m not an expert).  Tour culminates in meeting the house owners, who hold court in the courtyard, which is odd and somewhat awkward.  Proceeds go to charity-- great, but   the amounts didn\'t seem that impressive to me, compared to the value of that collection, and considering all the money comes from those who donate after the tour.

468051756.name: Truly extraordinary!
468051756.author: a TripAdvisor user
468051756.reviewBody: As owner of TheMayanTraveler.com, a tour operator to the Maya World and collectors of Mexican folk art for over 30 years, we emphatically recommend this beautiful casa and it\'s incredible collection of rare and beatiful art.  We are including a visit to this house and collection in all of our tours that travel to or through Valladolid.

467859916.name: Amazing!
467859916.author: a TripAdvisor user
467859916.reviewBody: Beautiful home and art.  Fun tour for the whole family.  I love that they request donations and give back to the community.  Highly recommend.

466383550.name: Excellent display of Mexican folk art.
466383550.author: a TripAdvisor user
466383550.reviewBody: Privately owned residence with an abundant collection of Mexican folk art. Interesting because the couple who collected the art live here and interact with the public. All funds collected by the museum go to help the underprivileged and aged members of the population.

466246466.name: Mexican folk art and a beautiful house
466246466.author: a TripAdvisor user
466246466.reviewBody: We visited when staying in Valladolid and enjoyed our visit. \nThe house is a well designed make over of an older property with attractive courtyards and bedroom suites. You get to see all around it, including some of the owners private rooms, all filled with Mexican folk art that the couple have collected over many years. You are shown round by a guide.\nThey take donations which are collected to help with local projects for the town.

465605177.name: A fantastic collection in an amazing house.
465605177.author: a TripAdvisor user
465605177.reviewBody: This is a private collection of Mexican folk art on display in a private home. The home itself is a restored historic building just off the main square. No admission is charged but a donation of 100 pesos is suggested. This money is donated to various charities. Guides are provided who provide essential information about the various objets d\'art.

465544283.name: Amazing home.
465544283.author: a TripAdvisor user
465544283.reviewBody: The artwork is really something to see, and the fact that this is in someone\'s home is even more amazing.  The owner was there when we toured, introduced himself, and asked each of us where we were from.  Our guide, David--was really knowledgeable and did an excellent job of explaining all of the art.

464328414.name: So much great folkart you can\'t absorb it all in one visit!
464328414.author: a TripAdvisor user
464328414.reviewBody: Beautiful home and diverse folk art from most of Mexico. Sculpture, painting, furniture, tinwork, you name it; it\'s here. Owner also took time to speak with us and we believe he talks to every tour group. Strict start times for tours, so watch the clock.

463848266.name: Must See
463848266.author: a TripAdvisor user
463848266.reviewBody: If you are considering this, do it.  It\'s more interesting that you can imagine.  The house alone is worth the donation but the collection is staggering.  You\'ll also learn a good deal about Mexican geography and history from the excellent guides.

463794972.name: Second Time through Just as Fascinating as the First
463794972.author: a TripAdvisor user
463794972.reviewBody: Be at entrance by about ten am to be part of a guided narrative through this living art museum and private home.  Owner and host John explained to me what he was doing in educating local school children in their Mexican folk art heritage. John is an American who is fortunate enough to have means to pursue his lifelong passion for regional Mexican folk art and the lore of Frida and Diego.

463465522.name: Absolutely Amazing
463465522.author: a TripAdvisor user
463465522.reviewBody: This is my second visit to Casa de los Venados It is truly an amazing home filled with beautiful Mexican folk art. You really need more than one visit to take in all that is offered visually. The couple who restored and own the home have graciously opened it to the public  and usually speak with each group that visits.  There is no charge to view this masterpiece only a donation at the end ,which helps to fund the owners foundation that assists  charities throughout Mexico.  THIS IS A MUST DO WHILE IN MEXICO

463317333.name: Very interesting house..
463317333.author: a TripAdvisor user
463317333.reviewBody: Can\'t say I know anything about Mexican folk art, but the tour of the house and collection was very interesting -opened up to the public by a generous couple.

463028540.name: Must see for art enthusiasts
463028540.author: a TripAdvisor user
463028540.reviewBody: This private collection of artwork is assembled in a private residence and open to the public.  The tour takes place daily and is quite amazing.

462756956.name: Mexican art and architecture
462756956.author: a TripAdvisor user
462756956.reviewBody: As others have written, for lovers of Mexican folk art and architectural remodeling/restoration this is an attraction not to be missed in Valladolid.  We were treated to a very passionate tour of the home and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  Must see!

461853921.name: An amazing place to visit.
461853921.author: a TripAdvisor user
461853921.reviewBody:
What an amazing labour of love!!  Folk art from all over Mexico is a sight to behold and the caring love offered by the owners is unquestionable.

The tour guides obviously love their work and invest a lot of energy into doing it right!

The art work is incredible and you can learn and appreciate much of Mexico by a visit.

460687949.name: Surprising gem in downtown Vallalodid.
460687949.author: a TripAdvisor user
460687949.reviewBody: This is surprising gem in the Yucatan, and well worth visiting. Little to add to all the \u201cexcellent\u201d reviews of this amazing collection and house.  The guide was enthusiastic, knowledgeable and clear, and we even got a short presentation of Mr. Venator himself, explaining the collection and the charitable work they do. Great visit.\nNote, however, that their opening hours are limited, and that things may get crowded when tours groups arrive (best is early morning).

460039188.name: The best of the best in Mexican Folk Art
460039188.author: a TripAdvisor user
460039188.reviewBody: This private home is a treasure trove of Mexican Art. The fruit of two passionate lovers of Mexico and its art.

459687094.name: Quirky, beautiful, interesting
459687094.author: a TripAdvisor user
459687094.reviewBody: We enjoyed our tour of Casa de los Venados. Amazing collection of Mexican folk art, and some very beautiful, unique pieces. The stuff you see in the market is going to look even worse.

459407685.name: Very interesting
459407685.author: a TripAdvisor user
459407685.reviewBody: We had a tour with our guide David, who told us many fascinating facts about the house, the art and also about Mexican traditions. What we did not know before is that you can only visit the house with a tour because it is a private house - one tour starts at 10 am and we were lucky to catch a tour at 11.30 am; you just need to ring the bell outside to ask. The tour took approximately 1h and the price is min. 90 mxn - but it is a donation, the owner of the house donates the money to local charity. We had a good time and many laughs because our guide was a fun person! It\'s a nice activity in Valladolid!\n

459393231.name: Absolutely Brilliant
459393231.author: a TripAdvisor user
459393231.reviewBody: A drive to Valladolid is very work while, It\'s about 1.5 hours from the coast resort areas and a real nice change to get a true taste of Mexico. Casa de los Venados is absolutely brilliant, the home is restored beautifully but maintains authenticity. Inside are over 3,000 amazing pieces of Mexican folk art. This is not to be missed. The cost is a mere 90 pesos (5USD) and proceeds go to local charities and infrastructure projects, a great cause. The tours start at 10am, keep in mind they are one hour behind costal time. After the tour I recommend one of the great cafes for lunch, or better yet buy some food from street vendors and sit in the city square and enjoy the scenery. After that we made our way down the street to Cenote Zaci for a refreshing swim. Then we made a short 20 minute drive north to visit the Mayan ruins at Ek Balam, no crowds, lineups or ropes. there were about 50 people there when we visited. Enjoy!

459311325.name: You MUST go if you love folk art
459311325.author: a TripAdvisor user
459311325.reviewBody: Valladolid is a wonderful town in the Yucat\u00e1n and Casa de los Venados was the highlight of our day trip from Isla Mujeres. Make sure you take a guided tour of this private residence with the most outstanding collection of Mexican folk art we\'ve seen. You won\'t be disappointed. And don\'t forget your camera--we got hundreds of amazing pics. You don\'t need to pay a tour company. Just take the ferry to Puerto Juarez, a short cab ride to the Cancun bus station, and a two-hour ADO bus to Valladolid. Enjoy!

459228644.name: An amazing experience
459228644.author: a TripAdvisor user
459228644.reviewBody: Show up on time and be prepared for an extraordinary experience behind an ordinary and quite anonymous door

458955775.name: Biggest and Best collection of Mexican Folk Art you\'ll ever see!
458955775.author: a TripAdvisor user
458955775.reviewBody: We traveled to Valladolid to see the Casa de los Venados (house of the deer). After our cousin who lives near Tulum saw our collection of Mexican Folk Art at our house in Canada last summer, he took us there when we were on the Mayan Riviera last week as he knew we\'d love it! And love it we did!\nA huge collection and just the most fabulous home of John and Dorianne Venator. All the money from tours is given to charity projects in the area.\nA \'must\' see for Folk Art enthusiasts. Very worthwhile! Well worth a trip to Valladolid, a very old Mexican city, a bit out of the way, but quite close to Chichen Itza should you go that way.

458396499.name: Mexican Folk art collection
458396499.author: a TripAdvisor user
458396499.reviewBody: An amazing houe - not a museum. The guide was knowledgable and his English was good and he was passionate about the collection. It is a private home - at the end of the tour your donation goes to local charities.

458342264.name: 5th Time and still see more and more
458342264.author: a TripAdvisor user
458342264.reviewBody: This is one of our favorite places in Valladolid and one we take friends and family to as well as recommend to anyone we meet. It was my 5th time and first time for my Daughter and Grand-daughter. David did a fantastic job with the tour. Even after 5 times I still find new things to see and photograph. Pictures cannot do it justice. If you are ever in Valladolid drop in and see for yourselves.

458335268.name: Amazing folk art collection
458335268.author: a TripAdvisor user
458335268.reviewBody: I should start by saying I am a Mexican folk art nut.  Nothing I don\'t like.  So with these 1,000s of pieces on display I was in heaven.  The pieces are the decoration for the owners home.  They are not displayed as if in a museum.  Wonderful experience.

457461164.name: A must see!
457461164.author: a TripAdvisor user
457461164.reviewBody: Breathtakingly beautiful home. Incredible Mexican folk art. Our guide, David was gracious, friendly, loves what he does. Small fee at the end of the tour goes to charity. Would visit again.

457149036.name: A MUST SEE IN VALLADOLID  1000AM DAILY!
457149036.author: a TripAdvisor user
457149036.reviewBody: Wow what a Bargain!  These nice folks have assembled an amazing display of Mayan ART & ARTIFACTS that will be sure to please! Right in the heart of downtown on AV 40  1/2 block fro town square!  DONT MISS IT!

457077379.name: Incredible.
457077379.author: a TripAdvisor user
457077379.reviewBody: So much incredible art here.  The tour was really worthwhile , it\'s free (you\'re asked to donate anything at the end to a charity box which goes to local charities) and very informative. The staff are great and knowledgeable. The house itself is a work of art.  Great morning spent here highlight of Valladolid.

456725906.name: Simply Amazing
456725906.author: a TripAdvisor user
456725906.reviewBody: We read the reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to drive to Valladolid, a colonial Mayan village.  A gentleman and his wife have collected a massive number of Mexican folk art sculptures, pottery.  Wow...this was beyond amazing. He and his wife were from the Chicago area and decided to renovate a 400 year old building to display their art. Every room was a wonder. I could have spent hours as there is so much to see in each room. This is their actual home and we were delighted to meet him. So generous to share his collection with the public. No admission, just a donation which he gives to charity which benefits the community.  Thank you for such an extraordinary experience!

456476701.name: 10 am everyday - NOT to be missed!
456476701.author: a TripAdvisor user
456476701.reviewBody:
OMG!  I could post one of the over one hundred photos I took, but truly, you should just go.  Madrid has the Prado, Paris the Louvre, and Valladolid has Casa de los Venados.

The one-hour tour is run on donations, with all of the donations going to local charities.  The home itself is gorgeous, but all the art that John has collected makes this place stunning!

When I return to Valladolid, there are places I may not return to, but Casa de los Venados will get more visits from me.  It might take a week to really see everything.

456401024.name: I can see why it\'s Number 1!
456401024.author: a TripAdvisor user
456401024.reviewBody:
Have 'done the tour' twice in the past month. First time around New Years with my partner and a friend and second a couple of weeks ago with the same friend and her daughter who had been ill for the first trip.

These people have even more interesting art in their house than I ever did!! 

Both tours happened to be guided by David who was very congenial and knowledgeable.

Be at the door at 1000 and do the tour!!  It will take about 45 - 60 minutes.  The requested donation is more than value for money. And, the monies donated go directly on to various local charities and good causes like water treatment, adaptive equipment for handicapped children, etc.  I was able to be at an evening event there last trip and witnessed one such 'handing over' of a cheque.

Often the owner will take a moment in mid-tour and chat with folks.

If you are going to be in Valladolid for a while, maybe do this first, so you will have some time to digest it and then come back again...I saw things the second time that 'weren't there' - at least I hadn't seen them, the first time.

455683327.name: Completely wort the trip to Vallalodid.
455683327.author: a TripAdvisor user
455683327.reviewBody: This home will require more than one visit.  I was in awe just seeing the foyer.  Such a wonderful collection of Mexican Folk Art from all over Mexico.  I now want to visit other states to see these artisans in action.

455229161.name: Arnaldo our guide
455229161.author: a TripAdvisor user
455229161.reviewBody:
Arnaldo was our guide, very well informed and professional.

He answered our questions with a full knowledge of the items 

We were asking about..

455014422.name: OMG!
455014422.author: a TripAdvisor user
455014422.reviewBody: I\'ve been telling everyone about this house...and it\'s art.  Every morning at 10 the house is opened for a free tour.  The lines get long.  I don\'t know if the number of people who get to enter is limited, but I would think so.  The renovated colonial is amazing but the Mexican folk art pieces are strategically displayed everywhere.  It\'s a living museum (living because the wealthy owners actually spend time there, but still allow visitors to enjoy their collection and house for a limited time each day.)

454139100.name: A Superb Tribute
454139100.author: a TripAdvisor user
454139100.reviewBody: How remarkably generous of John and Dorianne to share what is clearly a life-long love of Mexican cultural folk pieces. I cannot imagine the sumptuousness of walking from room to room on a daily basis and seeing the beauty of so many regions of Mexico surrounding me. The works are outstandingly vivid. The guest list pictured on the dining room chairs is a history in itself . Our guide clearly loved and appreciated his work. So did I. Thank you for a wondrous opportunity. Viva La Casa de Venados.

451733461.name: 18,000 sf home filled with decades of folk art collections
451733461.author: a TripAdvisor user
451733461.reviewBody: This was definitely worth the visit.  Be there by 10am for a free tour.  A donation is requested at the end to help defray the costs and to fund non-profit causes.

451730501.name: A MUST DO!
451730501.author: a TripAdvisor user
451730501.reviewBody: Such a wonderful and interesting tour! They offer tours in Spanish and English which is great! Such a beautiful home!

451701631.name: Wonderful
451701631.author: a TripAdvisor user
451701631.reviewBody: Everything about this place is fascinating! My tour guide was a absolute delight...it was just him and I! I can\'t say enough about this place. At the end you give a donation and it goes to preserve local artist and culture! I met the owner of the house....yes it IS someone\'s house which only adds to the charm. I recommend this to everyone. And there\'s so much art that you can keep going back and the tour will be different every time. I couldn\'t thank the owner enough for letting me look at his collection and beautiful home!

451490801.name: Great Art, Great Tour
451490801.author: a TripAdvisor user
451490801.reviewBody: What a great way to spend the morning. This is a beautiful casa with magnificent mexican folk art. The visit was educational and interesting.

450007654.name: A living private collection....
450007654.author: a TripAdvisor user
450007654.reviewBody: Having seen the reviews on Trip Advisor we really wanted to see this collection which belongs to a retired American couple who have built it up over many years. The house in which they live is in itself beautifully restored and the extensive collection of furniture, murals, paintings, sculptures and other artefacts from different parts of Mexico and different artists and artisans makes the house really special. Our guide David was charming and went into many interesting details and mine host (John) was really welcoming when we met him. There is no entry fee, just the request to contribute to one of the many charities they support. A very special visit and a concentrated introduction to some of Mexico\'s rich culture. Don\'t miss it if you come to Valladolid. As the Michelin guides say \'vaut le d\u00e9tour\'.

449765317.name: Fantastic tour of spectacular collection
449765317.author: a TripAdvisor user
449765317.reviewBody: My friend and I were really impressed by this house and the tour. Since the facility is a private residence that the owners actually live in, the 45min-1.25hr tour is required, but don\'t cringe at this--the tour (at least the Spanish tour with the guide David) is very well done. The tour is very thorough, and draws you in immediately with the story of how the owner and his wife met and began collecting together and then eventually found this land in Valladolid. The objects in the house were judiciously selected yet represent many aspects of the diverse culture of Mexico, and they become starting points for little stories by the guide on topics as far ranging as marriage customs in the town of San Juan Chamula to how the popular art tradition of alebrijes evolved. The facilities are stunning, and the quality of the tour takes it all to another level. Bring your camera and be prepared to find cute trinkets and charming details in unlikely spots!

449754510.name: Amazing home and art collection!
449754510.author: a TripAdvisor user
449754510.reviewBody: I highly recommend a visit to this home if you love all things Mexican. The owners have collected a fantastic assortment of Mexican art over many years and have presented it in their stunning home in the centre of Valladolid.\nWe were lucky enough to to meet the owners on our tour and they were happy to answer our questions and tell us about the history of casa de Los venados. Tours are at 10am every day and there is no admission fee just a donation which goes to worthwhile local charities. Would love to visit again one day as there is so much to see!

449733139.name: Beautiful Collection
449733139.author: a TripAdvisor user
449733139.reviewBody: It was a pleasure to visit the Mexican folk art collection in this beautiful house. Every type of art and craft are represented, and are gorgeous. The stand-out for me was the building itself, especially the magnificent swimming pool. The tour lasts for an hour, starts at 10:00 AM, and accommodates about 10 people. Be sure to take advantage of this opportunity soon because rumor has been put out there, that the owners are selling the property.

448397148.name: Museum visit
448397148.author: a TripAdvisor user
448397148.reviewBody: Wonderful from beginning to end! Thank you so much to the owners for restoring this treasure, and opening your home to the public to enjoy!

448303015.name: Amazing collection
448303015.author: a TripAdvisor user
448303015.reviewBody: Take the time to check out this amazing collection of Mexican folk art, housed in gorgeous architectural splendor.

448132088.name: Magical exhibit of Mexican folk art in a private home
448132088.author: a TripAdvisor user
448132088.reviewBody: My wife and I both love Mexican folk art and have been to the folk art museum in Mexico City, but visiting the home of John and Dorianne Venator in Valladolid and seeing their marvellous collection of more than 3,000 pieces of Mexican folk art was a treat. We were taken on a conducted tour of their very large home and at the end asked for a minimum donation of 90 pesos (about US$4.50). All donations are given to help support various Valladolid charities. We met John Venator and enjoyed speaking with him about his home. This is a don\'t miss experience in Valladolid.

447816660.name: Wonderful!
447816660.author: a TripAdvisor user
447816660.reviewBody: Get there for the 10 am tour, in English or Espanol, and prepare for immersion in generosity and Mexican folk art. Our guided tour, just over an hour, was superb.

447567636.name: Great Folk Art Collection
447567636.author: a TripAdvisor user
447567636.reviewBody: We loved the tour of this fascinating folk art collection. The private collection is housed in a grand colonial house that was modernized and expanded over an eight year period. Not only do you get to see the largest private collection of folk art but to also see the amazing architecture. When the current owners bought the house it was in serious disrepair but they completely restored it and have made it into a museum for their extensive folk art collection. Every room and every surface is full of amazing examples of folk art from across Mexico. The tour is guided but you are given lots of freedom to photograph, to ask questions and to study every piece. When we were there the owner was in the house and gave us lots of interesting background. Admission is by a suggested donation that goes to local charities. Overall a fascinating hour and not to be missed!

447022496.name: Simply fabulous!
447022496.author: a TripAdvisor user
447022496.reviewBody: If there is one place you MUST visit in Valladolid it\'s here! Beautiful place with the most amazing and colourful collections of folk art I have ever seen. We absolutely loved it. You can meet the owner and his dog, he is a modest man who just loves collecting. Every room is crammed with folk art delights! \nThe swimming pool is gorgeous. The tour guide is a lovely man who loves the collection as much as the owner. Tours start at 10am. Donations only. I cannot recommend this place enough!

446484165.name: Must visit place in Valladolid
446484165.author: a TripAdvisor user
446484165.reviewBody: If you can see only one thing in Valladolid this should be it. Mexican art extravaganza displayed in an occupied home setting. So much to see so little time since it\'s by guided tours only you won\'t have time just to wonder around the house and take it all in at your own pace. The house is full of beautiful Mexican art pieces from huge murals to smallest of accent items. Make  sure you call or stop by and ask the start times for a tour in your language. We missed the tour in English by 5 minutes and had to come back in couple of hours for the next one. Entrance fees are donation based and all go for a good cause (when we visited the owners of the house were working on a clean water project for school kids in remote areas of Mexico). If you have a chance meet the owners, they are a lovely couple from US. Don\'t forget to tip your guide, they really do an awesome job. The tour is about 45 minutes to an hour.

446325238.name: Beautiful property - I wish I could live here!
446325238.author: a TripAdvisor user
446325238.reviewBody:
This house is stunning! I would highly recommend touring it once in Valladolid. The tour begins at 10am (I arrived at 9.45) and lasts about 50 minutes. There is one in English and one in Spanish. The tour guide explains the history of each pieces and how they relate to Mexican history/way of life/nature.

The structure of the house is beautiful and there are so many pieces of quirky artwork. I found it really interesting and I'm most definitely not someone who enjoys going to art galleries!

The tour is free but there is a suggested donation of $5/90 pesos which goes towards supporting local charities.

If coming from Cancún, the 8.10 ADO bus arrives at exactly the right time to allow you to quickly check in/drop off your luggage and head to Casa Venados for the tour.

446298000.name: Gorgeous!
446298000.author: a TripAdvisor user
446298000.reviewBody: Historic house fantastically renovated to house the impressive private collection of Mexican folk Arte.  Definitely a must see.  Donations accepted go to local charities.  We had a great guide who pointed out the different types of materials and origins of the art.

445984841.name: Best place in Vollodolid
445984841.author: a TripAdvisor user
445984841.reviewBody: Incredible home, great art, wonderful guide, unbelievable sharing of years of collecting and owners love for Mexico.

445976588.name: Excellent!
445976588.author: a TripAdvisor user
445976588.reviewBody: Best museum tour I have ever had! David was our host and gave an amazing tour. Visiting this museum was one of my favorite things to do in Valladolid. At the end of the tour you get to meet the owners of the house/museum! Best way to learn about Mexican folk art!

445643464.name: Extremely glad I visited
445643464.author: a TripAdvisor user
445643464.reviewBody: Very complete collection of art work. The guide was extremely knowledgable and very nice to the whole group. The tour took aprox one hour and that was about right.

445175781.name: Amazing art collection!
445175781.author: a TripAdvisor user
445175781.reviewBody: I think tours run at 10am on the dot. So get there beforehand to ensure you have a place! An amazing art collection - words can\'t describe - so check it out!!!

444845928.name: Folk art galore!
444845928.author: a TripAdvisor user
444845928.reviewBody: How do you spend an hour touring someone\'s house looking at folk art and not get bored?  While in Valladolid, stop in at Casa de los Venados (tour starts at 10 am), that\'s how.  An amazing town house hidden behind an ordinary facade, rebuilt and filled to the brim with fabulous arts of Mexico. A tour guide tells stories about the restoration of the home, and describes many of the more than 3000 pieces of folk art.

444435588.name: Excellent art fine Mexican mus\u00e9um
444435588.author: a TripAdvisor user
444435588.reviewBody:
Omg what amazing art place! 
Our guide David was a very nice guy and spoke fluently our French language
Our opinion is that everybody need to go for the knowledge- because it is really amazing, beautiful and surprisingly!
Definitely a place to see that we will not forget in our memories!!!!
Sophia y pascualita!

444102445.name: We\'re still talking about this place
444102445.author: a TripAdvisor user
444102445.reviewBody: I don\'t know what\'s more spectacular, the art, the house, or the pool area, but we were amazed by all of it.  Definitely worth a trip.

443887088.name: Spectacular collection of Mexican folk art
443887088.author: a TripAdvisor user
443887088.reviewBody:
We learned of this place from our Airbnb host, Evelín. We didn't realize it was currently-inhabited home when we arrived, and we almost missed the last tour of the day, at noon (we showed up at 12:10). The owner of this house, John Venator, lives there as his primary residence, and for us, meeting him was part of the tour. He's from Portland, OR, where both my partner and I have lived, so it was fun to chat with him. He also knew our Airbnb host, Evelín, because of her involvement with the local sister-city program (Valladolid is apparently a sister city to Asheville, NC). Mr. Venator hosts the tours to support local charities. The suggested donation was 100 pesos per person when we were there in Dec. 2016.

The home is a beautifully restored 17th century villa, with a fantastic collection of modern Mexican folk art. Photos are encouraged, which is good, because there's so much to look at that the tour feels short at just an hour. I was glad to be able to go back and examine details in my photos. Our tour guide, David, was one of eight household workers in the villa, who do cleaning, maintenance, and lead tours. He was engaging on the tour, and knew quite a bit about the art, as well as some of the cultural practices associated with various pieces. 

My partner and I usually visit art museums in the town's and cities we visit, and this one was extraordinary for its context and collection. I would highly recommend it to anyone with even a general interest in art.

443866385.name: Visually impressive
443866385.author: a TripAdvisor user
443866385.reviewBody: A beatiful collection of very colourful and impressive Mexican handcraft and art. The house itself is stunning just on its own as a tour. You dont know where to look given the extent of the collection. I took plenty of photos to review later

443155827.name: amazing
443155827.author: a TripAdvisor user
443155827.reviewBody: I\'m not very much into art galleries, but this was really interesting. the house is amazing on its own!

441810032.name: Fun!
441810032.author: a TripAdvisor user
441810032.reviewBody: This house is a can\'t miss! The collection was beautiful and the restored house something to admire. We enjoyed meeting the owners. David our tour guide (in English-took around an hour) was wonderful and enthusiastic! We were happy to pay via a donation to a selection of charities of their choice! A unique can\'t-miss experience indeed!

441698736.name: Interesting visit
441698736.author: a TripAdvisor user
441698736.reviewBody: If you go to Valladolid you need to visit this house. It\'s located near the zocalo (central square). Every day at 10 am they run a guided visit through the house in exchange of a tip (normally 100 pesos). It\'s very interesting and you will have the chance to learn about location craftsmanship and the collection in the house is amazing.

440989385.name: NOT OPEN
440989385.author: a TripAdvisor user
440989385.reviewBody: The only reason for the 2 star comment was we were expecting it to be open in the afternoon and didn\'t see any info to the contrary.\nSo I am sure it is fantastic but need to visit in the am as the owners want their house to themselves in the pm, and who could blame them

439948415.name: Amazing. Simply spectacular. Words fail me.
439948415.author: a TripAdvisor user
439948415.reviewBody: Make it a point to make a detour to Casa de los Venados anytime I am in the Yucat\u00e1n or Quintana Roo. It doesn\'t matter how many times I have been each time I go I am simply astounded at this collection. I actually simply do not have adequate words to describe the work of a lifetime this couple has collected as their legacy. I am in awe of their commitment as well as their eye for the most spectacular folk art I have simply ever seen. I have traveled around the world visiting museums and I have never even remotely experienced a private collection like this by someone still alive. It is amazing it is worth the detour no matter how far away you are. If you are an art student an art historian and or an artist then you must make the pilgrimage here.

439791237.name: Too much to see in one trip, you will have to listen very closely to get all the history and origins of items  described
439791237.author: a TripAdvisor user
439791237.reviewBody: This is a truly amazing collection of Mexican art, of all types. The items contained in this collection rival many museums I have visited, and the wonderful thing about being able to view these items is that proceeds go to help the community. I will be back to visit this wonder casa! And I found the staff friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. Do make an appointment tours are at 10 am usually.

439096977.name: Best museum over all in Mexico
439096977.author: a TripAdvisor user
439096977.reviewBody: Definetely worth to see. An amazing collection, getting bigger and bigger every day. Not possible to catch every details. If I had enough time, I could visit one more time. Visiting without a guide is not allowed. Better to call before visit. Tour is based on donations.

438154490.name: One of our favorite things we did in 2 weeks in Mexico!
438154490.author: a TripAdvisor user
438154490.reviewBody: Gorgeous house, splendid art collection, knowledgeable pleasant guide, lovely owners. A must do if I the area.

437536965.name: WORTH A DETOUR!!!!!
437536965.author: a TripAdvisor user
437536965.reviewBody: Don\'t miss a tour through the private home of two avid collectors of Mexican 20th Century Art. You might even have a chance to meet the owners. The house itself is stunning and filled with over 3,000 works of art. Allow about 1 hour for the tour. No entrance fee but you are expected to make a donation which will go to a charity.

434949977.name: A must-see
434949977.author: a TripAdvisor user
434949977.reviewBody:
First off, the owner, who we were lucky enough to meet, was extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. The tour guide, I'll just put his first initial- D, spoke English very well and gave us a most exquisite experience in the house. 

The history behind both the 400 year old house and the art was incredible. We entered, not knowing much. We left full and enriched with a well-presented history lesson.

We were able to dream-build also. The house is massive. My girlfriend and I were oohhhing and awwwing the entire time.  We have new ideas for our dream house to-come. 

With a suggested donation (that all goes to charity) of only $5, the tour was worth way way more than that. This should be your first stop in this town. Tip the guide, too, please!

434896719.name: Delightful surprise and one of our trip\'s highlights
434896719.author: a TripAdvisor user
434896719.reviewBody: Wow!  Just wow!  Not only an amazing collection of Mexican folk art, but displayed in such a warm and accessible way.  And that\'s not all:  it comes with a highly educational session with a tour guide (David - you were great!).  We learned a lot and enjoyed seeing the art in a living context.  Also had the opportunity to meet and chat with the owner.  Truly stunning art and home.  And for a good cause: the suggested visit donation goes to local charity.

433803981.name: A beautiful private home that is like a museum, except lived in.
433803981.author: a TripAdvisor user
433803981.reviewBody: Recently while spending a few nights at Genesis Eco-Hotel in Ek Balam Pueblo, I decided to drive to Valladolid for a day to see what was there.  It was only 20 km.  After checking the internet to see what was suggested, I went to the Casa de los Venados, which is right downtown.  I was told there would be another tour in about ten minutes, so I went inside and waited a few minutes.  A couple from the US has collected over 3000 pieces of arts and crafts in Mexico.  A few years back they bought this abandoned house in Valladolid, remodeled it for a few years, and moved in.  Because people heard about the house and wanted to tour it, they let a few people do this, then decided to let everyone who wanted to see their home do so, asking only for a small donation which they provide to local charities.  The house is very large, and everywhere you look there are arts and crafts items.  You cannot possibly see everything in one visit.  I had a solo tour, and my guide was most helpful in explaining some of the beautiful things I was seeing.  It is worth a trip to the Yucatan just to see this house and its beautiful contents.

431372588.name: A brilliant find
431372588.author: a TripAdvisor user
431372588.reviewBody: Went here based on trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Our guide, Arnaldo, showed us round and told us all about the art. He was very knowledgeable and his English was impeccable. We also met John, one of the owners, who was welcoming and friendly. The art on display is varied and interesting, and you can see it all in about an hour or so. A great way to spend some time out of the sun

430963330.name: Fantastic art collection in a beautiful home
430963330.author: a TripAdvisor user
430963330.reviewBody: This is a private house museum started by two collectors of Mexican folk art. It is open for public tours every day at 10 am, and was the first stop during our stay in Valladolid. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and took his time with the tour, making sure we had all our questions answered. There are so many highlights it is hard to pick, but the Frieda Kahlo room and the quirky dining room set are among the gems in the 3,000+ piece collection. Highly recommended!

429866274.name: Incredible art in a beautiful setting
429866274.author: a TripAdvisor user
429866274.reviewBody: An impressive collection of paintings, sculpture, and ceramics housed in a restored home.  Our guide, David, was extremely knowledgable and entertaining.  Be sure to see the bench in the entry way painted with the images of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera and a Katrina--outstanding!

428587620.name: Absolutely amazing!
428587620.author: a TripAdvisor user
428587620.reviewBody: We rang the doorbell and Arnoldo answered and gave us a fabulous tour. The art collection is quite remarkable and the house is beautiful. Highly recommend.

427759603.name: Absolutely brilliant
427759603.author: a TripAdvisor user
427759603.reviewBody: We have been travelling in Mexico for 10 days now and this is our favourite thing we have seen. The house is beautiful and the art is stunning. The tour was so informative and the guide was clearly passionate about the house and the art. I would highly recommend to all visitors of Valladolid, even if art isn\'t usually your thing this place is a sight to behold!

427445111.name: Wow! What a Collection!
427445111.author: a TripAdvisor user
427445111.reviewBody: There is so much to take in! The owner was entertaining guests when we visited but still graciously introduced himself and spoke to us briefly. The tour was well paced and questions were welcomed. A must visit!

426532971.name: Must see !!!!   Extraordinary.
426532971.author: a TripAdvisor user
426532971.reviewBody: Whow !!  never seen something comparable. I am deeply thankful that the owner (who still lives there) opened his house for the public. Fredy, one of the guides, explained within 90 min so much details, really impressive.  Go there and do not forget to donate at least 80 Pesos per person. (Still worth more !!!)

423234291.name: Amazing home, a must see!
423234291.author: a TripAdvisor user
423234291.reviewBody: Wonderful tour given by David! Amazing facts, and history.  He was sure that everyone would take something from their experience.  I want to learn more....\n

411953357.name: Hidden Treasure of the Yucatan!
411953357.author: a TripAdvisor user
411953357.reviewBody: I visited Casa de los Venados at the end of June for a dinner during the last day of a trip designed for teachers. The owners of the home were so welcoming, and the artwork inside is absolutely breathtaking! Each area of the home is like a mini museum, and because much of the artwork was commissioned, it truly is one of a kind! It\'s easy to pass up on the outside, but when inside, you\'ll be in awe! Even if you\'re not an art lover, it\'s a must-see attraction in Valladolid!

408052236.name: Worth seeing
408052236.author: a TripAdvisor user
408052236.reviewBody: Every morning at 10am sharp this private residence is open for a tour of the huge collection of Mexican folk art inside. They ask for a 60 peso donation which they use for good causes in the area.\nWe went on a rainy morning and really enjoyed ourselves. The tour lasted around 30-40 mins.

405272287.name: A Must See if you are in Valladolid!
405272287.author: a TripAdvisor user
405272287.reviewBody: A great tour of a private home and their art collection.  The tour was free (Tips accepted at the end that go towards local community charities) and super informative.  The owner of the house even came down and welcomed us.  His art collection is the best personal collection that we have even had the opportunity to experience.  The tour guides were friendly and very knowledgeable about every piece in the collection.   The tours are small enough in size to allow questions and interaction with the guides along with being allowed to take photos.  We live a few hours away and came here based on recommendations from friends, and will join them in recommending this as a Must DO for all of our friends traveling up this way

403015948.name: Great art in Valladolid
403015948.author: a TripAdvisor user
403015948.reviewBody: This was a spectacular home filled with Mexican folk art.  It is a guided tour and the guide gives you lots of information.  The owners were present.  There is so much to see you definitely would like to spend a lot more time  looking at all the detail.

402812878.name: Beautiful and interesting!
402812878.author: a TripAdvisor user
402812878.reviewBody: As part of a larger group we were shown the incredibly gorgeous rooms and the collection of folk art at Casa de los Venados. In addition we got treated to a perfect dinner with the owners and invited guests, and I think I can speak for all of us when I say that we would recommend this experience to everybody.

400147721.name: The nicest "museum" in Valladolid
400147721.author: a TripAdvisor user
400147721.reviewBody:
This is a nice collection from the mexican culture. 
You can visit this house with a guide, he is very nice and say a lot of information. If you have luck, you can meet with the owners too.
If you can visit it more times, I am sure you will find always something new. :)

Saludos
Los Hungaros :)

393515309.name: Great Perzonalized Tour in an Amazing Private House full of arts
393515309.author: a TripAdvisor user
393515309.reviewBody: The owners allow for 3 small tours/ a day. From 10 to 1pm, a guide gives a really detailed tour by a beautiful renovated house that shows a great collection of arts and crafts. My husband and I got to meet the owner, John Venator and we loved the experience. The tour is free, we were just asked to give a donation at the end for the charities the owners fundraise for.

390243299.name: wow love the home
390243299.author: a TripAdvisor user
390243299.reviewBody: cool place to visit. the owners were actually home at the time. we got to meet them. what i loved about the place was the owners actually used the furniture even though it was a piece of art. lots of interesting pieces and a great place to spend a few hours.

389546256.name: Welcoming place
389546256.author: a TripAdvisor user
389546256.reviewBody: I had a great experience and the owners were very welcoming. The place was beautiful and the tour guides were very knowledgable

389416549.name: A must see for collectors and lovers of Mexican folk art
389416549.author: a TripAdvisor user
389416549.reviewBody: This private home has the most amazing and diverse collection of Mexican folk art.\nRoom after room, the colorful artwork is tastefully displayed.  The house itself is a work of art with the rooms located around a beautiful courtyard with a large fountain.   I highly recommend this house/museum tour.

389400626.name: AMAZING
389400626.author: a TripAdvisor user
389400626.reviewBody: This is the best-kept secret in Yucatan. The Casa de los Venados has possible the finest private collection of Mexican Folk Art in the world. In fact, it is so exceptional, that it is almost hard to process in one visit. I suggest setting up a long tour or visiting twice.

389092605.name: This is the best collection of Mexican art I have ever seen
389092605.author: a TripAdvisor user
389092605.reviewBody: This is a private house that has a most incredible collection of Mexican art from every region! They do daily tours, so you do have to catch the tour time to see it but it\u00b4s well worth it!

388992224.name: a nice place
388992224.author: a TripAdvisor user
388992224.reviewBody: Pretty place, although the tour guide rushed us a bit and conveyed an aloof air.  It  was hard to book the tour.

388468053.name: Really interesting private home full of Mexican folk art
388468053.author: a TripAdvisor user
388468053.reviewBody: Fascinating collection of folk art in a private home.  Tour guides very knowledgeable about the art, and an opportunity to look at a really interesting home.

388276069.name: Great morning visit!
388276069.author: a TripAdvisor user
388276069.reviewBody: We popped to the 10am morning tour and it\'s well worth it! What an amazing collection of art, amazing and great to see so many different types all set into a home. David was a great tour guide!

381444268.name: Awesome house with amazing art !
381444268.author: a TripAdvisor user
381444268.reviewBody: This is a cool thing to see. Lots of Mexican art in an amazing restored old home. Our guide David was great and gave us a lot of information about the art and the history of the area. I think it\'s a great concept of the owners. You give an 80 peso donation at the end of the tour which they put back into the community. A great your which benefited us as well as the local people

380401331.name: Can\'t wait to go again
380401331.author: a TripAdvisor user
380401331.reviewBody: This was absolutely beautiful.  And the owners were even there, bonus.  Over 40 people showed up on the day we went so it was hard to hear and see everything the guide was saying but again magical.

379963908.name: Put in your "To do List"
379963908.author: a TripAdvisor user
379963908.reviewBody: Amazing place in Valladolid. Do not leave this small town without taking some time for a visit! The tour starts each day at 10 AM without reservation. Just make sure you are there on time. Consider that an offer starting from 80$ per visitor is required. This is totally worth it! Very impressive!

375209399.name: An experience and an education well worth the visit
375209399.author: a TripAdvisor user
375209399.reviewBody: This private collection is reminiscent of the Barnes in Philadelphia and the Gardner Museum in Boston. The difference being that Mr. Venator is alive and well and still collecting. By chance he was home during our tour and my wife and I had a chance to speak to him about his love of Mexican art and culture. He was generous with his time and information. The collection has beautiful examples of many regions of Mexico. Our guide David was very informative and answered all of our questions. We learned the history of how different regions become known for distinct recognizable forms and material. Like the black clay of Oaxaca. The unique aspects of the collection though are due to the relationship the Venators forge with the artists. As Mr. Venator pointed out, when he meets an artist he likes and has collected, he gives them an opportunity to create something they\'ve always wanted to do but felt constrained by either time or funding. We recommend calling for a reservation. All the proceeds from the admissions go to specific charitable causes within Valladolid and the Yucatan. At the moment they are raising money to add a third ambulance to the emergency department in Valladolid.

373060286.name: Almost Overwhelming.
373060286.author: a TripAdvisor user
373060286.reviewBody: A huge home filled with over 3000 pieces of their Mexican art collection. Stunning and unique barely cover it.

372457653.name: Amazing!
372457653.author: a TripAdvisor user
372457653.reviewBody: This home is full of Mexican art (over 3000 pieces) every where you look. Pictures, masks, statues, vases, you name it.  I was truly amazed with each room we entered. The fact John shares his home with the public is wonderful and he encourages youth to become interested in art. This is definitely the number one thing you must see if you visit Valladolid!

372060204.name: A gem for art lovers
372060204.author: a TripAdvisor user
372060204.reviewBody: This private collection of mexican folk art is fabulous. We attended one of the daily 10am tours & our guide David was knowledgeable and informative about the different styles represented by the various regions of Mexico. The tour is free, but a donation of M$80 per person is suggested, which goes to local causes. Worth a visit.

371633387.name: An astonishing and beautiful house
371633387.author: a TripAdvisor user
371633387.reviewBody: We visited Casa de los Venados today and although we didn\'t realise there was just a tour at 10am (or by appointment) we were shown around this spectacular house by David, who was just lovely and very passionate and knowledgeable. The art is wonderful and extensive, with so much history and information given about the origins and meaning of each piece. The house itself if stunning. A huge amount of work has gone into renovating the building and we felt so lucky to be able to see not only the art but such a beautiful building and home. Thank you to John and Dorianne Venator for making your collection available for the public to enjoy, I loved it! I wish I had written down the name of the book about the Beaded Beetles though as would love to look it up. Thanks also to David for a great tour. I only wish we had more time to look around a bit more!

371550580.name: Beautiful house and private art collection
371550580.author: a TripAdvisor user
371550580.reviewBody: The tour was fabulous, our guide David spoke perfect English and was incredibly knowledgable! The house itself is stunning and the art collection extensive and interesting. The only improvement would be to have the fans and or air con on as it was very hot. Meeting the owner (and his dog) was a lovely added bonus! You must visit Casa de Los Venados if you\'re in Valladolid!

371445348.name: Must see for eclectic folk art
371445348.author: a TripAdvisor user
371445348.reviewBody: If you are fascinated by Mexican folk art, Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, then you must visit this house located just off the main square on Calle 40!  They ask for a small donation to maintain the museum like quality of this private home.

370941285.name: Must see
370941285.author: a TripAdvisor user
370941285.reviewBody: Good intro to mexicanske regions. David, the guide, was most talented and could tell for hours. Everything else said by others.

367468285.name: Mexican Folk Art Museum
367468285.author: a TripAdvisor user
367468285.reviewBody: This "casa" is a residence and also a museum for examples of some of the best folk art produced in different areas of Mexico, much of it commissioned by the owners. The daily 10:00 a.m. tour is free, but donations are appreciated. Donations are used for the benefit of the local population and also include donations from corporations and other organizations. My guide spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable about all the pieces. After traveling in Mexico for several months, I recognize various styles of folk art, so it was very interesting and informative to see additional examples and to find out about the origins of the pieces that came from places I had not visited. The state of Yucatan is well represented here as well as Valladolid and nearby pueblos. There are also many works from Chiapas, Jalisco, Hidalgo, Oaxaca, Michoacan and Mexico. Picture taking is encouraged. This is a great place for those interested in Mexican folk art!

364709715.name: Quite interesting
364709715.author: a TripAdvisor user
364709715.reviewBody: Did not get an english guide when we visited the place. However, it was fun nevertheless. It\'s quite obvious that the original (present?) owners are quite passionate about Mayan folk art.

362603891.name: Colourful delight
362603891.author: a TripAdvisor user
362603891.reviewBody: Had an excellent tour of the Casa de los Venados.  As others have mentioned, be there just before 10am for the free tour, although they recommend a donation (80 pesos if I recall correctly).  The guide was charming and it was a lovely place to spend 45 mins or so wandering around.

362166108.name: The house of my dreams,
362166108.author: a TripAdvisor user
362166108.reviewBody: This amazing house is in the heart of valladolid, just a few steps away from the main square. It has the perfect balance of colonial arquitecture and different sort of popular arts from all over the country. The tour is around 40 min but is worth the time and money.

361750502.name: luxurious villa stuffed with quality art
361750502.author: a TripAdvisor user
361750502.reviewBody: The villa was closed but after politely knocking at the door we were allowed to marvel at the extensive contemporary Mexican art collection of millionaire couple John and Dorianne Venator. Behind a sober restored facade lies ha heaven of peace, wealth and art in which even the luxury bathrooms of the guest accomodations are stuffed with sculptures, paintings and other objects. Truly dazzling especially compared to the down to earth scenario outside this millionaires habitat. Yes, \'intoxicating\' to just for a moment be able to join \'the smell of the roses\'...

361636442.name: The house and the art collection are a fantasy
361636442.author: a TripAdvisor user
361636442.reviewBody:
Rich collection of art in a dream house. It is a good way to get familiar with different sort of arts from different Mexican cities. 
The tour guide is very good. The tour is fast and interesting.  
And it is only based on donations at the end. 
Make sure to be there on time for the tour, we were there at 10 am.

361269885.name: A must see in Valladolid
361269885.author: a TripAdvisor user
361269885.reviewBody: Fantastic and unique Mexican folk art collection and house tour.  The house itself is amazing.  Well worth the time, and all proceeds go to local charity.

361027609.name: Dont miss it
361027609.author: a TripAdvisor user
361027609.reviewBody: One of the highlights of Vallodolid. This is a private home and you donate about 5 bucks to charity. show up at 10 am for a tour or call the number on the door to arrange one. We came at about 1015 the tour started so they told us to come back at noon for another tour. We were the only ones. The guide was very knowledgable. Cool Folk art from all over Mexico in a lovely home....

360686452.name: top notch
360686452.author: a TripAdvisor user
360686452.reviewBody: guided tour was a blast, our group was mostly english speaking so the guide gave a very detailed tour in english. couldnt fault it at all. the house is beautiful and all of the folk art stunning. particularly liked the kitchen, dining and living space that finished the tour. highly recommended.

359791770.name: An outstanding highlight in our three week holiday
359791770.author: a TripAdvisor user
359791770.reviewBody:
Be there on time at 10 o clock because latecomers may not get in. It is really worth being punctual because the guided walk around this wonderful house and collection of modern Mexican art is really mind-blowing. In every room the guide/curator will tell a tale of the artist, or one or two pieces, and you want to yell "but what about this, and this, and this….?" There is so much to take in. Remember, this is a private house, not a gallery. What dedication they have made to their collection. It really was a highlight in a wonderful Mexican three weeks.

Just one thing, probably not the place for young children…..not unfriendly, but so much precious art at all levels. 

The owner does not charge for this wonderful experience, but does ask for a donation to local children's hospitals and other local charities. Give generously. You would easily pay US$50 a head to see this in a gallery in New York or London…so don't be mean.

359145211.name: Marvellous Home-Museum
359145211.author: a TripAdvisor user
359145211.reviewBody: This family home owned by an American couple is filled with really amazing pieces of Mexican art and was one of the highlights of my visit to Valladolid. The one-hour guided tour that you need to take is a little rushed, but I would highly recommend stopping by the house.

358759080.name: Best surprise ever
358759080.author: a TripAdvisor user
358759080.reviewBody: My friend and I were walking around the city and just stumbled on this beautiful house. We noticed there were tours and came back the next day.  It is filled with such wonderful folk art  and the people are so friendly.

358320248.name: Charming
358320248.author: a TripAdvisor user
358320248.reviewBody: The casa is beautiful and rich in arts and culture. Wherever you look, there\'s something interesting to grasp your attention. It is definitely worth a visit of you are in Valladolid. The entrance is free, but they ask for donations, which go for various kid\'s foundations. There are guided tours at 10am every day, which I recommend. The guide explains the main pieces of arts, and the history of the house, which is quite interesting. It is a must!!

357961475.name: A wonderful Experience
357961475.author: a TripAdvisor user
357961475.reviewBody: Could not believe this place. The collection was absolutely remarkable as was the restoration of this 400 year old house! The pieces ,(over 3000) collected by this couple are all of museum quality and many made by commission. It was hard to believe so many beautiful objects could be brought together. The building that the couple use as their house was the perfect foil for the collection. As we walked through the rooms with our excellent English speaking guide Fredy he was an absolute fountain of knowledge on every piece. Do not miss this place in Valladolid!

357887689.name: Beautiful house with nice staff
357887689.author: a TripAdvisor user
357887689.reviewBody: We visited the Casa de Venados and had a very nice guide who shows us around the beautiful house. The house is no conventional gallery but a private house owned by an American who retired to Mexico.\n\nIt has all different folk arts and is pretty interesting

356997914.name: Advise making your plans to visit in advance
356997914.author: a TripAdvisor user
356997914.reviewBody: This is a smaller "museum" and seems to be more informally run.  After reading the excellent reviews, we tried to visit this museum at 2pm on a Tuesday afternoon but it was closed.  Someone was there who told us to come back the following morning around 10am, but we were leaving town the next day.  He said they were closed all that afternoon (and maybe most afternoons???).  If you are interested, I guess you need to make reservations and/or plans in advance?  The hours weren\'t clearly posted on the front.  As a result, we were never able to visit.

356652125.name: Do not miss this
356652125.author: a TripAdvisor user
356652125.reviewBody: The most generous couple to open their wonderful home and display of art. I would like to visit with each visit to Mexico. My wife  agrees worth every second  to visit, even if you do not love art you will after a visit. Mara villas !  The staff have so much knowledue and polite and a true passion for this collection. Please do not miss.

356296671.name: A must see in Valladolid
356296671.author: a TripAdvisor user
356296671.reviewBody: Amazing privately owned collection of Mexican folk art set in an American couples private house - great experience as you get an informative tour and introduction to Mexican art.

356092116.name: Fantastico!
356092116.author: a TripAdvisor user
356092116.reviewBody: Do visit Casa de los Venados, especially if you like Mexican folk art. So much to look at in every corner, nook, and cranny. So wonderful of the owners of this house to allow people into their home and to share their 40 years of collection!

355859077.name: Wow.....beautiful and so interesting.
355859077.author: a TripAdvisor user
355859077.reviewBody: We went to Valladolid solely for the purpose of visiting Casa de lots Venados and we were not disappointed. John and Dorianne were there to answer any questions and John spent some time telling us about their dream and how all the revenue from tourists like us go to help local projects in Vallodolid. The design of the Casa is beautiful and the artifacts are a visual feast.

355736620.name: Amazing collection of Mexican Folk Art!
355736620.author: a TripAdvisor user
355736620.reviewBody: We have visited three times now and love taking family and friends to see this wonderful collection that is presented in the nicest way...a personal residence.

354908852.name: Excellent collection
354908852.author: a TripAdvisor user
354908852.reviewBody: Thousands of works of Mexican folk art, housed in the home of their gracious owners.  Knowledgeable English and Spanish-speaking tour guides offer info about the art, the home and its renovation.  Well worth a visit!

354886039.name: Remarkable
354886039.author: a TripAdvisor user
354886039.reviewBody: The largest and most varied collection of Mexican folk art I\'ve ever seen, in the most relaxed and unique setting imaginable... a beautifully restored historic house in central Valladolid. Not a museum, but a private living space shared with incredible generosity by the owners. Must see.

354455620.name: ALMOST TOO MUCH
354455620.author: a TripAdvisor user
354455620.reviewBody:
In a beautifully renovated colonial house a treasure is to be found, 3,000 pieces of Mexican folk art pieces. Although the house is big (1,800 squared meters), it is too small to contain such a quantity of art objects. From every point of view it is a museum, and just as a museum does not expose all its collections all at once, Mrs. and Mr. Venado should consider thinning out so one could appreciate better every piece of art. Every centimetre of every wall is filled with paintings, every room is cluttered with furniture.
Less is More. Particularly with such valuable and beautiful objects of art.
On a personal note I will add that it is regretful that they do not fancy the art of weaving, as it is such an inherent part of the Mexican folk culture.

354085903.name: Fantasy House
354085903.author: a TripAdvisor user
354085903.reviewBody: A must-see attraction.  Restored hacienda overflowing with beautiful, unique crafts/art work collected by American owner from around. Entry by donation that goes to help local poor.

353938166.name: Truly amazing
353938166.author: a TripAdvisor user
353938166.reviewBody: This is a stunning, privately owned house. The guide who showed us round was excellent and helped to make it a wonderful experience. The guided tour round the house is actually free and you are asked to make a donation of 80 pesos per person, all of which goes to local charities. Most of the pieces of folk art were stunning commissioned pieces and the Casa was certainly one of the highlights of our 7 week trip to Mexico. If you are in Valladolid this place is a must. You win and so do local charities - what more could you want from a visit!

353824453.name: Casa de los Venados a must see!
353824453.author: a TripAdvisor user
353824453.reviewBody:
This is not a museum it’s a private tour of a private art collector's home of Mexican folk art. It’s located on Calle 40 just one block from the main square (Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton). 
Wall to wall art, over 3000 Mexican Folk Art pieces, There is beautiful art everywhere you look. Lovingly arranged. Every room even the restrooms are stuffed with artwork from around Mexico. The home owner John and his wife are very generous with opening up their home to the public.  There are very few rooms that are off limit to the tour.
Tours are once a day at 10am (or by appointment) last for about 1 hour.  We were lucky we just stumbled upon this place and their scheduled appointment was a no show so we took their place. Charge: 80 pesos or $5 USD donation that goes to local charities. They offer English and Spanish tours.  Our tour guild Arnaldo was wonderful very knowledgeable. Explains the background and history of the different pieces of art.  If you’re lucky as we were Maya (home owner’s schnauzer dog) may join your tour.   
This is a must see on your trip to Valladolid!

353358267.name: What an amazing collection!
353358267.author: a TripAdvisor user
353358267.reviewBody: This private home is most generously opened for tours at 10am everyday... and contributions from visitors are given to charity. The collection of art & artifacts is astonishing, as is the generosity of its owners. You must see it to believe it!

353310564.name: Incredible Private Collection of Mexican Folk Art
353310564.author: a TripAdvisor user
353310564.reviewBody: Not so much a museum as much as a private tour of an private art collector\'s home. This is the greatest single collect of Mexican folk art I have ever seen. The tour starts at ten am daily and was around an hour and a half long. Every room (even the restrooms) in this giant house is stuffed with artwork from around Mexico. There are guest rooms each with their own theme such as a Frida Kahlo room and a Valladolid room. The house is larger than you ever imagine when your first walk in and this trip will be the artistic highlight of any trip to the Yucatan.

353091373.name: Incredible Folkart
353091373.author: a TripAdvisor user
353091373.reviewBody: My cousin first told me about this place so of course we went. We had a normal our and after the tour we were introduced to John the owner. Much to our delight he took us around for another tour this time narrated by him. It was fantastic. Both meeting John and seeing his place is definitely worth it. \n\nWe have been back since to an event promoting the Englsh/Spanish Library and was able to see thing we had missed earlier. My other cousin is coming in a few days and this is definitely on the to do list.

352503342.name: Excellent Collection of Mexican Folk Art
352503342.author: a TripAdvisor user
352503342.reviewBody: I was originally skeptical about visiting, but I\'m very glad my boyfriend convinced me to go. There is beautiful art everywhere you look. The tour guides explain the background and history of the different pieces of art. Very informative!

350505011.name: An interesting place!
350505011.author: a TripAdvisor user
350505011.reviewBody: If you like historic houses and Mexican folk art, this is the place for you! The guided tour begins by ringing the doorbell at 10 am.  When answered you are invited in and a guide walks you thru, explaining the art and house. An interesting morning!

349941555.name: Huge Collection of Folk Art
349941555.author: a TripAdvisor user
349941555.reviewBody: At first I thought that this would be a touristy thing to do, which I try to stay away from. I had heard positive reviews and read about it here on trip advisor and so thought I would give it a try. I arrived at 9:30 for the 10:00 tour and waited out front. 15 minutes early would have been enough. They offered separate English and Spanish tours. John Venator, one of the owners greeted us during the tour and told us that the donations collected from these tours go towards local programs in Valladolid. I really enjoyed myself. Amazing pieces and an amazing home. I took pictures but best to go to the website at: casadelosvenados.com.

349832962.name: Fascinating art in a spectacularly restored colonial house.
349832962.author: a TripAdvisor user
349832962.reviewBody: An extraordinarily diverse collection of contemporary Mexican pieces just steps from the main square.

349675467.name: Wall to wall folk art!
349675467.author: a TripAdvisor user
