349675467.reviewBody: Our tour lasted an hour and our guide took us through most of the first floor of this enormous Casona and explained the origins, authors, themes and history of many of the pieces in the collection.    There was so much to view, it will take us several more visits to even begin to absorb this vastly varied and increasingly expanding collection.  It was fascinating, don\'t miss it!

349154587.name: Stunning Private Collection
349154587.author: a TripAdvisor user
349154587.reviewBody: Absolutely amazing private collection of over 3000 Mexican Folk Art pieces. Stunning. We were greater by the owner of the beautiful home and art collection who provides guided tours through rooms filled with Mexican folk art from all across Mexico. Saying the collection and home are impressive is an understatement. Daily entry and tour at 10am only. Bring your camera. Do not miss this on your next trip to Vallodolid .

348228901.name: What a collection!
348228901.author: a TripAdvisor user
348228901.reviewBody: More and better mexican folk art then you\'ve seen anywhere. Well worth going to Valladolid just to see this collection.  The city has many charms worth visiting (we\'ve gone twice, overnight both times) but Casa de los Venados is the top of the list.  Only open for tours once a day at 10am (or by appointment), you will be stunned at the breath and beauty of this private collection.  The owners donate all donations to local charities and live in the casa.

347927558.name: Amazing home and art
347927558.author: a TripAdvisor user
347927558.reviewBody: We spent about 1 to 2 hours on the tour.  Very interesting and the tour guide was full of information.  It is only open once a day for tours at 10 am.

347730013.name: absolutely magnificant and well worth seeing over and over again.
347730013.author: a TripAdvisor user
347730013.reviewBody: well worth the time and effort to see this has been our third visit. We live in Cancun and always visit the site when we have guests

347334273.name: Loved it!
347334273.author: a TripAdvisor user
347334273.reviewBody: My travel group, Project World School, visited Casa de Los Venados yesterday during our time in Valladolid. We absolutely adored it! Our guides were extremely knowledgable and the owners were also incredible to talk to. The collection itself is beyond impressive and I 100% recommend this as a place to visit in your time in Valladolid.

347203005.name: Best thing to see in Valladolid
347203005.author: a TripAdvisor user
347203005.reviewBody: Fine collection of Mexican folk art housed in the superbly renovated 17th century hacienda of John and Dorianne Venator.  Outstanding art in a superb setting.  Our guide, Arnaldo, was excellent.  Be there earlier than the 10 AM tour start time.  Donation of at least 80 pesos goes to charitable institutions in Valladolid. Don\'t miss this.

347010606.name: Remarkable!
347010606.author: a TripAdvisor user
347010606.reviewBody: We got there at five to ten in the morning and there were already about 20 people inside waiting for the tour. They broke the ultimately 35 -40 people into 2 groups. Our tour guide was the owner of the house and collection and what a treat it was to hear his stories about the various marvellous treasures in the house. It is a dazzling place full of extraordinary colour and energy. The house and renos are fabulous but it\'s the art that blows you away. Heart breaking, hilarious, visionary, domestic and wild. Look for the little details in every room. Best thing was that I came away with a renewed appreciation for folk art in general and the astonishing legacy of the  Mexican variety.

346741855.name: Stunningly beautiful
346741855.author: a TripAdvisor user
346741855.reviewBody: This house has been renovated to an exceptionally high standard, the collection of Mexican artefacts is just amazing, we were totally in awe of what the owners have achieved here. And the fact that there willing to do daily tours for a 90pesco donation. If your going to Valladolid, do visit. Tours start 10am. A must see, you will love it as much as us.

345265301.name: A must see in Valladolid
345265301.author: a TripAdvisor user
345265301.reviewBody: Arrive early for the 10 am tour which can be in english or spanish. This private folk art collection is exceptional and represents all areas of Mexico. This is a private home (18000 sq ft) and as exceptional as the art.

345060248.name: Fabulous!!
345060248.author: a TripAdvisor user
345060248.reviewBody: Words can not describe this wonderful house/museum.The Mexican art has been gathered from all overMexico by an American couple wh have restored the house.One should not ever go to Valldolid  without visiting.  We had an English speaking tour. It started at 10a.m. ENJOY!!

344585468.name: Amazing private folk art collection, available for visiting
344585468.author: a TripAdvisor user
344585468.reviewBody: The owners generously share their collection with visitors (ideally by appointment, but also those who show up at 10 am)

344242356.name: Amazing site, well worth a vist
344242356.author: a TripAdvisor user
344242356.reviewBody: This is an amazing collection of Mexican folk art, housed in a beautiful renovated house just off the main square in Valladolid. The guided tour (daily at 10am sharp) lasts around an hour and gives a really good overview of the art and other features of the house. Every room is full of fascinating pieces - paintings, sculptures, photos and tapestries, among other pieces. We left very envious of the owners\' guests, who get to stay in the amazing guest suites and use the spectacular pool! \n\nWas definitely a highlight of our stay in Valladolid.

343364686.name: Fascinating and huge art collection!
343364686.author: a TripAdvisor user
343364686.reviewBody: This was one of the two highlights of our recent Yucatan trip! Far exceeded our expectations. Beautiful home and fantastic art collection. The owners are most gracious to share this with the public in return for a modest donation that they forward to charities.

343204814.name: Awesome
343204814.author: a TripAdvisor user
343204814.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this tour.  Beautiful art, beautiful house and charming proprietor.  And proceeds go to charity...

342483228.name: Beautiful art collection
342483228.author: a TripAdvisor user
342483228.reviewBody: I enjoyed visiting this house because it has beautiful and well crafted art pieces, amaizing colours and variety of art work to endulge your eyes and stimulate your senses.  It is a private house and it opens only one hour a day from 10-11 am. Need to check if open on the weekends. The tour was in English, I booked for the Spanish tour but because I was the only one the tour guide declined, that was disappointing however the experience was superb and a lot of the art pieces speak for themselves! .

342478934.name: One of the best museums in Mexico
342478934.author: a TripAdvisor user
342478934.reviewBody: We live in Mexico and have been to many museums, but this is one of the very best.  It is a private collection of over 3000 pieces of folk art.  There are guided tours in Enlighten and Spanish.  The owners ask for an 80 peso or $5 donation and all money goes back to local charities.  Photography is allowed, so be sure to bring your best camera.  Call a day ahead to find out what time the tours will be given.  On the day we went, the only admittance times were at 10 AM and 12 PM. The tour took about 1.5 hours.  This is a "don\'t miss" for visitors and citizens alike.

342176726.name: House envy
342176726.author: a TripAdvisor user
342176726.reviewBody: The owners of this private home give the public a peek, requesting a donation of 80 pesos which they use for public good.  They have a fantastic collection of Mexican folk art, some 3000 pieces.  As interesting as the art is the house itself.  These folks bought it in ruins and completely renovated it.  It would be worth a quick visit to see their renovation if there were no art involved.

341972169.name: Amazing collection of art!
341972169.author: a TripAdvisor user
341972169.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this private collection tour!  Easily one of the most memorable parts of our trip to Valladolid.  The home is incredible on its own with gorgeous courtyards.  And the art - I\'d go back to Valladolid just to tour this home again!

341010437.name: Not to be missed!
341010437.author: a TripAdvisor user
341010437.reviewBody: This art collection is massive and absolutely fabulous, and the estate itself is an impressive work of art. The tours are for charity, and ours was led by a lovely and knowledgeable guide, super interesting and inspiring! All tours start at 10am, and run ~1 hour, but apparently if you get in touch they can also do 2pm tours. Thanks again for the wonderful visit!

340660218.name: beautiful & interesting
340660218.author: a TripAdvisor user
340660218.reviewBody: This house and the art that the owners filled(!) It with will blir your mind. Just beautiful & interesting. Super skilled tour guide with excellent english will tell you all you want to know. And be sure to say hi to Mija(?), the sweet little house schnauzer that welcomed us by the door : ) 10 am is the time and its free Except for the option of a donation, and the money goes to the community. Also here i finally found nice postcards :)) i loved everything, thank you for this experience

340108046.name: 10 stars!!
340108046.author: a TripAdvisor user
340108046.reviewBody: Wow! we arrived at 10:40 and quickly joined the one tour generously offered by the owner of this home. He opens his doors daily to view his amazing collection of Mexican folk art.From the Frida to the Diego room, the pools, the indicate bone and copper carvings, this place blew my mind. Do not miss! You do not have to be an art lover to appreciate the love and care this family has put into this place.. I really feel lucky to have seen inside these walls. The hand painted chairs, the place is definitely a museum but if feels loved and lived in, bravo!

339179001.name: Must see amazing collection of Mexican artwork!
339179001.author: a TripAdvisor user
339179001.reviewBody: We found this tour, the morning we were leaving Valladolid & wished we would have done the tour before setting off to explore the area. Spectacular collection in a private home. If you love the artisans of Mexico, you must visit! Also a quick education to artwork of the area. Thank you Venados for  your dedication and passion for the collecting magnificent art & crafts of the lovely people of Mexico.\nMy dream home!

338152964.name: Incredible private collection of Mexican Art.
338152964.author: a TripAdvisor user
338152964.reviewBody:
This was the highlight of our 2 week trip to Mexico for me. 
What an amazing collection of every kind of Mexican folk art.
The building housing the collection has been beautifully renovated. The guided tour is free and the owner of the collection just asks for a donation which goes to a local charity.
Do not miss this place if you visit Valladolid.

336974314.name: Una casa excepcional !! A wonderful house.
336974314.author: a TripAdvisor user
336974314.reviewBody: Es una casa decorada con artesanias 100% mexicanas, conoces la mayoria de las artesanias de Mexico en una hora mas o menos, una visita guiada y el costo es un donativo al gusto, nos atendieron los guias muy bien, apto para gente que gusta de la artesania Mexicana.\n\nIt\u2019s a house with 100% Mexican decoration, you can see must of the handcrafts from Mexican States in an hour or more, the guides are very polite and gentle, the cost is a symbolic donation, if you like or want to learn about Mexican art you must visit it.

336920417.name: Prearranged day/time of tour personally with owner; was turned away at door because owners were hungover.
336920417.author: a TripAdvisor user
336920417.reviewBody:
This was a laughably horrible experience for our family.  We planned our two-week Mexico itinerary around visiting Casa de los Venados, having not had a chance to visit on our last stay in Valladolid 2 years ago.  We emailed John, the owner, five days in advance to confirm whether they would be open on January 1st, our only full day in town.  If they planned to be closed for New Year's Day, we would have arrived earlier on the 31st in order to ensure we could visit, or skipped Valladolid altogether, having otherwise explored it thoroughly during a previous 5 day visit.  John's response: 

Yes...1 pm on January 1st would work well for a tour

John

----------------------------------
John Venator
Casa de los Venados
Centro Historico
Calle 40, # 204
Valladolid, Yucatan
C.P. 97780
MEXICO

After a brief back and forth, I emailed him on Dec. 30th confirming that 1:00 pm on the 1st would be perfect.

We set aside our only full day in Valladolid to visit Casa de los Venados, and arrived five minutes ahead of our 1:00 tour  When we rang the bell, an employee answered and said that there were no guides available.  I informed her, in Spanish, that we had a private tour booked with the owner.  A moment later, another employee came to the door and said that there would be no more tours that day (one was just finishing; the guests were still inside), because the owners weren't feeling well after the previous night's New Years Eve revelry.  I explained that we had come to Valladolid expressly to visit the collection, and that we were leaving early the following morning (5:00 a.m.) to return to the States.  No dice.

We were speechless.  The owner himself arranges a private tour for a family of four, who then travel to Valladolid just to see his collection, and we are turned away with no tour and nary an apology because the owners are hungover?  I thought this was unconscionable.  At the very least, John should have emailed us that morning and invited us to join an earlier tour.  We will likely not be back to Valladolid, and so have probably missed our chance to enjoy his undoubtedly amazing collection.  The thoughtlessness and callousness with which our family was treated was, frankly, outrageous.

336259130.name: Who would have thought? Extraordinary Mexican folk art in a tour of a private residence
336259130.author: a TripAdvisor user
336259130.reviewBody:
An American expat technology executive and his wife buy and restore a treasured hacienda next to the town square in the little town of Valladolid, fill it with probably the largest collection of Mexican folk art in the world and then open the residence to anyone for tours at 10a and 2p every day (call ahead to check lest you be disappointed - we got there at 10:30a and had to come back) for nothing more than a suggested donation (which goes to local charities. 

The traditional architecture itself is amazing with some interesting touches (like a glass bottomed bridge over the pool) but it is the folk art collection that will knock your socks off. The guides are part of the staff and the couple was there and chatted with us the day of our tour as we walked through their personal residence. 

Don't miss this stop. And word has it that the entire complex with the art will be willed to the town in perpetuity.  I want to invited to dinner there and maybe stay in one of the many guest rooms. Maybe one of the ones with the indoor and outdoor shower and private veranda;-). 

Good to combine with a trip to the local public ruins or the Ek Balam ruins.

335835062.name: Outstanding collection of folk art
335835062.author: a TripAdvisor user
335835062.reviewBody:
We did this tour not knowing what to expect.  We were amply rewarded for our curiosity.

The collection of folk art was really amazing for both its quality and extent.  The house also is pretty amazing.

If you have even a remote interest in folk art this tour is a feast!

335469164.name: Incredible art collection!
335469164.author: a TripAdvisor user
335469164.reviewBody: This is definitely worth checking out.  It is an amazing collection of folk art and it is in a private home.  We met the owners and they are wonderful people, doing good philanthropic work in Mexico.  It opens at 10am and they had 2 tours (one in English and one in Spanish).  Our tour latest about an hour. You are not pressured to give a contribution (entry is free), but you will want to when you are finished seeing all the incredible art pieces.

333320506.name: Beautiful collection of Mexican folk art
333320506.author: a TripAdvisor user
333320506.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite experiences in Valladolid! Definitely worth checking out all the amazing folk art.

333073086.name: Go to casa los venados!
333073086.author: a TripAdvisor user
333073086.reviewBody: Best private collection I have seen. Lovely to see traditional folk art that is being made by contemporary artists. The collector has a great eye and the works are lovely seen in the setting of this magnificent home. Must see!

331862986.name: I was surprised that it\'s really worth it!
331862986.author: a TripAdvisor user
331862986.reviewBody:
When I saw this was the nr 1 rated attraction in Valladolid I thought the owners would make a lot of pressure for the visitors to write reviews... but although the fact that the ticket price is given to charity might be the motivation of some of the "excellent" reviews, the truth is that this visit is REALLY worth it. (and no, they don't push you to write reviews :))

The explanations are really great, and even if you don't really like folk art, by the end of the visit you develop at least an interest in it.  John and Dorianne have collected such a variety of pieces that for sure some of them speak to you. 

The tour takes around 1,5 hours and for 80 pesos.

331527552.name: Mexican Folk art - what an unbelieveable collection and home!
331527552.author: a TripAdvisor user
331527552.reviewBody: We found this as the top attraction to visit in Valladolid.  The home of John and Dorianne Venator where over 3000 Mexican Folk Art pieces are displayed in their amazing home every day at 10a.m. Guided by Arnaldo!  The tour takes about 45min - 1 hour and a donation of 80 pesos is suggested, which goes directly to charity.  Well worth a visit.

330565020.name: What a trip!
330565020.author: a TripAdvisor user
330565020.reviewBody: Mr. Venados was gracious to allow us to visit at a non-regular hour because we could not make it to the 10 AM tour.  We were absolutely amazed by the quality of the collections and the architecture of this place.  We greatly appreciate their generosity in opening their door for the rest of us.

330417467.name: A must see if you\'re into contemporary Mexican "folk" art
330417467.author: a TripAdvisor user
330417467.reviewBody: The highlight of our time in Valladolid. You buzz the door - once! - at 10 am for the tour. Two hours of magic. You can go crazy with photographs - or just be simply gobsmacked by the stunning originality and execution of all these artists. If skeletons and their kin can be whimsically breathtaking, this is their little Taj Majal.

328461156.name: Great place to visit
328461156.author: a TripAdvisor user
328461156.reviewBody: This house is a must see for anyone staying in Valladolid. The Mexican folk art collected by the owner across his lifetime is incredible and the house was stunning. Tours lasted one hour and we\'re very informative. It\'s also nice that all the money given for the tour is donated to charity.

327627789.name: Quirky amazing house - MUST SEE
327627789.author: a TripAdvisor user
327627789.reviewBody:
This is a must see in Valladolid! Visit every morning at 10am, we were the only people so was like a private tour. 
The amount of pieces of art is amazing and it's also very interesting  to understand the Mayan and Mexican culture.
We met the owner, this is not a museum, it's an actual house where people live which makes it even more fascinating! Thanks for opening your own house to people!

326576288.name: Congratulations, great family museum
326576288.author: a TripAdvisor user
326576288.reviewBody: We visited Casa de los Venados this last November.  We had visited few other family owned house-museums in Mexico (like the Museum Atotonilco) and were expecting something of similar characteristics.  This time we found something else:  a very well organized collection of handicrafts and Mexican artifacts that besides their variety, do not clash with the house ambiance.  Also the pieces are not for sale and all contributions go to social programs.  I am very pleased we stop here and I heavily recommend this spot in beautiful Valladolid.

325432452.name: Truly something to do in Valladolid!
325432452.author: a TripAdvisor user
325432452.reviewBody: This place in Valladolid is stonishing. Its set up by US\'-couple that found it important to show the unique culture of Mexico and only the house is super amazing and this place you have to visit!

324897346.name: Amazing place! I want the owner to adopt me so I can live there!
324897346.author: a TripAdvisor user
324897346.reviewBody:
I got there twenty minutes before opening time (10am) because the mandatory RSVP suggested that they run on a rigid schedule. When I got there, I was the only one, and they kindly asked that I wait until a large organized group showed up to begin the tour around the mansion.

After waiting nearly 45 minutes, with the large group still absent, the home's owner personally greeted me and apologized profusely for the delay. Still the only one there, I had my own guide and the place to myself more or less, and in retrospect was very grateful and wouldn't have it any other way! 

The wait, although not anticipated or desired, was worth it, as the home was astounding! The tour guide was professional, polite, knowledgable and well-informed. He said the typical tour lasts about one hour. I think I ended up staying for 1.5 - 2 hours because I kept taking photos and asking lots of questions.

This aesthetic may not appeal to everyone (it certainly does to me, I felt I had died and gone to heaven, and heaven was this amazing Valladolid house filled with awesome arts and crafts!!), however, I still think anyone would be intrigued and awed by the scale and design of this home. The five different guest quarters each have their own thoughtfully decorated design scheme, the pool area is to die for, and the dining room table with the custom painted chairs is magnificent. 

My favorite pieces are the Frida, Diego, Catrina wooden bench in the foyer, and the intricately painted wooden skulls in the living room bookshelf. 

The center courtyard is so warm and inviting, I could easily imagine this being an excellent bed and breakfast or lovely venue for a wedding. 

The owner, John, was welcoming and gracious. I loved the fact that all proceeds from the tours go to benefit the community. In the future, it would be wonderful if he published a catalogue of all the amazing pieces in his collection -- I would most certainly buy it. They are all intricate, detailed, and labor intensive pieces, worthy of being seen by all.

323649582.name: Don\'t miss this place!
323649582.author: a TripAdvisor user
323649582.reviewBody: You don\'t have to be an art lover to appreciate this incredible collection of Mexican folk art.  The owners are gracious hosts, and ask for only a $5 donation which all proceeds from the casa go to local charity.   It is a city treasure.  Tours are at 10AM, every day.

319445447.name: Loved every minute.....and every minute detail!!
319445447.author: a TripAdvisor user
319445447.reviewBody: We found the location easily and were warmly welcomed by our guide, Fredy.  The building has been lovingly renovated into a private home, reception room and a couple of suites available for booking.  It houses the most amazing collection of over 3,000 whimsical, quirky artefacts.   We were shown right through the house which is around 18,000m2.  Every room boasts original paintings, sculptures, ceramics, furniture bringing together a collection started around 40 years ago.  John and Doriane are extremely generous to open their home and collection to the public and we were grateful for their generosity.

316367545.name: Fantastic!
316367545.author: a TripAdvisor user
316367545.reviewBody: This place is fantastic! Possibly one of the best museums in all of Mexico. Not only are the art works amazing, but the house itself is also wonderful to see. A must-see in Valladolid.

315107913.name: There\'s no way to give this place anything other than 5 stars. It\'s amazing.
315107913.author: a TripAdvisor user
315107913.reviewBody: The people that are behind Casa del los Venados must be the most amazing people. They bought a crumbling hacienda, completely recreated it, added beautiful architectural elements and filled it with astoundingly beautiful Mexico folk art.  Understand that this is their home, and they hope their home every day to visitors, who pay a very small fee to see what has to be the most amazing folk art collection in existence. They then donate the money raised to local nonprofits.  \n\nThe tour of the home is a "don\'t miss" experience - this alone is worth a special trip to visit the city.

309536386.name: Things!!!!
309536386.author: a TripAdvisor user
309536386.reviewBody: Amazing place.  It\'s such a shame the tour isn\'t a little bit longer as the house is so crammed with art so you could spend ages there.  I would definitely go back.  Make sure you go,  it\'s only open for an hour everyday at 10am and the entry fee goes to local good causes.

305961750.name: Wordeful private home to be visited absolutely
305961750.author: a TripAdvisor user
305961750.reviewBody:
Casa de los Venados is a beautiful private colonial house in Villadolid, renovated by the two American owners with the help of a famous architect.

The house in itself is a beauty,  most of it is open to the public for a guided tour.

The house contains over 3000  objects of Mexican arts, collected by John and Dorian during their lives: certainly some pieces are by famous artists, but plenty of objects are simple crafts you can find on the village markets.

The wonder of all this is all these hundreds of objects being put together in such a balanced and cahotic manner that the result is just amazing.

Just to confirm that everything is real, Mia, the owners' dog, is there to welcome you (the owners were not in town when we visited).

Congratulations to John and Dorian! i would have loved to spend one night in one the guests' rooms! I would have cooked a real Italian dinnner for them to pay back for my stay!

301797810.name: One highlight of the Yucatan Peninsula!
301797810.author: a TripAdvisor user
301797810.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite things in the Yucatan. This private home is opened up every day at 10am for a private tour. The gorgeous collection of Mexican folk art is unsurpassed and the home itself is phenomenal. Its definitely worth the visit!!!

301416734.name: Fantabulous!
301416734.author: a TripAdvisor user
301416734.reviewBody: Oh my goodness, we\'ve never seen anything quite like this before. Don\'t want to say too much to spoil it for people but definitely a must-see for culture. It\'s amazing what the family has done to the place. The staff members are great!

300951663.name: Amazing Mexican Folk Art
300951663.author: a TripAdvisor user
300951663.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite cities and experiences in Mexico. The owner is a Mexican Folk Art collector and ended up turning his house into a museum that you can visit. He donates the proceeds to local charities. Our guide was really knowledgable and friendly. If you like Mexican Folk art this is a must see!!

297051705.name: Mexican Folk Art Extravaganza
297051705.author: a TripAdvisor user
297051705.reviewBody: We visited La Casa de los Venados yesterday as it came highly recommended. We were not dissapointed, we spent a fantastic couple of hours admiring John and Dorianne\'s impressive collection of art. The guide was excellent and seemed enthused by his work. The visit is free however we ended up leaving more than we would for an ordinary museum as the money is given to charitable causes. Keep up the good work.

296980087.name: Amazing!!!!
296980087.author: a TripAdvisor user
296980087.reviewBody: Incredible place to visit!!!!!! You do have to be there punctual at 10 but it is worth it!! A personal museum of popular Mexican art!!!

296959417.name: One of the best pop Mexican art in Mexico
296959417.author: a TripAdvisor user
296959417.reviewBody: Is a must see if you come to Valladolid, the house is amazing and the art is unbelievable.\n\nThe pool area is just to cool and you will enjoy the visit.

295982719.name: Great tour
295982719.author: a TripAdvisor user
295982719.reviewBody: Really interesting tour. Wide variety of folk art on show that helps to illustrate local Mexican culture.

295080959.name: Must see! Amazing! Incre\u00edble!
295080959.author: a TripAdvisor user
295080959.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I took a tour through this house today and it was great. The art is amazing. The guide who showed us around was very knowledgable and we really loved it. You don\'t have to be a crazy art buff either to enjoy although if you are you may die of pleasure.\nMexican folk art is loud and cool and interesting and fun. If you\'re not an art fiend this tour will definitely start an interest in Mexican folk art at least.\nThe only cost is a donation to charity.

294669964.name: Beautiful!
294669964.author: a TripAdvisor user
294669964.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the tour of this place. The house was filled with amazing artifacts and items from around Mexico. We could have sent the entire day! Highly recommend. Thanks to the owners for opening up their home for tours.

294432332.name: A must visit in Valladolid
294432332.author: a TripAdvisor user
294432332.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to visit this casa today. John opens his home at 10am for a guided tour which lasts an hour. The art is amazing and the house has made me incredibly jealous! Make sure you include this in your trip! All donations go to charity too, which is an added bonus!

293152872.name: Beautiful Mexican Art
293152872.author: a TripAdvisor user
293152872.reviewBody: Beautiful home owned by Mr. Venator.  He shares the artwork by opening his home as a museum every morning at 10 a.m.  Thank you for sharing your collection.

290764747.name: Fantastic
290764747.author: a TripAdvisor user
290764747.reviewBody: This was one of the highlights of our trip - beautiful art in a stunning house. Thanks to John for opening up his home every day and for channelling visitors\' donations back to the local community.

290500475.name: Casa de los Vanados is Excellentnt
290500475.author: a TripAdvisor user
290500475.reviewBody: I was enthralled from the beginning to the end. The house is beautiful and the Mayan art is stunning. The tour is very informative with explanations of the art and where it came from. I took a day trip Akumal to Valladolid to see all the churches and was so glad i stopped to see this beautiful house. If your up this way you must stop and see this and \nthe city. I guarantee you wont regret it. There are many things to do in this beautiful colonial city and the people are so friendly.

288691597.name: Must see in Valladolid
288691597.author: a TripAdvisor user
288691597.reviewBody: Fascinating collection of wonderful folk art of Mexico in a delightful and creative house. A must see in Vallodolid!

288264138.name: Amazing Art
288264138.author: a TripAdvisor user
288264138.reviewBody: I love Mexican Folk Art and really appreciate how the owners opened their home to visitors to enjoy their impressive collection. I snuck away from my family (and kids) to visit Casa delos Venados - I don\'t recommend bringing children for the tour.

287940009.name: Wonderful Visit!
287940009.author: a TripAdvisor user
287940009.reviewBody:
The home is truly a gem and a wonderful way to experience a vast collection of Mexican folk art.  We were greeted by woman who immediately took us in and escorted us to a tour guide who provided us with a well-rounded explanation of the history, architecture, and collection of art.   

Located on a street amongst beautiful pastel facades.  It does not require much time and one can enjoy a quick visit.  Tours were available in English and Spanish.  No entry fee but donations are welcomed.  

While John and Dorianne, the owners, were not present, we felt like we were welcome guests in their beautifully restored home.  They have preserved the home and filled it with beautiful art work to share with the world.  I'm fascinated the gracious owners share their beautiful home and art with visitors and highly recommend a visit!  A true contribution to this lovely city.

287930146.name: Best Folk Art Collection
287930146.author: a TripAdvisor user
287930146.reviewBody: Amazing display of Mexican Art in a tastefully restored and preserved colonial mansion. Tours are once a day.

287744474.name: Absolutely amazing Mexican Folk Art museum
287744474.author: a TripAdvisor user
287744474.reviewBody:
We didn't plan to visit this museum but another traveller tipped us off to it and we're so glad we took his advise and got to see it. One of the best art gallery / museums you could ever visit with all the money going to local charities.  

John and Dorianne open the doors of their home each day at 10am for group tours around their private collection of Mexican folk art. Their entire home (which is a huge colonial building with courtyard) is full of wonderful colourful eclectic artwork - sculptures, hand painted furniture, pottery, tapestries, photographs, murals and colourful curiosities (from around all the regions of Mexico) that are all tastefully displayed in guest bedrooms, bathrooms, balconies and courtyards and around their swimming pool and gardens. The tour concludes with a tour John and Doriannes lounge, kitchen and dining room before concluding with a chat with the couple. 

One of the best art experiences we ever had - don't miss it !!

287452252.name: Interesting museum
287452252.author: a TripAdvisor user
287452252.reviewBody: Lovely and interesting art work in an old colonial home. The every day tour makes for a great experience while in Valladolid.

283930613.name: Beautiful
283930613.author: a TripAdvisor user
283930613.reviewBody: They had tours in Spanish and English. The house was beautiful, I especially liked all the art in the bedrooms. The pool and dining rooms were great. They definitely deserve a small donation!

283360001.name: Awesome collection of artesania
283360001.author: a TripAdvisor user
283360001.reviewBody: John Venator, the owner of the house and collection, is an inspiration of how to enjoy a collection and give back to the community.  The colonial house has been remodeled in a way to maintain the feeling of the colonial structure, display the tremendous art collection and be livable with modern conveniences.  Many of the pieces of art were done on commission specifically for the house. It is a pleasure to see the quality pieces displayed tastefully and playfully. They are fans of Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera and Catrina (skeleton) art which is reflected in their collection.   It would take many visits to see all of the pieces.  The Venators open their home for tours and ask only for a donation which goes directly to charities in Valladolid.  Thank you for your generosity in sharing your home and collection!

281872010.name: Amazing colection
281872010.author: a TripAdvisor user
281872010.reviewBody: Every space is made use of with amazing works of Mexican folk art. Defiantly a one of a kind tour and a must see.

281394440.name: Historical and quirky!
281394440.author: a TripAdvisor user
281394440.reviewBody: How generous of this family to share their art with visitors to Valladolid. My group along with our tour guide from 1% Travel enjoyed a brief tour of the home and its art!  And they allowed us to take photographs which were some of the most colorful I was able to take while on tour in Mexico.

280626444.name: The heart of Valladolid\'s Magic
280626444.author: a TripAdvisor user
280626444.reviewBody:
Inside the walls of a beautiful 300 year old hacienda style mansion, yet fully restored and functional you will find Casa de los Venados, featuring over maybe 2,3 thousand pieces of Mexican folkloric art work, from hand made piñatas out of "papel mache" to incredible paintings and carefully placed sculptures! 

Casa de los Venados is as warm and welcoming as its hosts, full of colorful and vibrant art this award winning private home opens its doors to the public every day as a non profit museum to help out the local town where the gracious owners choose to settle in! 

I was lucky enough to get a private tour around the property making my experience more in depth and magical and even then I can say, It's one of those places you can never get tired of visit due to the many different pieces of art they have anywhere you look. 

congratulations and keep up the good charity work!

278598650.name: Don\'t dither.. just go!
278598650.author: a TripAdvisor user
278598650.reviewBody:
It was a hot dusty moring, and as I turned up at 10 am, I was half expecting the daily tour to be cancelled due to lack of visitors. Not a bit of it.. The tour stared with just me and a young woman from Australia. Our guide was lavely, spoke perfect English and seemed to genuinely enjoy telling us about the building, and the stories behind the astonishing range of artefacts. I ran out of superlatives, and don't think my jaw could have dropped any lower! 
This is not a dry arid collection of incomprehensible bits and bobs, but rather a vibrant  assembly of imaginative and lively narratives in a vast range of mediums.  All museum curators should be sent here for training!!! 
I was politely asked to make a donation, which is used to fund local charities. Very happy to do so.
Three hours later, I emerged blinking in the bright day light and all I could say was WOW.

276930767.name: A must-see
276930767.author: a TripAdvisor user
276930767.reviewBody: Our extremely knowledgeable and articulate guide (Arlando?) did a wonderful job of explaining so many of the artifacts in this beautiful home.  Visiting is a definite must during any stay in Vallodalid.  So informative about the culture and Mexico.  Thank you, John, for allowing us to visit.

276178217.name: Unique Place to see.  Thumbs Up!
276178217.author: a TripAdvisor user
276178217.reviewBody: Warning this place is HOT.  I was hot my whole vacation but really hot here.  Wear your coolest clothing.  A great place to visit.  A wealthy American bought a historic property (more like a mansion) and restored it and filled it with his personal collection of Mayan Folk Art.  He allows tours and the money goes to local charities.  Even my un artsy husband enjoyed this as well as our college age kids.   This place has a great deal of unique whimsical  art to view and hear about from the guide.  What I liked is that it isn\'t famous art, but more typical  folk art from various regions. \n  One tour a day at 10 am.  $5 pp I think.

275822215.name: Great Tour
275822215.author: a TripAdvisor user
275822215.reviewBody: Amazing place and fantastic collection.\n\nWell worth doing the tour but I wouldn\'t want to do the dusting!!

274481392.name: Jewel of the Yucatan
274481392.author: a TripAdvisor user
274481392.reviewBody: Truly an unexpected treasure, this rich collection of authentic Mexican folk art and stunning architecture was the highlight of our stay in Valladolid!  A gracious and knowledgable docent met us at the door and provided a very thorough and detailed tour of each room and artifact including the history of the museum-like Casa.  The owners have restored the property in a way that provides beautifully appointed private area and guest suites that preserve the Colonial flavor of the past while infusing sumptuous amenities that rival any 5 star accommodation although it is not offered for public use.  Their attention to detail was remarkable in every way, but to discover that their efforts benefit the community through donations and private events was completely inspiring!

273465398.name: Must see!!!
273465398.author: a TripAdvisor user
273465398.reviewBody: I heard about this house through a friend went and saw it. It was amazing. I would recommend anyone who loves Mexican folk art to visit. John and Dorianne\'s life works collection is a must see. It\'s also for a good cause all money raised is donated.

272212713.name: Inspiring collection
272212713.author: a TripAdvisor user
272212713.reviewBody: Simply to understand contemporary Mexican culture, this is a must see. It will help unravel the complexities of the Mexican way of being, through folk art by master craftsmen given the freedom to express themselves by the owner/curators of the collection. Thank-you for opening to the public.

270025913.name: Impossible to describe
270025913.author: a TripAdvisor user
270025913.reviewBody: One of the best things to do in Valladlid. One hour tour in the house of this American couple who have collected hundreds of handcafts pieces of mexican art in their villa. An unforgettable experience, the place is amazing!!

269672635.name: Unique art collection
269672635.author: a TripAdvisor user
269672635.reviewBody:
This collection of folk art is a labor of love built piece by piece over sixty-five years. The collection is held in a private home so while the tour if free, it is important to respect the times (i.e. show up at 10 am for the tour). 

Our guides were knowledgeable and very pleasant. They provided detailed descriptions of many works of art in the house ranging from the paintings and sculpture, to pinatas, furniture and even place settings at the table!

269529691.name: beautiful house
269529691.author: a TripAdvisor user
269529691.reviewBody: It is a beautiful house, the owners are there to greet visitors on the tour, it has a large collection of Mexican pieces. the most impressive figures of the place are Mexican catrinas.\nI recommend visiting this house during his visit to Valladolid.

269145273.name: Disneyland of Mexican Folk Art
269145273.author: a TripAdvisor user
269145273.reviewBody: We enjoy and collect Mexican Folk Art and felt like it was the Disneyland of Mexican Folk Art.  The tour guide was very informative and took the time to explain the different art work and how the owners acquired it.  From item purchases to commission paid to Mexican artists to make the pieces.  It is colorful and at each turn of your head you see the spectacular work done by these artists and displayed very well.  It is a wide assortment to take all in on one visit, we plan to return and catch the items we surely missed seeing.  Be prepared to feast your eyes on some great folk art work. They opened at 10:00 am and the tour took about 75 minutes to complete.  It is located near the central plaza, just ask the local police the location and they will direct you to it.

266344039.name: Incredible collection (and house) showed me how much there is to learn about Mexican folk art
266344039.author: a TripAdvisor user
266344039.reviewBody: Wow, I had no idea about the richness, depth of Mexican folk art!  Seeing so much great work, while learning some of the meaning and context, was fantastic.  I\'m hooked now.  And I love that the owners do so much for the community.  The house itself is marvelously restored/rebuilt, too.

263339133.name: Memorable folk art collection shared by proud owners
263339133.author: a TripAdvisor user
263339133.reviewBody: This tour was truly a highlight of our Mexico trip so far. The collection shows the whole range of Mexican folk art while also displaying Mexican history and culture. It is so cleverly curated, which makes it even more remarkable that this is a private home and the art serves as decoration. The furnishing is also part of the whole and makes the display particularly personal and special, as does the beautiful colonial building. The guide gave competent explanations to many pieces and also helped understanding the collection as a whole and the collectors better. We met the owners during the tour and you can feel how enthusiastic and proud they are about this project (and rightfully so). If you are ever in the area: do everything in your power to catch the tour. It is around an hour and worth every second of it.

261703012.name: Remarkable Folk Art Collection
261703012.author: a TripAdvisor user
261703012.reviewBody: This was a real "find" and definitely worth a stop.  There is no entrance fee, however, donations are encouraged and the donations benefit a children\'s hospital - exclusively.  This is a private collectors \'hacienda\' and his generous spirit and superior taste are evident through-out.

261453096.name: Wow!!
261453096.author: a TripAdvisor user
261453096.reviewBody: This home/museum is not to be missed!! Fantastic collection of artifacts and commissioned pieces of art by local artists. The home is amazing and the whole experience is a $5 donation to a worthy cause.

261133726.name: Personally Curated and Uniquely Displayed
261133726.author: a TripAdvisor user
261133726.reviewBody:
When we visited Valladolid a few times in the past, we unfortunately didn't make time to visit Casa de los Venados.  We were determined not to miss the opportunity on our most recent visit and we will never forget it. 

At 10am, we were given our semi-private tour (in perfect English) of this astounding collection of Mexican crafts by an articulate and knowledgeable young man named, Arnaldo. 

Arnaldo walked us through a menagerie of pieces in the private Colonial home of John and Dorianne Venator. Their personal collection is from nearly every region of Mexico and Arnaldo informed us how each region can be identified by the materials the artists used in crafting their art. Whether it was ceramics, papier-mâché, tin, copper or steel, Arnaldo was ready with a concise explanation of the work and the particular artist. 

We were thrilled to meet the owner, who informed us how he has been happy to offer his collection and open his home to all who are interested with no admittance fee. He only asks for a reasonable donation.  The individual donations are then earmarked for either surgery for poor area families or for children with cancer. These are two of the many social services that the donations have been helping for a number of years. 

We cannot recommend visiting Casa de los Venados for both the incredible cultural experience and the knowledge that your donations help such important causes.

260882787.name: Astounding
260882787.author: a TripAdvisor user
260882787.reviewBody: A must while in Valladolid.  House tours are at 10am.  A private home full of over 1500 Mexican folk art.  Tour by donation, home is right around the corner of the church in the square.  Well worth taking the time!

260809725.name: Interesting Art Collection
260809725.author: a TripAdvisor user
260809725.reviewBody: Interesting tour of a private home with an extensive art collection (made public for daily tours). We were lucky to arrive just as a tour was beginning, and we enjoyed it very much. The owner is very friendly and the tour fee is actually a donation that goes to local charities. Overall, I would do it again and/or recommend it to others!

260774141.name: A must visit in Valladolid
260774141.author: a TripAdvisor user
260774141.reviewBody: This beautifully restored colonial home houses a magnificent collection of Mexican Folk art the likes of which probably cannot be seen anywhere.The guide is excellent both in English and in his knowledge of the collection much of which has been commissioned.It is very close to the square and opens at ten.Admission is by donation which the owner uses for a number of charitable causes in the area.\nA must see .My favourite visit in Valladolid.

260711160.name: Highlight of our time in Vallodolid
260711160.author: a TripAdvisor user
260711160.reviewBody: This luxury home houses a varied collection of Mexican folk art gathered over a lifetime of travel by an American couple that now lives here full time.  Featuring all types of media including  talavera pottery, prize winning art pi\u00f1atas, beautifully painted furniture as art, custom tile murals, wood carvings and textile art.  This is a collection worthy of a museum presented in a unique and beautiful setting with a guide to point out and explain many of the items.  A gem of a find in the midst of an otherwise modest city.

260464598.name: Excellent art opportunity
260464598.author: a TripAdvisor user
260464598.reviewBody: We read about this - private collectors who open their home to the public to share native art. We are so glad we went. We saw wonderful examples of handicrafts, and contemporary interpretations of the same. There is a fee, but worth it. The home is completely delightful (old building, with contemporary architecture in parts) and so is the guide and the dog.

260432465.name: Don\'t miss this treasure
260432465.author: a TripAdvisor user
260432465.reviewBody: This privately owned museum is unlike any other you will visit in the Yucatan area.  It has some of the most exquisite samples of local, contemporary  Mexican art around. The architecture alone is worth the visit, and all donations are for local charities.

260396898.name: If you enjoy art do not miss this place.
260396898.author: a TripAdvisor user
260396898.reviewBody: Extensive personal art collection, collected from Puebla, Oaxaca and Yucatan Mexico. The furnishings in the house are also art pieces. The tours can be done in English or Spanish.The owners are also very pleasant people.\nA nominal donation is requested and put into a jar to be used for locally to support worthy causes.

260232243.name: A Very Special Collection of Mexican folk art
260232243.author: a TripAdvisor user
260232243.reviewBody: My family and I had the pleasure of touring this private collection of Mexican folk art last week. The collection is extensive, a life time of passion for the subject and representative of all areas of Mexico. The restored home is an attraction in itself, really well done . The tour guide was extremely professional and made us feel connected to the work. The tour begins at 10am and lasts about an hour. Donations are welcome to support the owner\'s charitable work in the area.. Put this on your list .

260182637.name: The higlight of my stay in Valladolid !
260182637.author: a TripAdvisor user
260182637.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is a MUST SEE in Valladolid ! If you enjoy folkloric art you will be served for they have they most AMAZING collection of Mexican folkloric art I have ever seen. Do yourself a favor while in Valladolid and visit Casa de los Venados. The tour guide was a young local by the name Darwin and he was very friendly and knowledgeable. The day we visited the owners were present and they really made visitors feel welcomed and they both took some time to chat with visitors. I can\'t stress enough that I REALLY enjoyed Casa de los Venados !

259506308.name: Must-see
259506308.author: a TripAdvisor user
259506308.reviewBody: Fantastic collection! The tour was very well-done. We really enjoyed stories and connections between the artist and the collector.

259412120.name: AN UNIMAGINEABLE DELIGHT A MUST SEE
259412120.author: a TripAdvisor user
259412120.reviewBody:
We had a most amazing experience visiting the home of John and Dorianne Venator yesterday. The sign says daily tours at 10 am. it also says ring the bell for entrance. We arrived at the home about 1:30 or so and rang the bell. A very nice guide greeted us and gave us a most wonderful tour of the more than 3000 pieces of art selected by the owners over a lifetime of collecting. This is not your typical tour. You are actually taken from room to room through the private home of the owners. We were fortunate enough to meet both John and Dorianne who were casually enjoying a rest in the vast courtyard and then what looked like a wonderful lunch. Their dog followed us throughout the tour and often led the way.
The art collection can not be adequately described it is so vast and diverse. They have commissioned many of the pieces and my favorites were the hand hammered copper vases, the murals, the  art in the Frida Kahlo room and the dining room chairs.  The architecture and restoration work that was done on this building is exquisite. The pool area is breathtaking. All in all  you should not miss this gem.
Without a doubt one of our most favorite parts of our first visit to the Cancun area. they have a website and it has a video tour of the place but like all things this place must be experienced in person. casadelosvenados.com
Thank you John and Dorianne for opening your home up to us. I also love the story of your romance. 
Lou and Irene

256885759.name: A Treasure of Valladolid.
256885759.author: a TripAdvisor user
256885759.reviewBody: A not to be missed genuine treasure of local art and cultural history.  A warm and welcoming visit to a generous art patrons home.

256812152.name: Even My Husband Loved It
256812152.author: a TripAdvisor user
256812152.reviewBody: I dragged my husband here on our weekend in Valladolid, and he was glad I did. Our tour lasted an hour and a half, and was very comprehensive.  We got to see many of the rooms in the private home, each replete with colorful artwork.  The amount and quality of the artwork is amazing.  I have certain favorites pieces that just make me smile remembering them (and looking at photos that the owner, John Venator,  generously allows visitors to take.) It is wonderful that Mr. Venator has opened up his wonderful collection to the public, and equally wonderful that the requested donation is used to support charitable funds in the area.

256661418.name: Art and beauty that helps
256661418.author: a TripAdvisor user
256661418.reviewBody: beautiful place, its art, and design. It is a very nice stop in Valladolid, especially with the collected help low-income people.

256422998.name: Deer House Folk rt
256422998.author: a TripAdvisor user
256422998.reviewBody: Really interesting.  Tour led by a Mexican guide--Spanish or English. Very intresting large home full of Mexican  folk art with explanations od the significance and how it was acquired.  Photos allowed.  Small \'donation\' required.  Every day at 10:00 AM.  Well worth your time if inn Valladolid.

256413228.name: So so
256413228.author: a TripAdvisor user
256413228.reviewBody: Ok, if you like Mexican folk art. If not, spend more time at the ruins or one of the great reararaunts on the square.

256071711.name: The Hearst Castle of the Yucatan!
256071711.author: a TripAdvisor user
256071711.reviewBody: A unique private home that was once a 16th-century hacienda, and is now an amzaing museum of Mexican folk art. Nothing like it anywhere. Tours are every day at 10 am, small donating goes to local non-profits. One person on the tour had been three times before. It\'s only an hour long, and thre is so much to see!

256060973.name: fantastic collection, wonderful home!
256060973.author: a TripAdvisor user
256060973.reviewBody: We were able to secure a private tour of this beautiful collection at an unusual time as a result of being on a private day-trip with Cancun Manny (see separate review). Valladolid is about 1/2 hour from Chichen Itza, and we were able to visit Casa de los Venados after an early-morning tour of the ruins. Mexican folk art is fascinating, colorful and full of personality, and this collection is amazing. This is a private home, which in itself is a lovely remodel of an historic building, with a layout built around showcasing the remarkable art. The building is just around the corner from the main square in Valldolid. We met the personable owners while there, who were having lunch as a staffer gave us a tour in good English. In particular, there are separate rooms that are tributes to Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, and many fine examples of costumed skeletons that we learned actually were not Dia de los Muertos pieces as we thought, but began as political satire pieces done by local artists in protest over wealthy colonial rulers. There are many humorous, touching and quirky pieces the owners had commissioned, and even functional furniture that are art pieces. The owners ask for just a small donation, all of which goes to local charities. Check out their website at http://www.casadelosvenados.com/index_2.php for more!

255626743.name: Amazing treasure house of Mexican folk art
255626743.author: a TripAdvisor user
255626743.reviewBody: This is a \'must see\' if you spend a night in Valladolid. there are daily tours at 10am and you are asked to make a donation to charity. The house, which is home to an American couple, houses their amazing collection of wonderful artwork, mainly commissioned by them from living (or recently deceased) artists from all over Mexico. Beautiful, intriguing, sometimes even a little frightening work, set in a beautifully restored and enhanced colonial building. No words can prepare you for what you will see- just go!

255310560.name: Great tour of architectural wonder, fun art objects.
255310560.author: a TripAdvisor user
255310560.reviewBody: Very interesting modern remodel with folk art and fun quirks. Especially loved pool area. By donation: Donate generously as it is for charities.

255010228.name: Wow
255010228.author: a TripAdvisor user
255010228.reviewBody: This museum is awesome. You get a tour at 10 am and can be in English or Spanish , not sure about other languages. The guide is very knowledgable and does a great job. This is a fantastic place to see art work from all over Mexico.

253879071.name: WOW
253879071.author: a TripAdvisor user
253879071.reviewBody: Must see, the history and folk art collection is 2nd to none.  A private home and museum the John opens his doors.

253717585.name: Excellent
253717585.author: a TripAdvisor user
253717585.reviewBody: A must see.   Wonderful hosts and an amazing collection of Mexican folk art.     All donations are for charities in the area.

252967967.name: Simply amazing folk art
252967967.author: a TripAdvisor user
252967967.reviewBody: It\'s hard to describe such a beautiful house and it\'s amazing collection of Mexican folk art. Every where you look are crafted pieces of Mexicana from all regions of the country. The tour guides were wonderfully informative and friendly and you can take all the pictures you want. try doing that in most museums! And the house is conveniently located very close to the zocalo. It\'s a must see when in Valladolid.

252588921.name: Really unusual, colorful and fascinating
252588921.author: a TripAdvisor user
252588921.reviewBody: Photos don\'t do the art collection justice.  The colors and creativity used by the varied artists is so rich and exotic.  Unlike anything I\'ve seen before.  Arnaldo, our guide, was filled with fascinating information and did an excellent job showing us around.  We own a vacation rental business in Puerto Morelos, a small, seaside village between Cancun and Playa del Carmen and our guests rave about seeing the folk art at this museum all the time.  We ourselves have been there 3 or 4 times and it never gets old.  Valladolid is a fun day trip from the Cancun area.  Highly recommended.

251992054.name: Must see
251992054.author: a TripAdvisor user
251992054.reviewBody: Do not miss this fabulous house and folk art collection, if you are in the Valladolid area. A unique collection of outstanding folk art. Guided tours every morning at 10 AM in English and Spanish go thru the common areas, several guest rooms and part of the owner\'s house. A 60 peso donation per person is requested and is given to charity.

251193107.name: Interesting but......
251193107.author: a TripAdvisor user
251193107.reviewBody: This is a private collection of folk art from all over Mexico. Much of it is very new , having been directly commissioned by the owner in the past few years. The guide is knowledgeable though I learned less about pieces than I would have at a museum. For example, I saw a skeleton that was dressed\nas a yaqui deer dancer. When I asked for the background for the piece I was told that the artist /craftsman was from Mexico City and was  "into skeletons". No real insight or context was presented. But the art is visually attractive and presented in a lovely setting.

250401958.name: Remarkable collection of folk art
250401958.author: a TripAdvisor user
250401958.reviewBody: This is a must see attraction for anyone with an interest in Mexican folk art.  Not only is the collection varied and stunning but the owner, John and the guide Freddy were both remarkably knowledgeable and courteous.\n\nNot sure what the previous reviewer who arrived at 2:30 pm expected.  Every bit of literature printed and digital about Casa de los Venados clearly states "...open to the public every day at 10 AM for tours in both English and Spanish."

250394447.name: Highlight of the trip
250394447.author: a TripAdvisor user
250394447.reviewBody: If you are interested in architecture, you should go. This is an 18,000 sq ft, 400 year-old house that took 8 years to renovate. if you are interested in Mexican folk art, you should go. Over 3,000 pieces. If you are interested in the work of contemporary Mexican artists, you should go. Best of all, if you care about improving the lives of the local Mayan people, your visit to Casa de Los Venados will benefit them. All proceeds from the tour go towards healthcare for the Mayans.

250175251.name: well bunk to everyone
250175251.author: a TripAdvisor user
250175251.reviewBody: we arrived at 2:30 on Thursday...there was no friendly greeting we were turned away and told to come another day...no hours are posted...its some kind of secret club you must join to get in I think

249767372.name: Keeping folk art traditions alive!
249767372.author: a TripAdvisor user
249767372.reviewBody: A vast collection of Mexican folk art by artists both living and dead!  Each room is more delightful than the last, and our tour guide could not have been more friendly, generous and insightful.  The owner came out to greet us, answered questions, and even gave suggestions for other sights in and around Valladolid.  The 60 pesos donation goes to local charities, improving the health and quality of life of Valladolid\'s citizens and animals.  Expect to learn about the reconstruction of the residence and the living artistic traditions of Mexico.

249595866.name: Overwhelming, in a good way
249595866.author: a TripAdvisor user
249595866.reviewBody: A great way to start your day in Valladolid is to be at Casa de los Venados at 10 AM when they have their tour in English. There is so much to see, almost hard to take it all in. The tour takes and hour so the guide only focuses on some of the objects but you can always ask for more information if there is a particular object that interets you. The building itself is lovely to visit, a nice break from the noisy streets. The focus is on modern Mexican folk art so don\'t expect very old pieces. Also very nice to meet Mr Venator afterwards and hear about his passion for Mexican art the the different causes he and his wife support.

249175678.name: A Must if you love Mexican Folk Art ....
249175678.author: a TripAdvisor user
249175678.reviewBody: An amazing private collection of over 3000 folk art pieces collected by the American owners John & Dorianne.  If you love Mexican Folk Art, Casa de los Venados is a MUST.  Owner John led our tour through his beautiful home.  We were even escorted by the family dog Mia.  John said they are working w/ a university to catalog and photograph the collection.  He also said they spent 10 years renovating their large home.  Tours start at 10:00 a.m. and reservations are suggested.   Also, a donation is requested at the end of the tour.  Money collected goes to local charities.  Don\'t miss this incredible collection of Mexican Folk Art!!!!!

249158563.name: If you want to see how the other half live.....
249158563.author: a TripAdvisor user
249158563.reviewBody: While the art collection here is undoubtedly stunning, there is something strange about this place.  I did not know it existed and happened to be walking past when a tour started so was able to join.  You are walked through the private residence of Mr. John, the owner, from Portland.  The property is stunning, ornate, with a large private pool and fountains.  This insane display of wealth against the less well off town and the poverty in the region is so stark, it\'s almost depressing.  While Mr. John and his wife appear to donate to the community, I\'d like to know far more about what they do for the community.  Even on the website, there is little information about philanthropy and giving.  Without this, I see no reason to visit this place, unless you want to see how the other half lives.

248673252.name: How much cool stuff can you put in one house??!!
248673252.author: a TripAdvisor user
248673252.reviewBody: A massivly friendly and well informed tour guide showed us around the impressive Casa de los Venados. We were sceptical at first, something about tour guides and folk art didn\'t appeal (the review in Lonely Planet didn\'t do it justice), but I\'m so glad we listened our enthusiastic hotel neighbours - it was amazing! \nCrammed with beautiful pieces and teeming with history, it really is a gem tucked in a lovely town. \n\'Mr John\'s\' got it right!

248332921.name: Unexpected and wonderful magic
248332921.author: a TripAdvisor user
248332921.reviewBody: After the visit to Chichen Itza early in the morning, so no crowds, our guide from Univers Maya took us to a Cenote and then to the Casa de los Venados. I did not know what to expect about visiting a house, so I rather thought that I would wander through the city. But I decided to give the place a chance. Who knows. Wow! I\'m so happy I entered the casa. It was the highlight of my vacation. Its visit was more grand for me than the one of Chichen Itza. As a matter of fact, back home, I never talked about Chichen but a lot about la Casa de los Venados. Not that Chichen is not worth the trip but for me the Casa scores much higher - and I am a fan or ruins and have visited a lot, Incas or others. The Casa is full of popular Mexican art and works, much of which you won\'t see anywhere else. Or if you do, not in such a setting and in such numbers. Wow!  I am sure that I will go back during my next visit to Riviera Maya. And I hope I can meet again with Mrs and Mr Venator, its gracious owners and custodians. Thanks to them for opening their house to visitors.

248268310.name: a treasure
248268310.author: a TripAdvisor user
248268310.reviewBody: I was a bit reluctant to go at first as I thought it\'d be just another collector\'s home but these persons are the real thing. The house is magnificent. Don\'t miss it and your entry fee goes to charity.

247835808.name: Extraordinary collection of Mexican folk art
247835808.author: a TripAdvisor user
247835808.reviewBody: Call for a tour of this privately owned collection.  No charge, just a request for a contribution the owners will give to a charity. The collection of folk art is awesome. It is one of the things we most enjoyed in the Yucatan. "Mr. John," as the owner is called by the guides, made himself accessible and was helpful about other things to do in the wonderful colonial town of Valladolid.

246568019.name: unusual yet facinating
246568019.author: a TripAdvisor user
246568019.reviewBody: So many colourful and unique pieces of Mexican art fill this home.  Thank you for such a great experience!

245422948.name: What a great experience!  Don\'t miss this in Valladolid!
245422948.author: a TripAdvisor user
245422948.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is really something!  We were very fortunate to have had this experience.  The owner of opens his home to the public generally during the morning.  He has his staff give a personal tour of an incredible collection of Mexican folk art.  And boy, was it worth the time we spent there (approx. 1.5 hours).  He has a member of his staff give the tour and they go into great detail on how all of the art was obtained.  I believe it is the largest private collection of Mexican folk art.  We actually met John, the owner of the house/collection.  He was very friendly, answered our questions and made our small group feel very welcome.  Photos are permitted.  The home is located just feet off the main square in town.  Upon reflection, we should have tipped the staff member that gave us the tour.  I feel guilty that we did not because he spent so much time with us.  Admission is free, but they do ask you to make a small donation of approx. $5 pp--which is a real bargain.  The money goes to support the local charities of which they support.  That is the only reason I checked the "fee" box on the T/A page.

245334078.name: Una sorpresa and a big surprise
245334078.author: a TripAdvisor user
245334078.reviewBody: There was a lot of "Oh\'s" and "Ah\'s" while touring through la casa de Los Venados. An amazing and a lot of collections in the owner\'s house. Valladolid as such is a special town, but this house gives an asset to it. The about one hour tour is a very informatic tour and I enjoyed having been there. There is no entrance fee, yet a donation which the owners give it to some institution of need.

245002931.name: The best of the best in Valedolid
245002931.author: a TripAdvisor user
245002931.reviewBody: I knew I had to visit this place after seeing the many fantastic reviews, but the reality was so much more. Casa de los Venados is full of treasures.So many examples of the beautiful folk art that one can see all over Mexico...all in this one beautifully restored house.\nThe owners, who now live there spend over 7 years in the restoration of the building, keeping the best features, adding some new, so the fusion of old and new is effortless giving them a wonderful home and display area for their many different artifacts .\nWe arrived on a Sunday morning, not sure if it would be open for visits. Don\'t be put off if the door is closed, ring the bell or phone the number on the door....and you will be given a guided tour by a very knowledgeable young Mexican. All contributions are collected to give to local charities, so apart from a truly wonderful tour, you can do good by being generous too. It was my first visit...but I look forward to my next one so I can see the things I missed the first time round.

244589776.name: Casa de los Venados : Intriguing and surprising...
244589776.author: a TripAdvisor user
244589776.reviewBody:
Casa de los Venados, Valadolid, Mexique

To : John and Dorianne Venator,

I am writing this review in English, so it can also be read by the owners, as usually write my reviews in French. I may therefore adapt my text to publish it in French on TripAdvisor.fr. It will however contain just about the same information, a positive view of Casa de los Venados.

I must admit I was intrigued and a little surprised to find such an eclectic collection of art. To me, seeing so many interpretations of ''skelelon art'', (in my own words...) was very surprising, although I was expecting it to a point, since I had seen some representations in stone, on Mayan constructions. I have to say, I'm still not quite sure how I feel about it. I was bothered, but I cannot yet explain exactly why. I am sure it had something to do with my christian upbringing, and its consequences, and the different relation that mayan beliefs have with death, and the underworld. I am convinced that it is a very unique and original collection and I recommend a visit, to anyone with an open mind. 

Our guide, Victor (Univers Maya) gave us a tour in your home and we really appreciated his services. I am happy he gave us the opportunity to discover your collection and I congratulate you for giving a chance to Mexican artists to be noticed. We were told that you encourage these artists in a very concrete way.

Jean Morel, Québec City

244145701.name: Fantastic experience!
244145701.author: a TripAdvisor user
244145701.reviewBody: A wonderful experience!  From the stunning collection of folk art and the beautiful home in which it\'s displayed, to the knowledgeable guide and the gracious host this is, as others have stated, a "must see" in charming Valladolid.

243924037.name: Amazing folk art collection
243924037.author: a TripAdvisor user
243924037.reviewBody: There are over 3,000 pieces of folk art in this private collection. The pieces give you a different view of Mexican history, folklore and culture.  The restored Spanish Colonial home that houses the collection is also architecturally quite interesting, a combination of old and very contemporary.  Better yet, your small donation goes to local charities.  A fun and colorful experience.

243725986.name: A truly remarkable home - vibrant with art
243725986.author: a TripAdvisor user
243725986.reviewBody: As others have said, this is a \'must-see\'. Although the regular tours start at 10.00 daily, if you ask very nicely you may be taken around at other times, but remember to be generous as there is no formal fee but donations are encouraged at the end. Be prepared to be amazed: the indigenous art that the owner and his wife have collected is very striking indeed. It is full of colour and there are many suctpures that are decorated with coloured paint, pottery on a big scale and of course the paintings. For me, the best room was the dining room, so beautifully furnished and laid out with the most striking paintings as well. You feel very privileged to be shown round this large private home and it is not a visit you are ever likely to forget. Photography is permitted, although it is polite not to use flash in my view.

243564738.name: You have to see this!
243564738.author: a TripAdvisor user
243564738.reviewBody: If you love Mexican folk art you have to see this place.  And if you don\'t love Mexican folk art, you have to see this place anyway, because it will give you a love for it, which will then give back to you every time you visit Mexico.  Mexican folk art is one of the joyful things about this country, and Casa De Los Venados does a fabulous job of displaying a fabulous collection.  Well done!

243321713.name: Not to be missed!!!!!
243321713.author: a TripAdvisor user
243321713.reviewBody:
Amazing. Wonderful. Mind blowing. This casa (house) is out of this world!!!! 
Filled with the most breathtaking mexican folk art in a gorgeous house in the cutest wee town of Valladolid- i recommend everyone to stop through here.

We enjoyed our one night stop over in valladolid more than the 3 days we had in Mèrida! What a hidden gem this town and this house is.

242978230.name: Fabulous folk art
242978230.author: a TripAdvisor user
242978230.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this townhouse filled with the owner\'s 3000 piece collection of Mexican folk art, lovingly collected over several decades.

242349579.name: Incredible folk art
242349579.author: a TripAdvisor user
242349579.reviewBody: This is a must see for anyone interested in mexican folk art as well as architecture.  Loved the hacienda, and their collection is unmatched anywhere in Mexico.

241901812.name: Fantastic!
241901812.author: a TripAdvisor user
241901812.reviewBody: This little gem of a house is not to be missed. The private house with it\'s collection of Mexican folk art is absolutely lovely. There\'s a guided tour at 10 am, otherwise you have to make an appointment.\nThe art is insanely cool and the house itself beautiful. I\'d kill to spend a few nights in one of those rooms. The guide knew what he was talking about and the art very, very impressive!\n

241023258.name: This is not to be missed! A private home filled with beautiful Mexican art.
241023258.author: a TripAdvisor user
241023258.reviewBody: Right off the square in Valladolid, this beautiful home showcases the best of Mexican folk art! It is a guided tour that starts promptly at 10:00am and you shouldn\'t miss it. Museum quality art fills every room! A small donation is requested to fund several different charities.

238665949.name: Artful time in Vallodilid
238665949.author: a TripAdvisor user
238665949.reviewBody: Fabulous art collection and house.  I would\'ve gone to tour the house alone. Very knowledgeable Tour guide.  It\'s a long tour and I got a little antsy to move on to the next room but maybe that\'s just me.  They only asked for a $5.00 donation per person.  Well worth it and for a worthy cause.  Very unexpected find in small Mayan town!

238394921.name: A Must See in Valladolid!
238394921.author: a TripAdvisor user
238394921.reviewBody: Loved this beautiful showcase of Mexican Folk Art.  What a treasure!  Staff and guide were so knowledgeable and friendly.  Our main guide was Arnaldo (I think) and he was awesome!  We also were fortunate enough to meet the owner who was also fantastic.  Donations go to charity and it is well worth a visit.  We enjoyed so much we tipped our guide in addition to donation.  Fantastic time well spent!

238117098.name: Enchantment . . . .
238117098.author: a TripAdvisor user
238117098.reviewBody: On a whim while on our way to Merida, MX, my husband and I stopped to see the town of Valladolid.  It turned out to be the best experience of our entire trip.  We came upon Casa de los Venados which happened to be a location that a friend had been telling us to visit for years in that the owners were from Chicago (as are we).  We knocked on the door and were cordially welcomed even though it was not during tour hours and they were preparing for a Dia de los Muertos festivity that evening.  Arnaldo gave us a fascinating 40-minute tour which could have lasted longer but had to be shortened due to our travel schedule.  We then met the owners, John and Dorianne, and were made to feel that we had known them for years.  The history and collection of the Mexican folk art was outstanding.  It\'s a magical setting in an enchanted place.  Do visit and enjoy!

237651089.name: This was one of the most amazing actual museums - and homes - I\'ve ever visited...
237651089.author: a TripAdvisor user
237651089.reviewBody: ... and while absolutely historic and important - and indicative of the absolutely unique Valladolid culture, it was particularly charming because of the enthusiasm, commitment, presence and powerful social commitment of its two US-originated owners who retired only to take on supporting a wide variety of local youth and social causes from the proceeds of their ongoing and busy visits.  Interestingly, they impact all of Mexico with their beautiful home/museum as there are few if any senior Mexican politicians that haven\'t had parties/fundraisers/visits to this amazing site.  i WISH it were a hotel (the pool is particularly tantalizing.  My very best to the lovely owners who have done more good for Mexico, Mexicans and the cacophony of Mayan, Aztec and other artistic spirits that collide across the artistic richness of this entire home - one rather constantly approached for artistic exchanges with Mexico\'s best museums.  Thank you again, Sincerely, David, Ieva and Noah

236173053.name: Museum quality folk art
236173053.author: a TripAdvisor user
236173053.reviewBody: Excellent free tour. Amazing art throughout the house. If you think Mexicans just produce junk for tourists, you need to check this out.

232688807.name: World class collection
232688807.author: a TripAdvisor user
