232688807.reviewBody: A truly world class collection of Mexican folk art set in a wonderful building. Had the tour to myself and Darwin, the guide, was a fount of knowledge and made the experience special for me.

231621613.name: Worth going to Valladolid to see this
231621613.author: a TripAdvisor user
231621613.reviewBody: After reading the reviews, we knew we had to see Casa de los Venados in Valladolid.  We got there for the 10 AM tour, and it was excellent.  The guide, Miriam, is knowledgeable, and gives the tour in both English and Spanish.  This home is amazing, with a huge collection of Mexican folk art.  It\'s immaculately clean, and just fascinating.  The tour took about 1.5 hours - for 4 people.  There is a suggested donation, which the owners use to provide support for people with disabilities in the area.  \nIt makes me want to get to know John and Dorianne Venator, who so generously open their home for viewing.  They seem like they have a wonderful sense of humor and are great supporters of the culture.  Oh to be able to sit at their table and enjoy a meal there!

230580216.name: What a place!
230580216.author: a TripAdvisor user
230580216.reviewBody: This tour was lovely and conducted by a very knowledgeable woman name Miriam!  This house is awesome and filled with a marvelous personal collection of Mexican Folk Art!  A must see if you are in Valledolid.

229423896.name: A must see but please plan ahead....
229423896.author: a TripAdvisor user
229423896.reviewBody:
I first want to thank again our hosts and owners of the Casa De Los Venados, Mr. John and Dorianne Venator.. They had just finished hosting a town event and allowed us to tour the home.. This is there home.. I am sharing this as the negatives seem to be about times are other traditional tourist site issues.. 
This is not a tourist site. but an Art Collection disguised as the family home.. They have docents that walk you thru and share the story behind any piece that you pick out.. The collection is (I think) one of if not the largest single collection of Mexican folk art in Mexico.. Each room holds different pieces some collected and some commissioned.. 
Although they allow children.. I would not bring a child that cannot keep their hands at their sides.. Think full art gallery.. because this is a home there is not room to keep children in a stroller... 
As you enter the Venators own kitchen and dining area the pieces become more focused on Mexican history and famous people... 
We stayed an extra day to visit here and it was worth it.. Please have your hotel or hosts call a day ahead to make sure they are open.. 
Reminder they do live here and if they are out of town or have another event then they will not be able to accommodate you.
We were very privileged to have John himself start our tour then when Darwin was free he took over.. Nice young man.. 
I cannot say enough nice and respectful things about this Gallery or Collection... 
There is a donation box as you leave.. 60 pesos is suggested but no one is making sure you do this.. Honestly, it is worth so much more... 
The home itself has been renovated and it is a piece of art that has been featured in Mexico's Better Homes and Gardens.. 
Again, the negatives seem to come from those that do not understand the Home and the art..

227756982.name: You MUST go here - Highlight of trip!
227756982.author: a TripAdvisor user
227756982.reviewBody: What an absolutely incredible experience. The Venators have such a beautiful collection of Mexican folk art that left us stunned and in awe. Our lovely guide was super knowledgeable, enthusiastic and friendly--he took us from room to room explaining the stories behind many of the art pieces. I really can\'t explain how amazing the art collection is and how generous the Venators are for inviting us into their home (this is where they live!), plus they are quite philanthropic and help out the local community (if you choose to donate at the end, the money goes to locals who need it, not to buying more art). Do yourself the favor of visiting Casa de los Venados--you won\'t want to leave!

226958438.name: The most stunning house I have ever seen
226958438.author: a TripAdvisor user
226958438.reviewBody: An absolutely stunning house of art which moved me to tears. The owner has truly created something special here that everyone should see if they\'re in Valladolid. The tour guide Darwin was excellent as well. Cannot recommend this place enough!

225550085.name: Best bit of our trip so far! We could have stayed forever!
225550085.author: a TripAdvisor user
225550085.reviewBody: We are so so glad we missed our coach by going instead to casa de Los venados. It literally left us speechless. The most amazing, beautiful house and collection of art we have ever seen. The owners and our guide were wonderful and we are so greatful that thy allowed us into their home, we really wanted to stay forever! We 100% recommend taking the time to visit the house, we really hope to come back sometime as there is too much to see in just one trip! Make sure you arrive at 10am for the little tour! :) Thank you again!

223532495.name: A impressive collection of contemporary Mayan art in a beautifully restored home.
223532495.author: a TripAdvisor user
223532495.reviewBody: Mr. and Mrs. Venator have amassed a wonderful collection of contemporary Mexican art from many regions of Mexico including a large amount of Mayan art from local Valladolid artists, sculptors and painters.  The size of the collection allows for much diversity while maintaining the continuity of the regional influences in the many pieces.  This is a private residence which is graciously opened daily at 10 AM for a free tour.  Donations are collected and all money collected is donated to local charities.  See not only the amazing collection of art pieces but also tour parts of the remodeled homes guest quarters as well as the owners private living space.  This tour is well worth the time and, truly, should not be missed.

221963544.name: Unique and unforgettable
221963544.author: a TripAdvisor user
221963544.reviewBody: Ring the doorbell at 10 am and enter a magical world of Mexican folk art, housed in an incredibly redesigned noble house. This is  a place like no other i have been. Jammed full of an immense collection of folk art from around Mexico, we were guided around by Darwin, who beautifully explained much of what we saw, from the artists and meanings of pieces, to the story behind the amassing of the collection by the owners.  He was clearly passionate about his work and kept us, and two usually impatient teenagers engaged and enthralled.  The house itself is worth the visit, with the old part having been amazingly restored, and the new additions beautifully designed. And the modest cost of your visit helps local charities. A must-see in Valladolid.\n

215232221.name: Fascinating!
215232221.author: a TripAdvisor user
215232221.reviewBody: A must see in Valladolid! So nice to be so warmly welcomed into someone\'s actual home. The collection was wonderful and Darwin brought it all to life through his brilliant explanations. Shame the owners were away as we would have loved to have met them. The Frida Kahlo room was a highlight as well as the stunning pool!

214674637.name: Outstanding
214674637.author: a TripAdvisor user
214674637.reviewBody: Very interesting and beautiful. Great tour guide and the owner even came to welcome us to his home at the beginning of the tour.  Do not miss this opportunity.

213780478.name: Amazing collection
213780478.author: a TripAdvisor user
213780478.reviewBody:
This place is a hidden gem! The collection of pop art displayed here is vast and beautiful. Every piece is placed strategically to be admired to the fullest.
Darwin was amazing, he knew every piece and the history behind it. 
A nice surprise was to meet Mr. Venator! He was so nice! 

Definitely a must if you are in Valladolid.

212538324.name: Really Fabulous collection of Culture
212538324.author: a TripAdvisor user
212538324.reviewBody: i loved that all the areas of Mexico were represented in the handicrafts that were collected. It was amazing to see the vast array of artwork. I love the Frida Kahlo themed room and the Dia de los Muertos calaveras.

212193547.name: Extraordinary collection in an extraordinary house.
212193547.author: a TripAdvisor user
212193547.reviewBody: It\'s simply mind-blowing how many pieces have been collected in the house, and how many they are still collecting. The tour is worth it to get a story behind a lot of the pieces presented there, and house itself is a beautiful ground for displaying everything. This is a cultural gem in Valladolid, and cannot be missed.

211363867.name: fabulous museum
211363867.author: a TripAdvisor user
211363867.reviewBody: You have to arrive at 10am for the tour. It is well worth doing - the collection is fascinating. Rather anonymous from the outside - in fact difficult to spot.

206893816.name: Mandatory visit for everyone to valladolid
206893816.author: a TripAdvisor user
206893816.reviewBody: I do not normally write reviews for attractions, only for hotels, but had to write one for this place as it is amazing. There is so much to see in one place, one doesn\'t know where to look. All of the art has a story and is interesting and varied. The actual house itself is amazing to look at. This is better than any museum or gallery and the entrance fee is donated to charity. The guide made it very interesting too. There is a lot to look at and the place is very memorable, this was a real surprise and better than what I expected.

204866588.name: A must see
204866588.author: a TripAdvisor user
204866588.reviewBody: Wow.  The residence is fabulous and the folk art amazing. Definitely worth taking a trip to Valladolid to see

204585720.name: Better than a museum!
204585720.author: a TripAdvisor user
204585720.reviewBody: We recently visited Casa de los Venados on the recommendation of our B&B host, Dennis Larson of Casa Hamaca. The Casa de los Venados is a private home owned by John Venator and his wife. They are avid collectors of Mexican Folk Art and there cannot be a better collection anywhere in the world. The home is huge and just a couple doors from the central plaza making it very easy to find. They purchased the home in early 2000s and took 8 years to completely restore it. They give tours every day at 10:00am. One of the owner\'s staff members led the tour and his knowledge of the art and artists was amazing. I don\'t know how he remembered all of the artists names for every piece, and what part of Mexico the piece was from. Even if you think you are not a fan of Mexican Folk Art you will love this tour. Seeing the home, where John and his wife live every day is fascinating. The home is often used for events and many Mexican politicians have visited and conferred various awards to John and his wife, who donate all admission donations to local charities. We chatted at length with John after the tour as he and my husband are both Rotarians. John even walked with us to town and helped us get a good deal at a nice shop. John and his wife do much for the town of Valladolid and the arts community and patronizing the Casa helps local charities so you cannot go wrong visiting Casa de los Venados!

204461063.name: An outstanding private museum!
204461063.author: a TripAdvisor user
204461063.reviewBody: La Casa de los Venados is a private historical colonial house, right off the main square, which has been totally renovated by the current owners in order to house their most impressive collection of Mexican popular art...perhaps the largest collection in private hands in the world. I was lucky enough to be the only one signed in for the daily morning guided tour, so I got the royal treatment! I even got to meet the owner, a fabulously rich American from Chicago, who, with his wife, has been collecting Mexican popular art for many, many years. The dozens of rooms of the renovated house are chock-a-block filled with gorgeous items coming from all areas of Mexico. I can\'t begin to describe all the objects that are to be seen. As well, the very knowledgeable guide, who speaks both Spanish and English, provides fascinating details about the collection. A minimum monetary contribution is requested, the proceeds going to a local charitable foundation run by the owners. If you\'re in Valladolid and appreciate Mexican art (or if you\'d like to discover it), don\'t pass up this unique tour! You won\'t regret it!

203948686.name: Feast for the senses
203948686.author: a TripAdvisor user
203948686.reviewBody: This house is gorgeous and well worth a visit. The guide was welcoming and informative. The place is jam packed with mexican folk art. We didnt know much about this so it was great to see the range of stuff. The restoration is superb and interesting architecturally as well. Vallodolid is a lovely small town but the casa makes it well worth the stop

202772450.name: Wonderful whimsical meaningful art in a magical setting.
202772450.author: a TripAdvisor user
202772450.reviewBody: This private museum of fantastic Latin American folk art fills up a beautifully remodeled Spanish Colonial home. The American ex-pats invite visitors everyday at 10 am for a personalized tour in Spanish and/ or English.  The Mexican staff are well trained and give fabulous tours.  On our visit, John Venatu, the patriarch collector and owner, was having coffee in the interior patio and spoke with our tour.  He is a lovely and gracious man who loves to share his and his wife\'s personal art collection with everyone.  Admission is free although there is a \'suggested\' but not required, donation. Proceeds go to local schools. The engaging collections fill all the nooks in the house, and, impressively, the tour goes through every room, including the kitchen.  The art in each room is delightful and even stunning. The family has several suites for visiting guests and dignitaries, and each suite has a theme, such as Frida and Diego.  As great as the actual folk art collection is, the house itself is a glorious refurbishment of a hundreds-year old Colonial building.  The pool is to die for - and I\'m sure most visitors feel as I did - that they wish to dive in and enjoy the beauty.  We highly recommend the Casa de los Venados for a utterly unique and enjoyable art and cultural experience.

202483006.name: Worth the trip from Cancun
202483006.author: a TripAdvisor user
202483006.reviewBody: Amazing collection of colorful folk art in the home of the collector.   We were very impressed to be able to tour the home as well as the art work.  Our guide was young and new, but his explanations were well done.   I wish we could have met the owner, but he was away in South America.

201858798.name: Absolutely must see!
201858798.author: a TripAdvisor user
201858798.reviewBody: If you have any interest at all in folk art, you must stop here and have a tour.  This is a private residence but for a donation to a local charity, you will be able to see a great part of this couple\'s stunning collection.  Absolutely amazing, beautiful artwork on display in this gorgeously renovated colonial house!

201209062.name: an unexpected treat
201209062.author: a TripAdvisor user
201209062.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is both a Museum and a home.  The home is set up in a way that guests may come and stay with the owner in a most magnificent setting - if you are so lucky.  As a museum, it houses many artifacts masks presented as a private collection, but open for everyone to see.\n\nthere are a number of apartments each with their own theme and the artifacts in the room exemplify the theme of the room.  The owners offer out their grand ball room for events to fund raise for the community.

199931759.name: It\'s Art!
199931759.author: a TripAdvisor user
199931759.reviewBody: Got the chance to visit Casa de los Venados on our way back to Cancun...our host at Casa Hamaca arranged a special tour for our group.  Wow! Really interesting collection of pieces that cross generations of Mexican/Yucateco folk art...thanks for letting us visit!

199200265.name: Awesome museum of Mexican popular art.
199200265.author: a TripAdvisor user
199200265.reviewBody: Not to be missed. Beautiful colonial mansion with an extraordinary collection of Mexican popular art.

198937844.name: Such a treat!
198937844.author: a TripAdvisor user
198937844.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to be given a tour of this incredible house by the owner John. Both him and his  wife were so kind to answer our questions and most especially to share their home with perfect strangers. You just have to see to believe. One of our best travel memories EVER!

198583850.name: DO NOT MISS THIS TOUR!!
198583850.author: a TripAdvisor user
198583850.reviewBody: We traveled throughout the Yucatan and this was my favorite thing we did over 10 days. They conduct a tour everyday at 10AM sharp. It is an 18000 sq ft private home of the most amazing art you have ever seen! NOt to mention the interior design and the pool area is jaw dropping. The interesting thing about this place is that it is a guesthouse that is occupied while you tour it and if the philanthropist owners are not traveling the country looking for the  art, they are living there. Interestingly, beyond the invaluable art the place is completely non ostentatious. No doubt it is upscale with stainless appliances and very contemporary furniture, but not excessive. However, there isn\'t a  square inch on the walls or floor that aren\'t occupied by art. Three dimensional and wall art. But the best thing about this place is the education you receive about Mexican art culture and its significance. I used to think it was all just tacky tourist garbage. Not true. Incredible learning experience!

198169729.name: If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would
198169729.author: a TripAdvisor user
198169729.reviewBody: We decided to visit based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor.  This attraction far exceeded our expectations.  It was a living museum, a feast for the eyes.  I could easily return again and again, there was so much to see.  Great value.  Show up for the daily 10am tour.  Approximately 1 hour, and a $6 donation suggested.  Our guide was excellent.  Owners still live there, but were not home the day we visited.  Very interesting folk art.  \nWhile this place is difficult to describe, just trust those that have gone before.  It truly is a do not miss experience.

197419126.name: Don\'t miss this!
197419126.author: a TripAdvisor user
197419126.reviewBody: The art collection is absolutely world-class and not to be missed.  You get a tour of the house, which is fabulous and filled with every type of Mexican art and pottery, collected lovingly over many years.  Tour takes about an hour----photos encouraged---you\'ll be thinking and talking about it for years to come.  What a vision this man has had, and what a contribution!

197342340.name: Beautiful home, splendid folk art collection
197342340.author: a TripAdvisor user
197342340.reviewBody: I have spent years in Mexico and have devoted much of that time to learning about Mexican folk art.  The collection at Casa de los Venados is the best personal collection I have ever seen.  The Venators open their private home every day to visitors at 10:00.  If John is at home, as he was the day we visited, he offers a personal tour, explaining the stories behind the award winning home and many of the individual pieces.  This is a must-visit spot for anyone with an interest in Mexican craft and traditional art.

197207039.name: Must see
197207039.author: a TripAdvisor user
197207039.reviewBody: American man, the owner of the house, took us to a walk trought the house and told us so many stories about the past and how they reconstructed the house, what they do... \nYou will have chance to see so many pieces of modern art. This is house museum that offers pieces you will not be able to see anywhere else. Entrance is free of charge but they do ask a donation of cca 60 pesos per person or more. \nTour is organized once a day - every morning at 10 am so don\'t be late :)

197176217.name: Promise you will regret missing out on this!!
197176217.author: a TripAdvisor user
197176217.reviewBody: It really makes your Trip when a discovery such as Casa de los Venados happens.  Definitely the NUMBER ONE attraction on Valladolid. Why?? This is a one of kind place. The owners John and Dorianne Venator a lovely couple have devoted a great part of their life in putting together one of the best and biggest collection of Mexican folk art. What\u2019s unique about it?? You ask! This is no ordinary museum. No long lines, no tickets or souvenir shop at the end. This place was designed to be a house where the owners could retire and live the remains parts of their lives. And as a house there are several suites each with their living rooms, bathrooms and interior gardens. Big dinning halls and central patios!! Go and see how a museum meets a \u201cCasona\u201d (big house or mansion).  A small donation to the local clinic is asked!! A small gesture for such a big privilege. \nWord of advice! Tours are only in the morning after 10am. Call before hand and try to make a group if possible.  Remember this is a full operating \u201cCasona\u201d so visiting hours are restricted.

197018771.name: Casa de los Venados
197018771.author: a TripAdvisor user
197018771.reviewBody: We very much enjoyed our tour of Casa de los Venados.  My only regret was that we could not spend a longer time enjoying the amazing collection of art work.  It will be a regular stop on my trips to Valladolid in the future. Both the host and his employee were gracious and professional in showing us around this amazing restored home.

196631260.name: Wow
196631260.author: a TripAdvisor user
196631260.reviewBody: Extensive collection of folk art in beautifully restored home.  Take photographs to record some of the more spectacular pieces.  Owner and his wife seem especially proud of their acquisitions.  These are Americans who can afford some of the best works, but also acquire very humble local art.  Good for them.

196352344.name: The most unique attraction in Valladolid
196352344.author: a TripAdvisor user
196352344.reviewBody: The tour of this house, every morning at 10:00, is free and well worth the time. The owners have collected an amazing amount of Mexican folk and fine art and share their home with the public to enjoy it.\nIt is by far the most unusual attraction in town. You\'ll never see anything like it.

196016306.name: Must see!
196016306.author: a TripAdvisor user
196016306.reviewBody: This is non-negotiable. There is not reason to miss this wonderful collection. The owner is so generous with his time and his privacy that everyone is welcome to have a look. He is open every day, and I will go again, since it is impossible to digest the extent of his display in one visit.\nThank you !!

195908096.name: Fantastic collection of Mexican Folk Art in a wonderful setting
195908096.author: a TripAdvisor user
195908096.reviewBody:
This private US expat collector has made available for viewing his well considered collection of Mexican folk art ranging from local artisans to commissioned works.  We had a great tour from the owner and were pleased we could view this as part of our trip to Chichen Itza and Ek Balam.

This collection is not to be missed!

There is a suggested modest that goes for charity medical care for mexicans.

195799011.name: Bizarre but so interesting!
195799011.author: a TripAdvisor user
195799011.reviewBody: We managed to book a tour straight away on arrival in Valladolid and in fact we were the only people on the tour given by a very enthusiastic young man. The house is amazing, like most Mexican houses, it does not look particularly wonderful from the outside but it has been renovated to a very high standard and is just beautiful! As well as the main rooms we were shown the guest suites, the owners section and the pool area. Everywhere there is a most amazing exhibition of art work, ceramics and painted furniture  - a  life\'s work and no doubt what is clearly a labour of love for the owners in choosing and displaying their beautiful (and sometimes weird and wonderful) collection.

195610764.name: Introduction to Mexican Folk art
195610764.author: a TripAdvisor user
195610764.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the tour around Casa de los Venados.  The range of art at times can be overwhelming - there are so many great pieces to see that you just can\'t take it all in.  A fantastic collection which takes about an hour to walk through.  Well worth the time.\n\nGreat to hear some of the explanations of the various types of folk art, and some of the artists stories too.  What a great building - loved the colours.   John & his wife do so much for the local community & for Mexican art - the donation for the tour goes to local community.  John was also kind enough to recommend some places to purchase some art  which we were looking for - which we visited & found some great pieces. Very enjoyable.

195169458.name: Really Beautiful Place
195169458.author: a TripAdvisor user
195169458.reviewBody: This was an amazing house and what wonderful work has been done to restore it and plan it.  I absolutely loved the art work here - all aspects of it.  I am so glad that we visited and it is very photogenic.  Thank You for sharing your fabulous home & quirky art collection.

194035601.name: Almost unbelievable
194035601.author: a TripAdvisor user
194035601.reviewBody: One of the cultural highlights of our trip to Mexico. If you are in Valladolid you HAVE to visit this treasure trove of mexican art. Highly recommended

193785054.name: A veritable treasure trove of native art
193785054.author: a TripAdvisor user
193785054.reviewBody: We would highly rrecommend a visit to this wonderful (and extensive!) collection of native art in a spectacular private house The ancient building has been brilliantly restored and blended with modern architecture without loosing anything of its aancient charm and heritage .\nA real "must see" when in Vallidolid

193687059.name: Colorful world of folk art - hidden in Valladolid
193687059.author: a TripAdvisor user
193687059.reviewBody: Incredible, huge house that has been properly renovated to modern standards, while still retaining its original charm. The collection of folk art is unsurpassed, and the ability to view it in a private home adds a certain specialness to it. Definitely worth a visit if you have any extra time, and it only takes a couple of hours to take it all in.

193374467.name: A museum in a private home
193374467.author: a TripAdvisor user
193374467.reviewBody: If you make it to the beautiful little colonial city of Valladolid don\'t miss "La casa de los venados". This is the private collection of John and Dorianne Venator which they have gathered over more than 15 years. They bought their beautiful hacienda style home and remodeled it with exquisite taste. Over the years they have filled it with over 3000 museum quality pieces of folk art from every corner of Mexico. Some objects are found and some were commissioned but all are of the highest quality. At 10 AM each day they generously open their doors to the public for tours both in  English and Spanish and we were lucky enough to have John himself tell us all about his passion for collecting. A 60 peso donation is requested though not mandatory and every bit of it goes to local charity. My guess is that with overhead running these tours cost them money but it is their way to share what they love and also help the community. This stop is truly not to be missed.

193358638.name: Worth it for the restored house alone
193358638.author: a TripAdvisor user
193358638.reviewBody: This place is stunning. Definitely should appear firmly on everyone\'s itinerary who plans a visit to Valladolid! There are some great works of Frita here as well. Before you go, watch the movie about Frita and you\'ll have a better understanding of her importance in Mexico if you don\'t already know about her.

193358194.name: Amazing folk art collection.
193358194.author: a TripAdvisor user
193358194.reviewBody: Just beautiful! What a lovely collection. Be sure to make the effort to see it. The guide is very knowledgable and the home itself an architectural delight.

192978551.name: wonderful house with owners\' private collection
192978551.author: a TripAdvisor user
192978551.reviewBody: a daily 10AM tour (guided) through the restored house of an American couple who have traveled and purchased extensively throughout Mexico.  Their collection of folk art is interesting and well displayed.  Additionally, the donation that you provide as payment for the tour is put to very good use in local charities.

192966166.name: This amazing art collection and house is worth the trip to Valladolid, and we had the priviledge of meeting  the owner
192966166.author: a TripAdvisor user
192966166.reviewBody: We hired a driver for the 1 hour 40 minute drive from Maya Riviera because we wanted to see the colonial city of Valladolid, we just happened on the 10 am tour of casa de los venados (deer).  It was a highlight of our trip, if you enjoy folk art and Mexican history you shouldn\'t miss this tour.  We had the honor of meeting the American owner who provided details on the reconstruction and even graciously answered personal questions.  This collection is unsurpassed from any I\'ve seen and I have travelled a lot in Mexico.

192661317.name: fantastic collection of Mexican folk art in restored villa
192661317.author: a TripAdvisor user
192661317.reviewBody: You need to take a tour as it is a private house. The English tour is 10AM. You are allowed to photograph as you please.

192615195.name: Colourful and exuberant and sometimes mysterious world of Mexican folk art.
192615195.author: a TripAdvisor user
192615195.reviewBody: An exceptional collection in beautiful surroundings enthusiastically hosted. The otherworldly quality of Mexican folk culture comes across with great energy.

192152366.name: LOVED THIS PLACE
192152366.author: a TripAdvisor user
192152366.reviewBody: I took a side trip from Tulum to Vallodolid on a friend\'s recommendation.  I was not disappointed either with the town, which was lovely and charming or the museum and tour.  The folk art was wonderful, the architecture of the owner\'s home was amazing, and the tour was really interesting.  I didn\'t the suggested donation was out of line, especially in light of the fact that this man has opened up his home daily for tours and gives a great amount of money to the local schools for art projects.  Can\'t remember the name of the restaurant where we ate, but it was really beautiful, near the town square.  I would have enjoyed staying in this town for a few nights, rather than just for the day.  Not touristy, very beautiful and peaceful.

191766804.name: Wonderful museum
191766804.author: a TripAdvisor user
191766804.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados was high on our list of places to visit in Valladolid, and it didn\'t let us down.  Our tour started a bit late due to a field trip before we started, but we were in vacation mode, so it wasn\'t an issue for us.  The tour was quite extensive, the guide knowledgeable,  and the art collection is just amazing.  I think my husband could have spent the whole day just taking photos.  Highly recommend if you\'re interested in Mexican folk art.

191466732.name: Not to be missed!
191466732.author: a TripAdvisor user
191466732.reviewBody: Anyone visiting Valladolid should put Casa de los Vendos at the top of their sightseeing list.  This home-turned-museum displays an impressive collection of over 3,000 pieces of Mexican folk art.  The home itself is beautiful, and the art is unique and interesting and displayed to magnificent effect.  We were not in the city during normal tour time, but owner and host John Venator offered to give us a private tour.  His stories of friendship with many of the artists and explanations on how many of the pieces were either acquired or commissioned added a lot to the tour. His love of art and beauty is contagious.  There is no fee, but a donation is appreciated which goes directly to charities.  Truly outstanding!

190539922.name: A Must See
190539922.author: a TripAdvisor user
190539922.reviewBody:
This is an excellent place to visit if you are there at the right time.  It is a private home with a huge collection of Yucatan / Mexican folk art.  

Important information to know.  Tours are at 10am only.  A donation of $60 peso's is required - take change as none is available.  

I would do this tour a second time in a heart beat.

190181226.name: Mexican folk art and commitment
190181226.author: a TripAdvisor user
190181226.reviewBody: As impressive as the artwork is, I found it notable how personally involved the home\'s owners and community benefactors are. Their dedication to the city and community and artisans is remarkable. thanks to Miriany for a memorable tour. Be sure to not miss this gem in Valladolid!

190148582.name: Don\'t miss this!
190148582.author: a TripAdvisor user
190148582.reviewBody: This house and collection is jaw-dropping--really, not to be missed. We also went to a Christmas concert there that was lovely.

189931326.name: Amazing Private Folk Art Collection
189931326.author: a TripAdvisor user
189931326.reviewBody: Wow! I don\'t think I would want a hoard of strangers traipsing through my home every day at 10 am, but I am glad the Venators don\'t mind. They have amassed a most beautiful collection of folk art from all over Mexico. I\'ve gone twice! Absolutely gorgeous!

189896923.name: Impressive collection!
189896923.author: a TripAdvisor user
189896923.reviewBody: This is an extremely impressive and beautiful collection of Mexican folk art in a lovely house. The English-speaking guide was very knowledgeable and the owners were very welcoming- they even invited us for cake and a drink after as it was three kings day! \n\nDefinitely recommend, even if you wouldn\'t normally visit galleries/art collections. Donations from the tour go to a local charity, which is a great bonus.

189873004.name: My review is inadequate - go to the website.
189873004.author: a TripAdvisor user
189873004.reviewBody: The main reason for our visit to Valladolid was Casa de los Venados.  It\'s a private home and Mexican folk and modern art museum. The owners have been collecting Mexican art for over 50 years. Just about all of the furniture in the house/museum is art.  The most notable was the dining set with chairs painted with the faces of famous people including Frida Kahlo. Lot\'s of paintings of Frida Kahlo. Also, as we found elsewhere in Mexico, the were calaveras (skeletons) everywhere. There is no way my review can really describe the museum.  Find the website and look at the pictures.\n\nWe made advanced reservations for the once a day tour.

189537841.name: Decent if you are in the area
189537841.author: a TripAdvisor user
189537841.reviewBody: Typically, you wouldn\'t be making a separate trip to Valladolid.  It\'s a perfect stop over en route to fill up gas and spend some time here before you head back to Cancun.  The church itself is nothing spectacular.  Valladolid is a nice small colonial town (the original Valladolid is in Spain).

189229037.name: A wonderful collection of folk art in a beautiful setting
189229037.author: a TripAdvisor user
189229037.reviewBody: This was a beautiful collection of folk art in a lovely setting. A small group for a tour through the home with a very nice English speaking guide. My only complaint is that we wished we could have stayed longer! They request a 60 pesos donation per person that is given to the local community. Would definitely recommend.

188711666.name: Wonderful way to spend a few hours of your morning in Valladolid, MX
188711666.author: a TripAdvisor user
188711666.reviewBody: I had a tough time convincing my Mexican family members that this would be worth our time, but having always valued what I read on TripAdvisor, I managed to convince them to give this place a shot. Admission was free (they do as for donations, which goes back to the local community), and it was AMAZING. My Mexican friends left with their jaws on the floor. The house is very beautiful, with I believe over 3,000 pieces of art not just from the Yucatan, but from all throughout the country of Mexico. Not being a particular fan of art, I was blown away by just how awesome this place was. If you\'re looking for something unique to do in Valladolid, you won\'t go wrong with La Casa de los venados (owned by a couple from Chicago but they are very appreciative of Mexican art and Mexico in general). Tour was very informative.

188488738.name: Fabulous Mexican Folk Art Collection
188488738.author: a TripAdvisor user
188488738.reviewBody: An absolute "must see".  Not only the Folk Art, but the beautifully designed home.  We also met the delightful owners.  They have guided tours for a 60 pesos donation which the owners give to charity.  They have an English/Spanish speaking tour guide.  A very sweet lady.

188407527.name: Fabulous place not to be missed!
188407527.author: a TripAdvisor user
188407527.reviewBody: Incredible architecture, amazing and plentiful art.\nGreat experience not to be missed! We enjoyed this place and highly recommend a visit here.

187823827.name: Hidden Gem xXx
187823827.author: a TripAdvisor user
187823827.reviewBody: While we stayed in Valladolid a guest that was staying at the same hostel as us recommended we check this place out. We\'re so glad that we did. This collection of artwork is so unique, such a wide range of different styles and pieces that work wonderfully in such beautiful surrounding. The house itself is beautiful. Many thanks to our guide who showed us around, also to the owner, it was lovely to have a little chat at the end of our tour, and also to the owners dog who gave us a warm welcome. Would definitely recommend checking this place out, make sure you book a timeslot xXx

187486963.name: Beautiful home!
187486963.author: a TripAdvisor user
187486963.reviewBody: The guide was great. The couple that owns it live in it and are art collectors, the art being from all over Mexico. They are originally from Chicago and have made a gorgeous home and showpiece in Valladolid.

185974154.name: A unique place in Valladolid!
185974154.author: a TripAdvisor user
185974154.reviewBody: A unique place in Valladolid. Mexican Popular art at its best! This is a must-do when in Cancun or Merida.

184611815.name: Do not miss this!
184611815.author: a TripAdvisor user
184611815.reviewBody: You must plan ahead since reservations are needed for the tour, but it is well worth it.  The art collection in this private home is museum quality and there is lots of it.  The home itself is gorgeous and walking into it, you will realize you have found a little paradise.

184148209.name: Highlight of Valladolid
184148209.author: a TripAdvisor user
184148209.reviewBody: Be sure to stop by at 10 am for the tour of Casa de los Venados.  You will not be disappointed.  The guide is excellent and house and artifacts are unbelievable.  The only downside is that you will never be able to look at Mexican folkart the same; everything else will look shoddy by comparison!  I have visited Mexico since the early 70s and can relate to the owner\'s love of Mexico since visiting so many years ago.

183473209.name: Wonderful collection - make some time to visit
183473209.author: a TripAdvisor user
183473209.reviewBody: Tour happens once a day @ 10am Sharp...so don\'t show up late. Incredible to step off the road and into this private residence to see the most elaborate art collection. We enjoyed the distraction from the rest of this wonderful little town/city.\nDo yourself a favor and pay them a visit - donation of 60 pesos per person if I remember correctly...all goes to a great cause and supports people in need.

183401002.name: A beautiful house/museo full of wonderful Mexican folk arts
183401002.author: a TripAdvisor user
183401002.reviewBody: Waited at the door at 9:55AM on my last day in Valladolid. Door opened promptly at 10AM and the excellent female guide gave us a marvelous one hour tour of this beautiful house filled with enormous collection of Mexican folk arts. If you\'re in Valladolid and if time allowed, make sure to join this free, daily 10AM one hour tour.

183215486.name: Great House
183215486.author: a TripAdvisor user
183215486.reviewBody: The mexican art collection is amazing. \nThe XVI century house has been restored to its former glory. \nI specially like the Frida Kalo room.

183074800.name: A Real Treat while in Valladolid
183074800.author: a TripAdvisor user
183074800.reviewBody: American John Venator remodeled this grand house and it now houses a tremendously valuable and interesting collection of Mexican Folk Art. What a place!

182406121.name: The Alchemical Combination of Intuition and Taste
182406121.author: a TripAdvisor user
182406121.reviewBody: Creating a collection of art is both personal and collective. Personal in that it reflects the taste of the buyer. Collective in that someday, even private collections, become public. In the case of John and Dorianne\'s collection at Casa de los Venados, there is an merging of these two interests. Collections also fall into the very personal and be damned about the resale value; and the ones curated with resale as the prime motivation. In this case, passion, taste and an informed intuition of form, materiality and juxtapositions have conspired to create a truly wonderful setting where arte popular can be seen in the context with similar regions and artists. There is a broad sweep of the range of craft and artistic interpretation from all over Mexico. They collected what they liked and felt best resonated with their artistic spirit. John and Dorianne have graciously opened their house and even more magnanimously created a 501(c)3 not-for-profit to ensure this superb collection remains for generations to witness. My only slight reservation was the tributes to Frida and Diego--this seemed a bit theatrical and out of context to the wonders of the "arte popular". Go see this collection...it is worth a detour.

182330342.name: The kids eyes popped out of their heads!
182330342.author: a TripAdvisor user
182330342.reviewBody: What a little gem this place is. John was super kind and gracious letting us in despite our schedule running rather late. I haven\'t see the kids so quiet all week - they were agog (and enjoyed it much more than Chichen Itza!) Fabulous to see what a lot of passion and some focus can do for a collection and really wonderful seeing it in a private family home. This is a must see for anyone in the area.

181268299.name: Restored Ruin and Folk Art
181268299.author: a TripAdvisor user
181268299.reviewBody: This house is a restored ruin (very well done) that is amazing with a collection of Mexican Folk Art that is over the top.  Don\'t miss the opportunity to show up at 10 AM for the only guided tour of the day.  The modest donation requested is donated to local charities.  Well worth the 60-90 minute tour.

180742654.name: Wow!!! JUST GO AND SEE FOR YOURSELF
180742654.author: a TripAdvisor user
180742654.reviewBody: We were recommended that we must visit this amazing home and its collection of Mexican folk and contemporary art. Well it is worth ringing the bell just before 10am to be let into the collection, dont worry if you dont like art galleries its nothing like youve seen before and I bet you wish you could stay in one the suites. You will find amazing and amusing things side by side. GO AND SUPPORT THE GOOD CAUSES its worth the hour or so of your precious holiday time.\nThankyou John and Dorianne \n

178134479.name: Beautiful Mexican art and handicrafts!
178134479.author: a TripAdvisor user
178134479.reviewBody: The Casa de los Venados is one of the best places to appreciate Mexican art and handicrafts, probably only second to the Museo de Arte Popular in Ciudad de Mexico. \nMoreover, the setting in this gorgeous private house is really personal, making the tour like a visit to friends with the owner John Venator giving a personal welcome and chatting with you about his amazing collection.\nMuch better than a standard museum and recommended also for children (aged 6 and above).

176550632.name: It was one of  the highlight of our trip to the Yucatan.
176550632.author: a TripAdvisor user
176550632.reviewBody: We had been encouraged to go and I\'m so glad we did.  The tour was great (fun to have Mia along!) and John and Dorianne were gracious hosts.  The art was all so much fun.  And it\'s great that they give all the donations to help local people.

175988594.name: Impresive!
175988594.author: a TripAdvisor user
175988594.reviewBody: I visited Casa de los Venados last wednesday and  it was simply impresive! I had heard about it, and thereefore had some epectatikns. Surprisingly, my excoectatins were not only met, but very far exceeded! From the minute we arrived, being greeted by Fredy and Mia, inmediately followed by the hosts, John and Dorian, every minute of the visit was spectacular. The pride with which John and Dorian keep and share their collection adds a lot of spectacularity to the already spectacular collection. They actually take you in their house to share with you their beautiful and impresive display of Mexican Folk Art. If you are in, or around, Valladolid, this is defi itely a must. Thank you John and Dorin and all your amazing staff for a beautiful visit.

175086824.name: Amazing art collection
175086824.author: a TripAdvisor user
175086824.reviewBody: We just turned up (walked from our hotel) at 10am one morning and were given a comprehensive tour of the house - each room is packed with really interesting art. Not sterile (dare I say, boring) stuff like in a gallery, but accessible, really interesting pieces (many focussed on death!) absolutely everywhere. Much of it is integral to the home rather than just ornamental. The house itself is also fabulous - I really wanted to be the Canadian diplomat who would be staying there as a guest that night! And the pool looked SO inviting! A brief pleasant chat with the owner, who recommended places to visit in the area. I\'d like to say that our teenage children enjoyed it as much as we did, but that might be going too far! Very happy to make a donation to local charities at the end of the tour.

172567289.name: Amazing Collection of Art
172567289.author: a TripAdvisor user
172567289.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados was very easy to find just off the main plaza.  We rang the doorbell around 2:00 in the afternoon and Fredy answered the door.  He immediately informed us that the house is in fact a private home.  He proceeded to give us a private tour of the house while sharing stories, histories, and facts about the spectacular collection of Mexican art displayed all over the house.  As the only 2 there, our tour was not rushed nor held up.  I am glad that I had the chance to view this unique and beautiful art collection.  GO SEE IT!....

171740617.name: Casa De Los Venados great place to visit
171740617.author: a TripAdvisor user
171740617.reviewBody:
Kolekcija je odlicna, arhitektura impresionantno povezala staro sa novim. Vodici besprekorni i sjajni domacini koji su nam dozvolili da razgledamo kucu van vremena zakazanog za posete. 

If you are traveling just in Yucatan, this place is must to see it's great collection of Mexican popular art is hard to find on one place here. Host were  great and  bilingual guide will provide you with more then enough informations. House architecture  is magic connection old and new. 
Great time and will be one of places I will always visited on my way to Yucatan.

169779896.name: Really worth a detour to see this place
169779896.author: a TripAdvisor user
169779896.reviewBody: We had no idea that such a place existed. The collection of Mexican folk art is staggering, and we had a private tour as the only guests on the day we visited.  This is a truly impressive collection that shouldn\'t be missed.  Not to mention that the entire entry fee (which is not expensive) goes to charity in support of the local community.  Highly recommended if you are in the area.

169554702.name: Fantastico!
169554702.author: a TripAdvisor user
169554702.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is a fabulously funky and enchanting experience. This unique gallery of exquisite and colourful art pieces will entice every traveller .... even children and those not usually inclined to visit galleries. Every room in this amazing private house is tastefully and delightfully embellished with Mexican folk art. The owners and guide are friendly and welcoming. Do not miss this attraction if you are in Valladolid .... and if Valladolid wasn\'t on your itinerary, it is worth including it for this wonderful attraction and the quaintness of this lovely Mayan town.

168166437.name: Amazing place
168166437.author: a TripAdvisor user
168166437.reviewBody: Loved the decor and building and got a really good feel for modern Mexican art. You need to get there at 10am, but don\'t miss.

166910364.name: Amazing mexican art! and the money is for a very good cause.
166910364.author: a TripAdvisor user
166910364.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is still somewhat unknown to tourists in general. We were the only ones there. You don\'t find it in tourist guides, for example, at least not yet. But it is definitely worthwile. You get the chance to see a huge collection of amazing traditional/modern mexican art. Tours are only available once a day, around 10am, since it\'s a private house museum. When you\'re in Valladolid, check it out!

166858597.name: Gorgeous Hacienda, Great Tour!
166858597.author: a TripAdvisor user
166858597.reviewBody: We were really wowed by this restored Hacienda full of modern Mexican art.  My husband and I were only ones on the tour today. The hostess was really lovely and patient with all my pictures taking.  We met John, the owner of the house.  He was very kind, came by and said "Hello" and then chatted with us several times over the tour.  He and his wife Dorrian  open their lovely home to strangers once a day at 10am.  The tour hostess even took us to their private quarters.  The tour is free but a donation is suggested.  Proceeds of the donations goes to specific health care facilities or needs for the poor.

163579538.name: Absolute must to visit
163579538.author: a TripAdvisor user
163579538.reviewBody: We were totally amazed by the beautiful collection of mexican folk art and the warm welcome. We learned so much in one our about the mexican culture. It makes the rest of our trip even more interesting. And no entrance fee but a donation of 60 pesos or more. What a great way to help the local community!

161897509.name: Absolutely Fantastic
161897509.author: a TripAdvisor user
161897509.reviewBody: We had read about this place on trip advisor, but it was the owner of our hotel (Casa Hamacas) who really recommended we visit. We weren\'t sure really what to expect, but we went along to the 10am tour (donation of M$60 per person which goes to charity). The house is a private house, but was opened up to tours because of the amount of interest it was getting, and in the process they are raising money for charity focusing on health for the poor in Valladolid. A very friendly Fredy showed us round with 2 other people. I just cannot describe the impact of the thousands of pieces on display - as furniture, decoration and just for fun - has when you walk in. We weren\'t particuarly interested in Mexican Folk Art, primarily because we didn\'t know very much about it, but this is a DO NOT MISS!

161718009.name: A Spectacular Collection of Mexican Folk Art
161718009.author: a TripAdvisor user
161718009.reviewBody: We recently brought guests of ours to see the amazing collection of Mexican Folk Art  at the private museum, Casa de los Venados, in Valladolid. We had been there a year before and were so impressed by the art and by the house itself, so tastefully and lovingly restored, that we have been  recommending it to all our visitors. The Venadors, owners of this largest private collection have created a perfect blend of art and setting, offering visitors a unique visual experience. There is no better place to gain an understanding of the creative spirit of the Mexican people. The guides on the 10 A.M. tours are informative and friendly and and it is a special bonus if you have the chance to meet John Venador, who often comes out to greet visitors. Discovering this unique gem has encouraged us to consider Valladolid worth more than a lunch stop.

161640692.name: what a wonderful ecclectic and awe inspiring collection
161640692.author: a TripAdvisor user
161640692.reviewBody: Before visiting Casa de los Venados I did not know anything about Mexican folk art but having seen such a fascinating and incredible and wonderful collection wow I am now an interested follower and admire how such a fascinating collection has been so beautifully put together and displayed   I look forward to returning and again visiting casa de los Venados

160117024.name: Remarkable
160117024.author: a TripAdvisor user
160117024.reviewBody:
How often do you get to see something very special, and at the same time help those less fortunate. We went here on the recommendation of our hosts at La Selva Mariposa, and our visit turned out to be a visit we will not forget. Our guide, Francisco, with his "Brooklyn is King" tee shirt and NY Yankee hat (perfect for this NY couple) was knowledgeable and charming. The owner, John Venator was very gracious and welcoming, as was his wife Dorianne ( not to mention their great little Scotch Terrier.

What we have here is a beautiful and stunning house (ten years in the making) filled with the most incredible pieces of Mexican Folk Art you will ever see this side of Mexico City. After the tour you are asked to make a donation which will be used for local charities as well as to other charities through the owners' charitable foundation.

Do not leave the Yucatan without visiting this remarkable private house museum. A must see for art lovers and everyone else.

159031166.name: Don\'t miss this place
159031166.author: a TripAdvisor user
159031166.reviewBody: We extended our time in Valladolid to take the 10am tour here, and we\'re so glad we did. It was just my wife and I on the tour - and it was fantastic. The house itself is amazing, and all the folk art is spectacular. It\'s free to go, but they suggest a 60 pesos donation at the end, which we were happy to give. We met John (the owner) who was super nice, and suggested some additional places to visit in Valladolid area as well.

158515819.name: Spectacular folk art collection
158515819.author: a TripAdvisor user
158515819.reviewBody: Don\'t miss Casa de los Venados. This immaculately restored mansion is filled with folk art from many regions of Mexico. Every wall, counter, and corner holds yet another beautiful example of Mexico\'s finest. Our guide, Fredy, was fantastic\u2013knowledgeable and friendly. Plan accordingly, the tours are limited. There is no fee but they ask for donations that support health services for kids. I wish I had more cash with me as I would have given more.

158488880.name: We love Casa de los Venados!
158488880.author: a TripAdvisor user
158488880.reviewBody: We took the daily 10am tour around Casa de los Venados and enjoyed it immensely. The house itself is breathtaking and a joy to walk around. The restored hacienda-style private home also has some modern aspects, the architect did an amazing job here. And no where else in Mexico will you get the chance to see such a beautiful private selection of folk art. If you are in Valladolid, make the time to visit Casa de los Venados, it is a real treat and a privilege. And don\'t forget the suggested $5 donation charge for the tour goes to help local charities.

156652100.name: Amazing collection
156652100.author: a TripAdvisor user
156652100.reviewBody: This is simply the most amazing collection of Mexican folk art you will ever see, displayed in a beautiful home. We were blown away. They do tours at 10 each morning, lasting 20-30 minutes. Admission is free, but they take donations at the end which are used for social and health services. Our kids enjoyed it too.

156164384.name: Amazing
156164384.author: a TripAdvisor user
156164384.reviewBody: I loved it all and the fact that it is a private collection that the owner is willing to share makes it even more special.Check it out ahead of time as the house may not be open other than at a certain time of day.

156067388.name: Wow!
156067388.author: a TripAdvisor user
156067388.reviewBody:
I thought this would be a nice attraction, but it was even better than we could have guessed.  The collection is amazing but the stories behind the origins of the pieces and the house instead were equally engaging.

It was also interesting that our tour passed through the kitchen where the owner was having breakfast with his wife and friends.  They offered interesting insights into the collection and were extremely gracious.  A really interesting experience.

No fee, but they do request donations for different medical charity endeavors.  Very cool.

154707749.name: Best attraction in Valladolid. Senorita Dorriane is a doll!
154707749.author: a TripAdvisor user
154707749.reviewBody:
There are always a few moments from your trip that always stand out more then the rest. "Casa de los Venados" is one of those moments for us. I am a huge art lover and all the art was so beautiful with a story to go along with each and every piece. Although I did love the art. The moment that stood out for me/us more was meeting Dorriane (wife & owner) of the home. She was so informative, beautiful, cute and just and all round treat to meet. She added humor and reality to the tour. 
We took a day trip to Valladolid with another couple . My only regret is that we could not stay & visit with Dorriane longer.  If we came by ourselves we would have spent the rest of the Day with her and rented a hotel room then toured the rest of the sights the next day!
The Art....Ohh the art..It was just beautiful. There are unique pieces every where you look. You could tell each piece was tastefully chosen. Even the bathrooms were beautiful!
We were fortunate enough not only to meet Dorriane but also Mia which is their "Furry tour guide". We became pals and she stayed beside me for most of the tour.
Yes this was my favorite attractions in Valladolid. And I would love to visit it again!

154616121.name: Wonderful, even if Mexican art\u2019s not your thing
154616121.author: a TripAdvisor user
154616121.reviewBody: Our visit to Casa de Los Venados was one of the highlights of our two weeks in the Yucatan. We loved the place just as much as the other reviewers on here, but I\u2019m writing this review specifically for anyone who might think they won\u2019t like the style of art \u2013 we weren\u2019t sure whether we would.\n \nFor a start, the house itself is stunning \u2013 a beautifully restored 17th century mansion. The artworks, which cover every surface, are presented with such clear love and enjoyment, and almost none behind glass or closed away, so it\u2019s clear that you\u2019re seeing someone\u2019s incredible personal art collection, rather than visiting a gallery. We went to a couple of other galleries where similar pieces were displayed individually in white-walled glass cabinets \u2013 that\u2019s just too sterile and soulless for this exuberant, gleefully macabre, highly coloured, deliberately over the top style of art. There\u2019s so much variety that, although we didn\u2019t love everything, we found many pieces we loved, some of them very surprising and different from what we expected, and got a really good idea of the range of art being produced in Mexico \u2013 basically, even if you don\u2019t love everything about the style of art, you\u2019ll learn a lot about Mexican culture. This is clearly a real labour of love, and we felt privileged to be able to see it. It\u2019s a great reason to stay in Valladolid all on its own.

154587690.name: A must-see for art lovers!
154587690.author: a TripAdvisor user
154587690.reviewBody: The Venator\'s home is an art gallery worth seeing.  The guided tour is about an hour, shows you pieces in most rooms, courtyard, back yard and provides brief information about where pieces/artists originate from and how they came to be in the collection. Quite a few of the pieces (at least of the ones most discussed) are commissioned by the Venators and/or copies of pieces in Mexican museums. \n \nDonations are accepted for worthy causes (for instance glasses and eye-examinations for children in need), but be prepared to hear less about the artists (are they up and coming? famous? who knows?) than which politician has been to the Venatnor\'s home for lunch or dinner.

154251324.name: Don\'t miss this!
154251324.author: a TripAdvisor user
154251324.reviewBody: I had the pleasure of visiting Casa de Los Venados in March.  What an experience!  The house itself has been lovingly restored and is absolutely gorgeous!  It is home to an outstanding collection of Mexican folk art and fine art from all different areas.  Mariany (the tour guide) was knowledgeable and has a beautiful smile!  I was lucky enough to go on a day when I had her all to myself.  What a gift the Venators have graciously given all of us!

154209479.name: Highlight of our trip!
154209479.author: a TripAdvisor user
154209479.reviewBody: Words and photographs cannot do this place justice.  You must see it for yourself.  My husband & I made a special point to drive here for the day from Tulum so that we could tour Casa de los Venados.  We were not disappointed.  There are 3000+ pieces of Mexican folk art, all beautifully displayed.  Our tour guide, Fredy, was very knowledgable, answering any and all questions we had about the works of art throughout the home.  It was a pleasure to meet the owner of the home, John Venator.  We were blown away by the sheer volume of art pieces under one roof, as well as the skillful restoration of the sixteenth century home.  While the tour is free, donations go to benefit local charities.  What a treat!

154017121.name: Amazing cultural adventure
154017121.author: a TripAdvisor user
154017121.reviewBody: John Venator and his wife always the gracious host in opening their home to the public in promoting Valladolid Yucatan. Thank you

153942345.name: Must Do
153942345.author: a TripAdvisor user
153942345.reviewBody: This is a private art collection of over 50 years in the making. Donations are collected for hearing aids and eyeglasses for the poor children of the area

153803155.name: Enjoyed our tour of Casa de los Venados
153803155.author: a TripAdvisor user
153803155.reviewBody: We really enjoyed visiting Casa de los Venados, they have a superb collection of Mexican folk art and the setting is wonderful. Just seeing the private home is worth the tour, the guides are well informed and helpful.

153690051.name: Beautiful & unique attraction, art collection in a private home.
153690051.author: a TripAdvisor user
153690051.reviewBody: So lucky that the owners open up their impressive and amazing home, and art collection, to visitors. Donations for admission go to local charities. The collection is impressive and must be seen if you like Mexican art/folk art. Really worth seeing! Central location to the city square/downtown, easy to walk to if you are staying in the city. Be there by 10am for the public tour.

153441311.name: Don\'t miss
153441311.author: a TripAdvisor user
153441311.reviewBody: Not much I can add here except to say don\'t miss this. Not only is this collection impressive but the house itself is amazing. None of the reviews are hyped. Doors open at 10 AM. The tour is well organized and in English.

152676040.name: The Number 1 Thing to Do in Valladolid, Mexico
152676040.author: a TripAdvisor user
152676040.reviewBody:
On Calle 40, just next to the main square, this sensationally restored colonial mansion is the private residence of an American couple, John and Dorianne Venator, who now live in Valladolid. Having spent 35 years building a collection of over 3000 pieces of contemporary Mexican folk art, they then spent nearly 10 years on a spectacular restoration of a derelict mansion to house it (and themselves). Since 2010, they have been accepting visits by individuals or small groups each morning at 10am for tours in English or Spanish (no appointment necessary, just turn up and ring the doorbell). 

Tours last about an hour, and take in the whole house and garden, swimming pool and private living quarters except for the upstairs rooms. The front part of the house is meticulously restored, and laid out as a series of guest rooms facing a central courtyard. The rear of the house is in a contemporary style, including an eye-popping bridge over a very inviting looking swimming pool. Almost every inch of the house is covered with contemporary Mexican art, pottery and sculpture, much of it from the state of Oaxaca (Wahaca). I loved it, and if you look at the pictures below, you may see why. 

Tours of this privately owned home are free, but participants are asked to make a minimum donation of 60 pesos (£3.50) which goes to local charities. A must-do for any visitor to Valladolid.

152649979.name: Don\u00b4t miss it!
152649979.author: a TripAdvisor user
152649979.reviewBody: This is the best collection of Mexican folkart that I\u00b4ve ever seen.\nThere is only one tour a day, which is very informative. The collection itself is full of coulorful objects and a bit overwhelming, but worth checking out if Valladolid is on your list.

152628278.name: Must See
152628278.author: a TripAdvisor user
152628278.reviewBody: So much to see! A wonderful collection of art from all over Mexico. Owners are warm and friendly and greet guests when there. Be sure to take a camera.. you will want to record this beautiful place for friends back home.

152225337.name: Delightful visit
152225337.author: a TripAdvisor user
152225337.reviewBody: What a wonderful gift to the city of Valladoilid and to its visitors.  It was a privilege to tour the beautifully remodeled home and see this amazing collection of Mexican folk art.  The tour guide was gracious and well informed and the owners are most generous in allowing access to so much of their lovely home.  The house is easy to find just a quarter block from the Zocolo and the Tourist Info Center.  Allow about one hour, but do be there a few minutes before 10 a.m.to get the full tour.

152187676.name: Very worthwhile expedition to ad on while visiting the pyramids in this area
152187676.author: a TripAdvisor user
152187676.reviewBody: The best private art collection you will ever see plus the seeing the house itself is well worth the trip.

151598377.name: Breath taking folkart exquisitely presented
151598377.author: a TripAdvisor user
151598377.reviewBody: In Valladolid , Yucatan there is a treasure. If you have any interest in Mexican folkart  Casa de los Venados has it all!  If you have traveled at all in Mexico as  you wander through this gorgeous home you will  feel like you are visiting every corner of Mexico. Do check their website or email to make sure they are open. Easy to find in central Valladolid.\nThere are daily tours in English and Spanish .\nDonations accepted...suggested 60 pesos.

151570974.name: World Class Collection in an Elegant Colonial Home
151570974.author: a TripAdvisor user
151570974.reviewBody: Valladolid had another wonderful surprise for us this morning! 10 am we arrived and the tour had begun. John & Dorianne have assembled one of the most impressive colloections that we have seen outside of a museum! We encountered many of the collectible masters of Mexican Folk Art. Vasquez, Medrano, Linares just to name a few. Not to mention the wonderfully restored central courtyard Colonial Home! Don\'t miss it. We were stunned by this diverse collection.

151243788.name: Not to be missed
151243788.author: a TripAdvisor user
151243788.reviewBody: We had this place recommended by an American academic and how right she was.  The Venators have been collecting Mexican art since the 1950s and by chance (and the planning regulations in Oacaxa) they ended up restoring a house just off the main square in Valladolid. How often do you get a chance to see large quantities of art of every sort in a domestic setting and welcomed by the owner?  The tour is at 10am and the guide, Freddy is most knowledgeable but Mr Venator is around to answer any questions. The minimum donation of $60 (pesos) goes to local charities and the large room in the front is used for events open to the local people. Not to be missed.

151228854.name: Casa de los Venados - amazing Mexican Folk Art Collection
151228854.author: a TripAdvisor user
151228854.reviewBody: Don\'t miss seeing this collection if you are in Valladolid. We visited the Casa on Feb 1, 2013 and were simply amazed.  A wonderful enjoyable hour.  Entry fee is a donation, and please be generous if you can as the proceeds go towards various local charities. There are so many pieces to view in this collection that it is worth a return trip.

150896070.name: No category for this
150896070.author: a TripAdvisor user
150896070.reviewBody: This is just a "wow" place. The American owners bought a large ruin right smack in downtown and spent eight years turning it into a super elegant mansion, filled with Mexican folk art on top of everything. Words can\'t describe it, just go and see it. Daily tours at 10 am.

150894203.name: Wow!
150894203.author: a TripAdvisor user
150894203.reviewBody: Beautiful, private home filled with an incredible collection of Mexican folk art.  Don\'t miss it even if you are not a fan of Mexican folk art.  It was even more amazing than I expected and I had read lots of rave reviews.

150868268.name: unique collection
150868268.author: a TripAdvisor user
150868268.reviewBody: What a treat. The Venator\'s have assembled a marvelous collection. It must be wonderful to live with such beautiful pieces. And great that they allow and even encourage visitors. Don\'t miss it.

150145311.name: best part of valladolid
150145311.author: a TripAdvisor user
150145311.reviewBody: Get there on time! Not too early, not too late- 10:00 am! What a phenomenal collection, John has done a fantastic job collecting, organizing and displaying mexican art. The guide was knowledgeable and didn\'t rush us through. The highlight of the trip was having John (the owner) come out and chit chat with us. It felt like visiting a friend who has an AWESOME house which happens to have AMAZING art all over.

149821582.name: A fabulous tour with brilliant Mexican Folk Art!
149821582.author: a TripAdvisor user
149821582.reviewBody:
Amazing to the eyes!  You can't beleive the collection. The guide spoke English and was able to explain it all very well.  And you can take pictures too.
This house is so beautifully put together.
They ask for 60 pesos donation which goes to a charitable cause.
I will always remember the House of the Deer.

149471900.name: Unique Opportunity and a Feast for the Senses
149471900.author: a TripAdvisor user
149471900.reviewBody: I would not have known about or taken time to visit this wonderful museum if Mari Pintowski had not encouraged a visit - and it was an anchor for much of what I saw during the rest of my trip to the Yucatan.  Seeing such wonderful, playful, rich, diverse, exquisite, (yes, I am getting superlative) art in the gracious setting of a renovated Spanish Colonial home - what an amazing opportunity.  See the other notes for detail and visit the website - but take time to go - just to stand in the central patio is a sensory experience worth the trip.  It also made me appreciate and be more discriminating of the art, curios and wares for sale in stores, stalls and roadside venues.  It is an education in Mexican art and folk art, with a huge variety from Day of the Dead to fabulous furniture, painted ceramics, oil paintings, historical and modern pieces.  The owners love their home and love sharing it.  It is stunning - every piece of furniture is used AND is a work of art.

149135585.name: A great place to visit
149135585.author: a TripAdvisor user
149135585.reviewBody:
What you need to know about Casa de los Vanados
It's a private house, not a museum or an art gallery.  The tour starts at 10am sharp.  There was a separate English and Spanish tour.  The price is by donation, I believe the suggested donation was $5 a person.  Take as many photos as you want, but don't lag behind.

Lastly the map on tripadvisor is wrong.  Google maps is far more accurate - meaning that Casa de los Venados is on the Calle 40 (aka Carretera Federal 295 aka Felipe Camillo Puerto - Valladolid).  It is somewhere north of Calle 45 and south of the town square (aka Calle 41).  Or in longitude and latitude, about 20.687913,-88.200834

148512516.name: A must see
148512516.author: a TripAdvisor user
148512516.reviewBody: One of the best collections of art I\'ve ever seen anywhere---a hidden gem in Valladolid.  Definitely worth  scheduling time for a tour and a visit with the host.  A fabulous experience, very inspiring.

148295993.name: Comprehensive overview of mexican art
148295993.author: a TripAdvisor user
148295993.reviewBody: For those who wish to see a very extensive snapshot of Mexican art in a remarkable residential setting, be at 10h00 am at Casa de los Venados for guided tour.

148253683.name: An amusing delight
148253683.author: a TripAdvisor user
148253683.reviewBody:
Those are the two words I will use to describe la Casa de los Venados: Amusing and delightful.

Delightful because the exquisite mixture of traditional and vanguardist architecture. Old and new materials, traditional and unique colors dance together in la terraza of the Venator's house. Old and new art have an encounter in each room. Every piece of the house, ceilling or floor, is a poem to mexican culture, tradition and most important of all, their artisans, to their people. 

Amusing, because youn can feel (and almost see) the mischef of the alebrijes, calaveras and catrines. You can imagine Frida Kahlo drinking coffee or painting for Diego in la terraza, or refreshing herself in the outdoor baths.

An experience that must not be missed when visiting Valladolid. Personally I am a lover of the mexican art, music and people... and I have never seen nothing like what I saw at John's and Dorian's house.

147058273.name: Treasure of Mexico
147058273.author: a TripAdvisor user
147058273.reviewBody: Tours of this private art collection are possible at 10am nearly everyday.  An extraordinary museum steps from the Zocalo.

146873941.name: Amazing personal collection of Mexican folk art
146873941.author: a TripAdvisor user
146873941.reviewBody: This is the second time we have visited Casa de los Venados.  This time, after our tour, we had the opportunity to talk with the owner for about a half hour.  I think this was the highlight of our trip to Mexico.  Any trip to Tulum. Playa del Carmen, or Cancun should be include a trip to this delightful private museum.  It will be interesting to young and old alike!

146118253.name: Mind blowing
146118253.author: a TripAdvisor user
146118253.reviewBody: This is the most phenomenal collection of Mexican folk art of the highest quality.  The tours are at 10 am and end with an opportunity to donate to a charity chosen by the friendly owners.  What a fabulous living museum / art gallery / home.  It is a must do on any trip even close to Valladolid.  Truly fantastic.

145491980.name: Visit this Museum
145491980.author: a TripAdvisor user
145491980.reviewBody: Very nice remodel of a classic Colonial villa to a modern home and museum.\nGreat that all the entry money goes to charity!!

143165495.name: See this if you have a soul
143165495.author: a TripAdvisor user
143165495.reviewBody: This art collection/restored house is jaw dropping. It has to be the greatest collection of Mexican folk art outside of Cuidad Mexico. Your token 60P entry fee is donated in full to local charity by the owner .... just see it !

142926639.name: Amazing eclectic Mexican art in private collection
142926639.author: a TripAdvisor user
142926639.reviewBody: You should make a reservation to ensure you will be admitted since this is a private residence.  Although a guided tour is provided, there is no admission price.  At the end you will be asked to make a donation to support the charities supported by the owner of this collection.  I consider this a must-do for anyone remotely interested in Mexican folk art.  The experience is actually better than any museum I can think of.  We also were able to meet meet the owner.

137178548.name: excellent place to get a snapshot of Mexican culture
137178548.author: a TripAdvisor user
137178548.reviewBody: This is a must do visit if you want to here about mexican art in general. Very friendly people, 2 hours are needed.

135724941.name: Don\'t Miss This in Valladolid
135724941.author: a TripAdvisor user
135724941.reviewBody: This house offers a unique opportunity to see a truly incredible collection of Mexican folkart. The owners have spared no expense. Many pieces were made especially for them by well known Mexican artists. The house is not only beautifully designed but the collection is carefully showcased in the home\'s many rooms. This is not to be missed.

133560155.name: Beautiful property
133560155.author: a TripAdvisor user
133560155.reviewBody: We really enjoyed touring Casa de los Venados. The best part was listening to the owner, John, talk about individual pieces and the architecture. He\'s insightful and passionate about the property. He was also kind enough to give us some recommendations on other places to visit in the area.

133062109.name: Amazing collection of Mexican Folk Art
133062109.author: a TripAdvisor user
133062109.reviewBody: An amazing collection of Mexican Folk Art in this beautiful restored colonial building. Tours are offered most days at 10 a.m. They expect you to give a donation of 60 Peso in the end of the tour which is going to social project. One of the best places I\u00b4ve vistited in Valladolid.

132596560.name: A highlight of our trip to the Yucatan!
132596560.author: a TripAdvisor user
132596560.reviewBody: We absolutely loved our visit to Casa de Los Venados. A truly magnificent collection of Mexican art. It is impossible not to love the vivid colours and fantasy on display here. The tour was in both English and Spanish and our guide (Fredy) was extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic. The place has a wonderful feel as both a home and a museum. One of the many great reasons to visit Valladolid. (Ps: The drive from Cancun to Valladolid on the toll road is very very easy... There is no excuse for not visiting this wonderful little town)

132551161.name: If you do nothing else - GO HERE
132551161.author: a TripAdvisor user
132551161.reviewBody: the tour only lasts about an hour, but the memory will last a long time! The local art objects are glorious (I\'m jealous and would love to have some of them) and the home itself (architecture) is a showplace.

131404912.name: A treasure of Mexican folk art.
131404912.author: a TripAdvisor user
