131404912.reviewBody: The daily tour begins at 10AM and gives you a chance to see and learn about Mexican folk art without visiting museums around Mexico.  It\'s a treasure.

130491236.name: Amazing art house
130491236.author: a TripAdvisor user
130491236.reviewBody: my first time in a antique house renovated, well done, its a nice house, now owned by and American

129044243.name: Amazing home!
129044243.author: a TripAdvisor user
129044243.reviewBody: Definitely a must visit when in Valladolid.  Tours every morning at 10am, and a wonderful collection of art in this amazing home.

128936481.name: Mexican art in all its forms
128936481.author: a TripAdvisor user
128936481.reviewBody: So many beautiful pieces in such a settings. Sometimes the guide went a little too fast for me but she slowed down when ask. Great jewel in Valladolid. Better to make an appoitment

127076738.name: Amazing collection of Mexican folk art
127076738.author: a TripAdvisor user
127076738.reviewBody: We did not realize that tours of Casa de los Venados started at 10 am and we had arrived 20 minutes late.  We were greeted by the owner (John Venator) who ended up giving us a personal tour of his home himself.  The layout of the home and the collection of Mexican folk art were absolutely fabulous.  The two story guest rooms, the large open center court yard, and the pool area with its partial glass bridge were quite grand.  John & his wife Dorianne are very gracious to allow tours of this place of wonder for a $5 donation that goes to charity.

126986325.name: Amazing Folk Art Collection
126986325.author: a TripAdvisor user
126986325.reviewBody: One of the highlights of our 2 week stay in the Yucatan

126705062.name: You haven\'t been to Mexico if haven\'t seen Casa Venados
126705062.author: a TripAdvisor user
126705062.reviewBody: The Collection represents the most authentic of Folks Art, a learning experience. Our favorite piece had to do with a large table where every chair is carved and given the shape and form of each former Mexican president. Highly recommended! \nBeautiful property too.

126188961.name: This Is A Cultural and Architectural Gem
126188961.author: a TripAdvisor user
126188961.reviewBody: Casa de Los Venados is a cultural and architectural gem in the heart of Valladolid that should not be missed by anybody who is the proximity, and it is even worth the side trip for those traveling to/from Chichen Itza and/or Merida. This the home of John & Dorianne Venator, and their graciousness allows them to share their passion for Mexican folk art with the public, albeit on a limited basis.  "Must see" can sometimes be over rated, but in this case, it is a phrase made for Casa de Los Venados.

125889641.name: Interesting, if a bit long
125889641.author: a TripAdvisor user
125889641.reviewBody: I know nothing about art, and to be honest, am not really too interested in it, but I thought this would be a nice mini-adventure in Valladolid. It was. My girlfriend and I took the tour at 10am on a Monday, and the guide, Freddy, was extremely knowledgeable about the TONS of folk art in this house. I was more interested in just touring a nice hacienda, but still learned a bit during the tour. The owner of the house chatted with us for a bit; friendly guy. We had a small group, and it lasted for about 90 minutes, so we were ready to leave when it was over.  I\'d recommend this tour to anyone who loves art or has some knowledge of Mexican art. The 60 peso per person "donation" goes to charity. The house itself is pretty; unassuming from the outside like most of the buildings in Valladolid.

125645398.name: An incredible collection of Mexican Folk in an amazing historic home, go and see it.
125645398.author: a TripAdvisor user
125645398.reviewBody: This historic home, lovingly preserved, is only half a block from the main square in Valladolid. The owners enthusiasm is wonderful and the collection is very extensive. The small donation of 60 pesos, or $5 minimum is a small price to pay for a tour of this incredible collection and ALL of the funds go to a charity that supports surgical procedures the Mexican health care system does not support.

125524293.name: Worth going to Valladolid to see
125524293.author: a TripAdvisor user
125524293.reviewBody:
The collection is phenomenal, the renovation --no, reconstruction -- of the building in the spirit of Mexican architecture, the guided tour flawless. And I say this as a person who hates guided tours.  The man who has created this collection and the building has done an impeccable job and a huge huge service, if that's the right word, to the preservation of Mexican folk art. Among the collection are pieces he and his wife have commissioned, helping more the Mexican forms to flourish today. Don't miss this. In fact, go to Valladolid to see this. 

He asks for a donation -- double it!

Carol

125481389.name: Beautifully restored house and fantastic collection of art
125481389.author: a TripAdvisor user
125481389.reviewBody: This house has been beautifully restored and the owner has a wonderful collection on show here. I think the 60 pesos donation to a worthy cause is a wonderful idea too.  On www.yucatanliving.com there is a really good article about this house as well as an informative 8 minute video, just search Casa de Los Venados.  I\'m so glad that I was able to visit this house, would love to go back for another  look sometime.

125423420.name: Not to be missed if you are anywhere near.
125423420.author: a TripAdvisor user
125423420.reviewBody: This home is a masterpiece of Mexican folk art.. There is 1 tour a day at 10 am. Our tour was 1 1/2 hours long and guide was incredibly knowledgeable.  This is not a wander around on your own but a guided tour. The owner very generously opens up the downstairs of this beautifully restored home to tours. He asks for a 60 peso apiece donation and all money goes to surgical center for the poor.

125189050.name: Private Collection of Mexican Folk Art
125189050.author: a TripAdvisor user
125189050.reviewBody: If your travels in Yucatan take you to Valladolid (close to Chichen Izta and other Mayan ruins), see about the daily tour through a private home off the central plaza that houses a large and impressive collection of Mexican folk art. The home/casa itself is impressive (18,000 sf) and worthy of attention from architectural students. The folk art collection consists of over 3,000 pieces of sculpture, paintings, glass. Tours are given most days at 10 am by staff who provide an informative background to many of the items. A modest donation is requested that goes to local charities. The home is owned by an American couple and if you\'re lucky, one of them will stop by on your tour to welcome you and explain their interest in Mexican folk art. Lovely people. Touring the house and viewing the collection is one of those unexpected treats one hopes for in travel.

125163913.name: Do not leave Valladolid without a visit to Casa de los Venados.!!!
125163913.author: a TripAdvisor user
125163913.reviewBody: Amazing that they let people traipse right through their beautiful home. There is such an incredible amount of art to see, it is impossible to take it all in on the first tour. We will probably go into Valladolid again next time, and repeat the tour. An exquisite home and such generous people to let the tours come in, and donate all of the money to a children\'s cause ( deaf children receive hearing aids) .Thank you for a wonderful morning viewing your amazing collection.

124822607.name: Folk Art
124822607.author: a TripAdvisor user
124822607.reviewBody: This house contains a fabulous collection of Mexican Folk Art of fine quality. The house itself is amazing, too. It\'s right in town so you don\'t have to drive anywhere to find it. It was a highlight of our trip.

124637565.name: A highlight of our trip
124637565.author: a TripAdvisor user
124637565.reviewBody: I had read bout Casa de los Venados in YucatanToday.com and arranged with the owner for a tour during our visit to the Yucatan. It\'s so much more than the amazing collection of art --the restoration and architecture blew me away. So much to recall. I\'ll be back just to see the silkscreen prints of Izamal. Thank you for opening your home and sharing this amazing collection.

124553739.name: A don\'t  miss!
124553739.author: a TripAdvisor user
124553739.reviewBody: I was totally amazed at the collection this American couple has in a restored 18,000 square foot home.  We went with a group of 12 by appointment if you call ahead.  They have the best private collection of Mexican folk art.  The visit is in their home, led by the owner, all for only a donation.  Totally incredible!

124278551.name: Amazing collection of folk art.
124278551.author: a TripAdvisor user
124278551.reviewBody: This place is amazing. It\'s only a half block away from the town square so it really easy to get to. The owner definitely knows the history of the art. So many fascinating pieces in a beautifully restored house. I love that they ask for a donation instead of admission which all goes to local children who need hearing aids.

123847690.name: Outstanding Popular Art Collection
123847690.author: a TripAdvisor user
123847690.reviewBody: In December we were travelling in the Yucatan Penninsula.  I had read about La Casa de los Venados in Valladolid and wanted to visit.  It is a colonial home that has been completely redone (took 10 yrs) and decorated with a lifetime collection of Mexican Popular Art.  We were able to take a guided tour through the home, take pictures, ask questions etc.   The charge is a donation of 60pesos but the money goes to local medical charities.  \nBeing a lover of Mexican Popular Art I was in awe.  This is the most amazing home I have ever visited. \nThey do not advertise much, and the home is only open when the owners are in town.  Go to Youtube.com and search for Casa de los Venados for a wonderful video of the home.

123807593.name: Experience the exquisite art of Mexico in this fabulous collection just off the Valladolid Square.
123807593.author: a TripAdvisor user
123807593.reviewBody: Take a few hours to tour this lovingly restored hacienda just off the Valladolid Square. The owners, John and Dorianne Venator spent 10 years restoring this historic building and adding their own modern touches, and it has won numerous architectural awards. They have been collecting Mexican folk and contemporary art for years and personally share their treasures with their visitors daily at 10 a.m. Tours are given in English or Spanish and visitors are asked for a minimal donation which goes to local charities and larger donations are happily welcomed. John led our tour and it was so interesting to learn where he found his treasures and the history behind his discoveries. Many pieces are from renowned Mexican artists and some are anonymous finds that were bargains. You will be educated and inspired to look closer at the Mexican culture and their art! Go and see for yourself!

123792408.name: Huge collections of quality Mexican crafts.
123792408.author: a TripAdvisor user
123792408.reviewBody: This private home has been opened to the pubic to see a magnificent collections of crafts, almost all from Mexico, in a beautifully restored Mexican home.

123768616.name: Beautiful house and art works
123768616.author: a TripAdvisor user
123768616.reviewBody: Certainly worth a visit. Costs 60 pesos, 100% of which goes to charity.\nVisit only by guided tour, 10am daily (better phone in advance).

123674893.name: Very interesting Mayan museum in a private house
123674893.author: a TripAdvisor user
123674893.reviewBody: We were very pleasantly surprised when we visited the "Casa de los Venados". It is located in a private house owned by John and Dorianne Venator (American couple). Public tours start at 10AM. Bring your camera!\nSuggested donation is 60 pesos (about $5), which is 100% donated to charity and to the Casa de Cultura.

123591761.name: Unexpected and awesome art collection
123591761.author: a TripAdvisor user
123591761.reviewBody: Had no idea what to expect when entering the old stone building.  Once inside, we were astounded by the modern furnishings and the collection of antique and contemporary art of the Yucatan.  The host was most gracious and gave us access to all parts of his astounding home - 18,000 sq feet under roof!

123424298.name: Astounding collection of Mexican art.
123424298.author: a TripAdvisor user
123424298.reviewBody: Quite simply, an awesome collection of Mexican art in an architecturally restored masterpiece of a home.

123259883.name: pretty place
123259883.author: a TripAdvisor user
123259883.reviewBody: lovely house, now owned by an american, but well worked. close to down town

123118865.name: Awesome Collection of Mexican Folk Art
123118865.author: a TripAdvisor user
123118865.reviewBody: One of the most beatifull, carefully selected over decades of carefull consideration, collections of Mexican Folk Art.  A MOST on your visit to this interesting and well preserved colonial city.

122412746.name: fine folk art and preservation architecture feast
122412746.author: a TripAdvisor user
122412746.reviewBody: I discovered this treasure by web searching Valladolidand finding the story of an American couple recently finding, buying and renovating the colonial house in the heart of a town I had visited 35 years ago.  The tour company from whom I rented a home and accompanied for two full days of authenic Yucatan explorations alerted me to the importance of being prompt for the 10 am public tour of athe private home and extensive art collection.  The experience was beyond imagination.  A guide explained art displays in the entrance hall, adjacent gallery, central court yard, six living suites for family and friends, study, pool and spa area, kitchen, diningroom and livingroom.  The owner joined us at that point pointing out some of his favorite pieces and entertaining questions.  We were also introduced to his wife, an aunt and his mother who was celebrating her 95th birthday.   This family intimacy intensified our amazement at the diversity in paintings, sculptures and furniture imagined by people of Mexico.

122248187.name: With the trip
122248187.author: a TripAdvisor user
122248187.reviewBody: This is a rare collection and experience. If you likeMexican folk art , this is a must-see. Owner gives a personal tour, very gracious and hospitable. Highly recommended.

122065832.name: A little awkward but beautiful stuff to see
122065832.author: a TripAdvisor user
122065832.reviewBody: The art in the house is absolutely beautiful but the tour itself was really bad. They were setting up for a party later in the day so some of the rooms were closed off and our guide told us normally they have about an hour for the tour but not today. Also it looked like everyone staying in the rooms was made to leave and wait in the center courtyard so while you are looking around people were just sitting there staring at us waiting for us to leave. Also our guide was not able to answer most of our questions, when we asked how old certain things were he just said oh it\'s been here six months. I would recommend if you are doing the tour ask before hand if there is anything else planned for the day so you can get the full tour and not feel like your inconveniencing everyone.

121814618.name: Museum residence
121814618.author: a TripAdvisor user
121814618.reviewBody: This is an immaculate art museum behind a very unassuming street entrance. It holds some very beautiful Mayan and Mexican artifacts in an elegant decor. My wife and I highly recommend seeing this.

121663148.name: This was a great hour -- the house is gorgeous, the art and renovations really interesting, and the host a real gem.
121663148.author: a TripAdvisor user
121663148.reviewBody: My 21-year old son and I really enjoyed our visit to Casa de los Venados.  The host is both knowledgable and super-enagaging about the building and the art.  Admission is free but he asks that you make a donation to a local charity that he has chosen, which made us feel even better about the Casa.  We would both highly recommend spending an hour here.

121639853.name: A MUST
121639853.author: a TripAdvisor user
121639853.reviewBody: This is an opportunity to see excellent examples of folk art from all areas of Mexico.

121605825.name: If you like Mexican folk art this is unmissable
121605825.author: a TripAdvisor user
121605825.reviewBody: The owners have refurbished an historic wreck into an astonishingly beautiful home that is worth seeing in its own right plus stuffed it full of the highest quality mexican folk art. The 60 peso donation for the hour long tour at 10am goes to charity. Worth every centavos.

121303913.name: Don\'t miss this when visiting Valladolid!
121303913.author: a TripAdvisor user
121303913.reviewBody: I visited with my mom and my aunt and we loved the tour! I had read about it before leaving the US but was unsure about going until the owner of our inn suggested it. I am so glad that we went because it is such a rich collection of Mexican art. We found the representations of animals so delightful! We had a very personal tour - just the three of us - and our guide seemed happy to answer any of our questions. \n\nThere is a fee of 60 pesos which all goes to charity. I arranged it by emailing the owner at:  javenator1@gmail.com and he emailed back within minutes to confirm.

121303659.name: A truly great folk art collection
121303659.author: a TripAdvisor user
121303659.reviewBody: Frankly, we went to Valladolid because I read about Casa de los Venados in the Rough Guide to Cancun and I wanted to go see the folk art collection.  It was definitely worth the trip!  An outstanding collection of carvings, ceramics, paintings, sculptures, religious art, Oaxacan animal carvings, Dias de los Muerto items, etc.  It is worth emailing the owner in advance to check that it will be open.  Check the site www.casadelosvenados.com for more info.  A world class collection of vibrant, exciting folk art in a beautifully designed home.

121299611.name: Definitely worth a visit
121299611.author: a TripAdvisor user
121299611.reviewBody: Amazing collection of folk art, much better than in the museums. The owner gives excellent tours

121103539.name: Loved our Tour.
121103539.author: a TripAdvisor user
121103539.reviewBody: Our time spent visiting Casa de los Venados was so enjoyable.  What a fantastic labor of love.  The owners were very gracious and this is an absolute must-see in Valladolid.

121093888.name: Brief Tour of Casa de los Venados
121093888.author: a TripAdvisor user
121093888.reviewBody: This is a beautifully restored structure in Valladolid. The owner is a very nice, retired expat with a lot of cool folk art. It\'s a house with impeccable style and taste. I like to donate to worthy causes (and goodness there are a LOT of worthy causes in the Yucatan) but...I think the "suggested" donation was a bit much for touring someone\'s house. I had not read up on this before going so really had no expectations.

120762381.name: Amazing cultural experience
120762381.author: a TripAdvisor user
120762381.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is a wonder! The owners have thought of everything when they renovated and put the museum together. One can tell that it is a labor of love. Art from all over Mexico is included in the collection. It is sure to become a main attraction of Valladolid and Yucatan. We met one of the owners who was very nice and welcoming. They do not charge for admission but instead have a box for a suggested donation to an organization who helps local kids with hearing problems.

120724214.name: A Must-See Stop In The Yucatan
120724214.author: a TripAdvisor user
120724214.reviewBody: I\'ve been around the world and seen art museums all over.  But nothing prepared me for the collection of Mexican traditional art at Casa De Los Venados.  Because most of the work is commissioned, the work feels fresh and often addresses contemporary themes.  The works that are more traditional are of the finest caliber.  If you are going anywhere near Valladolid, you\'ll want to see this place.  You\'ll be amazed.

120401309.name: I think I broke my camera here
120401309.author: a TripAdvisor user
120401309.reviewBody: This is a must see for anyone interested in Mexican folk art of all kinds. From sculpture to ceramics, paintings on canvas to tile murals, paper maiche to furniture. This is an incredible collection, with art everywhere you turn. \n\nLocated just off the main square in a renovated town house, you will be blown away by the quality, scope and quantity of pieces. We were shown the property by one of the staff as the owners were away on business. This was a highlight of our trip to Mexico.

119827089.name: A must see in Valladolid!
119827089.author: a TripAdvisor user
119827089.reviewBody: This collection of Mexican art is like none other.  It is displayed in the home of the Venators and the tour is normally conducted by the owner himself. On this occasion, the owner was out of the country and a member of his staff led the tour.  It is a unique exhibit.

119717251.name: Must see!
119717251.author: a TripAdvisor user
119717251.reviewBody: There were many great one of a kind pieces.  The owner is quite boastful and has a rather overbearing presence. I thought  it was rude that he stand at the donation jar and basically bully you into donating.  The suggested donation is approximately $6 U.S. if I recall correctly and it is worth it.  The staff is great.  Get the tour in Spanish if you can, by staff members.

119300989.name: Wonderful collection of art work from all over Mexico housed in meticulously restored Hacienda
119300989.author: a TripAdvisor user
119300989.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this experience! John is a wonderful host and shared stories and information about his art collection and Hacienda with us. We didn\'t make a previous appointment yet had read that tours started at 10am so turned up 5 mins to 10 and were warmly welcomed.

117181141.name: Mexican Hospitality At It\'s Best
117181141.author: a TripAdvisor user
117181141.reviewBody:
John,
your energy and love for art is amazing!!  Y'alls house is AMAZING and your taste in art is refreshing and put a smile on my face.  I belive it was my best visit in the Yucatan.

Thanks again,

Brian Horne
President - Stags Leap Ranch

117156094.name: Absolutely Amazing!
117156094.author: a TripAdvisor user
117156094.reviewBody: I was invited by a friend of John\'s to go & have a look around with a family group, I think about 24 people, I am not arty so did not know what to expect from Mexican Art? I was simply stunned by how beautiful Casa de Los Venados is, John could not be more enthusiastic, accomodating, & knowledgable about this hacienda, it is fantastically restored, & filled with beautiful & interesting art which has to be seen to be believed! We looked around & I was amazed by the quality of the restoration considering the \'before\' photos on display! & a dip in the pool was fantastic too! This place cannot be missed if you are in the Yucatan!!! A credit to a fine couple! A+++

117137292.name: A must see if you are anywhere near Vallladolid!
117137292.author: a TripAdvisor user
117137292.reviewBody: Breathtaking home with the largest collection of Mexican folk art in the world outside of a museum! Casa de los Venados is not a museum, but actually the private residence of John and Dorianne Venator.  They restored the impressive 400 year old city center hacienda to the award winning architectural marvel that it is today, and filled it with thousands of pieces of beautiful Mexican art work which they have collected throughout their lifetime together.  Their passion for both their home and their collection shines through as they take you through the property.  It\'s a fabulous place to visit and I can highly recommend it to anyone visiting Valladolid or the surrounding area.  It\'s half a block off the zocalo (Main Square) very close to the municipal palace.  We went with young children which was fine other than I was running around after the kids instead of looking at each piece of art.  There are of course some breakable pieces of art there, so please use your own discretion regarding suitability for your children. A wonderful place to visit and the Ventors are gracious and welcoming hosts!  A special place and definitely a must in Valladolid!

116857441.name: This is a breathtaking home and wonderful folk art collection
116857441.author: a TripAdvisor user
116857441.reviewBody: I\'ve known John for sometime and I had the good fortune to attend a party at Casa de los Venados out by its beautiful pool. I had heard about the renovation of the home over the years but I was not really expecting to step into one of the most interesting folk art collections I\'ve ever seen. John and Dorianne are fantastic hosts and art enthusiasts. Valladolid and Casa de los Venados are a destination worth visiting.\n\nClarke Porter

115013961.name: A friendly, personal tour of a gorgeous display of Mexican art - a Valladolid must-see!!!
115013961.author: a TripAdvisor user
115013961.reviewBody: My boyfriend was a little skeptical of going to La Casa de los Venados, but once we went in, he was blown away.  We both were.  John was very accommodating and let us in a bit before 10AM, when they usually lead the tours.  He is so passionate about describing the renovation of the house and how he and his wife acquired each amazing piece of Mexican art that it draws you in and makes you so comfortable walking through his home.  It is a very unique museum since it has such a personal touch.  I would absolutely love going back since he says the tour is a bit different each time, since he likes to keep things fresh for himself and talk more about different pieces of art each time.  The fee is actually a donation.  John asks for 60 pesos or $5 minimum donation that goes to the Charitable Foundation for the Arts and Education.  There are also postcards and soft drinks for sale.  This is a MUST-SEE in Valladolid.

112321833.name: A fabulous tour of a wonderful art-filled home conducted by the owner himself!
112321833.author: a TripAdvisor user
112321833.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados (House of the Deer) is a wonderful spot to visit in a beautiful city.  It is a hacienda-style private home which was lovingly refurbished and added to by John and Dorianne Venator.  John conducts daily tours at 10:00 (Phone ahead to make sure.) of this amazing structure and its equally-amazing arts and crafts.  The exterior is quite unassuming, but the grandeur is apparent immediately upon entering.  You may take photos throughout the tour which easily lasts an hour.  John will answer question and tailors the tour  according to the group.  The Venators ask for a donation (A minimum is suggested.) which goes to charity.  When we visited, the funds were earmarked for medical personnel who donate their time and skills to provide services for those in need.  This was a highlight of our time in the Yucatan!

109491854.name: Amazing
109491854.author: a TripAdvisor user
109491854.reviewBody: Beyond the wall a few steps from a busy intersection in Valladolid  is a wonderful home and art collection  of John and Dorianne Venator. John welcomed us and showed us around and was happy to answer all our questions about the art. All for a donation to a local charity.  We\'re so glad we didn\'t miss this.

106267017.name: For anyone who enjoys Mexican art and handcrafts, this is an absolute must.
106267017.author: a TripAdvisor user
106267017.reviewBody: Since there are already so many reviews that give Casa de los Venados the highest rating, we are simply casting another vote for it. Absolutely wonderful, a must for anyone visiting Valladolid, and in fact a good reason all by itself to visit Valladolid, if any were needed.  (Valladolid is a delightful town.)

103546972.name: An unbelievable and \'must-see\' collection of Mexican folk and contemporary art.
103546972.author: a TripAdvisor user
103546972.reviewBody:
Located at #204 Calle 40. 
We had heard about this collection from Trip Advisor and so, right after breakfast on our first morning we knocked on John's door but, because they were hosting a gala event that evening with over 250 people, we came back the next day and, were delighted that we did so. John and Dorianne were such gracious and welcoming and enthusiastic hosts to their home/art gallery. 
John gave our small party a 90 minute tour and we felt that we had only scratched the surface of his knowledge and collection! He has a personal and interesting story behind each piece. 
Casa de los Venados is a 'must-see' in Valladolid and complements the fascinating history and beauty of this wonderful city.

103317193.name: Far Better Than Expected - A Private Museum of Interesting Treasures
103317193.author: a TripAdvisor user
103317193.reviewBody:
Because on the great Trip Advisor reviews we decided to give Casa de Los Venados a try. We showed up one evening and were politely told that the tours are at 10am each day. Luckily we had one more morning in Valladolid. 

The spectacular home is filled with a massive number of Mexican folk art items. There are examples of folk art from every part of the country and representing all sorts of art forms - paintings, murals, sculptures, painted furniture, etc. John, the owner, is a pleasant, enthusiastic host, a great story teller, and is very knowledgeable. 

There is so much to see that it was quite overwhelming at first. It was amazing, interesting, fun, educational and very memorable. The only "charge" was a 60 peso donation used to help the local people. 

Take your camera. He encourages photo-taking.

102379146.name: Not an artsy person, but this place blew me away
102379146.author: a TripAdvisor user
102379146.reviewBody: Art is in the eye of the beholder, typically.  But Casa Venados has something for everyone. It\'s fun, funny, uplifting, humorous and more. It\'s a great way to spend a couple hours, if you can get in. Gracious hosts with great stories make this place happen. I usually walk past art galleries. I\'m happy I didn\'t walk past Casa Venados.

101979185.name: Wow
101979185.author: a TripAdvisor user
101979185.reviewBody: Who would believe that behind a large wooden door set in a plain stucco wall is an architectural masterpiece filled with an incomparable collection of Mexican folk art. John and Dorianne were warm, gracious, and welcoming. After the "tour" John told me he had neglected to tell me I could take pictures and that I was welcome to wonder through the rooms we had visited at my leisuire to take photos. I could only imagine how wonderful thel upcoming luncheon for the Yucatan governor and her entourage would be; several items had been moved out of their usual place to begin preparations. Do not miss this!

99940062.name: Valladolid Inspiration
99940062.author: a TripAdvisor user
99940062.reviewBody: John and Dorianne graciously open their home to the public most days for 10am tours of their gorgeous and imaginitive restoration of a grand colonial home, filled with a vast and high-quality collection of arts and crafts.  If you want to see a first-rate restoration and enjoy John\'s informative narrative on the architecture and arts as you make your way through this grand space, set aside a late morning for this activity.  \n\nThe Venators ask that guests donate about 60 pesos each (about $5 currently) on exit, which funds local food relief for the needy and augments charitable medical services provided by out-of-town medical personnel at a local clinic.

99581926.name: A highlight of the trip to the Yucatan
99581926.author: a TripAdvisor user
99581926.reviewBody: Wow, a totally unexpected surprise that turned out to be a highlight of the whole trip to the Yucatan and we didn\'t even know about it until the day that we were leaving Vallodolid.  If you have just a fleeting interest in folk art then this is not to be missed.  Beautiful art in beautiful surroundings.  This is an easy 5 star rating.\n\nI made the assumption that I couldn\'t take pictures, and unfortunately, I assumed wrong!  John and Dorianne were most accomodating as guests and tour guides.

99572914.name: Exceptional Collection of Arte Popular
99572914.author: a TripAdvisor user
99572914.reviewBody:
All I can say is "WOW".  Casa de Venados is a spectacular rehab job and a loving ode to the Mexican artes popular (folk arts). Do not miss the opportunity to take a tour through this restored mansion. 

The owners took an 18,000 sq. ft. structure and totally renovated it maintaining it's colonial heritage, while updating and modernizing to make it functional as their residence. The folk art collection is nothing short of astounding in the variety of artists and genres of folk art that are represented, and runs the gamut in quality as well. The owners have collected what they liked from unknown and unhearlded artists as well as acquiring pieces from well known artesans. The pieces are fun, approachable and certainly represent the connection, respect and affection the owners have for the artesans, the folk art and the arts in general. The sheer size of the collection is staggering adn the overall quality of it good.

Even if you don't think you like folk art, take a look. There is something for almost everyone in this collection and the owners are gracious hosts with a knack for making everyone feel welcome. 

Proceeds from entry and donations go to support local medical projects and have so far been used to build surgerical suites for use in treating locals who have poor access to treatment otherwise. 

Casa de Venados is truly a special place.

95433000.name: Casa de los Venados
95433000.author: a TripAdvisor user
95433000.reviewBody: We just returned from a visit to Casa de los Venados in Valladolid, Yucatan, Mexico (about 100 miles west of Cancun).  Casa de los Venados is a restored 18,000 SF in town hacienda which is over 400 years old--and fully restored after a just completed 10 year effort by John and Dorianne Venator.  The hacienda houses over 3,000 original works of Mexican art from all over Mexico.  I highly recommend this attraction, and if you have friends and family visiting, this is a guaranteed crowd pleaser, and the best cultural experience on the entire Yucatan Peninsula.  The Venator\'s request a $5 USD donation to support a local medical charity which they provide financial support to.\n\nCasa de los Venados is located immediately adjacent to the central square (Zocolo), and is easily reached from Cancun (around 100 miles West of Cancun), and the surrounding area, via car, van, or local first class ground transportation for around $24 USD R/T, and the trip is two hours in duration.

94685576.name: A must-see for art-lovers and those beyond
94685576.author: a TripAdvisor user
94685576.reviewBody: An impressive collection of Mexican folk art worthy of a museum - but you get to experience it in the privacy of a splendid home. Interesting even to those not traditionally into art, as it is quite accessible. What a surprise to find such an exquisite collection in Valladolid. Proof that it always pays to stray off the beaten path.

91389990.name: Wow!! If you like local art, words can\'t describe it.
91389990.author: a TripAdvisor user
91389990.reviewBody:
We found out about Casa de los Venados from Denis Larsen at Casa Hamaca.   This was an unplanned activity in our last day in Vallalodid but easily one of the highlights of our trip.  Casa de los Venados is located right off the main square and from the street you would never know the fantastic architecture and beautiful Mexican artwork that lies inside. 

John and Dorianne Venator spent 30 years scouring Mexico for unique pieces of art and filled their home with it.  The only word I can think of to best describe our tour is “jaw-dropping”.  My teenage daughter called it the ultimate in eye candy. 

John took us on a personal 90 minute tour of the property and he said that everything in it has a story.  While we only had time for the highlights, he made the artwork come alive with details of the artist (most he has personally met) and it’s cultural context.  It was extremely educational not only for my wife and I but also for my 3 children (college and high school).  What made the difference was John’s passion for Mexican artwork and architecture which came through in his animated stories and subtle humor.

My kids liked the pool area best. Its nothing short of spectacular.  You walk over a bridge which has glass panels. He has water gently shooting into the pool from five animal heads mounted on the wall. Its easy to see why his property won several international architectural awards.   

I can’t possible write a review that does justice his property and art collection so I will stop here.   All I can say is check it out for yourself but you will want to contact John and Dorianne ahead to find out what times are best for a tour.  Their website is: www.casadelosvenados.com.

90587045.name: Gracious and friendly hosts, unique folk art collection
90587045.author: a TripAdvisor user
90587045.reviewBody: Having arrived after the scheduled daily tour, we took a chance and knocked -- luck was with us, as Dorianne and John took time out of their day to give us a tour of their beautiful collection.  The art -- paintings, collage, furniture, pottery, sculpture, etc. -- is spread throughout their gorgeous home, the pieces in each bedroom following a different theme.   John shared the stories behind the art, providing background on each artist and highlighting different aspects of technique -- overall, a great tutorial on the folk art style.  Definitely a highlight of our visit to Mexico!

90233366.name: Amazing house, beautiful art, wonderful people....a must see!
90233366.author: a TripAdvisor user
90233366.reviewBody:
I had been doing some research on things to do in Valladolid and I came across Casa de los Venados. I decided to email John and Dorianne. They were very accommodating. Tours are set at 10:00 am. We found the house no problem. It is located just off of the square. Valladolid is a beautiful city. The house is very unassuming from the outside but once you get inside it is amazing! The architecture was very well thought out. To see a once fallen down hacienda turned into such a wonderful home is a sight to behold. The art was everywhere. So much to take in. John and Dorianne is very knowledgeable about every piece and loves to share their extensive knowledge. Although this is not a museum, John and Dorianne has opened up their home to share with everyone. It is a must see while in Valladolid.  Because it is not a museum you must make a reservation with them. They ask for a 60 pesos donation per person. The donation go to various places such as Clinic San Lucas here in Valladolid for medical surgeries for the indigent, they give money through a program of the Chicago Chamber Music Society (of which Dorianne serves on their board of directors) for inner city music education for youngsters who no longer have access to it as the school budgets have been cut or eliminated.  This often includes paying the rental fees for the musical instruments as the poor families can not afford to rent the instruments let alone buy them. 
 They also give money to another organization that give scholarships to people with disabilities and inner city youths in the US to train them in business computer skills to help them find employment.
 As well as from time to time other charities such as giving money for "dispensas" (boxes of food staples for the poor)  in the villages that surround Valladolid) through the Catholic church priests.
They are also getting info from teachers on educational programs and school supplies needed in Valladolid to help where they can in the new year.
Impress your spouse or your friends and take them to a one of a kind adventure!

87076703.name: A fabulous selection of Mexican art and an architectural restoration triumph
87076703.author: a TripAdvisor user
87076703.reviewBody: Tours are now offered by the owners (who moved in two weeks ago) every day at 10 am.  The experience itself is a must for anyone who loves Mexican art and culture.  We were the only two people on tour and the ownersa could not have been more hospitable or informative.  At 60 pesos each (donated to a charity set up by the owners) this was real value.

86433835.name: Is this place really open to the public?
86433835.author: a TripAdvisor user
86433835.reviewBody: After reading these reviews I was anxious to visit Casa de los Venados to see the art collection.  I rang the bell and the caretaker (?) answered.  He said the house is not open to the public and that I should come back in about 10 days to talk to the owner.  I asked around at a few local businesses, all said that as far as they knew, this was just a private home and not open to the public.

86215476.name: Already seen the churches and tried the cochinita?
86215476.author: a TripAdvisor user
86215476.reviewBody:
A random knock on the big, wooden doors of Case de los Venados led to the highlight of my parents' trip in Valladolid.

This unique home located in the colonial city of Valladolid is an absolute must-see.  Located in the city centro, Casa de los Venados is a museum-within-a-home full of popular Mexican art, and charm.  What makes it so special is how every piece has a personal story and why it was chosen by the owners.  

From start to finish, the tour is lleno (full) of hundreds of pieces of original artwork.  The beautifully adorned guest rooms are themed, giving each room an individual touch.  (The Frida Kahlo Room, The Valladolid Room, The Izamal Room, etc).

The gardens, the pools, the entertainment areas, the patios, the rooms, the art-- it was so much moer than expected.  And to top it off, I was delightfully surprised to hear that all entrance fees are being donated to various charities in the United States-- giving just one more reason to visit.

Fue un placer.  ¡Gracias!

86011395.name: If you have ANY interest in Mexican art, see Casa de los Venados
86011395.author: a TripAdvisor user
86011395.reviewBody: A world-class museum in a private home. Casa de los Venados is Valladolid\'s answer to NYC\'s Frick Museum. I\'ve been fortunate enough to visit Casa de los Venados a number of times. And everytime I discover something different that I had not noticed before. The design of the casa is on a grand scale with open spaces leading the eye (and the feet) to the next spectacular view, the next room, the next space. But it is the details of the 3,500 plus pieces of Mexican folk art that really get me. Their quality, their humor and their presentation are all over-the-top. The owners of Casa de los Venados, John and Dorianne Venator, are now in full-time residence so it is much easier to make arrangements to view the collection. A visit to Casa de los Venados is well worth an extra day in Valladolid.

82670110.name: Casa de los Venados, the YouTube video was fun to watch, but the live tour 3 months later has been engraved in my mind
82670110.author: a TripAdvisor user
82670110.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful hacienda with an amazing art collection. It\'s by pure coincidence that we found ourselves touring one of most beautiful haciendas in the Yucatan Peninsula. I was first introduced to John Venator and his wife Dorianne early June at a Gala where he began chatting about his hacienda. Later that week I saw the you tube link of their amazing restored hacienda in Valladolid. That summer we took a trip to the Yucatan and we asked John if someone could give us a tour of his Casa. He accommodated us by having someone local take time out from the middle of their day to oblige our request. The home was simply incredible, it was fully decorated from contemporary Mexican art brought over from all over the Peninsula, and other pieces put together on the premises by local artists chosen by the Venator\'s to accent their hacienda. I was WOWED!!! and I\'m sure their future guest and visitors will be too, and will be talking about it for a long time to come...

82349815.name: A Remarkable Experience in Valladolid!!
82349815.author: a TripAdvisor user
82349815.reviewBody: On a recent trip to the Yucatan traveling from Cancun to M\u00e9rida passing through the lovely town of Valladolid, we were very much impressed with a must see visit to Casa de los Venados. The beautifully restored 400 year-old plus hacienda right off the main square which is in itself a trip in to the past was equally rivaled by local and national Mexican artwork adorning Casa de los Venados. I personally love the artwork of Frida Kahlo and saw much of her influence throughout the Casa including her image on several custom made chairs and a bench in the entryway. I believe there was a small fee to pay but well worth it based on the amount of authentic artwork that one can see at one time. Artwork represented in all types of forms and media from all over Mexico. From the grand entrance of the foyer to the magical patio and then to each of the individually decorated suites, Casa de los Venados was breathtaking at every turn. This definitely is not a typical local museum but a warm and welcoming hacienda portraying all aspects of Mexican art and culture. This is a cultural experience not to pass up while in Valladolid.

81365567.name: Casa de los Venados
81365567.author: a TripAdvisor user
81365567.reviewBody: I was able to explore the treasure that lies only steps from the main square in Valladolid. Casa de los Venados was pure eye candy. The collection of Mexican art is astounding. Murals, ceiling structures, paintings, metal sculptures are just some examples of the folk art displayed throughout the property. A must see for all.

80633684.name: Worth Remembering! A Must In Valladolid
80633684.author: a TripAdvisor user
80633684.reviewBody: What can I say...Casa de los Venados is a work of art! Every detail and feature is a labor of love. Years in the making is unveiled beautifully. I had the pleasure along with my wife to see a amazing display of the most unique collection of art. The experience was breath taking . Upon entering you are taken by the sheer scope of modern mexican art, sculpture, metal work. paintings designed and displayed in such a comfortable setting.\n\nIt is a wonderful place in Valladolid that cannot be missed!

80592179.name: Casa de los Venados-A real treat in the Yucatan
80592179.author: a TripAdvisor user
80592179.reviewBody: Once people tire of the chain hotels and restaurants on the Mayan Riviera, I hope they\'ll take the time to experience the real Yucatan Peninsula. In particular,  Valladolid...a charming colonial town with a historic cathedral, and proximity to several Mayan ruins. I was staying in a small hotel just off the main town plaza, and they suggested a visit to Casa de los Venados. Behind an unassuming door to the street, I experienced a treasure trove of Mexican art and gracious surroundings. Commissioned artwork in a variety of media adorn the walls and courtyards of a magnificently restored property. The work of many modern Mexican artists is represented here in painting, sculpture, ceramics, furniture, etc, etc. It is difficult to adequately describe the quantity of significant art pieces, or the detail of the restoration. This is a place that is a "must see" and would be a great part of a trip to nearby Chichen itza ruins .

79655413.name: A major private art collection available for public viewing
79655413.author: a TripAdvisor user
79655413.reviewBody:
We recently visited an art gallery in Izamal featuring modern Mexican and folk art, and a couple we met there told us about a gallery in Valladolid that rivaled anything they had seen in Mexico.    Our plans took us in that direction, so we made a point to look up the address.  We were stunned.  This is a private casa which the owners have renovated and made available to public visitors, but it is on a scale that any city would be hard-pressed to match.

The 18,000 square foot hacienda is a beautifully renovated 400 year old home filled with several hundred (thousand?) pieces of Mexican art.  Every item in the home, whether functional or ornamental, is a work of art, and the eye sometimes has trouble resting on one piece without being drawn to another even more beautiful.

If you have an interest in Mexican art and architecture this is a must-see.

They are just a few steps off the Zocolo at Calle 40 #204 - just ring the bell.

79530894.name: A must see
79530894.author: a TripAdvisor user
79530894.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados in Valladolid is worth the drive either from Cancun or the Riviera Maya areas. This amazing Casona has been restored to its full splendor and it offers to the visitors the most amazing private collection of Mexican Popular Art I have ever seen... every corner is a celebration of Mexico, it\'s colors, it\'s passion,, it\'s textures and flavors, as a Mexican is great to recognize the love and appreciation that the owners have for my country. Each piece is a master piece and carries all the energy of the hard working people, the artist that found their inspiration in the simple things and carries the tradition of many generations. No video, or photo can communicate the energy of walking to its patio, they rooms and the amazing outdoor area. You have to see Casa de los Venados, is amazing!!

79525625.name: Must see Art Gallery and Pool in re-modeled colonial Hacienda one block off the town square!
79525625.author: a TripAdvisor user
79525625.reviewBody: What an interesting suprise! My wife and I were peeking through the doors when a friendly voice called from acreoss the street, "want to see inside" and what an amazing tour we had! Room after room of sculpture, ceramics, metal work,  paintings and furniture engrossed us for hours. The owners could not have been more acommodating and egar to show us their vast collection, this is a must see for anyone in the Yucatan. Spend a day at the ruins and come to Valladolid for lunch or dinner, and visit this rare and unique collection.

79310767.name: One of the best Mexican experiences: a must see!
79310767.author: a TripAdvisor user
79310767.reviewBody:
A friend wanted to take us to Casa de los Venados and we did not know what we were about to discover!
The house is an old Mexican house that has been entirely renovated by a couple passionate with Mexican art. Not only the house is amazing, one of the most beautiful we have ever seen, but it is a real museum.
It contains thousands of art pieces including statues and paintings.
I do not know how to thank the owners for this moment of true happiness!
I will never forget it. Thanks!

79141225.name: Casa de los Venados
79141225.author: a TripAdvisor user
79141225.reviewBody: The upper balcony of Casa de los Venados at night was breath-taking, what a wonderful place for a cocktail party and to enjoy friends! The food was delicious and that mixed with the view it was an evening to always remember. \nWhat I enjoyed the most was the art and architectural design. Visiting Casa de los Venados made you felt part of the history. The art was amazing and knowledge that Mr. and Mrs. Venator shared made you really understand the history

78491785.name: A Cultural Surprise Behind the Doors of the Casa de los Venados
78491785.author: a TripAdvisor user
78491785.reviewBody: I first visited Valladolid in 1978 and have returned many times.  My favorite hotel is the El Meson del Marques, located on the city\'s zocalo.  Recently, the hotel\'s owner suggested that I visit a stunning new attraction near the hotel.  Nothing could have prepared me for the unique experience which awaited me behind the simple wooden doors of the Casa de los Venados.\n     Casa de los Venados should be placed at the top of the list of sites to visit for any tourist travelling in the Yucatan.  It is a four hundred year-old hacienda which has been meticulously restored by its American owners.  The interior contains one of the best collections of Mexican folk art as well as Mexican contemporary art in all of Mexico.\n     Currently, visitors can arrange a tour for the small tax deductible donation of five U.S. dollars, all of which is dedicated to a charity supported by the owners.  If visitors are fortunate, the owners will be present and personally lead the tour as they highlight and describe some of the most stunning and unique Mexican folk art available for viewing anywhere in Mexico.  Be sure to give yourself enough time to thoroughly enjoy this superb collection housed in a truly enchanting environment.  Your visit to Casa de los Venados will linger in your memories long after your return home.

78490666.name: A Labor of Love
78490666.author: a TripAdvisor user
78490666.reviewBody: Casa de los Venados is a very unique and beautiful home.  It is filled with incredible Mexican folk art.  The mural depicted just inside the entry is absolutely breathtaking.  This restored hacienda style home is very large and yet has a lovely comfortable air about it.  I love the enchanting courtyard area!  The sound of the fountain and the sunshine reflected within this area create a magical atmosphere that instantly suggests tranquility.   The artwork is a feast for the eyes.  There are also many unusual and one of a kind pieces of furniture attracting one\'s attention throughout the property.  The substantial collection reflects a true love and appreciation for  Mexican folk art.  The colorful murals in each of the suites are not to be missed.  The details hiding within are like pieces of a puzzle waiting to be discovered.  I found this home to be more interesting than many "stand alone" museums.  In their home, the owners salute and embrace several aspects of the Mexican culture into their daily lives through their decor.  This labor of love has taken about ten years to reach fruition.  This is a one of a kind home and a one of a kind experience.  Thank you to this American couple for sharing their personal collection with us!  Take a friend and check it out!  The $5.00 donation is well worth the experience.

77135420.name: An amazing Mexican art collection in a spectacularly renovated home - a must see
77135420.author: a TripAdvisor user
77135420.reviewBody: Every visit to Valladolid should include a tour of Casa de los Venados. You can tell the love and attention this charming Chicago couple put into the renovation of this casa just off the town square. What an enchanting way to discover the work of some of Mexico\'s most noted comtemporary and folk artists.

77030115.name: Spectacular Architecture and a Mexican Art Museum all in one
77030115.author: a TripAdvisor user
77030115.reviewBody:
We want to make sure that NO ONE who visits Valladolid misses the opportunity to see this amazing home and collection of Mexican Art.  A Chicago couple has recently completed a 10 year project to rebuild (that is an understatement) a 400 year old hacienda and is conducting tours, by request, for a modest donation to a charity they support.  The home is a spectacular place that has won several design awards and would be worthy of a visit by itself.

But in addition, there is huge folk and modern Mexican Art collection...one that rivals many museums.  You can see a sampling  for yourself by entering "Casa de los Venados" on Youtube.  You will see a video produced by Yucatan Living that will give you a good idea of what you will see.

We were fortunate to have been guests of the owners last year and we didn't know at the time that they were planning on arranging to have guided tours.  We urge you to take advantage of this opportunity.  It is on Calle 40, just off the main square in town.  I am not sure how you might contact the owners, but I suggest just ringing the doorbell and hopefully they will be there.

77017752.name: Like a Museum!!
77017752.author: a TripAdvisor user
77017752.reviewBody: My family and I were referred to this wonderful tourist attraction at our hotel in Valladolid. It is a block from the main square, and it is definitely worth the visit! The house is enormous, with amazing marble floors, a beautiful fountain, and a collection of Mexican folk art large enough to be considered a museum.

77010332.name: One of the best experiences in a life-time of traveling around the world. Every object rings with magic. A must see!
77010332.author: a TripAdvisor user
77010332.reviewBody:
I have spend most of my life traveling around the world. I heartly recommend to visit CASA DE LOS VENADOS in Valladolid Mexico. Truly an exceptional place in every aspect, architecture, art, decoration, .... this amazing Historical property resonates and reflects the Mexican Magic through the amazing ART collection and the presence of the Mayan energy in every corner of this magic place.
A MUST VISIT :-)

Alexandra Dumareille
956-239-2531
alexandrabunt@dialmex.net

76969722.name: Casa de los Venados, Valladolid, Yucatan, Mexico
76969722.author: a TripAdvisor user
76969722.reviewBody:
I had the distinct opportunity and pleasure to visit Casa de los Venados in FEB 2010.  I had been following the progress of this major undertaking for several years via the Casa de los Venados website, and the over 1,000 photos on that website.  However, I was not at all prepared for seeing this project up-close-and-personal.  It was vision which had become reality.  It is easy to see that John and Dorianne Venator put their whole heart and soul into this project, and that is borne out by all of the attention to detail in every aspect of this project-of-love.

The experience of visiting Casa de los Venados hearkened me back to the many times that I visited Haussner's Restaurant in Baltimore, Maryland.  Haussner;s closed in 1999 after 76 years of being in business, and that dining experience was like having a fine meal in a museum filled with thousands of American and European paintings and sculptures.  Indeed, Casa de los Venados has expanded that dining room museum-experience into a whole-house experience.

I predict that Casa de los Venados will become the principal attraction for the region, and a must-see stop on any visit to the Yucatan Peninsula.

I highly recommend a visit to Casa de los Venados from either Cancun or Merida.  It is an easy two hour bus ride from either location and a day or overnight trip to Valladolid will become one of the high points of your visit to the Yucatan.

75948641.name: Amazing home and art collection!
75948641.author: a TripAdvisor user
75948641.reviewBody: I had the pleasure of touring this home March 2010 before it was open to the public and  I would highly recommend it.  The time, money and love spent in the restoration is incalculable, but the result is worth it.  The art collection is museum quality.

75513887.name: Casa de los Venados
75513887.author: a TripAdvisor user
75513887.reviewBody:
There is a hidden gem in Valladolid that few visitors have seen.  If you wander a quarter of a block from the Zocolo on Calle 40 look for the sign for "Casa de los Venados."  If you peek through the windows you will get a hint of what is inside.  It looks like a museum - and it is.  It is also the home of John and Dorianne Venator.  They have spent the last nine years rebuilding the hacienda from its neglected and rundown condition to the gem that it now is.  It now houses the Venators' collection of folk art and contemporary Mexican art.     

It is impossible to describe in words what the Venators have done.  Take a look at:   http://www.casadelosvenados.com/  and http://www.yucatanliving.com/houses-of-merida/casa-de-los-venados-in-valladolid.htm  The home has won 4 first prizes in various architectural competitions.  

I had the opportunity to tour Casa de los Venados as the guest of the Venators.  I understand that they are now opening up the house to individuals and groups on a scheduled basis to take tours for a small charitable donation.

670307675.name: Loved our tour & tasting!  Support Mayan bees!
670307675.author: a TripAdvisor user
670307675.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of the grounds, learning about the bees and Mayan culture.  A reminder of how important places like these are in the world, who work hard to preserve traditions and species that are diminishing. \nMuchas gracias!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

666211181.name: Interesting and welcoming staff
666211181.author: a TripAdvisor user
666211181.reviewBody: Dianela was a super interesting guide, eager to answer the questions. She can make the tour in Spanish or in English. I\'ve learned a lot.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

665538065.name: Bee tour
665538065.author: a TripAdvisor user
665538065.reviewBody:
Went on the 90 minute tour. Engaging and very interesting guide. Dry cenote, explanation of how it formed, showed several local bee hives and how they work in conjunction with local fauna. 
Tasting afterwards, with possibility to purchase.
They were not at all pushy towards a sale.
Tour 100 peso per person.
We were the only ones on site.
Recommended

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

660639985.name: Awsome learning experience.
660639985.author: a TripAdvisor user
660639985.reviewBody: We went with a guide, Daniela. She is really well versed in the place, the bees and what they mean both to history and the ecosystem as well as the cycle that cenotes go through, which we had no idea about. It has a dry cenote. As it turns out, it is the perfect habitat for the Melipona bees.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

657249914.name: Bees of The Yucatan
657249914.author: a TripAdvisor user
657249914.reviewBody: It was very interesting. a nice side trip; we got to see many bees of the Yucatan.and visted a dry cenote

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

657238547.name: So interesting!
657238547.author: a TripAdvisor user
657238547.reviewBody:
We walked from our hotel and missed the morning tour but Daniela was our guide and gave us a personal tour. 
She did an excellent job.
She explained the natural history of the area, the history of the owners and of course many details about the bees and their life cycle as well as other insects and plants.
I highly recommend the tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

653212935.name: Sort of Interesting
653212935.author: a TripAdvisor user
653212935.reviewBody: This was an enjoyable tour to do on the day we left Valladolid.  Interesting to see the different trees and types of bees, but not that exciting.  Our guide was very nice and enthusiastic.  A decent way to spend a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

649116049.name: A highlight of our visit
649116049.author: a TripAdvisor user
649116049.reviewBody: We all thoroughly enjoyed this simple,  but fascinating tour. It was so informative and in a lovely, relaxed setting. The tasting session at the end was a real treat and there was absolutely no pressure to buy anything - we did though,  because it was quality stuff at a good price.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

648604369.name: Eco-friendly tourism highlight for Valladolid
648604369.author: a TripAdvisor user
648604369.reviewBody: Two of us visited on a Sunday morning for the 10 am tour, which costs 100 MXN per person. There was a large group of 12 people on the tour, but Jorge was an excellent guide and was able to keep us all engaged with his informative descriptions (in English, with some supportive signs and images) of bees, plants, and Mayan traditions. If you are lucky, you may also see the beautiful turquoise-browed motmot (on of Mexico\u2019s most exotic looking endemic birds), which appears to enjoy the natural environment of the drained cenote on the property. We were very interested to learn about the different types of Mayan honey-producing bees, and to have a chance to view them up close in a natural habitat as well as in the apiary. The tour ended with a very collegial tasting of different honey projects by the group seated around a large table; it is possible to purchase these at reasonable prices in the Xkopek store. The family running Xkopek seems to be doing very admirable work in supporting biological diversity, cultural traditions, and overall making the world a sweeter place. It\u2019s worth a visit here to support their work and share in their appreciation of the Mayan bee-keeping tradition.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

645652051.name: Amazing
645652051.author: a TripAdvisor user
645652051.reviewBody: Really cool tour to find out about the mayan culture, bees and endemic trees. At the end you can taste some products made with pure honey, delicious btw. Very interesting experience in general.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

644123920.name: Really fun!
644123920.author: a TripAdvisor user
644123920.reviewBody: 1 hr tour to learn about local bees. Walk through dry cenote and see 5 different kinds of bees. Then visit honey making facility. End by buying some honey products!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

642535248.name: Mildly interesting
642535248.author: a TripAdvisor user
642535248.reviewBody: The reviews of this tour are overly positive, in my view. It consisted of an introduction to different kinds of bees, a few sentences about local trees, and a tasting of different honey products at the end. Not much of a cultural or natural experience, but it passed the time. Go to Cenote Zaci instead.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

641958931.name: Must visit
641958931.author: a TripAdvisor user
641958931.reviewBody: Very interesting to learn about mayan culture and the local varieties of bees, traditional medicinal use of the honey

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

641874450.name: Great experience
641874450.author: a TripAdvisor user
641874450.reviewBody:
We were delighted by this tour where  you learn so much about bees and mayan culture.
At the end you can taste honey and ofcourse buy some at the shop.
We went home with couple of jars;)
I would definitely recommend this if you are in Valladolid.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

636507756.name: I learned so much about bees!
636507756.author: a TripAdvisor user
636507756.reviewBody: Wow, I learned so much about bees here. Not that I didn\'t love honey and bees before, but I now have a new found appreciation for them (especially local varieties of bees, other than the European bees that most people tend to know about). Jorge, our tour guide, has had this property in his family for generations and is very knowledgeable about Mayan bees, local Flora, and cenotes.\n\nHighly recommended! We even bought three jars of honey after it was so good

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

634931427.name: Enriching educational experience for the entire family
634931427.author: a TripAdvisor user
634931427.reviewBody: Today we visited the city of Valladolid and a beautiful bee sanctuary, named Xkopek by a Mayan family who has been harvesting bees in the Yucat\u00e1n for a very long time.  our family of six (kids ages 15,9,6,2) had the pleasure of going on a guided tour with Jorge.  He was well versed on the indigenous stingless bee species in the park, as well as the plant species in the area.  He educated us on the dry cenote and cave system, the Mayan culture and history with the plants and bees, and the families experiences with the bees over the years.  The bees actually built nest in caves and the dry cenote.  Nowadays they have bee boxes, but a bit different than European bee boxes.  The tour ended with a beautiful tasting of the variety of honey that is harvested on the land.  We also tried a fresh lemon juice and honey drink, homemade cough syrups, some pollen, and some propolis, used for medicinal purposes that the native bees make.  We were gifted with some honey sticks and candy at the end.  The entire experience was extremely educational and the patience he had with our two year old was outstanding.  We couldn\u2019t recommend this place more.  It was very clean, professional, and educational.  But the star of the show was the delicious honey.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

625103283.name: A beautiful green conor in the city
625103283.author: a TripAdvisor user
625103283.reviewBody: My wife and i desided to pay this Beautiful conor of the city a visit. Even tho the bee tour was closed on mondays, Jorge still made time to give us a privet tour. For a guy that didnt know alot bees and mayan culture i was very satasfyed. Jorge is a kind and happy guide and if you think about visiting this plase, do it! \ud83d\ude0a

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

622755787.name: Stingless bee tour
622755787.author: a TripAdvisor user
622755787.reviewBody: As Europen bee keepers, we learned alot about the variety of Stingless bee species, in Yucatan. Jorge is an accommodating host, with extensive knowledge to share

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

621924318.name: Discover the Mayan bees
621924318.author: a TripAdvisor user
621924318.reviewBody: We discovered other bee species, specially the indigenous species of the Yucatan. Nothing that you can see on Google. The tasting of the honey and pollen at the end was the cherry on the cake. Walking in the collapsed and dried cenote was  also interesting, with cave dwelling animals and plants and an altar to the Alux. We asked for an achiote seedling for our garden and the guide was very kind to gift it to us.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

620303017.name: A beautiful and unusual contact-with-nature experience
620303017.author: a TripAdvisor user
620303017.reviewBody:
Xkopek is a big nature park where you can camp or rent a cabin. If you want some quiet time away from the crowded cities, and at the same time learn about Yucatán's native bees, this is the perfect place to do so. 

As in many nature parks, kitchen and eating facilities are simple, please do not expect to find a full restaurant in there. However, those areas are functional and clean, and they serve their purpose very well.

Apart from the bee learning experience, there is also a souvenir store where you can buy natural honey and related products. Do not miss the chance of tasting the native bee's honey!!! it is something different to what we are used to. 

People are very nice and love their place and their job, they make your stay as if you were home. 

I definitely recommend this place if you want a peaceful and different experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

609032258.name: Beautiful and interesting
609032258.author: a TripAdvisor user
609032258.reviewBody: My hostel told me about this place and I\'m so glad they did. I cycled here and had a tour with Joel and absolutely loved it. It was so interesting and peaceful. The tasting at the end was great too. If you have the time it\'s definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

606747417.name: Little Oasis
606747417.author: a TripAdvisor user
606747417.reviewBody: This is very beautiful place to stay in Valladolid! You can camp with your our gear or use their tents. Perfect garden with nice places to relax. The bee tour that they do every morning is very interesting. Cool shop with all their natural products and amazing honey. We would definitely recommend staying here.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

600558099.name: A delightful learning experience
600558099.author: a TripAdvisor user
600558099.reviewBody: My friend and I  learned a great deal about native bees on our tour. Our guide, Jorge, is passionate about his heritage and helping teach about  the different  kinds of indigenous  bees in the Yucatan.  We also learned about the medicinal uses for honey products. It was great to be able to sample different honey products -- the native  honey really is better!  Definitely a great  experience.   There is some walking up and down a hill for those who might have mobility issues, bit it was manageable for two a going women.  Loved it!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

598680769.name: Excellent visit with passionate people
598680769.author: a TripAdvisor user
598680769.reviewBody: Interested in learning more about mayans bees \ud83d\udc1d and their honey, in complete nature and with knowledgeable people? Then you should definitely go visit this place!!! We found it on trip advisor, with amazing reviews and we thought we would give it a try even if you have to walk a bit to go there (took us 15-20min walking from downtown but you can take a cab). We were hosted but two brothers who made us visit the site. The visit was absolutely amazing and we learn so much, and tasted multiple honey products at the end, very yummy!! Those brothers started this project a couple of years ago, it\u2019s still very quiet but it\u2019s a must do for sure !! \n\nPs: Plus if you don\u2019t know where to sleep in Valladolid there is a campground right by the site.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

598043172.name: Gem of a spot! Don\'t miss it.
598043172.author: a TripAdvisor user
598043172.reviewBody: What an excellent and informative experience. Jorge gave a great tour - he was passionate about his family\'s business and very knowledgeable about the local bees and Mayan culture around bees and honey. We really enjoyed this spot!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

596261444.name: great time with the bees
596261444.author: a TripAdvisor user
596261444.reviewBody:
went there with a friend for a 1.5 hours of be tour.
the place is 15 minutes walk from the center and the cost of the tour is 100 pesos pp.

the tour was very interesting and fun and we learned many new things about the mayas and the bees. the tour ends with a tasting and then you can buy something in their store.
worth the money, worth the time- recommended!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

585042667.name: The overall beauty and serenity of the park
585042667.author: a TripAdvisor user
585042667.reviewBody: I   visited this park this past March.  It was outstanding in terms of educating us about the Mayan bee culture.  Our guide, the grandson of the couple who started it many years ago, was very knowledgeable, walking us through the park slowly , stopping to describe the flora and the nature of the bee species we were seeing.   The presentation of the various honey samples, description , and ambiance was wonderful.  I highly recommend this park for all.  And best of all, the Mayan bees DON\'T STING!!!  A bonus is that you are able to camp on the grounds and eat the tasty dishes prepared by "Tia"  - the aunt of the grandsons who run the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

581765263.name: Must do while touring the Peninsula
581765263.author: a TripAdvisor user
581765263.reviewBody: My 8 year old son and I toured the Yuc peninsula for 2 weeks and this was our sole purpose for coming to Valladolid and it was worth it!  It was our favorite activity next to the cenotes.  We love bees and learned so much about the local bees and plant life.  This is a family run property and it is evident how well loved and taken care of it is.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

574334255.name: Great Valladolid Destination!
574334255.author: a TripAdvisor user
574334255.reviewBody: I highly recommend the Xkopek tour, which gives you a flavor of local plants and bees that make luxurious local honey. Our tour guide was a member of the family that own the farm and he gave an interesting, engaging tour of the history and religion behind this art (bee/honey farming) and healing properties of with a honey tasting to finish.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

573691388.name: Oh honey, bees!
573691388.author: a TripAdvisor user
573691388.reviewBody: Our group took a tour of this bee preserve and loved it.  It was educational and delicious. I appreciate the care this family run business has taken in developing habitat to preserve and care for the mayan stingless bees. The tour ends with a tasting and the gift shop is well stocked with unique products made from the propolis, honey and royal jelly they collect. I will be back!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

571952328.name: Super Fun Bees!
571952328.author: a TripAdvisor user
571952328.reviewBody: We had an awesome and informative guide named Renee, that educated us on all the different types of native bees. He showed us around and the site was absolutely beautiful! I learned so much about bees, how they live, and how the locals use their honey. It was never boring and our guide always kept it fresh and fun. At the end of the fun tour, we got to taste all the different kinds of honey they get from the bees and it was super delicious. After that they have a shop where you can buy the honey you tasted or any other products that they make with honey from the bees. They also have cute t-shirts, which I of course had to buy! I would 100% recommend it to anyone that visits Valladolid. It is a must see place!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

571282454.name: Wonderful visit!
571282454.author: a TripAdvisor user
