571282454.reviewBody: My husband and I loved our tour with Jorge. He was very knowledgeable and entertaining. The honey was delicious, the property was beautiful, and the entire staff was welcoming. A highlight of our trip to Valladolid!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

570967260.name: Number 1 thing to do in Valladolid
570967260.author: a TripAdvisor user
570967260.reviewBody: Very interesting place to visit and understand local honey production and learn about different kind of bees. The local Mayan bees have no sting therefore it is perfectly safe. The farm counts as well with a dry cenote converted into a beautiful garden full of fruit trees, birds and of course bees! Our guide showed us different species of wild bees they keep only to restore balance in nature, as well as the bees they keep for honey. We could see inside of beehives, very different to the European honeycombs. At the end of the tour there was honey tasting - delicious! There is also a small shop were you can get the original Mayan bee honey and candy, perfect for a souvenir or gift. It was a great tour especially because our guide was so passionate about sharing his knowledge and work. Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

570875264.name: Great Tour & Exposure to bees
570875264.author: a TripAdvisor user
570875264.reviewBody: We went with our study abroad program on our last day in Valladolid. It was a great tour by Rene. He kept us interested and was very informed. It was a lovely experience and would definitely come back again. Seeing the bee up close and tasting different honeys was great!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

570874696.name: Flagler College Bee Tour , Amazing !
570874696.author: a TripAdvisor user
570874696.reviewBody: My Spanish class went on this tour during our spring break study abroad trip. Renee was our tour guide and he was very knowledgable and outgoing. This tour  was a highlight of my trip! I really enjoyed this gift shop as well, and bought some honey to take home to my family.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

568311338.name: Great introduction to the stingless bees of the Yucatan...and their honey.
568311338.author: a TripAdvisor user
568311338.reviewBody: I had been in this dry cenote many years ago before it became the home of melipona bee tours. and was very impressed on how fertile the ground is. Big trees had grown since I was there last. Jorge was a super excellent guide and switched back and forth from English to Spanish as needed for the different languages spoken by the visitors on the tour. Although I am not an expert, I do know something about the sting-less bees of the Yucatan and Jorge covered all the bases. As a bonus we had a tasting of various honeys and a refreshing drink of tamarind. Highly recommended as a way to experience some local flavors, nature and Mayan lore.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

567331560.name: Great Bee Tour and Great Place to Stay
567331560.author: a TripAdvisor user
567331560.reviewBody: We visited Chichen Itza and then came here for a night. There were five of us - we had two tents and a one bedroom bungalow. No hot water but not that big of a deal. \n\nThe bee tour is great - the grounds are clean and basically in town. We slept well and enjoyed our stay.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

563408136.name: Awesome family experience - don\'t miss it!
563408136.author: a TripAdvisor user
563408136.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this experience with my family and it was a fun way to support a local community. Jorge did a long and fascinating tour with my family into the dry cenote to show us the many different types of native bee hives. They are all around but until someone points it out you just don\'t notice. The kids loved exploring, finding the hives, and the stories. The honey and bee product tasting was great and you can also do some excellent shopping at the location at all hours. \n\nDon\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

562704589.name: Mayan Bee Tour
562704589.author: a TripAdvisor user
562704589.reviewBody: We went down into a cenote where bees had created hives into crevices in the rocks.  This is a special kind of bee that is stringless and whose honey is extra special.  They also have boxes where bees create hives.  After the tour, we were invited to have a sampling of different kinds of honey.  The owners asked for a donation as there is no entrance fee.  Also, they have honey for sale, and as usual, I bought a t-shirt that says Xkolpek.  The parque is a little hard but well worth the effort.  It is right in the town of Valladolid.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

558428825.name: Wonderful tour!
558428825.author: a TripAdvisor user
558428825.reviewBody: Enjoyed our tour today. Lovely place which should not be missed. The Maya bees are fascinating and they do an excellent job explaining the differences between each other and the European bee. The rejollada walk is cool and refreshing with so much information given freely. All lovers of the Yucatan should visit this place!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

554809911.name: Interesting and low key
554809911.author: a TripAdvisor user
554809911.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the 10 am tour with Jorge visiting his family\'s property. He took us to their dry cenote where we saw various bee hives, iguana, and several turkey vultures chasing each other! He showed us the vegetation important to the bees and the Mayans. We walked through the jungle, saw more hives that they can open, and then enjoyed a honey tasting. We loved how low key this tour was; no pressure fo buy trinkets! The cost is 100 pesos per adult and lasted over an hour. You must be able to walk over rough terrain and climb steep stairs.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

553809355.name: Educational
553809355.author: a TripAdvisor user
553809355.reviewBody: Delightful insight into world of the stingless bees of the Yucat\u00e1n. The grandkids were enthralled. The tour guide was helpful and informative. A truly unique experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

551984601.name: Incredible tour
551984601.author: a TripAdvisor user
551984601.reviewBody: My husband and I visited on our honeymoon to mix things up and were so pleased we did. The tour was fascinating. We learnt about Mayan culture and the different plants and trees as well as seeing a dry cenote and many types of bees we didn\'t know existed. It ended in a delicious honey tasting. It\'s well worth a visit. It\'s a slice jungle walking distance from the centre. Really great. Check it out.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

551802335.name: Native bee tour
551802335.author: a TripAdvisor user
551802335.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our trip to Xkopek. Our tour guide was delightful as he throughly and enthusiastically explained all about the native bees, dry cenote, and local vegetation. Honey tasting was also included in the tour. Definitely worth the trip if you are in the area.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

551616313.name: What a wondeful way to spend a couple of hours
551616313.author: a TripAdvisor user
551616313.reviewBody: Earlier this year Jorge gave a presentation at the Valldolid English Library about the Bees and his family. The location of Xkopek Parque is just around the corner from where we are staying. We have some friends from Canada and thought we would take them there. It was just an absolutely fabulous tour. He should us a dry centone where different types of bees make their homes as well as showing plants and trees very important to the bees and Mayans. At the end of the tour we were given a taste of  the different types of honey and a wonderful refreshing drink of Honey and Lemon juice. Our friends took home some Melipona Honey to treat a cataract. I sure hope it works....\n\nRegardless, I will be more that happy to recommend this tour to anyone

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

550481438.name: Something different
550481438.author: a TripAdvisor user
550481438.reviewBody: We loved our time in the Yucatan including the beahces, cenotes, ruins, and food, but the bee park in Valladolid was a truly unique experience. My parents had been on the tour before, but they liked it so much that when the rest of the family came to visit we all went. Jorge was our tour guide and, like others have mentioned, is GREAT and probably the most fluent English speaker on-site (but they are trying to train the younger guides so if you know some Spanish or have a bilingual group you should go with them and you\'ll both learn something!). We loved learning the history, hearing about local flora, and tasting the honey. Unfortunately they were out of the local bee\'s honey at the shop (you\'ll learn on the tour that they produce very little), but we got some of their European bee honey to go.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

550310961.name: Wonderful little place!
550310961.author: a TripAdvisor user
550310961.reviewBody: We truly enjoyed visiting Xkopek, arrived between 3 and 4 pm on a weekday and were the only ones for a tour with Jorge, whose family owns the place. It\u2019s a perfect time of the day to visit, as there is good shade, so makes for a good afternoon activity. My family does beekeeping as a hobby, and everything we saw was top notch. We paid 100 pesos per adult, half of that per kid. The 6 y o really liked it, 4 y o was interested, and the tasting at the end the one-hour tour was wonderful. We ended up buying lots of honey-based products to bring home, glad we did!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

548237690.name: Quiet Jungle paradise near to citycenter
548237690.author: a TripAdvisor user
548237690.reviewBody: A must visit in Valladolid, next to cenotes, museums and the delicious cuisine is Xkopek Park. You can stay overnight, either camping or in one of the cabins... in the middle of this tiny jungle with maya plants and animals. During daytime you can visit the park in a tour, at which they will all explain about the maya beekeeping, plants, the cenote... and so on. \nHe Dzib family is very welcoming, kind and amable. Lovely spot to cook and have a campfire. Be aware of the mosquitoes though...

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

547389335.name: Lovely place, some guides not that fluent in English
547389335.author: a TripAdvisor user
547389335.reviewBody: The grounds are interesting, especially going down into the collapsed cenote (note there is a long set of steps to go down and back out again). After reading the glowing reviews of the owner\'s knowledge of bees and plants and fluent English we were disappointed to be guided by two very nice young people who were not fluent in English. Someone else in our tour group spoke both Spanish and English, which helped, and the English signs helped too. I still recommend the tour, but if you want more than the basic info and are not fluent in Spanish it might be wise to request the owner.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

542734081.name: UnBeelievable
542734081.author: a TripAdvisor user
542734081.reviewBody: What an amazing place. We learned so much. The little Mexican bees were so cool in how they lived. I don\u2019t want to spoil the details for you as you should be as fascinated as we were. I have two young daughters who struggle to focus and they were captivated. The farm is doing an amazing thing and Jorge is so nice. You have to go here.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

542724033.name: Really nice place to learn about wild bees and their honey
542724033.author: a TripAdvisor user
542724033.reviewBody: I visited the place in November 2017 because I found the promissing reviews here and I was really happy with that choice. I contacted them via facebook and everything was really uncomplicated. Two guids showed us around the park and explained the different plants and trees that have been important for the maya and of course the bees. I did not know that there are so many totally different looking and living bees. They explained a lot and showed the really impressive cave Afterwards we got to know how they harvest the honey and we could even taste it. Really nice! I would highly recommend this place.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

538775679.name: What a great place if you like nature!
538775679.author: a TripAdvisor user
538775679.reviewBody: I am an amateur entomologist and I am familiar with the stingless bees (Melipona sp.) so I was not expecting to learn a lot. Surprise! They actually have 6 of the 8 species in Yucatan. These bees are very important in the Mayan history both as a sweetener and as medicine. The tour is really interesting. Really worth it and I will go back again.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

536061008.name: Very interesting tour and guides
536061008.author: a TripAdvisor user
536061008.reviewBody: I really enjoyed all the explanations about the bees, the Yucatan environment and its legends. I liked the eco-friendly vision of this place. A must for me!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

531519294.name: Wonderful! Highlight of our visit to Valladolid
531519294.author: a TripAdvisor user
531519294.reviewBody: We had the most lovely visit to Xkopek. It was a little difficult to find, but once we got there, the staff was welcoming and we were instantly glad that we had decided to visit. We brought with our young kids and our guide was friendly and patient with them. The tour is super interesting. It was the highlight of our trip. I only wish I had bought more of the honey lozenges because my 3 year old loved them and ate them all before the end of our trip.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

520611826.name: Great, informative and perfect for everyone
520611826.author: a TripAdvisor user
520611826.reviewBody: Jorge was absolutely fabulous!  His family have been raising bees for decades and his whole purpose is to educate the public about the indigenous bees that are STINGER LESS!!  It is amazing to see these tiny insect in their natural environment. Jorge shares the ecological need as well as the historical importance to the Mayan people! We actually rented a house through AirB&B in the town of Valladolid from Jorge. It is a modest place but all we needed. I recommend the home and the park to everyone!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

514041036.name: Fantastic insight into maya bees and culture
514041036.author: a TripAdvisor user
514041036.reviewBody: We went for the 10am tour and we were lucky to have the guide (and owner) Jorge, to ourselves. The tour lasted 1h30 and we loved every minute of it. We saw many different types of bees and their hives, in their natural environment. The part where we saw the hives that Jorge had made was our favourite.  Your get to see the bees so close and see what\'s happening in the Hive. It was fascinating.  Jorge is really passionate about the bees and he explains everything really well (his English is great).  We got to taste different types of honey at the end and it was delicious.  The tour is only 50pesos per person which is amazing value for money.  This has definitely been one of the highlights of our trip. If you are curious about bees, don\'t miss this tour!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

464764547.name: Sacred Place
464764547.author: a TripAdvisor user
464764547.reviewBody: As part of a culinary and cultural tour our group had the honor of visiting this amazing place! Jorge did such a wonderful job teaching us not only about the bees and honey but also about the Mayan culture he is clearly so proud of. \nThis family owned/operated business is truly a gem! The tour itself was fascinating and the land beautiful--it really felt like a sacred place and we were able to take a little bit of that glow back with us! The honey tasting at the end of the tour was amazing as was the shop showcasing some of the many things that can be made from honey--great place to pick up some gifts/souvenirs for back home!\nThis turned out to be one of the highlights of our entire trip and is definitely not to be missed! Highly recommend!!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

464393227.name: Best Cultural and Culinary Tour in the Yucatan!
464393227.author: a TripAdvisor user
464393227.reviewBody: I can\'t begin to tell you how much I enjoyed our tour at Xkopek. It sticks with me as the highlight of our 2 week culinary vacation in Mexico. I found Jorge/Xkopek on Facebook, and right away he was very easy to communicate with and set up a tour for our group. We were mostly interested in artisan food production, but this tour offered far more than an explanation of how honey is made. Jorge, our guide, and the grandson of the Mayan family that owned the land wove in tales of Mayan culture and environmental issues facing the bees and the humans who call that area home. We walked around the land for about 45 minutes. He taught us about trees that produce other products used in Mayan cooking and their spiritual beliefs. Jorge spoke great English, was very open and fun and organized. Then, he sat us at a table to taste three honeys produced on the land. He described in detail the importance of the bees in Mayan culture (they are stingless!!). The final tasting was from the sacred Mayan melipona bees. The honey was incredible, like fine wine. I can\'t explain the feeling that we had after that tour, it was not only educational, but spiritual in a very grounded way, and fun. I cannot recommend this tour enough. He also has very rustic lodging and camping sites available for the adventurous:) An easy walk from in town, too!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

440658290.name: Really neat experience
440658290.author: a TripAdvisor user
440658290.reviewBody:
We only stayed on night here but wish we could have stayed longer and will definitely be back on our next trip to Valladolid! Jorge was very welcoming and quickly responded to our last-minute request to stay at the ranch. We enjoyed perusing the small shop which was full of bee products such as many different kinds of honey which we could sample, edible pollen, oils, bath products (soap, shower gel, etc). Jorge was very knowledgeable about the bees and was eager to share information with us. 
The accommodations and tent itself were nice and the foam mattress/air bed was surprisingly comfortable. The bathroom was very basic but clean. There was also a kitchen which we used to cook our breakfast.
We loved falling asleep to the sounds of nature and waking up with the sun. In the morning, we walked around and saw three newborn baby goats (just two days old!), quail, ducks, and chicken. 
Overall, a great stay and we hope to come back!

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

414968079.name: Very special campsite!
414968079.author: a TripAdvisor user
414968079.reviewBody: Apart from an activity, Xkopek is also a very nice place to stay as it counts with two tents, a private bathroom and the unique possibility to stay on your own in between the nature. Jorge, the owner, and his hole family are very committed to make their guests feel at home, you get a lot of useful information, a little tour in a dried cenote that forms part of the Xkopek territory & there are also two bicycles for you to explore the surroundings (the city centre of Valladolid or the cenotes, for example) on your own. We spent a short, but great time there. Thumbs up & absolutely recommended.\n\nPS: People with a light sleep should bring earplugs as the fauna (frogs etc.) around the tents can get noisy at nights.

address.streetAddress: Calle 57 X 38 Ex Aviación Colonia San Juan, a un lado del sindicato de taxistas Los Frailes

648223413.name: Great visit: Mayapan Tequila Agave Destiller
648223413.author: a TripAdvisor user
648223413.reviewBody: We were on a bike trip and stopped by the Mayapan distillery to learn about how tequila was made. A nice break from a long bike ride. The staff were friendly and the guide showed us how tequila was made. It was about a 15 minutes guided tour. At the end of the tour we got to taste 5 different types of tequila and wear sombrero and ponchos -- get a great tourist photo :).

646647494.name: Avoid
646647494.author: a TripAdvisor user
646647494.reviewBody:
20°43'32.75"N  88°12'22.79"W

I visited this factory from Chichen Itza. It is not worth the visit which lasts about
5 minutes for which you pay. They offer both Tequila and Mezcal at really high prices.
I bought nothing. Then you go to a souvenir shop where the prices are also very high.

I have visited other factories such as Herradura in Jalisco and that visit was worth it.
Don’t waste your time.

597686191.name: Small and nice
597686191.author: a TripAdvisor user
597686191.reviewBody: Small family business. Friendly staff.\nDone in 10 mn. The opportunity to taste 4 different types of Local tequilas. Surprisingly better than expected. Good guava honey.

597115120.name: local tequila
597115120.author: a TripAdvisor user
597115120.reviewBody: Great quick stop while on a tour or in a rental car. Right off the Cancun-Merida Toll road and very close to nearby Valladolid. The tour is interesting. The guides gave us extra tastings. Bought a small nip of tequila. The tequila is both smoky and sweet. Very different tequila than the traditional, well-known brands. Huge gift shop where we didn\'t buy anything.

566764133.name: Nice stop
566764133.author: a TripAdvisor user
566764133.reviewBody: We visited the place with our family. The tour was 50 pesos, as I had not visited any tequila distillery that it was interesting to see how it is made and of course it was nice to try different tequilas.

559044259.name: Meh....
559044259.author: a TripAdvisor user
559044259.reviewBody: The \'tour\' was very short, though it did present a couple of interesting points.  At 50 pesos, it\'s value priced.  The tequila is not bad, it has a very distinct smoky taste which will appeal to some but not to others.  The gift/souvenir shop was more extensive than the tour, and almost as interesting, as there were some fairly exotic tequilas on offer there.  OK, if your itinerary passes by the facility, but not worth a detour.

548038349.name: Surprisingly Good Tequila, Beautiful Location
548038349.author: a TripAdvisor user
548038349.reviewBody: I am not much of a tequila drinker, and found Mayapan\'s tequila to be surprisingly smooth and pleasant. The tour experience was brief, but very educational (and extremely inexpensive... 50 pesos?? Not even $3...) \n\nThe smell of the blue agave pineapples smoking was wonderful, and we loved tasting the five varieties of tequila and chatting with the distillers. Our Spanish is somewhat poor, but everyone had some command of English so we all muddled through. This was a great stop after visiting Chichen Itza and on our way to Valladolid. The location is quite beautiful as well.

537199938.name: Little Tequila Town
537199938.author: a TripAdvisor user
537199938.reviewBody: A quick visit to a little Tequila distillery that is well known in the Yucatan peninsula region. They offer free tasting before any purchase of all the types of tequila - even antiqua. They also sell Maya bees honey and Mexican cofee so definitely worth it.

477557040.name: Day trip
477557040.author: a TripAdvisor user
477557040.reviewBody: This place is so cool! They have an agave plant farm and grow, harvest, and make the tequila right there! We got free tastes and seen them labeling recently filled bottles! Awesome place!

474288925.name: Disappointing
474288925.author: a TripAdvisor user
474288925.reviewBody: The guided tour in the distillery cost us 50 pesos each, and took only around 4 minutes. The tour guide was a young woman whose English was really bad and she talked in such a low voice we could not understand a thing.\nWe got to try different sorts of tequila, but apart from that the whole experience was very disappointing and definitely not worth the money.

458195629.name: average house tequila, fun experience
458195629.author: a TripAdvisor user
458195629.reviewBody: Bit of a tequila nerd and this wasn\u00b4t a very nice tequila compared to other regions. Made roughly catering to tourists who dont know anything about tequila. Regardless, learned a lot and cant beat the price and experience. Highly recommend the stop. Tip well.

445653094.name: Worth stopping
445653094.author: a TripAdvisor user
445653094.reviewBody: On the way back from our tour they stopped here - great lesson on how Tequila is made (they can\'t call it that here ) they give you a taste of 5 types all different ages

435975863.name: Incredible
435975863.author: a TripAdvisor user
435975863.reviewBody: The agave fields are gorgeous! We learned a lot about the making of the tequila. Then got to taste! They even repoured some. The smoothest tequila ever. You can\'t get this in the USA. Our tour guide seemed a little tired and rushed us through but the son of owners was so talkative and we learned so much from him. Do not miss this place!

434812226.name: Fun stop
434812226.author: a TripAdvisor user
434812226.reviewBody: This is a quick tour stop if you are on your way to Valladolid or Chichen Itza from the Riviera Maya.  It is not worth a drive on its own.  There are English-speaking tour guides that give you a quick run down of the tequila making process.  Then you get a taster of their different varieties of tequila.  Kids are free on the tour (they don\'t get tasters!)

427447608.name: Tequila Time!
427447608.author: a TripAdvisor user
427447608.reviewBody: The tour was quick (under 10 minutes) but covered the basics of tequila production. We enjoyed the tasting at the end but there are other places to do tequila tastings in more convenient locations.

422879052.name: Tequila!
422879052.author: a TripAdvisor user
422879052.reviewBody: There is nothing like few tequila shots in the early afternoon! But even better when it is fresh artisan tequila and accompanied with personalized tour of an agave farm and the distillery. The tour is fun and educational. The Mayapan Tequila Distillery uses over 400 year old traditional methods... After touring the farm and distillery you can sample their product - from dark to light tequila - all of them good! Don\'t forget the gift shop- nice selection on tequila bottles, honey and other gifts.

400865843.name: Best Tequila
400865843.author: a TripAdvisor user
400865843.reviewBody: Best Tequila I\'ve ever tasted! There were 6 bottles that we could try with lime and salt. We had our own guide and told a lot of how the tequila was made. You can buy your favorite tequila.

400543491.name: Distillery with tour which explains the production of Tequila
400543491.author: a TripAdvisor user
400543491.reviewBody: For a very fair price we got a private tour for our group of six. We got a quick overview about growing and harvesting the Agave as well as how the Tequila gets produced. The tour included a tasting of the different grades of Tequila.

383233193.name: Wouldn\'t go out of my way to go
383233193.author: a TripAdvisor user
383233193.reviewBody: No other tourists were there, but we had to wait a while for a tour (of just the two of us).  The tour was short, somewhat informative with pretty big shots of tequila at the end.  It was fine, but I\'m not sure people need to take time to make this happen.

350504317.name: Took American visitors with us this time.
350504317.author: a TripAdvisor user
350504317.reviewBody: We have been to the distillery at least 3 times.  The first time we were there, we really enjoyed the tour.  Every step was taking place inside.  We saw the agave growing, harvested into what they call pineapples, the smoking process,  the horse drawn mill wheel and the fermenting vats.  We even saw the still dripping tequila! We really enjoyed the tour.  The last 2 times we have gone, we only saw where these things would happen.  It was much less enjoyable.\nIt is a really nice building and gift shop. English speaking guides are also available.

340795100.name: great place to visit
340795100.author: a TripAdvisor user
340795100.reviewBody: a little hidden gem, it was hard to find it but worth the time, don\'t forget to get a couple of bottles of tequila, you\'ll will regret if you don\'t do it, I just brought 4 and regret I didn\'t bring more

340661243.name: Short n sweet
340661243.author: a TripAdvisor user
340661243.reviewBody: Nice, short tour of a little distillery 3km out of town  (wished i had got me a bike instead of going by taxi). Sweet girl (cristina) giving the tour. Wasnt able to catch all that she said but enough to know how tequilla is made : )

338209030.name: Nice quick tour, good tequila, fun visit
338209030.author: a TripAdvisor user
338209030.reviewBody: This distillery offers a nice quick tour of the tequila making process, from the blue agave to burning to distilling to storage. When we visited there were young folks running the place but they were very professional and the young lady that gave the tour was 16 but she was extremely professional and courteous.\n\nThe tequila tour was 40mxn and included 4 small shots of tequila at the end. Everything above the silver entry level tequila was smooth. We took a few bottles home to share with friends.

333613733.name: Interesting Tour and Agave Tasting!
333613733.author: a TripAdvisor user
333613733.reviewBody:
I visited the Mayapan Traditional Agave Distillery on my last afternoon in Valladolid on November 17th. I took a taxi from Valladolid’s central area to the distillery, which is located just on the perimeter highway of the city (about 7 minutes’ drive). The taxi cost us 50 pesos on the way there and 40 pesos on the way back to Valladolid. The tour of the agave distillery cost 40 pesos. 

As we drove towards the distillery, I saw fields upon fields of the blue agave plant. They were huge! The taxi dropped us off in the large and empty parking lot of the distillery. We were initially worried that the place was closed, because there was not a person in sight – guests or staff. But once we walked inside the building and wandered around for a bit, we were able to find someone to give us a tour. 

Since we were the only ones at the distillery, we got our own personal and private tour. Our guide only spoke Spanish but I was still able to understand little bits of what she was saying (and I only know very basic Spanish). She showed us the agave plants in the fields surrounding the property and then took us inside the building where the agave plant was cultivated and transformed into the agave alcoholic drink and she explained the entire process and all of the steps involved. The agave is crushed using a horse pulling a stone wheel around in a circle. Our guide was informative and knowledgeable and it was a fascinating tour! I learned a lot of interesting facts – for example, they cannot technically call the agave “tequila” because it is not made in the city of Tequila (located in Jalisco). I also learned that the agave alcohol is made from the “pina” which grows underground from the agave plant. The “pina” basically looks like a massive pineapple. We even got to try the fruit of the “pina,” which had a tough texture and tasted exactly like tequila! The distillery processes and bottles the agave on-site, stores it in wooden barrels to age it and then sells it to the public in their attached gift shop. 

After the tour, which lasted around 15-20 minutes, we were able to taste four different kinds of agave, which were all different ages. I enjoyed the milder tasting one the most. The staff were really fun and we got to wear sombreros while we took shots of agave! 

Following the tour and tasting, we were invited to browse through the large gift store attached to the distillery. They had a good selection of agave, as well as a large variety of other tequilas and alcohol. They also sold typical tourist souvenirs, various agave products and honey made from the agave, which tasted delicious! I enjoyed taking photos of the expansive agave plant fields after browsing the gift shop. The plants were so huge! 

Finding a taxi to get back to Valladolid was a little bit more difficult than I was expecting. We walked a little ways down the highway to the cloverleaf, where we stood and waited along the side of the highway for about 10 minutes or so, until a taxi came along. We flagged him down and got a ride back to Valladolid. 

I would definitely recommend visiting the Mayapan Distillery for a tour when you are in Valladolid! I had a really enjoyable experience.

324452168.name: Interesting and Informative
324452168.author: a TripAdvisor user
324452168.reviewBody:
We toured the distillery in late October.  Betty was our guide and was very knowlegible of the entire process, from cultivation of the agave until it reached our glass for tasting!  We were not in a crowded tour group, so there was plenty of time to pause for pictures if we wanted, and Betty took our questions and was in no rush to push us through.

We enjoyed a taste directly from a 'batch' that was in process, as well as a taste of each of the four classes distilled and bottled there: white/silver, gold, reposado, and extra aged. And of course there is a shop if you want to buy and take some home.  

I would recommend this as a side trip when visiting in the Cancun/Riviera Maya area.  We stayed in Puerto Aventuras and found a local tour guide (Connection Zone, also highly recommend) to take us. If you've been to the area several times, it's always nice to find something new and different, off the beaten path.

Thank you Betty for an enjoyable and informative tour!

318945900.name: Great tequila!
318945900.author: a TripAdvisor user
318945900.reviewBody: The factory is quite beautiful, the agave plants all around are stunning. The tour itself is short... it\'s interesting but I was really expecting more since you are paying for it and of course at the very end they show the different presentations your may purchase and which of course after the tasting you can\'t help but buy. The tequila is great, if you are really interested in seeing how artesanal tequila is made take the tour, but I much rather recommend just purchasing a bottle of

308123246.name: Fun stop on your way to the ruins!
308123246.author: a TripAdvisor user
308123246.reviewBody: A quick stop - tour is short, and informative. Props which are given give great fodder for some hilarious pictures! A bit for all ages in the group.. Their extra viejo Tequila was pretty good. Reposada  Tequila not so much. Definitely purchase the tequila if you like it.. All other items at the shop were very overpriced.

289982875.name: Not worth the time
289982875.author: a TripAdvisor user
289982875.reviewBody: This is a very small tequila distillery. The grounds were filled with beautiful agave plants. I took the "tour" which consisted of a walk through a one room building. It did show the process of how tequila was made but I\'m pretty sure they don\'t use the donkey anymore and have a more updated process elsewhere.  The tequila tasting consisted of three tequilas they make with different ages, which I thought would get better with each shot. Boy, was I wrong. They were all horrific and burned all the way down. If you are looking for good tequila this is not the stop you want to make.\n\nThis trip was in Jan/Feb 2014.

285105953.name: Great experience!
285105953.author: a TripAdvisor user
285105953.reviewBody: I\'m so thrilled we stopped here; Definitely take the tour! After showing us the agave growing in the fields, we went inside the distillery to see how they crush the agave (with Angel the horse towing a huge stone wheel around a circle), heat the distiller with fire, and store the agave in oak barrels to age it.  They were generous with the tastings, and we purchased a few liters to bring home. Well worth the detour.

281793156.name: Short but perfect!
281793156.author: a TripAdvisor user
281793156.reviewBody: It is \u00e0 short tour that tells you all you need to know About how they make And process it all. Afterwards \u00e0 Nice tasting. They really wanted to share their way of making Their specialty. \nWorth it!

281642712.name: Blanco, reposado, anejo?
281642712.author: a TripAdvisor user
281642712.reviewBody: Fantastic visit in destillery. Good to know which tequila is good, better and the best. Personally I prefer mezcal :) Our guide said mezcal is just poor destilled moonshine, but I don\'t care. Please remember. When you drink mezcal, you must eat a bug.Never throw it away. Person finishing a bottle must eat a bug. If not, bad things gonna happened to him soon. Mexican fate...

281450545.name: Interesting and Fun Tour
281450545.author: a TripAdvisor user
281450545.reviewBody: We decided to stop by the Mayapan Distillery on the way to have lunch in Valladolid.  I have to admit, I really wasn\'t expecting much, but I thought it would be worth a stop.  The distillery is a small operation that produces Mezcal.  The tour wasn\'t expensive and one of the young woman that works in the shop gave us the tour.  It was maybe a 15 minute tour, but we both enjoyed it.  It really didn\'t need to be longer.  The shop was nice, they had a nice selection of agave products and some of the usual Yucatan craft stuff.  If you are cruising through the Valladolid area, it\'s something different to do.

279404012.name: Nice experience
279404012.author: a TripAdvisor user
279404012.reviewBody: We happened not to like the Mayapan they make there, but were only offered 2 to try.  We spent a good amount of time looking through their nice gift shop and bought a Mexican blouse, some chocolates, some Mayan honey and few other little things there to give as gifts.  It\'s nice to look out over the agave fields and the building is charming, though quite big.

253513186.name: Mas Tequilla !
253513186.author: a TripAdvisor user
253513186.reviewBody: We did the tour and tasting on a rainy afternoon and it was nice. Although a bit brief the tour was educational and it\'s interesting to see how it\'s all done by hand. We then were able to sample the 4 types they produce and bought a bottle to bring home. All in all a nice outing. It was however a bit confusing to find and I was once again let down by google maps. It\'s on a small road right next to an overpass and fairly easy to miss.

253380268.name: Fun and Informative
253380268.author: a TripAdvisor user
253380268.reviewBody: The visit here was part of an escorted tour.  The grounds are beautiful with tropical foliage and flowers.  The explanation of the process of distilling tequila from the blue agave was concise and interesting.  But, tasting was the most fun.  We tasted six different kinds, each with its own distinction. Our group enjoyed the visit, bought some tequila and several items from the gift shop. The tequila is a little pricey AND worth every peso.

245682932.name: \u00a1Viva tequila!
245682932.author: a TripAdvisor user
245682932.reviewBody:
Mayapan Tequileria is dope. Highly recommended.
Really cool traditional, craft tequileria where they produce the tasty liquor according to the old classical method. The tour is quick and instructive, the tour guides are all nice Maya ladies, and the small scale of the facility makes it ideal for a 1hour activity.
MOREOVER: The price is 40 pesos, and you get to taste their 4 tequila quality. That's what you call a deal.
You can obviously purchase a bottle as a souvenir. They have all sizes and qualities.
The location is easy too, just about 7-8 minutes away from downtown in a cab or a car.

235942005.name: Nice stop back from Chichen Itza
235942005.author: a TripAdvisor user
235942005.reviewBody: Our driver recommended we stop here and we were glad we did.  It costs $4 us  for one person and $7 US for two people tastings of tequilla and they gave us 4 shots each.  The Extra Anejo tequila was quite good.  The tasting room is kind of neat how they show you the stoves to cook the agave, then they have a horse going around in a circle to mash it up.  The tour does not take long and it it is worth it.\n\nAs you can imagine, they have tequila for sale and it\'s probably overpriced but I bought some anyway.  They also have cold beers and sodas for the road (assuming someone else is driving).   There are also bathroom facilities

224267358.name: Enjoyable visit
224267358.author: a TripAdvisor user
224267358.reviewBody: We looked round the distillery with our 3 teenage boys so this was a popular trip!  Worth a visit if you are interested in how Tequila is made- it\'s only just outside Valladolid but slightly difficult to find so look at the website before you set off.

196029230.name: Beautiful Property & Great "Tequila!"
196029230.author: a TripAdvisor user
196029230.reviewBody:
Our experience at the Mayapan Distillery in Valladolid was a positive one. We met with the owner, Enrique and he and his helpful staff showed us around the distillery, cactus museum and farm. The distilled agave is delicious and you are able to sample 4 different varieties and ages (white to 3 years). 

The whole distilling process was interesting and the location is great. It's only a couple of kms outside of Valladolid (40 peso taxi ride). 

For more information, check out our article:
http://goatsontheroad.com/tequilafloor/

167348878.name: great place and great tequila....
167348878.author: a TripAdvisor user
167348878.reviewBody:
small but great experience as i commented in my other review about this place.
great tequila, nice guys who share with you all the process of making the tequila.
great souvenir store and great costumes to take some photos, 
if you are returning from chichen itza or staying in valladolid this place deserve a visit.

167347855.name: small place but great tequila!!!
167347855.author: a TripAdvisor user
167347855.reviewBody:
An small artesanal distillery where you can appreciate all the process to create the tequila and of course taste all the variety that they produce.
Great people, the tequila is also great and the souvenir store is great and the prices are fair enough.
This visit was part of my tour with flavio tours, we really spend a good time and took great pictures with the costumes.
the best for me was the reposado!!

164205398.name: Very nice tour
164205398.author: a TripAdvisor user
164205398.reviewBody: If you want to see how is the process to mede the Tequila this one is a very nice place, you know all the traditional way to made it and test 3 different tequilas, don\'t miss the opportunity to buy what you like

164197514.name: Short and sweet
164197514.author: a TripAdvisor user
164197514.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way back to the coast from Chichen Itz\u00e1. The place appears to be designed for large bus tours, but we were the only ones there when we visited. They gave us a quick tour (30 Mexican pesos/person) and at the end you can taste their 3 "tequilas" (even though you can\'t call them that outside of Jalisco). The tour was ok, but where else can you have 3 shots of tequila for approximately US$3? They also have a large store where you can buy a number of different things from all over Mexico, including other licquors.

144340138.name: Fast and informative
144340138.author: a TripAdvisor user
144340138.reviewBody: Didn\'t take more than 10-15 minutes.  Jesse was our tour guide in English.  Not my favorite tequila but it was worth the stop.

142926951.name: I learned to appreciate distilled agave here
142926951.author: a TripAdvisor user
142926951.reviewBody: Call ahead to figure out when this place is open.  The published hours proved to be inaccurate for us.  This is a relatively new distillery which adheres to tradition and is remarkably simple.  Tours are readily available in Spanish.  If you want a tour in English, you may need to arrange something or wait a bit.  The free tour itself is quick; perhaps 20 minutes at most.  The tour ends with a tasting of the three products of this distillery (no aging, short-term aging, aged).  We purchased 8 bottles of the house Resposado (short-term aging) for family and friends.

142747617.name: Quaint traditional Experience
142747617.author: a TripAdvisor user
142747617.reviewBody: This was part of our tour guide which was a side attraction to Chichen Itza tour with Jerry we stopped off here we enjoyed our full guide of how the Tequila was made from start to finsh even including the traditional horse style crushing the tequila plant into mush to create this. We test run a couple of tequilas whilst doing this and then we purchased a  couple of bottles. The staff were very humble and helpful and showed us the full extent of the traditionalism of the technique! This is a really unique experience as its all so old fashioned like going back in time! We loved it!

139586326.name: Your chance to learn about making tequila
139586326.author: a TripAdvisor user
139586326.reviewBody: Nice introduction to blue agave,different tipes of tequila.Tour the factory,try tequila .Souvenir shop has good viriety

137754165.name: A distraction for a long drive
137754165.author: a TripAdvisor user
137754165.reviewBody: Very small factory at the side of the cuota between Merida and Cancun, at the Valladolid turn-off.  The tour was very short, and as there was no English speaking guide, our Mexican friend did the translation.  It was interesting to know how tequila is made though, and something new to tick off on the long list of things to do.

137180720.name: A great little tour!
137180720.author: a TripAdvisor user
137180720.reviewBody:
This place is really worth a stop, if you are in the area. It is a fascinating small organic family business that distils small amounts of the agave liqueur (tequila, in all but name.)
Tours are available in English and are led by one of the family members. They have a very good grasp of English and are extremely passionate about their product.
The tour takes about 20 minutes with tasting at the end.
We bought a bottle at the end and it was just as good as the samples.
If you don't have a car, make sure you get the taxi driver to wait for you. A round trip cost us 80 pesos.

132250298.name: Ole the Distillery
132250298.author: a TripAdvisor user
132250298.reviewBody: Really good to see old ways of doing things and great tastingings. Well worth a visit at the end of the day on your other trips. Close to town, Valladolid.

127052273.name: Touristy
127052273.author: a TripAdvisor user
127052273.reviewBody: Only worth it if you are passing by, not for a special trip. After sampling the tequila we we decided to purchase a few bottles from there shop only to find out that bottled tequila didnt taste anything like the one we tasted at presentation, its actually tasted really bad! Way too smokey! \nWe did take some nice pics at the place and agave plants were beautiful.

126190711.name: "Very Interesting" as Arte Johnson would say.
126190711.author: a TripAdvisor user
126190711.reviewBody: I live in Akumal, about 100+ kilometers from Valladolid, so this is a very good opportunity to see the processes involved with making tequila, even though, technically, this cannot be tequila.  It was a slow Wednesday around noon, and they had to get a tour guide from the fields, as well his amigo to lead the horse around the crushing pit.\n\nIt\'s kinda hokey, because this cannot be the real thing, but it is interesting.  It is worth the stop if you have the time, but it is not something to go out of your way to see.

125889916.name: So cool!
125889916.author: a TripAdvisor user
125889916.reviewBody: My girlfriend and I took the tour and were fascinated by the traditional nature of this operation. They do everything manually, and the amount of work that goes into producing the "tequila" at the end is staggering. We enjoyed the tour and the tasting, although I am not a fan of tequila. My girlfriend bought some in the shop, as the story behind the margarita she\'ll make from it was worth the price. The distillery seems to be eco-friendly, which we appreciate. This is an easy, affordable tour you can take while in Valladolid or just on the way to somewhere else as you pass by.

124596301.name: Very Interesting!
124596301.author: a TripAdvisor user
124596301.reviewBody: We were fortunate enough to be at the distillery on a Thursday when they cook the "pineapples".  My husband and I were the only tourists there and the owner took us for a tour.  It was so fascinating  to watch how Tequila is made.   It was a great tour and would highly recommend it.

122536273.name: Fun to see how tequilla is made.
122536273.author: a TripAdvisor user
122536273.reviewBody: Tour was only 30 pesos per person and ended with tasting of all the tequila.  It was interesting to see how it was made from plant to bottle.  Worth the stop.

121639895.name: Up close and personal
121639895.author: a TripAdvisor user
121639895.reviewBody: Take the tour!  Not only do you see how tequila is made, but you have the opportunity to taste 3 different ages.

120212273.name: Nice tour. Don\'t ask for a taxi back...
120212273.author: a TripAdvisor user
120212273.reviewBody: Interesting tour but... When we asked them to call us a taxi they said just walk over there and a taxi will come. Yeah right... Blisteringly hot on what is basically a freeway. Walked about a mile before a cab stopped. He already had a passenger but still charged us 20 pesos more than the guy who took us out there. make sure you have a lift back to valladolid first.

116127969.name: Don\'t miss this stop on your trip!
116127969.author: a TripAdvisor user
116127969.reviewBody: The Desterileria is about 5km +/- north of the city--about 50 pesos (about US$4.50) by taxi.  This was such a fun part of our vacation. Enrique gave my bf and I a tour which took about 30 min. He walked us through the whole process. It was great!  At the end we got to sample the different products. \nOne tip if you are visiting Valladolid and the distileria: After the distileria, go take a dip at one of the cenotes, as it only a few km beyond the destileria. This will save you a trip back to the town.

115161737.name: Very interesting to see how Agave Liquor is made.
115161737.author: a TripAdvisor user
115161737.reviewBody: I had heard the hearts of the agave were called pineapples (pi\u00f1as) and had this preconceived notion of them being the size of pineapples as well. Was I wrong! The pi\u00f1as are huge. It must take two or three men to move them! But they did have the wonderful aroma of pineapples as they were cut to smaller sizes, crushed, fermented and then distilled. We sampled three types of the liquor: white, aged and old. The color got darker with age and the taste became smoother and more complex. Well worth the short trip to see everything in action. Nice gift shop as well with a number of things that are hard to find outside specialty shops. They cannot legally call this tequila but for all intents and purposes, that\'s what it is.

114811185.name: A very educational, informative and enjoyable FREE tour / and tasting!
114811185.author: a TripAdvisor user
114811185.reviewBody:
Mayapan liquor is a 100% Blue Agava distilled beverage - but it can not be called legally tequilla, since it is not make is the state of Jallisco. (Just like California sparking whiite wine can not be legally called Champagne since it was not made in the provence of Champagne in France.)  Too bad - as it only adds to the confusion to have to say it is really premium tequilla, but you can not call it that.

The brand new distillery, gift shop and demonstration tour area are all very nicely designed.  There are also men's and women's bathrooms which are very clean and up to USA standards.  The distillery is easy to find - as it is just a few kilometers North of the city of Valladolid on the main road leading to the Merida / Candun toll road.

We especially enjoyed the tour which included the horse walking around and around in circles pulling a large "crushing stone" to mash the agava "pineapples" before they are then allowed to ferment and then are distilled into the liquor.

The facility also has a tequilla shop - where they sell not only their own brand in "silver" reprosado and aenjo (spelling?), but other brands as well. 

 Be sure and buy a bottle of Mayapan liquor to take home with you -  as Mayapan liquor is a "boutique" superior quality brand that will be very much enjoyed by any of your friends that are knowledgable tequilla drinkers.

111209513.name: Cool find!
111209513.author: a TripAdvisor user
111209513.reviewBody: We got a little lost around Valladolid, driving from Cancun to Merida. Glad we did! We stumbled upon this small aritsan tequila distillery and really enjoyed the tour and tasting. Superb tequila! Great people. Stop in if you are in the area or near Chichen Itza.

98213800.name: Great Tour of the Mayapan Destilery
98213800.author: a TripAdvisor user
98213800.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the tour and 100% blue agave Mayapan testing.

96965576.name: Nice little side trip...good demonstration
96965576.author: a TripAdvisor user
96965576.reviewBody: We enjoyed our brief stop over at the Distilery.  Nice demonstration / excellent tasting!  The also have a shop that sells tequilla there.

668334293.name: Something to do
668334293.author: a TripAdvisor user
668334293.reviewBody: Overall a quality experience with a couple of shortcomings. \nAt reception we were told towels were provided and included in the price. Once inside we learned towels were only available for purchase. Tips were aggresively pursued everywhere on the property. Buffet with a variety of selections. \nNo drinks included.

661525836.name: Good to visit
661525836.author: a TripAdvisor user
661525836.reviewBody: Visited this place was on the way to Chichen Itza, not crowded. I think the view is not good as Ik Kil cenote

650397395.name: Amazing!
650397395.author: a TripAdvisor user
650397395.reviewBody: Stopped here on the way to Chichen Itza. Very cool cenote and very cold water that was refreshing on a hot day. Swam and explored. Good change facilities, though the info provided wasn\'t the clearest on how to get changed, get equipment, etc

647967071.name: Another great cenote to visit and swim
647967071.author: a TripAdvisor user
647967071.reviewBody: We did not swim this one but our friends did and very much enjoyed it.  No one else was there at the time and wooden stairs allowed for easy access

638733385.name: Breath-taking experience!!
638733385.author: a TripAdvisor user
638733385.reviewBody: This Cenote is located in the beautiful Hacienda area.  We stopped here to enjoy swimming in the Cenote on route to our visit at Chichen Itza. They are clean, organised and safety cautious.  At the changing facilities you can lock your personals, take a shower and get life jackets (compulsory).  Our group enjoyed the cool swim and some more adventurous jumped from the higher platforms (almost 4m).  There are areas where you cannot swim (marked with ropes) but you can access the waterfall.  We did not eat at the restaurant so I cannot comment on the food.\nThis is most certainly something I gladly recommend to include in your tour \u2013 you will not forget the experience and the beauty!  I have to say this was the highlight of my day \u2013 absolutely breath-taking!

638082517.name: Awesome cenote
638082517.author: a TripAdvisor user
638082517.reviewBody: It was our first time at any cenote. This is a place we highly recommend for visitors to this beautiful city of Valladolid. It is from our favourites. The entrance to the cenote and the life jacket is a must and required during the swim. I love their service and their facilities. We love it and we will return! \n\nMake sure to avoid 13 Baktun tours

625124079.name: For Me --- Hard to have the Words.
625124079.author: a TripAdvisor user
625124079.reviewBody: I felt this Nature Wonder was just that A WONDER!  Yes, Hard to Have the Words.  I thought this was Beautiful, Stunning, Everything.  The water was refreshing. The wall from the bottom to the top and the top to the bottom were Beautiful.  Yes --- pure Sweetness.

614715432.name: Gorgeous cenote, artificial waterfall, viewing deck
614715432.author: a TripAdvisor user
614715432.reviewBody: We went to see Hacienda Selva Maya\u2019s own Cenote Saamal right after we finished our buffet lunch at the restaurant. Cenote Saamal is an open and round-shaped sinkhole, similar to the Sacred Cenote in Chichen Itza, except with clear waters, and definitely more appealing. A tall artificial waterfall pours a steady trickle into the waters below. Life vest use is mandatory for all swimmers, regardless of skill level. Uneven stone steps lead down to a viewing deck for guests who only came to have a look at this gorgeous cenote. We walked halfway down the wooden stairs to pose for a quick pic and left soon after for our next destination, downtown Valladolid.

613544061.name: Nature wonder
613544061.author: a TripAdvisor user
613544061.reviewBody:
Cenote Saamal is located in the Hacienda Selva Maya . Yucatán peninsula . We visited as a trip from Playa del Carmen to Chichén Itzá . 2 hours trip from there .
The Cenote is a water hole formations in the rocks . This place is beautiful , you can swing and diving . Is a restaurant there with  buffet providing local food and some internacional too.
A shopping with locals merchandise , tequilas , souvenir .
Nice place to have a fun and relaxing day .

586258603.name: First Class Cenote Experience
586258603.author: a TripAdvisor user
586258603.reviewBody: All cenotes (sink holes) have their particular charm.  What this one has that sets it apart, it\u2019s a full-service operation around it. There are bathrooms, restaurant, stores, etc. Even if you come with grandma and she doesn\u2019t want to get in, there is plenty for her to do while she waits.  Very nice set up around one of God\u2019s wonders.

567344707.name: A must see!
567344707.author: a TripAdvisor user
567344707.reviewBody:
This is the only cenote I've ever visited, but it was worth the time for sure!  We went as part of a tour so I'm not sure what it cost to enter and rent a locker and life vest, but other reviews have mentioned it is not too pricey. 

There is a platform to jump from and a lower one with a ladder to get into the water from and I strongly suggest that you jump!

So refreshing and beautiful!

657071303.name: Nice for an evening stroll
657071303.author: a TripAdvisor user
657071303.reviewBody: Our hotel (Tunich Beh) was at one end of this street so it was nice for an evening walk. The street is closed to traffic in the evenings on weekends so the restaurants put chairs and tables out in the street. Some have live music. Nice to sit and have a drink except for the smokers!!!

651752347.name: Wonderful little street with some amazing shops
651752347.author: a TripAdvisor user
651752347.reviewBody: I was kind of taken aback by this sophisticated street in this little town.  Postcard perfect with some truly big-city shops, restaurants and hotels.  Both day and night it is a wonderful place to explore.\n

650381654.name: nice colourful street
650381654.author: a TripAdvisor user
650381654.reviewBody: Nice street to San Bernardino Cathedral. Many picturesque shops with local artesanal specialties. Houses are low and you can easily walk through.

647183755.name: great place to walk around while here in Valladolid.
647183755.author: a TripAdvisor user
647183755.reviewBody: I enjoyed being here the second time . Every time that I am here I see more things I want to do NEXT TIME...

647153041.name: VISIT THIS STREET ON THE EVENING WALKING TOUR
647153041.author: a TripAdvisor user
647153041.reviewBody: Every evening at 7:00 p.m., a free walking tour is offered in Old Valladolid.  It takes you down this street which is especially charming in the evening light.  A residential area, there are also some fine restaurants, bars, and shops.  The street ends at the Convent de San Bernardino de Siena.

644441663.name: Hipster Street of Valladoid
644441663.author: a TripAdvisor user
644441663.reviewBody: Indeed a nice street to wonder which used to connect the old Indian village with the monastery settlement. Most houses are newly decorated in different colors with many fancy small-scale shops and boutiques. However, some of those places seem to go a bit over the top with the prices and the street seems just a stark contrast to most other parts of the city.

643410228.name: Beautiful street to wander
643410228.author: a TripAdvisor user
643410228.reviewBody: Great places to shop, eat and relax. Just on edge of city centre but should not be missed, as plenty of choice

636739765.name: Pretty street, but watch the traffic!
636739765.author: a TripAdvisor user
636739765.reviewBody: The colonial-style buildings are colorfully painted, and there are large planters on the edges of the street - very attractive!  Just watch as there is not much room to walk, and the cars move along pretty fast!  We stayed at Tunich Beh on Calle de los Frailes, and enjoyed the location very much.

633279345.name: great colonial street
633279345.author: a TripAdvisor user
633279345.reviewBody: At first we thought we were lost in a local neighborhood. But soon we saw some great shops and a spa  which was absolutely beatiful and had a little coffee shop in their gardens and sold exquisite perfume made on site. At the end of the stret is a local park next to the covenant that was delightful

629405182.name: Glad we came
629405182.author: a TripAdvisor user
629405182.reviewBody: Very nice colonial town very easy to walk around an enjoy this Mexican town. My wife and I wish we had more time to explore but we were on tour stop.

600530736.name: Pretty town
600530736.author: a TripAdvisor user
600530736.reviewBody: This is a very pretty town, where you can get a more local Mexican experience. I can definitely recommend to go and combine it with the cenotes nearby which are gorgeous too.

587028724.name: Historical Building and Photo Opportunities
587028724.author: a TripAdvisor user
587028724.reviewBody: We walked around and took picture. The street is full of color historical homes. We saw restaurants and few boutique shops and galleries.

577661588.name: Lovely restored colonial street
577661588.author: a TripAdvisor user
577661588.reviewBody: Step back into the 18th century along this street. It connects the Convento with the city center so a great walking connection with shops, a few restaurants and private residences.

560933000.name: Prettiest streets and buildings
560933000.author: a TripAdvisor user
560933000.reviewBody: Highly recommend spending a few hours exploring this area. Couldn\'t stop taking photos of the beautifully painted buildings. Lots of local shops and wonderful restaurants in the area as well. Well worth the drive from Tulum.

560262741.name: Nicely restored, gringo oriented
560262741.author: a TripAdvisor user
560262741.reviewBody: This is a quaint little street with typical Yucatan single story buildings in many bright colors. Its lined with galleries, shops and a few restaurants. The sidewalks on the street are extremely narrow so that two people walking in opposite directions will have a difficult time passing each other and staying off the street. The street is poorly lit at night, which some might call romantic Most if not all shops cater to tourists,as prices are quite high for the locals.

556145238.name: Picturesque, beautiful street!
556145238.author: a TripAdvisor user
556145238.reviewBody: This is a beautiful, quiet street with lovely buildings, restaurants and shops on the way to the convent.  Definitely a must see when in Valladolid.

532070842.name: Fantastic City!
532070842.author: a TripAdvisor user
532070842.reviewBody: Valladolid is this rather small, very friendly & personal city, with tons and tons of Colonial Charm.  Beautiful buildings, great little stores and restaurants. \n\nSure, you can tell the town is (too close) to Cancun, but it has tons of charm.  Well worth a visit!

502558495.name: Very old typical housing
502558495.author: a TripAdvisor user
502558495.reviewBody: You can noticie the old town, its colour ful, street, you can do it walking or in Car, this town has every thing

487807523.name: great street to walk from the cathedral to the convent
487807523.author: a TripAdvisor user
487807523.reviewBody: we loved the walk from the Cathedral to the Convent to watch the Lights and Sound history show; that street soon will be full of cafes, small restaurants, specialty stores and more!  I would love to see that street as a pedestrian-only street!!

483043072.name: Main street
483043072.author: a TripAdvisor user
483043072.reviewBody: Very cute street that connects the Convent with the Cathedral. Various restaurants and cute shops. Be careful with prices though as they appear to have many tourists and increase them considerably for what you\'d expect.

477975981.name: A must-see in Valladolid
477975981.author: a TripAdvisor user
477975981.reviewBody: The calzada is a must see while in Valladolid. The best is to have a walk from the main plaza all along this street, perhaps in your way to the "Ex-convent of San Bernardino of Siena". Some very good shops (many of them very expensive) and some very good restaurants too.

669027296.name: Beautiful plaza
669027296.author: a TripAdvisor user
669027296.reviewBody: The plaza is really beautiful.  Fun to hang out and people watch.  We caught some aztec dancers and folk dancing one evening, really enjoyed it!

663571014.name: Vallodolid experience
663571014.author: a TripAdvisor user
663571014.reviewBody: After a long day of visiting Xichen Itza and the Cenote Suytun, grabbing a caramel churro and seeing the San Servacio Church across from the town square, was just magical. It was the perfect day of being able to visit one of the seven wonders of the world with a Mayan-Mexican guide and learn so much about the culture. If you are planning on taking an excursion while in the Maya Riviera, this is a must do experience. You will be so glad that you did, even in the heat and humidity, it is all worth it.

663543341.name: Peaceful yet Lively
663543341.author: a TripAdvisor user
663543341.reviewBody: This is a nice town center plaza with a good amount of (some interesting) seating options.  There were food stands and people buzzing about mid-week.  We only had about 30 minutes to spend here, but I could enjoy it close to a full day.

658644355.name: Colourful leafy park
658644355.author: a TripAdvisor user
658644355.reviewBody: This is a lovely little park in the middle of Valladolid. We walked through here several times whilst in town and enjoyed being there. It looks well maintained, and looked after, and the bright colours give it a cheerful atmosphere. There are some friendly vendors selling snacks and drinks, and lots of seating if you want to take a rest for a while.

657251824.name: Lovely park
657251824.author: a TripAdvisor user
657251824.reviewBody: This was one of our favorite places to go and rest while staying in Valladolid. It was fun to watch the dancing in the evening.  It made a nice stop to sit and eat an ice cream. It was fun to sit and just people watch .It was nice to see an active center of town.

656435998.name: Underwhelming stop
656435998.author: a TripAdvisor user
656435998.reviewBody: This plaza is a 20 min stop on most tours to Chichen Itza. The park is not very well maintained and the trees are overgrown the foliage hides the church which is the focal point of this square. It has a food court with washrooms and an upscale chocolate store at the intersection as well.\n

648016277.name: Lovely,leafy area to sit and relax a bit
648016277.author: a TripAdvisor user
648016277.reviewBody: This is the main square of Valladolid and a great place to people watch.  On Sundays there is a handicraft market starting around 10am which goes all day.  There are some interesting textiles, leather items, some jade items and an booth that sells items made from gourds.   In the evening there is music.

647889926.name: Main Square with small town flair
647889926.author: a TripAdvisor user
647889926.reviewBody: Reminds me of M\u00e9rida 15 years ago. Vendors located around the main square. Lots of stores surrounding it. I was surprised there were so many tour buses there. There\u2019s lots of paid parking areas (cash only). Our teens were disappointed in the corn flavored ice cream lol. I enjoyed it.

645002623.name: Quaint colonial town
645002623.author: a TripAdvisor user
645002623.reviewBody: Definitely stop by here on your way from Chiche Itza. The central park, or the Plaza e Parque is very cute, the food place surrounding are awesome. \nThe church by its side is also superb. We had churros, corn on the cob, chocolates all made right there in front of you. we did not venture far from the bus as we had only 30 minutes here, but we made the most of it.

644955378.name: Beautiful beautiful beautiful
644955378.author: a TripAdvisor user
644955378.reviewBody: The park here is very beautiful and offers some amazing picture opportunities with the Cathedral de San Servasio in the background. The found is a stunning centrepiece and the park is full of character and a buzzing atmosphere.

642857795.name: Lovely Plaza
642857795.author: a TripAdvisor user
642857795.reviewBody: I love that Latin countries always have plazas, and often numerous plazas in a city or village, with one every few blocks. What better way to encourage people to come out into their neighbourhood and greet others, chat and interact. Though I love travelling in Asia, I found myself often wishing for a place to sit and people watch, rest, have a coffee or cool drink \u2014- to no avail. The Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton in Valladolid is just a great place to rest and enjoy the tide of life around us.

634652925.name: Peaceful park
634652925.author: a TripAdvisor user
634652925.reviewBody: As more central parks in Mexican cities this one was also very nice especially in the evening when most of the tourist buses are gone and the local people walk around here and making some music of dance a bit. \nWith the cathedral in the background it was a wonderful place to be.

630841571.name: Super Fun Weekend Adventure
630841571.author: a TripAdvisor user
630841571.reviewBody: We were in Valladolid for the weekend.  What a treat.  The Plaza was hopping all weekend.  Saturday had great market stuff and heaps of brilliant street food, good value.  Highly recommend the roasted corn with mayo, special cheese and chile.  Seriously, a MUST try!  The people were friendly.  On Sunday there was live entertainment on one side of the park (they close the streets off).  Various performers through both days.  The vendors were not pushy at all.  Friendly and cheerful.  Just a great place to sit and people watch too, or pop in for an early morning sunrise photo shoot on the side streets.  Brilliant colours on the buildings, especially with the morning light.  Classic and true Mexico. And, the folks at the info centre were amazing and patient, no matter how many times you came back in. Free wifi in the park as well.

629404655.name: Peaceful
629404655.author: a TripAdvisor user
629404655.reviewBody: Walked through here after we had lunch nearby. \nConsidering cars circle this plaza it had a peaceful fill. Good place to sit and relax.

622757552.name: The plaza in the center of town in Valladolid
622757552.author: a TripAdvisor user
622757552.reviewBody: Small plaza near the main Cathedral.  Has a working fountain in it.  Places to sit and people watch abound and lots of craft and souvenir sellers too nearby in the plaza.  There are sets of white chairs interconnected and which face each other, quite interesting actually.  \n\nI liked this park/plaza, quite simple and understated Clean, worth a quick check out if in the town.

621583017.name: My first choice is Plaza da Candel\u00e1ria, but both are wonderful.
621583017.author: a TripAdvisor user
621583017.reviewBody: Wonderful place to go to rest, watching the movement and enjoy a quiet city. My first choice is Plaza da Candel\u00e1ria, but both are wonderful. It has several food options and you can see the beautiful central church.

614975204.name: Typical square-shaped park, surrounded by parked tour vehicles
614975204.author: a TripAdvisor user
614975204.reviewBody: Our tour group was given free time to explore downtown Valladolid and we were dropped off right next to this park. My husband and I have been to many colonial towns in rural parts of the Philippines--the country was under Spanish rule for over 300 years--and the sight of Parque Francisco Canton Rosado definitely reminded us of those places...typical square-shaped park, right across the old church and town hall, a central fountain, park benches and vendor stalls... \n\nWhen we were here, the entire square was literally surrounded by an assortment of parked tour vehicles. It was not a pretty sight and you cannot see the plaza from across the street. However, said vehicles\u2019 presence is not at all surprising since downtown Valladolid is part of most tour companies\u2019 Chichen Itza itinerary and the park is obviously the most practical spot to do pick up and drop off.

614765459.name: Cute Little Town between Tullum & Playa Del Carmen
614765459.author: a TripAdvisor user
614765459.reviewBody:
This is a cute small town on the way from Tullum to Playa Del Carmen. If you want to explore typical day to  day Mexican lifestyle/ shops/ restaurant and people, this is the place to be. 

I found a large Galleria full of Small Eateries with lots of common seating. 

It isn't a large town, you can cover the central place by walking 20 min on each side.  There're many restaurants & shops around the central plaza. 

One thing which caught our attention was this vendor on a cart selling crepes inside the park. He had atleast 2 dozen variety of crepes, and the waiting was as long as 45 mins.. But the speed  & efficacy at which he was rolling out those crepes was remarkable. 

He uses 2 unique large iron crepe makers on a gas flame. I'd strongly recommend paying a visit to him in the evening if you're in town. If not for crepes, but for his effort too.

612668090.name: Very pretty
612668090.author: a TripAdvisor user
612668090.reviewBody: This is just a nice area in the middle of town with benches, vendors and gardens.  It was an easy meeting spot also.

604752369.name: Nice place to watch the world go by
604752369.author: a TripAdvisor user
604752369.reviewBody: We stayed at Maria de la Luz on the plaza and spent most of our evening sat in the plaza. Lots of places to sit and on weekends quite a few food vendors around the edge to get a snack from. Beautiful view of the cathedral

597773039.name: A bit of Colonial Spain in the Yucatan
597773039.author: a TripAdvisor user
597773039.reviewBody: I live n iTulum, about an 1.5 hours from Valladolid, but love to got there.  It\'s a great walking town and the park in the center is really a great place to people watch and see some local folk art dancers.  It comes alive at night with the hustle and bustle of vendors and locals hanging out.  You can spend some of the day and evening shopping and eating along as you walk the city streets. On some of the side streets are great restaurants.  And don\'t forget the big indoor Market that\'s open on the weekends.

597594684.name: Beautiful little town
597594684.author: a TripAdvisor user
597594684.reviewBody: We stopped here after seeing Chichen Itza. We had a private tour take us to the Yucat\u00e1n. We stopped here at the plaza for a short bit and walked around. We went to chocolate shop on the corner and saw the mayor\u2019s residence. Our guide also took us into town a few blocks away and we walked around the Saturday market that was filled with all locals. Was so nice going somewhere and not seeing tourists. Thanks to Kay tours, we were able to see this gem.

594482361.name: Great Family Park
594482361.author: a TripAdvisor user
594482361.reviewBody: Parque Francisco Canton was a nice park that my tour bus stopped at after spending some hours at Chichen Itza. The atmosphere was great and you can tell that this place is more like a local neighborhood place for families to hang out and enjoy live entertainment. Not sure if this is something that happens on a daily basis but when we weee there they had a mariachi band and some dancers. While enjoying the show they also had a few stands with snack you could enjoy as well. My group had a blast!

587028357.name: Good Place to People Watch
587028357.author: a TripAdvisor user
587028357.reviewBody: This is a good place to watch people and the local life. It is good early in the morning or late in the evening. In the afternoon, there are lot of tourist buses and tourists wandering around.

573320095.name: nice plaza
573320095.author: a TripAdvisor user
573320095.reviewBody: The heart of Valladolid. Strawl around and let your self flow.\nYou\'ll always find somthing interessting.\nMaybe buy an icecream and have seat....

572772763.name: Beautiful
572772763.author: a TripAdvisor user
572772763.reviewBody: The park was very beautiful, I wish I had spent more time there. The confidant chairs were cool and romantic. The churros were amazing! The scenery was just awesome, I can\u2019t wait to go back.

568991891.name: The plaza is fixed up and really pleasant
568991891.author: a TripAdvisor user
