568991891.reviewBody: We were here in the evening and the plaza was really nice. Fountain working, families enjoying the place- it\u2019s very nice.\n

567966819.name: A lovely place to sit and relax out of the sun
567966819.author: a TripAdvisor user
567966819.reviewBody: The park is central to Valladolid and provides an enchanting place to sit and watch the world go by. The layout is attractive and worth visiting.

566818798.name: Relaxing and enchanting
566818798.author: a TripAdvisor user
566818798.reviewBody: One of our most favorite times in the Yucatan. Perfect place to spend some time sitting in the romantic chairs during the evening after dinner.

564340015.name: Stop over
564340015.author: a TripAdvisor user
564340015.reviewBody: Nice stop after chichen itza tour, Cenote swim and lunch. The church wasn\u2019t open so walked around here for a while, found the churros shop across the street and the chocolate shop at another corner maybe nice later at night to sit and enjoy some marquesitas but they weren\u2019t open yet when we passed by. there\u2019s a nice food court for authentic local fare, with restrooms to use with a fee

563656429.name: Nice city park
563656429.author: a TripAdvisor user
563656429.reviewBody: In the middle of city this is a nice little park with lot\'s locals. Some vendors selling ice cream and other sweets, people walking their dogs, there are many places to sit and enjoy. Around the park there are restaurants stores and churches.

562556158.name: Great place to walk and relax
562556158.author: a TripAdvisor user
562556158.reviewBody: One of the several plazas in City. Nice walking paths. Vendors. Nice seating to just sit and enjoy the people and atmosphere

561057912.name: Pretty central square
561057912.author: a TripAdvisor user
561057912.reviewBody:
Our driver suggested a detour to avoid the monotony if the highway to Tulum

We are glad he suggested it because we passed through some interesting villages and found Valladolid to be a very charming oasis in the middle of the Savannah 

The side streets are charming, a lot like Mérida, and we are in a food market on the corner of the plaza 

In all we stopped off for about an hour

560268789.name: Typical Yucatecan Plaza
560268789.author: a TripAdvisor user
560268789.reviewBody: A lively central plaza with a nice park inside. Surrounded by single and two story colonial buildings it is a nice place to relax on a bench after a day of touring. The cathedral of San Gervasio is a major point of interest along the plaza it is also where most of the events are happening during the night. Nice, but unspectacular, in a word, quaint.

560216153.name: Short stay
560216153.author: a TripAdvisor user
560216153.reviewBody: The trip wasn\u2018t planed, although worth it after visiting Ek Embal. Lovely nice town with the unexpected carnival feeling. Nice to see people in traditional clothes celebrating and dancing. Thanks for this experience.

559064029.name: Scenic and lively.
559064029.author: a TripAdvisor user
559064029.reviewBody: My wife and I spent a 1/2 day here after a walk through Coba Ruins. The town center was very alive with vendors, restaurants, and towns people. The tourist to locals ratio was substantially in favor of the locals. We were looking to get off the beaten path and this was as far as time would allow us to get. The setting was very scenic and had a historical, old charm to it. Everyone was friendly and everything was well maintained. parking is a bit of a challenge and will require some patience, especially on a weekend. The local restaurant had very good food and the was of great value compared to the cost-cheap eats, quality service and excellent authentic food. A very worthwhile little adventure.

556918291.name: Vibrant city sqaure
556918291.author: a TripAdvisor user
556918291.reviewBody: Coming from small town Alberta I enjoying seeing such an active central park where people all mingle.  There are booths and stalls selling all kinds of wares, there were street performers, and there were people watchers (like myself).  People all all ages talking, having a treat, taking a walk and just being social.  I felt safe and comfortable.  Lots of smiles and goings on.  Nice place to stop for a quick stroll, an ice cream or what have you.  \n\nThis is the main park located right across the street from the old cathedral.

552982356.name: Lots of Good Street Food
552982356.author: a TripAdvisor user
552982356.reviewBody: The day we went here there was a market, tons of vendors. They had an excellent amount of street food vendors. Churros, street corn, some type of bread thing that I had no clue what the name was, but everything was delicious! \n\nWe came here on a tour, the last leg of our trip. I would have loved to have more time to spend in Valladolid, but am glad I at least got to experience this little square.

550416679.name: Beautiful zocalo
550416679.author: a TripAdvisor user
550416679.reviewBody: Beautiful area with unique park benched and a cathedral. Lovely area to walk through, free parking behind the bancomer. Lots of vendors and a relaxed vibe.

549940275.name: Nice park
549940275.author: a TripAdvisor user
549940275.reviewBody: A nice place to stop and rest after a long tour. There was a market here the day we visited. Its in the center of Volladolid. If you are given free time in the town you may as well check it out.

548311424.name: Good place to rest
548311424.author: a TripAdvisor user
548311424.reviewBody: This is a small plaza in Valladolid. My family and I visited on our way back to Cancun from Chichen Itza visit. It is a good place to take a rest from long bus ride. There are some food vendors that sell mexican food.

540925388.name: Best spot in Valladolid to rest and explore the surroundings
540925388.author: a TripAdvisor user
540925388.reviewBody: Small square, like we find a lot in Cuba, Spain, etc. \n\nLot of seats, clean, relax, shade. Next to the little cathedral and local stores to explore. We all enjoyed.

532068058.name: Beautiful Zocalo
532068058.author: a TripAdvisor user
532068058.reviewBody: Valladolid is a truly charming town, and the Zocalo (Main Square) is wonderful.   Grand, beautful, and surrounded by beatiful buildings.   \n\nGreat for strolling, people-watching, just to soak up the atmosphere of Colonial Grandeur.

526363106.name: Very pretty local park
526363106.author: a TripAdvisor user
526363106.reviewBody: When you visit this quaint little town, take a stroll around this park.\n Very pretty and well kept. Small, doesn\'t take long.

504049219.name: Nice coloured square
504049219.author: a TripAdvisor user
504049219.reviewBody: Take your time and have a seat in this place. Just smell the city, the people, the tourists, colours, business... it deserves at least 15 minutes to enjoy this fantastic place.

504026477.name: Small historic town
504026477.author: a TripAdvisor user
504026477.reviewBody: We visited the ruins at Ek Balam and than travelled about 15 minutes to the town of Valladolid. Sunday evening we had a wonderful time in the town square in front of the hotel. There were traditional esquites, marquecitas, and ice cream to be had. Live music, and dancing also. Very quaint. Be sure and bring your camera, walking shoes, and mosquito repellent. We were spending the night since we had spent most of the day visiting ruins and cenotes, and wanted to visit a nearby museum in the morning.

503351726.name: In the heart of zocalo
503351726.author: a TripAdvisor user
503351726.reviewBody: In the heart of Z\u00f3calo, near every thing, from Market for eating, to the punish cathetral of Valladolid,

502943853.name: Nice, relaxing square
502943853.author: a TripAdvisor user
502943853.reviewBody: The plaza has lots of vendors, seating in the shade, and is very safe. Nice place to sit and people watch or just get out of the sun. Go get an elote (corn in a cup) or ice cream and enjoy the scenery. They also had comedians on the weekend (if you understand Spanish), and there are plenty of places to eat and shop surrounding the square.

499628525.name: Great plaza to relax and people watch.
499628525.author: a TripAdvisor user
499628525.reviewBody: Great central plaza to relax and people watch. There are vendors selling refreshments and usually bands playing traditional music.

486802011.name: Beautiful Central Square
486802011.author: a TripAdvisor user
486802011.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the Francsico Canton Square. By day we used it to relax and have an ice ream in the heat of the sun but by evening the place really came alive as all the locals congregrated there and there was music and a real buzz.\nValladolid is a nice, sleepy town and this square is at its heart with nice places to sit and chill out and a few nice bars and eateries either on the square or on the roads leading off it.Lovely architecture too so all in all a pretty good place to spend some of  your time in the city.

483518945.name: Coconut ice cream
483518945.author: a TripAdvisor user
483518945.reviewBody: The ice cream sellers have the most delicious coconut ice cream and you can sit on the lovers seats admiring this stylish town.

483502137.name: Plaza with charm
483502137.author: a TripAdvisor user
483502137.reviewBody: Not expecting a lot from Valladolid but was positive surprised by the small town. Nice plaza with less tourists. Great building around.

483236591.name: Center of Valladolid
483236591.author: a TripAdvisor user
483236591.reviewBody: This is the town\'s central.  The cathedral is across the street and restaurants, shopping and local merchants are around the park for blocks. IT is very historic.  The architecture of Valladolid is colonial and the park is no difference. The details and colors make this a gem.  It feels like you are back in time.  Very quaint.

478592599.name: Such a cute little town
478592599.author: a TripAdvisor user
478592599.reviewBody: We tried the stuffed churros at the plaza and they were delicious!! wish we would of stayed longer!!

477985974.name: A pleasant stop
477985974.author: a TripAdvisor user
477985974.reviewBody: We stopped in Valladolid mid-way on a long drive from Merida to Tulum and were glad we did.  The small plaza in the center of town is quite lovely and is ringed with vendors and shops selling local handicrafts.  The best crafts to be found are hand-embroidered blouses and dresses for sale, usually by the women who made them.  There is a small artisans\' market facing the square that has many small shops with excellent selections.  Valladolid is definitely worth a visit if you are passing through the area.

477974083.name: Nice place
477974083.author: a TripAdvisor user
477974083.reviewBody: Nice place, especially in the afternoons, to see all the people walking around. Many people selling food and crafts.

469450854.name: Just listen and relax (but not under the trees)
469450854.author: a TripAdvisor user
469450854.reviewBody:
An oasis in the busyish city. Full of bird life, especially at dusk when the cacophony is loudest and you stay away from under trees to avoid the drippings.

Sit on the South Western corner to see the setting sun's rays light up the side of the cathedral. 

The square used to be the site of the Mayan pyramid till the Spanish imposed Christianity on the locals and used its stones to build the cathedral and government buildings (as in Mexico City!). See review of 7/2!

Have a chat face to face with your friend or partner on the kissing chairs.

Ponder the heritage and life of the mixed race woman/mestiza in the centre and admire the cathedral overlooking the square itself.

You may be approached by a friendly, charming man who offers a ride around the square on a fancy (but not posh) horse and carriage for $1USD/20pesos. The A-Frame sign has the same deal - each. Just do him a favour! It's fun and nowhere else will you get that deal! 440m is the distance a 40 taxi took us in Coba. This is far more fun! The local driver may be on his mobile phone though ignoring you. I think the horse is in charge. 

Grab a Marquesitas, at 20 each, from the stall -a sweet crispy rolled pancake with Nutella and grated cheese just for the hell of it! 

If you want to splash out a bit then eat in Hotel Maria de la Luz (see pic). If budgeting then the Loncheria El Amigo Casiano at the end of the food hall (also pic from carriage).

An intermediate bar with a table on the pavement is a few steps away from the Hotel. Menu with food inside with other more comfy tables but no prices on the beer anyway though (45 on asking so cheaper in posh Hotel)!

Buy a cheap tacky t-shirt from the old girl by the hotel MDLL restaurant as she was the only person slightly pestering anyone. She deserves a break! 

Read the interpretation boards around the square in English but they will not tell you about the 'Crimes of The Mayors', you will have to Google that! 

Watch the barrowmen pushing huge crucifixes and other religious artefacts around the street.

Enjoy!

468668075.name: Quiet on Sundays
468668075.author: a TripAdvisor user
468668075.reviewBody: We visited a Sunday afternoon ... The Park ist really small but nice ....you need less than 10 minutes for a complete turn...so sit down and relax.\n\n

467411979.name: Lovely
467411979.author: a TripAdvisor user
467411979.reviewBody: We stayed in a nearby hotel and I awakened early (7am) in the morning to beautiful birdsong. I quietly left my husband sleeping and went alone out to the plaza. So wonderful! The trees were teeming with birds who were very loudly greeting the sun. Apart from one couple and a few locals walking to work I had the place to myself (and the thousand birds). Very memorable. The Cathedral across the street was open so I wandered in and gave thanks for the winged ones. And then took many photos and videos for birdsong as the early light began striking the buildings and nearly empty streets. So wonderful. Very Mexican without the trappings of tourism. Of course, you don\'t have to look far to find that.

466350117.name: Wish we had stayed longer
466350117.author: a TripAdvisor user
466350117.reviewBody: Valladolid was a wonderful follow up to the morning and early afternoon at Chichen Itza. This originally wasn\'t on our radar, but while we were in line to enter the world heritage site, we spoke with some people that recommended it. This is a colonial town and the plaza is a great place to grab food, drinks and take a look at the cathedral. Be warned, they lock the gates at the cathedral and if you are inside walking around you may have to do a little running to keep from getting locked in. This happened to us and some people shortly after us. The history of the conquistadors is pretty tragic. For modern times, the town and architecture is very well preserved and a pretty picturesque blend of colonial buildings, arched walkways, patterned tiles, and multiple cathedrals. There are some tourists but it isn\'t overrun by people. Parking is inexpensive and tucked behind buildings out of site of the pretty architecture. Restaurants and cafes line the plaza. I would have loved to stay multiple days here and intend to when i go back.

466333491.name: Ms
466333491.author: a TripAdvisor user
466333491.reviewBody: Beautiful place with lots of shade in the center of town. Everything is in walking distance. The people are very friendly. We would diffently visit again

465565978.name: A great view of Mexican culture
465565978.author: a TripAdvisor user
465565978.reviewBody: Our bus tour of Chichen Itza stopped here on the way back to the Riviera Maya for about 45 minutes. Good photo opportunities at the Plaza and church across the street. I think the church was begun in 1543. The town is very clean and safe and the people are very friendly.Spanish is a big plus here but not a must. Our bus guide is from here and his family distills tequila here, which they hand out on the bus. \nI\'m glad we got a taste of small-town Mexico here, and it broke up the trip back to our hotel.

458873180.name: Beautiful plaza and park
458873180.author: a TripAdvisor user
458873180.reviewBody: Reminiscent of Spanish colonial style; and well preserved; with plenty areas where one could rest after visiting the Mayan ruins at Chichen-Itza.

457901965.name: Beautiful, European-style park is good place to start your visit to Valladolid
457901965.author: a TripAdvisor user
457901965.reviewBody: Our tour bus took us to picturesque city of Valladolid in Yucat\u00e1n after our tour of the Mayan ruins at Chichen Itza. It\u2019s a beautiful city, and it was unfortunate we did not have much time to visit. We would have liked to stay longer. The principal sites in Valladolid are well marked with signs in Spanish and English, which makes it nice for English-speaking visitors. \nDominating the center of Valladolid is the Cathedral of San Servacio, which overlooks the  European-like Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton. This delightful square-shaped park is surrounded by shops selling food, handicrafts and souvenirs. A few vendors in the park offer ice cream and other goodies. Several in our group made a beeline from our bus to the ice cream vendor, and afterwards declared the ice cream delicious. A few blocks from this heart of the city is Cenote Zaci, which we unfortunately we did not have time to visit.\nAccording to Wikipedia, Valladolid, named after the Spain\u2019s capital city at that time, was established in 1543 near a lagoon. Apparently, the first Spanish settlers complained about the mosquitos and humidity in this ill-chosen spot, so two years later, Valladolid was moved farther inland to its current location. This place was apparently a good one, since it was already a Mayan town. This did not stop the Spaniards, however, and they built Valladolid version 2.0 on top of it. The Mayan buildings were dismantled and their stones used to build the colonial era-style churches and villas. As one may expect, this did not endear the indigenous Mayan population to their European interlopers and several conflicts followed. Nevertheless, by 1840 Valladolid had a population of 15,000 and was considered the third largest and most important city of the Yucat\u00e1n Peninsula (after M\u00e9rida and Campeche) until the early 1900s.

457867772.name: Perfect to get some food and peoplewatch& San Servasio Cathedral
457867772.author: a TripAdvisor user
457867772.reviewBody: Perefect palce to get some takeawayfood from any of the vendors in the street or from the nearby foodstalls a beer and peoplewatch and check out the Cathedral that is just in front, also veyr cool and confy weirdly designed chairs that face eachother ( you will know what I mean once there). Nice spot in the center of Valladolid

456837430.name: Interesting plaza
456837430.author: a TripAdvisor user
456837430.reviewBody: Beautiful plaza at the heart of this little gem of a town, Nuevo Valladolid (Yucatan).  Bordered by the man church and City Hall, it is a classic Spanish colonial design

454837267.name: Sit down in the opposing chairs
454837267.author: a TripAdvisor user
454837267.reviewBody: Really beautiful time here sat in the opposing chairs with my girlfriend just talking and taking it all in. In the evening there are artists about which is quite fun. There was a man doing a drag show which was fun to watch and lots of families about as it was not rude or over the top. Something to do all day here if you have a few minutes to sit, relax and listen. No hassle from beggars or pushy sales people either which is a blessing.

453670455.name: Not a bad plaza
453670455.author: a TripAdvisor user
453670455.reviewBody: We were dumped here when we did a tour. WE had an hour to walk around the town. I spent all the whole time in the plaza as it was very relaxing. a few vendors selling various products.

451080724.name: The fountain was not working but good spot to people watch
451080724.author: a TripAdvisor user
451080724.reviewBody: The Plaza was our second stop after the cenote. It offered a great spot to sit in the shade and people watch. The have multiple signage in both english and Mexican about the history of the place and other interesting facts.

449701567.name: Quickly View a Lovely Town Square
449701567.author: a TripAdvisor user
449701567.reviewBody: If you can only spare a half hour to experience the look and feel of colonial Mexico, this is where you want to go. The park is enjoyed by locals and tourists alike. It contains a few nice artifacts to look at (even the benches are interesting) and on the south side you get a a great view of the facade of the Catedral San Gervasio. Touristy shops surround the square.\u00a0If you\'re at the square in the middle of the day, Casa de los Venados nearby may be open.

449377570.name: Great Stop For Food Cart, Stroll and Foodcourt
449377570.author: a TripAdvisor user
449377570.reviewBody: We stopped by with the tour group. It\'s a nice park at the square with a taste of the colonial past. There are food vendors, the cathedral and a food court with various kinds of food and drink. It\'s great when it\'s nice out on your way to or from Chichen Itza.

448638035.name: Great for a stop over!
448638035.author: a TripAdvisor user
448638035.reviewBody: Excellent classic central town piazza, surrounded by nice food places, street vendors - (not aggressive at all), some shops and the regular local crowd - look for a nice walk around enjoying some great mexican food.

448533765.name: similar to any other spanish town, square church shops etc
448533765.author: a TripAdvisor user
448533765.reviewBody: Stopped here on a coach trip after a visit to Chichen Itza. To be honest if we had not stopped here I would not have missed it. It is similar to any other Spanish town. Was only there for an hour so did not see any of the tourist attractions, if there are any? just had a refreshment stop and a walk round the square.\nOne thing that is handy is that all the shops on the square have toilets for tourists.

447923573.name: Nice town square to walk around
447923573.author: a TripAdvisor user
447923573.reviewBody: This is a quiet and nice town square to walk around, people watch and spend some time on the way to Chichen Itza.  The place was clean and the vendors didn\'t disturb us much.    The statue at the center of the square was interesting.

442985968.name: Fun no matter what time of day
442985968.author: a TripAdvisor user
442985968.reviewBody: The weekend the place was jammed with activities, food vendors, and shine guys.  Stopped for breakfast at the pavilion one morning.  Great espresso, adorable older Mayan server.\nLike all squares great people watching area

436481717.name: Nice place to stop if you have a chance!
436481717.author: a TripAdvisor user
436481717.reviewBody: This is a worth stop if you\'re traveling through, or a great place to spend an afternoon. Yes it\'s touristy, but that doesn\'t take away from the beauty. On the weekend (can\'t recall Saturday or Sunday morning) it\'s lined with vendors selling things. It reminds of of some of the traditional Spanish roots of the town. It\'s surrounded by the gorgeous cathedral and some touristy shops. Visit the Artesania mall across the street (entry way next to a book store and ice cream shop) if you\'re looking for traditional embroidered clothing items.

421738067.name: Beautiful!
421738067.author: a TripAdvisor user
421738067.reviewBody: This is the place where people can sit, enjoy the food and seeing the locals and the historical site. There is a fountain here too.

421202569.name: A beautiful spot for people watching
421202569.author: a TripAdvisor user
421202569.reviewBody: Perfect for just sitting back and people watching. Bordered by market stalls the Plaza offers a place to promenade, shop or just sit and watch the world go by. We visited as part of a wider excursion but could easily imagine spending considerably longer here with lunch/dinner in one of many nearby restaurants followed by a leisurely walk in and around the surrounding streets.\n\nCompliments a visit to the Catedral of San Servisio and highly recommended.

419955101.name: Loved!
419955101.author: a TripAdvisor user
419955101.reviewBody: Cool plaza, you have to try the Marquesitas just amazing and cheap! Lol. It is cool to see the locals there and the history around the park. Loved the chairs.

413275840.name: Lots of culture
413275840.author: a TripAdvisor user
413275840.reviewBody: To appreciate Valladolid, the park lends itself to showcase the town\'s community and beauty. People are just enjoying the day, night, and each other\'s company. Not too mention the delicious Marquesita carts to indulge your sweet tooth

400323989.name: Valladolid\'s plaza
400323989.author: a TripAdvisor user
400323989.reviewBody: This is Valladolid\'s main square. On the one flank is the San Gervasio cathedral. The park itself is neatly kept and you can get a little shade from the trees in areas. Plenty of benches including \'love seats\'. You can see quite a few locals chillin\' here.

389794088.name: Quiet and beautiful
389794088.author: a TripAdvisor user
389794088.reviewBody: There are benches everywhere, there are people sitting around enjoying life and it makes you forget about the frustrations of life when you\'re there.

376560034.name: 16th Century Monastery
376560034.author: a TripAdvisor user
376560034.reviewBody: This set of structures are among the oldest built by the Spanish in the new world. Recent restorations make it a must go to site for history buffs.  The museum is well worth seeing.

367020579.name: Beautiful
367020579.author: a TripAdvisor user
367020579.reviewBody: I loved this little park in the heart of the town.. it reminded me a lot like public gardens in Halifax ns but obviously smaller.. it just had a nice friendly vibe about it. There was lots of places to just kick back and people watch or enjoy the sun \ud83d\ude09.

366487172.name: Central Fun
366487172.author: a TripAdvisor user
366487172.reviewBody: When traveling in Valladolid, my family and I found ourselves in the plaza every day. The first day we enjoyed fresh, hot and delicious churros. That evening, we were surprised by great Sunday music and extra activities for the kids (painting, jumpee houses, etc). Other days, we would stroll around and look at stalls, or just relax and people watch.

364496702.name: Nice plaza
364496702.author: a TripAdvisor user
364496702.reviewBody: The traditional placa of a south/middle-american city. Its green, flowers, trees for shade... A good place to relax a bit from the heat and enjoy

361191256.name: Quiet, peaceful, beautiful
361191256.author: a TripAdvisor user
361191256.reviewBody: It was seeing this beautiful plaza while passing through on a bus that inspired me to come back later and spend time in Valladolid, and I am so glad I did! Such a lovely city! The plaza itself is a gorgeous place to rest on a bench and plan your trip around town and is very centrally located. the Catedral de San Gervasio is across the street, as well as artisan shops, restaurants, you name it. The ADO bus station is a couple of blocks away, as are the collectivo taxis to Ek Balam, and many other attractions are within short walking distance. As an added bonus, when I was there at least, a group of women set up an impromptu market selling embroidered puebla blouses and huipils and I got myself a nice souvenir.\n\nFor a great map of the city, head to the concierge desk at the hotel El Meson del Marques (their restaurant is across the street from the northern part of the plaza). It highlights all of the attractions in Valladolid.

360712611.name: Excellent place for relax
360712611.author: a TripAdvisor user
360712611.reviewBody: It is a place for relaxing time and some of the markets of Valladolid are around.\nA place for joining with couples in the casanova style seats.\nPeople likes to give food to the birds.

359304796.name: Nice park
359304796.author: a TripAdvisor user
359304796.reviewBody:
We stopped here while on a tour.  The park was pretty busy, but It was Easter Sunday.

There were vendor boots set up (surprise!).  Everywhere you went, someone was trying to sell something to you.

There is a nice fountain in the middle of the park, and plenty of shady benches to sit it.

The park it surrounded by quaint shops an restaurants.

358747758.name: Lovely Park in the Heart of the City
358747758.author: a TripAdvisor user
358747758.reviewBody: We stopped here for a quick break/a few pictures following a delicious lunch across the road.  The park was beautiful, with plenty of locals relaxing and enjoying their afternoon on the benches/grass.  The benches near the fountain make for a beautiful photo op.  Overall, a very authentic experience.

358249369.name: Great Place for Evening Stroll
358249369.author: a TripAdvisor user
358249369.reviewBody: Have spent a couple of evenings cooling down under the park trees. Always seems to be some sort of entertainment especially Maya Dancers. Well lit and lots of seating as well as food stalls make it very user friendly. The many Love seats needed painting white again.

357094236.name: Lovely, Family Oriented Park in Downtown Valladolid
357094236.author: a TripAdvisor user
357094236.reviewBody: Valladolid is completely a family-focused town all around. The central park is just really an extension of that. Evenings and Sundays, multi-generational family groups all enjoy the park together. As is the case with most zocolos in Mexican towns, wifi is free here so even the teens and young singles tend to converge on the park just to check email, visit Facebook, and even do homework. Sundays are filled with blow-up jumping houses, multiple vendors, and playing children. Located right across from San Bernadino Cathedral, many families are still dressed in their church attire when enjoying the park. Several shops and restaurants line the square around the zocolo and most are open on Sundays to take advantage of the increased traffic in the park. Plenty of benches (now painted white to help reflect the sun) and a lovely fountain make this a picturesque place to spend some time with the locals.

354602581.name: Lovely park
354602581.author: a TripAdvisor user
354602581.reviewBody: Great place to spend some time when you are tired. Nice park, lots of shadow, interesting mexican style concrete sits, on which two persons face each other... And all that just a few steps from the most picturesque sights, shops, restaurants....

353839282.name: Wonderful Mexican plaza in center of Valladolid
353839282.author: a TripAdvisor user
353839282.reviewBody: A wonderful Mexican plaza, It\u2019s found in the center of Valladolid. It really seems to be the heart of the town. Sitting in this park is a wonderful way to sit and rest on the plentiful benches (many in the shade) enjoying the trees and watching the locals interact with each other enjoying life in general. They have these fun couples chairs, love chairs or kissing chairs (see picture) such a quaint leftover from the past.\n\nThis park is surrounded by good restaurants, San Servacio Cathedral, shops is colonial buildings and government buildings. Also don\u2019t miss out front of the Municipal building is this incredible local artist Eduardo Camara Alonzo hand carving this one piece of wood representing different animals of the Yucatan. So far he has been carving this one piece for 3 years, 16 hour days. (see Picture)

350665904.name: very nice park
350665904.author: a TripAdvisor user
350665904.reviewBody: I love the fountain and the quaint benches. Across the street is the Catedral de San Gervasio, so you can stroll around the park, then visit the church.

347456345.name: Lovely park and central square
347456345.author: a TripAdvisor user
347456345.reviewBody: The park was a meeting place for lovers, seniors, and travelers. Vendors sell food, children play and others just sit and enjoy the day.

346566533.name: Beautiful place
346566533.author: a TripAdvisor user
346566533.reviewBody: After lunch we had a nice stroll at this park.  It is full of locals just hanging out and enjoying life.  It is found in the centre of Valladolid. I love the couples chairs but they can use some cleaning.  There are plenty of vendors selling snacks like peanuts, candy, popcorn.  You can find benches that are directly under trees for some shade, and also seating areas to sit and bask in the sun.  Before you enter the park, look around for the signs that describe the history of the park.  I absolutely love Valladolid.

345267428.name: sit and watch the life in Valladolid
345267428.author: a TripAdvisor user
345267428.reviewBody: A wonderful mexican plaza and park, very green and lots of benches. We especially enjoyed the wrought iron benches with the seal of Valladolid inset in the back.It really does seem to be the heart of the city with people in it all the time. In the evening the birds fly in and roost in the trees, what a sound to experience, just watch where you sit!

344444987.name: nice park
344444987.author: a TripAdvisor user
344444987.reviewBody: nice park located in the centre of valladolid. there are plenty benches and fountains where you can enjoy some ice cream or a cold beer in the shade of the trees.

344377582.name: Delightful place to chill out.
344377582.author: a TripAdvisor user
344377582.reviewBody: Sitting at this park is  wonderful way to sit ands rest  and enjoy watching the locals interact with each other and observe how they enjoy themselves and go about daily life. Good opportunity hear and practice the language and watch the children laugh and play. There are small stalls where you can buy home made food typical of Valladolid and also buy suveniers. This park is surrounded by good restaurants, cathedral, colonial houses and government buildings.

343350088.name: autentic zocalo
343350088.author: a TripAdvisor user
343350088.reviewBody: spending your sunday afternoon chilling in Parque francisco is one of the most authentic mexicain exp\u00e9rience you can do in a trip to yucatan.

339045266.name: pretty park and cathedral, try the helado
339045266.author: a TripAdvisor user
339045266.reviewBody: Due to my poor Spanish, somehow I got corn ice cream (helado)...yes whole kernel CORN in the ice cream.  It was delicious.  The park is pretty.  They had quite a few vendors...seems like it was Sunday.  The cathedral is pretty too...I wish I\'d had time to go in.

333400016.name: Beautiful and Quiet Central Park in Valladolid - Great Place to Relax and Observe the Local Life!
333400016.author: a TripAdvisor user
333400016.reviewBody:
The Plaza and Parque Francisco Canton is more commonly known as Valladolid’s main square, central park, plaza principal or zocalo.
 
The park is absolutely lovely. It is well-maintained and has lots of large and beautiful trees and lush foliage. In the centre of the park is a beautiful water fountain, and various paved pathways stem in all directions from the centre that are lined with bench seating and unique “lover’s chairs.” On the south side of the park, stands the gorgeous San Gervasio Cathedral and the Palacio Municipal (government building) is on the east side. 

I really enjoyed sitting and relaxing in the park during the day, and the atmosphere was so tranquil, peaceful, and quiet. It is a great place to observe the local life around you. I also enjoyed strolling around and checking out the various food and handicraft vendors that set up along the pathways on Sundays. At night, the park becomes a lively and bustling place full of activity, as the locals gather and meet there to chat and hang out. 

In the evenings (mostly on the weekends), there is often local musical or dance performances happening on the streets surrounding the park. During my stay in Valladolid, there was an amazing traditional dance performance for Mexican Revolution Day. There were chairs set up all the way down the street and the area was packed with locals. It was such a great experience! 

I highly recommend spending some time in this park when you are in Valladolid!

332418459.name: Center of the Action
332418459.author: a TripAdvisor user
332418459.reviewBody: This lovely center plaza was decorated for the holiday and was busy with people walking around and enjoying the lovely weather.  Sadly the fountain in the center was covered with a tarp and it was not going.  The city\'s cathedral is on one side and the government buildings on another.  There are some great shops on the same side of the plaza as the cathedral.

329534896.name: Great place to get street food for cheap
329534896.author: a TripAdvisor user
329534896.reviewBody: This is a great place for just strolling around and it is lined with restaurants and nice little shops reccomend the tortas stand.

319926869.name: Hannah
319926869.author: a TripAdvisor user
319926869.reviewBody: Pretty little square, stalls and beside a food market for cheap eats, selection of craft stores and linen stores around it

300634622.name: Step back, take a minute, relax
300634622.author: a TripAdvisor user
300634622.reviewBody: The piazza/plaza was gorgeous and was a combination of a European piazza and a square in a Southern town in America. It was a place where people could meet, hang out, people watch, pass the time, etc. it is designed to welcome, and it certainly did this. There are many benches, beautiful trees, and lush greenery. There were dancers and musicians playing in the plaza too. You could easily spend hours there. I love these little plazas/piazzas/squares that invite you to take a minute, slow down, and enjoy the moment a bit. \n

298572426.name: Main plaza in Valladolid
298572426.author: a TripAdvisor user
298572426.reviewBody: You can buy  an ice-cream cone (coconut and elote-corn, it\'s good) from a little guy with a tiny push wagon  and then try to find a shady bench  to sit and enjoy it. On  sundays  some arts and crafts are there, music and dance at 8pm.  Always across the street, next to the book store,  are dozens of local women with their  a. & c. in little stalls the city rents to them.

286704099.name: Peaceful Place to Relax in Valladolid
286704099.author: a TripAdvisor user
286704099.reviewBody: This is the central park/plaza or "zocalo" in Valladolid. There are lots of park benches and chairs for seating. Vendors selling souvenirs, ice cream and Mexican snacks can be found along the paths in the park. There is a beautiful fountain in the centre of the park with a statue of a woman on top. In the evenings around 8 or 9 pm, you can often find performances of dancing, music or theatre taking place on the streets surrounding the park. It is a lively place in the evenings and all of the locals come together here to chat and relax. In the daytime, it is a peaceful and relaxing place to read a book or just observe the local life going on around you. The only downside to the park was the fleet of big tour buses from the beach resorts full of tourists in the middle of the day, who would stop here on their way to or from Chichen Itza. The park got really busy around lunch time with all of these people, but once they cleared out, it was serene and beautiful again. I recommend taking some time to relax here when you are in Valladolid.

279532412.name: A peaceful little park!
279532412.author: a TripAdvisor user
279532412.reviewBody: This is the central park in Valladolid.  It is very nice and peaceful.  There are benches and many courting chairs throughout park where you can sit and relax.  Numerous vendors line the edges selling souvenirs.  The is a fountain in the center with "La Mestiza" and woman of mixed race in the center.   A nice place to sit, relax and enjoy the day!

274052029.name: Nice place
274052029.author: a TripAdvisor user
274052029.reviewBody: Liked it from the beginning. Just take a book with you or walk around. Talk to other people and be a bit social. Why everyone has to check his phone ever minute?\ud83d\ude0a

273194550.name: A simple and romantic clean park
273194550.author: a TripAdvisor user
273194550.reviewBody: This is the city\'s central park, directly across from the Cathedral.  Designed as a plaza mayor as many colonial Spanish towns.  Its a quaint and cute little spot to rest and take in the sights.  The park benches are well maintained and adorned with the seal of the city itself.  So cute in its simplicity.

267620083.name: Picturesque
267620083.author: a TripAdvisor user
267620083.reviewBody: It\'s just a basic park square in the centre of Vallodalid. There are a number of shops and restaurants surrounding the park as well as the Cathedral of San Gervasio. I like the unique seats in the park.

258381155.name: Pretty little square
258381155.author: a TripAdvisor user
258381155.reviewBody: The centre of town, this plaza is a nice place to rest your legs or read a book. The locals seem to gather here in the day to hide from the sun which can be hot during the afternoon. It is located next to a nice old church and is well kept offering some solitude. People watching here while enjoying a locally produced ice cream was time well spent!

256423592.name: Valladolid Zocalo
256423592.author: a TripAdvisor user
256423592.reviewBody: A nice, picturesque Mexican Zocalo.  Peaceful, mostly quiet except for the diesel buses coming and going.Lots of photo ops during the day--dead as a doornail after dark.  Fountain, Vendors of snacks and souvenirs.  Its the city center with shopping, Cathedral, hotels and restaurants on all sides.  Sometimes surrounded by tour buses in the daytime.  Walking distance to ost everything there is to see in Valladolid

256335515.name: Surprising fun for a quick stop!
256335515.author: a TripAdvisor user
256335515.reviewBody: My wife and I did a inland circuit with a rental car, and stopped here on our way from Ek Balam to Chichen Itza. It was surprisingly fun and quaint. We first walked to the cenote a couple of blocks east and then came back to enjoy some coconut and sweet corn (yuck) ice cream. It\'s a funny place; in the late afternoon most of the people there were foreign tourists all enjoying the same ice cream and the park was lined with tour buses. Nothing much to see or do, but a nice place for a quick stop.

249875534.name: Beautiful and lively park at night!
249875534.author: a TripAdvisor user
249875534.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful park by day or night, with a lovely fountain and a big cathedral nearby.  It's incredibly scenic at night, has some vendors, a lot of people, and hundreds, if not thousands, of birds in the trees chirping. It sounded surreal. I really enjoyed the visit!

The square is surrounded by shops, beautiful restaurants, bazaars (cheaper but equally delicious food courts), and a lot of art, crafts, and culture.

LOVED IT!

248933169.name: Seems like a nice little town square
248933169.author: a TripAdvisor user
248933169.reviewBody:
Nice little park on the middle of the town center square.
We stopped in Valladolid for about 45 mins during our tour.
Checked out some of the many little shops around the square and went in to the Catedral de San Gervasio.
Enjoyed the visit.

247375004.name: Great atmosphere
247375004.author: a TripAdvisor user
247375004.reviewBody: This parquet is very lively and gives you the opportunity to interact with local people and get an impression of their arts and crafts.

246730554.name: Must Stop in Valladolid
246730554.author: a TripAdvisor user
246730554.reviewBody: This \'central\' park/square is the main gathering spot for Valladolid. You see the Spanish influence throughout and there are various vendors selling their wares. Prices here are good compared to the very touristy areas. Original hand made hammocks are the specialty here as locals actually use them to sleep on. We bought one for $20 US.

244737644.name: Lovely pleasant town square
244737644.author: a TripAdvisor user
244737644.reviewBody: Mexico knows how to do a town square. Plenty of trees, plenty of space and plenty of seating. San Gervasio is a beautiful cathedral, but the main attraction is good old people watching.\nPleasant place to sit and enjoy life, but most colonial towns have similar zocalos.

243490520.name: Nice little park
243490520.author: a TripAdvisor user
243490520.reviewBody: Pleasant little park in the middle of town. Walked around sat in the little hand shaped chairs facing each other. nice fountian in the middle.\nPeaceful. Lots of birds.

231854924.name: The center of it ALL
231854924.author: a TripAdvisor user
231854924.reviewBody: In most Latin towns, the central plaza is where it\'s at, and this is true of Valladolid\'s pretty, peaceful plaza. One sees couples strolling, children playing, singles flirting.... and tourists taking photos of it all. What makes this one memorable to me, however, is the incredibly noisy tropical birds who descend on the square just after dark, converse madly, then promptly fall asleep!

231041359.name: Carnaval 2013
231041359.author: a TripAdvisor user
231041359.reviewBody: Love this park.  We celebrated Carnaval 2013 here and loved every second.  Got a few looks the last night because I unknowingly dressed in all white (and am a tall fair complexioned woman) the night of the mock funeral procession but despite my mistake we were graciously accepted into the packed park.   Vendors sell sweets and kids trinkets at night as it is common gathering place.

226680210.name: Spanish Colonial Park With A Pre-Hispanic Vibe
226680210.author: a TripAdvisor user
226680210.reviewBody: I felt very safe walking this park as a solo woman.  Many locals gathered here talking and resting. They had a nice area of all the animals found in the area which was really cute.  Lots of vendors selling corn with mayonnaise (never saw that before) and other odd delicacies.  I highly recommend the caramel filled churros.  Very sweet but oh so good!  It is also felt as if the locals are more Mayan than Mexican but that was only my feeling from observing facial features and clothing.  One last note is that no merchants were calling out to you to look at their goods which I really enjoyed.  It allows you to relax and take it all in.

214755924.name: Beautiful in the evening
214755924.author: a TripAdvisor user
214755924.reviewBody: Really nice to walk around, look at the families, the children playing, see wat vendors make and sell, listen to the birds in the trees, ... The foutain is beautiful with the lights on in the park...just sit on the benches and enjoy the moment.

214285098.name: Plaza de Parque Francisco Canton
214285098.author: a TripAdvisor user
214285098.reviewBody: I enjoyed Plaza de Parque Francisco Canton very much. It\'s an cozy looking park with lot\'s of color in it. The trees, the fountain and the kind locals make it a great spot to cool down from the heat of the sun. Feeling thirsty? No problem! There are quiet a few locals selling you drinks from a (really cool) cart, like Pina Colada\'s!

201861233.name: Where you can watch the world go by
201861233.author: a TripAdvisor user
201861233.reviewBody: Sitting under a canopy of beautiful, ancient trees, watching families enjoying their evening visits, children playing...enchantment in the park!  There are vendors galore, food or crafts to buy or just admire -   viviendo la vida dulce!

657904007.name: Baby enjoyed!
657904007.author: a TripAdvisor user
657904007.reviewBody: You can visit XKeken and Samala cenote including very decent meal for 250 pesos/person.\nFor all of you going with babies...We did it with our 15 month old baby,you can leave stroller upstairs and rent life vest outside. Yes,you can swim with your baby with extra care, there are ropes to hold yourself and baby. Also be careful with the stairs and floor because it\u2019s wet. Baby had tons of fun and place is amazing

638886438.name: Very beautiful cenote
638886438.author: a TripAdvisor user
638886438.reviewBody: Burrr!  The water is really cold when you first get in.  I suggest a fast plung and then swim straight to where the sunlight is coming through a small hole for a little warmer water.

567895198.name: Discovered by a Pig
567895198.author: a TripAdvisor user
567895198.reviewBody: The Yucatan is well known for its many sinkholes.   This one was discovered by a farmer who being curious about how his pig regularly returned covered in mud followed it to reveal this sinkhole.   Like others there is a single shaft of light coming through the roof; the roof itself is adorned by tree roots and stalactites.   The water is clear and warmer than one might expect.  For those willing to sit quietly on one of the rocks small fish will give a free pedicure.   The site does not appear to have large numbers of visitors at once so is a good choice for a relaxed visit.  A swim is a must.

563226425.name: Well organized double Cenote feature
563226425.author: a TripAdvisor user
563226425.reviewBody:
My 3nd cenote out of 10 visited on Yakatan. This turned out to be one of the most liked. It is well organized tour with another Samula cenote. There was a free guide that was walking us through these 2 cenotes, making a few pointers, jokes and patiently waiting for us while we experienced it. 

Life jackets, pictures with parrots, coconut drinks are all provided for a small fee.

It is also called Dzitnup cenote. It is my first underground cenote, and i was very impressed with stalactites, especially the one in the form of elephant. I swam to it and touched it, even though it was't allowed. Water was not very clean.

552573882.name: Unique
552573882.author: a TripAdvisor user
552573882.reviewBody: Every single cenote is different from others. All of them are unique and worth to be discovered. Yes, it can be a bit expensive and yes, the local people can be a bit pushy to get "something" from you but: first of all they are working and is the only way to really know the stories about this places, and second is a very small price to enjoy this wonders of nature which are kept safe and clean by the same locals. So is understandable and justified.

548727493.name: Two magical cenotes in one
548727493.author: a TripAdvisor user
548727493.reviewBody: Two cenotes within this property. Easy access with all well maintained. Each has its own character. Both can be swum. Worth the visit even without the swim.

535664882.name: Great experiance
535664882.author: a TripAdvisor user
535664882.reviewBody:
We visited this place to have a swim in the cave.

It was really a good experience. The cave was beautiful, the water was clean with many fish. I could have been in the water for hours.

The area around the cave need to be renovated, but you should go there anyway.

It is only 80 pesos per person and free parking.

675328477.name: unspoiled and not over-commercialized
675328477.author: a TripAdvisor user
675328477.reviewBody: This cenote is not as visited as the others so you don\'t have to worry about tour buses dumping off groups of tourists. I love the way the light streams in and plays off the cool water. Plenty of cave features to keep me interested for hours.

647855318.name: Excellent but Workers are Opportunists
647855318.author: a TripAdvisor user
647855318.reviewBody:
There are two great cenotes to visit here.  Water in the large one was cool but not bad once fully in; the smaller one is significantly warmer  Both have substantively intact ceilings covered in stalactites.  Natural light is scarce but combined with artificial light it's illuminated similar to twilight.

Some bus tours do stop there but they were leaving as we arrived in the early afternoon.  We spent at least an hour swimming in the larger colder one and were the only visitors for about half that time.  The other had more people but was still uncrowded.  There is an on-site restaurant that serves buffet only (I believe) lunches to the bus groups. 

The workers aren't the most honest.  Be certain to know what bills you pay and what change to expect.  To condense a rather long story one in our party of four who paid for the 2nd cenote had gone to the car to get his wallet from the trunk.  He put the key on the desk when he paid.  Either he forgot to pick up the key or it was whisked away.

When it came time to leave the key could not be found.  The workers claimed nobody had found or seen a key.  After a lot of backtracking, careful searching and some assistance from the workers it was almost dark and I decided the key must have been locked in the trunk.  I decided to break the driver door window, picked up a large, sharp rock and hit struck it hard a couple times.  The glass was much harder than the soft limestone and it barely left a scratch.  One of the workers came running saying they'd found the key but needed some money...

562550206.name: Closed off and dark
562550206.author: a TripAdvisor user
562550206.reviewBody: We originally were coming to see both Cenotes - Palomitas and Agua Dulce. After Palomitas we ventured over to Agua Dulce, but it was not what we expected and did not match any reviews I had read. It was closed off by a barbed wire gate that a kid came an opened for us. Super dark, scary and dismal looking, full of spider webs so you could tell no one goes in that often. Though we took a moment to take some pictures and play with our echoes. The winner hands down of these two was Palomitas! Don\u2019t even bother with Agua Dulce.

541257717.name: Fun but ask for your chnge!
541257717.author: a TripAdvisor user
541257717.reviewBody: Awesome swim....but ask for the 80 they try to keep. Valladoid tries to cheat ya with change. Just stand with your hand out and they finally give it to you. The culture in Vaadoilid tries to cheat ya! Watch everywhere.I\'ll tip ya ,but don\'t cheat me!\n.

477590667.name: Easier access now - new staircase.
477590667.author: a TripAdvisor user
477590667.reviewBody:
This is definitely a place to go to avoid large crowds - we had it to ourselves for the whole time. 

In terms of getting there and locating it - it is paved road all the way until the cenote entrance - rough gravel but not too bad and there are several signs along the way directing you to Agua Dulce Y Palomita cenote (shared site). 

Once inside you are directed to a main ticket booth for both Agua Dulce and Palomitas. We only went to Agua Dulce as from the photos it looked larger and more dramatic and as we arrived a small group (4people!) were entering Palomitas but no one was at Agua Dulce. 

It cost 120mxn pp. Palomitas on the same site cost 90mxnpp. 

At the site itself Palomitas is more developed of the two as there are changing rooms / toilets close to its entrance and a restaurant. 

Agua Dulce is next door (approx 5 minute walk or you can drive and park there) and only has basic toilets and no shower or lockers so ideally use Palomitas before heading over if you aren't already changed.

It has a newly constructed shallow concrete staircase and then a series of wooden stairs leading down to the cenote so is easier to access now. There is also a huge two tiered wooden platform area giving you plenty of room to leave your things on benches in the cenote. The spiral staircase is also still in situ if you wanted to try that out! 

You can rappel and kayak too within the cenote but we were happy just to swim. Rubber tyres are provided too and ropes across to assist swimming. You can also hire lifejackets. 

The cenote is huge with thousands of stalactites and a few openings to the air with roots that hang down. Very atmospheric and beautifully lit with both natural and artificial lighting. Photos don't do the scale of it justice. 

We spent a fantastic hour there and probably would've stayed longer but the weather was stormy and we actually got pretty cold! 

I would imagine the improvements to the cenotes entrance are to cater for tour groups so enjoy the peace while you can...

476448399.name: Worth the drive
476448399.author: a TripAdvisor user
476448399.reviewBody: Admittedly this place is WAY off the beaten path and a little confusing but so worth going. While it would be a shame if this lovely pristine place became overrun with tourist it definitely needs more people so they can stay open and so people can feel more comfortable in this extremely isolated place. It\'s a great cool off after trekking around the Coba ruins. By far the most dramatic cenotes I\'ve ever seen in the Coba area.

466247466.name: Natural beauty
466247466.author: a TripAdvisor user
466247466.reviewBody: There are actually two centotes here to see which are both lovely and can be swam in. Access is down steps and particularly for Agua Dulce, which is down a small spiral staircase, anyone without fairly good mobility would struggle. \nIt was very quiet when we were there- we were the only ones! The temperature in the water is actually quite pleasant, not too cold and the surroundings are very impressive, turquoise water and the cave with stalagmites around you.\nThe road to the entrance is quite poor in places with lots of pot holes, a coach wouldn\'t be able to get down it, the reason it is quiet I expect!

460154091.name: Amazing cenote!
460154091.author: a TripAdvisor user
460154091.reviewBody: Absolutely amazing cenote, free from tourists. After visiting the cenote de palomitas which is 5 minutes by walk from this one, we decided to visit it as well. A good decision. The water is so clear, there are few holes in the roof, from which the water falls down. There is a rope as alternative way to enter the water. Hold it, jump, leave it, sink. I still wander why so little tourists go to these cenotes. Really worth the way!

449033413.name: Awesome cenote
449033413.author: a TripAdvisor user
449033413.reviewBody: Went to this cenote today and it was really nice. Not overcrowded. After 4pm we were the only ones and manged to take pictures . Absolutely magical place with all the stalagmites and stalactites. Liked it much more than gran cenote

434950724.name: Super cool
434950724.author: a TripAdvisor user
434950724.reviewBody:
90 pesos.
Well-lit now. 

I recommend you come go mid-day to catch more sunlight into the place. We went near sundown but there was still enough natural light and plenty of lamps to view the depths of the cenote. 

Guided with people watching over you.

Has a fun rope swing, multiple floating devices, lockers for valuables, crazy views, multiple ropes that span across the water if you're not a strong swimmer. If you choose only one in this area, make it Agua Dulce.

420995204.name: Beauty beyond description
420995204.author: a TripAdvisor user
420995204.reviewBody: Off the beaten path, far away from the Cancun coach parties, this is one of several marvellous Cenotes in one hacienda back yard which deserve a visit.  Very welcoming host (Mario, thank you), dramatic descents into a breathtaking world with ever-changing natural light streaming through small holes in the limestone rook.  Prepare to be amazed.

396371968.name: Amazing
396371968.author: a TripAdvisor user
396371968.reviewBody: My husband and I went here as a half day trip while we were in valladolid.  This cenote is off the beaten track, no one else was there but us! You have to pass through some rural towns to get there but its a glimpse into real living.  The peoperty is spacious with goats and chickens running around.  Its about 20km from the center of valladolid, and we paid the taxi driver 350mxn round trip and we stayed about 2 hours.  There are no taxis there, so you have to pay the driver to stay, or to come back at an hour you arrange.

375826950.name: Gorgeous!
375826950.author: a TripAdvisor user
375826950.reviewBody: Five of us just stopped into this lovely site on a whim -loved the name.  OMG - so glad we did!  Beautiful! Refreshing after a hot day.  Only other guests were a group of 5.  There is a restaurant on site as well, but we did not try it.  Highly recommend this cenote.  \n\nNOTE: The spiral stairway to go from ground level to the water is suspended and connected to a floating platform.  It\'s safe, but steep and moves a bit.  Someone with a fear of heights or someone with bad knees may not want to go down there.

367612986.name: WOW!!! the best cenote we visted!
367612986.author: a TripAdvisor user
367612986.reviewBody: This is an amazing cenote - mostly covered, but with several openings letting daylight shine to the bottom of the water. If you do not like LONG spiral staircases, this is not for you. It is well worth the climb out afterwards.

352371090.name: Beautiful Gem
352371090.author: a TripAdvisor user
352371090.reviewBody:
I really am writing th this review to clarify a few things about this hard to find cenote. Until three years ago this place was a cattle ranch that used the cenote for watering the cattle. They decided tourism was more financially profitable and got rid of the cows.  It's in the middle of no where, relatively new buildings for changing. All the employees are really nice, not sure if they speak much English. Unless you are there during a holiday or a tour bus arrives, it's pretty empty. 

There are two cenotes on the same site, Las Palomitas and Agua Dulce.  We chose Agua Dulce based on pictures and reviews. You pay for each cenote, no discount for both, so we just went to one. Please be aware that the decent into Agua Dulce is not for the faint of heart and if you have issues with heights, do not go here. The decent is a very tight and steep spiral stair case that is suspended, by some feat of Mexican engineering, by the roof and just floats on the water. I have issues with heights and almost turned back. We made it down, I wouldn't recommend bringing bags down, the platform was covered in water except for the benches. I assume some days the benches are even covered. 

Once inside it is really amazing. It is huge and deep and stunning. There are about three homes in the ceiling to light it as well as lights around the outside do you can see better. It's a little chilly, I warmed up quickly. We had the whole cenote to ourselves, a guide stayed with us most of the time.  It really was relaxing and breathtaking. If you want off the beaten path, this is it.

To find it, leave Valladolid going west on 180.  Past Ticuch, there is a road to the North that will point to Cenote Maya and another pointing to the town of Yalkoba, both pointing the same direction. You follow the signs and go all the way through Yalkoba. In Yalkoba there is a sign that says 3 km Cenote Agua Dulce, it's probably more like 5 km so keep going. One last thing, a kid followed us from the town on a bike, trying to convince us to go to his cenote instead. The people at Agua Dulce said a new cenote opened down the road with an island, we didn't check it out though.

347928766.name: Beautiful
347928766.author: a TripAdvisor user
347928766.reviewBody: If it is the same one that I am thinking of it is part of a park and a restaurant.  We ate an amazing meal right next to the cenote.  There were many swimmers

319948187.name: Absolutely beautiful cenote
319948187.author: a TripAdvisor user
319948187.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of our tour of Chichen Itza and it was so refreshing.  Truly an amazing place.  The water was cool and perfect after an afternoon spent in the hot sun.  Just remember to take a camera with you, a Go Pro or the waterproof camera would be ideal.  We left our camera in the tour bus and wanted to kick ourselves for it afterwards.

303810550.name: Fantastic cenote
303810550.author: a TripAdvisor user
303810550.reviewBody: Wonderful cenote and fantastic experience.\nIt a bit difficult to find but it\'s wort it.\nJust a couple of people, clean water and kindly personal. Clean bathroom facilities.

300951976.name: A nice place to cool down
300951976.author: a TripAdvisor user
300951976.reviewBody: Not the most beautiful cenote in Mexico by any means, but it\'s worth a visit if you are in the area.

297632935.name: Breathtaking experience and spiritual renewal
297632935.author: a TripAdvisor user
297632935.reviewBody:
First we followed the road signs to Maya Cenote from Tulum, which was a quite a long (~1.5 hrs) drive. When we arrived it just closed but a lifeguard working there recommended Agua Dulce to us and said it was bigger and cheaper (100 pesos) entrance. He took his bike and showed us the way there. 
When we arrived we there were only reception guys and we were the ONLY visitors. The lifeguard ( I am so sorry I don't remember his name but he was incredibly kind and took great pics of us) took us to the cenote through a stair tunnel underground. 
The view took our breaths away. It was so quiet and only drops of water dripping from the stalactites broke the silence. The cave is I think one of the biggest in Riviera Maya, and very deep- 45 m max. A few catfish swims in the water and you can see them very well through crystal clear water even when the cave is lighted by some 4-5 lights.  
Minutes later a tropical rain started and a loudest thunder echoed through the cave. In the cenote ceiling, through a 1.5 diameter round opening, sun-illuminated rainwater was bursting through down to the underground lake. 
We jumped of the cliffs to the chilly water again and again. The lifeguard had to go somewhere and left us alone for about 20 minutes- this was truly romantic. 
Overall it was certainly worth a long drive and me and husband loved this incredible and non-touristy spot.

285815053.name: If you only have time for one cenotre close to the town of Valladolid make it this one!
285815053.author: a TripAdvisor user
285815053.reviewBody: Forget about the other, more popular cenotes and visit this one instead. You would need a car or taxi as it\'s off the beaten track. Just follow the signs to Yalcoba from Valladolid and go through the town; it\'s just on the other side. We took the road from Ek Balam (after google mapping it) and it was quite an adventure with every little town saying that they were the site of Agua Dulce to make us visit their cenotes. When we finally arrived about an hour ahead of a thunderstorm, we had the entire cenote to ourselves. There are two cenotes on the site, and we chose Palomitas since the other one required descent down a spiral staircase. Three easy access points to the water in Palomitas. The water was the perfect swimming temperature and an amazing aqua blue. The rock formations were stunning, and when the rain came down the single hole above, I knew I was in heaven. My only advice would be for the owners to require showers beforehand as I noticed a sheen of lotion on the water surface, and it will surely build up over the years.

278404644.name: Fantastic off the beaten path attraction!
278404644.author: a TripAdvisor user
278404644.reviewBody: Cenote Agua Dulce is located far off the highway past a few small Mayan villages. There are several cenotes in the area, and they are not too touristy. I went to Cenote Palomitas on an excursion through Palace Resorts in Cancun. Like another reviewer said, I am hesitant to let this secret out because it is so nice without much overuse from tourists. It is a small operation with a bathhouse (that also rents out towels and life jackets), several huts selling goods, and an outdoor restaurant. The cenote itself is simply amazing, especially if you have never seen or swam in a cenote before. There are quite a few steps going down to the water level, and there are also several ropes you can hold on to while swimming (it\'s 45 m/150 ft deep). The water temperature is a refreshing 25 C/ 77 F, and will leave your skin and hair feeling soft from the dissolved minerals in the water.  The restaurant where we ate lunch was delicious: there were plenty roasted meats, fresh tortillas, crisp vegetables, and creamy desserts all cooked by the local Mayan women. This cenote operation is designed to support the local Mayan villages. Hopefully the establishment stays small and secret because it truly is an amazing natural wonder that needs to be preserved.

272255083.name: Shhhh, don\'t tell anybody about this one!
272255083.author: a TripAdvisor user
272255083.reviewBody:
I'm really torn about whether to review this beautiful cenote or not, because it is truly exceptional, and the majority of tourists are just going to screw it up, and the magic will be lost, as people pollute the crystal clear blue water with lotion, perfume, and sunscreens, as they have so many other cenotes in the area.

That said, this cenote is exceptional, and I thoroughly enjoyed freediving it on a quiet day when we were the only ones there... It was actually closed, but they opened it up for us, and it was truly majestic, which is why I'm not going to explain how to get there, so that there is a small chance that it will look just as beautiful the next time we're out this way for a visit...

Nah, that's just cold... All right, I'll give you a hint. Head towards Cenote Maya, turn the other way, don't go down THAT road, and you'll see a make shift sign for Cenote Aqua Dulce, go that direction... drive through town, past the dilapidated church, continue down the road to the left, keep driving until you think you're lost, you'll find another sign, turn there and drive down the dirt road to the reception area, and be sure to visit Cenote Palomita while you're there, it's also exceptional and distinctly different.

633292337.name: Great place for all family
633292337.author: a TripAdvisor user
633292337.reviewBody:
We visited zoo with our 2 kids (3 years and 9 months). We felt like we were the only visitors there.
The zoo is really interesting with animals and birds that live in Mexico. Our oldest boy loved feeding fishes (5 pesos). The entrance fee was 50 pesos per person, kids - for free. 
And we also loved banana and exotic fruits fields we could walk around. 
Great experience for half a day.

600194410.name: Nice place to visit if you have kids and they love animals
600194410.author: a TripAdvisor user
600194410.reviewBody:
I was very surprised by this small zoo, the staff is very friendly the animals look very well care and is very cheap!!
Do not expect a big zoo, this is a small collection of animals but is great to walk and learn about the different species.
They also offer the option of renting small boats for an artificial lagoon the build there and is a lot of fun.
Just make sure you have sunblock and water to enjoy the experience.

539966334.name: Beautiful and well kept oasis
539966334.author: a TripAdvisor user
539966334.reviewBody: Breathtaking and extensive.  The jungle cats are gorgeous and awesome. The enclosures are large, the captive animals are peaceful, the environs are very pleasant. Low key but very impressive.

511832183.name: Amazing
511832183.author: a TripAdvisor user
511832183.reviewBody: It\'s so close to nature, a great place for people who enjoy watching animals freely. Would come again.

503624239.name: A zoo of local animals of the Yucatan...no elephants or giraffes. A great family attraction
503624239.author: a TripAdvisor user
503624239.reviewBody: I went to the grand opening last year and was surprised how many locals came. And was equally surprised that the six year old boy in front of me got so excited over seeing a cow for the first time. All of the animals are local including local farm animals. Currently three jaguars roam a large compound. I have visited the zoo a number of times since opening day and have enjoyed every visit. I\'ve been there with young children, with a family and by myself. There is a visitors center with bathrooms, drinks, snacks and souvenirs. A number of spots to bring a picnic. Early in the morning is the best time to visit before it gets too hot and the animals seek the shade. There is also a small lake where you can rent a rowboat. At the same location, along one edge of the lake, is a new miniature golf course. Lots of fun for the kids and quite challenging for adults. A family could easily spend a full morning here. The VallaZoo experience is a great way for families traveling with children to make a satisifying adult day/kid day trade off.

475662805.name: A very good place to see many species of the area, very accessible.
475662805.author: a TripAdvisor user
475662805.reviewBody: This zoo opened in 2016 therefore is still a work in progress.  However it has a surprisingly substantial amount of animals to view, especially the big and little cats.  The zoo is approximately 15 kilometers out of Valladolid, the road is dirt and you really feel like you\'ve taken the wrong road to nowhere, but keep going, it\'s really there!  We used our Google Map, but it is a straight shot from town.  It\'s quite a large area, wear comfortable shoes and I would suggest an umbrella for shade.  We spent about an hour and a half, but didn\'t see everything.  Study the map before you take off into the zoo.  You can buy food for 5 pesos to feed the animals (approximately 25 U.S. cents) in the visitors center.  There are cold drinks, ice cream and snacks available.  We throughly enjoyed seeing so many jaguars, big and little.  The monkeys are a real delight and the tropical birds are gorgeous.  Be sure to bring a camera.

643152387.name: Still a secret... phew!
643152387.author: a TripAdvisor user
643152387.reviewBody: After enduring the relentless crowds at Chichen Itza non of us (4 friends) wanted to go to a busy cenote. Thanks to the glowing reviews on here highlighting how peaceful it was, we decided to give it a shot. It lived up to expectations in every way, we shared it with another group of 4 for 15 mins as they were on their way out, then we had it to ourselves until we left over an hour later. \n\nBeautiful, refreshing, fun, QUIET and all of the sum of 75 pesos a person. What a win!

628956944.name: Amazing Cenote
628956944.author: a TripAdvisor user
628956944.reviewBody: We went to this cenote on our way back from Coba as it was a hot day and after the hike in Coba we needed a refreshment. We hadn\u2019t read any reviews so entered on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised! We were the only ones there. The cenote is beautiful and it has washrooms and a place to change. It was amazing!

622749874.name: Great Cenote, worth checking out
622749874.author: a TripAdvisor user
622749874.reviewBody: My tour guide took me there. I loved it.  Clean, no-one really there, easy access from the road and a short hike to the entry, easy steps all the way down, a small intimate cenote, run by a local Mayan family.  Quite picturesque also and a small opening above of course.\n\nWell worth seeking out and then checking out.

599068074.name: Amazing quiet cenote
599068074.author: a TripAdvisor user
599068074.reviewBody: Wonderful cenote.  Very refreshing on a hot July day.  My husband and I were the only guests there.  There were a couple children who are affiliated with the cenote playing.  Water was so clear and cold.  Temps were 97 degrees out and it felt amazing! Highly recommend this hidden gem. Not crowded at all.  Very peaceful.   Restrooms and changing areas very clean.

571145634.name: One of the best Cenotes we have visited by far
571145634.author: a TripAdvisor user
571145634.reviewBody: This less-visited, but easy-to-access cenote is run by a coop of locals and is absolutely beautiful.  It\'s a cavern with a small opening to let in light and the 2 young "tour guides" (brothers age 9 and 10) were delightful, showing our kids the best places to dive and making themselves understood despite the language barrier.  \nEasy drive from Valladolid and a wonderful stop if you\'re heading in to Vallodolid from the east on the free highway as we were.

566847332.name: Cool water
566847332.author: a TripAdvisor user
566847332.reviewBody: I loved this newly opened cenote.  I was the only person there.  It was wonderfully quiet - so quiet that I saw and heard bats flying and diving down to the water.

566169751.name: What a place!
566169751.author: a TripAdvisor user
566169751.reviewBody:
This cenote is a must! Having been in Cobá (nearby ruins) and Valladolid (beautiful Colonial city) earlier during the day on a very hot day, Xux-Ha was a welcome stop just by the highway. 

Alex (pictured) was our 10-year-old guide who was simply fabulous! Really friendly, witty and a great playmate for our kids!

The cenote is beautiful and refreshing. Don’t miss out!

552611207.name: Amazing!
552611207.author: a TripAdvisor user
552611207.reviewBody: Beautiful underground cenote with cristal clear and refreshing water. The farming community opened this cenote to the public at the end of 2017. They maintain the location, which has bathrooms and a changing place. They built a solid staircase (very well built) that descends 60 ft. (18 m) to reach the water. A central opening (approx. 10 ft. -3 m. in diameter) at the top provides great illumination.

475813513.name: We loved it!
475813513.author: a TripAdvisor user
475813513.reviewBody: We went on the recommendation of our hotel owner in Valladolid, as a cenote that isn\'t crowded or touristy, and boy was he right.  My husband paid the 200 peso entrance for our family of 4 and we used the very clean bathrooms before heading off to the cenote.  The path is very well marked with painted limestone rocks and the stairs to access the cenote are extremely well built and safe.  It truly was magnificient!!

371305064.name: We had it all to ourselves!!
371305064.author: a TripAdvisor user
371305064.reviewBody: The previous review was spot on!  An amazing Cenote worth the time!  Carlos was very patient with us as we spoke no Spanish, but we all sure enjoyed communicating nonetheless!  Make sure you take the time to stop here, a true undiscovered gem!!  (And the washrooms/changing area were SO clean!!)

357535593.name: A gorgeous fresh water sink hole in the open air
357535593.author: a TripAdvisor user
357535593.reviewBody: Fans of cenote swimming will really appreciate Xux Ha.  The family who owns the land have made a huge effort and have built clean and new changing rooms, a lovely out door sink area to freshen up after your swim and have a little shop under a palapa where they sell Mayan crafts.  They are native Mayan speakers who also speak Spanish and are happy to share information, folk lore and - when we were there - their fresh fruit with us!  The cenote is about 30 meters down and you access it by walking down some very secure steps.  There is a very large platform with benches where you can leave your bags and towels and even have a picnic in the cool shade.  There are various ladders for entering the water as well as a 3 meter jumping platform.  There is even a paddle boat!  The trees and roots grow down to the water and you can watch beautiful birds in the trees.  We loved this cenote - it\'s huge and unique and the family who runs it directly benefits from the modest entry fee of 50 pesos per person.  A must!  The cenote is marked with a sign and a palapa with bunting.  On highway 180 as you leave Valladolid it\'s about 10 minutes from the town on the right.  If you hit Km 177 you have passed it.  The good gravel road takes you 650 meters to a large, shady car park area and it\'s a short and delightful walk through the jungle to get to the cenote.

667451635.name: Small and interesting / peque\u00f1o, interesante
667451635.author: a TripAdvisor user
667451635.reviewBody: This tiny museum is quite nice. They are a no -profit with a small entry fee of $50. The guide was knowledgeable and courteous. The clothing is lovely. Worth one hour for sure.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

666809172.name: Incredible museum with lovely propietor
666809172.author: a TripAdvisor user
