666809172.reviewBody: We happened upon this wonderful museum while walking through Vallodolid, and are so happy we did! The care taken with the pieces and curation is remarkable, and the owner walked us through telling stories and histories of the pieces. It doesn\'t take long, is incredible in value, and one of the most informative museum stops you can have. The clothing is beautiful, thank you Tey!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

666512117.name: Unexpected Lovely Museum
666512117.author: a TripAdvisor user
666512117.reviewBody: My millennial daughter found this museum through Googling and suggested that we visit it and I am so glad that she did!  The founder and director gave us a tour, providing fascinating explanations for each of the items that she personally collected to illustrate the ethnic clothing of the various regions of Mexico.  Her passion for the clothing and culture was palpable.  Although the clothing was not displayed on mannequins with faces, she viewed each display as a person wearing his or her own clothing, referring to it as \u201che\u201d or \u201cshe\u201d.   We loved this small treasure of a museum!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

661494291.name: Really interesting clothing
661494291.author: a TripAdvisor user
661494291.reviewBody: We happened into this little place run by Tey Mariana Stiteler, a Mexican American woman, who was kind enough to give us a personal tour of the beautiful, ethnic outfits she has collected.  The way of life reflected in the clothing is dying out in our increasingly interconnected, homogenized world.  Learning how the styles morphed over the years, and seeing various influences over time was fascinating.  Definitely more interesting to me as a needleworker and crafter than my hubby, but he appreciated learning some cultural history.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

657059592.name: Amazing look at Mexican culture
657059592.author: a TripAdvisor user
657059592.reviewBody: Museum has a wide , interesting view of Mexican regional garments. Much of the traditional garb and techniques would be lost if not for Tey\'s vision , passion and knowledge. Well worth one\'s time.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

645249876.name: Definitely worth a look
645249876.author: a TripAdvisor user
645249876.reviewBody: Housed in three galleries, the museum\'s collection is easy to walk through in twenty minutes. We repeated the experience three times and gained a deeper appreciation on each pass for the cultural expression of clothing from different Mexican regions. The museum staff offered insight on various pieces. It was definitely worth the time to see.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

640239359.name: Nice suprice
640239359.author: a TripAdvisor user
640239359.reviewBody: It was a nice surprice to found this museum, we felt in love of the collection and of Fey ( owner of the place) it is a \u201cmust\u201d to do in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

637445299.name: A surprise museum
637445299.author: a TripAdvisor user
637445299.reviewBody:
I happened to pass this museum and entered. The founder and curator, Fey, personally took me round and her enthusiasm and knowledge were contagious. 
It is beautifully arranged with lots of information in English and Spanish. The small shop sells carefully chosen articles. I was pleased to find some lively Christmas decorations .
Highly recommended

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

633291942.name: Perfect
633291942.author: a TripAdvisor user
633291942.reviewBody: We visited museum today with our 2 kids (3 years and 9 months). It was really interesting and informative. Our oldest son got worj sheets and it keeped him busy all the visit.\nLady was very welcoming, we could even take bananas from the garden. Thank you for work you have done and great experience.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

632953404.name: Fascinating insight into traditional dress
632953404.author: a TripAdvisor user
632953404.reviewBody: Totally recommend this museum, for only 50MXN it\'s 100% worthy of 30/60mins of your time and surely a must visit in Valladolid. Tey gave us a tour of the museum and would suggest you allow her to do the same as her interest in the pieces and stories of how they were acquired really bring it all to life! Thanks again!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

624681284.name: MUREM - Amazing Experience
624681284.author: a TripAdvisor user
624681284.reviewBody: MUREM was amazing...My favorite museum in Valladolid. Unbelievable & beautiful traditional/ethnic clothing collection. Staff was friendly & knowledgeable. Definitely a must see while in Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

621879957.name: Gorgeous, intimate museum
621879957.author: a TripAdvisor user
621879957.reviewBody: MUREM is a gem - beautiful collection of traditional clothing from all over the country. The indigenous costumes are absolutely gorgeous and vary widely - really special way to learn more about Mexico. Staff is also very knowledgable and welcoming. Def a must-do if you\'re in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

621630495.name: NYC to Mexico
621630495.author: a TripAdvisor user
621630495.reviewBody: Came here with my girlfriend and totally fell in love with the space. Its a collection of traditional ethnic clothing from the 31 states of Mexico. If you\'re only vacationing in the Yucatan this is a great way to take in the rest of the country. Some of the masks are amazing! It\'s different from the other \'things to do\' in town which is why I wanted to write a review of it. Check it out!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

619172135.name: Colourful collection of traditional clothing
619172135.author: a TripAdvisor user
619172135.reviewBody: Lovely new museum in Valladolid to visit if you\'re interested in learning about Mexican life through traditional clothing. Danielle was so helpful and knowledgeable in answering our questions.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

612432597.name: Highly recommended
612432597.author: a TripAdvisor user
612432597.reviewBody: We had a wonderful tour of this museum with Danielle. It was so enjoyable and informative. I urge anyone visiting Valladolid to visit this place and you will learn so much more about Mexico. The price is great too!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

599338422.name: Small clothing museum
599338422.author: a TripAdvisor user
599338422.reviewBody: Two room museum with ethnic clothing. Our guide was really passionate about the topic and very nice!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

595361511.name: Small, informative and fascinating collection of Mexican ethnic dress
595361511.author: a TripAdvisor user
595361511.reviewBody: This museum is a two small galleries holding a treasure in costumes from indigenous cultures throughout Mexico. Some of the designs are stunning, and all of them have interesting origins.  My tour was guided, and the guide stopped at each outfit (approximately 30) and explained their use, origin, motifs and meanings. It really made me think about how culture is formed and how we choose to identify ourselves and our communities through clothing.  Well worth your time if you\u2019re interested in Mexico\u2019s indigenous cultures, fashion, textiles, and cultural history. \n\nN.B.: The set up of the museum and the guided tour means that you will not be having a wandering on your own type of museum experience...so just know that going into it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

593662338.name: Wonderful meeting Danielle who helped guide our visit of this colonial town
593662338.author: a TripAdvisor user
593662338.reviewBody: We arrived in town without a plan or a map and happened upon this museum and our guide Danielle, who generously gave us many great tips and directions for our visit to valladolid. We enjoyed our tour of the collection of traditional regional clothes of Mexico at this museum, and we gained a great appreciation for the people and art of this country. Danielle\u2019s welcome and hospitality made our visit one we will remember.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

591157192.name: Do not miss this gem of a museum in Valladolid, Mexico!
591157192.author: a TripAdvisor user
591157192.reviewBody: If you are not paying close attention, you may miss this new museum just off of the central square in Valladolid. It is identified only by a smallish sign on the street. But what is inside is an enormous addition to the cultural attractions in the city. MUREM consists of a small entryway/gift shop, two display areas and a small, pretty garden in the back of the house. The collection of traditional clothing spans almost the whole of Mexico, and besides the kinds of pieces you would expect, such as the china poblana or the tehuana costumes that have become familiar through Frida Khalo paintings, there are unusual, unique and startlingly surprising pieces (plaid ???) that reflect  many years of careful collecting and researching. The  tour guides are extremely knowledgeable and speak Spanish, English and French, and perhaps other languages. The gift shop features unique and reasonably priced items that are made by artists and artisans from the region, not mass-produced in faraway factories. This museum is reason enough to plan a visit Valladolid, especially if you are traveling in or around Cancun or Merida. If you need a place to stay, the museum also hosts an airbnb, the profits of which support the collection. Do not miss it!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

588125239.name: Gorgeous collection!!
588125239.author: a TripAdvisor user
588125239.reviewBody: Such a beautiful collection and museum. Danielle is so knowledgeable and gave me such a wonderfully detailed tour of all of the pieces in the collection! Such a cool way to learn more about Mexico! You must check out MUREM if you are in Valladolid!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

586815738.name: Fantastic collection and insight about cultures of Mexico
586815738.author: a TripAdvisor user
586815738.reviewBody: I was surprised by how engaging and wide-ranging this beautiful collection is. The clothing is often in complementary sets of men\'s and women\'s outfits, which is very unusual and a real find. The clothes are gorgeous, often with superb crafting of the details, matched only by the simply elegant surroundings of the renovated colonial building right near the main square. Stop in for an intriguing look around or as a delightful immersion. It would be great for many kinds of visitors, men and women. Fashion tells us so much about cultures, eras, and lifestyles.  Check out the handmade clothes and items in the gift shop on your way out.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

586814987.name: lovely museum!
586814987.author: a TripAdvisor user
586814987.reviewBody: This is an amazing opportunity to know about trajes tradicionales mexicanos. It is a well planned and organized museum. The explanation of the different vestidos is not only impressive, but well organized. Dont hesitate to stop by and visit this nice and lovely museum. The guide is amazing!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Ropa Etnica de Mexico -- MUREM

address.streetAddress: Calle 41 x Calle 38 y Calle 40 Colonia Centro

661252602.name: WOW!
661252602.author: a TripAdvisor user
661252602.reviewBody: We visited this cenote after a trip to Ek-Balam. Was perfect for us... very quiet, interesting and Luis was more like a friend than a guide. He explained everything that we were seeing and the history better than any other tour leader we\u2019ve ever o. The cave and cenote are bothe beautiful, well worth your short drive from Vallodolid. We will visit again! Thanks,Luis!

658531781.name: Unbelievable!
658531781.author: a TripAdvisor user
658531781.reviewBody: My wife and I visited upon a recommendation from our hotel host. I\u2019m so glad we did! It is a short drive from Ek Balam, which we went to first. We did the cave exploration and the cenote. Our guide spoke English well which made up for my limited Spanish. We swam in the cool waters of the cenote for around an hour and had the whole place to ourselves! There is shallow water and deep water with a place to dive in. It was an amazing experience.

657803895.name: BEST CENOTE EVER
657803895.author: a TripAdvisor user
657803895.reviewBody: I have gone to various cenotes in my 3 years in Valladolid, and i can without doubt say this is THE MOST BEAUTIFUL ONE!!! it really is amazing, not very common, they get about 20 people per day so you have it basically to yourself, it is about 25minutes from the city (i went by scooter) and it is just a bit of paradise, the top of the cenote fell off thousands of years ago, forming an island in teh middle, literally with sand so it is a beach in teh middle of nowhere.....sooooooo worth it.!!!

655834456.name: Luis
655834456.author: a TripAdvisor user
655834456.reviewBody: Luis was our tour guide through the caves and to the cenote. He was fabulous. Thanks Luis!! Spectacular

653576770.name: Highlight
653576770.author: a TripAdvisor user
653576770.reviewBody: A hidden gem not yet discovered by tour busses like many other cenotes in the neighbourhood. We had it for our own and felt in Eden. Utmost friendly Luis joined for some explanations about the surrounding nature and maya culture.

638455777.name: So far one of the best cenotes!!
638455777.author: a TripAdvisor user
638455777.reviewBody: This is one of the best I ever seen, this is like a  Hidden gem. This place Is  spectacular. We had the guide guy just for my husband and I, his name was Luis, he\u2019s so friendly and teach us so many stuffs from the Mayan culture, his family are from Mayan ansestors. The Cenote is so big with a amazing trees and it\u2019s very clean. Plus we visit a cave was near there. Is worth it Visit Valladolid and go to this place. We also eat there and the food was delicious, and the stuff very friendly. They made us hand made tortillas. I highly recomend this place, belive me you never gonna regretted. \ud83d\ude4c\ud83c\udffb

612654871.name: Amazing
612654871.author: a TripAdvisor user
612654871.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous spot! Must see if you are in the area. We repelled down and went for the most refreshing swim!

570895761.name: Beautiful cenote
570895761.author: a TripAdvisor user
570895761.reviewBody: We found this cenote by way from Ek Balam - very nice place, quiet, without people. We were there about 11 a.m and we were alone. Cenote is very green - many trees inside on  small island - around is water. Entry fee is 90 per person, servis is perfect, whole area is clean. I recommend to visit as long as it\'s a tourist-unknown place (and no swimming pool with many people as another cenotes :).

556942812.name: Cenote Near Ek Balam
556942812.author: a TripAdvisor user
556942812.reviewBody: Cool cenote near Ek Balam and Valladolid. Not too touristy (we were the only ones there when we visited). You can rent kayaks to paddle around.It\'s shallower than the other cenotes in the area and you can see tiny little fish swimming around in the clear water.

671911506.name: Very old but in pretty good shape.
671911506.author: a TripAdvisor user
671911506.reviewBody: Once you enter you realize that it is bigger than it seems. Nice artwork. Definitely worth a visit! It\'s right off the main square in the heart of the city center.

670279870.name: Nice
670279870.author: a TripAdvisor user
670279870.reviewBody: Symbol of Valladolid. Very nice, colonial, hotter compared to the european ones but very characteristic

669027459.name: Nice cathedral
669027459.author: a TripAdvisor user
669027459.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cathedral, worth stopping to check out while visiting the plaza.  Eat at El Atrio del Mayab next door, it\'s delicious and has a quiet garden area to sit in.

656334340.name: Stunning Spanish Cathedral
656334340.author: a TripAdvisor user
656334340.reviewBody: Catedral de San Servasio is a picturesque cathedral sitting proudly off the park in the center of Valladolid. We only had a few minutes to spend on a quick stop so we were unable to go inside.

650397776.name: Beautiful Cathedral!
650397776.author: a TripAdvisor user
650397776.reviewBody: A very picturesque Cathedral built of stone and totally befitting this small Mexican city. Spent nearly an hour here and marvelled at the beauty

647890147.name: Beautiful Cathedral
647890147.author: a TripAdvisor user
647890147.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral located across the street from the zocalo. Definitely worth a walk through. The side of the church has some shady trees and a short wall around the gardens is the perfect spot to sit down and people watch.

647358836.name: Great to visit on a rainy day for a snack and Tequila\u2026!!
647358836.author: a TripAdvisor user
647358836.reviewBody: It was a day that was windy and some rain therefore we decided to visit Valladolid, not much to see however a nice stopover for a snack or coffee break or maybe a large glass of tequila in this little city to see while passing through to other locations. You can see the San Bernardino Cathedral for sure at one time very elegant\u2026 but not preserved at this moment in time that is my opinion anyway! It is neglected and not taken care of properly as a visitor place for this city. You can enjoy walking through the local center for 1 hour or so there is some beautiful Spanish style buildings very colorful some food stalls with tasty recipes to choose\u2026 but afterwards is time to leave there is nothing else to see!  Depressing.or maybe you want to include a visit at the Zaci Cenote nice but when we where there we left early as there was lots of tourist and it were quite stressing!

647258088.name: Stunning building
647258088.author: a TripAdvisor user
647258088.reviewBody: The San Gerv\u00e1sio catedral is stunning as a building but the inside of it is a little disappointing as one would expect it to correspond to the magnificent exterior and it does not. Still well worth a visit if you are in Valladolid.

647183548.name: Very Beautiful Cathedral.
647183548.author: a TripAdvisor user
647183548.reviewBody: This Catholic Cathedral is very old and still is in use. I enjoyed taking my time to walk through this beautiful place. sit in the pews. Say a prayer and have a wonderful day in the park just outside. \n

646305154.name: Closed for public
646305154.author: a TripAdvisor user
646305154.reviewBody: Perhaps it was better is was closed. Local people should have some for their own aswell.\n\nFrom outside great and beautiful chirch next to main square of valladolid

644955767.name: A must-see
644955767.author: a TripAdvisor user
644955767.reviewBody: The Cathedral of San Servacio stands high above anything else in Valladolid and makes for a stunning picture with the park in the foreground. The exterior shows intricate markings and carvings and the interior is just a wonderful.

639166081.name: Beautiful
639166081.author: a TripAdvisor user
639166081.reviewBody: Spanish feel to it. Beautiful church and colonial town. Walk through the streets, take a picture at the Valladolid colorful letters. Go to the nearby cenotes and have a great mexican lunch.

638071998.name: Welcome to Spain...
638071998.author: a TripAdvisor user
638071998.reviewBody: Classic European architecture. European all around the world, except Asia. Magnificent structure in the middle of Mexico...

634653325.name: History
634653325.author: a TripAdvisor user
634653325.reviewBody: We visited a lot of Mexican cities and they all have cathedrals like this but it never bores. \nNice building with a peace park in front of it and in the evenings you can enjoy the lights, great view.

633277772.name: the cathedral is classic catholic mayan invasion era
633277772.author: a TripAdvisor user
633277772.reviewBody: Adjacent to the wonderful plaza/park it is very majestic bu not very impressive other than the small scene alcoves and very high ceilings. A five minute visit ( unless you soit and pray/meditate /contemplate that is worth it

632133603.name: Beautiful
632133603.author: a TripAdvisor user
632133603.reviewBody: So breathtaking beautiful!!! The church gets pretty busy so be sure to visit early before the crowd.

631475251.name: Nothing very special
631475251.author: a TripAdvisor user
631475251.reviewBody: If you come from Europe, this church is really nothing special.\nI would suggest to visit only if it is in your way.

629605925.name: Hard to miss
629605925.author: a TripAdvisor user
629605925.reviewBody: This church is hard to miss. Probably tallest structure in the entire town. We stopped by here during are free time on our tour of Valladolid. Very nice building not fancy by any stretch, rather simple looking.

626081990.name: Local Chirch !
626081990.author: a TripAdvisor user
626081990.reviewBody: On the main square of the city, a typical Colonial Church, not really worth the detour but if you are there have a look.

622751520.name: Worth checking out if you are in town, but not worth seeking out
622751520.author: a TripAdvisor user
622751520.reviewBody: An interesting exterior, not much to see on the inside I am told, we could not go in since there was a special service going on. We took extensive photos of the courtyard and grounds and of the church itself. A cool entry way and some other cool features around the side too.  A large cross is off to one side and there is a great photo op to shoot that in the foreground and the front of the church in the background.  \n\nWorth a quick visit if you are near by, not a destination to go seek out by any means.

618075001.name: Austere
618075001.author: a TripAdvisor user
618075001.reviewBody: This cathedral is plain and austere because the indigenous people stripped it bare during an uprising many years ago. It\'s actually rather refreshing.

616476231.name: Nice Architecture
616476231.author: a TripAdvisor user
616476231.reviewBody: If you\u2019re nearby its a nice building to see, made from the stones an old Mayan pyramid. Weren\u2019t there long.

614973442.name: Pretty outside, not much to look at inside
614973442.author: a TripAdvisor user
614973442.reviewBody: We were only given 45 mins to do our DIY sightseeing in downtown Valladolid so after a brief stop at Palacio Municipal, we hurried to cross the street to visit the Catedral de San Servacio next. We entered the church through the open main doors around 4:45PM and found only a few locals and tourists inside. This old church has a very plain interior, the walls and high ceiling painted a dull white and lacked ornamentation. The altarpiece is a simple three-tiered structure that held religious figures. We did not linger here and eventually went out via an open side door. We walked around to the back to take pics of the church facade but finally crossed the street to be able to do so. Overall, it is pretty enough outside but not much to look at inside.

611309232.name: Nice for a glance
611309232.author: a TripAdvisor user
611309232.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful building and helps frame the area, especially from across the street in the park. I wouldn\'t say it\'s a go to destination, but if you\'re in the area, you should stop by.

608471940.name: If you\'re around go see it, but don\'t travel to it
608471940.author: a TripAdvisor user
608471940.reviewBody: The cathedral was kinda pretty on the outside, but really just plain inside. If you\'re in Valladolid, pass by to see it, but don\'t travel just to see it, it\'s not worth it.

599559040.name: Big building, furnished soberly, bit like a big cave inside
599559040.author: a TripAdvisor user
599559040.reviewBody: Yes, it is an impressive building. Yes, it represents history and therefore it has a certain value to visit it. Inside: also big, rather dark, not really much to see/rather empty. When you\u2019re around and not into history, walk through it, it will take appr. 5 minutes. When you are fond of these buildings, spend a longer time there, but only travel specifically for the Cathedral to Valladolid in case you are very, very much into these kind of buildings.

597157447.name: Sad story.
597157447.author: a TripAdvisor user
597157447.reviewBody: This Cathedral was the site of some of the most depressing stories of the Mayan culture and the conquest by the Spanish empire.  There is a light show projected against it that looks awesome.  Drive from Merida and stay in Valladolid.  It is in the middle of all the cenotes and Mayan sites.

596004225.name: History
596004225.author: a TripAdvisor user
596004225.reviewBody: The Valladolid is a nice for visit, if you want to escape from resort to feel the Mexico.  The Cathedral is very beautiful. Just across from the park and lots of stores in the area to enjoy.

588167249.name: Cute Small town with a Spanish style
588167249.author: a TripAdvisor user
588167249.reviewBody: Very cute town, the main square is nice with a chocolate shop like a nexpresso store, with different types of chocolate flavors ...the church ...

585662752.name: Beautiful church, Tour bus should have given more time to explore this
585662752.author: a TripAdvisor user
585662752.reviewBody:
So, we stopped at cenote for 90 minutes but our tour bus gave us just 20 minutes to explore Valladolid and nearby areas, great...!!
That why I recommend coming by yourself. No doubt church looks very beautiful from outside, but we did not have time, so we just roamed in central park, have churros and then came back. Central Park was full of people, warrior dressed guys, vendors.
Streets were looking so beautiful, vibrant, colorful from the bus. We should have stayed here for longer time.

I recommend visiting here. It is as vibrant as it can be

582735800.name: Church as old as the city \u2013 a landmark and must visit for tourists
582735800.author: a TripAdvisor user
582735800.reviewBody:
While returning from out tour to Chichen Itza, we stopped in Valladolid and passed from the front side of this church. At the first look it appears that the church building needs a lot of repairs and maintenance for this to be one of the best attraction for tourists in the city. 

This is the old church built in 1543 - the same year as the founding of the town/city. Thus, the church is already a landmark! 

A must visit for seeking blessings and prey.

580006551.name: Beautiful cathedral!
580006551.author: a TripAdvisor user
580006551.reviewBody: Built in 1543, the same year as the founding of the town, the San Servasio Cathedral is a great photo opportunity for everyone who is visiting the town of Valladolid.\n\nThe park in front of the cathedral is the perfect place to enjoy a relaxed evening watching people and enjoying some delicious local snacks and drinks.

573590768.name: Old church for some sight seeing
573590768.author: a TripAdvisor user
573590768.reviewBody: It\u2019s old and a large landmark to see when visiting the town centre. It\u2019s a bit decayed and run down, which gives it an interesting look. If you peer way up there is a tree growing on top of one of it\u2019s highest towers

573239217.name: Nice church in center
573239217.author: a TripAdvisor user
573239217.reviewBody: We stopped in Valladolid as a part of our tour to Chichen Itza and Cenote Ik Kil. We went into the church and stopped by some of the souvenir shops.

569324708.name: Historic and Still Well Used
569324708.author: a TripAdvisor user
569324708.reviewBody: Very moving place to visit especially since it remains an important part of the community. The paint inside is chipping and there are some parts that are crumbling, but the spirit is still there. The bells in the evening are splendid.

567964714.name: A spiritual experience
567964714.author: a TripAdvisor user
567964714.reviewBody:
The cathedral looks sensational from outside - it towers above the location and dominates it by its presence.

Inside it is relatively plain but its history and years of prayer are keenly felt in the atmosphere.

It's a must-see building

564012706.name: a good comparason
564012706.author: a TripAdvisor user
564012706.reviewBody: looking at old architcture , you can compare it to others and wonder how the constuction process could have been accomplished , massive strcture and , old but still sturdy

563876131.name: Beutiful church
563876131.author: a TripAdvisor user
563876131.reviewBody: Its a must see and can\'t miss in the city square. Still in use and a great piece of history. Take the time and don\'t forget to donate.

561344423.name: Stunning
561344423.author: a TripAdvisor user
561344423.reviewBody: Stopped on our way back from C Itzu at the recommendation from our guide. Great little city and the church is across from the park. Great history and architecture. Well worth the stop.

560266651.name: Interesting history of church and town
560266651.author: a TripAdvisor user
560266651.reviewBody:
This is a lovely church in a colonial town of Valladolid.  It is just outside the main town square, surrounded by other colonial buildings.  Apparently this town used the building blocks from Mayan ruins to build the structures, including this church.

I would dress respectfully, nothing skimpy, as it is a place of worship after all.  

Didn't find that we had to spend too much time here.  A few souvenir shops are around.  Hope it doesn't turn into a big tourist trap.  There were quite a few people begging for money in and around there as it seems to be a growing tourist stop.  

The eatery area with restaurants were a bit sketchy for us.  If you need the bathroom, you have to pay for toilet paper!

559234938.name: Beautiful!
559234938.author: a TripAdvisor user
559234938.reviewBody: We did a quick tour stop at Vallodolid and visited the Cathedral, very beautiful and ornate.  Just across from the park and lots of stores in the area to enjoy.  Nice visit for a day trip.

556921598.name: Majestic in its humble simplicity
556921598.author: a TripAdvisor user
556921598.reviewBody:
Located right across from the main little city square is this old cathedral.  Its not as big and ornate as European cathedrals - but its charm is in its simplicity.  On the outside it is a bit drab...but the story is that the cathedral was built from the stones of a Mayan temple.  The doors are huge and impressive but are showing their age.  The inside is serene and rustically somber.  It was a place for quiet contemplation.

The courtyard has its share of beggars and street people but they were not aggressive in their panhandling. As this is a tourist area and there are lots of people they seemed to do alright financially?  I suggest you give a donation to the church's poverty fund if you are so inclined

We like visiting churches wherever we go.

555209917.name: Not so interesting from outside !
555209917.author: a TripAdvisor user
555209917.reviewBody: Huge cathedral... Build using recycled stones from an older mayan city as per the tour guide.\nNot so impressive from out side. Couldnt visit insode as it was closed at the time we visited. There is a park right opposite the with some intersting chairs built just for lovers.\n

553018339.name: History!
553018339.author: a TripAdvisor user
553018339.reviewBody: It\u2019s a gorgeous church that I would absolutely recommend a walk around if you\u2019re there. I would recommend going on Sunday so you can go to the market in the square!

549940582.name: Nice cathedral
549940582.author: a TripAdvisor user
549940582.reviewBody: The cathedral is very nice and sits right across the street from the main park in town. Worth a stop if you are close by.

548312780.name: Peaceful cathedral
548312780.author: a TripAdvisor user
548312780.reviewBody: It is right in front of Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton. I was able to get inside too. No admission fee.

547431364.name: Old Cathedral in The Main Plaza
547431364.author: a TripAdvisor user
547431364.reviewBody: One of the main attractions in town sorry we could not go inside. Looked interesting although having seen many much larger we were a little disappointed.

540926006.name: Nice to see and enjoy the inside quietness
540926006.author: a TripAdvisor user
540926006.reviewBody: Not much to say, it is a church. Once passed through the local vendors (a bit more insistent than in most parts of the city), you access this relaxing place to just relax and pray if you wish. Paired to the adjacent park visit, it is a nice stop in your mexican journey.

540304409.name: Nothing special
540304409.author: a TripAdvisor user
540304409.reviewBody: It is the major attraction in Valladolid, ok, but it is nothing special and even more boring inside.

530597387.name: Sweet church on beautiful square
530597387.author: a TripAdvisor user
530597387.reviewBody: Church is worth looking into if you\u2019re in Valladolid. Some dodgy looking statues in there as someone else has mentioned, but a nice cool place of tranquility for a little bit of reflection.\n\nThe square it sits on is beautiful, surrounded by colonial architecture all round.

526496229.name: Beautiful Church with Historical Background
526496229.author: a TripAdvisor user
526496229.reviewBody: We spent several days in Valladolid on our annual Mexican vacation largely due to churches and the Convent we saw when passing through in years on by on other trips.\nThis church is BEAUTIFUL and impressive with architecture that left you wondering ,"How they did it" back in the day without modern conveniences.\nWe were also told that when the city was named Zaci (prior to the Spaniards and naming it Valladolid) that the rock used to build this church was a pyramid in the location that is now the town square across the street. It\'s not huge but it\'s impressive for a small colonial town\'s main cathedral.

518006126.name: Beautiful church
518006126.author: a TripAdvisor user
518006126.reviewBody: This is the most important church in Valladolid, you must visit it. It won\'t take you a lot of time and you would like it.

516698857.name: Great Place to Visit on the way to Chichen Itza!
516698857.author: a TripAdvisor user
516698857.reviewBody: I have traveled to Chichen Itza several times over the years and they all included a stop in Villadolid, Mexico.  There is an amazing cathedral in the center of town that has a very interesting history.  I will not give anything away.  The town is safe to walk around and take in some real Mexican culture.  Despite many tourists passing through, this little  city has kept its true Mexican appeal.

516500568.name: Beautiful Old Cathedral
516500568.author: a TripAdvisor user
516500568.reviewBody: This trip was so historical and shows your a colonial town from the time that Spain ruled Mexico. The history of the area and people are so impressive and when inside the church it shows the detail of both spanish colonies and the mayans. Tragic but in return they left nice architect. I even got a chance to pay worship to my family and loved ones. A must visit when you come to Yucatan. Enjoy and please respect the citizens still in the area.

507004556.name: Nice stopover
507004556.author: a TripAdvisor user
507004556.reviewBody: The building was a nice example of Spanish colonial architecture and so was the area surrounding the main square.  Valladolid was a good choice of a stopover to Chichen Itza, glad we did it.

505165798.name: Great landmark
505165798.author: a TripAdvisor user
505165798.reviewBody: The house of worship was impressive inside and out. I spent some time circling the beautiful structure before entering. I really appreciated the detail. And when I entered i was just as impressed. The history on how the spaniards forced the Mayans to switch religion is terrible but the architecture left behind is amazing.

504047370.name: Colonial church
504047370.author: a TripAdvisor user
504047370.reviewBody: Nice church in front of a nice square. The style is colonial. If you have the chance to visit, do it, because you will learn about the culture of the place of that city, founded by spanish people. When you go out please give charity to the poor people.

504034194.name: colonial town cathedral
504034194.author: a TripAdvisor user
504034194.reviewBody: Valladolid is a colonial town from the time that Spain ruled Mexico. This is not a major city or cathedral, but the history of this area, and the people are well worth the visit. This cathedral is still very much in use by the people of Valladolid.

502939345.name: Average cathedral
502939345.author: a TripAdvisor user
502939345.reviewBody: Mexico has some very cool cathedrals. The one in Valladolid is an impressive size, but there is not much to see or look at beyond the exterior.

502555189.name: Small if compared to the religuos Past of the m\u00e1gico town
502555189.author: a TripAdvisor user
502555189.reviewBody: Smal, simple More a chuch, very old, like the town or downtown, near Z\u00f3calo, lots of restaurants, shops

502481044.name: Beautiful Cathedral
502481044.author: a TripAdvisor user
502481044.reviewBody: Didn\'t get a chance to go in but i did get to see its beauty from the outside. If passing through i would definitely recommend visiting

499627271.name: Wonderful place to see transition from native to colonial
499627271.author: a TripAdvisor user
499627271.reviewBody: Great old church to see the transition from indigenous to colonial culture. As most of Mexico, the church was partially built with the same stones left from Mayan structures. The church even incorporated some Mayan symbols to entice the Mayan people to come. When we were there, they were doing a first communion mass. Very cool!

496860551.name: Beautiful Cathedral but closes around 1pm on Saturday until 5pm....
496860551.author: a TripAdvisor user
496860551.reviewBody: We traveled from Tulum, Mexico to Valladolid - about 1.5 hrs away just to see this cathedral and spend the day in Valladolid.  Valladolid is a neat city with shopping & restaurants all around the square.  My iPhone maps got us there easily but there are some turns, etc so make sure your GPS works or that you get the directions in some form to refer to before you get out of service area - it\'s a remote drive.  Don\'t get stuck driving back at night/after dark b/c most of the 1.5 hrs was remote with no light poles so the roads would be VERY dark if traveling at night.  Also make sure your vehicle is gassed up before you get stuck out on the remote drive.  There was one police checkpoint for us between Tulum and Coba - no big deal at all.  Just rolled down the window and told them where we were going.  \n\nPlease note that the cathedral closes sometime around 1pm (at least on the Saturday we were there) until 5pm.  No entrance fee.  We got there around 12 noon so had a good hour to look around, pray, and take pictures.  1 hour is about all you need.  After visiting the cathedral, we walked across to Las Campanas Restaurant to eat - very very good food and extremely cheap.  Good service too.  Spent rest of afternoon shopping in the area and bought a few things.  Driving back to Tulum we stopped in the village/city of Coba and were amazed at the local handicrafts made there.  Mostly dream catchers (some were HUGE) but also some woodcrafts, leather goods, hammocks and furniture.  The people of Coba were soooo friendly and nice and not pushy hovering like the shopping in Tulum.  We actually went back on Sunday afternoon to Coba to get a few more items - they were selling their goods, even on Sunday (I was wondering fi they\'d be closed).   Better prices and easier to deal with shop keepers than in high-pressure, high tourist trap Tulum shopping.  Tulum has more types of items to buy but the shopkeepers there are very very pushy, hovering, and will try to rip you off (so practice your bartering skills before you got to Tulum!!).  If you got to Valladolid from Tulum, stop in Coba ....it\'s only about 17 miles outside of Tulum and worth the drive if for nothing else just to see the most intricate, unique, and huge quantity of dream catchers you\'ve ever seen.

487804990.name: traditional catholic church
487804990.author: a TripAdvisor user
487804990.reviewBody: we were there in a Sunday, so we stayed for the Sunday mass. The service was nice, the cathedral is humble but nice.

487376438.name: Right on the Plaza
487376438.author: a TripAdvisor user
487376438.reviewBody: This church was open when we passed by, so we went in. It\'s not overly decorated (typical of churches in the Yucatan) but quiet and peaceful and lovely in its own way. Definitely a popular spot for tourists.

486803173.name: Beautiful Old Cathedral
486803173.author: a TripAdvisor user
486803173.reviewBody: This is a lovely place to visit, a really ornate and serene cathedral in the heart of the city. it dates from the 15th century and you really get the atmosphere when you visit of a place that has been the centre of devotions for centuries and is relatively untouched aside from maintenance.\nIt is a working cathedral so I did not take pictures, as other reviewers have said it was very populated with local people praying at the various altars and chapels.\nSuch a beautiful church and even by night it is worth a visit to see it so nicely lit from the outside.

486273883.name: A Sad Experience
486273883.author: a TripAdvisor user
486273883.reviewBody: Do not get me wrong, this is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen. But whether you are a religious person or not, it is disrespectful for tourists to come into a place of worship and take pictures of people worshiping; which is exactly what this was. It is beautiful but if you go please be respectful. Our tour bus dropped us off and have us a few minutes to walk about the cathedral built in the 1500s.

483502500.name: Nice church
483502500.author: a TripAdvisor user
483502500.reviewBody: Huge church in the small town. It looks fantastic in the evening when the lights are turned on. Nice view.

483240159.name: Beautiful Catedral
483240159.author: a TripAdvisor user
483240159.reviewBody: This Catedral is a must see.  It\'s grand in stature and beautiful inside.  There are many alters and statues of saints. I\'m not able to upload photos right now but I\'ll try again later. Everywhere we travel we visit the cathedrals, basilicas and this one doesn\'t disappoint.

477974764.name: Beautiful
477974764.author: a TripAdvisor user
477974764.reviewBody: Beautiful building with a lot of local history. Very interesting to see the local people attending the mass.

477295838.name: Brief Visit
477295838.author: a TripAdvisor user
477295838.reviewBody: Beautiful, historic colonial church. Stopped in for end of evening mass. Worthwhile spending more time here.

475908255.name: A Simple Beauty
475908255.author: a TripAdvisor user
475908255.reviewBody: This was our last stop from our Chichen Itza tour. It is situated across the plaza. The cathedral was closed when we were there. Unlike the other churches I\'ve seen in other parts of Mexico, the exterior of this cathedral is simply decorated. Very simple but yet beautiful.

472965060.name: Interesting history
472965060.author: a TripAdvisor user
472965060.reviewBody: This was one the stops included on my day trip to Chich\u00e9n Itza, and I\'m aware that the only reason I found this interesting was the amount of knowledge my tour guide had - I could feel how much he admired the culture and history, and he had tons of small details to show us. It\'s really interesting!

469652960.name: A beautiful example historic architecture
469652960.author: a TripAdvisor user
469652960.reviewBody: Our tour bus stopped in Valladolid on our way to Chichen Itza. We were given a short period of time to visit some of the sights. This was our first choice. It is a magnificent structure. Once we entered the building there was a respective silence as people examined the craftsmanship and art within the cathedral. It was a quick visit but worth seeing.

469587724.name: Sultana of the Plaza
469587724.author: a TripAdvisor user
469587724.reviewBody: A typically bold, austere Yucateca style quite different to the baroque excesses of central Mexican churches.  It\'s not clear from the outside when they hold Mass but they do so several times a day on Sundays.\n\nThe Cathedral overlooks a magnificent plaza which comes to life when the weather cools after dark.  People enjoy the quaint S-shaped love seats.  On the Sunday evening when I was there, an excellent ten-piece band played Cuban and Colombian-flavoured music, with people invited to dance.  Valladolid is nearer Havana than Mexico City and they do like a cumbia here!

467703324.name: Beautiful Stately Church
467703324.author: a TripAdvisor user
467703324.reviewBody: We were unable to get in to this Cathedral as it was locked up tight. The exterior promises a church you would like to explore. A beautiful building for pictures. Not sure if there are times when it is open to the public.

466948360.name: Tour to Valladolid.
466948360.author: a TripAdvisor user
466948360.reviewBody: Booked a tour in Puerto Moreles from Lighthouse Tours, across from town square. Valladolid was part of trip, also visited Xichen, a cenote, Mayan center and a great buffet for $70.00 USA. An all day trip, worth every cent.\n     This was our fifth year In PM, a month each time. I would not just go to Valladolid for a visit, long ride really not much to see, also city is larger than I expected.\n.

464158269.name: very impressive catedral
464158269.author: a TripAdvisor user
464158269.reviewBody: it was nice to see it. very impressive building from outside as well as from inside. it is located in the middle of the town . not to be missed

462667759.name: You can feel the history...
462667759.author: a TripAdvisor user
462667759.reviewBody: Beautiful historic cathedral - amazing how these buildings survive the test of time.  Well worth stopping in to see inside.

462587414.name: The main attraction in Valladolid - you cannot miss it
462587414.author: a TripAdvisor user
462587414.reviewBody: The cathedral is located in the town square from what I\'m told built from the ruins of a Maya temple across from it.  The cathedral was closed when I was there so could not go inside, but outside architecture fit the surrounding town square environment.

461854483.name: Nice church to view
461854483.author: a TripAdvisor user
461854483.reviewBody: Arrived just before closing time, 12:30 and needed to scurry.  There are folks outside looking for money for sick kids and ladies selling peanuts who wont take no for an answer.

461308393.name: Beautiful Cathedral in Valladolid
461308393.author: a TripAdvisor user
461308393.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way back from Chichen Itza. It\'s a beautiful church and quaint little town. While we were here we walked through the town square and visited the chocolateria.

454579947.name: Village visit
454579947.author: a TripAdvisor user
454579947.reviewBody: Went here on way to chicnen itza and worth a stop. Typical small Mexican town with old shops pretty much unspoilt. Cathedral is fabulous and got some great photos around the square.

454382055.name: The Crown Jewel of the Main Plaza in Valladolid
454382055.author: a TripAdvisor user
454382055.reviewBody: Beautiful!  Stunningly beautiful and the Crown Jewel of the main plaza in Valladolid.  We didn\'t have time to go inside.... but will definitely plan to do that next time !

453670747.name: Great looking Cathedral
453670747.author: a TripAdvisor user
453670747.reviewBody: Great looking Cathedral.  I was there at dusk so I witnessed it transform as it got darker. Took some amazing photos of it.

452759358.name: TThis was interesting but we did not have a guide so I know there was more to understand.
452759358.author: a TripAdvisor user
452759358.reviewBody: We walked in a side door and a few guys told us to pay to look so we did--I\'m not sure that would have happened had we walked in to any other door!  the Cenote was the most interesting part.  It appears to still be functioning.  We walked around the former convent and that was interesting too.

451279239.name: good to check out
451279239.author: a TripAdvisor user
451279239.reviewBody: This is right in the center of town on the south side of the plaza. Easy to go check out and walk around the plaza for a bit. Not lot some other big churches you might be thinking of, mostly a modest church...but if you as passing through worth checking out.

451260167.name: Must visit when in the area
451260167.author: a TripAdvisor user
451260167.reviewBody: This was one of the stop over I had when I had the tour to Chichen Itza ruins. The city was beautiful and this cathedral was simple with some personality to it that reminded me of home. There are lots of souvenir shops around and the park in front of the cathedral is also a must. Make sure to stroll around and try the street foods, especially the churros! it was heaven!

451081077.name: 1705 charming and simple
451081077.author: a TripAdvisor user
451081077.reviewBody: We enjoyed our hour here. The Cathedral has a lovely simle spanish style with a rich history. Very beautiful and just of the main plaza. Free to visit.

449754395.name: 1705 Church with some personality
449754395.author: a TripAdvisor user
449754395.reviewBody:
It seems that every church has its fascination.  So we stopped.  

The exterior shows a certain personality while inside, I was only able to find charm in the lighting coming down the dome and the mid aisle welcoming statuette. 

If you plan a trip to Chichen Itza, it can be a good place to stop.

448635540.name: Simple and beautiful!
448635540.author: a TripAdvisor user
448635540.reviewBody: Quite unassuming, simply decorated, but beautiful nevertheless. Great classic location in the central piazza of the old city of Valladolid

447922495.name: Nothing special
447922495.author: a TripAdvisor user
447922495.reviewBody: The cathedral was closed during our visit to the town although it was nothing special from the outside.  We were able to take a few pictures from outside.

447443377.name: Closed
447443377.author: a TripAdvisor user
447443377.reviewBody: In the midst of the tourist season, we were surprised to see this site closed.\nWe were really looking forward to seeing this iconic colonial landmark, but we had to settle by just snapping a few selfies from the outside.\nDon\'t assume and check their operating hours as for us it was a long day trip from Cancun.

446804757.name: Nice church
446804757.author: a TripAdvisor user
446804757.reviewBody: It is a nice church to see if you are already in town. \n\nNot worth a special trip to go to the town.  The town itself is nice but not remarkable.  It was a stop on our trip back from Chichen Nitza

444717523.name: Massive walls, surprisingly restrained decor.
444717523.author: a TripAdvisor user
444717523.reviewBody: Expecting masses of gilded statues and extravagant decoration this calm peaceful church is quietly impressive.\nMain entrances at North and South, the only real decoration is found in the organ and alterpiee.

444111550.name: Step back in time
444111550.author: a TripAdvisor user
444111550.reviewBody: We just had a short time (15 minutes or so) in this fine, old (300+ years) church but it was very pleasant.  It is not open all day, so being able to visit the inside may depend on your luck and timing.  It is a working church with local parishioners in and out to worship so respect their space and keep conversations and photos to a minimum.  If you enjoyed your visit, let them know by dropping a few dollars or pesos in a collection box on the way out to contribute to their building maintenance fund.

442986241.name: Spectacular
442986241.author: a TripAdvisor user
442986241.reviewBody: The longer you stay the more you see.  The art, history and religion all seem to hit you at the same time as you finally realize the enormity the building and what it must have taken to build this 300 hundred years ago in what must have been a pretty primitive area.

438633654.name: A beautiful old Catholic Cathedral in the town Center
438633654.author: a TripAdvisor user
438633654.reviewBody: I love attending this big, beautiful Cathedral with the very quiet, humble Mayan people.  I was fortunate to arrive early and witness several families celebrating the baptism of their children.  The Mayan women wear their traditional Huipil dresses and children are so adorable!  Our evening view of the Cathedral lightning up every night from our balcony at the Hotel Meson de Marquis was so beautiful.  We just love taking our guests to Valladolid to experience this amazing peaceful city.  It is so charming!

438189308.name: Quaint city and beautiful church
438189308.author: a TripAdvisor user
438189308.reviewBody: Quick stop in Valladolid and couldn\'t resist snapping a photo of the church next to the park. Didn\'t have more than 30 minutes to explore. Quaint city.

437414815.name: Worth a visit
437414815.author: a TripAdvisor user
437414815.reviewBody: A big church not the colonial baroque of the big churches in some of the other towns but definitely you get the feeling that it is a house of worship alive with people.

431999115.name: A Religious  Experience
431999115.author: a TripAdvisor user
431999115.reviewBody: We were in valladolid  for almost two days\nAfter spending  a day in chichaitza we decided to spend the night and explore the town wonderful history this church was open to all , but be respectful  to the locals turist just walk in snapping  pictures and making loud noises.

430745370.name: Beautiful Cathedral, Somber History
430745370.author: a TripAdvisor user
430745370.reviewBody: This beatiful cathedral is worth the visit on the way back from Chichen Itza to Cancun. The church is a very impressive landmark from the past and a grand structure. Our guide told us that stones and materials to build this place came from temples and landmarks of Chichen Itza, after being destroyed by the Spaniards.

422870034.name: Nice church.
422870034.author: a TripAdvisor user
422870034.reviewBody: We stopped in Valladolid for lunch on our way from Chichen Itza to Ek Balam. Nice, charming little town with deep history. The central part of the town is the town square and the Cathedral of San Gervasio. The church was built by Franciscan brother in 1570... but it was destroyed during the disputes between Mayans and Spaniards. Eventually the cathedral was rebuilt in 1702. Very impressive church, with great architecture. It needs a little "face lift" but worth to see it!

421737282.name: Beautiful Cathedral
421737282.author: a TripAdvisor user
421737282.reviewBody: Do drop by to see the inside as well and enjoy the beauty of the architectural Cathedral. The plaza outside offered foods etc and the surround need to be maintain to keep it historical value for tourist.

421200211.name: An eclectic mix both inside and out.
421200211.author: a TripAdvisor user
421200211.reviewBody:
The Catedral is one of the most impressive features of the town of Valladolid and is great example of colonial religiuos architecture. So much so that it's actually quite surprising that more aspects of the surrounding town are not protected. When you visit you find so many of the features lost in other parts of Mexico in the name of change. 

Admittedly the same as you find in many other parts of the world and while change can and is quite often is good you have to retain those sites and building that give it context. 

So it is with Catedral, you have the colours, the building and the supporting features both original and authentic looking refurbishments. The problem comes with the more modern aspects that are creeping in which in part looks like a response to tourists visiting the town. While it's less present in the main square adjoining the church it definitely blights a number of side streets, it is the ugly facia of fast food establishments and utility shops which are at real odds with the charm that you find almost everywhere else around the town centre. It may be an economic issue but protection of the whole of the central town area would I believe increase the economy the more authentic buildings the greater the appeal. I also feel that if further encroachment of such building is allowed it could result in a real gem being lost. 

My recommendation would be to see the church and it's adjoining square sooner rather later. I also hope that I'm wrong about future potential development and these buildings see a more sympathetic overhaul, in and around the church.

419954542.name: Ok place!
419954542.author: a TripAdvisor user
419954542.reviewBody: The Catedral is nice good history, but nothing too crazy! The whole area is cool. Lots of history! Inside is ok.

417546168.name: Beautifull
417546168.author: a TripAdvisor user
417546168.reviewBody: Unfortunately we only stopped for 30 minutes in Valladolid on our way from Chichen Itza, so only thing I saw in the town was this church, but it was enough to remember Valladolid forever. It is really beautiful from outside and inside. Also a park across the church is impressive. If you have a chance stop by and visit it. It will show you other interesting face of Mexico.

417519474.name: Beautiful church set within busy Mexican square
417519474.author: a TripAdvisor user
417519474.reviewBody: This was a quick visit as part of a day tour, definitely could have spent much longer inside the church and outside in the area. There are some amazing looking shops around and lots of entertainment. Lovely place to sit and people watch, both inside the church and outside. The church itself is truly peaceful and very beautiful.

413188448.name: Spanish reminiscent church
413188448.author: a TripAdvisor user
413188448.reviewBody: This was on one of the stops on way to Chichen Itza from Cancun which was worth a visit and looked like a church in some small European town. It was claimed by guide that buiidling material for church was provided by dismantling mayan pyramid present at nearby garden site situated opposite church.

411628785.name: Worthwhile stop on the way from Coba to Chichen Itza
411628785.author: a TripAdvisor user
411628785.reviewBody: Valladolid doesn\'t have a lot to recommend it but we enjoyed experiencing a town where people work and live and was not inundated with tourists.  A few historical spots, including the catedral, are worth a visit.  But you needn\'t spend more that a few hours to cover them all.

407612338.name: Worth visiting as on main square
407612338.author: a TripAdvisor user
407612338.reviewBody: A very handsome building dominating the square but was sadly locked up whilst we were there (lunchtime midweek) - shame!

406186750.name: Wonderful old church.
406186750.author: a TripAdvisor user
406186750.reviewBody: Valladolid is such a wonderful town, there are little surprises around every corner.  Definitely go to the information center and get a map and list of sites to see.

405709045.name: Make sure to visit St. Servasio Cathedral while in Valladolid
405709045.author: a TripAdvisor user
405709045.reviewBody: Centrally located along one side of the main town square, the cathedral is definitely worth a visit.  Seeing the classic Spanish colonial architecture up close, both inside and out, and experiencing the solemn yet welcoming atmosphere of the active church provides a good sense of the role and importance of the Catholic church and Spanish influence, historically and current, on the Yucatan peninsula..  Please remember to be respectful and polite and follow the standard rules for visiting a place of worship; be quiet, unobtrusive while taking photos (when allowed), and do leave a donation.

405274111.name: a beautiful building
405274111.author: a TripAdvisor user
405274111.reviewBody: Located in the city square the Cathedral is a beautiful landmark with very nicely maintained grounds.

402619999.name: Nice to see when in main square
402619999.author: a TripAdvisor user
402619999.reviewBody: It is right on main square so if you are visiting Valladolid it does make sense to check the cathedral out. Plus which Valladolid is so small and not much else to see...

395998342.name: Gorgeous open air church
395998342.author: a TripAdvisor user
395998342.reviewBody: There not much to this simple open air church but there\'s history to it and a beautiful open air plaza to visit across the street.  And vendors selling the same souvenirs as everywhere else in Mexico.

395632420.name: Gorgeous exterior, simpler interior
395632420.author: a TripAdvisor user
395632420.reviewBody: Located on one of the sides of the central square. Beautiful exterior.. that makes for great pictures as well. The interior is rather plain compared to other colonial churches in general. Definitely worth a visit if you are in town.

388571150.name: Night view very nice
388571150.author: a TripAdvisor user
388571150.reviewBody: The day there was a wedding, so pretty at night they have it light up very nice. \n\nVery clean around, lots of traffic runs there but its right in front of the park.

380880850.name: Must visit
380880850.author: a TripAdvisor user
380880850.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old church. Great to see a true catholic church without any gold, marble, or any other riches materials.

376431295.name: A trip to the past
376431295.author: a TripAdvisor user
376431295.reviewBody: What a beautiful church and the plaza was so picturesque. The altars are absolutely gorgeous. The images of the Saints and the paintings on the wall are beautiful. Don\'t miss this historical building. Then spend some time sitting on one of the benches on the square and enjoy the pleasure of doing nothing but relaxing and watching people walk by. I loved this place. Found out later that this is where my great great great grand father had married after he came to the Continent as governor of Yucatan. No wonder this place was calling my name.

372415629.name: The city is amazing!
372415629.author: a TripAdvisor user
372415629.reviewBody: I spent 6 days there.  I was glad I did.  I walked all over Vallalodid, and if you like sociological exploration this little city will show you the Yucatan and Mexico right in your face.  Everybody is helpful and kind.  It is not charming.  It is real, very real.  The parke de centro is full of tourist crap, but even there you can find wonders.  Half a kilometer away you will find the way Yucantecans live.  Eat tamales for $10 pesos off the street, two for a meal, breakfast for $16, walk down calle 39 para 6 calles to the east and eat huevos mexicanos that you will die for.  Do not trust advise from the ADO attendants, and there are *no collectivos* in Coba.  Eat at the economico comida plaza across the street on the corner of the centro park.  Go to Ek Balam (collectivo at calle y 37 down from the bus station).  Get out in the evening.  Talk to the people.

365516304.name: 1500\'s Colonial Cathedral
365516304.author: a TripAdvisor user
365516304.reviewBody: Like many visitors here, we stopped in Valladolid while on a tour to Chichen Itza and nearby Cenotes. The Cathedral is located on the main square and is very well preserved. You can see the twin bell towers from a distance and is how we found it. The exterior is colonial Spanish style with some architectural decoration, but overall very conservative. The inside is white-washed walls, old wooden pews and stone columns & trim. At the altar is a group of six idols. The Cathedral is probably the main tourist stop in Valladolid.

364710663.name: Serene church
364710663.author: a TripAdvisor user
364710663.reviewBody: We visited while there was a local mass going on Sunday in the evenings. The church was full with I assume locals. It was a very spiritual atmosphere. Enjoyed the visit.

359303013.name: Nice old church
359303013.author: a TripAdvisor user
359303013.reviewBody: This is a nice old church.  It\'s still being used for mass, so be respectful when visiting.\n\nWe were on a tour that stopped in on Easter Sunday.  The church was packed.  We were able to check it out and it\'s surrounding area.  Nice, but nothing special.

358746980.name: Beautiful Cathedral. Gorgeous Colonial Architecture.
358746980.author: a TripAdvisor user
358746980.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cathedral located in the heart of Valladolid.  The architecture is breath-taking, it\'s a great spot to take some memorable photos of a day in Valladolid

354417597.name: A beautiful church from the outside
354417597.author: a TripAdvisor user
354417597.reviewBody: A lovely church outside, but not too elaborate inside.  Beautifully light at night and a pleasant plaza across the street to hang out in.

353113374.name: An old Catholic church
353113374.author: a TripAdvisor user
353113374.reviewBody: When walking around the square, stop in and look around. It is a nice respite from the travel experience.

352641036.name: Very old church and worth a visit
352641036.author: a TripAdvisor user
352641036.reviewBody: If you are walking the square in Valladolid, be sure to stop by this church.  It dates back several hundred years and is a nice quiet stop.  Took pictures inside without difficulty.

350665577.name: majestic church
350665577.author: a TripAdvisor user
350665577.reviewBody: when my sister and i visited, there was actually a wedding in progress! loved it! across the street from the church is a really good restaurant as well as the Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton.

350033886.name: Catedral de San Gervasio
350033886.author: a TripAdvisor user
350033886.reviewBody: We visited the Cathedral last week while visiting in Valladolid. The building is beautiful and the history interesting. The city has done a great job posting signs explaining the history in both Spanish and English which makes it much easier to understand the changes that have taken place. It is definitely worth the visit if you enjoy learning about the hiistory of the region. It was good to take time to sit and reflect inside the simple, yet beautiful interior.

349263928.name: Quick Stop
349263928.author: a TripAdvisor user
349263928.reviewBody: Make a quick stop in to see the Cathedral de San Gervasio. Lots of religious statues and architecture. You will hear the clanging of the bells any where around the town square. Can\'t miss it.

347457290.name: Very nice historic Catholic cathedral
347457290.author: a TripAdvisor user
347457290.reviewBody: This attractive cathedral is very popular with the locals and mass is well attended. The high ceilings, and religious statues and icons seem appropriate for locals seeking comfort in their religion.

345398942.name: Colonial Gem in a Real Gem of a Town
345398942.author: a TripAdvisor user
345398942.reviewBody: Please be aware this church is still a highly active congregation and runs worship services regularly. Plan your visit accordingly if you want to just see the chapel and be able to take photos inside. The interior is less ornate than many other churches of this period, largely because of the fire that destroyed it during the Caste War. While I would not call this church exceptionally beautiful in the aesthetic sense of the words, it is a very important location historically. It was here, inside these gates, that the Maya rebelled, beginning what would be known as the Caste Wars that reverberated thorugh the Yucatan. It is easy to find; just look across the street from the central park. There are lots of services nearby. And Valladolid has many signs in both English and Spanish making it a very visitor friendly town.

345266781.name: quiet place to reflect
345266781.author: a TripAdvisor user
345266781.reviewBody: The Catedral is very inspirational with rather austere interiors. Beautifully illuminated at night. The altar is quite ornate without being overwhelming. A wonderful place to sit and think about the history of the Yucatan and all that has taken place in Valladolid.

344286179.name: Not "terrible", just "poor" and nothing to see!
344286179.author: a TripAdvisor user
344286179.reviewBody:
One can´t have travelled much, if this is something to visit.
Outside a large building, as cathedrals are, inside plain and "empty".

Most European churches are more beautiful.
There is literally NOTHING to see inside.

So let´s be honest: Valladolid is a beautiful city, but has not much to offer (except great food - just as most Mexican cities do) - and its closeness to Chichen Itza.

One of the very few "highlights" is this "cathedral".
But again, do not waste your time.

343521365.name: Beautiful
343521365.author: a TripAdvisor user
343521365.reviewBody: Impressive cathedral with fine facade and detailling. The interior is relatively unadorned, which was something of a surprise, but it makes for an oasis of calm away from the heat, traffic and bustle outside.

343520878.name: Beautiful
343520878.author: a TripAdvisor user
343520878.reviewBody: Impressive cathedral with a fine facade and detailling. The interior is almost surprisingly unadorned, but this makes for calm atmosphere away from the traffic and bustle outside.

343252311.name: nice colonial architecture
343252311.author: a TripAdvisor user
343252311.reviewBody: nice and simple cathedral. can be seen in a few minutes. entry is free and is located in the heart of the city of valladolid. easy access .

342394279.name: Cathedral se San Gervasio
342394279.author: a TripAdvisor user
342394279.reviewBody: This 16th century Spanish colonial Cathedral is located in the heart of Valladolid Mexico. The cathedral was built with parts of ancient Maya temples and buildings after Spain invaded and destroyed them trying  to colonize and convert the Maya to Catholicism. There\u2019s a very sad history to learn of the Maya people at the hands of Spain here. The Cathedral itself is incredibly beautiful with many symbolic architectural details.

341259204.name: A beautiful and emotional experience!
341259204.author: a TripAdvisor user
341259204.reviewBody: We visited the Catedral de San Gervasio with a GoMexico tour last week (to Valladolid, Chichen Itza and a Cenote). I expected to see beautiful architecture, and did, but was surprised to find myself on the verge of tears during the presentation by our tour guide outside of the structure. The impressiveness of the structure itself combined with its history was enlightening and highly emotional. I will be sharing my experience with friends and family with hopes that they will also be inspired to visit this fascinating landmark.

339461927.name: Gorgeous
339461927.author: a TripAdvisor user
339461927.reviewBody: This is a magnificent cathedral with its signature double towers dominating the area.  The facade is lovely, with grand stonework and decorative patterns around the door and elsewhere.\n\nThe interior is cool and calm. It is relatively unadorned and this is in its favour. It has some nice features, including impressive statuary.

336114081.name: Impressive structure
336114081.author: a TripAdvisor user
336114081.reviewBody: Located across the street from the main town park.  Beautiful area to spend some time with a few good restaurants and shops that surround it.

335326468.name: A beautiful church
335326468.author: a TripAdvisor user
335326468.reviewBody: This church is on the main square of town. Architecture from the 1700s. Everything is original. It is still used as a church today. You will find many people stopping on their way to school or work to say a prayer. There is a donation box on the right side as you walk in that would be nice to put a couple of pesos in to help the church out. After you get some ice cream and enjoy the park walk across the street and take a step back in time.

334091542.name: Beautiful Cathedral - A Must See in Valladolid!
334091542.author: a TripAdvisor user
334091542.reviewBody:
The San Gervasio Cathedral is situated on the south side of Valladolid’s main square, overlooking the central park. 

The cathedral has beautiful and detailed architecture. I really enjoyed relaxing in Valladolid’s central park while admiring this church. The cathedral still holds services regularly and it is also interesting to sit in and observe one. 
In the evenings, the cathedral is lit up beautifully and makes for some great photos! 

I recommend checking out this cathedral when you’re in Valladolid. Make sure to wander inside as well!

333671872.name: Nothing exception!
333671872.author: a TripAdvisor user
333671872.reviewBody:
Hello,
It is one of the few things that I have hit Mexico .
externally is ancghe beautiful to see how the church , but the interior is poor and bare.
you can not remotely compare with the churches which are in Italy .

332418762.name: Not the Original
332418762.author: a TripAdvisor user
332418762.reviewBody: While this Cathedral is from the 1700s, it is not the original, but a rebuild after the church leader for the area had the original partial destroyed due to the sin of the locals.  It is still very lovely and is only open when services are going to take place.  The stain glass window above the entrance is lovely.

326488971.name: Just ok
326488971.author: a TripAdvisor user
326488971.reviewBody: The church at night with the lighting was nice. Nothing special about the inside. Something to look at while in town but nothing to go out of your way for. I think we would I have gotten more from it if we had a guide to tell us about the history.

326387387.name: Free so well worth a look
326387387.author: a TripAdvisor user
326387387.reviewBody: Interesting to wander around but I preferred the temple/fort more which I saw first but as its free might as well take a peak

316680538.name: Beautiful Historical Church
316680538.author: a TripAdvisor user
316680538.reviewBody: You can visit for sightseeing or go for a mass, as the church still operates today. We popped in for a few minutes \u2013 there were several homeless people outside, so maybe carry some extra pesos with you to help out the needy right outside the church.

315394104.name: You can breath history here.
315394104.author: a TripAdvisor user
315394104.reviewBody: This cathedral was completed in 1570 by The Franciscans. But, due the struggle between the Maya and the Spanish the church was desecrated by violence. So in 1702, it was destroyed and rebuilt. The church is considered chastised and is the only one whose main doors face north instead of west. \n\nDefinitely must visit if you\'re around.

313149074.name: wonderful discovery
313149074.author: a TripAdvisor user
313149074.reviewBody: For those who are religious or not this is a wonderful Cathedral to visit fully restored in this colonial town of Valladolid  exterior is stunning located in the center of town easily accessible  stunning ! interior is beautiful take in a mass all are welcome in Mexico religion is very important ! great for picture taking !!

309827344.name: A Traditional Mexican Church
309827344.author: a TripAdvisor user
309827344.reviewBody: We visited the Catedral de San Gervasio while on a tour to Chichen Itza.\nIt is always interesting to visit Cathedrals in Mexico. They are beautiful and very different from those in the United States. \nProbably the most apparent difference is the lifelike representations of Christ. In this instance he is in a glass coffin.

308358456.name: Beautiful Architecture
308358456.author: a TripAdvisor user
308358456.reviewBody: We were here after 5 pm so we got to see the beautiful architectural lights that gives to church a stunning look definitely worth to visit.

302603132.name: Beautiful city
302603132.author: a TripAdvisor user
302603132.reviewBody: Worth a seperate visit on its own but included in any trip to Chichen Itza ! Not really enough time on this tour to enjoy the city but visually beautiful and a real mexican experience with a fantastic cathederal    try and go on a seperate trip to experience it in full !

300777733.name: Decent attraction for an hour or less
300777733.author: a TripAdvisor user
300777733.reviewBody: The cathedral is pretty much what you\'d expect and nothing more.  It is not spectacular, but it is worth a stop if you are in the area. It is a small cathedral that has been kept up well and there is less touristy propaganda than at most destinations of this type in the Yucatan. The plaza across the street is pretty good for buying souvenirs and the bazaar down the road has several good options for cheap, authentic mexican food.

299383448.name: Cool Old Cathedral
299383448.author: a TripAdvisor user
299383448.reviewBody: My wife and I visited Valladolid and checked out the Cathedral de San Gervasio during a stop on a Chichen Itza tour.  The cathedral is stunning from an architectural perspective and stands like a giant among the colonial era village of Valladolid.  We only had 15 minutes to explore Valladolid a little before we had to continue to Chichen Itza.  I could have spent an hour just exploring this old church.

292245650.name: Lovely Cathedral
292245650.author: a TripAdvisor user
292245650.reviewBody: We weren\'t in Valladolid for long on our tour but we went to the Cathedral and I\'m glad we did because it is beautiful and at the centre of the town. A must see when in Valladolid

286705361.name: Beautiful!
286705361.author: a TripAdvisor user
286705361.reviewBody: This church/cathedral is located across the street from the main plaza/park in Valladolid. It is a beautiful building and you can wander inside as well. The ceiling inside is stunning. Church services still take place here (I am not sure of the schedule) but anyone is welcome to attend. There are also frequent weddings here in the evenings, which are interesting to watch and sit in on. The cathedral is lit up beautifully in the evenings as well. I recommend a visit here when in Valladolid.

280457886.name: Small primitive church
280457886.author: a TripAdvisor user
