280457886.reviewBody: Visited this little church during our excursion to Chichen Itza. The church opens at 4PM every day. Its an interesting building. But do not expect too much from it.

274051357.name: Over renovated
274051357.author: a TripAdvisor user
274051357.reviewBody: It is nice and I really liked it. You know one church is like the other. Jesus und angles everywhere.  If you are around go and check it out!

273197541.name: Beautiful facade yet stark inside
273197541.author: a TripAdvisor user
273197541.reviewBody: I was somewhat confused when visiting the City\'s main Cathedral off the main plaza, as all the tourist and historic signs refer to this as simply Iglesia de San Gervasio, rather than Catedral de San Gervasio.  Regardless, its beautiful and striking to view from the facade outside, especially across the street from the main park.  However, once inside it is very underwhelming and stark.  Not much to see, all statutes are small and dwarfed by their surroundings.  Worth a visit no less though.

254049388.name: A bit dull
254049388.author: a TripAdvisor user
254049388.reviewBody: Not much to see really, the outside was interesting. Nice and cool on a hot day but not overly interesting.

253211012.name: Cathederal by the main square.
253211012.author: a TripAdvisor user
253211012.reviewBody: Nice cathederal by the main square, looks nice lit up and night. Not too elaborate by OK, worth a look whilst walking around the square.

252422958.name: A bit different!!
252422958.author: a TripAdvisor user
252422958.reviewBody: I\'ve never seen such a morbid glass coffin with a statue of Christ dead in a Cathedral before!!!!  It\'s to the right of the altar. Quite unbelievable!!

251517888.name: Catedral de San Cervasio
251517888.author: a TripAdvisor user
251517888.reviewBody: Impressive and massive cathedral on the quiet main square  built before the pilgrims even landed in the United States

249881729.name: Incredibly at night
249881729.author: a TripAdvisor user
249881729.reviewBody: It\'s just stunning! \nRight near the center square, there is a lot to do and seen.  This monument towers from above and makes for excellent photo op!

247376211.name: Impressive
247376211.author: a TripAdvisor user
247376211.reviewBody: A beautiful cathedral with a great energy. I truly enjoyed taking part of the Christmas celebration and was impressed by the solidarity of the locals

244737371.name: Really beautiful when lit up at night
244737371.author: a TripAdvisor user
244737371.reviewBody: So many cathedrals in Mexico, it\'s hard to compare impartially. San Gervasio is really beautiful on the outside, especially at night.\nInternally, I found it a bit disappointing. A few old and sometimes gruesome statues which is the norm in Mexico, but it seems to lack something.\nMost cathedrals I visited inspired some kind of reverence, but this seemed a little more mundane. Maybe I am getting cathedral fatigue - every town seems to have a beauty!

242406818.name: If you come from Europe it\'s nothing special
242406818.author: a TripAdvisor user
242406818.reviewBody: One thing I have to say: when streets are deserted, the church is still open and full. For the rest, the outside is better than the inside, where you\'ll find a few quite recent statues of saints (200 yers old max) and that\'s it. Well I come from Italy, where we expect something more from churches...

239915238.name: Adorable
239915238.author: a TripAdvisor user
239915238.reviewBody: And inspirational place. Interesting and beautiful in the same time. Take a few minutes to think and pray.

237790993.name: Picturesque and historical
237790993.author: a TripAdvisor user
237790993.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral both inside and out. I was shocked that the stones had previously been a pyramid in the the town square. The park has a pretty fountain. Be prepared to pay if you need a restroom

235969666.author: a TripAdvisor user
235969666.reviewBody: The size of the structure is pretty impressive as well as the architecture . \nInterior decor is pretty creepy. They have a deceased Jesus in a glass encasement that\'s really creepy.

235800338.name: Wonderful
235800338.author: a TripAdvisor user
235800338.reviewBody: I stopped by on a recent trip to Ek Balam and was delighted by the ornate carvings throughout the chapel.  This is a truly beautiful church and is located on a very active square in Valladolid.  It is easy to spend an hour or two exploring the church and the surrounding area.  Interesting to say the least - much different than the cities on the coast.

231045254.name: Beautiful Piece of History
231045254.author: a TripAdvisor user
231045254.reviewBody:
The church is breathtakingly beautiful throughout the day and night.  The people and palms frame the scene ideally.  During the day, its age and life show in its gray weathered façade.   Long gone is the smooth surface that once covered the limestone brick structure.     

Pairs of palms and belfries, bells still hanging, frame the central stained glass window and giant wood door leads to the interior ministry.  A smooth yellow meter high wall sits beneath another meter high rod iron fence.  Open to the public, a stream of onlookers and worshipers file in to admire its beauty.  Some pray for help, others forgiveness or guidance; many simply walk the aisle to admire the beauty and history contained within.

At night its edges glow with life and history, demanding your attention – regardless of what is going on around you.  Whoever designed and installed the lighting was genius as it commands attention.  San Servacio distracted me from the pulsing beat of drums, mimicked by the male singers’ hips and the rhythmic crowds’ feet, yet amongst the chaos of Carnaval I still found myself engrossed with the peacefulness and beauty of the church.

216294294.name: Cathedral of Valladolid
216294294.author: a TripAdvisor user
216294294.reviewBody: Beautiful place. Cathedral of San Gervasio, an old church that was built in 1570 by the Franciscans, destroyed during the Maya/Spanish conflict, and later rebuilt.

214288779.name: A cathedral that makes an impact!
214288779.author: a TripAdvisor user
214288779.reviewBody: When visiting Valladolid make sure you visit the cathedral! Just standing before it will make an impact, especially when it\'s sunny (most of the time). When you enter the historic building you will notice there\'s more. Just by walking through the cathedral will leave a feeling you can\'t describe. It\'s out- and inner beauty together with the company of locals coming to pray is an overwhelming experience!

203988557.name: Lovely peaceful church
203988557.author: a TripAdvisor user
203988557.reviewBody: Stunning building which is very plain inside. Visted on a day when there was a walk to church. Wanted to leave a donation, but the box was quite hard to find.

192905157.name: Amazingly beautiful at night
192905157.author: a TripAdvisor user
192905157.reviewBody: This beautiful historic church is lit up at night and its lovely. You can see it better during the day but come back at night just to see it. The central park is really nice with unique seats and a relaxing feel day or night.

187955908.name: Beautiful
187955908.author: a TripAdvisor user
187955908.reviewBody: The church is beautiful.  The limestone of the church with the yellow of the exterior fence makes for an incredible picture.  Yes, there are beggars at the door, but they will not hurt you!  If you don\'t want to donate to them, then just keep walking, or put in a buck or two and change the course of their day.  There is a lot of history here, the door faces the wrong way as punishment for violence.  Be sure to ask many questions to your guide.  You will be surprised.

183915079.name: Beautiful!
183915079.author: a TripAdvisor user
183915079.reviewBody: This is a wonderful old church.  The interior is amazingly simple for a Catholic church, but at the same time I thought it was beautiful and peaceful.

175966426.name: The culture.
175966426.author: a TripAdvisor user
175966426.reviewBody: This church is simple and i think is a good representation about the culture in this region of mexico.  The sunset on this place is really delicious.

169522216.name: Not Impressed!
169522216.author: a TripAdvisor user
169522216.reviewBody: I was really looking forward to seeing the Catedral de San Gervasio in Valladolid, as we stopped there on the way back to our hotel from a long day-trip to Chichen Itza.  The outside was fairly impressive, but there are beggars at the door, which is a bit unnerving and unexpected.  The inside was a terrible disappointment.  There are these ridiculous cheap-looking religious statues.  One looked like a mannequin with a cheap brown curly wig on it.  At first I thought it was some obscure saint that I had never heard of but the plaque said "Jesus of Nazareth".  Go figure, I missed the resemblance.  Another was an old guy wearing a big gold crown holding a mini-Jesus shrouded in blood and thorns with a big bird on the top of the crown.  It was titled "The Trilogy".  Not impressed, and I was actually rather uncomfortable being there, because it was a terrible impression of Christianity.  I wanted to respectfully light a candle but the only place I could find was a coin-operated light bulb machine with fake red candle holders made of light bulbs.  I popped a coin in, a light came on, I laughed quietly, and walked out.  It\'s a travesty that this church played a role in how the Spanish destroyed the Mayan culture in the 1500\'s.  In the end, that\'s all I\'ll remember about the place.

167412930.name: A piece of history
167412930.author: a TripAdvisor user
167412930.reviewBody:
It's part of the history of Mexico and the Spanish colonialism, a place to visit and admire, on the walls of the cathedral and the surrounding houses you can appreciate stones that the Spanish took from the Mayan pyramids to build this colonial cathedral.
It's a place that i would recommend to visit.
The cathedral was completed in 1570 by The Franciscans. But, due the struggle between the Maya and the Spanish the church was desecrated by violence. So in 1702, it was destroyed and rebuilt. The church is considered chastised and is the only one whose main doors face north instead of west.
Regarding the beggars at the door, they are not going to do anything to you, just donate a dollar or two, the same that you donate to Africa or others poor countries and just make a different day for this guys.

163808147.name: Interesting
163808147.author: a TripAdvisor user
163808147.reviewBody: Very nice to look at from the outside. The inside is far less impressive. Built in 1570 by monks. Entrance has beggars looking for money.

653229525.name: Beautiful Church
653229525.author: a TripAdvisor user
653229525.reviewBody: Make a detour, or make a special trip, to see this amazing church.  In the middle of nowhere, I\'ve never seen anything like this.  It\'s only 20 minutes by car from Valladolid, or on the way to Chichen Itza.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

621584296.name: Stunning architecture and incredible paintings
621584296.author: a TripAdvisor user
621584296.reviewBody: What charmed me the most was the drawings and every painting that composes all the architecture of the place. It is well worth knowing and enjoying this wonderful and beautiful church.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

589248155.name: Well worth a side trip from Vallodolid and it\u2019s free.
589248155.author: a TripAdvisor user
589248155.reviewBody: This church is highly attractive both inside and outside, with unusual decorative motifs. Quite a work of art! Restoration in the baptismal font area was underway when we were there. The church has been mostly, and lovingly restored. Unfortunately, there was no explanatory material in Spanish or English. The town area around it has also been restored, with colorful buildings, an attractive plaza, a red bed and breakfast, a nice colorful public library and town hall. People obviously take pride in their pleasant and attractive town with the church as its centerpiece.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

561771754.name: A wonderful, unexpected, detour
561771754.author: a TripAdvisor user
561771754.reviewBody:
We had hired a private driver, Manuel Puc, of Maya Adventure Taxi Tours, to take us early morning from Valladolid to Chitchen
Itza, and thus miss the huge crowds who arrive on buses about
noon from Cancun.  Manuel was exemplary in every way.  On return he spontaneously took us slightly off route to this wonderful and utterly unique church in this sleepy Mexican town.
Great trip--with complimentary water and delicious local (with peel) fruit thrown in.  Manuel a fount of information too.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

553017817.name: If you enjoy looking at history this is for you
553017817.author: a TripAdvisor user
553017817.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful! And while I was there after mass they marched around the square singing and playing instruments. Wonderful.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

529066084.name: Excellent
529066084.author: a TripAdvisor user
529066084.reviewBody: We decided to make a detour on our journey into Valladolid and called into Uayma to see the church. Spectacular painted walls, lovely to walk round and have no other tourists around. Real rural Mexico.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

503841548.name: Nice place
503841548.author: a TripAdvisor user
503841548.reviewBody: Great local history, si ce the conquiste! Well preserved, there is a free night tour by a local mayan anthropologist

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

494375376.name: A Delightful Surprise
494375376.author: a TripAdvisor user
494375376.reviewBody: We travel to the Yucatan annually. This year we really didn\'t plan much and decided to just wander. We were in Valladolid and wandered into Uayma. I had never heard of this church. It\'s  d\u00e9cor is unlike any other church that I have seen in the Yucatan. We were blown away by the uniqueness and went inside. It was amazing!  We were only there for a short time, but it made  quite an impression. It is only 20 minutes from Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

465610495.name: A unique and interesting site
465610495.author: a TripAdvisor user
465610495.reviewBody: Built in 1646 this church was destroyed during the Caste Wars. Restoration was early 2000s and it opened in 2004.\nIt is unlike anything I have seen. Located in the quiet village of Uayman\' a short drive from Valladolid.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

464853456.name: Beautiful Temple
464853456.author: a TripAdvisor user
464853456.reviewBody: Unique and charming, a short drive from Valladolid.  This Iglesia is not like any you will see in the region.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

464332696.name: Amazingly different historic church
464332696.author: a TripAdvisor user
464332696.reviewBody: If you have an interest in historic Mexican churches, do not miss this one. We\'ve seen dozens of churches across the country, but none like this. Built around 1542, it is exquisitely unique.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

451700349.name: Beautiful!
451700349.author: a TripAdvisor user
451700349.reviewBody: What a cute little town with a amazing piece of history! Loved it. I showed up during 12pm mass (on a Thursday) and when it was over they set off firecrackers while singing and playing instruments around the park. I\'m not a religious person but I\'d be a fool to not see the beauty in it all.....Such a wonderful culture.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

436273456.name: Beautiful
436273456.author: a TripAdvisor user
436273456.reviewBody: The evening  lite show was well done and it explains the history of the convent/building and some of the Mayan history.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

356673496.name: Beautiful Different Church Near Valladolid
356673496.author: a TripAdvisor user
356673496.reviewBody: We stopped by this lovely church on our way from Valladolid to Cancun. It is a lovely 15-30 minute stop if the building is closed. Signs indicate the chapel exterior is being renovated. How far they were in the process, I cannot say as we had never visited before. From pictures, this chapel changes its look slightly in color scheme periodically while maintaining the historic integrity of the mosaics. \n\nThe drive is mainly on country roads, a couple of which were a bit rough. Nothing terrible and nothing that risks your rental car. During the time of our visit, there was not much going on around the church but I suppose this could be just the day we were there. (late Sunday afternoon) After other smaller towns we have visited, we were surprised there was no market or family gathering in the zocolo across the street. Perhaps they were all in nearby Valladolid for the larger Sunday markets.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

352662100.name: Quaint Maya town and spectacular church
352662100.author: a TripAdvisor user
352662100.reviewBody:
On a roadtrip though the Yucatan, my traveling companion and I decided to check out the town of Uayma (pronounced WHY-mah), one of the towns that make up the Pueblos Magicos (Magical Pueblos) a select group of villages of cultural and/or historical significance. 

The town was well off the beaten path, the signs leading to it covered with jungle vines, but truly no more than 15 km from nearby Valladolid. But getting there was half the fun, tooling about in our tiny rental car on the back country roads, passing handicraft stalls and coconut vendors. 

Sneeze and you might miss the turnoff, but once we arrived, we were rewarded with one of the most spectacular churches— and the centerpiece of the town— we had seen in our entire journey. This alone is worth a 20 minute detour to or from Valladolid.

According to Wikipedia, "The church was built originally by the Spaniards to enforce their culture in Uayma, which was at the time an important Mayan center. Stones from nearby Mayan temples (including Chichen Itza) were used to build the church, some of which can be seen on the facade.”

The reddish facade is adorned with beautiful white and blue rosettes unlike anything we’d seen in our travels. We had no way of knowing if they represented a traditional Maya design or had some Spanish influence. Regardless, the rosettes resembled many Mudejar designs seen largely in Andalusian architecture. With no one to guide us except a stray dog, we enjoyed exploring the church and were intrigued by a nearby house named the Casa de los Pianos. A local explained it was occasionally rented, often for tv and film productions. Neat!

Uayma is a great little village to explore if you enjoy admiring the local architecture. You can easily combine it with a trip to Valladolid, or on your way to/from Chichen Itza.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

344455689.name: A hidden colonial gem
344455689.author: a TripAdvisor user
344455689.reviewBody: The Mayan town of Uayma is very  secluded in the outskirts of Valladolid and is surunded by jungle. It can be reached by car or taxi. This little town has one of the most beautiful churches called " Convento de Santiago" for the lovers of history and colonial architecture this small convent/church is just beautiful to look at and to spend time contemplating the internal colour and design which is very different from the usual colonial churches. The town is very tranquil and there are no restaurants. there is however a bakery but it is not open all the time. you can bring your own food and sit and eat at the central plaza or park. People are friendly. If you travel towards Chichen Itza or Merida you can have a 30 min.to one hour detour to visit this hidden gem.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y Ex Convento de Santiago Domingo

657259026.name: Historical murals
657259026.author: a TripAdvisor user
657259026.reviewBody: This site has large murals that depict the history of the area around Valladolid. They are full of symbolism of Mayan origin and Spanish origin. Take the time to really study them. Beautiful work.

657071085.name: Great murals
657071085.author: a TripAdvisor user
657071085.reviewBody: We love the tradition of murals in Mexico. These were quite interesting. Worth a visit and easy to find in the main square.

647733784.name: Do go upstairs to see the murals
647733784.author: a TripAdvisor user
647733784.reviewBody: It is worth entering the building for a quick look at the four murals that summarize the history of Mexico. Also look out the balconies for nice views of the main square.

647184039.name: A quick visit here is par for course. 1 hour and you\'ll know a lot more of this city.
647184039.author: a TripAdvisor user
647184039.reviewBody: I enjoyed viewing the paintings. Free admission to this museum. With the descriptions of where this town came from is apparent in the paintings.

644956280.name: Tapestry-like murals
644956280.author: a TripAdvisor user
644956280.reviewBody: The murals here in the National Palace are simply stunning. They display informative pieces of Mexican history in a beautiful tapestry-like format. The attention to detail is meticulous and awe-striking. It is somewhat of a hidden-gem that I would recommend to anyone. They also have a number of plaques that are translated into English in which one can educate oneself in regards to these question-spurring paintings.

635121046.name: Brilliant
635121046.author: a TripAdvisor user
635121046.reviewBody: I loved every bit of being there. Such a rich place to see. The 4 huge painting on the second floor are ridiculously captivating.

631474813.name: History on the wall
631474813.author: a TripAdvisor user
631474813.reviewBody: It is great to see history painted on the pictures.\nMuch better if you have a guide explaining what is in the pictures.

629772253.name: Check it out
629772253.author: a TripAdvisor user
629772253.reviewBody: Like many other people we were on a brief stop on our tour. We had about 40 mins to look around Valladolid and we stopped here to admire the beautiful paintings/morals. Very close to the main plaza.

626082331.name: Intresting !
626082331.author: a TripAdvisor user
626082331.reviewBody: If stralling through the city worth going up stairs to see the building and the gallery, with what I would call bombastic paintings.

618397738.name: Nice place but nothing really impressive
618397738.author: a TripAdvisor user
618397738.reviewBody: This museum was nice and clean but not much was really there. Nice for a few minutes  of walk but not so special at all\n\nMuzeum takie sobie, nic specjalnego, kilka murali i to wszystko. Mo\u017cna zobaczy\u0107 jak ma si\u0119 chwil\u0119 ale wra\u017cenia jakiego\u015b wielkiego nie robi.

614950474.name: Large paintings, big doors overlooking plaza
614950474.author: a TripAdvisor user
614950474.reviewBody: We were only given 45 mins to explore downtown Valladolid so we wasted little time and immediately went in search of the Palacio Municipal. I googled the area prior to the trip so I knew which way to go. While looking for the entrance, we passed by a face cutout photo board in front of the Tourism Information office so we stopped briefly for a photo. I remember reading that the Palacio Municipal is just next door but we did not see any sign outside. We went in and despite the language barrier managed to inform the woman at the desk that we wanted to go upstairs. Admission is free.\n\nThe large colourful paintings are the main attraction here. There are four of them displayed in the 2nd floor gallery, each one an interesting depiction of Valladolid\u2019s rich history from pre-Hispanic era to early-20th century, with accompanying bilingual (Spanish and English) info panel. After looking at the paintings, be sure to peek out the big open doors for a sweeping view of the plaza. We stayed here only a few minutes then we walked to our next destination, Catedral de San Servacio.

573315841.name: it\'s absolutly worth comming here
573315841.author: a TripAdvisor user
573315841.reviewBody: If you want to feed your brain, this is the place to come.\nBesides the colonial style in Valladolid, here you\'ll get a different style of culture; it\'s more local.\nIt\'s good to open your mind

569317378.name: Beautiful Murals
569317378.author: a TripAdvisor user
569317378.reviewBody: This artistic wonder is right on the main plaza. It only takes a few minutes but it is worth it to see these magnificent murals.

567331837.name: Interesting Place
567331837.author: a TripAdvisor user
567331837.reviewBody: You can learn a lot about the history of the area here.  Just off city center - stop for a visit.  No fee  . . .

561575189.name: Learn about Valladolid history
561575189.author: a TripAdvisor user
561575189.reviewBody: There is a small museum and a gallery containing several large paintings overlooking the main square, just above the tourist information office. The peaceful atmosphere of present-day Valladolid belies a turbulent history.

558466080.name: Expressive Murals
558466080.author: a TripAdvisor user
558466080.reviewBody: It is free!  A broad presentation of civic life in Valladolid since its Maya beginnings through today.  The 2nd floor murals are rich and vivid - it is evident that Valladolid is proud of its heritage and place in Mexican history.  Our visit was brief and gave us an overview of the highlights and traditions of this pueblo magico!

551168426.name: Fascinating in-depth walking tour of the 2nd floor murals and more
551168426.author: a TripAdvisor user
551168426.reviewBody:
We took the free walking tour that leaves nightly from the visitors center. We’d seen several of the sights already, but we wanted to see the four murals on the second floor of the Palácio Municipal. Our tour guide was amazing. He spent 40 minutes going through the deep details of these beautiful murals, giving a college-level minicourse on the history, religion, and culture of the Toltecs, Mayans, Conquistadors, and the development of the city—and pushing the limits of my Spanish comprehension. Then we got another 20 minutes on the history of the cathedral. 

Some of my takeaways: 
•	The more than 3000 scattered around the Yucatan cenotes were created by a 30-meter meteorite shattering the soft limestone and sending most of the rivers underground. 
•	The area had no silver, gold, or other metals—but salt was mined. Other ancient Mayan industries included corn, textiles, and sisal fiber (from the maguey plant also used to make tequila for rope-making).
•	How Mayan prophecies about the coming of the white men may have led to the abandonment of their cities, requiring the Spanish to import black slaves from Cuba. 
•	The Mayan calendar end date of December 21, 2012 was not a false prediction of the end of the world; it was merely the start of the next cycle.
•	The church on the main square is the only church in the Yucatan to face north. All others face east, toward Rome.
Strongly recommended if you have at least intermediate Spanish. The tour had two more stops, but we’d seen both on our own and we were hungry, so we thanked the guide profusely and dropped off to go find dinner on the square.

533616504.name: Short, interesting visit!
533616504.author: a TripAdvisor user
533616504.reviewBody: Stop by the Visitor\'s Center a few doors down to confirm the location.  Interesting murals with descriptions.  Good for a short visit.

502556871.name: In the Z\u00f3calo area
502556871.author: a TripAdvisor user
502556871.reviewBody: Very helpful police officers, (women)\u00a1 it has the historic insights, nice to see when walking this area, you can take the tour at night

497741592.name: great place to stop by
497741592.author: a TripAdvisor user
497741592.reviewBody: if you have extra time on your itinerary to by valladolid and go to the second floor of the town hall to see the painting. \n\nthe park and surrounding is very typical of colonial cities.

483503045.name: Nice building
483503045.author: a TripAdvisor user
483503045.reviewBody: Not much decorations for the tourists but everything was made with great intentions. We felt very comfortable when we walked through it.

472909627.name: VERY NICE COLONIAL CENTER PIECE OF VALLADOLID
472909627.author: a TripAdvisor user
472909627.reviewBody: You must visit the Palacio  it has really interesting exhibits and displays. Theres also a really nice Library with lottsa interesting books. Great starting place in the center of town across from Central Park

470394206.name: Very interesting murals depicting Mayan and Mexican history plus a tourist information center on the ground floor.
470394206.author: a TripAdvisor user
470394206.reviewBody: A light and airy room filled with murals depicting Mexican/Mayan history. Downstairs there is the tourist office which seems to be open all day and evening - with maps and information. Good place to start off.

467703670.name: Excellent Starting Point for Valladolid
467703670.author: a TripAdvisor user
467703670.reviewBody: This municipal office right on the main square is a great place to start your explorations of Valladolid. On the main floor is a tourist office with English speaking staff who will give you a map of the city and any directions you may need. They were very helpful and friendly.\nThere are also pictures of many of the noteable stops in the city. Upstairs is a series of murals depicting the history.

461854784.name: Lovely murals upstairs
461854784.author: a TripAdvisor user
461854784.reviewBody: Friendly place to see how the government works and the display of murals showing historical information.  The 4 murals are quite lovely with both Spanish and English translations.

455953315.name: Kalaidoscope of art, history, culture that\'s easy to absorb
455953315.author: a TripAdvisor user
455953315.reviewBody: It expanded my horizons on Mexican culture and history.  Rooms clean and airy.  Very easy to take in... It would be good to allow 60-90 minutes.

424940833.name: Mexico history in arts
424940833.author: a TripAdvisor user
424940833.reviewBody: Well worth the visit to connect with Mexican art, culture, history and beauty.\n\nTakes lots of pictures.

392670442.name: Wonderful murals
392670442.author: a TripAdvisor user
392670442.reviewBody: This is an excellent free attraction right off the main square. Go upstairs and read the description of the murals to get a great summary of local Mayan and Mexican history.

369039614.name: Must see the historical murals if you visit Valladolid
369039614.author: a TripAdvisor user
369039614.reviewBody: I always suggest this place for visitors to Valladolid to get an artistic view of the history of the city.  Nice view of the plaza from the second floor too.

363842215.name: Interesting stop...
363842215.author: a TripAdvisor user
363842215.reviewBody: If you spend a couple of days in Valladolid- which you should-this colonial building on the square provides a nice sidetrip. Just walk in by the nonchalant attendant and token police officer with a wave and "buenas tardes" and up a winding marble staircase to a wide hall lined with historical murals. An interesting timeline illustrates the importance of Valladolid in Mexican history from the Caste War to the Mexican Revolution. Open balconies provide beautiful vistas over the square especially in the evening with Mayan families and lovers taking an after-dinner "paseo". And it\'s free!

358745986.name: Great location!
358745986.author: a TripAdvisor user
358745986.reviewBody: We stopped here after lunch to check out the small gallery on the main floor, and the murals and the view of the Cathedral and park from the upper floor.  It was an interesting place to make a quick stop!

358248460.name: Great Gallery on First Floor
358248460.author: a TripAdvisor user
358248460.reviewBody: We climbed the unmarked stairs to The Gallery of History. The several huge Murals told the story of Valladolid wonderfully well. Would not have found it but for Toon from Mexigo Tours tipping us off! Well worth a visit!

356799044.name: History
356799044.author: a TripAdvisor user
356799044.reviewBody: The paintings of Manuel Salazar are superb!  The colors are brilliant and depict arrival of the Spanish,  Maya resistance and eventaul colonization of the area.  English explanation of each painting very helpful in understanding his art.

354604772.name: great murals
354604772.author: a TripAdvisor user
354604772.reviewBody: Building is interesting from the outside and as the entrance is free it is worth to pop in. First, there is a tourist office if you might need something, Second, to see great picturesque murals. And plus, climb up for the view of the nearby square - park.

345267909.name: Worth a visit for the view of the Cathedral and Plaza
345267909.author: a TripAdvisor user
345267909.reviewBody: Go up to the second floor to see the murals that cover the walls in the room. The stairs are old and require some caution to prevent a fall. The view from the doors looking out to the plaza and cathedral is exceptional.

342484041.name: Masterclass in history
342484041.author: a TripAdvisor user
342484041.reviewBody: Superb historical  paintings, well presented written historical events , fantastic collection of factual historical information in English and  Spanish.  It\'s located at the heart of the city in Valladolid. Very close by it\'s the cathedral, lovely park, markets and great restaurants.entry is free.

334108439.name: The modern history of the Mayan People in four murals
334108439.author: a TripAdvisor user
334108439.reviewBody: On the second floor of city hall is the Salon de los Murales... four large murals painted on canvas and hung from the walls. The paintings are not great art but they are very powerful art. Showing, in sequence, the Mayan world and life before the Spanish came. If you look closely you can see the coming Spanish ships in the sastun of the shaman as he sees into the future. The second mural shows the treatment of the Maya under the Spanish rule. While the third mural shows the revolt of the Maya (one of many reveolts). The last shows the 1910 Revolution, Pluse from the gallery windows there is a great view of the parque principal and the church.

333175876.name: Beautiful Building! Check out the Murals and Views from the Second Floor!
333175876.author: a TripAdvisor user
333175876.reviewBody:
The Palacio Municipal is a beautiful colonial building situated on the east side of Valladolid’s central square. It houses the city’s government offices. 

I recommend climbing the stairs to the second floor (it is free), where you will find some lovely murals painted by a local artist along with a row of windows overlooking the central square, providing great panoramic views!

I really enjoyed my time here.

326387566.name: Beautiful murals
326387566.author: a TripAdvisor user
326387566.reviewBody: Murals are amazing and it is free to pop upstairs to take a look which I was so glad I did as I think they are stunning. There are three murals and I preferred the first two.

308575003.name: A fantastic pit stop
308575003.author: a TripAdvisor user
308575003.reviewBody: Like many Palacios across the Yucatan, Valladolid\'s features majestic historical paintings.  I was impressed by the ones in the front room, depicting the Spanish conquest on the maya-yucatecos in four tableaux.  My sons were 6 and 9 at the time I believe, and I remember how easy it made it for them to understand the conquest as a giant storyboard.  The park is lovely, the famous mayan bee honey (distinctive taste, try it) is available here sometimes, check out the vendors!  If you land in Cancun and are on your way to Yucatan, it\'s worth making Valladolid a one night stop.  There hotels right in the zocalo, I believe the one we stayed at a couple of times is called Maria de la Luz.  Very well priced, clean, it has a pool, indoor gated parking, and a great breakfast buffet Yucatan style.

305761036.name: See the murals on the second floor
305761036.author: a TripAdvisor user
305761036.reviewBody: Four very powerful murals show Mayan life before and after the arrival of the Spanish conquistadores. These are not great art but are very powerful. The first two, in particular, show details of what Mayan life like.

258433840.name: Nice park to hang out in
258433840.author: a TripAdvisor user
258433840.reviewBody: Like every other Mexican town/city - there\'s a park just like this one next to a big church.  Not much different except the frog statues in the center fountain. \nThe vendors are a little more aggressive here - those old ladies know how to work it.... Best to have a pocket full of small pesos to hand out

238738909.name: interior and exterior are beautiful
238738909.author: a TripAdvisor user
238738909.reviewBody: I like best the night viisit walk upstairs and enjoy the mural but also the view of the illuminated park and cathedral

201860545.name: Very good overview of the history of this pretty colonial city
201860545.author: a TripAdvisor user
201860545.reviewBody: Interesting to read up on the history of this pretty colonial city.  I was enchanted with the architecture of the colonial buildings her: soaring ceilings with the huge log rafters and the beautifully crafted double doors.  Not always a peaceful history, by any means, but the Municipal Building gives an interesting overview of it.

175967723.name: Pretty building.
175967723.author: a TripAdvisor user
175967723.reviewBody: Pretty building but I couldn\u00b4t go inside. On the left block, at the end of the main square, just 10 meters, infront of the food market,  is located an ancient Icecream shop attended for beautiful lady who sells natural flavors. Ask about the smoothies.

647734469.name: Nice local museum
647734469.author: a TripAdvisor user
647734469.reviewBody: If you happen to pass by this museum, do stop in.   The exhibits are interesting and I especially liked the shaman altars.  Enjoy a sit in the small square out of the side door.

644954851.name: Stunning murals
644954851.author: a TripAdvisor user
644954851.reviewBody: The murals in the Museo de San Roque are absolutely incredible. The murals display Mexican history in a beautiful tapestry-like format. The attention to detail is meticulous and awe-striking. It is somewhat of a hidden-gem that I would recommend to anyone.

636738586.name: Wonderful murals of Mayan history
636738586.author: a TripAdvisor user
636738586.reviewBody: This museum is small, and by far the most interesting part is the huge murals depicting Mayan history.  This is located on the square, and is well-worth a short visit.

606156308.name: Hidden gem
606156308.author: a TripAdvisor user
606156308.reviewBody: A lot more to this place than meets the eye, and the few of you who will fully explore the place will receive many surprises. Great little spot.

575470799.name: Well worth a visit
575470799.author: a TripAdvisor user
575470799.reviewBody: Tiny but perfect museum of the pre-historic, ancient, medieval and modern history of San Roque. Most of the exhibits are labelled in Spanish and English. A lot of astonishing archaeological finds on display.All beautifully presented. Free entry

574418658.name: Nice place for a quick stop
574418658.author: a TripAdvisor user
574418658.reviewBody: Has some interesting artifacts and information about the history of the area. Small, easy to get through quickly.

572040518.name: very nice local history of the mayan culture
572040518.author: a TripAdvisor user
572040518.reviewBody: just takes a short time to view the exhibits here depicting the Mayan Culture so prevalent in this Mayan Cultural city

569791570.name: Beautiful Old Building - Don\'t Forget to Look Up
569791570.author: a TripAdvisor user
569791570.reviewBody:
We just happened to stumble upon this beautiful old mysterious building.
It appears (based off the poor translation of the only sign in English) is it use to be a Hospital.  A very prominent one from what the sign tries to translate.  The building appears to hold several pieces of artifacts that have been found all around Valladolid and the nearby ruins.  Because these signs next to the artifacts are not in English, we were unsure of what they said.  I could have translated on my phone, but just didn't take the time. I will be going back in 7 months so I will for sure take the time and translate.

The building itself is beautiful.  The outline of it on the outside is just so pretty.  The inside ceiling is wonderful.  Please don't forget to look up!

Be sure to take time and visit.  I can only imagine what the true history of this building and the courtyard must be.  I would imagine it's fascinating.  I tried to look information up on the internet but found practically nothing about it.

Stop by and check it out, let your imagination run wild with it's own history lesson.  And don't forget to look up.

567966302.name: A bit frustrating
567966302.author: a TripAdvisor user
567966302.reviewBody: the museum should have been a fascinating place to spend about an hour discovering the history of Valladolid. There were lots of exhibits but the explanations were all uni-lingual in Spanish. I know I should make more effort to learn the local language but it was frustrating not to get much incline about the importance of each exhibit.

541641717.name: Nice for a quick visit
541641717.author: a TripAdvisor user
541641717.reviewBody: This is a small museum in downtown Valladolid.  There is free admission, just sign the guest book.\n\nNot too many exhibits, but the courtyard is pretty. Bathrooms were not functioning.

503346952.name: Better take it in the after noon
503346952.author: a TripAdvisor user
503346952.reviewBody: Go to the tourist infirmation area, a guide will tell you all the history of the place, very recommended go with water, you will walk a lot

484778236.name: Worthwhile to visit and learn about local history.
484778236.author: a TripAdvisor user
484778236.reviewBody: Free to visit and nice to stroll through artifacts about local history. Don\'t forget to spend few minutes in a small beautiful park which is a part of the facility.

477486441.name: Nice stop while in town
477486441.author: a TripAdvisor user
477486441.reviewBody: Small museum that has some nice artifacts.  Biggest problem is lack of organization, with second problem is lack of maintenance.  Seems to be trying to tell the story of the history of the town, but can\'t really get the information across.\n\nCould use much better signage, even if in spanish.  Would also liked to have had some more history of the building, which appears to have been a convent.

433805596.name: Small museum downtown Valladolid
433805596.author: a TripAdvisor user
433805596.reviewBody: This is a small museum, one large room, with several items from the locality.  Not much signage.  Worth the price, which is free.

427444431.name: Small Museum, Big History
427444431.author: a TripAdvisor user
427444431.reviewBody: Although Spanish is necessary in order to be able to read all the exhibits we still enjoyed our visit and were able to piece together some of the history from the graphics.  I wouldn\'t pay much to visit here but it was a nice free stop on our day in Valladolid.

394677312.name: Beautiful Historic Representation
394677312.author: a TripAdvisor user
394677312.reviewBody: Like so many of the public buildings throughout Mexico, they are adorned with artistic representations of the country\'s history paying homage to their indigenous roots and struggles against oppressive colonial governments and ruling elites.  i wish it were only so though much has improved in my nearly 50 years of visiting Mexico.   This is a fine example The incomplete achievement of their dreams is witnessed by the periodic unrest (well beyond the narco wars) and the migration of many to the US peak volumes of the work ahead.  \n\nHaving traveled to more than 100 countries around the world, Mexico remains my favorite.  The people with their considerable regional cultural variation, the food, the sites and the varied geopgraphy make this an extraordinary place.

358251367.name: Everything in Spanish so not user friendly
358251367.author: a TripAdvisor user
358251367.reviewBody: Have visited many museums in Mexico and this one was very average. Very few exhibits and all labelled (if at all)in Spanish.\nDisappointing!

353701304.name: Tiny Museum
353701304.author: a TripAdvisor user
353701304.reviewBody: Spanish is necessary to fully appreciate this museum. They have fragments of Mayan artifacts but the best part for us was the staff/guard? who explained some of the present-day Mayan traditions. He was clear enough that we could follow him in our basic Spanish.

347203483.name: Good Yucatan history
347203483.author: a TripAdvisor user
347203483.reviewBody: If you read Spanish well, this museum is a fount of information about the history of the peninsula.  If they did a translation of the information panels, it would be a great help to English-only folks.

345434882.name: Free and Informative, Worth a stop!
345434882.author: a TripAdvisor user
345434882.reviewBody: This small but informative museum gives a lot of information on the history of Valladolid. It is interesting to see the diorama of the original boundaries and layout of the town. There\'s a lovely nice vessel from the small town up the road (Uayma) that is nicely preserved as well as some more modern but interesting colorized art prints of the town. We found the small park-like entrance restful and apparently they sometimes have concerts or small presentations there as well. We stayed a little over an hour but I took lots and lots of photos and my husband read every single sign. Probably most would be there under an hour so it\'s easy to fit it in with a trip to Cenote Zaci which is right up the street.

345268580.name: local museum
345268580.author: a TripAdvisor user
345268580.reviewBody: The original structure is quite lovely and was originally a church. The exhibits leave a bit to be desired except for the models of Valladolid.

290923372.name: Free entrance and plenty of information on this area of the Yucatan
290923372.author: a TripAdvisor user
290923372.reviewBody: So much information is provided on this area of the Yucatan, on the city of Valladolid and on the local customs: from the time of the first pirates to the present time. The information is easy to read. The attention at the entrance is very courteous and the museum is well maintained. You may want to count on more than one hour to read all the information provided.

273200399.name: Interesting regional museum of Valladolid - Spanish is a must
273200399.author: a TripAdvisor user
273200399.reviewBody: Inside this former church is the now present regional museum of Valladolid.  It covers the history of the prehistory people to present day.  There are over a dozen small exhibits ranging from local aquatic life, to maize and tools used by the indigenous, to murals depicting the political development of the modern era.  In my opinion, the museum would be of more appeal to history buffs versus casual tourists.  I personally found it enjoyable and the staff were very accommodating and helpful.  You must be able to read Spanish or have a good camera translation app on your iphone, like Word Lens.

266717699.name: Interesting local history, but you need to read Spanish
266717699.author: a TripAdvisor user
266717699.reviewBody: Interesting details about this area about the Yucatan - history, culture, politics.   Spanish language only.  Small, easy to get through in a short period of time, free, and near to the lovely Cenote Zaci in the middle of Valladolid.

248241117.name: Sublime Mexican Art at Museo de San Roque
248241117.author: a TripAdvisor user
248241117.reviewBody:
This church-turned-museum is centrally located between Calles 38 and 40 and from the second floor has wonderful views overlooking the Vallodolid zocola.

If you adore art and architecture as much as I do, you'll appreciate this small but high-impact museum featuring a number of explosive, historical paintings by Mexican artists.

The art, right across Mexico, thrilled and delighted me. I had no idea it was so prolific, so intense, so historical, so intrinsically artistic and so compelling.

The Museo de San Roque offers another insight into Mexican culture with these dramatic and large-scale works.

Our Mexican guide, Linda, explained the art works and their historical and cultural significance to us and this made it all the more meaningful. 

Don't miss this enchanting museo in the heart of Vallodolid.

238319267.name: Amateur hour
238319267.author: a TripAdvisor user
238319267.reviewBody: This tiny museum, located in a former church, is charming but amateurish, but nonetheless worth a visit, as it is very obviously a labor of local love.

662249611.name: Chocolate
662249611.author: a TripAdvisor user
662249611.reviewBody: It is a nice, clean, air-conditioned store. Because it is slightly different owner from the store in Merida (Ki Xocholatl) Some of the products are the same, but they have a wider selection. Great chocolate

657060283.name: Great knowledge tour of Chocolate
657060283.author: a TripAdvisor user
657060283.reviewBody: Extensive tour concerning history of Chocolate in the mayan way of life and Chocolate in Europe. Very interesting.  Samples in the store

647185008.name: Chocolate store ! Free samples
647185008.author: a TripAdvisor user
647185008.reviewBody: I had to stop in here while visiting Valladolid. After all.... they had chocolate! With a small gift shop also there inside the store, one can bring back a little bit of the history that makes this place wonderful.

657254457.name: A must stop
657254457.author: a TripAdvisor user
657254457.reviewBody: You really should visit the mercado in Valladolid. This is the place to buy things grown and made by the locals. You can find just about anything for a good price, breads, meats, belts, purses, honey, vanilla, vegetables, flowers. Also, you can get full meals, made by the local vendors.

650369092.name: Fantastic
650369092.author: a TripAdvisor user
650369092.reviewBody: We went ther late morning. Still lot of fresh food (meat and vegetables). We has lunch near the entrance with absolutely the best panuchois and salbutes ever had in our life. As well as empanadas de queso. Superb food at an extremely cheap price. Need to visit it. Also biscuits and cocoa desserts in the vegetable market are were delicious.

606495974.name: Nice & lovely
606495974.author: a TripAdvisor user
606495974.reviewBody:
Going to the Mercado was a really nice experience.
Is a small place, however you can find a lot of interest thing.
Real mexican food, toys and sweets. I loved all regional items I found.
For sure a nice and lovely expereince I will repeat in the future.

577658436.name: a most authentic experience
577658436.author: a TripAdvisor user
577658436.reviewBody: A true mexican experience! This mercado has a wealth of products not even seen in the main mercado in Merida. When we were here, may 2018, melons not usually seen, numerous ricados ( dry rubs used in the cuisine of the yucatan) longaniza (local dry sausage) to name just a few. A real treat for all the family to experience.

572969576.name: Great Plants of all kinds at this Market!
572969576.author: a TripAdvisor user
572969576.reviewBody: My husband and I live in Tulum and have been looking for fruit trees that are already bearing fruit.  Not always easy, as you can find young trees but I don\'t have years to wait for the fruit to begin!  A Mayan friend of ours recommended this market in Vallodolid so we went.  Sure enough we found plants of all kinds to buy.  We were able to buy a mandarin orange, regular orange and lime tree and all had baby fruits on them already. And of course you have to "rigatear" (bargain and haggle) at the market so we got them for a great price!  We got there late so some of the vendors were already packed up.  They begin at 5am so some are gone by 3pm.  It is open only Saturday and Sunday so get there early!

549083495.name: Our favourite market!
549083495.author: a TripAdvisor user
549083495.reviewBody:
For us, one of the greatest experiences in Mexico is to go to the local market, where the locals shop.  The sights, smells, and interaction with vendors and other customers is unique, and should not be missed. 

You'll get to see and taste new and exciting things, and I am almost always amazed at how friendly, positive and pleasant the vendors are. 

One of the first things you should do when you come to a new town / city is to visit the market - it gives you a great feel for the place and the people. 

Rick Bayless (on Mexico One Plate at a Time) called the Valladolid Mercado "one of the most authentic & best in Mexico", and I believe him - this is our favorite market in all of Yucatan. 

Go there - you'll be glad you did!

662088343.name: Went to mass
662088343.author: a TripAdvisor user
662088343.reviewBody: This is a big old church,  It was packed on Sunday but it was a great experience attending mass there.

658695561.name: In its glorious day
658695561.author: a TripAdvisor user
658695561.reviewBody: This tall architecture was probably something in its glorious days as it is in a need of maintenance like a lot of churches around the world. But you can make it with a bit of imagination. Plus, sitting in the center of the city, next to the largest park  you cannot miss it.\n

647153443.name: BEAUTIFUL!
647153443.author: a TripAdvisor user
647153443.reviewBody: We dropped by this church in the late afternoon.  It is lovely, facing a small park.  The street alongside the church leads you back into the main square of the historic city.  The area has been revitalized and is very attractive, with many shops and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

616553318.name: Colonial architecture and beautiful square
616553318.author: a TripAdvisor user
616553318.reviewBody: The whole colonial church, part of the history of this beautiful city and its square in front, holds a harmonious tranquility, great for spending time and rest.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

564236710.name: Not open
564236710.author: a TripAdvisor user
564236710.reviewBody: Could only see  the exterior. It\'s being renovated. There\'s  a nice park and cafe across the way.  Enjoy the silence.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

502557591.name: Has a nice park, with restaurants
502557591.author: a TripAdvisor user
502557591.reviewBody: Has a nice park, with restaurants , there have to many chuches in this town, and convets, it has its charmec

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

472910847.name: VERY BEAUTIFUL ORNATE CATHOLIC CHURCH
472910847.author: a TripAdvisor user
472910847.reviewBody: Very nice church with very nice architechture and paintings inside. My daughter had her QUINCE ANOS here and it was magical. Very Friendly people to help

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

425750539.name: Attractive
425750539.author: a TripAdvisor user
425750539.reviewBody: I was staying in a hostel in the plaza across the street so saw it first thing when I walked outside. Its an attractive church but not sure if it is worth a detour.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

358250574.name: Nice Old Church but nothing special
358250574.author: a TripAdvisor user
358250574.reviewBody: This Church was nice but nothing special. Facing a square that once belonged to it it had nothing about it that made it stand out amongst the many Churches of Valladolid. However it did have an attached cloister. Worth a look if in the area but not worth a special trip unless to eat at Candelitas Cafe in the square.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

356622562.name: just nice
356622562.author: a TripAdvisor user
356622562.reviewBody: Nice looking church - worth to step inside, althought it is not very rich decorated. Just another simple mexican church. Might be good idea to visit it during a mass

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

349264475.name: Simple Old Church
349264475.author: a TripAdvisor user
349264475.reviewBody: Loved this little church. Step inside and go back in time. Quiet, old and simply restored. I walked by it several times before I actually realized it was a little church. Lots of character.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

345268258.name: lovely ornate altar
345268258.author: a TripAdvisor user
345268258.reviewBody: A very old structure in one of the original barrios of Valladolid and still in daily use as a neighborhood church.While the interior is rather plain, the altar screen is exceptional with gilt and colorful paint.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

334060019.name: Lovely Church and Beautiful Park in a Peaceful and Charming Neighbourhood!
334060019.author: a TripAdvisor user
334060019.reviewBody:
During my time in Valladolid (November 15-18), I stayed at Hostel La Candelaria, which was situated on the north side of La Candelaria Park/Square. 

The square was beautiful, with lots of bench seating, a small playground for children, and lots of large shade trees. It was always very quiet and peaceful, and was a great place to sit and relax in the afternoon and evening. 

The Iglesia de la Candelaria is located across the street from the square/park and is painted a bright red colour. It was a really pretty and charming small church. 

I enjoyed relaxing and spending time in this park/square and admiring the church. La Candelaria is a lovely neighbourhood in Valladolid and I cannot wait to return here someday!

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

308356907.name: Beautiful Architecture
308356907.author: a TripAdvisor user
308356907.reviewBody: We were there after 5 pm so we got to see the lights on, that gives  the church a different look, but definitely this is a truly master piece well preserved.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

298568566.name: Patron saint of Valladolid
298568566.author: a TripAdvisor user
298568566.reviewBody: Charming little church with live nuns and two beautiful virgins of Candelaria.   And a great shop for  religious stuff, pictures, books, figures, clocks,and more .  Recently restored alter piece brought  it back  from being silver toned (aluminium I am told) for many years to the original gold leaf.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

286728686.name: Beautiful Cathedral Across from a Lovely Park!
286728686.author: a TripAdvisor user
286728686.reviewBody: This cathedral/church is located across the street from Candelaria Park, where my hostel (Hostel La Candelaria) was located. The neighbourhood itself is peaceful and relaxing and the cathedral and park are lovely. The park/square is a great place for relaxing on the benches or chairs and there are lots of shade trees. There is an ice cream/popsicle place (Flor de Michoacan) and an Italian restaurant located on the square. I didn\'t venture inside of the church and I am not sure if you are allowed to, but I did admire the cathedral from the outside every day while walking to and from my hostel.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria

257366595.name: Candelaria festival time!
257366595.author: a TripAdvisor user
257366595.reviewBody: We were in Valladolid during the Candelaria festival and there was something gong on almost every night outside the little church. We watched the locals purchasing a candle and a herb before they went before the saint in the glass. Every night I went over to the church to see what was happening that night. I always had a piece of delicious flan and a couple of nights there was live music being played in front of the church. One day we witnessed a parade passing by the church that included the 2 queens of the festival. I found it all fascinating and will definately be back.

address.streetAddress: Calle 44 s/n Corner with 35, Plaza de la Candelaria
